Since they have opened, they have been a staple in my weekly routine either for a work lunch or happy hour.  I absolutely adore the Cowboy Salad and Ahi Tuna Wrap.  The grilled asparagus is always my favorite side when I am trying to avoid those dangerous tator tots!  Service has always been very good and the food and drinks consistent.As many reviewers have stated, you need not arrive without reservations at 12:30 for lunch without the willingness to find a seat at the bar. I am so excited summer is finally here and I can enjoy the patio after work!

To be fair, we only had appetizers and a couple beers here. It was busy, as expected on a Friday afternoon, and the service did not suffer because of that. Knowledgeable, friendly staff. Wide beer selection and good ambiance.We had the cheese curds which were really good. Large portion and served with a really yummy tomato sauce. Also ordered the buffalo chicken egg rolls and they were pretty good, not great.There wasn't really anything negative about the experience but also nothing outstanding. Good place to grab a drink.  I'm sure during the summer, sitting on their patio next to the river adds a lot to the experience.

I love south branch! Whether for a happy hour outside after work, a lunch meeting, taking my parents out, or for a company event, I have always been extremely happy at South Branch!Some of my favorites include:1. Their Sunny-side-up Burger.. a soft pretzel buns, bacon, caramelized onions, lettuce, tomato, and a oozing egg. I always eat it with the sweet potato fries... and 10+ napkins. This is by far one of my favorite lunch time splurges... and I finish it right in enough time for an afternoon nap.2. Their Calamari.... delicious and very great for a happy hour appetizer!3. Herb Crusted Salmon... served over a tomato pure'... SO yummy!4. Cowboy Salad... a lighter option, but just as yummy and filling.They always have great service and drinks as well. I once ordered a drink that I didn't really enjoy, and the waitress asked me why I wasn't drinking it and when I told her it just wasn't my favorite, she comped it, and brought me an alternate beverage.... without me asking!Our company has had numerous company events and happy hours here, and I have always been extremely happy. They were happy to rope off an area for us, and push together tables so we were comfortable.I love South Branch, and will reccomend it for any occassion!

South Branch is one of my favorite lunch spots and they also have a great happy hour (especially in the summer when you can sit outside).  Definitely good for a casual business lunch or grabbing drinks after work.  My favorite menu item is spinach & artichoke dip but their salads and wraps are pretty good!Can be hard to find get a table starting around 11:30AM on weekdays - its usually a 15-20 minute wait if you don't have a reservation.

South Branch is always busy with local professionals. It's bustling and lively during the lunchtime hours and it's absolutely packed after work. It's clean, it's modern, and it has a beautiful view that is on display as there are windows lining the restaurant.It's no wonder South Branch is always busy. They have a really simple yet delicious menu. My team and I came here for lunch one day, and a teammate kept raving about her favorite menu item that we 'just couldn't pass up'. SO OF COURSE WE GOT THE CHEESE CURDS!!! =D  I think they are especially good here because of the batter and the unique smoked tomato coulis side filling.Although I am sure that we all would have been perfectly happy with a few plates of cheese curds, I ordered the Grilled Yellowfin Tuna Sandwich, and my teammates ordered the Turkey Burger Flight special and some Baja Fish Tacos. My sandwich was so good - everything complimented each other so well, and the portion was so big that I was even able to save half for later. The sandwich is a bit difficult to eat since the tuna is a rather thick cut so maybe opt for something else if you're trying to look cute while eating. I didn't get a chance to try the tacos or mini turkey burgers but they looked scrumptious and I heard no complaints.TIP: TATOR TOTS TATOR TOTS TATOR TOTS - as a side or on their own, just get them.

Seems like a solid place. Super loud but the food/drink options are good. I had the turkey burger and a couple of beers. Not the best, not the worst. Salads looked huge and tasty. No one complained. Service is really good. Super attentive and fast. Can't hear a darn thing but I'd come back if I was in the area and needed decent food.

Beautiful venue with indoor/outdoor options. Fantastic service and event coordination and super friendly stuff. We always love DJing and working with South Branch Tavern & Grill.Thank you,Extreme Sounds Entertainment & Lightingextremesoundsent.com

Convenient place to stop for drinks after work. Nice space on the river with tons of windows so you actually get some natural light. Solid beer list...I was very happy to find they had Southern Tier Pumking a couple weeks ago.

I have loved the salads at south branch for a long time. BUT they would only serve the guys in our group alcohol. I give credit to restaurants and security for cutting people off, but it wasn't appropriate this time and there were visibly more drunk people than us. It was most ridiculous and I will probably boycott the restaurant for some time.

Great upscale sports bar/restaurant to stop by afterwork or on a work meeting. The outdoor patio is great. I have had the shrimp appetizer, which I highly recommend, and the ham and avacado sandwhich. Their house cabernet is around $12 though, so plan on spending a decent amount if you are there for a while. If you work in the loop you should definitely check it out... especially during summer.

Team Lunch 15 ppl. Table outside, way to hot, asked to be moved inside and they accommodated! Very cool! They put us in a private dining room! Service was excellent! Food was good. I had the French Dip Sandwich, really good but the Tater Tots took it over the top for me!

My boss was bored today so he dragged me to South Branch for lunch. South Branch is located at the former location of the underrated Pazzo's. Despite the fact that it's a dead work day in downtown, the place is packed with well-dressed young professionals taking long lunch breaks because it is slow at work this holiday week (same here, except for the "young" part). We waited 20 minutes for a table, and even though the place was packed it never felt like we were crammed next to another group. The window seats along the river look like prime seats. The bar looked like a good place for an after work drink, so I may have to save that for another day.Instead of going for the patty meIt, I ordered the Trevi - grilled chicken sandwich with mozzarella and tomato on a fairly blah focaccia roll. I guess my choice was the healthier one, though I might do the patty melt next time. The sweet potato fries were not bad. I did have a bit of lunch envy as my boss had The Dip, a massive prime rib sandwich on Texas toast with a small bowl of au jus dip that he could not use for awhile because the sandwich was so big. He gobbled up the tater tots, and also a bowl of tortilla soup that looked good too. Service seemed rapid here, so even with the wait for a table we spent only about an hour there.
great outdoor seating and view of the river.  servers were great and the food was good but not great.  expensive but that is the area and was expected.  great layout as well

I'm bumping up a star because the GM contacted me to rectify my poor experience.Moving forward, I will say that South Branch is an excellent after work place to unwind and mingle. They have an decent beer list and an upscale outdoor area.The food menu on the other hand is limited and not very creative.

Meh - crowded and so loud I could barely hear the person next to me.  While I will admit, it's a nice outdoor option in the loop, it was just not very comfortable.  Our friends were at the bar and we were seated (which they didn't know) so they joined us, with drinks, and the waitress snapped, "you shouldn't be getting drinks at the bar.  That's my job."  Ok... next time, we will try elsewhere.128/365

South Branch is a classy restaurant/bar with the food and drinks to match. I went here for lunch with a co-worker and we both enjoyed our meals. I had the Nola, or salmon salad, and my buddy had a pork shoulder sandwich with sweet potato fries. Everything was really tasty (~$13 each). They also have a good alcohol selection.The atmosphere is semi-classy but pretty average for the loop. Service was quick and friendly. Overall, a great experience.Atmosphere: 7.5/10Service: 8/10Food: 8/10

One of my new favorite brunch spots in Chicago!! I'm absolutely in love with everything about this cafe :) It is super spacious inside with high ceilings and plenty of tables. We came here on a sunny Saturday morning at 11am and were seated immediately.I started off with the house bloody mary. Ooh wheee this was pretty great! The glass rim is sprinkled with salt and spice and it comes with a few pieces of cheese, which pairs really well with the drink itself!We shared the lemon pancakes and salmon hash for a mix of sweet and savory. The lemon pancakes were GREAT! It's not what you'd expect lemon pancakes to taste like. The lemon sauce is more sweet than sour and the pancakes are perfectly fluffy. It's topped with fresh blueberries to make you feel good about yourself after indulging in the pancakes. The salmon hash is also amazing! It's super rich in flavor and pairs well with your choice of condiments whether it be hot sauce or ketchup (or without any!)!Affordable prices AND delicious food? I'll definitely be coming back again soon :)

I loved the atmosphere and the setting. It's really bright and open with high ceilings. Service was also fast and on point. One thing to note is that this place is really loud on Saturday mornings during brunch. It's a wide open space so there isn't much to absorb all the noise.I wasn't a fan of the Eggs Benedict. The bbq chicken was a strange combination for the protein choice. I wanted to give it a try because it sounded interesting but it didn't work for me.  I also got an iced Vietnamese coffee which was not good because of how watery it was. I couldn't drink it, and I love all sorts of coffee.

Want to get brunch at a more lowkey restaurant, where you won't have to wait in line for forever? Well, this is the spot! Delicious (more so on certain items than others..) and inviting.The service was great, we only had to wait about 5 minutes for a table for five people around noon on a Saturday. That's pretty fast for a brunch place at that time. The staff were friendly and kept checking up on us if we needed any refills on any of our drinks. One of my friends received her entree fairly late after the rest of us got our food, and they comp'd us some chocolate dipped strawberries. I thought that was a pleasant surprise, especially since we didn't think much of the timing of her food nor complained about it at all. Another note is that if you eat inside the restaurant, it can be pretty loud due to their high ceilings. So if you want to hear your friends talk a little clearer, I would sit at the outside patio.Now onto the food and drinks. The drinks we had were iced coffee, and Vietnamese iced coffee. The iced coffee was good, not too acidic. However, I do not recommend the Vietnamese iced coffee. It does not taste remotely near any authentic Vietnamese iced coffee! It just tastes like a cup of iced coffee with milk and a ton of granulated sugar instead of using condensed milk. And onto what I had, the Kingsbury Eggs Benedict. It was delicious!!!! I highly recommend it. The sauces on top were great, and the hot sauce that we got at our table was a great addition to it as well. The roasted baby potatoes with the Benedict were just as tasty as the main part of my meal. Four people in my group had this, and one girl got the salmon frittata (which she said she enjoyed!).I would definitely come back here and try to explore the menu a little more.

BBQ Chicken Benedict still as good as the few times before, however they only serve this on the weekend as "weekend special". Just wish they have the special menu during the week too because my office is actually near them and would be great whenever i miss the chicken benedict i can just order it at lunch.I still gave 4 stars is because i went there once during the week and food was only good, like good but not as good as the weekend special menu :)

I really wanted to like this place, but maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.I came here for lunch and was looking for a healthy meal. They have a decent sized salad selection so I asked my waiter what he recommended and he suggested the autumn chopped salad with chicken. The portion size was huge. The vegetables were plentiful and fresh, however, the salad was quite plain and bland. The salad plus tip and tax was $25, yikes. Do yourself a favor and order anything else!

4.5 stars overall but 10 stars for the muffins!!Stopped in for brunch at Kingsbury St Cafe before heading out of town for the weekend. If you want to beat the rush, 9:30 am on Saturday is the perfect time; the place was mostly empty. We were even able to snag an outdoor table with a great view of that gargantuan Whole Foods across the street...Service was outstanding! I don't think my water glass even got to half empty, and I pound water at restaurants like it's my job. We started with a couple blueberry muffins because those immediately caught my eye in the display case when we walked in. AMAZING. They come out cut in half and slightly toasted. I'm tempted to go back this weekend and just buy a 100 of them.Beyond muffins, I ordered the Kingsbury Eggs Benedict, which had bbq pulled chicken instead of Canadian bacon. It was good! Didn't blow me away but I left full and satisfied. My one friend tried their famous lemon pancakes which he loved. My other friend got the avocado toast special. Beautiful dish but the gluten free bread kind of killed it she said.Great place for brunch down if you're down by the Clybourn strip mall (at least that's what I call it). Would definitely go back!

Hit 'n Miss with pricing, portion, service and food flavor.  Overpriced by $1.25 - $3+ per item.  Excellent slice and dice of ingredients, and food presentation.  Tad pretentious. FREE parking if you find a spot.LEMON PANCAKES ($12) -- 2 big circles of fluffy pancakes.  Lemon sauce is best enjoyed when you slice the pancake pizza-style to enjoy the perfect bite.  Too much carb for my taste that half went to trash.  What a waste of $$.  Only a gluten-free pancake can charge $10+.SALMON HASH WITH POACHED EGGS ($16) -- Worthy.  Serves 2+.  Perfectly poached eggs.  Plenty of salmon.  Perfectly sliced small peppers.  Nice touch of garlic buttered perfectly grilled French bread.GRILLED HANGER STEAK POBLANO ($17) -- the classier version of Steak Fajitas by $3.  A good balance of ingredients with a monotone flavor.  Serves 2+.  Reheats well.  Good amount and quality hanger steak.  I wish the poblano pepper can add pizzazz into the dish, fine dining style.In BEVERAGES, you are funding the Bodum glass supply:VIETNAMESE COFFEE ($4.50) -- clean taste with a portion that leaves your heart palpitating.  Comparative product at $3.25 on Rush St.  *wink*MASALA CHAI TEA LATTE ($4.50) -- it's by Rishi.  Streeterville area goes for $3.75.  I'm sure it's same taste.ETHIOPIAN DRIP COFFEE ($4) -- taste like it's slow/V60 drip.  Clean.  Since it is dark roast (negated delicate Ethiopian Bean origin), I doubt the beans are single origin.  SKIP.SERVICE -- they can sell you the menu like its the last meal on earth.  Sunday's Host took the time to tell me that kitchen closes in 15 mins.  Since it's a rare occurrence to places that charges max price, it's tacky!  It's best to go across the street, no tips needed.  *wink*BAKERY is ordinary, overpriced with decent portion.  Go across the street!  The $4.50 MERINGUE was hard and too sweet -- sweet jam on a sweet meringue (sugar overdosed!).

I was passing through Chicago on a cross-country road trip and found this place through Yelp. The menu was extensive and had a lot of fun and creative dishes.I ordered the Lemon Pancakes with a side of the bacon and my copilot ordered the special, avocado toast with poached eggs. Both dishes were absolutely delicious and the coffee was strong.The only reason this got three stars is because the service was largely underwhelming. The server seemed burdened by our eating there, so it was relatively unpleasant to interact with them. Don't expect to feel comfortable eating here.

I love the food but not the service....I have been coming to this trendy restaurant for over two years now. Every dish is amazing and the muffins...let's just say, there are no better muffin in the city, they go perfect with their strong coffee.Food - is alway great, from eggs to chicken BLT sandwich, salad and the yogurt with fresh fruit, yum! Yes, the food is amazing, the coffee is strong, the foam on the cappuccino is perfect.They place is clean, sharp, very open, easy on eyes, pretty loud, but fun. Good art, fresh flowers, and they have a few tables outside. With a beautiful decor around them. Most of the time you will wait for a table...30 min even more...very normal for this place.Service- this is where it's gets tricky for me. I do love this place, but they will still only get a three stars for me, not because of the food but because of not consistent service they provide. Like today I waited for over 20 min for my cappuccino. Last time they where not exempting credit cards and after I ordered my food, I was told no cash no service. No explanation or nothing. Like--/there is a cash machine on the corner...stuff like that happens on and off here. Sometimes they are just missing the easy smile that goes a long way...

We finally found the best classy yet casual brunch spot in Chicago!I had the bi bim bap: The flavors were so fresh. The chili paste was delectable. The mix of pickled vegetables and sautéed spinach was so on point...I honestly can't believe how good it was!My husband had the croque madame: The cheese had an amazing flavor, and for someone who doesn't eat pork really, I found the flavor to be delectable. In my husband's words "my only problem was the sandwich was too good and I couldn't stop eating it."Bloody Mary's were more 'gardenish' than I would normally like, but I found the flavor to be refreshing and completely delicious.This place is awesome...we will most definitely be back! Thanks to Check Please for revealing this gem!

Come. Here. For. Brunch. And like everyone else has said, get the lemon pancakes - they are absolutely delicious. All of the food was fresh, wonderfully prepared, and the whole vibe of the place is fun. The coffee is delicious and so was the homemade turkey sausage. We'll be back!!

The shrimp and egg white frittata here is by far the sexiest thing on the block. And that's including the fact that Kingsbury Street Cafe sits next door to one of the better strip clubs in Chicago. Now granted, our city isn't exactly known for it's naked lady spots, but still, I'd spend my hard earned dollars on this breakfast dish over a lapper from about anyone in the entire world. Ok...maybe not Channing Tatum.The egg whites, spinach, roasted tomatoes, and giant prawns just go together more perfectly than anything I've ever eaten in the morning. Not to mention it's half way healthy. Sure, paired with a cup of coffee, and you're looking at about a 20 spot for a breakfast, but sometimes the finer things in life are just worth paying for.Always incredible service and you can park pretty easily in the Whole Foods loading area. Overall the only thing I don't like is when I've tried to go too early and they weren't open. Other than that this is probably my second favorite breakfast in the city.

Yum!! What a nice brunch. Ordered a chai tea latte and was so pleased, it had the best spice to it.I regret not ordering a muffin because they looked so good .. next time.Instead I got the piggy moo sandwich, which is aptly named with its two types of pork. It's definitely not a light brunch item. Only order this if you're hungry, because it's quite large. That being said, it's delicious. I added some sriracha to it, because everything is improved with a little hot sauce. The potatoes were also delicious.The atmosphere is open and bright, and on a nice day it's great to sit outside.

This is a cool place!Interior was gorgeous - the outdoor seating in the summer I'm sure is incredible. Huge menu, with healthy options as well as your cheat day meals. I found it really interesting that they serve three different types of coffee as well.The bartender was my server and she was as sweet and friendly as could be.  Great service and great food, what more could you ask for?

This place has a ton of options for anyone: from the adventurous eater to the special vegan diets to the cautious "classic American food" only eater. Whenever I have someone in town and we're looking for a brunch, I always take them here and everyone always is blown away with their meal. Highly recommend a visit!

My visit here was a random find! Had some family in town and needed a brunch place.We were there early on a weekend so we didn't have too terrible of wait but if they take reservations, I'd recommend doing so if you go during busy times!Our waitress was great though. Very friendly, attentive and patient with my parents who don't eat out a ton. The speed of the food being brought out was right on par and the quality of the food was good.This is definitely a place I'll keep in mind for future occasions.

Thank goodness for a healthy breakfast! During a trip to Chicago I had burnt myself out on all my favourite foods (pizza, portillos, more pizza, more portillos, tacos...etc). A friend suggested this place for us to meet and I was expecting greasy, but delicious diner food. Wow was I pleasantly surprised at the great selection including a few things that would really help give my body a fighting chance. The service was also amazing with friendly staff and constant top-ups of water and coffee. Very great experience overall.I won't be back for a few months, but when I am I will definitely suggest this as a place to meet up with a few friends!

The best breakfast/brunch place in Chicago. Ethiopian drip coffee and the buttermilk pancakes are amazing. You can tell the ingredients are all high quality and usually organic, way better than a lot of other brunch places in the city.
Delicious food, beautiful interior, and outdoor seating! Great for lunch or brunch and can accommodate big groups.

I wanted to like it more.On my first visit a few years ago, I remembered Kingsbury as having the best chai tea latte I've ever had.  It was spicy, it was flavorful, and it was comforting.  The sandwich I tried on that occasion (cluck moo oink?) was ordinary, and I remember eyeing the pastry case on the way out.  Muffins, cookies, and the like are piled high!  Talk about eating with your eyes!Flash forward to March 2015, and I decided it was time to return for brunch with some friends.  Easy reservation on OpenTable!  Be prepared for an energetic atmosphere; the acoustics in the space will make it hard to carry on a focused conversation.I ordered the chai tea latte, and it was disappointing because it was lukewarm at best.  Also, our waiter Ben disappeared and didn't return for a while, so by the time he came back (after our meals were served), I just forgot about telling him about the temp problem.For brunch, I usually don't opt to burger, but I was craving some heavy protein, so I went with the bacon burger, ordered medium.  Burger was really dry and took a lot of chewing; bun was also too much bread and added to the dryness.  My friend's lemon pancakes, though they looked delectable, were notably bland (whaaa!).Last note: good luck with parking!  We were lucky and found a street spot right outside, but it's a busy area by North/Clybourn with a large Whole Foods across the street.

Enjoyed brunch here with my Mom on a Friday morning.  Lots of options and everything was delicious.  Love the open airy feeling in KSC.Only issue would be parking, there's a lot next door for around $7 or the FFC lot is there too.  & make a reservation!
Was seated for 12 minutes before being acknowledged by a server, then food took over 30 minutes to receive...

I came here for brunch with my mother and I had the Kingbury Cafe Breakfast with eggs, tomatoes, fingerling potatoes, and vegan patties. The vegan patties were pretty good as were the eggs. The cheddar scone was REALLY GOOD and moist. The potatoes could have been seasoned a little more and the roasted tomatoes could have as well. Overall, the service was good and the restaurant was very nice.

Was looking for brunch places and came across place, WAS AWESOMEEE!Me and my friend ordered the lemon pancakes and the pulled chicken eggs benedict. Both were amazing. The lemon pancakes was amazing, I'm not a huge lemon fan but they were so fluffy and delicious. The portion sizes were perfect.ordered the masala chai tea was is a bit sugary, FYISeems we got a table at around 10 but I came back the next day and it was JAM packed... right fully so.I was thinking about bongo room in wicker park which I've been to, always packed, but the portion sizes are ridiculous, so much sugar for their pancakes, this was way more tolerable.Also, service, cleanliness, lighting of the place/atmosphere were all great!

What a great little breakfast! I got the piggy moo cluck breakfast sandwich -- yum! Fiancé got the lemon pancakes -- also yum! He ended up ordering sides because several reviews said the portions were small and the prices were high. That was not our experience, at all. The prices were very reasonable and the portions were great! I don't eat like a bird, either. I am... AMERICAN!!The only complaints I had: (1) coffee. Bitter. Very common complaint throughout the reviews I read. Fix it! There are tons of great coffees out there. (2) noise. It was SO loud in there.  People were commenting on it all over the place. Maybe it was the high ceilings? (3) flies. There were tons of them, and not because the patio was open. Fruit flies.

Wait and location aside, this place is deserving of of 4.5 stars but our server wasn't that great either. Some may consider it pricy too, but no more than most other chic brunch spots in the city.Between 3 of us, we got a house Bloody Mary, a Cappuccino and a Vietnamese drip coffee with condensed milk. All our beverages were really good. For food we ordered a Kingsbury cafe eggs Benedict, the Egg white frittata and I got the salmon hash.  The BBQ chicken in the Benedict was certainly unique and very tasty.The inside of the space is bright, clean and very warm and inviting. I would certainly go back to try of the traditional lunch menu items.

My husband and I had our wedding reception at Kingsbury. It was amazing and perfect for our party. The staff was very flexible and accommodating, even when I changed our arrival time 3x (oops). Danielle was our fabulous server. The restaurant gave us several treats and even a plate of their Lemon Pancakes with their congratulations written in chocolate sauce on the plate.The environment was very welcoming and casual but it still had some class to it. They even had alcoholic beverages to go with breakfast/brunch like bloody marys and mimosas. Each one of their dishes was beautifully served and delicious. All of my guests were happy and well taken care of. The extra price for their food is worth it.

Sharing the lemon pancakes and black bean butternut squash tostadas with a friend for brunch was the perfect mix of sweet and savory. Everything was delicious and they even had pumpkin pie hot chocolate, which tasted more like a pumpkin pie chai, but it was super yummy all the same. Good service, was able to get seated promptly. I will be back!
Good Sunday brunch.  Food was good. Coffee was strong.  Service was ok, but not egregious.  I'd go back.

I was hoping for great things at Kingsbury and I was disappointed.We arrived around 1:45 P.M. on Saturday. The restaurant was two-thirds full, with the outdoor tables turning over. I was hoping we would be able to get one, but we had 3 parties in front of us who arrived about 30 seconds before we hopped in line.It wasn't a good start. We waited for what it seemed to be 10 minutes just to speak to the host. We were going to have a party of 3 or 4, and when we stated that our 4th member may not come, that seemed to cause a crisis for the male host.We eventually were seated, and things did not get better. Our menus arrived and we browsed, then waited, and waited, and waited. My brother finally went up to the host and made sure that they knew our 4th wouldn't be coming (we weren't sure but we didn't want to delay service; ended up being delayed anyways!)When our waiter arrived, we were ready to order. My friend order the Piggy Moo sandwich or whatever it's called, along with a bloody Maria. My brother ordered the Kingsbury breakfast, which came with eggs, bacon, roasted potatoes, roasted tomatoes, and their whole wheat buttered toast.  I created my own omelette with leaks, mushrooms, and peppers. I had a choice of potatoes or tomatoes, and opted for the latter. The toast (whole wheat) was also included. I added a side of sautéed spinach as well.My friend's bloody Maria was terrible and he barely took 2 sips. His sandwich was good; he was full and saved his potatoes and half of his sandwich for tomorrow. My brother enjoyed his bacon the most. He also said that the hot sauce on his scrambled eggs was good. As for me, my omelette was just okay. Not great, but nothing made me go 'Wow.' I was given potatoes instead of my requested tomatoes, but was given the latter after mentioning it. They both were very good.My meal was 13.50. Our total was 49 and change. I went up with two 20s to get change and was told by the male host to go to the bar. Not a problem, but I was very irked by his overall demeanor, to be honest with you. I usually give everyone the benefit of the doubt, but this guy just rubbed me the wrong way. Our server was good; no complaints there. Food came out relatively quickly, too.There's nothing that is going to make me come back to this place, especially with x amount of restaurants in the area. The overall experience was not good.

Went here Memorial Day weekend for lunch.It took us forever to get seated. Not only did some mature male decide to cut me in line, but the host was aloof to what was going on.We got seated by about 2 PM. We got water from the bus boy (SHOUT OUT), but our server was MIA. For about 15 minutes, we waited to get coffee and my friend got a Bloody Mary which he took two sips of and HATED!The food was actually really good. Our server didn't come by until 15 minutes in and did not come back to check on us either.They messed up my brothers' order. Food was awesome. Best toast I have had in a while. The maple glazed bacon was awesome, too.I won't be back. I'll stick to Kanela or Horizon Cafe.

Why have I never been? This isn't my neighborhood but I'd come back in a heartbeat. Menu was interesting and such good options. LOVED my avocado toast! Beautiful presentation. Service was very attentive but not over the top....nothing was better than my server Jake asking if I wanted a coffee to go when I was done. #class

The breakfast/ brunch here is great. The menu has an array of unique options that are all delicious. I went with a group of 6 and we all ordered different items and nobody had any complaints. Between the deviled eggs, scrambles, pancakes and hashes, everyone was satisfied with their meals.The wait can be long and it gets really crowded inside so you may have to wait outside. They had our table ready for a while but did not seat us because they said they needed menus, which was a little odd.Overall good food and I do recommend!

Food is very good (as others attest), but portions are too big and the price tag too high (50$ for brunch for two - no alcohol). Worst is how loud the place is. 2/3s full for Sunday brunch and we had to ask to be  moved outside to be able to converse. Front door staff lacked the easy smile we should expect (especially when we asked to move), but wait staff were lovely. We would not return.

We ordered:Salmon HashLemon PancakesVietnamese Coffee (with sweetened condensed milk)All 3 dishes were so delicious! Salmon hash was the perfect combination of breakfast staples (perfectly poached eggs, crispy hash brown, veggies and well seasoned and not-dry salmon). The lemon pancakes with blueberries - i love the lemon+blueberry combination so this was a winner before it went in my mouth! Coffee was delicious as well..Service was phenomenal - super friendly and attentive workers, meal came out fast and tasted great!I also love the place - super high ceilings and just a very open room with lots of natural light - my idea of the perfect ambiance for brunch!We will be back!

Bright, warm and inviting this place is a great spot for brunch. The food is great! however the service is a little slow.Between the three of us we ordered BBQ Chicken Benedict, Egg white shrimp frittata and Salmon Hash with poached eggs. Everything was delicious and fresh. The vietnamese coffee is a must try here, as it is not as sweet as the traditional coffee. I loved the House Bloody Mary too.This was my second visit to the place and definitely it has now become one of my new favorite brunch spots!

The restaurant itself was very nice but my cobb salad had absolutely no flavor. It looked great but the vegetables had no taste whatsoever. We waited for 45 minutes even though there were open tables inside the restaurant. The server only came by 2-3 times and seemed disinterested. The lemon pancakes were easily the best meal our table had. I wouldn't go back again.

I loved this place--brunch was delicious and the restaurant is light and airy, though a bit loud.  The coffee was a little strong for my taste. I ordered the bim bim bap, my husband ordered kingsbury Benedict and the kids ordered chicken fingers. Everyone cleaned their plates. We'll be back!

I went there the day after black Friday for brunch. The location is convenient near whole foods and a whole bunch of branded showrooms.The food was excellent. I had Egg Benedict with freshly blended mango-orange juice. The waiters are friendly and welcoming. Also, very vegetarian and vegan friendly.

Three of us went here recently and the whole experience was rather meh. We waited almost an hour (to be expected, we had no reservations and it was a Sunday). The food (breakfast sandwich, salmon hash, and chilaquiles) was all average, definitely not worth the price tag. We did have a lovely helpful waitress, and the space is bright and delightful, even on the rainy day we came.Overall okay, but won't be coming back for sit down brunch.The pastries are very good- pop in to take one to go!notjustbrunch.wordpress.…

Arrived 30 minutes before closing but we were still seated. Our orders taken and the food was delivered promptly. Presentation was amazing and taste even better! I had the Lemon pancakes and bacon. You don't need syrup because the Lemon sauce is perfection. My son had a burger. He doesn't really chew but sorta inhales his food. I guess it was good.  My daughter had salmon and egg benedict. She was really impressed. It was so much she couldn't eat it all.I ate here about 4 times a couple years back then had an issue with the food (hair in it) and the lack of concern by my server and management caused me to avoid it for about a year. I returned because my daughter wanted to try the place.  Glad I came back.

Great place for brunch! Beautiful space, good service, and great food! I had an omelette with turkey bacon, spinach, & Swiss cheese. The omelette was large and it also came with potatoes and toast which where also good. Service was attentive & quick. Looking at the menu their lunch items look good as well so I will definitely be back to try out lunch.

I have only been here for brunch on the weekends and I've always left satisfied! One of my FAVORITE dishes is the lemon pancakes (with the creme anglaise & lemon sauce); I was a bit hesitant the first time, however SO glad I tried them and recommend and get them each time now. We usually get a plate to share for the table, so we can all have a few bites. Surprisingly, these aren't as sweet as most specialty pancakes. It was a perfect taste of sweet! A MUST TRY at this place! I usually get the chilaquiles here, which are always delicious and I like how they use fresh jalapenos on the dish. My friend got the vegan breakfast patties and really enjoyed them; he actually couldn't tell if it was vegan or meat at first (he is not a vegetarian by the way). We also did a "made your own omelette" - it was a pretty big serving, and didn't end up finishing it. It was filling and good, however nothing out of the ordinary. I would recommend getting one of their other dishes that is more unique to this place.  My friend got the melon & ginger fruit cooler - I tried a bit of hers and really wasn't a fan. It tasted exactly that - a lot of ginger water with a hint of melon. The coffee here is great...really strong, but a bit on the expensive side. Not a big deal though for your occasional coffee! The service here is so-so; nothing terrible or outstanding. It's always been busy every time we've gone, so that may also be the reason. If you are planning on going during the weekend, expect to wait a bit - it will definitely be worth it though!

Food was good but like everyone else said, service needs to improve. Not very friendly service and the wait got worst as the meal went on. No offer to refresh coffee. Waited about 15 minutes just to get the check closed.
Great brunch spot with lots of fresh baked options and some novel twists on standard brunch/breakfast items.  One of my favorite Chicago brunch spots.

Love love love the lemon pancakes! If you're a lemon fan like I am, definitely recommend! Although it could do without that super sweet sauce in the middle on top of the lemon sauce drizzled on top of the pancake. The blueberries on it are also a nice touch! Also, had the chia oatmeal and it was ok... Nothing I would kill for (haha) The egg white omelette was decent. Fresh veggies in the omelette, but nothing special. Fries are huge and chicken tenders for kids was quite unique. Doesn't look like your typical chicken tenders but still crispy. Didn't have much flavor which is good for kids, but when I have to finish my kid's food, it should have a little flavor for my taste. Would go back just for lemon pancakes... The price of it...not a fan of... Can do without paying $12 for two decent sized pancakes...$7 maybe better  the host was also a sweetheart, and I felt bad because he kept picking up my son's little toy train. I didn't get to pay the bill since my friend picked it up, but I would definitely leave a nice tip for the welcoming atmosphere and helpfulness of the host.

Bright, open space and really delicious food make this the perfect spot for brunch. The Lemon Pancakes, Chilaquiles, and Kingsbury Benedict were all fantastic-the Benedict is made with pulled bbq chicken and sautéed spinach, a great twist on a classic. The pancakes were soft and fluffy and the bright lemon sauce and crème anglaise were the perfect complements. They can get fairly busy on the weekends, but don't worry-you'll have their line-up of pastries to drool over while you wait.

Great brunch spot!! Service was great, attentive but not overwhelming. Lemon pancakes were amazing... Consistent with everyone's recommendations also reviewed here.We arrived on a Saturday with a group of 5 and had a short wait for outside which was awesome. It's surprisingly large inside which you wouldn't realize walking past necessarily.Everyone ordered a number of different items. I had the quiche which exceeded my eggspectations. Yum. Other friends had waffles, another egg dish, and I believe a breakfast chilaquiles or something similar. We scarfed it down so I believe they were quite pleased as well.Definitely would come back again soon!

Always on the lookout for a good breakfast lunch place.  Clean, minimalist look that serves real  potatoes as opposed to those extruded strings of potato flesh that are squeezed in the likes of a potato "Iron Maiden" and fried .  Toast is made from artisanal bread, sliced like biscotti, and oven toasted.  My omelet was oval shaped (like it should be), cooked in a real omelet pan ( as opposed to beaten eggs fried on the flattop, filled with the filling of your choice, and folded over.  If I'm ever in the area, I'd go back......however it's not a place I would wait 20 minutes for a table.

Cute breakfast spot. My mother and I went here on a recommendation from the instructor at the spin studio we had just worked out at.Bright and spacious, I liked the ambiance. The food was good! We both had omelettes with veggies and cheese. I also had the veggie sausage and I thought that was pretty good too. I like the potatoes. Everything tasted fresh and healthy.Service was slow and a little spacey, but I would be back for sure!

Brunch in River north? Yes, this is a legit place to make it happen. Smoked salmon hash, eggs Benedict with sweet pulled chicken. Both... Amazing! I had reservation on hollandaise with sweet pulled chicken, needless to say they "pulled" it together with the perfect blend of sweet and savory, complements by baked potatoes to soak up the remaining flavors of the yolk and hollandaise. The salmon hash, flavor filled, light, filling and generous in portion. It took about 20 minutes for the food to come, but totally worth it! The location is surrounded by a shoppers delight, so take a break and enjoy a bite.  I'm going back to try the kingsbury breakfast and can't wait!

Attractive breakfast place. Great Bloody Mary's , odd / unique breakfast items. Not your average/ standard fare.  Awesome bakery goods. A bit pricey for what you get. Great servers.              But I have one complaint. And it is happening more and more, with restaurants in the City.  We went there this morning ,and there were several empty tables. I was parking the car, and walked back to the restaurant. But the other person in my party was told, " they could not be seated till all members in our group were present".  Really?   There were just the two of us . I could see if it was busy but there were 7 empty tables.   I dislike that policy ,when a place isn't that busy.
This is our third time here and it never disappoints!  We've had the beet salad, the lemon blueberry pancakes and the chicken Blt!  All have been perfection. Can't wait to come back!

Piggy Cluck Moo sandwich is my recommendation. But you really can't order anything bad here. Bakery items won't disappoint either. Fresh ingredients with a modern ambience. The servers and baristas have always been friendly. Making a reservation is best for parties of 4 or more, especially on the busy weekends. Usual quiet during the weekday mornings  before business hours which can be conducive to breakfast meetings. Otherwise, when it's a full house, the noise level is high. Across from the Whole Foods so the traffic can be moderately heavy and the buzzer from the WF garage can be distracting, if you're seated in the outside patio.

Really good brunch option. Would not normally come in this area for brunch but we too a chance and worked out. Great service and big dinning area with an option outdoor patio. We lucked out with beautiful whether when we were there and decided to eat outside. Great move. We then tried a latte and regular coffee which came fast then we got my son's pancakes. He was a little disapointed that the berry pancakes did not have the berries already inside but really liked them anyway. I had the kingsberry plate with eggs, potatoes, roasted tomatoes, maple bacon, and a beautiful cheddar scone. Very good. My wife had the BBQ chk Benedict and she was happy as well.We has a chocolate covered strawberry from their dessert counter and it was a nice treat to end the meal. Would come again for sure.

This place is great which is in Lincoln park area. I went here two times with my husband and then with my friends. The wait wasn't long at all which we waited for 10 minutes. The restaurant decor is really nice with plenty of seating inside and some outdoor seating. Each time I went I had the same waiter and he was great and attentive to my needs. I must the say the food is amazing and so tasty and delicious. I had the tomato quiche twice which they only serve on weekends and the other time I had the kingsbury breakfast. My friends love there cheese scone and even had to take one to go. I am glad this restaurant came on check please. I would come back here in a heartbeat and recommended to others. You can't go wrong with this place and I am always trying out new breakfast places.
Great brunch spot! Very busy, but worth it. The Chilaquiles were on point and loved their muffins. We will be back for sure!

10 stars for kingsbury cafe.I went here recently with a date and we wanted to try so many items. My date got 2 breakfast entrees!!  What a woman!!! :DShe got the salmon hash which she LOVED and the lemon pancakes which she also loved.I got a delicious breakfast sandwich called piggy moo cluck sandwich. Yum as ever! Came with breakfast potatoes.In the spirit of ordering 2 things I got a chocolate chip muffin toasted with butter. It was delightful.The only hiccup I had was when I ordered an ice mocha the person who dropped it at the table (not our waiter) said "here is your latte" I said this is not a mocha to the waiter and he returned some time later to say. "They said it IS a mocha but how did you want it to be differently and they'll make you another". I had to say "well there was absolutely no chocolate in that drink so starting there I guess is what I would like."  When he returned to the table he definitely had an iced mocha so I felt a lot better.  My date had an alcoholic drink which she liked but I cannot remember the type however I do remember a lot of fruit and it was very boozy. She liked it.Service was great in fact since she ordered two entrees the server offered to warm her pancakes up since she had let them cool considerably while having the salmon hash.Despite going around 11:30am on a Sunday the wait was only about 20 minutes. It was a cool rainy day tho and patio was closed.

This restaurant was very clean, perfect service, food was amazing, and a good value. We were a part of 8 and tried all different players and every one of us was happy. We're from California and we'll come back everyone we're in Chicago. I'd always nice to see operators that take pride in their trade. Thank you for the experience.

Excellent menu and food. Kids will love the little silverware and extensive kids menu but slow service and few check-backs makes it less kid friendly. No crayons or anything to occupy the kids so they will get antsy with how long it takes to get their food. This restaurant will nickel and dime you for everything here...$1 for this, $1 for that, $5 for this, $8 for that. It all adds up. I got a salad with no drink and my kids split 1 kids meal for lunch and the total was over $30 without tip. It seems excessive for what was ordered.

Well where do I start? I wanted so bad to love this place but I'm a bit disappointed.The service was friendly. No complaints there.The food: disappointing!I had a bakon bloody and the presentation was nice but I felt it lacked some zing.My sister ordered the shrimp frittata and she said there was way too much tomato flavor, considering there was two whole plum roasted tomatoes plopped on her plate I don't doubt it. So if you're not a fan of tomato, ask them to omit when ordering that dish.I ordered the kingsbury special, 2 eggs, maple bacon, potatoes and a roasted tomato. The maple bacon was delicious, the potatoes were hard and bland. Tomato and eggs were fine, not much you can do wrong there. It came with a cheddar scone, which I also felt lacked flavor. The coffee was good.Over all, I am glad I can finally say I have been but I doubt I will be returning.

Can we talk about how absolutely amazing their lemon pancakes are? Beautiful space, friendly service, good coffee and delicious lemon pancakes. Sadly, I've not been wowed by anything else on the menu. But I return for the pancakes! Also, though it doesn't appear to be upon first glance, it's actually a very kid friendly place.

We went in here on a Saturday morning and it was packed to the gills. It is one of the most beautiful and spacious establishments I've ever been to although the staff was a bit dismissive. Probably due to the high volume of people. I ordered the kingsbury cafe breakfast with turkey breakfast patties. The sausage wasn't my favorite but the rest of the food was delicious. The cheddar scone was one of my favorite items. I would for sure go back to this restaurant ideally when it wasn't as busy.
The food was great for brunch, but the interior was one big, LOUD room. Everyone's laughter and conversations bounced off the walls, and it was quite distracting.
I like roasted tomatoes, I like fresh vegetables in the omelette, I like the toasted bread, everything is simple but great here!

Get their Kingsbury eggs benedict. Just... do it. It's two poached eggs smothered in hollandaise sauce, topped over a pile of delicious pulled BBQ chicken, rested over two fresh pieces of English muffin.Anyways, with that out of the way, I now have yet another contender for favorite brunch place in Chicago.Kingsbury Street Café is a bit misleading, because it's more diner than a café.With bright lighting, large open tables, and tall stools by the side, it's as close to a modern diner as you can get.While they are a bit lacking in the sweet department, their egg based brunch items are amazing.I've tried the Kingsbury Café Breakfast (pretty standard, but those herb potatoes are amazing), Piggy Moo Cluck sandwich (loved the smoked ham with maple glazed bacon) and Kingsbury eggs benedict (delicious on all levels).They've also got some killer coffee, notably the Vietnamese drip coffee. Just know that their Ethiopian and Vietnamese drip coffee don't come with free refills, so if you're lacking some caffeine, stick to their house coffee.They've also got an awesome assortment of pastries and deserts by the front, something I am definitely planning to explore in the future.

Maybe this hit the spot because I was starving, but it was the best brunch I've had in a long time.Perfectly prepared breakfast.I ordered the Kingsbury breakfast which is simply Eggs, Potatoes, a meat, and a cheddar scone. The scrambled eggs were perfectly cooked, soft, moist, eggy.The potatoes were perfectly cooked, browned on the outside, soft on the inside, nicely seasoned. The cheddar scone was to die for, moist, just a little cheesy. I had the veggie meat patties which weren't awesome but with some ketchup, passable. I don't fault the restaurant, it's soy after all. I thought the stewed tomatoes were a weird addition to the breakfast but no harm done.The service was pretty fast and attentive. Two of my fellow diners had the salmon hash with tater tots which looked amazing. There were alot of things worth trying here. Wish I could go back!
The food was phenomenal!!!! We had the avocado toast, spring chopped salad, and the carrot pancakes. Great atmosphere and extremely friendly staff. This will not be our last visit here!

A solid place for brunch. Love when places offer multiple kinds of bloody mary's, the bacon bloody was great. My mushroom quiche was on point but every meal I saw that included an egg looked amazing. The service was very quick, your water glass will always stay full & the staff was super friendly.  Will definitely go back.

I think I had the best fresh fruit parfait I have ever had at Kingsbury Street Café!  It came with large amounts of fresh mixed berries, yummy vanilla yogurt, lots of granola, and the secret ingredient was the lemon zest that threw it over the top!  I also had a side of bacon, it was quite good with a maple flavor , but definitely dripping in grease.I find many places in Chicago dim and narrow...Kingsbury Street Cafe's ambiance is open and airy with high ceilings, crisp white walls and they have a patio.  When I am back in Chicago I will definitely come back...their omelets looked and smelled delicious!

Luckily no wait for us (group of 3) on Friday around 12:30, but place was still quite busy.Nice that they have a counter in the front to grab a pastry and coffee to go. Loved the open space. So refreshing to go to a brunch spot and actually be somewhat intimate, without the hectic chaos of traditional brunch diners.After reading other reviews, I opted to build my own omelette. I originally was taken aback by the idea, as I tend to think that restaurants should have a clear idea of their own concoctions. However, at Kingsbury they had both. My omelette had gruyere, jalapenos, leeks and turkey sausage. This just may have been one of the best omelettes I've ever had, and I think I would say the same if I had chosen different ingredients. They just really know how to make an omelette here. Not only that, but they did not skimp on the ingredients at all. The accompanied potatoes were fine but the multigrain toast was delicious. Loved how it was in a biscotti form, as it was not only easier to eat, but looked nice as well. Also thought that the omelette option was good bang for your buck, as the portion was quite generous, and starts out at $10 for 3 ingredients and just $1 more for every additional ingredient, so mines was only $11.Sis thought her tofu miso scramble was a tad salty while cousin thought his shrimp egg white frittata was quite bland.We also shared the lemon pancakes and these were amazing. Super light and fluffy with a perfect lemony, not-too-sweet glaze.Service was pretty good. Server and staff were friendly and waters were refilled when necessary.Overall, would love to come back. Omelettes and lemon pancakes are where it's at!
Delicious. Great brunch spot, but make reservations ahead of time!

Magnificent!  Someone recommended this wonderful  little establishment and we went on a weekday for a late breakfast. The food is OUTSTANDING!  The place has a very clean, stylish design.  There are very high ceilings, so it can be a bit noisy but you can still hear your companion without shouting. There is slightly an open kitchen and you can see the chefs working their magic.The food is just simply devine!  We had the whole wheat carrot pancakes with cream cheese and toasted pecans.  This is an outstanding riff on carrot cake. The pancakes weren't dry, as whole wheat can be, very tender and with a small dollop of syrup (which came on the side in a cute little crock) you could taste all those wonderful flavors without getting knocked over by richness or sweetness, it was balanced and VERY tasty!Next we had the egg white frittata with roasted tomato and kale with three perfectly cooked jumbo shrimp and a sprinkling of feta (you could choose goat cheese too). This too was simply amazing!  It was cooked perfectly, presented beautifully and was light and very flavorful.The coffee comes in a huge mug and is "Starbucks grade" (yum!) the cream comes in its own individual chilled crock, no prepackaged creamer crap here!  We each had a small freshly squeezed OJ (double yum!). Service was nice, friendly and but just a tad slow.The menu is diverse and I am going to make it my job to try it all!  I just don't think you can go wrong here!  There may be a wait but it is soooooo worth it.I love this little slightly hidden gem, but it's across from whole foods so there's your landmark to find it. Double win because I can eat here and shop there!Our tab was $46, I think that's on point for the exceptional food we had. I think the ingredients used , preparation and presentation are reflective of the price, and very "worth it" to me.This is a place you want on your radar, get there soon, you will be delighted you did!

Came here for brunch on Sunday, and it was nice to be able to have a table available right away. I heard about the lemon pancakes and they were really good. I wonder if they offer a half portion though, because after a few bites I was fulfilled. The dish has a nice creme anglaise  & lemon sauce, lemon zest and blueberries, which all worked together well. My husband and I split this with a create your own egg white omelet(roasted red peppers, onions) that was nice and fluffy. The omelet came with well seasoned and roasted fingerling potatoes and some multigrain bread.  I also ordered a large orange juice, which was pricy, but I believe fresh squeezed.Overall this was a nice brunch place, a bit on the pricey side if you order beverages, but the food was fresh and tasty.The atmosphere is minimalistic and very bright/airy with the high ceilings. The waitstaff was on point and friendly. We did find free street parking on the block behind the restaurant.

This brunch started off right when my mimosa came in a giant flute and was 70% champagne. We sat outside under the shade of a nearby tree next to window boxes of herbs. I ordered the mushroom quiche with side salad and an order of bacon. Everything was perfect. Hot, and rich with an abundance of mushrooms mixed with fresh and tangy with spicy arugula topped off with BACON! Seriously this bacon though you guys. It had a GLAZE. Possibly maple? Possibly liquid crack? 3 slices of heaven that the entire table was salivating over. If you go here and don't get bacon, go straight to the nearest sanitorium. Oh, you're vegan and don't eat bacon?? Excellent, more for me! My only regret was not getting a bloody mary in case there was bacon in it.tl;dr: go here and order a mimosa and bacon.

It was very difficult to decide what to order. Every dish that the servers brought out looked absolutely incredible. We decided to go with the eggs Benedict with pork and carrot pancakes. Every bite got better. It was hard to leave knowing that we don't have restaurants in my hometown that even remotely resemble the flavor and unique dishes that this place serves. We also had a couple bloody Mary's, which were pretty good and the perfect addition to brunch.

Right across from the  Whole Foods on Kingsbury, I dropped in midweek partly out of curiosity and also because of the reviews on Yelp.The decor is bright and very open though not as industrial as I was expecting... But that's a good thing.  It wasnt particularly busy and so I had no problems with conversation and our server Jenna (?) was solid.  No complaints, all smiles.For me,  it was a must that I try the lemon pancakes.  Heard about them, but they're better in person... trust me.  My partner in crime had the shrimp fritatta and thought it was just "meh" tasting, although beautifully presented.  She finished my lemon pancakes... and she doesn't even like pancakes, let her tell it.The masala Chai and fresh fruit made a nice finish to midweek brunch and I'm sure I'll return to Kingsbury Cafe next time for some moo and cluck.

My sweetie took me to lunch at Kingsbury St Café after hearing about it from a friend. We were especially eager to try it out because we had been big fans of  Work Of Art, it's parent. It's a very nice addition to the burgeoning shopping expanse of the Clybourn Corridor.The place serves breakfast and lunch all day on weekdays and brunch on weekends. It's a large, bright, airy space, comfortably casual. Service was friendly and a bit leisurely, which suited us on our recent visit. I think anyone could find something appealing on the menu, which features American café favorites with a few Vietnamese influences. In addition to a variety of coffees, teas and soft drinks, there was a small selection of beers not on the menu (I did not inquire about wines).We each had sandwich plates, and they were generous. My pork belly bánh mì was tasty, though a bit messy to eat; it was served on a toasted baguette rather than the traditional soft roll, and the ingredients were not uniformly distributed -- as a result, things kind of oozed out here & there. My sweetie's BLAT with chicken was more composed, and was delicious (the chicken was exemplary in its freshness and good flavor). Each came with a nice small salad of greens and carrot shreds; my only complaint was that the vinaigrette was too vinegary). The BLAT would easily have served two diners; I think it would be a smart choice if they had a half-sandwich option paired with soup or salad.We had a nice lunch. The BLAT sandwich stood out as our favorite, and all the rest was definitely A-OK. I'd surely stop by again if I were in the neighborhood at lunchtime.

I've only ever had their B.A.L.T (bacon avocado lettuce tomato) chicken sandwich and it is amazing!!! Their spicy mayo is so good as well. It's a huge sandwich so I don't eat the bread on the second half and I always say I'm going to save some for later but end up eating it all. So Delish!!!!

There's a lot of hype surrounding this place and to me it was honestly just OK.I was 10 minutes late  because of the abysmal parking situation. What brunch place has a valet only parking lot in Lincoln Park? This is not River North or the Loop people...We had a large group and we were seated at the front table near the host stand. It was great to be out of the way except that area of the restaurant was absolutely FREEZING. Between the front door opening and closing and blowing cold air in and being seated next to the large front windows I was not warm for a moment of my time spent there.For my meal I had the steak and pepper sandwich with fries. The sandwich and fries were good but not great. The food took a quite awhile to come and I found it to be a somewhat overpriced for what we were served.Overall I think that Kingsbury is a bit overrated and I think there are a much better spots to go for brunch that are a better bang for your buck and definitely more comfortable and easily accessible.
I thought it was OK. If I lived in the area I would go more frequently, but is not worth the drive out there. Good spot to try at least once.

This place is excellent! The atmosphere is really nice, yet relaxed. We waited about 10 minutes in Saturday morning for a table. Upon being seated we order a couple of house bloody Mary's. They were spicy, but not over the top. You can't governing with Tito's vodka either and that's what the house is made with. We had trouble deciding what to get so we got eggs benedict and whole wheat carrot waffles to share. Both most excellent!!!! The open kitchen made it able to see all the food coming out and we admired each plate. Everything looked so amazing! I def recommend this place!!!!

Went here a few days ago for lunch with my daughter and her boyfriend. We wanted to sit outside but the 5 tables in front were full. They have a ton of tables to the side of the place but no chairs, that's a problem. We were seated inside where it was nearly empty.The waiter took close to ten minutes to acknowledge us. I saw on the menu that the least expensive drink was a canned soda at $2. Call me crazy but I wasn't about to pay $6 for lemonade!! So what if it's fresh squeezed - $6??? It costs about 20 cents to make.My diet coke came in a glass and at first I thought it was a dark iced tea as there was no carbonation. It was flat and tasted like pure sweet syrup. I called the waiter over and he explained that they didn't have any cans and that this came from a gun. I asked for an iced tea instead.When that arrived I took one sip and nearly got sick. It tasted like I was drinking perfume. And that was $3.50.I ordered the grilled bbq chicken sandwich which came on a focaccia bun with a small side salad. It was fairly dry and unappealing but not awful. My daughter had a "bahn mi" sandwich which she liked; her boyfriend enjoyed the veggie burger. I did ask at the end to have the tea removed from the bill. The waiter was a bit arrogant in stating that I was the only person that ever complained about it.All in all the service was sketchy, the food was just ok and it was overpriced. The city needs more basic restaurants where you don't have to float a loan to eat lunch. These places are all trying to outdo each other and this one didn't cut it. Would not go back. I'll squeeze my own lemonade.

Only giving it two stars because the bathrooms were fancy and clean. Waited outside for around 50 minutes, and when I went inside to use the restroom there were 4 open tables with no one sitting at them, so I asked the hostess what was going on and she proceeded to say that they are "getting it ready for us". Still waited for another 20 minutes while the tables sat there empty. Food was nothing special, especially when you add in the price you're paying. The $14 salad had no flavor, the $16 chilaquiles weren't very good, however, the pancakes were pretty tasty. Service was mediocre. Definitely not going back.

For brunch, this is as good as it gets. The atmosphere is incredible and the food really stands out compared to other brunch places. I got the smoked salmon crostini and chilaquiles . Both to die for. Killer bloody as well

Awesome brunch spot! Two of my friends and I arrived at 1130a on a Sunday and we sat down at 1230p. I've heard there's always a wait on the weekends but we were prepared for that. I had the Benedict and it was so flavorful! My friends both built their own omelettes and also thought they were exceptionally good. They got mimosas and I had their regular Bloody Mary- awesome! Food came quick even tho our waitor was very busy. He did a wonderful job. Would definitely go back.

Back in my old hood of Chicago! What I miss most of all about Chicago is the food, and this place does not disappoint! I ordered, because I was feeling sassy on a Sunday, the house Bloody Mary (they have all different kinds with tequila, whiskey etc). It was great, spicy, and fresh! You can tell its homemade tomato juice!I had the build your own omelette with egg whites packed full of veggies. I picked the roasted tomato and toast rather than the potatoes. The toast was more like a baguette/biscotti and it was incredible! I got the whole wheat....mmmm!My friend ordered the quinoa and kale which came with an egg on top...wow, it looked amazing and she loved it!They also have lemon pancakes which we didn't order but looked at longingly and envious from afar. Will definitely get those next time I am in town!The decor is minimalist and modern and just perfect! The only thing missing was my husband who was back in Washington, sigh, can't wait to bring him here on our next visit!

Great....but....Been to KSC several times.  The food is ALWAYS amazing.  Id kill (figuratively) for the deviled eggs.  Theres not a bad item on the menu.HOWEVERI was there yesterday with a big group for my wives birthday.  Food was great, service was perfect...until it was time to pay.  We gave the server a few credit cards to split, with simple, round numbers on each.  The server station was next to my seat, and after 10 minutes, I asked what was taking so long.  He said something about the system, but had no answer.Then I went and asked at the host stand, and was told they had a new system, and had to call the  company because they could not get it to work for us.  Every other table was checking out, but not us.Then I got REALLY upset when the server left all the credit cards laying on the server stand, and he walked away.  Left them there for anybody to steal.  He went to serve other tables, leaving us waiting.Of course, two of us had infants who needed to get home to feed, and another had to get to a class.Once I complained AGAIN, they somehow got it to work.But it took 30 minutes from the time I gave the server our cards to get them back. That is inexcusable.  Not sure I would go back with a group with our kids.  Im afraid of being stuck for 30 minutes waiting to pay again.
Very high quality ingredients and the best coffee around. Recommend getting 1/2 decaf as it is full bodied. Gives you the opportunity to have your omelette cooked firm or loser.

If you care about eating all natural, healthy cooked food- this is your destination.Came in after a facial (first notice- I was not professionally dressed and this is a nice cafe) on a weekday afternoon. Few but good amount of diners, a hostess with a friendly greeting right by the front doors, open space, with lots of sunlight coming through the windows. Clean and quiet, it's a great meet up place with a friend or in a middle of a work day.WONDERFUL menu. All natural burgers and I ordered one, and it was thick, and the patty was cooked perfectly medium as requested. Came with largely sliced tomatoes and lettuce, along with a pickle and fresh cut fries on the side. I heard brunch is amazing, and I would come back for that.The reason why I rated this restaurant a 4 instead of 5 was because I was asked by the hostess, who was very friendly, to order 'to go' by the cashier. 4 people working on the staff, and one of the cooks, after a few minutes of waiting, said '2 more minutes.' He didn't make any eye contact, no greeting, but for not being so busy, and it being during lunch hour, I felt patience was key, but i'm surprised they didn't get to me sooner. I waited for 10 minutes for my food, but that's okay. I know they cook everything fresh, and they did offer me water or to order a drink, but I should've received attention more quickly. I do believe that if I was dining here, it probably would have been a quicker notice.I think this cafe does strive to improve and do it's best. Great location next to Whole Foods. So if you want to grab lunch without it being an overwhelming experience at Whole Foods, then this is another great option!

This is a great spot for a nice brunch and they have the most delicious toast I have ever had, but you have to ask for the house made jam to put on it! Everything on the menu is good but everything is very pricey and both times I've gone I had to ask for extra things so that to make the food great i.e. The jam on the toast. The food isn't worth the price but you pay for the ambiance.

Kingsbury street cafe is great for breakfast.  The food is predictably good.  I have never had a bad meal.  We love to indulge for brunch and get a "starter" and get a grilled muffin.  Please note!! Ask to get your muffin grilled!!  So good.  Why haven't I done this at home?! They also have great boozy brunch drinks.

Delicious brunch! If you plan on going, understand the parking situation is pretty dismal. Like, real bad. We had made a reservation but definitely did not need it at 11:30 on a Saturday morning. They brew their own coffee and it was fantastic, very bold. Aidan L. thought that the breakfast quinoa sounded interesting, so we ordered this to start. I liked the idea, but you can't really hide the taste of quinoa or pretend that it's as tasty as oatmeal.For brunch, I ordered the salmon hash and was incredibly pleased with my decision. The flavor of the salmon and herbs was awesome, absolutely recommend this dish. The boyfriend created his own omelet and it was gargantuan. He thought it was good, but nothing amazing. There was a lot of egg, but not a ton of fillings. The toast that came with it, however, WAS amazing. Thick bread with unbelievable raspberry preserves, this tasted more like cake than toast. The real reason for my drop down to four stars is the service. Our waiter was friendly, but was MIA for what felt like years. Tables around us were sat, ate, and left in the time we were at Kingsbury. He was just nowhere to be found for most of the meal. I'd like to come back to try some of their sweet breakfast options and the baked items in the front looked spectacular.
Great ambience. They accept reservations for 6 or more, went there for brunch and got the salmon hash. Delicious.

This place was really cute inside - high ceilings, a little pastry section, and an open kitchen.  We were seated promptly, and our server was pretty pleasant.  I tried their Strawberry & Watermelon Fresh Fruit Cooler (had a weird aftertaste; probably from the watermelon) and their Masala Chai Tea Latte (big mug, but more foam than the tea).  For eats, we ordered the Kingsbury Cafe Breakfast (which came with 2 fresh organic eggs, roasted tomato, herb potatoes, cheddar scone, and maple glazed bacon), the Deviled Eggs (with crispy chorizo and chives), the Chia Seed Breakfast Pudding (with orange, blueberry, strawberry, almond milk, agave, and sliced almonds), Oatmeal Brulee (brown sugar crust, apple-cinnamon-raisins compote), Whole Wheat Carrot Pancakes (with maple cream cheese, pecans, and maple syrup), and a Create Your Own Omelette.  I enjoyed the cheddar scone as it was moist, tasty, and definitely not dry as I expected most scones to be.  the deviled eggs were tasty and were filled up to the max with the fillings, and the crispy chorizo strings on top were a nice added touch.  The oatmeal was pretty good, and the chia pudding tasted healthy (but would need more sprousing of the agave honey that came with).  I enjoyed the carrot pancakes with the maple cream cheese - not too sweet or not too bland.  It was a pleasant breakfast, but I thought it was a little too pricey with the serving portions they gave you as well as the cost of each of the additional sides (like $3.50 for two puny slices of the maple glazed bacon).  There are valet, garage, and metered parking around the area.+cheddar scone+deviled eggs+chia pudding+carrot pancakes with maple cream cheese+valet, garage, and metered parking available

We stopped here for our last day of our Chicago trip for breakfast. (We had actually walked right by it our first day during a walking tour, but were paying more attention to the Gatsby-like designs of the building's interior rather than the shops inside.)My friend and I were SO happy to have found this place. We went on a Friday morning (maybe around 9 or 10?) not full of people by any means, but a good solid breakfast joint! Our waitress was so kind, and friendly. There are definitely people that are regulars of this place, but they don't treat you like an outsider if you're not.Coffee was STRONG!! But hit the spot with out breakfast. Classic breakfast foods, done well. Pretty reasonable prices, and in a really cool building!

Years ago my husband had eaten some amazing banana pancakes at a restaurant somewhere along Jackson or Adams--he couldn't remember where--and now that we were back in Chicago he wanted them again. A two-hour Yelp search of all the breakfast joints in the area pointed to Ceres so we came here for breakfast. Nope, it's not the same place, but the pancakes were good and my eggs Benedict were even better. He said the coffee was really good as well.Can someone tell me something? This is the second time we've had hash browns in Chicago and they're different than what we usually get in Minnesota. There they're uniformly shredded and cooked so that they're golden brown and crispy on at least one side, maybe both sides. The ones we've had here have been an assortment of randomly shaped and sized potato pieces with some browned bits mixed in throughout. There's no cutting the edge of your fork through a crust into soft potato shreds inside. Just wondering.Anyway the prices were good and the food was really good so if I were in the neighborhood I would definitely eat breakfast here again.

I have only ever been here for drinks and this review is limited to that.  This is a nice bar for drinks after work.  The drinks are reasonably priced for downtown.  The beer list is good.  The service is always flawless and the staff is welcoming. I plan to continue drinking here after work.

Was waiting for a friend and decided to dine myself here.  Not bad at all - ordered the chicken enchiladas and a diet coke.  Got some hot sauce and had a little food party with myself.  The wait staff is really sweet and the food came out promptly.  It was inexpensive and filled me up.  I will likely forget the entire experience even happened next week.  I think the drinks here are cheap and worth it - if you're looking for a casual place to chat up a few finance peeps.

Not sure where to start with this one... I wanna say the inside reminds me of like an IHOP / Denny's sit down sort of place, but everyone inside was down to get turnt. Literally every table was here to get their drink on when I cruised through around 6pm on a Thursday.The alcohol here.... Let me just say that when I ordered a Buffalo Trace n Coke, I literally got a full glass of Buffalo Trace and a can of coke... WHAT THE EFF. Totally worth the $8 and change, goodness gracious. Hard liquor is where it's at here. Debated going for a second one, but I was pretty toasty after that first and didn't want to end up like the guy I saw on the way to the restroom holding on to the wall for dear life, so I decided on a 22oz draft Guinness to get into the St. Patty's Day mood.The food here... Just okay. I went for their Chicken Pot Pie special served with your choice of soup, salad, or potato. Overall it was alright, but I must say it was pretty generous on the chicken comparable to how generous they are on their alcohol. So that's always a plus!Definitely a good place to cruise thru if you're trying to get your drink on. 'Til next time, CHEERS!

You get an ENTIRE glass of liquor. If you say, "Gin and tonic, please." they bring you an ENTIRE GLASS OF GIN with a can of tonic. Challenge accepted.... one "drink" later and I was one happy lass.Waitstaff could be a bit better. I stared at four workers gossiping in a galley for 15 minutes before they came to ask what I'd like - it wasn't even happy hour yet.

"What's Ceres?" The first time I asked that question i got the response WHAT DO YOU MEAN YOU DONT KNOW WHAT CERES IS?!! ITS ONLY THE PLACE YOU START OFF WHEN YOU KNOW IT'S GONNA BE A LONG BOOZY NIGHT...wait, what? It's in the loop? How is this possible?..but it is. Situated on the first floor of the Board of Trade (you have to go inside the building to enter, unless it's summer when the back door is sometimes open for patio seating), it ...well, it looks like a run down IHop to be honest. But it is SO MUCH BETTER. For one, they have TVs everywhere. But more importantly, you can get sloshed for $9-12 (and possibly an extra $1 if you want that coke on the side).PS They also serve food if you don't want to meet a drunken demise too early...

Went to Ceres Cafe with some coworkers for lunch, and overall, this is a really busy place, but mainly because there aren't that many options, because this place is just average.Because I was just visiting Chicago, I wanted to find a place that I hadn't been to in downtown Chicago, and my colleagues recommended this place. We were able to get a table for during the lunch rush hour, but basically all the tables were full. I'd say this is just a typical diner, and a lot of the furniture and decor was faded.I had a BLT, and it was just average. Basically this is just quick lunch grub, the only difference is you sit down here while you get a Subway sandwich to-go. Basically the same quality, though.Service was fine enough, but it does seem that basically all the servers had been here for 20 years and were "over it."I don't really have a problem with this place, but I have no intention to go back for a work lunch.
