I believe the total with tip was around $25, which is very much expected when drinking with the chi-town scenesters;)All in the all, the Allis is a perfect spot for a pre dinner drink if you are dining on Randolph street. Very, very sexy and yummy drinks! Will definitely return:)
The main breakfast 'dish' is AMAZING...literally - PILE of smoked salmon with two eggs, avocado, tomatoes, and toast...very filling and super nutritious!

Came here for afternoon tea with my hubby. The stunning interior design and decorations caught my eyeballs at once!For $24 per person, it's well worth it. They offer finger sandwichs, several fancy desserts and a range of leaf teas for your choice. All tasted good, and my personal favorite is red velvet cupcake.Overall it is a great experience. Will definitely plan a visit again!

I'm obsessed with the Allis in the newer Soho House hotel. The hotel has everything from a spa, to a pizza place, a chicken shop and my absolute new favorite place to afternoon tea, the Allis. I made reservations a few weeks prior since they are starting to get busier and for some reason when I called the day of they didn't have the reservation. I thought I was going to freak out, but the manager Janel (sp?) totally took care of it and made sure we could be accommodated. Not only that since we asked for 5 girls for our table and two of the husbands tagged along with the babies they were able to get chairs for us last minute, now that is service you can rely on. We would all head over to the pizza place after having fabulous and affordable afternoon tea here. The place really is spectacular and we loved it for being located in the lobby. I must say this is no peninsula or the drake but I kind of like the more casual, boho like environment with super funky chandeliers. I also loved the fact that its kid friendly as I saw quite a few toddlers and babies around with their mommies as they sipped on their afternoon tea.Now onto the tea part, for $24 I truly think it's an affordable afternoon tea package with your own little tea pot. At first I thought the quality wouldn't be as great as some of the other high tea places in Chicago but I was gladly mistaken as everything and I mean everything was phenomenal. I kind of want to come back every weekend now. The presentation is beautiful when they bring everything out and all the pastries were delicious. Loved the salmon sandwich, loved their scone, loved the lemon tart with blueberries on top, loved the macaroon (and I normally don't like macaroons) and I even loved the chocolate cake with the delicious fluffy and whipped like chocolate mousse. I felt like those were the true standouts and I left full which doesn't always happen with an afternoon tea service. I know that at the peninsula and the drake you can ask for more scones as part of the package but I wasn't sure if they had that here since they also have an a la carte menu.So after everything, the only negative was that we were too full to join the guys at the Pizza East place besides having one bite just to try it (that place is also on point). I will be back for several reasons, LOVED the atmosphere, the management including Janel was super sweet and accommodating to us and our babies and the tea service itself was very memorable. Can't wait to come here again soon!
Incredible service. Seriously one of the most friendly wait-staffs I've ever encountered. We went for breakfast and it was fantastic. Such a cool place!

I've been to The Allis several times now for different reasons, at different times of the day and have always had a wonderful experience. Staff has always been incredibly friendly and service has been quick (but not rushed). I love the indoor bar as a spot to meet for a drink before heading somewhere else for dinner. The bar is beautiful and you never know who you'll run into. I equally love the cute little outdoor tables where you can enjoy a light breakfast or lunch. The pastries and breakfast offerings have always been topnotch and the coffee made to my liking. The atmosphere is almost European like, especially on sunny mornings when sitting out with a friend.

This is the type of place where you can eat breakfast, lunch, and dinner with delightful tea - but what made the experience was our amazing server- Sara. She was the best! Visiting from NYC, I can say that this is now THE place I have to return to every time I come to Chicago.Ps. Always get a slice of chocolate cake!

Super cute little bar inside of be soho hotel, love love the ambiance, tons of couches, seating, and little knocks. Came to meet a friend about 7pm Thursday night.. TERRIBLE parking (west loop is the worst!) but well worth it. Wonderful staff, friendly and quick service.. A bit overpriced but well worth for a drink with friends or date night.

Great use of space and the food/drinks were delicious even though pretty pricy. Brunch would have been amazing had we had better service. Our waiter took FOREVER to bring us anything and had to come back to ask what we ordered. We tried making conversation with him, but he was just not friendly and maybe just too overwhelmed even though there was 2 other waiters and a manager on the floor helping him clear tables and running his food. I asked if he could bring out my soup first, but I guess he forgot and brought us everything at once.This place has potential once they can figure service out.

Getting tea, homemade English muffins, a healthy and delicious meal, and being enveloped in style: what else is there for a weekend getaway brunch? We came because of the other high reviews on Yelp and made reservations for high tea the following day. Highly recommend the grains bowl - can't wait to try more tea flavors. We'll be coming again and again.

I'm a fan. Love x2 the ambience and vibe. Classy but casual and unpretentious. We usually come here for drinks and end up getting a few items to share. Can't help but always end up wanting to munch on something here because of the table spread they have next to the bar. The old fashioned and negroni are fabulous.Not sure what the other reviewer is complaining about in terms of not plating the food well. Soho House is British-inspired and they have very classic British items on the menu like the Scotch egg, pork pie and sausage roll. You eat it just like and it's not supposed to be garnished like at a fine dining place. Even Jamie Oliver would have served it like it is served at The Allis. The Scotch egg is ahhhhmazing.Breakfast here is wonderful too. They have boiled eggs and soldiers (can't get these British classics anywhere else in Chicago).

Such a lovely afternoon tea time with my mom and sister! I called about a week before to make reservations (tea time is the only thing you can make reservations for, and I suggest calling a few days before to get a spot) and had no issues. We were running about 15 minutes late so I called to inform them; when I arrived, I had no issues getting seated.The setup was so charming. Each person was required to get the afternoon tea package (1 pot of tea of your choice with a stacked tower of goodies. Each person got one of each food item). The package was $24 which was so great considering everything you got.I love the ambiance, the inside decor is so great.I definitely recommend tea time here, it's in a great location, close to many food options and bars.

Fantastic spot for a girl's afternoon tea or a baby shower/sprinkle.  The tea selection was robust and the spread of scones, sandwiches, cakes and sweets is impressive with enough variety to please everyone.Love the atmosphere of the place - updated shabby chic type of style that's eclectic.  It feels comfortable and not pretentious.  Overall, a great spot to spend the afternoon.

After searching for a unique spot to grab breakfast and coffee, I stumbled upon The Allis. Once inside I was immediately impressed by the refined interior and comfortable furnishings. This is the perfect place to meet friends for a coffee or high tea. I chose a cafe latte and the avocado toast for breakfast. Both were prepared well. While the toast was nothing over the top, the atmosphere alone made my experience.

I really wanted to give this place five stars, but I was not exactly pleased with the staff. My friend and I got there at 10:45am and were informed that they're doing last calls for their breakfast menu, so we ordered right away. My friend had originally asked for their eggs in a pot, but after about 4 minutes the lady came back and told us that they're out, and now she can only take order from their lunch menu. I'm not sure what their time frame is, but that was 10:52.The food was good. I had the avocado toast, and it was arguably the second best I've ever had. The avocado was fresh and ripe and very very very creamy. The poached egg on the top was OK, the yolk was cooked a little much for my taste. Regardless, the big chunks of avocado with basil was very impressive, the basil really added to the flavor and gave it a fresh taste.Excellent interior design as well, which I am a total sucker for. Perfect for a breakfast or lunch with your friend (if you can wake up early enough to make it before they start their lunch menu, that is). The lunch menu seemed good too, definitely want to try their wagyu tartare and tuna crudo, and the atmosphere seemed to be good for an afternoon tea too.I am definitely going back, I just wish the staff was a little friendlier, i got the impression that they just didn't want to be bothered and were not pleased whenever we asked for something (we weren't asking for anything impossible, I just wanted a napkin so I could spit out my gum, and separate checks for me and my friend. Plus, we only had one menu to begin with). Also, I could see how it could get a little hectic as people from the hotel kept on passing by with luggages. I really want to like this place, hopefully it will work out next time.

I've been celebrating my birthday this whole week and it seems the celebration continued with or without me wanting it to continue. It has been a special big birthday and at the end I couldn't be more blessed.We planned having afternoon tea for our annual spring tea but since it's so close to my birthday, it was sorta kinda mixed up together. We were giving a new player in the tea Chicago arena a try.Soho House is a beautiful hotel and quite exclusive. It's a member only hotel and if you aren't a member, you ain't staying here. It's pretty hip and pretentious at the get go. One of my friends said she was ignored in her Honda at valet and they took care the Porsches and the Teslas first. Douchey on that.The inside was beautiful and buzzing! So many people in the lobby and it was quite overwhelming for a little bit. I had an issue with my reservation but they finally made it right by me and they kept my original time and sat us after about 10 minutes of wait for them to set up the tea set.For $24/pax, it was a pretty wonderful tea offering. We didn't know what to expect as comparing it to Peninsula's tea at a whopping $75/pax after tax and tip, $24 plus tax and tip seemed pretty damn reasonable. The tea selection was smaller but I found my earl grey and I was happy.The sandwiches were simple but they were delicious. The ham and cheese was especially nom nom though it's just ham and cheese. The desserts were pretty including lemon tart, eclairs, macarons, and a chocolate cake. The sweet bread and the scones were my least fave. They were just okay borderline meh. However, we were full and happy. We had a great time chatting away on the couch and drinking tea and eating tiny food where our pinky raised as we held them. Oh poo. Call it hoytie toytie. At least we didn't put on hats and flower dresses.It was definitely enjoyable and the price was right. The ambience was also pretty chill after the lobby died down. The service was a bit slow, and then it picked up, then it was slow again. But overall, for being as busy as they were, I forgave them.For some reasons, all my friends left me to wait for my ride to pick me up at 6 pm. I was actually a little pissed they all left me to wait by myself but turned out they were all being sneaky as they had to go to the restaurant where I found them all as they screamed surprise!! Holy shit. It was crazy.Was a great afternoon tea spot. Nice ambience, food is more than fair, and price is right. The tea madam would recommend it.

Finally made the trip here for breakfast around 10 with a couple friends. Seated right away and had wonderful service. We ordered the poached egg avocado toast, yogurt with berries and granola and the almond butter flax seed toast. Loved all three of them!! This place is so adorable and unique, it was well worth the early wake up! Highly recommend if you're looking for a trendy (and healthy!) breakfast option.

Ordered the El Jefe style quarter chicken (dark meat), mac n cheese, and mexican coke to go.The employees were all friendly and the wait for my food was minimal (10 minutes top, probably less.  What am I, a clock?).  The mexican coke is self explanatory, always good.  The mac n cheese was good.  The sauce wasn't watery and it was a healthy serving (unless you're a glutton).  If I'm being picky, I'd have preferred the noodles be more tender, but come on, that's pompous.  I would order it as a side again.  The chicken was great (drum stick and thigh, which came with pita bread).  Whatever marinade they use for the El Jefe was reminiscent of how my father would marinade his chicken for a chinese "bbq" chicken.  If I'm being honest, it was a bit better (sorry pops!).  Not in your face with the flavors and subtle.  Maybe you want it to hit your taste buds like an atomic bomb, but I don't.  Plus, they have two types of hot sauces (green and red).  They both were great sauces, the red being spicier and maybe barely edging out the green (jury's still out).  All this for ~$10.  Really feeling and left me satisfied.  I'm looking forward to coming back and trying the other style and other side dishes.$10 credit card minimum

The Art of Chicken is a pretty good place to grab a bite if you're ever in Bucktown and craving some chicken.  My wife and I ordered the El Jefe with sides of sweet potato fries, mac and cheese, and corn on the cob.Firstly, the chicken was really tasty.  Be sure to ask for their homemade sauces to try, as there weren't any bottles out when we stopped by.  It really does make a difference. I especially enjoyed the green chili sauce.  The chicken itself wasn't too dry, which shows that they actually monitor the food as they cook it instead of throwing it on the grill for a long time and drying it out.I wasn't as impressed with the sides.  The mac and cheese seemed like your standard fare for any BBQ restaurant in the city, and the corn on the cob had too much mayo on it for my liking and was slightly soggy.  Sweet potato fries are just that...sweet potato fries.  It's hard to mess that up.In short, come for the chicken, not the sides, and you won't be disappointed.

Very tasty chicken! My husband and I split a whole El Hefe chicken and we got the mac and sweet potato fries as sides.  All the food was very good, especially the chicken.  It was very flavorful and moist--perfect! The restaurant was clean and staff was nice.  Prices were reasonable.  A great find!

I just left, this is a small spot since we were the only two there that was fine by me. I got 1/4 white El Jefe with mashed potatoes n gravy. There was only about a 10 min wait. The chicken was cooked perfectly and juicy while the skin was crunchy as grilled chilled should be. The mashed potatoes were made with redskin potatoes (YES) n the gravy was yummy. I mixed the hot sauce (orange) and the bbq sauce, the BEST!!!! I'll definitely be back.

Never disappoints! One of my favorite spots in the neighborhood. I prefer the Jefe. Fries are a no brainer. The only thing I think that could use some improvement are the steamed veggies -- I'd rather them plain. Regardless, you can't go wrong here!

Visiting Bucktown from Memphis, TN and decided to stop in. Decor is great but the food was even better. Ordered a half chicken el jefe style with mashed potatoes, friend ordered half chicken chico style and mashed potatoes.Chicken was perfectly spiced lots of great flavor and the meat itself was fresh and delectable. Mashed potatoes were a perfect compliment. Ate everything on my plate including the warm pita bread.Food came out to roughly $12.50 including 20% tip. Felt very full from this meal!

Ate hear on a Thursday night.  Very simple menu.  They have 2 types of chicken and some sides.  The chicken was excellent and the sides were good as well.  Great value.  It was a nice day and we ate outside.

Good chicken but I don't know. The concept needs a lot of work.The art of chicken makes you think that there'd be something more sophisticated to this or something more complex/refined. And you'd expect that to be reflected in the descriptions of the chicken. Something to make your mouth water...They serve two types of chicken but based on their description, I can't even tell how they're supposed to be different. It was confusing. And although the chicken we picked was pretty good the sides were definitely not....pretty bland overall.
Great food ALL the Time!What else can you say they keep it so simple it taste great!
Best chicken I have tried so far lots of good flavors and herbs.Chicken is  marinade very delicious.  You must try

If you're craving chicken, this place is great! A very simple menu makes it easy to decide what you want.I actually called in to find out the difference between el jefe and crazy chico. I was told that el jefe was more crispy and that crazy chico had more herbs. No mention that it wasn't fried chicken which was what I was expecting (again, no descriptions on grubhub, I'm not crazy!).It wasn't a big deal, though, because both types were good. I'm probably not going to order crazy chico again (just a matter of taste, not the biggest fan of herby chicken but my sister really liked it) but I loved el jefe and will likely get it again.The sweet potato fries were a bit eh but the mashed potatoes were awesome and a better pairing with chicken anyway.
This is a great place to pick up a amazing succulent, herbed and marinated bird. Every time I go it's packed with cops eating lunch. Try the fries, mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese.

I came in thinking that they served fried, not flame-broiled, but I loved it nonetheless. I had the El Jefe white meat quarter chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy for lunch on my way back from O'Hare, and it delivered. The chicken was very moist, the mashed(smashed really) potatoes and gravy was really good(the portion was pretty sizable as well). The service was also fantastic.

I'm a huge charbroiled chicken fan. When I saw that there's a chicken place closer than Wicker Park, I really wanted to try it. My first go around with Art of Chicken was just okay. We weren't wowed by it.This weekend, on the suggestion of my husband, my infant son and I did a stroller walk to lunch (for me) while my eldest son napped. When I stepped into their small storefront, their cute kitschy decor impressed me. For such a small place, they put a lot of thought into how it looks. When I looked over the menu, I asked the server at the window what was her favorite. She preferred "Crazy Chico" with its herbs and spices marinade. I stuck with my typical charbroiled chicken order of a half of chicken and a side. Since it's been super hot lately, I got a beverage too.The chicken is served on a cute metal plate with a tray and homemade salsas with pita bread. Crazy Chico chicken is amazing. It almost made me question my loyalty to Nick's Pit Stop. It was a great blend of herbs and spices to make a tasty chicken. I had sweet potato fries which were tasty too. If there's one thing I don't like about Art of Chicken, it's the pita bread. Theirs is dry and a little too salty. I like soft fluffy pita bread not overly chewy.Overall, I like this place and will return again for another stroller walk lunch with my kiddo. The staff was really nice and helpful too.

Outside of always running out of my preferred chicken, and it being so popular the wait is a min of 20 minutes when I visit, every side is flavorful, staff is friendly and the food is filling and affordable. When I don't want to cook, a chicken, pita bread, creamy Mac, sweet Potato fries and green rice are our favorite actions and I never pay more than 25-30 bucks for at least 3 of us (there are always leftovers). Hope they expand for more seating soon!

Delviery order.  2x Half orders Chico/JefeSweet potato fries, Corn on the Cobb.Amazing well prepared chicken delivered timely(Thursday delivery).Sides well made too :)We only wish there was a sweeter sauce for the chicken.  The red/green sauces while tasty weren't all too different from each other.  Not much contrast.

I have to say I am very impressed with the owner Christian me and my had a bad experience with an employee and he was quick to resolve the issue and offered us a free meal for our trouble! I respect him as an owner and btw the chicken here is really good!

The menu is short and sweet and delicious! I prefer the 'Crazy Chico', but you can't go wrong with either chicken choice. As for sides, I am a sucker for their mac & cheese and their mashed potatoes.I love Art of Chicken for quick, yet scrumptious dinners.. Definitely recommend!

Ordered both types of chicken available and steamed vegetables. Steamed vegetables were not good, but the healthiest option for sides. Would definitely order other sides if I return. El Jefe is much better of the two chicken options. Pricing is good and food came out relatively quickly.
The food is good. However the wait time is outrageous for a couple pieces of chicken. Both times I've been here there's only been two other people waiting and it was 15-20 minutes wait.

Small menus typically make me feel a little claustrophobic, but sweet ass chicken can change just about anybody's mind!I tried the half chicken (el jefe), mac and cheese, and sweet potato fries.This place is definitely ALL about the chicken.  The seasoning packs a nice herby, salty, tasty goodness.  And the prep of the roast/grill gives a slight char with a nice crisp and a juicy inside.  A+.The salsas (red/green) are also very tasty and go well with the pita they give you.  You can make like 4 mini-gorditas... or not.The mac and sweet potato fries were above average and a nice complement.  The sides were only a little disappointing because of how flavorful the chicken was.Also, they did not have any crazy chico when I went, which is weird considering they only offer 2 flavors?  C'mon man.Overall, a great spot for a quick/simple dinner without the complete guilt of typical fast food.
This place is perfection. Every time. From the food to the delivery guy I really think they nail the fries and chicken. No qualms.
Soggy pita bread. Average chicken. Poor service. Go to Nick's Pit Stop for much better experience.

A restaurant that obviously focuses on chicken vs. a vegetarian - they had enough delicious sides to make me forget they were a chicken restaurant. And ordering just sides, I had a very inexpensive lunch! This is a great spot to grab something to take with you or take a load off and enjoy the food right when it comes out of the kitchen. I know there's a lot of new chicken places in town, but if you haven't tried this one yet, you're missing out.Oh, and this is part of what I've been calling the "Walk Western" path - starting down at Challengers Comics (or coming off of the 606), hitting Margie's/Quesadilla/The Art of Chicken/Paladar for food, grabbing something sweet at GBD, hunting to get a piece of your childhood back at Toy de Jour, looking for oddities at Sideshow Gallery, and ending up at Logan Arcade. Great date day all in one stretch of Western that most people miss while doing the same old Milwaukee Ave stuff. All this while getting some exercise walking Western!

I work in the area and order from this place a lot for lunch as a group. The food is great, no doubt about it.  The chicken has plenty of flavor and the sides are good.My only complaint for much needed improvement is delivery.   It's always 1 1/2 - 2 hrs wait time.  The group loves the food enough to deal with the long wait time.

Price has gone up from $10.99 to $13.99 for a whole chicken. The El Jefe was pretty darned tasty, whatever it is they smear it in. The skin was super crispy and full of flavor, although the flavor didn't fully penetrate the chicken. If they were to marinade the chicken for longer, find bigger chickens, and lower the price, that would probably bring this review up to 5 stars.Service was awesome I have to say. I was working out and called about 25 min before close to ask if I could place an order for pickup at around close. Lucky me, they said yes! The girl on the phone was friendly and my order was ready for pickup when I got there so I was in and out in 5 min.

Great chicken place. My 2 yr old asks for "more chicken more chicken more chicken" $13.99 for a whole chicken wasn't too expensive but I did think $3.99 for a side was a little steep. The elotes were good, and the kids devoured the Mac n cheese. All in all this place has what you need for a good chicken shack. Prob only room five tables inside but we took ours to go and ate at home.

Friendly service, and the mac & cheese is to die for! Great quality chicken and seasoned to perfection-- however, even though I ordered a quarter size chicken, I was kind of let down when I saw just how small the chicken leg & breast piece were.
El Jefe style was amazing! Best seasoned fries ever! Terrific Mac n' cheese!!! So good. Reasonably priced. Blows Honey Butter Chicken out of the water. Super nice service!
Really great flavor...hot sauce is one of the best I've had...only negative thing I have to say is that it is closed on Sunday's.

We love the Art of Chicken.Tonight, I picked up dinner on my way home (I live on Western). Once I got out of my car, the bottom of the bag was water logged and ripped open. All the food spilled out and was wasted in the dirty alley. I called up Art of Chicken and told them, showed them pictures and they made us a brand new order at no charge.Great food and great business owners. We will be back.

The Art of Chicken has amazing chicken! I came in one night after hot yoga and this is what I ordered --El JefeVery flavorful and moist! My mom and I loved it-Mexican CornDid not enjoy this one, would not order again-Sweet Potato FriesDelicious! Perfectly crisp on the outside but still moist and wonderful on the inside-Mexican RiceYour average Mexican Rice. Nothing mind blowing about it but done very well and tasty-Red Hot SauceMy mom loved this! It's quite spicy though so be careful in pouring it on your chicken!Grand Total ~$15!The Art of Chicken is a great deal and has very very delicious chicken. I would definitely order their sweet potato fries again but not any of the other sides that I ordered. I really want to try their mashed potatoes next time!Bonus! The decor in here is absolutely adorable!

Really excellent! After trying both Crazy Chico and El Jefe, we've decided that the more popular El Jefe is our favorite, but they're both delicious! The sides were good, too - pita, steamed veggies, Spanish rice - but the Spanish rice with roasted corn is our fave. Delivery was fast and friendly, and everything was piping hot when it got here - no mean feat from Logan Square to Wrigleyville! This place is a solid A+, and we finally found a chicken place to replace our beloved, now defunct Fogo2Go.

This is absolutely one of my favorite places to get chicken. If your looking for flavorful, juicy chicken, this is the place to be .The associates are very nice and care about the food, I have only positive things to say about this place.

Really good chicken, I tried the crazy chico and man that chicken was good. French fries were awesome and sauces as well. The chicken is well marinated and not dry at all or over seasoned. Will be back to try el jefe...
Excellent chicken marinated is excellent. French Fries seasoning is amazing. All around excellent place to go for lunch or dinner.

God, I love this place. I live a block from here and every single day it is a STRUGGLE to not walk in here and order the El Jefe. Self-control!!!I've tried both El Jefe and the Crazy Chico. Chico is good but not as good as El Jefe, so I'd definitely recommend El Jefe over the Chico. For the side, the sweet potato fries are pretty on-point and amazing. The pita you get as a free side and the salsas (both!) are phenom.They're pretty busy during dinner times but they're always extremely nice to you. Really clean and nice space as well, if you would rather eat in!

I am so disappointed in this place lately. The food is great. However, trying to get the food seems to be a problem lately. At work, our office used to order from here all the time. At least once a week, sometimes more & our orders were usually $50.00+ each time. But as of lately, it seems there are a lot of catering orders going on & we have to wait until those are completed in order to place an order. Unfortunately, our orders have cut down because of this. We try calling at 11:00am when they open thinking that we might beat the lunch crowd, but because there is a catering order, they want us to call back around Noon or 1:00pm and then it ends up being an hour and a half wait. I'm sorry, but I think that's ridiculous. Either more staff is needed or they shouldn't service out of the delivery area (past catering orders were near the airports) to where regular locals cannot order because of a long wait.

I am bad about using Yelp just to gripe about places but I am trying to redeem myself and be positive. I have been going here for years and it is just one of the best chicken places I have ever been to. The Chicken is always tender and the sauces really spice it up. The sides are all awesome and the corn on the cob is just to die for. A must eat and great for takeout.

OMG soooo good!Just ordered this yesterday when I was yelping for Chicken while shopping at Target (Elston). Why haven't I been here before?Anyways we got 1.5 of El Jefe with mash potatoes, Spanish rice, and sweet potato fries as our sides. The entire family loved it - yes even our picky 3 year old loved it. My 1 year old also devoured everything.Definitely my go to place for char-broiled chicken :)

Love the crazy chicken.  Have been about ten times after other place closed on damen.  Great choice by me.  Have had both and they taste similar but crazy chicken is my favorite.  The Spanish rice is a must and the corn on the cob is great as well.  Skip the veggies they aren't very good.  Limp and dead

High hopes were dashed by very dry chicken.  The sauces were very spicey (and I like spice) but too hot for my husband.The fries were the best thing (5 star) crispy and awesome with some special coating and seasoning.The Mac and cheese okThe 'steamed vegetables' were horrible and like school lunch frozen veg.Still on the hunt for awesome chicken.

Finger lickin good!  First time at this place and I walked out impressed, full and happy!Their menu is simple.  Choose the type of chicken you want between two choices, the El Jefe and the other one that is not as intense (LOL,can't recall the name).The pita bread that accompanies the chicken is good and kinda greasy but in a taste so good so who the hell cares kind of a way.  I kept it simple with 1/2 of a chicken, mashed potatoes and corn on the cob.  I was in carb heaven and you will be too so go there now and tell yourself you'll hit the gym tomorrow and eat steamed veggies only for the next 10 days.  Their chicken is some of the best fried chicken I've had.
Em jefe was delicious !  Quarter of a chicken and fries cooked to perfection!  It must have been that overnight marinade.  So moist, fries so crispy!

Attention All Chicago Foodies !!!I found the perfect Mexican grilled Chicken Spot !!!I had the El Jefe order.Man it was out of this world.The salsas where fresh and on point.The fries could also be a main course as well andThe chicken was moist inside and crispy goodness on the outside.I Will definitely be back with friends and family.

Good, simple chicken joint. I prefer the El Jefe with a crispier skin to the spicier Loco. But, both are solid options. Great sides too! Mac 'n cheese and sweet potato fries are my favorites.Very friendly staff and I love the chicken artwork.

Been here a couple of times.The chicken is just chicken nothing crazy. I mean yea is good chicken but not outstanding. First time I was there I tried both of them and even though I did notice a little difference between them, the flavors are not as distinctive as I would like them.BTW the fist time I was there the chicken was a little underdone, almost raw. second time we asked them to cook it well done and it came out just perfect.The sides, on the other hand, are great. And for me maybe the only reason to come back to this joint. I have tried the mac n cheese, corn on the cob and sweet potato fries. Mexican style corn the way is should be on the cob with all the toppings. solid mac n cheese and great fries. When I think about this place I crave the sides more than the chicken. Would it be wrong to make a meal out of sides???Service is nice but there is one girl with a bitchy attitude disguised as nice. She tries to be nice but her bitchyness comes through.The place is small but really cool. Some tables and bars, some chicken wire and cool wall art make for a cool place.The prices are spot on.The art of chicken, 3* for chicken and service, 4 * for the sides

I ordered twice and both times my takeout order was excellent. The service is good and the portions are larger than you think. Everything I ordered came with lots of bread and sauce. Also, it is great that you can order through Grubhub.

Nom Nom Nom. I've been waitingggg for this place to open up forever. The inside makes you feel like you just dropped peyote and started drawing chickens. Also, it makes me feel like I'm a chicken stuck inside a cannibals heaven. And 9 minutes for my meal! Damn! These hombres do NOT mess around.There are two types of chickens, El Jefe and the crazy Chico.//el jefe - 4.25 (quarter chicken) - smokey flavor with a crispy skin. It almost has some sort of sweet tangy taste to it. I loved it, thought it was amazinnngggg//corn on the cob - 1.99 - dayummm dayummm DAYUUMMMMM. this is some REAL ASS CORN! its very similar to elotes [might be the same thing] except they don't cut the corn off, put it in a styrofoam cup and give your fatass a spoon it eat it with! The corn was sooo soft and full of flavor. I meannnn JUICES UP IN YOUR FACE.. and you better believe you be thanking it afterwards [it = referring to the corn].All in all. This place is amazing. Maybe I was just lucky but I think this place will be here to stay. Great service, nice staff, quick food, cheap food and free parking. Art of chicken, you know a way to a man's heart, by slowly clogging his arteries.

This is a great little chicken restaurant!They do not have a huge, extensive menu but they offeryou a choice of 2 types of chicken, El Jefe' which is marinated overnightand has more of a smoky traditional flavor or the Crazy Chico which boastssome really great herbs and spicesI myself felt a connection to the Crazy Chico and I was not disappointedwith this flame broiled goodness.You have the options of a 1/4 chicken, 1/2 chicken or a whole.and it comes with warm pita bread and homemade salsa.Sides will be extra but they offer such sides as mashed potatoes,sweet potato fries,spanish rice, mac and cheese.The Art of Chicken has about 4 tables and some seating againstthe window, I also noticed some tables outside as well.The menu prices are very reasonable, I got a whole meal forunder $9.00 which I thought was pretty sweet!So.. if  you haven't tried the Art of Chicken I would suggestyou give them a try..You may like them as much as I do...
Food is really really good, but there are just too many of this type of chicken joints in Chicago that do the same thing for so much less money.

I was very excited to try this place- I asked the girl behind the counter which chicken had the most flavor, she said, "El Jefe" the menu also offered something called, "Crazy Chico".  The description of the two was about the same-I walked right in and ordered- no waiting there- but, did have to wait over 10 minutes for a whole chicken to go (no sides). Easy enough order- and all the chicken was pre-made- so it shouldn't have taken 10 mins. There were 2 people ahead of me also waiting.They apologized for the wait to everyone. I understand, the place is new, and they are getting it together, But they need to step up the pace a bit- Everything is already cooked, it shouldn't take so long.As far as the chicken goes- it did not jump out at me, as being anything special, it was good, but not over the top.  For half the amount, the rotisserie chicken at Costco is better. But, I will try this place again.The salsa they offer with the bird is great.

Love this place! It is the definition of what makes a great neighborhood restaurant. The menu is simple but consistently delicious, decor is fun but not tacky, and staff are all friendly. I used to live across the street and would go 2-3 times per month and loved taking visiting friends and family there to get a taste of the neighborhood. Also great pre-game food.
This chicken is amazing guys. It's a must have. I always buy El jefe chicken and can't never get enough of it. Place is a also need and clean.

I've been craving the chicken here for months now so I finally decided to do something about it.  As usual the food was outstanding.  The main reason I'm updating my review is to update some information.  The pictures of the menu for this business here on Yelp are no longer accurate price wise.  Unfortunately I didn't think to take a picture of the current menu prices.  For a whole chicken the price has gone up $3 so it's now $13.99 for a whole chicken.  I know my grocery bill continues to rise so it makes sense that restaurants are feeling the same financial pinch that their customers are suffering through.Even with the higher prices I will continue to get here as often as possible since they make outstanding chicken that I think is worth the 1 1/2 hour ride on public transportation to get there.  The price may be higher than it used to be but in my opinion it's still worth every penny.  If it goes much higher then I'll think twice, but for now it's well worth it.

Really casual and affordable, perfect for pick up.  Tasty chicken, tasty salsa!The chicken comes with pita bread and salsa for dipping and it's a surprisingly good combo.As far as the sides, the Mexican style corn is always good and so are the fries and potatoes.  It's a small business so it's a small menu, but I appreciate having something a little different in the area.  Thanks guys!

El jefe or Crazy Chico, you can't go wrong! I usually go with the half chicken and a side of sweet potatoes after the gym and this is the perfect combination of protein and carbs after a workout. Sometimes I'm feeling fancy and get the Mac n cheese too. Even the veggies are seasoned well and they are very tasty. I'll keep coming back as long as I am in the area.
Love this place so much. The chicken is amazing, well seasoned and properly cooked. A great bang for your buck!

Warning : This review is based solely off of customer service, never even got to try the food. I called in an order for pickup- quarter chicken and a side of fries. A few minutes later I had something come up and realized I was unable to drive there and pick up my food so as a courtesy I called back to cancel the order. The person who answered the phone tells me to hold on at this point I'm wondering what do I have to hold on for isn't this the part where you say "okay thanks for calling and letting us know"?  Anyway she comes back on the line and tells me with attitude "your order is on the grill" my reply was "hey I'm just calling you as a courtesy, I'm telling you I'm not going to get it.  With that she hung up on me.  Needless to say I'll never know what the chicken tastes like but I can tell you the service sucks.....

So good! I finally found my grilled chicken spot. Juicy and flavorful. I also loved their fries and Mexican corn. What would make this place even better? Seasonal sides. I would love to see other options for veggies. Overall a solid lunch.

Even if I were to become a vegetarian, I'd still get the chicken here.  Art of Chicken provides a noble end to every hen that meets its demise upon the grills therein.  Every bite is heaven.  The skin is crispy and flavorful; the meat is savory with just the right texture.The quality of the chicken varies a bit.  The Saturday crew is always awesome.  However, the chicken has been unusually dry/burnt on weeknights once or twice.  Dear reader, if it's not perfect the first time, give this place another chance and go back again a different day.The mac and cheese pairs well with either the Crazy Chico or the El Jefe.  It's basic mac and cheese - not fancy or heavy or artisanal, just creamy white-gold goodness on noodles - comforting, tasty.  It calms your palate after the kick from the red salsa.The Mexican corn on the cob is glorious, but a guiltier pleasure.   The steamed veggies were weird and tasted like canned food - would not get the veggies again.Everyone who works here is really nice.  I also tend to see a lot of police officers eating here, so uh... don't commit any crimes while you're waiting for your food.The interior has a really charming, wooden, artsy feel.  Great place to bring friends/family, or for people watching.  Western Ave near the blue line has been undergoing a metamorphosis over the past few years, and Art of Chicken really represents the positive changes there.

The Art of Chicken is one damn fine restaurant. But not nearly as fine as the art itself. Indeed, the chicken here is roasted to perfection. I had a half order of the El Jefe and a regular sized order of the Mac & Cheese. The El Jefe chicken is marinated overnight, cooked slow, and you can definitely tell from the first bite; it is a masterpiece. The spice is light but the taste is substantial. The skin comes crispy and breaks with ease as it separates easily with each bite thus allowing you to portion your skin to meat ratio as you please. The meat falls effortlessly off of the bone which, if you've ever cooked chicken, is not simple feat. In the end, you will have a pile of bones and nothing else.These guys really put the time and care into making great chicken and if you ever crave it, then you shouldn't hesitate to come here. Along with the chicken, they also serve some pita bread, which comes out warm and soft like they had just baked it. If you'd like, they will also serve you up some homemade salsa which was quite delicious. I'm from California, so my expectations for salsa are very high. I had their green and their orangyish salsa. Both were spicy, which I was excited about, and packed some nice flavor. However, i'm a much bigger fan of salsa that carries much more of a tomato taste. Although the salsa that I tried had more flavor coming from the peppers, it was still satisfying. The mac & cheese was no gimmick either and paired well with the chicken.All in all, the service was great, the place is clean and well-kept. They got a TV to entertain you, although I'm sure you'll just be staring at your plate. In the end, it's all about the chicken.

I had to get $10 worth because there is a $10 credit card limit and then I was waiting inside for my order and the music was so loud and pop-y that I couldn't bare it much longer. So when I got my food I took it outside which was nice, it was a nice a day. The corn with everything was a disappointment there was an overload of butter mayo and parmesan and im not picky about corn, I love elote, this corn just didn't taste good. Then my chicken meat was grey, I'm not sure if it was because marinating over night so I ate it anyways. And there was not enough chicken meat on my piece for one person. I was still pretty hungry after spending $10 so I was pretty bummed. I'd like to give it another chance but honestly I'll probably stick to the chicken dinner for $7 at Q-tine

They were out of corn which I really wanted to try. They were also out of one of the chickens we wanted. I guess this is a sign they are great. The fries were awesome. Delivery took an hour or so. The driver was kinda rude like a few others said. But I would definitely order again!

I love this place - great concept. Super simple, straight forward menu that is done really well, at a low price. The chicken can take a while to come out, but everything is seems like it is made to order. Both flavors of chicken are good but I'm partial to the Jefe.The sweet potato fries and rice are very good, though I think the other sides are a bit lacking. However, I'm happy enough to just eat the chicken with that warm pita, and some salsa.It is a tremendous value, considering you can get a huge amount of Chicken for about $13 - I've lived off a single order a couple days!

The hubby and I stopped in the Art of Chicken on a rainy Thursday night. We were supposed to see a country concert at the Congress, but it was cancelled due to rain. I wanted to go somewhere nearby that matched my cowboy boot attire, so we ended up at the Art of Chicken.The restaurant is tiny, and when we were there it was filled with cops (which I have learned is a good sign).I had the crazy chico chicken (breast and wing) with mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, and Mexican coke (YAY for Mexican coke!).The chicken was moist and tender, but it wasn't super flavorful. The red and green sauces were good and added a little kick--which I thought was missing from the skin.  I think I would rather go to Feed for my chicken needs.  However, the sides were awesome. I loved the mac and cheese. It was creamy and gooey. The mashed potatoes with gravy were yummy as well.Overall, we will probably go back to the Art of Chicken. The chicken was not as awesome as Feed's, but the sides were pretty delicious.

Minus the weird name and semi-confusing chicken descriptions, this place is awesome. There aren't many really good places in Bucktown to grab a solid, home-cooked, comfort food chicken meal. So when this guy moved to town, I was pretty excited to try it out.Essentially, they have two options of chicken, you pick one or the other, and load up on side dishes.  One is juicier than the other, so it really depends if you like moist chicken or spiced and crunchy chicken.  Both are delicious so if that's all you care about, close your eyes and point.For side dishes, I recommend the mac and cheese and/or the sweet potato fries, but they have plenty of other options to choose from.  I tried out the corn on the cob with everything on it, and I hate to say it (for fear of sounding like a 12 year old girl) but it was pretty spicy. I don't know what was on it, but my lips felt like the sun afterwards.  Just fair warning that if you like it more on the mild side, just ask for butter.The prices are very reasonable, the food is delicious, the staff is friendly, and the service is quick.  What more could you ask for?

It's so nice to have a casual, carrry-out restaurant in the neighborhood. The Art of Chicken recently opened and it's perfect for those evenings where you want to pick up something quick, inexpensive, but still relatively healthy.TAOC sells two kinds of chicken, which is grilled: Crazy Chico and El Jefe. The descriptions sounded about the same to me, but I recall that the El Jefe is marinated in juices and spices, and the Crazy Chico is marinated in herbs and spices. The chicken is sold in quarters, halves, or whole options, and comes with homemade salsa and pita bread.Several sides are also available: mashed potatoes, spanish rice, fries (sweet or regular), steamed vegetables, corn on the cob, and my personal favorite, mac and cheese. Sides come available in both small and large size options.We placed an order for a whole chicken (Crazy Chico), and sides of spanish rice and mac and cheese. We waited about 15 minutes for our order. The chicken came hot off the grill, and looked and smelled great.I thought the chicken was really well done (in execution, not temperature) . The skin was crispy, and the flavor went deep into the chicken. It was juicy, and kind of smokey tasting. Me likey.The spanish rice was rather lacking. It didn't have a lot of flavor, but the mac and cheese more than made up for the shortfalls of the rice. It tasted strongly of a nice sharp cheddar, and the consistency was very creamy. Wished we'd have ordered a large size instead of a small.Service was swift and very friendly. You may have to wait a few minutes for your food as the chicken takes some time to cook, but it's worth it.Chicken is all they sell here, but they do it right.
Excellent chicken joint just a few steps north from the Western O'hare blue line. The service is friendly, the prices are reasonable, and the bird and sides are FLAME!
There really needs to be a score higher than 5 to accommodate Art of Chicken. When you're tired & beat down from the chicago winter, there is really nothing so great as art of chicken and netflix.

I've been waiting since the minute they put the sign outside their store. That was a long time ago.   I spent most of my day annoying coworkers telling them about the chicken I would dominate after work.  Finally, my wish came true as the place opened for business today.I hate comparing it to chains like El Pollo Loco or Pollo Campero, as it's much much better than those places.  Wait, I guess i just did.  But that's what I was first reminded of.  The Mexican influence is apparent throughout the small menu and they do a great job on their specialty chicken.We had the Crazy Chico along with some fries, mac and cheese, and spanish rice.  You could really taste the flavors and spices used.  Not sorry to say I went HAM on the Crazy Chico and almost finished a whole chicken by myself.   The french fries were our favorite out of the sides. Big crunchy slices of potato with subtle hints of herbs and spices, we were quite pleased with them.My only suggestion would be to maybe offer some pico de gallo with the the chicken. Their salsas are tasty, but a good pico would go really well with the chicken. Maybe they just didn't have it today, hopefully they'll add it later.Inexpensive food and friendly counter service. Very excited that this place is open and I will definitely make multiple return trips.

All I have to say is I definitely echo the sentiments of the other reviewers on this page. I had a half order of jefe, large mac and cheese, and a regular sized sweet potato fries.The chicken was crispy on the outside, while retaining moisture and its juiciness. Even the breast from the chicken wasn't tough or dry like other restaurants. The sweet potato fries were excellent and the mac and cheese delivers like mac and cheese usually does. Will definitely be back soon! I do wish the pita that the chicken comes with had a bit more flavor- something was definitely missing.

Um, wow....just tried Art of Chicken tonight, and it was really really really good. I was worried after reading through the Yelp reviews and seeing things like "best chicken  I've ever had", that it wouldn't live up to the hype, and it did.Ordered delivery  for dinner (which arrived hot in about 45 minutes through Grub Hub) & tried the El Jefe (1/2 chicken), mac & cheese and mexican corn on the cobb. The menu isn't very big, but they did have roast vegetables as an option if you wanted to make it a healthy meal unlike what we did.The corn wasn't the healthiest I've ever tried, but it was very flavorful and had a bit of kick. The mac & cheese was the creamy & delish as well....and last but not least, the chicken was just about perfect! Often when I try roast chicken like this, the meat might not have nearly enough flavor compared to the skin, or it ends up overcooked/ dry, but none of those issues here. The flavor was amazing through the entire half chicken & it was cooked perfect & juicy.We tried the red & green sauces & while standalone I thought they were very good, and would love them with some chips or on a taco, I didn't think the chicken needed them.All of this + delivery + tip for ~$30 for 2, and we have at least 1 meal leftover...not too bad!I've never dined in so I can't comment on the service, but I've been in the area and its a casual, order-at-the-counter kinda place & has a small patio.Will be eating here again in the near future!

Yeah baby, super dooper winner chicken dinner!We've been ordering from here via GrubHub lately and mmm mm, good.  Definite toss up between Brasa Roja and here as my fav chicken joint in town.Nice simple no fuss menu (which others have outlined adeptly here, no need to rehash).  We've had both types of chicken they offer and the difference is so subtle, you won't go wrong with either.  Salsas aren't my thing with chicken so I'm no judge there.  Mac and cheese certainly tastes homemade and is super creamy.  It's on the subtle side which is what makes it good but I would not call it bland.  He's had the corn which tends to look overdone but hey, it's delivery so it's fine.  He likes it as well as the mashed potatoes.  Toss in a couple of Mexican Sprites with real sugar and it's chow time.Speedy friendly delivery, always earlier than estimated.  Good stuff!  Try it, you'll like it!

Great chicken! I highly recommend the El Jefe, it is a bit more spicy than the other, but not real spicy. It is just right! Cooked as you order it, not sitting around waiting for someone to buy it. All the sides are really good too, my husband and I always get the mashed potatoes, mac and cheese and corn, you can't go wrong with any of them. But I have to say the best side of all is the mexican rice, it is our favorite. The place is really cute and the staff is very friendly. They also give you two different sauces for your chicken, one more spicy than the other. I personally like the spicier one! It's nice to stop in, pick up some grub to take home and chow down! It is like having a home cooked meal, without the hassle of cooking and bonus, no mess in the kitchen! We always have leftovers and they are great the next day too, I love to eat the chicken cold.So, take the night off and go grab some grub, you'll love it!

Like William the Conqueror before it took a nation of Britons away from King Harold II, I expect Art of Chicken to take a nation of hipsters and yuppies away from Harold's Chicken Shack #36.Harold's #36 is the natural comparison to this place due to proximity, price point, and the fact that they both have five star chicken and decent sides. They also both have service that leaves something to be desired to varying degrees.I'd compare growing up with Harold's to growing up with an abusive drunk parent, and finding Art of Chicken is like finding refuge in a foster family where my care-givers are just drunk but not abusive.Harold's historical abuse of patrons is well known. Ran out of chicken? Ok. Got my order wrong? No problem. Ran out of chicken during the time it took me to drive back to pick up whatever chicken you didn't give me. No worries. I'll just take 3 wings for that breast I paid for and didn't get and you no longer have - ok I'll take 2 - ok 1 wing, and some extra white bread? Please?I've already ordered from Art of Chicken like 20 times. Unlike Harold's, they always answer the phone. Unlike Harold's, they have never got my order wrong. Unlike Harold's, they actually have a decent space to eat in and actual tables with a bathroom. [How Harold's in WP gets away with no public restroom - even for customers - I still don't understand.]Like Harold's they have upped the wait time. Like Harold's they have run out of chicken on me - though never after taking my order. Like Harold's they are pretty militant about getting the f- out right at closing to the extent that it's not a good idea to order for pickup within 30 minutes of closing.But beyond the better (or not as bad) service - I think this place eclipses Harold's because it's not nearly as bad for you health wise. Both versions of chicken at Art offer nice spice without the potential to stain your furniture or clothes with grease. For those of us over 30 it gets harder and harder to justify clogging your arteries especially if (or more likely when) you are treated poorly for the privilege of doing so.In short, Art of Chicken serves chicken with an attitude, but doesn't serve it outright rude. To quote the immortal Yelp development team 'yay I'm a fan'.

Love this place, although the sides are just meh..  the chicken is so great that you don't even need sides.  Actually, the corn is great and so are the fries but all others are jut ok.  I go with the whole El jefe everytime and even the leftovers are amazing!
I have been here maybe 4 or 5 times. Gotta love El Jefe and the Mac and Cheese. Im pretty sure that's what I had ever single visit. Real good stuff!

I have come here several times and it by far the best chicken I have ever eaten.  The spices and tenderness of the chicken makes me crave it even more after I'm done.   I have to admin the Crazy Chico is the best.Also, the Mac & Cheese is awesome

Holy smokes.  This place is delicious and totally worth the wait for it to open.  I love the El Jefe, and the other one is super delicious too.  Highly recommend their fries!  Great service, and its adorable on the inside.  This will be a new staple for me!!!

We've never actually been here but my fam and I have ordered delivery from there 3 times now and it just hits the spot! The El Jefe and Crazy Chico are both delicious as well as the fries and mac and cheese. Tasty and you're not too weighed down by grease because the chicken is grilled. YUM!

2.5-3 stars Hmmmm Mac n cheese like stove top, was expecting something else based on reviews...chicken nice but not impressive. Ordered the corn which was frozen corn on the cob.I would compare to quick to go meal like Jewel or similar. Food may be rated better by those that do not cook? I would not visit again too many other places that do better.

I've been seeing some good press on The Art of Chicken, and was anxious to give them a try.  There is a really simple grilled chicken place near my office, and looking at the menu, I felt that The Art of Chicken would be similar, but better.  All in all, it was slightly better, so that's nice.I ordered to go, but it's a really cool place. Super clean, bright, and festive graphics on the walls.As mentioned in the reviews, they have two flavor preps for the chicken; El Jefe and Crazy Chico. I really wanted to try both varieties in this visit, so I ordered two quarters, one in each variety. (While I realize this wasn't cost effective as you end up paying $2.25 more by ordering 2 quarters instead of 1 half). I also ordered a side of Spanish rice, and mashed potatoes.Everything was really good, and plentiful. I couldn't finish all of the sides and pita that came with the order. While there was a difference in the varieties, it was very subtle. If I had to pick one over the other, I would go with the Crazy Chico. It seemed to have a bit more brightness to it.  Though the description doesn't say so, I was really hoping that El Jefe was going to be spicy. It wasn't.  They do, however, have a couple of sauces on the side, that had nice spice.The quarters came with a leg and a thigh. I generally prefer dark meat, so this was fine, but I wonder if one could request a wing and breast.As far as the sides go, the Spanish rice was slightly above average, and the mashed potatoes were average (but did appear to be made from real potatoes). Next time, I'll order the half chicken outright, and go with a single side (like I said, they are plentiful).The best part is the price. Cheap has a negative connotation, but that's what it is. My entire order was about $13, and that's considering the fact that I purposely overpaid in the manner in which I ordered. I'm always on the lookout for takeout dinner options that can come in  under $10. This is definitely one of those options.

There are lots of Mexican joints around, and rotisserie chicken is easy enough to find, but this place stands out. The El Jefe is great Flavorful and juicy and a bit of spice. I admit that I like the Crazy Chico the most, which is their regular chicken that somehow manages to stand out from the everyday. I don't know why it's so good, but it is. I like to get extra pita.Where I was disappointed was the sides. The corn was decent, but otherwise, I have been unimpressed. It's also veru cute on the inside, but small and not especially comfortable.I say order a chicken, get extra pita and take it home to eat with some Velweeta mac and cheese.Dat Chicken doe.

HAHAHA. SO. GOOD. First of all, Chicken Hut has been my jam since I moved to Chicago six years ago. Coming here, I felt like I was cheating on Chicken Hut.I didn't want to love it. But oh man I loved it.I got the El Jeffe, mashed potatoes, and mac n cheese. Oh man. Mashed potatoes were incredible, mac n cheese was so creamy and amazing. Everything was just so good. I can't wait to come back here.MOOOOOORE. Art. of. CHICKEEEENNNNN.

Delicious food but I want more. It's a good spot, but it's missing some options to take it next level.The el jefe chicken is flavorful and doesn't even need the salsa or fluffy pita that comes with it. All of the sides I've tried have paired great with the charred chicken.I want more:-Sauces (bbq? Hot? Buffalo?)- descriptions on the difference between jefe and crazy- speedier service: this place isn't exactly grab and go

One of THE BEST! roasted chicken I've ever tried!!!!Both (El Jefe and Crazy chico) have great flavor. Their salsas, especially the red one, are delicious. Loved the whole concept and location. This place might not be the best option for a "special ocation type of dinner", but for a takeaway, it is great.The girl at the register is not exactly very friendly, but is ok.100% recommendable!

Called in an order for pick up on a Saturday night and was told to come in 15 minutes to pick up my food. When I arrived over 20 minutes later, I was told that my order wasn't ready yet. Not only was it not ready, but they had run out of the mashed potatoes I ordered and also had run out of the corn I had ordered. After just doubling up on the other sides, I also ordered a bottled Coke to go. After 10-15 minutes of waiting in there for my order to be ready, I finally got called up. Since I was in a hurry and quite frankly starving, I ran out of there with the bag. Got home and realized they didn't include my Coke in the bag, but had definitely charged me for it.Although it was an unsatisfactory customer service experience, the food was pretty good. I got both types of chicken (El Jefe and Crazy Chico) and I'd say the Crazy Chico is much better with a lot more seasoning. The sweet potato fries were also very, very good. Almost made up for not getting my mashed potatoes...almost. The mac n' cheese was good too. What I really loved was there orange spicy sauce. You only need a little bit but it adds a lot of kick. Skip the spanish rice. It was very bland.Overall, great food but they need to work on their customer service and ordering process. Would love to try again without all of the issues.

Excellent spicy chicken and sides. I have driven  by here for years  and knew of Las Asadas,   almost  next door but didn't see this place before. Understand  that they have been open for like  2 years.  Good service and fair portion  size. They need to have another location  where there is a lot of foot traffic..like off of an "L" stop, where you can smell the food walking by...people just don't know this place exists.  Worth driving to....Open another in Lakeview/Lincoln Park /Wicker Park. ...try them out!!

Tried this place for the first time last night. Because there's a $10 minimum on credit cards, I got a half Crazy Chico style chicken, mac & cheese and sweet potato fries. All of it was really great, and now I have leftovers for work--$12 and some change isn't bad for two meals worth of food! I'd like to go back and try El Jefe soon, as that seems to be the fan favorite, but the Crazy Chico was herby, juicy, light and delicious.

It's all about that green salsa. And the chicken is good too! Always delivered by Alanski even when the weather is bad. If he is running late, which only happened because of the Puerto Rican parade in Humboldt Park, he gives me a call to let me know that he is on his way. Yeah, I probably order delivery from this place too much but It is rare to find a place with great food (props to the kitchen staff) and great delivery! Seriously folks, order now and tip tip tip!
I've not had chicken in the area that comes close to this. Consistantly amazing.

This place is as good as it gets! Let me just start off by talking about the perfect location, which is right off the blue line.  The menu was really easy to follow, and not to mention that each featured item complemented each other. I didn't feel overwhelmed and my decision was made within three (3) minutes.  I had "El Jefe" along with sweet potatoes and corn on the cob (the original Mexican corn on the cob, make sure to order all the condiments to have the full experience, and don't forget the napkin). The chicken was so juicy and GOOD. The place is really clean and the decoration to the point. We didn't have to wait for our food, and staff was very attentive to our experience.I read comments on the delivery before visiting the place, but none are congruent with my experience.
Great chicken! Full of flavor and just cooked the right way. Had corn on the cob, sweet potato fries, and veggies. Everything tastes fresh, and the place is really nice!

Food was bland and boring.  Cashier was not helpful at all. Told her we were eating outside she said she would call our number when ready, again we said we are going to be outside on patio she said fine she would come and let us know when food was ready, not bring it to us just let us know so we could pick it up.  I asked for a water she said bottled I said no, end of conversation. When she let us know one of our meals was ready, we went inside and gave another customer a glass of water, I said are those available she said yes, I asked May I please have one she said yes, just not helpful at all.Basically $10 for half a bland chicken and a side, better roast chicken at Wal-Mart, I am serious!

WOW, OMGOODNESS!spectacular experience!Even tho i have lived in chicago 20 years, I am still an uppidity New Yorker at heart..tonight - the food, the atmosphere, and staff were all stellar!I/ we really really enjoyed ourselves, and look forward to going back for more farm inspired deliciousness, and wine pairings! (Which Were perfect!- )Thank you again for a great night!Satya

100% AWFUL.  We are fussy, yes.  However, even a diner not as discerning would be displeased: entrees missing, drinks never arrived, manager, Thomas, came up, we told him the issues, as we were on the phone trying to get into Joe's in the next few minutes just to get out of there and have a decent meal, and he said he'd be right back to fix it all, and he NEVER came back!  (That may have been the strangest of all things that went wrong.)  All their fish is farmed, including alaskan halibut, which I've never even see farmed-raised (why not put some extra $ into your ingredients??), etc.I think the hostess could see how upset we all were, and she was so sweet, perhaps the only one who cared (Sharee, if any management ever reads this, which I'm sure they won't), and offered to cover our dinner and have us back.  Mind you, this is not something we like to have done, simply because I'd rather have a stress-free, seamless, delicious meal, than complain over and over.  Then, to have everyone who works there come up and say, "Well, we are paying for your meal."  I'm good, thanks.But here's the kicker: WE GOT SICK THAT NIGHT AND THE NEXT DAY!  Husband had to take a Lomotil (google it) simply to calm down stomach.  For me, it's been two days and I'm still not back to normal.Lastly, dinner in the bar the night before went pretty much just as bad.  Told waitress we don't eat meat, mussels arrived covered in chorizo.  We asked for a Tito's martini, was told they don't have it but would sub something comparable -- they used Chopan and charged us $19 for martini.  We have a place in NY and have never even seen a martini there for that price.  Glass of wine was so small could have sworn it was just a taste.The two managers that night, David and Thomas, were most definitely the worst part (aside from getting sick).  This is a pretty-ish hotel (the Lagham in NY is way nicer), but the service is the worst and just weird, especially in the club room and travelle.  Stay at the Peninsula, Park Hyatt, or Waldorf.

I've eaten at both the restaurant and enjoyed the service in the bar lounge. The quality of food and the service is impeccable. If you are meeting a date for drinks, you can't do better than the lounge. If you want a romantic dinner, ditto for the restaurant.The experience starts from the moment you step into The Langham. All the way to the end when the impeccable hotel staff gets your car.Simply, as good as it gets.

Across from trump, wanted to check out Langham hotel, lounge is hip and views of street level from the second floor. Drinks are strong and good, bar food was that small but tasty. I'd go back maybe try dinner.

We decided to have a dinner in this restaurant on Saturday October 15 because we been there several times before and in was incredible experience. This time it was TERRIBLE. Probably because they hired a new chef. All dishes were tasteless. Terrible mussels in ground beef sauce and fresh(!?) onion and radish (?), fish "branzino" ... I was crying. It definitely doesn't cost $300. Not recommended. Never come again. Sorry.

House keeping was cleaning up our room so decided to kill time and head to Travelle. Ordered their appetizer and had the octopus and their tomato salad. Fresh tasty and forward. 3 because I did not try enough and my review is for the 2 appetizers ordered that cost $45

Came for restaurant week and once again service and food were spectacular.  In my opinion, Travelle is a top 10 restaurant in Chicago.For lunch, I had the salmon and short rib entrees from the restaurant week menu and both of them were expertly prepared.  The salmon to a medium rare and the short rib maintaining shape but soft as butter.I also ordered the grilled cheese of the day which was crusty, melty, and a very good restaurant version.

My girl Emily and I met up here for dinner while I was in town for work. What a great little spot. When we were seated we noticed that the their kitchen area was wide open and it had little notes on the window for the day. It ranged from wishing everyone a great St. Patrick's day, to the weather, to Happy Birthday shout outs to two of the guest that were celebrating with them that night. Very cute indeed.I started off with an drink called Corn, Bread & Butter. It was brown butter fat-washed with  moonshine, cranberry, orange marmalade. Very unique and quite delicious. Next I ordered the Bbq Octopus with pork belly and sea island red peas. OMG That was so good! I swear I could have had three dishes of this as my meal and I would have been in heaven. For dinner I ordered the Chili Braised Short Rib with Red Beans and rice and smoked Sour Cream. Sadly I was too full to really enjoy it all and because I was staying in a hotel room, I couldn't exactly take it with me. But I did manage to eat almost half of it and it was quite tasty. The short rib was a little bit more fatty than I would have liked but it was still quite good.All in all it was a wonderful evening in Chicago with my fabulous friend and fellow Yelper Emily! The food, the company, and the service were wonderful and I will definitely come back again during my next visit.

Such a solid disappointment. I'll try to be concise.1) Service was slow. The place wasn't crowded and 3 people checked up on us but none of them were allowed to take our order so we ended up waiting a while for the waiter. He apologized but I was still a bit annoyed by the long wait.2) We were craving eggs, bacon, and a wonderful breakfast but the menu had nothing but lunch options so we settled for squash soup and a broccoli cheese grilled sandwich. The soup was just okay. I liked the unique seasoning clump on top and think it saved the soup since the soup by itself would have been boring and bland. The broccoli grilled cheese was stuffed by so much cheese that I had to remove half of it to taste the bread and broccoli. I wouldn't order this again.3) Upon leaving, we were both super upset to see the breakfast buffet! We would have loved to have that and I wish the waiter would have said something!!Overall, we were underwhelmed. Glad we got to see what the hype was about, unfortunately our expectations weren't met.

Great atmosphere and views on the second floor. Very unique and tasty drink combinations like the martini with fruit juice, vodka, curry and a rosemary sprig. (Unfortunately, I can't remember the name of this drink). But it was really good. Nice place to sit in comfy, roomy chairs and have a meeting or quiet conversation.

I went here with my work friend, it was her suggestion.. N my oh my!! I just loved the place, the ambience, the service, food, drinks.. Everything was great!! We went there just for drinks to celebrate my last day at work and ordered some lychee based tea and a moscow mule. Both were good, the tea was one of the best... Moscow mule could have been a little stronger but was okay for that moment.We were enjoying our drinks and suddenly the comes with 2 plates of awesome looking triffle with come panacotta on the bottom, raspberry coolie, and chocolate brownie topped with something that tasted like chocolate butter cream.. With a gluten free chocolate cookie and a dark chocolate coated fresh strawberry on the side.. It was to die for, I am not a dessert person but this was goooooddd!!! And the best part was, it was complimentary, they had some plates extra so.. I guess now is the time when I shud mention, the lounge is reservation only, bar is not and bar is not that expensive.Overall, awesome experience, will go there again. It is good for a romantic brunch, dinner, or just drinks with friends too...

Drop the mic: Boom!Travelle really delivered the wow factor. I took the elevator to the second floor and was greeted by iridescent metallic orbs suspended from the ceiling and smartly dressed employees - particularly the Dutch guy with a pocket square and the blonde woman with a My Little Pony tail swishing down her back. My hand brushed against the wall as I walked to my table and it's slippery bumps surprised and thrilled me. The view of the city from floor to ceiling windows took a back seat to the glassed-in kitchen stage which was the perfectly appropriate centerpiece to the dining room.I was excited to go to Travelle ever since I saw it featured on the television show Check Please! I studied the menu and made a list of everything I wanted. The server helped me decide how to order my two cocktail selections: first the elaborate Corn, Bread & Butter followed by the mature Santiago Reunion.The Corn, Bread & Butter is probably one of the most embellished cocktails you will ever have in your life. It is served on a wooden tray filled with crushed herbs and grains. There is a smoldering cinnamon stick (or something that looks like it), a two inch cube of cornbread, a small jar of marmalade, and the drink in a copper mug (like a Moscow Mule). The mug is filled with crushed ice from which protrudes a narrow straw. It's embarrassing to admit that the clandestine drink eludes my description. It was a little sweet and everyone at my table really liked it but I wonder if all of the fanfare scattered the possibility of analysis.The Santiago Reunion is like a smokey Manhattan. I absolutely loved it and would get it again. It's unadulterated simplicity was bold in maturity. I would say that in comparison a Manhattan is bright with syrupy flavors like walking through a forest with light beams broken by the leaves and branches. The Santiago Reunion is the leathery face of a well-traveled, strong individual walking through the trees.We shared three starters: Roasted Bone Marrow, Roasted Cauliflower, and Endive Salad. We liked all three. M's favorite was the Endive Salad and her least was the Roasted Bone Marrow. My opinion is the opposite of hers. We both agreed that we were unimpressed by the Roasted Cauliflower.We asked our server if the meat was grass fed and he answered no. He explained that Chef Tim Graham prefers grain fed animals. We further asked if the corn and soy used in some of the dishes was non-GMO to which the server reported, "Yes, the chef said that he uses all organic ingredients." Um... I don't know if you know this, but although non-GMO and organic might often overlap they are not synonymous. So that answer influenced M to get the BBQ Octopus and I took a walk on the wild side and got the Soy Marinated Skirt Steak.The BBQ Octopus left M in love with Travelle. In fact, she said that this might become our new anniversary restaurant. My Soy Marinated Skirt Steak didn't lead me to agree with her. I appreciated that the flavor of the meat shone through. The thinly sliced radishes, cucumbers, and mango was a bright contrast to the characteristically tough and fatty meat; however, I think I prefer a more traditional preparation.For dessert I was torn between the State Fair Cream Puff and the Pumpkin Cheesecake Pie. The server surprised us by bringing both and they were both incredible. I appreciated that both were rich with flavors but light in texture.We weren't paying but we think our bill was over $200 for the three of us. It was a delicious dinner in a chic setting. It seemed as if every detail was attended to. For example, the acoustics were perfect for comfortable table conversation balanced with background music and the muted voices of those at other tables. They accomplished this by having smartly carpeted floors and textured ceilings. I definitely appreciate a restaurant that is able to bring incoherent dreams to sharp focus.

Travelle is a great place to go to if it's just for some cocktails in their chic lounge or if it's for a great dinner. I came for a holiday work dinner in December, and everyone had a great experience.We had a private section for about 20 people, with a preset menu. We all started off with some appetizers - two flatbreads, a mushroom one and an assorted veggie one. The mushroom flatbread was great! We then had an option to pick between the field squash soup and the endive salad. I chose the butternut squash soup, which was very flavorful and light. For my main course I picked the mushroom risotto. It was great! Very tasty, a little heavy (but that's expected with a risotto). I would definitely order it again. I finished my dinner off with the apple cobbler, which was more than enough to make my dinning experience excellent.The atmosphere, the service, and the food all deserve 5 stars.
