This place would have been at least 4 stars had I not got the fries and a hot dog..I'll start with the good...the beef is excellent, no complaints about that at all..Great flavor, melt in your mouth texture(pause), sweet peppers were well proportioned and had good flavor as well, bread was nice and soft and the "dip" was also good, not too sloppy not to dry. So no problem there..The fries are no good, small crunchy salt-less fries. The hot dog was probably the worst I've had, it was the size and texture of a slim jim on the most stale bun in Chicago. Also "everything" means only mustard, relish and onion. I wasn't even mad cause the beef was so good. I'll definitely return for the beef..
I had to update on a second trip.I got the combo- Sausage and beef piled high on beefy-deliscious au jus bread.  I could not have enjoyed my experience more.Its out of the way, but way worth it!

If I didn't get fries, this would have been 5 stars.  But the fries at Joe Boston's are pretty weak.  Crunchy, bad ketchup, served kibbles-and-bits-style (I'm a big fan of full-length fries; I know I'm weird in that way.).  Skip the combo, bring a drink with you and buy the sandwiches to eat in your car.But the beef, oh my goodness, my Italian beef dipped was magic.  Incredible flavor, spicy, shredded beef was tender, bread was not totally soaked through five minutes later (like the dipped is at Al's).  $7 for a big sammich, fries and a drink, and that drink can be Mountain Dew?  Yes sir!  I'm actually surprised, given the legend of this place, that only 80-something Yelpers have reviewed this spot; something is very wrong with this picture.Staff was great (guy in the kitchen clearly has been using his script of one-liners for years) and the decor is just as divey as you would expect.  I'm actually thankful that Boston's is not open later, because bad decisions would be made here regularly otherwise.

Pretty decent Italian beef but not that memorable. The inside is also clean but pretty nondescript. If you're in the area and  want an Italian beef, it's a pretty good choice but I wouldn't travel for miles to go here.

Tried their beef, taste good but cheap on the meat and they hardly dipped it in beef sauce (upon request). They also refused to give me beef sauce on the side. Will never go back there again! I'm sticking with Jay's Beef!
I came here even though i live in elmwood park one block from johnnies beef well worth the drive . Thier sandwich is better tasting ,stuff with beef .great fries ,good service great prices

Decent Italian beef, but I left disappointed. The sandwich was consistent with what I expect at an Italian Beef place, but I found the service dismissive and unfriendly. The eat in experience is unpleasant, as the place reeks of grease. Take-out is an option, but make sure not to get the sandwich dipped or semi-dipped, as you will end up with some soggy mush.On the whole, the sandwich is reasonably satisfying, but not worth a trek.
The dipped Italian beef was very good, as were the fries and chili. Our order was taken and cooked quickly, and it was nice to get fries that weren't overly salted. We look forward to coming back.

I briefly lived about a three minute walk from this place, and ended up coming here often - I do think that these are probably the best beef's I've had in Chicago.  Since I no longer live close by, I rarely get the chance to go anymore.  Once in a while I'll take my bike over and get a classic dipped beef.  Quick service and very tasty!The hot dogs and fries are pretty standard rate for places like this.  Never had any of the sausages or brats.  The pepper and egg left more to be desired... The interior isn't very exciting and their fountain drinks are a little limited, (update: more choices!) but in all honestly if you venture out here it's going to be for the beef.  Definitely worth a trek at least once.

This is the beef place. Home made beepers made right there on the premises. Can't speak on the other stuff because I always get a combo dipped with sweet peppers and Vitner's chips and a Pepsi. I drive pas a lot of beef joints to go here. Give it a go.

I've been to probably 50+ beef joints since I moved back here 7 years ago. And stumbled on this place by accident on Thrillist. If you are driving by and didn't know to go here you would probably drive right by. But you'd be making a huge mistake. It is now, hands down, the BEST beef I have EVER had!! If you haven't been and love Italian Beef you have to come here!! Amazing!!

Here's the problem with Joe Boston's: you have to deal with the crippling depression that invariably accompanies the last bite of their Italian beef sandwich.Al's? Portillo's? Buona? The fuck outta here. No, no and no. And a resounding "NO" to any other Italian beef joint whose name may now be bubbling to the surface of your misguided thoughts. Joe Boston's is the real deal--no frills, no nonsense, and certainly no bullshit.You walk in and are greeted by the delightful individual at the counter. You place your order, which is for an Italian beef, dipped, with hot peppers. You pay. You wait, briefly, as your food is prepared with the utmost skillfulness and care. You receive your sandwich, sit down and promptly enter a sanctified cathedral of deliciousness. And shortly thereafter, you begin to weep bitterly as you realize that the holy moment has ended. You've finished your beef. In my experience, this weeping continues until the next time you make the trip to Joe Boston's--which should be as soon as possible.

Did I go to the wrong place? I bought a groupon $30 for $16.50(Three $10 groupons). The beef was pretty light on the meat compared to most places in Chicago. Bread didn't hold up and the beef didn't have any seasoning. Fries sucked. The inside was disgusting. Sticky tables, over flowing trash, broken chairs. I can't imagine the kitchen is that clean. Johnnys is way better, so are Portillos and Als.That being said, I'm not going back. If anyone wants the two other groupons(expiration 10/3/2014), send me a message and I'll email them to you for free.

Hands down the best Italian Beef Sandwich I have ever had.  The slices of beef are a bit thicker than some other places, but in this case, girth is always welcomed! As you put the sandwich in your mouth, you are greeted with juicy wet beef juice goodness that few things in life can prove as satisfying.  I was a bit surprised at the lack of long lines, but the service is fast and friendly.  No nonsense, the time it took from the point of putting in the order to the time it hit my mouth was less than 3 min.Stick to the Italian Beef and I would pass on the tamale and chili cheese fries. Save those calories and get another beef sandwich.
If anything comes close to Johnnie's this is the place.  Joe's is an institution in Chicago. A place where you know exactly what you're getting.  A great Beef or Combo sandwich at a great price.

I use Johnny's as the gold standard for Italian Beef in the Chicago area. Joe Boston's beef is perfectly good, but not as good as Johnny's to my taste buds. It has to do with the seasoning of the beef. Johnny's beef is more flavorful. Of course, if I'm in the neighborhood, I'd stop and have a Joe Boston beef without hesitation. Again, the flavor is a matter of personal preference.Service: They don't have the concept of queueing here, which should be fundamental. People just crowd around the counter and it's impossible to understand who is next.Atmosphere: It's a beef stand. Could be updated.It's nice that they have pepper and eggs, but only on Fridays. Too bad. C would order that any day of the week.
Italian beef and fries.. That's the ticket! Worth the drive west for a juicy dipped Italian.

Stopped here again tonight.  I like the beef with sweet and dipped.  I've never had anything else here.It's a little place right on the corner or Grand and Chicago.  Just east of Sacramento.  Cash only here but reasonable prices.  There are a few tables but don't expect much in the way of decor.  You come here for the Beefs.I like Jays on North Ave also.  If you want to sit down and eat that is your better choice.

Wow, what happened Joe Boston? You used to have 5 star beef sandwiches. I picked up 2 beefs to go last night and had to check the bag to be sure both were in there. (Because the bag was so light.)  There was about 1/2 the amount of meat in there than in previous visits. And the bread was totally stale. Did I just catch you on a bad day, or are you getting cheap?  I'll give you one more chance, but you better get it right next time or I'm done with you.  One more thing...clean the place up, it's nasty dirty in there.

Where's the beef? Joe Boston's that's where! As a lover of all Chicago-style foodstuffs I pride myself on knowing the real deal. This is just the place to get a real Italian beef (dipped of course and with hot peppers). Quick and dirty...in and out or sit and stuff your face with some real neighborhood characters.The service is super friendly and hook you up if you're good people. They were nice enough to cut my beef in half as I pretended to be dainty at my first visit. My only wish is that the fries were better, their alright with cheese...but definitely need salt. Nonetheless, I can't wait to bring my dad...a real Chicagoan. I think I'll make him proud!

This is a good beef.Italian Beef, wet, with spicy peppers.  Some cheese fries on the side.  Makes for a filling and tasty meal.The beef itself isn't ridiculously flavorful, but it's absolutely tender.  The bread that they use is just right, and the dip is done so that the bread is just soggy enough but not falling apart, unlike some other places I've been to.Cheese fries are a nice side to round out the meal, with the generic toxic yellow cheese that you know can't be real... but still plays to your tastebuds like any guilty pleasure.$5 for a beef, $2 for cheese fries, 25 cents for some peppers make for an enjoyable experience.  Give it a whirl!
Hands down the worse Italian beef sandwich I've had. If you like your sandwich soggy to the point where it's literally disintegrating in your hand than this place is for you

Having seen this on the Food Network "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" I put in my bookmarks so I would not forget when I got up to Chicago.  I had the wet Italian Beef  with fries and a soda for a can't be believed $6.75.  You seem to get about a pound of roost beef and 1/2 pound of peppers.  Since it came wet the sandwich was soggy but not too soggy that the bread fell apart.  The sandwich is the star here and it is 5 stars.  Service is counter you walk up they tease you as you look over the menu trying I guess to make you make a fast decision.  My wife ordered first and I second.  When I had finished ordering hers was in front of her.  Now that is fast.  One warning do not order the large fries.  As everything here is huge the small fries are huge.The beef had a very nice taste and somewhat of a lingering after taste of black pepper which was very satisfying to me.  We really don't have anything that compares to Joe Boston in St. Louis but that is not to say our Italian sandwiches on  The Hill are inferior just different.Thanks Chicago for a great place.

Great beef spot in the middle of nowhere.  This place is pretty large, but there are only about 5 small tables in the corner.  I don't think they've invested much in decor since they opened in 1949.Service was quick and straightforward.  There was no line (Saturday afternoon) and in less than two minutes our meals were wrapped in white paper (no plates) and ready to go on the counter.The beef (dipped, hot) was money.  Tons of flavor in the meat and just enough heat in the giardiniera to keep things exciting.  My hands were covered in oil by the end, which is a good sign when it comes to beef.  I ordered a tamale and it was pre-wrapped in a plastic bag like something from the supermarket.  I was skeptical (I expected homemade), but it ended up being really good so no complaints there.  This would have been a five star experience if the fries were better - the portions we're small and they weren't seasoned at all.On a side note, there was a homeless man staring at us from the corner table throughout the meal.  We just focused on our beef and went about our business.  Maybe next time we'll buy him a tamale.

Oh it was delicious!!! This was the best Italian beef I have had in a long time!! And it was so cheap too! For $7.00 you got fries, an italian beef sandwhich with a drink. The sandwhich was a decent size and very filling! I scarfed mine down so fast. They people were also very nice and I am very glad I went! Especially after reading all the reviews Al's has gotten lately.

The Italian beef was absolutely amazing. Joes is a true neighborhood chicago gem when it comes to casual dining. If you have had a long day at work and are looking for a place to find a meal that makes the day melt away as you enjoy each juicy bite of a dipped Italian beef and where customer service is 100% this is the place to go.

I ordered Joe Boston's beef for my crew last week. I have some seriously picky people when it comes to Italian Beef, so I was really curious to see how it went over.The ordering was a bit of an adventure, but when your food is that good, you don't have to be overly friendly. And, they did agree to heat up the gravy for us, which was a big help, and didn't seem to be the norm.The beef was awesome, super tender, lean, and not fatty at all. Everyone proclaimed it their new favorite beef. But, what really blew my crew away were the sausages. They had that perfectly crisp/charred outside, and were gone before I had a chance to get seconds.Great fries as well. Don't go in there expecting a salad or pasta or anything else but the basics, I solved this by ordering a tray of salad and pasta from Oggis around the corner.They will be back here for sure...and with double the sausages.

Sadly, i am just able to give 2 stars for that place. It's not even about the Italien beef sandwich, which was ok. The problem is the environment and the CLEANLINESS. I never saw such dirty garbage cans like this in my entire life! They are disgusting, obviously never got cleaned  at all. It's just not possible to enjoy anything when you are surrounded by dirt... And the big question for me is: How the kitchen looks like if they are not able to wipe trash cans?? Sorry. Complete no go... It's not a "first-date-restaurant" for sure :)
Slammin' Italian Beef that is huge and comes on the cheap. Definitely a spot that you will miss while driving unless you know to stop.Enjoy Suckas'!!!

Best Italian Beef found for Chicago.  It was a place that was featured on Food Network a couple of years ago.  Highly recommended for their delicious Italian Beef, and the excellent food value for the price, makes it well worth the visit.

After enjoying one of best Italian Beef's on the planet, I raced to church so I could tell my pastor about the sins I had just committed.Joe Boston's has a blue collar feel to it. The employees are friendly, but get straight to the point. I'd love to be a regular at a place like this. Although I'd probably die shortly after...The beef is marvelous. Homemade girdinara, a spectacular recipe for their beef, and you get a combination of greatness. I asked for cheese, not knowing it was pump style, but ended up enjoying it more with the cheese. The girdinara has a nice heat, not as hot as Johnnies, but very edible and with a good crunch. The beef is the show stealer. They've got a recipe loaded with spices and the beef is cooked and sliced to perfection. I could drink their au jus.This is one dirty, guilty, sinful, sandwich. Take a shower after you eat it. You'll need it.

I like a good Beef sam maybe once every few months tops.  And when I go it's almost always w. my trusted favs, 1. Al's on Ontario  2. Portillo's (yes Portillo's! where, predictably, Yelper's seem to eschew for its proximate existence to a *chain*, shock/horror/etc..) and on the rare occasion 3. Buona.Well I came across an old thread on IB's and this popped up as a top pick of many.  And lo and behold it's like maybe 4 blocks from where I live...didn't even know after five+ years living here...it's on a stretch of Grand that's half industrial meets Metra switching station meets a sorta nondescript and somewhat desolate urban wasteland.  Perfect for a place that specializes in Italian Beef.  And the building, inside and out, fits right in looking like a Blue Collar haven...read: totally stripped down and utilitarian in nature.Oh, the Beef you ask??  Yea, it's damn good right on par w. Al's and Portillo's.  Really good flavor, tender, thinly sliced beef...dipped with hot peppers (always) you will not be disappointed!  Comes w Fries and a pop right at 7$ even (Cash Only).Lastly, they've been family owned and operated since like the 30's or 40's so again, you can support your local neighborhood ppls and feel all warm and fuzzy inside.

We have been doing our own italian beef Food Wars and this was the first place on our stop.    It definitely edged out Al's by all in the group.   This place is more affordable than most of the beef spots and the fries and beef were hot and fresh.  It had a great herb/spice flavor and the giardineira was pretty standard.Now on to Mr. Beef, if we can ever find them open!

I bought a groupon and each time I went it seemed the food got worse. First of all the restaurant is located in a diverse neighborhood, so why do people look at you like you came in to rob the place. Second, the fries suck, they could do better serving homemade fries. The third issue is the italian sausage on my combination was terrible. If you make a product that is subpar maybe you should buy it from a vendor. I saw the owner who I saw on a television food show that showcases Chicago food. Talk about lifeless, this guy lacks the character needed to run a succesful establishment. Anytime you visit an establishment and you are the only one ordering from the time you come in, to the time you leave, something is wrong.

Good sandwich and meal. Flaw is that it's in a super sketchy location in humboldt park and both times I went there the only patrons looked/acted like addicts and hookers. It's def a well known establishment. I am sure I will go back sometime soon!

I only am in the mood for an Italian beef maybe once a year. And if I moved away, I probably won't even miss it. Since lent starts next week- I've been working on eating all the bad shit all in one week and that means eating loads of fried dough, buffets and at greasy dirty looking holes such as susie's or this. Joe's is actually not even that dirty in my opinion (the unisex restroom is). Here's what I ordered: a tamale (bad decision), and the #1 dipped and with sweet and hot peppers. It comes with a small fries and drink.If you're curious about the tamale on the menu. Don't do it. It's just the same one in the frozen aisle sold at your local jewel. You're welcome on that one. The fries are alright. The sandwich itself was good. It had decent flavor and the meat was good. The sweet peppers were just there, I could have done without them. The hot peppers were good and spicy. I'm not a native Chicagoan so I'd be fine with the same sandwich at portillo's and I don't think this rendition knocks it out of the ball park, it tastes the same to me. There's parking in the back but it's easier to park on the street getting in and out.

Drove a long way because of great reviews , but was dissapointed with the bland italian beef and the barely cooked fries. $7.00 for a beef fries and drink.....won't be going here again.     ON THE PLUS SIDE THE WORKERS HERE ARE AWESOME!!

It's good. On my Italian beef meter it registered about a seven. They have my respect for not charging extra for peppers. Locationally-challenged though so I would not recommend a special trip to go here, but if you're in the neighborhood it's worth a try.
I always go here when I'm in Chicago.  By myself, sitting in the corner, practically crying, because yum.
Boston's is truly the best Italian beef in the Chicagoland.
Great Classic Beef Sandwich - Perfect Hot and Sweet Peppers - Excellent Greasy French Fries - Bare Bones Dive-y Atmosphere - Fun Guys Behind the Counter - Good Eating - Authentic - Hits the Spot!

This place rocks.  I searched yelp for "beef" because I didn't want the hassle or expense of going to a Al's or Portillo's... There's easy parking here, great value for the money, and delicious beef sandwiches.

Yes it's very good. My combo was a little dry even though I asked for it dipped, but good flavor. The sausage was excellent. Hard to find parking. If your in the area...worth the stop. Indoor seating.

The location sucks for me. It seems a little shankerish and industrial.That's the only downside.And.... please don't hurt me, but it's true- this place is better than Johnnie's. And I live in Oak Park!The combo hot is the best sausage and beef around.

This is the real deal Italian Beef. No frills no decor just some of the best Italian Beef that I have ever had.The help is friendly and the food comes promptly as ordered. My one criticism.... If you want cheese on your beef it's cheddar not mozzarella. The beef is great and it doesn't need cheese. A group of 6 ate for less than $45.00 Forget Portillos, forget Al's, sorry Mr. Beef but I am a convert to Boston's and I hadn't known about it until a couple days ago when I found it on Yelp!

Well, on a recent trip to the Windy City, I had my "cherry popped" on Italian Beef sandwiches.  If I had on white panties, they would be soaked in the brown au jus sauce that the sanwhiches are dipped in; UN-FREAKING-BELIEVABLE!!!!  For my first time, I don't think I'll ever have another Italian sandwich that will be as flavorful and spicy; this place set the bar so high I don't think I can ever go to another place for one.I ordered the "combo" sandwich which included a sausage inside.  I requested a polish sausage be used instead of an italian sausage because I wanted it a little more spicy.  The double-dipped bread soaked in all the juices without having it fall apart.The cook joked around with me as I bumbled through my order but I enjoyed (and frankly expected) that.  The only downside is that this place is so out of the way but it was so worth the trip.

I went to Joe Boston's because I saw it on the The Food Network.. A chef from NYC said it was "..the Best Thing I Ever Ate.."(name of the show).So I decided to check this place out. The service was nice and friendly. I had a beef dipped with fries. Everything was good. ..not GREAT,but good. The beef was tender,flavorful,the fries were OK,the bread was firm enough to deal with the au jus and fresh.. The establishment was clean,and simple. I give Joe Boston's three stars because it was good,and I'd go back,but not before I'd go to AL's. They're still # 1 for me,even after a pleasant visit to Joe Boston's

How to eat well at Joe Boston's:1. Order a #1.2. Tell 'em if you want it dipped sweet or spicy.3. Select your soda.4. Gorge on fries and the best Italian beef you eve have tasted.I think the owner/cook is a former boxer, as he talked boxing with me for a bit and was shadow boxing in the back room by the stove. Also, he talks and serves fast, so know what you want and listen closely when prompted.

Mmmm beefy. Definitely one of the highest quality beefs out there in the world. I like to get mine with hot peppers and dipped so you'll need to plan on wearing clothes that you can get beef juice on if there's any drippage (plus your hands will smell like italian beef unless you scrub off a couple layers of skin). There's so much deliciousness in this sandwich it is difficult to convey. They have a beef, fries and drink combo for $7. This place is (at least the times I've been) pretty relaxed and quiet. The fries here leave something to be desired so I would only get them again if I were super hungry or wanted to split them with someone else. If you're a fan of italian beef you owe it to yourself to make a trip to Joe Boston's.

Ehhh, it was ok. I had their beef late on a Tuesday night so maybe it was an off day butI've definitely had better. Definitely could have done without the fries as they were major freezer burn. I'll have to try this place again but probably not.
One of the best beefs I've ever had growing up in Chicago. Old school place, delicious beef.

Yesterday on my way to the movies, I stopped by Joe Boston's for an Italian Beef sandwich - got it dipped, with sweet and hot peppers. (Even though the theater was only 10 minutes away, I ate the fries on the way there cause I hate cold fries).  That  was the tastiest Italian beef sandwich I had ever eaten. It had just the right amount of everything on it.  And it didn't drip or fall apart while I was eating it, making it great theater food for eating in the dark. I just wish they had wrapped it in heavier paper cause my purse ended up a bit moist from sneaking the sandwich into the theater. Great food at a great price - that's the Chicago way.
One of the best Italian Beef joints in Chicago!!
Loved the service, and of course their sandwiches!  Definitely one of the spots I'll be taking family from out of town to!
Best italian beef in chicago.

To start of this place has the most tastiest Italian beefs ever, I cannot tell you that they are the best in town but for my set of taste buds is the best one thus far. They cook their own meats and trust me I seen this myself since I used to work for them when i was a teenager. other places order their beef precooked and all they have to do is heat it up, not this place, it's basically made from scratch. The owner is a very straight forward guy, you will rarely see him but most likely it will be in the mornings, and this restaurant is a very friendly place to eat at.now if you are going to be around the north side of Chicago and have a craving for beef's this is the place to go to. I suggest getting the Combo which is ( beef/ sausage) all in one bread, and make sure they slap on the hot giardiniera  because the sweet peppers will not bring out the full experience of this great crafted sandwich and have it slightly dipped in their gravy,, trust me you will not be disappointed.

YUM. This is a Chicago classic spot... the beef is just as tasty as it was 5 years ago... 10 years ago... etc. Nice and juicy, not to mention it was done in a jiffy. I got the beef dipped with sweet peppers & fries. Fries were extra crunchy (as fries should be) & the beef was savory and flavorful. A must have!!!!

I want to start of by saying,THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST FREAKING BEEFS AROUND!I wake in the middle of the night somedays craving a Boston's Italian Beef.Yeah there isn't much in the way of decor but what real people give a shit about decor?I don't care about pretty pictures on the wall or table arrangements.I just want good freaking food and that's what Boston's serves.The guy that cooks the Beef is one friendly dude also.Very personable and will have you rolling if you strike up a conversation with him.This place is for the average joe that appreciates good food in a casual environment.You don't have to have a stick up your ass to enjoy food here.I frequent this joint often and the Beef never dissappoints.If you're in the Humboldt park area and want one of the best Beef sandwiches around for cheap,hit up Boston's.
get the combo, extra beef with hot peppers...friesit doesn't get much better!

It's all about the basics. Excellent food, quick service, good prices.I highly recommend the carne asada tacos and orange salsa.FYI - not much seating. If you have more than 1-2 friends with you, I would take it to go.

All I wish I could say is...  ESTA GUENO!  LOL well my sisters and I were in the area and right away we said let's eat tacos!  We arrived and were greated by the friendly staff!  This is the HOLE in the wall you WILL FALL IN LOVE WITH! The food is DELICIOUS!  If you don't have a Mexican Momma and you want that Authentic Mexican flavor (without the Chancla voladora) this is THE place!
It's good Friday and la international was closed so we tried cucos. Had 2 tacos, asada and al pastor. They were pretty good. Salsa tasted good too. I'll be back and trying the tacos de camaron.

The meat  was so flavorless. I bought them yesterday and had my hopes up because it had amazinggg reviews. Maybe it was a bad day,  maybe all those people don't have taste buds lbs my mom had a torta, dad had a burrito & I had carne asada & lengua tacos, No one enjoyed their food.

Best tacos pastor ever. No kidding. The dinner plate was perfect. Add the red salsa. The horchata had a hint of coconut which I not a fab of (together). Now - the rating is purely on taste and type of place. If you are going to have a restaurant feel - fuggedaboutit.

just had the carne asada tacos, and they are delicious.  taquero even threw in one of the roasted jalapenos that was on the counter.  green sauce is pretty mild, but the red sauce is spicy and delicious.  bring cash, no credit cards accepted.

Sign me up for any taqueria with a basket of grilled jalapenos on the counter.  I am a taco loving gringo, have been to countless taquerias in Chicago, and this one definitely is top three on my list.  I ordered dos pastor y un asada, and as I'm writing this a day later, I want to go back and do it again.  Next time I'm in the area, I'll definitely pay them another visit.
Very small store front place but the shrimp tacos are delicioso! The menu is not too extensive so stick to the basics.
Very good tacos , the meat is well cooked and seasoned, not too much fat. The place is very small, the service is topnotch. Degenerate recommended.
The tacos are Amazing!  I read a food review on their fish and shrimp tacos. Drove in from the suburbs and I am hooked!

Tacos Al Pastor are the best I've had, and the shrimp tacos will make you question if beef is really the best thing to fill a tortilla with. Simple, cheap, great for before an event. The cook is friendly and loves a good compliment. They would be the best for after a night out, if only they stayed open later.

Fantastic little place along 47th St. that is so unassuming you might walk right by, but don't! Some of the best tacos al pastor I've had, and their salsas are extremely fresh they brighten up already fresh food. I enjoyed the salsa rojo and their guacamole sauce. Friendly owners, clean place, and excellent food.

They are the best Tacos I have ever tasted. I been going there since day one. When we want taco the first place we think about is Don Cucos. I have been to other taco places and by far this one ranks number 1.  Its tiny place but i highly recommend this place if your in a mood for good tacos that will fill you up.

Good ass tacos! Especially the orange hot sauce. i recommend the fish taco. The place is kinda small. There's no tables. Only counter tops & stools. Enough for about 12 people inside. Your stomach will be satisfied & full.

Food and presentation were excellent.Here's the issue.We came in at 4pm when they were changing shifts.Listen, I've been a server, bartender, FOH manager, you name it; I get it. But seriously, train some consistency in your staff. The cocktails we got when we ordered with our first server tasted significantly different than the cocktails with our second server. I know, I know, our server didn't mix the drinks - but I watched the AM bartender hand off his shift to the PM bartender about 20 minutes before our second round was requested.It was unfortunate and frankly, not something you look for in a chain restaurant. Service was also spotty.We will be back; this is a great location - but maybe we just need to wait a couple more months for some turnover. You know, letting th bad ones weed themselves out.

I met for a lunch meeting with two colleagues. Location was convenient and free 90 min parking was a total surprise for a city restaurant.The decor is classy with lovely interior finishes and art and it made me want to return when all the beautiful people are there which I'd guess would be there in the evenings and Fri and Saturday nights?  Pretty quiet during lunch on Tuesday.Service was ok. One beverage and later the dessert menu had to be requested twice but no biggie.I ordered the mixed fajitas and I've never seen this dish presented this way. It wasn't served on the typical searing hot cast iron skillet but in a sizzling bowl filled with plentiful green peppers and onions, tender strips of grilled steak and chicken, delicious spices blended into a generous serving of sauce and topped with hot gooey cheese. More tortillas are necessary to finish the meal but I'm rarely one to request more. I just ate the remaining filling with the warm tortilla chips served earlier with the made-at-the-table guacamole.  Home run!  I can't wait to go back to try the tempting margaritas.

We went on a week day for a celebratory dinner...the place is huge but not trendy. The crowd is very mixed with in a rush movie goers and others trying to enjoy a quiet dinner. So I am trying to say that please dress casual :)Absolutely enjoyed the 3 salsas and free chips. The hubby got a Modelo and I got mango margarita on the rocks which was good. We ordered the tamales which were okay, the kids had quesadillas and shrimp fajitas. Hubby got chicken with pistachio mole. our waitress was very good and checked on us every few minutes, she also brought out the moles for tasting which was nice. I had mentioned it was husbands b'day so the staff came and sang for him and brought him a sombrero as a gift which is a nice touch.Will probably go back again!
Great place ! Wonderful fresh margaritas . Freshly made guacamole . Great selection of tacos $4 each . Great selection of salsa ! Super cool decor!Fun place to hang out

Three stars for my first time here. The ambiance is great--a classy, fun, slightly bougie Mexican spot is everything we needed in the Sloop! My first drink experience wasn't the best...I ordered the guava frozen and it was so sweet I could barely drink it. I understand that's probably personal taste preference, and was trying my best not to hold it against them but when our food came out shortly after, it too was slightly lacking.The table side guac was great, the chile relleno platter was great, the pinto beans were realllyyyy great, however all 3 of the tacos we ordered were bland and not quite right. The chicken Tinga was sweet which was odd and the chorizo and Picadillo were a bore.Don't worry Mago, we'll be back to give you another shot! Hoping the few flaws will be ironed out once they're open for a bit longer.

Must try their Salsas, Guacamole, Drinks and Tacos.Ambience: always gets 5*. Well maintained.Love to sit and Relax at this place.Food: they offer free chips and 3 diff salsas.Extremely Tempting and nice taste.Guacamole is made fresh at the table in a Cart.Cost: Quality:QuantityTaste : Cost is perfect ratio.

My husband and I enjoyed date night here this past weekend.  We'd seen this restaurant in passing when visiting the theater and decided to give it a try.First off, we were greeted very warmly, and our server was very knowledgeable about the menu.  He then brought to our table fresh chips and three salsa options.  Then, we ordered the house guacamole, which is made fresh and table side.  It was delicious and a plentiful serving.  We each got an El Hefe margarita, which was their classic margarita, but they had many options to choose from.  The margaritas were good but very sweet.  Then we chose to split the Carne Chihuahua, and was it savory!  The steak came with special mashed potatoes and fresh salsa as well as soft tortillas.  we also ordered sweet plantains on the side, which were also delicious.  It was plenty for the both of us to share, and by the end, we were incredibly full.The restaurant has a fun, colorful decor and is large enough to accommodate groups.  The service was excellent and so was the food.  The price averaged to $35 per person for the meal described.  Plus, this restaurant is convenient to the movie theater, making for a fun night all around.  I'd recommend Mago's, and I anticipate I'll be coming back.
Good food, good service, excellent ambience! Try their fajitas, they are too good and different from anything I've tried before. This place is a must visit!

As the last place to check out at the Roosevelt Collections location, I had high expectations. Especially with its 4 star rating. My fiancé and I aren't picky eaters and had our fair share of poor service, which surprises me to have to write such a bad review. We eat at Mexican restaurants, almost weekly (chains & mom and pop restaurants). We were interested in trying this place out.Usually, when asked if this was your first time, detailed explanation about the menu and recommended flavors are offered. The menu explains the flavorings but it sounds complicated. But not this time. The waitor let my fiancé and I sit there puzzled about what to order for over 10 min. He walked past us asking his other tables how they are doing. And one table to the left of me, he blankly asked, can I take this out of your way and give you the check? Whoaa, didn't even offer dessert yet and he has his customers 1 foot out of the door. The restaurant was almost completely empty, with 1 table left on the other side of the restaurant. So it wasn't like it was so busy to a point where you need to close tables out to re-open for the next customers.I had chosen 2 entrees incase the waitor would say something I didn't like on my initial dish. But no, he just took our order without explanation. When we received our entrees, my Mahi Mahi was half drenched in this unappetizing colored spicy sauce. The Mahi Mahi was bland without the sauce. So when I eventually looked past the color and the thoughts that it reminded me of, it was just ok. Nothing fancy like the menu explained, nothing to keep me wanting more.My fiancé's churrasco wasn't appetizing either. The sauce was sweet and tangy, flavors he didn't like. Overall, the flavors of everything, from the salsa for the chips to the sauces that were paired to our entrees were not appealing.This overview of flavors could have been more helpful if the they were explained in details. I also had the Mago-rita Mango and it was disgusting.I usually give restaurants like these a 2nd chance before I even think about writing a review, but I couldn't stop thinking about how our expensive dinner was a disaster. Never returning and I DO NOT recommend this place.

Went today, 10-22-16,I had the Mago Salad with chicken.  Salad was good but not as promised on the menu. A few chicken slices,not a whole chicken breast as the menu stated.  Not much romaine lettuce as stated mostly mixed greens. Had to look for the corn, beans  and avocado.  Salad was good but barely had what was stated ion the menu actually on my plate.  I must also add that the place was clean and the food was prepared clean as my body has a way of telling me if it's not :)

The food here was pretty good. It definitely felt like a chain restaurant, but if you already know that you know what you're getting into. I would definitely come back if I was in the area, but this is not a place where I would go out of my way to go. I love that with the salsa and chips they give in the beginning there are three different types of salsa. My salmon meal with the coconut mole was delicious. I also ordered the bread pudding for dessert. It was okay. I like my bread pudding to have ice cream on the side rather than whipped cream.

My boyfriend and I tried this place for the first time and loved it!The interior decor is extremely vibrant and joyful. The ambiance makes it a great place for a fun first date or for any type of dinner party.Right when you walk in the host and hostess's are very welcoming and friendly, which is always a huge plus for me.You get complimentary chips and salsa while you wait for your food. But BE CAREFUL!! We ate too many of these and got so full by the time our entrees arrived! They're slightly addictingMy boyfriend got the chicken enchiladas which he wiped clean, and I got two steak tacos with a side of Mexican rice. We also had the calamari for an appetizer, which was nothing special but still pretty tasty.Overall we definitely want to go back. Great atmosphere and energy, good service, and it's fun but it's pretty classy too!

We came here for a drink and a snack.  We tried the guacamole and the classic margarita.  Both were pretty good.  I was impressed with the amount of guacamole they give you.  #worthit.  We also tried a churro.  It was my first churro ever, and I was not impressed.  It was dry on the outside, and pretty doughy on the inside.  I would go back for the same, but was not pushed to be like 'Oh I NEED to come here for dinner'.

I've been here two times in the last two weeks and I don't plan on slowing down!The staff is so friendly and knowledgeable on the menu. The restaurant is clean, beautiful and the music is set to the right volume so it's easy to have a conversation here.The free chips and salsa are delicious! I've ordered the Mago salad twice, but I never finish it because of the chips and salsa. ;)You have to order the La Encatada drink - it's fruity and smooth. Just remember that this is not traditional Mexican food, but it is delicious!Overall, skip Chop and come here! :)

I'm giving 4 stars simply because it was a really long (probably 30 minute) wait just for tacos. Our waitress was apologetic though. The food was good--complimentary chips and 3 kinds of salsa were delicious. Chipotle salsa was on point. The taco variety was nice. We got carne asada and al pastor; both were tasty. The arroz rojo was nice and fluffy. They also have little guacamole carts that roll around and make fresh guac for the table--very cool! The tacos aren't expensive but some menu items run kind of steep. Overall, good up-scale(ish) Mexican food.

We decided to visit Mago last night for dinner since the new location finally opened! The interior design is pretty amazing compared to the older locations and the vibe is amazing. We were seated right away, but it took a good 5 minutes or so until our waitress greeted us and brought us some water. We ordered chicken fajitas that come in the lava rock (not the traditional ones) and a side of the Hispanic corn. The fajitas were decent, but the corn was not good at all. The waitress saw that we didn't touch the corn and didn't pack it up to take home, so I'm surprised she didn't ask us how it was. It would have been nice to get something else instead of a dish that had more cream than the corn itself. Overall, our experience was decent. I will come here occasionally, but will stick to the Arlington Heights location when possible!

This might sounds bias but you haven't had Mexican food until you had this place. The food is so tasteful and juicy I could eat here everyday. The water was room temperature & I loved that. You can also request ice if you wanted to. The chip and salsa is to die for. TO DIE FOR!!!Everything I ordered was so fresh I couldn't believe it.The atmosphere was so warm and upscale.You would be satisfied rather you came alone or with a dozen people ****ALSO I HAVE NEVER SEEN A MEXICAN RESTAURANT WHERE THEY HAD FAMILY STYLE- where you pay per person but only for 6 people or more*****THEY ONLY REASON I GAVE IT 4 STAR BECAUSE MY WAITER SUCKED. HE DIDN'T WATCH OUR DRINKS. HE TOOK FOREVER WITH THE CHECK AND HE DIDN'T SEEM HAPPY TO SERVE.

Shockingly fresh, tasty Mexican here. The chips and three salsas were anything but an afterthought, with terrific, unique flavors. And my Dorado tacos were fantastic. To top it off, my server (I ate at the bar, although had to skip the tequila this time around) was knowledgeable and attentive. Recommended. I'll be back.

I'm very mixed on whether to give a three or four star rating.  Went on a Saturday night with friends.  The food was absolutely outstanding but the service was lacking.  The server went out of his way to be helpful but one meal arrived 15 minutes before the others.  By the time they arrived I was halfway done eating.  The noise level is deafening.  It was extremely difficult to hold a conversation and, to add insult to injury, there was a large group of people with a children's sports team.  The adults sat at one table while the children were separated into two tables of approximately 10 and 6.  These children seemed to age in range from 11 to 14 and were running from table to table.  The adults sat by themselves ignoring the children.  Some of the other diners asked to be moved to a different section because of this.But, as I said above, the food was really good and we are trying to decided if it would be worth another try.

Great fresh table made guacamole, nice warm tortilla chips and pretty good all around cocktails but the rest is just meh.....standard mediocre chain restaurant  Mexican food. Fajitas are really underwhelming.

I've been to the Arlington Heights location and loved it, but this was just not good. I do love the various salsas that the include with the chips before our order comes. However, my boyfriend ordered the ropa vieja and didn't like how the meat was shredded, or the diluted mayonnaise that was on top of it. I got the cacahaute mole, and the sauce was really good, but the pork medallions I got it with were dry and tough. They also initially brought me the wrong sides. The service wasn't too great either. All in all, a disappointment after my enjoyment at the Arlington Heights location.

Went here after the movies. The place was nicely decorated, had a good vibe. Were seated right away. We sat for about 5 minutes before our server came to our table. She was soft spoken and the place was a little loud. Had a hard time hearing her, kept asking to repeat, just decided to skip the drinks. Ordered guacamole, fajitas, salmon dish, and plantains. All were delicious but the guacamole, since it came after we finished our meal. I don't know if the server was new or just out of it. The place wasn't crowded, less than 10 tables. Asked for more chips 3 times and didn't get any. Had to ask for another glass twice because mine had a chip. Didn't refill our water pitcher, even though we asked. I would try this place again because the food was good but I would get another server.

Only been here once, it was awesome!! The atmosphere was beautiful, it's spacious and the service is great! We had Guacamole, Frozen Margaritas and I had a Burrito! My boyfriend ordered a chicken dish, the food was great! We will definitely be back! It's great place to head to after work to just chill-ax!

This place just opened and we decided to try it out. Restaurant was done really nice.  Service was great. The manager Brian was really helpful.  Drinks were awesome.  We had the Horchata and virgin pina colada mojito. We were really impressed how great they tasted.The shrimp Chechive and guacamole apps were great.  They make the guacamole table side.Our entree was the steak fajitas and it didn't disappoint. Would recommend trying it. They have a  large menu selection.Desert was my favorite. Tres laches and the donuts filled with Nutella are a must have!We will definitely be back here again and we found our new local spot. A great addition to the south loop.

Nice atmosphere that's very convenient to the theatre and shopping.Chips are fantastic! Hot and fresh; and alone make it worth coming back. They serve three salsas with them which are also pretty good.  The margarita (up) is pretty solid too.Unfortunately the food was a kind of a let down.  The moles seemed to be a focus, so I went with the more traditional, with peppers and chocolate as the base. Served over top of the half chicken.  The chicken itself didn't have a lot of flavor which probably would've been fine IF the mole stepped up to it.  But it didn't have any of the deep, rich flavor that you should get from a good mole. Disappointing.The tacos were a-ok. We tried the steak and pastor.I know the restaurant is new, but I'm wondering if maybe their focus is on a few too many things starting off.  The menu is huge and I'm wondering if everything could benefit from scaling back a bit.I was hoping for an upscale Mexican place that I would want to go to without having a theatre ticket in hand. Not saying I wont try it again, but at the moment I'm not rushing back...
The food, the ambience, the service, everything is so impressive. And yes, loved the variety in the menu.

Now after being in the West & Northwest Suburbs this finally came to Chicago. This is a Mexican Cantina but with a Latin American twist. I had the tortilla chips with 3 of the house made salsas. The first one was Roasted Tomato and Jalapeño which was mild. The second was Fresh made with jalapeño, tomatillo and jalapeño which was medium and the third was Arbon Chile made with sesame seeds which was spicy. I liked the Roasted Tomato and Jalapeño and Arbon Chile. Then I had their Horchata which was not too sweet and it was great. It was their soft opening so they were in testing mode but the Staff still did a great job. The grand opening is on 7/18.

Although it's nice to have more pre-movie dining options at Roosevelt Collection, we had a bit of a mixed experience here. We went not too long after their opening (yes, it's taken me a few weeks to post this review), so I'm hoping they will smooth out the kinks as they go. We started with a drink at the bar, while we waited for the rest of our friends to arrive. The bartender was friendly, efficient and provided great service...and even though I'm not much of a tequila aficionado, I was impressed with their tequila menu. So...4 stars for the bar experience. Once our friends arrived, we moved to a table for dinner. I liked the chips with the 3 different sauces that they serve, and they came in handy, because service/food arrival was sloooooooooow. Also, the food was kind of hit or miss. Some of the dishes were great....some not so great....and some of them came out very cold, including the classic fajita entrees, which you would expect to be sizzling hot. So....2.5 stars for the dining room/dinner experience. The ambience is great...they really did a good job with the build-out of the space...and the staff was mostly friendly. So, overall, 3 stars, with the possibility to increase based on the success of future visits. I am looking forward to returning and trying again!!!

I really want to give this place a good rating but the service does not deserve more than that.Let's start from the beginning:A 30 minute wait for an empty dining room because they are not properly staffed. I can understand this if the hostess was upfront, she wasn't.A server who not only messed up (confused) two orders of kids quesadillas for enchiladas but then took 5-10 extra minutes to serve a taco salad is inexcusable. A taco salad...At the end though the manager made it right and we will be back.

Went here the other night with friends for the first time and had a great time. The ambiance was fun - exactly what you'd want from a cantina-style restaurant: bright decorations, modern and spacious. Drinks were balanced and strong, our waitress was super friendly and attentive, and the food was hot/flavorful. My friends had a couple of repeat issues with their dietary restriction requests in the kitchen, but the waitress quickly corrected and the manager provided service recovery. We'll be back!

If I could give this place 4.5 stars I would.  Stopped in and sat at the bar. They bring chips and 3 unique and tasty salsas. I ordered the Rojas and some other vegetarian taco with plantains. Absolutely delicious!!!Atmosphere is nice.  2 thumbs up!

We were a large group comprising some vegetarians and some meat eaters, and the wait staff handled us very well. We never felt rushed. The food was delicious and presented very well. I personally had their guac, their mango margarita and four different seafood tacos, and they were all yummy. The portion sizes were large. The chips and salsa kept flowing... I personally loved their green salsa the most. Overall a very good experience. And it didn't feel too expensive either. We had recently been to another restaurant in Chicago in River North and had paid about 120 per couple, and here we paid close to 80 per couple for similar orders. Add to that the convenience of free parking for three first 90 minutes and this place feels unbeatable. Highly recommended!

I ordered steak quesadilla and French fries. The French fries were cold. The quesadillas were just okay. I also ordered frozen mango margarita. I really enjoyed the margarita. The chips and salsa was good. The chips could have been warmer. I liked the atmosphere and the people were really nice.

Delicious authentic Mexican food. Flavors were spot on. The drink menu has something for everyone and our margaritas were very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. I'm glad we tried this new spot and will be returning!

The experience started out promising.  The strawberry margarita...bomb.com!  The traditional  margarita...strong!  The three salsas and chips... delicious!  But that's were the good times ended.  First, they were out of ceviche.  Then they were out of shrimp for the shrimp fajita.  And most disappointingly, the food took nearly an hour to come out and was not delicious.  Granted two different people stopped by our table to apologize for the long wait and the manager even comped our two rounds of drinks to compensate for it.  However, that didn't make up for the lack of flavor of our entrees.  I ordered the chicken fajitas (since they were out of shrimp) and he ordered the steak fajitas.  My entree was bland, bland, bland, and his entree tasted like it was burned.  I may return for drinks, but definitely not for a meal.

Went for the first time last night; this place is great. Nice atmosphere, spacious, great decor, and attentive service. Food was tasty. Had the hot guacamole and it was definitely hot lol, but tasted so good! Had the La Reina margarita; nice flavor, not much of a kick though. Also had the enchiladas salsa verdes, and it was very flavorful. Nice portion sizes. I will be back!
Great food. Very large portions. Nice atmosphere. Full service bar. Flavor of the Loop but kind of off the beaten path in my opinion. Great service. It's definitely worth a visit.

We enjoyed the atmosphere and the overall ambiance of the restaurant. We ordered the queso and the carne asada tampiquena and both were delicious! Our service was adequate and the menu seemed slightly overpriced for the portion size of the meals. But generally, this restaurant was enjoyable, and we'd return!

Such a disappointment! Decor is very nice and I could see maybe hanging out there for Happy Hour (although we didn't have nay drinks), but that's about it.  Entree prices are rather high and since it was our first time, we decided to try a few of the tacos and one of the entrees to get a taste of what they had to offer.  There were 3 of us.  We had the Pastor, Carne Asada, Chorizo & Camaron tacos, the roasted asparagus with chimichurri sauce and the Ropa Vieja (slow braised beef brisket).  Pastor and Chorizo were the best of the tacos, but not great.  Camaron was okay, but the Carne Asada was tasteless ... I don't even think there was salt and pepper on it.   Meat to tortilla ratio was excellent, but not good.  We would rather make the trip to Pilsen or Chilango on Taylor for tacos.  The braised beef brisket was okay, but for $17 we expected a lot more that just okay.  It was mushy and tasted like bland beef stew.  The roasted asparagus was the actually a dish we really enjoyed though!  The service irritating and strange on many levels.  I don't understand why the the staff feel the need to clear one person's plate while others are still eating.  Eventually, it ended up that my husband sat there still eating all by himself while the rest of the table was cleared.  On top of that, the waitress then brought the dessert menus over to me and my mom.  My husband was still eating when the waiter came by and asked if we'd like dessert (never even acknowledging my husband)!  We we said "no", he immediately turned around and returned with the check.  My husband was still eating!  Then when my husband was actually done, a gentleman came by (we assumed he was a manager because he had seated us) and scooped up my husband's plate without asking if he was done and came back to clear away the chips and salsa.  Again, he never said a word.  Didn't ask if we were done, how our meal was, if he could get us anything else .... nothing!  At that point it became clear why the wait staff didn't know how to do there jobs .... management doesn't know how to do the job.  Quality of food did not match price points and weird service means we won't be back.

I haven't been to this one, but they have the same one in Bolingbrook. This is authentic Mexican food. The dips and salsa are heaven, the avocado sauce they have is truly delectable! This is not chipotle!! I enjoyed the food and the preparation was authentic is every way. The menu is extensive with many choices.
This place is fantastic! The food is amazing and the staff was great. This is a great place for dinner and a movie!

Great service, nice ambiance. Appetizers and drinks were great. Table side  guacamole was great. The entrees were good. Not necessarily authentic,  but tasty. I would recommend for a date night or night out w friends but not if you are craving authentic Mexican food.
I was honestly surprised with the food and ambiance. The food is a similar style as Uncle Julio's but with much better drinks.

If you have ever gone to a bbq not knowing if you wanted a burger or a hot dog, and agonizing over the decision the whole length of the food line, this place is the hot dog joint you never knew you were searching for!I had the Memo burger. Which is a burger with a hot dog on top! With all the classic fixings of a Chicago style dog. Seriously, my mouth is watering from writing this!I loved the food, I loved the super nice workers, and I loved the hole-in-the-wall feel. I want to go back! And that's saying something considering how many food places there are to explore in Chicago!

I've been passing this joint like I'm Bob Marley, but only recently decided to stop in & try 'em out. And I'm kinda hooked.They stand out as this bright yellow building varnished with Vienna Beef logos on a street chock full of cafes, Latin cuisine, and hipster hideouts.Their menu is pretty extensive and laden of heart attack inducing options. My go-to has been the double gyro-cheeseburger. But they also make a mean Polish.This isn't some fancy "our beef is never frozen" place. Their beef is more frozen than that guy in the meat-truck in Goodfellas. But I don't care. Dem shits is good.Certainly not a place that's going to bring tourism to Pilsen, but for the locals, a good option when you want some simplified, non-Mexican fare.

Memo's A hot dog joint that used TO BE Ronnies.Hot dogs are fine with all trimming.fries thick cut and very hot. If you order cheese fries you will receive a glob of an unknown yellow substance for cheese.The burgers patties are thin but are beef. I ordered the double cheeseburger on french bread which comes with fries and it was very filling.Soda selection is plentiful with various canned ice teas. A few table are avaiable if you want to eat food their.The cook after all these years has not picked up his speed and the reason why is he is the owner.Street parking is metered and the meter maids stay on  between 1400-1600 on 18th st. all daySo if you want to spend under 8$ on a quick lunch MEMOS will fit your budget.CAUTION GYROS meat is from the freezer so will taste kinda of freezer burned DO NOT order!

Would definitely come back here for aChicago dog. The best I've had yet. Customer service was great. The woman that helped us was friendly and fast. Atmosphere is just right. The restaurant has an "old" feel to it, but in a good way.

Love this place for hamburgers and gyros. I believe the owners are the people that work there, they are awesome and extremely friendly. Highly recommend this place over any other hamburger hotdog joint in Pilsen.

was on a quest to look for big portion cheese fries and came across this spot in pilsen..this place is small and can be quickly overlooked if not paying attention..good and friendly service..i have came here multiple times already and have tried the cheese fries.. the heart attack .. pizza puff.. and double cheese burger on French bread-cheese fries.. its all what I was looking for.. large portion and loaded with cheese!-pizza puff- ehh it is just your normal typical frozen pizza puff.. nothing special-the heart attack- this is a triple cheese burger! it is pretty good and filling! not for the weak hearted ppl haha-the double cheese burger on French bread- I got this because it was the special of the day and it sounded interesting.. indeed it was something I never saw before haha.. not sure how I like it tho.. I think I enjoy it more on regular burger buns..overall I like this little spot.. especially the cheese fries and the heart attack burger!

Omg...The cheeseburger is the best ever. Not greesy, very fresh tasting.   Prices are cheap and  customer service was perfect...Seems like a family owned business, which gives you that comfortable feeling as soon as you walk in.  I will be back tomorrow to try their Chicago style hotdog..

Good Chicago style Hot dog and burger shop. This place has been in Pilsen since I can remember.  Try the double cheese burger on French bread  and the Memo burger (burger topped with a Polish and grilled unions).

Still the best after so many years of changes in owners. The guys running it now are nice and quick. The food is just like I remember it. You can't beat the prices. There's no place around in Pilsen that gives you the deals that they do. Give them a try and you won't be disappointed. They totally put the competition to shame.
These guys are pretty cool  and the food is great and the prices are how do you say SWAGERIFIC.when your there try the memo burger pretty damn flame.
Best hot dog joint in Pilsen and best I've been to in this city to date. Prices are a steal and the people there are pretty nice.

Memo's is very clean - and has a nice decor = quaint but cool.  Service is great and the food is fresh and you can watch them prepare.  Nice hint - try the Memo burger w mayo......excellent after a couple at Harbees!!

So never noticed this place for the past year I been walking past it but decided to give it a shot because I wanted something other than Latin food & it was perfect ! I order the chicken tenders & cheese fries . Great portions for a great price ! They will definetly be seeing me again ; probably 1-2x a week .
Just stopped in there and grabbed a double cheeseburger on French bread and it was so delicious! Great prices and great food. Definitely a place I'll be coming back to.
Great little family place!  On days when only the father works, they don't take credit cards probably because he doesn't dig the technology.  Food is always nicely prepared and inexpensive.
Cheap.  Delicious.Whatever you order will hit the spot.  And the people who own it are really friendly.
LOVE this place. Always super friendly, always great food and a must when im in the neighborhood.

I'm not sure why there aren't more reviews for Memo's. Located on 18th street a block from Ashland it has the most delicious and cheapest burgers and hotdogs I've ever had. The owner is extremely friendly and is always welcoming. You can get a cheeseburger and fries for $3.60!

Came here last week. I've always passed it and thought i would give it a try. Its small yet cozy the lady was nice i ordered the cheese burger and cheese fries for a little over 5 bucks. Food was good service was friendly prices are reasonable also. Give them a try to get their ratings up.

Ordered from this place on Uber eats a few time. Excellent value for the price. Both times I've ordered a sand storm bowl. Plenty of delicious food. Falafel slightly dry, and a bit of fat on the steak. The quantity of food in this bowl makes up for those tiny problems.Ask for extra white sauce on the side. Red sauce not the hottest I've had.

I ordered the falafels plate with a side of Jerusalem salad and lentil soup.  Additionally, I ordered some Dolma and Baklava.  My online order was placed two minutes before seven, and I received my food a quarter to ten.  There was no hummus or tahini included in the meal, unlike other Mediterranean places I've gotten similar foods from, let alone tzatziki sauce.  What I *did* get, however, which I found absolutely disgusting, was ranch dressing, and a lot of it.  The food itself was only so-so.I will not be ordering from here again.
Had the falafel sandwich. Delicious and tasted fresh.My BF had the lamp chop platter. He is very picky and loved the lamb.

Been here twice, nothing but delicious fast/casual food. It's a convenient nutrition stop during a bar crawl or after the Cubs game. Price is decent. The felafel is bomb, crispy on the outside, hot and fresh every time! Their sandstorm sandwich is another great option for meat-lovers, def my husband's solid go to choice. One minus: it can get quite busy on certain nights, so wait time varies. Skip the bar food, check this place out whenever you're in the neighborhood!

Zam Zam's is the perfect place to eat for a vegetarian. I usually get the falafel plate which includes a ton of rice, 6 falafel, and two sides of your choice AND pita! It's a great deal and I always have left overs for the next day. Plus it's a great deal! It's made fresh every time I come in which is about once a week.Fast and friendly service. This place is truly a gem.

There is MUCH better Mediterranean food out there, that or they were off today because of the Cubs game. Hummus was delicious but chicken was rather dry and the flavor wasn't the best. They left the hummus off my wrap and really skimped on the rest of the ingredients.

decent food, good quantity, moderate price. Baba Ghanoush was good. Lentil soup was mediocre. Their steak and chicken shawarma meat are great!Asked for pickles with me plate, didnt come through on it (maybe he wanted me to pay? Never said so though).Plenty of food, rushed during games at Wrigley field.I was between 3 and 4 stars but gave it the 4 because of the quality of steak
This place is great. One of my favorite places in the neighbor. Lots of food. Great price. Friendly staff. Would recommend. Chicken is delicious.

Wanted to get my Mediterranean fix on, and heard good things about this place so decided to stop by the past weekend. Ordered a sandstorm plate, which had chicken + beef schwarma and 2 falafel.Pros: All of their entrees held up. Meat was tender and flavorful. Falafel was crispy and not at all bland. Could probably scarf down 10 of those on my own.Cons: The Zam Zam salad was a bit of a let down, and they were a bit skimpy with the hummus. The rice itself was alright(not phenomenal, not terrible, a little dry). For the price($11), expected a bit more in the plate.Verdict: 3.5 stars. Good food, though for the price of the sandstorm I expected a little more(esp on the hummus). That said, would be willing to try again and see if maybe it was just an off day, as the schwarma and falafel(especially the falafel) were quite delicious.

I don't review often, but I had to for this one. Im pissed because my little sandwich cost me 20 bucks. The delivery fee was $10. I would never had ordered had I known and the guy who took my order didn't bother to tell me. Ridiculous that it's so high. The sandwich was nasty. It was devoured in too much sauce. I asked for garlic sauce on the side and it was ranch dressing. Never again will i order from here

We order from Zam Zam for delivery every now and then and will continue to. I love the chicken shawarma, and the garlic sauce is so good. The tabouleh is also so fresh and tangy. The pita is like the type you'd buy from the grocery store (pita pockets), and the hummus is just ok. I love their falafel and order that as a side with my shawarma.So good!
It's nothing special, but the food was decent. We got a lot for our money. The portions are very large. The chicken was a little dry, but I would eat there again.

Excellent food made with care and pride.  Shwarma, falafel, tabouli and more.  The falafel are one of the best ever, not greasy, but very crispy.  Meat is seasoned super tasty.Prices and portions are great, for quality food.I ate here exactly one year ago and the owner still remembered me.   If you are in Chicago's Wrigleyville, Zam Zam is THE place.

The food was alright nothing amazing but nothing bad either. Also lots of food for the price but The worst part was that we had to wait forever to get take out from here on a week night inspite of them having only me, my husband and another guy waiting for our orders. The person at the counter looked clueless.Don't think I am going back again.
Quick fast easy. I order from them at least twice a month, its not premium food, but not bad either.Quality for the price - all of it is delicious.

We ordered one chicken kebob plate and one falafel sandwich, they were incredibly delicious. The chicken was tender with great seasonings, and the sides (Jerusalem salad and zam zam salad) were amazing.The sandwich was surprisingly good, I thought it is small at the first sight but I had enough. I really enjoyed every single bite.I strongly recommend this place.

This place is just plain awesome! I am from Detroit and spent alot of time in Dearborn...I know all about what good Middle Eastern Food should be! This place is as close as it gets in Chicago! Meat is moist, well seasoned, sides are fresh. This place is spot on! Always hot and fresh! Loooove it!!!!!!!!!!It is a must try if you want REAL middle Eastern food at an excellent price and quality!
I love this place! I always get the chicken shawarma bowl, really can't get enough of the garlic sauce. It's delicious!

Sorry for the delay on the update, but food was great. We've been back a few times since!Fries.. Dangerously good, perfect crisp texture. Falafel.. Again, texture and flavor are great. Thanks for being a quality business in a sea full of sub par places that simply exist!

I ordered delivery from here and had to jump on Yelp! right away to write a review. Some of the best Mediterranean food I've had in years. Everything from the hummus to pita to chicken shawarma, down to the sauces-was delicious. The delivery was also fairly quick and the portion was enough for two meals. I will definitely order from here again. But, first I'd like to go in to see the actual space myself!

I love this place I usually get it about once a week! Chicken Shawarma plate is the bomb! About a month ago they changed their white sauce (tahini) to this horrible vinegar like mustard nonsense and when I called to ask if maybe I received the wrong sauce the man on the phone got angry and told me they only added a little spices and it tastes exactly the same, it was bright yellow smelled rotten and I ended up feeling pretty sick for several hours. I was pretty sad and ate my food without the delicious sauce the next time. Apparently other customers agreed and they stopped doing that and now the regular sauce is back! Hooray! 5 stars! Definitely try it out! If what the advertise as "creamy white sauce" looks yellow and mustardy I would suggest throwing the sauce in the garbage immediately though...

I tried out Zam Zam with my bud on a cool wintry weekend evening.  Zam Zam has a very lowkey interior, with a TV in the corner and country music (???) blaring overhead to drown out our conversation.  Other than one flurry of customers coming in to order food we mostly had the place to ourselves, though a colorful parade of Christmas-themed barhoppers passed by outside.We each chose a plate for dinner, and we appreciated the fact that you have quite a few options to choose from for your two side items.  I had the beef kefta atop a bed of rice, and I opted for a cup of lentil soup and a side of three falafels as my side items.  The plate also comes with pita bread and a few little cups of sauces.  The best part of my plate was the kefta meat, and that's the way it should be.  The soup was a little soupy, but nice and warm does the trick during this cool evening.  Everything else was fine as well, along with my bud's chicken shawarma plate.

Well priced authentic middle eastern cuisine. I am a big fan of shawarma sandwiches amd platters. I can tell who is faking it and who is the real deal.In my opinion this is probably the most authentic in the Chicago-land area.

I've always seen this place and decided I'd give it a try. I'm a huge fan of Mediterranean food so I had high expectations.I went with the sandstorm plate - chicken shawarma, steak shawarma, and 2 falafel with rice, pita, and choice of 2 sides. I went with hummus and cucumber and tomato salad.I'll start by saying the falafel was the best I've ever had. Amazing texture, piping hot on the inside, and great flavors. It was the best thing on the plate.Cucumber/tomato salad was crunchy and fresh. Rice was perfect. Steak and chicken both had their positives, but I liked the chicken better.I think my only complaint was that the hummus was a little oily - oil accumulated on top. It still tasted superb, but the oil was a turn off.Great spot - I'll be back!

All meals are under $10; cheap sides as well. They also have rotating cupcakes, cake pieces, baklava, etc dessertsGot beef schwarma and it was very very good. Lots of food. Jerusalem salad was fresh and tasted good with the humus side.
Get the Sandstorm, it's a sampler of their greatest hits. Awesome place to eat before going to Wrigley field.

Ordered via yelp and it said 35-45 minute delivery. An hour an a half later I still hadn't received my food (I was busy packing my condo to move so lost track of time or would have called sooner). They said they couldn't track down their delivery driver so he hadn't even left with my food yet. Cancelled the order obviously but it left me stranded for food options since it was so late and I was starving. They could have very easily called me within the first 30 and told me they wouldn't be able to fulfill the order.

I love this place!  I order delivery or carry out pretty frequently. The food is delish. Prices are reasonable and the quantity of food is just right. I ordered a chicken donar sandwich and they made a mistake and gave me a falafel sandwich. Serendipity!!  Boy that was the best falafel sandwich I've had in awhile. Now I always get that. Love the hummus, baba ganoush, the sandstorm plate and the lamb chops.

Mmm Zam Zam is so delicious! The chicken schwarama is moist and flavorful, while the sides are so fresh and tasty- my favorites being the humus and Jerusalem salad.I also love that even though they give you plenty of food (typically two meals worth), it's relatively cheap, about $9 for a plate, and you don't feel guilty after devouring all the deliciousness.Zam Zam is a must try if you love mediterranean food but can also make you a believer if you don't!

Excellent value, fresh food, and as a Mediterranean guy myself, I can vouch for the authenticity and quality of this meal. All the way from Houston, and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Prices are incredibly reasonable as well.I had the beef shawerma plate, and my wife had the chicken shawerma plate.
I love this place so much. It is so freakin' good and its open late on Friday and Saturday.Best shwerma and ghanoush that I've had in the city. Better than Dawali in Lincoln Park in my opinion.

What can I say, I'm a sucker for great shawarma. Zam Zam certainly did not disappoint. Pairing moist grilled chicken with the perfect amount of cabbage and pickles made for a 5-star consumption experience. The first time I ever ordered Zam Zam was on a cold, snowy night about a month ago and it took 2 hours to arrive. I later learned that the delay was the fault of Grubhub rather than Zam Zam, but the owner was very apologetic and offered to comp my next order. I did not let one poor experience due to the weather mold my opinion, and giving the place a second shot was a great decision. I will definitely be back for more.

First time I ate here the food was pretty good. Last few times I have gone the meat has been dry and it was painfully obvious the pita bread has been sitting around all day. Decent drunk food but definitely needs some work if you are gonna try to grab a real meal here.

The chicken shawarma plate is fantastic. The owner is there quite a bit & is super nice too! Never had a bad meal, and you can't beat the prices for the amount of food you get. Definitely a go to for us.

Needed something to eat. Late dinner. Saw this place on Yelp. Friendly manager. I got the beef kefta kabob and my wife got the chicken. Comes with rice, pita, and two sides. I got the hummus and one their salads. It was really good. I enjoyed both dishes. Will be coming back.

Just moved into the neighborhood last month. Yesterday, we were lazy and decided to GrubHub it. I placed the order and in ten minutes everything came piping hot and fresh. Yep, 10 MINUTES! Ordered beef and chicken shawarma plates with hummus and falafel and fries. The meat well flavored and tender not dry like most middle eastern restos we've tried. Even the falafel was moist inside and crunchy on the outside. We're happy to have discovered this place and we'll be back for more.
Falafel was average,they forgot my pita and the beef I ordered was tuff like it was heated in the microwave.baklava was good

Dawali is our go to place for tasty and fresh Mediterranean food.  My wife and I were going to order Dawali and realized that we are just outside their delivery area and were too lazy to go pick it up.  Luckily we decided to try Zam Zam!  I'm not always a huge delivery fan, as the food can arrive stale.  Zam Zam's food came fast and fresh.Everything we ordered was outstanding.  The pockets were great, the Lentil soup was as good as Nesh (which is a great thing), and the sides were solid.  The menu is simple and affordable.  I have a feeling we will be coming here a lot more, since it's just around the corner!  It's always good to have a solid Mediterranean place in our backyard!  Long live Zam Zam!
Bomb hole in the wall place for a quick shawarma fix.Found this place accidently roaming around the wrigley field area.Prices are fair.Chicken shawarma jas a smokey plavor!Beef shawarma is good too.

Whoa! What happened ZamZam? New recipes, new chef? Say it isn't so! I've been a faithful customer since they opened and it's always more than delightful. Ordered the following tonight:Lentil Soup - delicious as alwaysChicken Shawarma Plate - something is off here, the chicken pieces are super big and there's not nearly as much as there used to be. There's also a sauce poured over all of it - that's new. I always ordered extra pita because there was more than enough to NEED extra pita. Now I hardly need the one that came with it.Falafel - they are in a different shape than usual and completely soggy and gooey in the middle - grossExtra pita - no longer cut in halfExtra hummus - still deliciousWith every package I opened it was more and more disappointing.Whatever you guys are doing different over there - STOP!Update - without even a call, Mike sent me a brand new order and it looks absolutely lovely! Amazing customer service guys!
