My wife and I love this place! Food is always great and fresh. Owners are very nice and food is quick to get. We go at least once a week. My favorite is the chicken shawarma wrap with spicy + a side of humus and my wife gets the chicken plate with tabouli and baba ghanoush.

Fast, friendly, and tasty. Everything I'm looking for in a fast casual Middle Eastern place. Zam Zam's food is always fresh, too. And they're willing to hook you up with some extra pita which is always nice. Love this place!

I ordered delivery twice in one day because THAT'S how delish this place is. The chicken bowl? Um, hello. Amazing! The white sauce? I don't know what the official name is or what it contains but pour that on everything! 5 very well deserved stars!!

I visited here yesterday for a quick lunch.  I had the falafel sandwich and a bottled water.  When I got the total, I was floored; it was 6 bucks and change.  The falafels were great and I loved that they gave me the option of making it spicy.  Minus 1 star as I didn't like the pita they used.  It's tasty but it falls apart quite easily.  It made it a messier meal than it should have been but I'm definitely going back to try their other menu items.

Seeing a new-ish restaurant with five stars on Yelp only a few months after opening means one of two things - 1) the restaurants friends and family have "stacked" the reviews or 2) the place is really darn good.  After trying Zam Zam last week for the first time out of curiosity and a love for all foods Middle Eastern, it is evident that #2 is the case here - Zam Zam is really darn good!I ordered a chicken shawarma plate and not being a big fan of rice asked what my options were and they allowed me to double up on hummus instead of rice which was a score, because their hummus is super tasty and creamy and delicious.  I also ordered a side of falafel to go with my meal, and they were crispy nuggets of heaven.  And I am picky about falafel, but these were great - cooked to perfection but not soggy and undercooked or greasy and over cooked - perfection.  All in all my meal ran me about $11 (w diet coke) and I had plenty to take home for leftovers!  The staff and manager/owner are very friendly and nice, too.I will be sure to be back!

Love Zam Zam! We discovered them two weeks ago and have been there three times already. The hummus is amazing, the chicken is great, and the rice is good. I'm not a fan of the zam zam salad, and the pita is REALLY lacking. However, the good is good enough that we keep coming back!

Zam Zam is my favorite falafel place. The food is great and as a vegan I love that the staff is very knowledgeable about veganism and plant-based eating so I never have to worry about my food having animal products in it. I also appreciate that they're proud of having vegan options and are looking into adding more vegan options in the future.Every vegan or vegetarian definitely needs to get a falafel wrap from this place. Seriously sooo good, so filling, and reasonably priced at under $5.The guys who own it are some of the nicest guys in all of Chicago and they treat their staff well, which is important to me. If supporting small businesses with ethical business practices is important to you, Zam Zam should be on the top of your list of restaurants to frequent.Good vibes at Zam Zam all the time. It's never noisy or extremely crowded like other places in Wrigleyville. I always feel welcome and at home. I can't say enough great things about this place.

I just walked back from my lunch break and I had to review this spot. I live in Albany park which has a lot of great Middle Eastern options. In fact, I rarely try any spots outside Albany Park cause they usually let me down. I had a craving today and was too far to go home, so I decided to try Zam Zam and I'm glad I did.I had the "Sandstorm Wrap" so I could try a bit of everything (Falafel, Beef, Chicken). It's essentially a burrito with all three staples, red cabbage, pickles and yogurt sauce. The guy at the register asked if I wanted it spicy which is always a bonus for me. So they threw in some hot sauce.From the one sandwich I had, I can tell they don't mess around. All three main ingredients were on point. If you're in the area and want a decent meal, stop at Zam Zam. I will be recommending it to my falafel loving friends!
Great place to get a taste of the middle east.... Food was tasty  fresh and great portions. Price was excellent as well finally something near Lakeview that can get a taste of back

This place rocks! I came here for a late night bite and was blown away by how much I loved my schwarma. Despite being full I ordered another and then fell in love all over again at breakfast this morning. They do take their time for each order (we waited 20 mins), but we all thought it was worth the wait.I'd recommend you go for the Schwarmas. The beef schwarma was pretty epic and meaty. They also have one that is a mix of beef and chicken which is great too. Their Lentil soup is also worth a try - I ended up stealing a lot of my friend's soup because I couldn't get enough.This place is open late and dirt cheap too. I'll definitely be back.
This place has legit you are my amazing amazing amazing food I will be back there many times

The food is great, but if you're ordering pickup/delivery I highly recommend calling it in as opposed to using GrubHub - the system gets backed up and the orders don't go through, which causes a long delay.

I love this place. I had a chicken shawarma plate and pita bread. To me, if the shawarma is good and the pita bread and hummus is good, it scores high in my book. I have eaten here and gotten food delivered. Great place in lakeview.
Had the sandstorm bowl and loved it!  I recommend it spicy.  A good quantity of food and delicious!  Highly recommended.

"The Best" comes to mind when thinking of this place, because I have yet to have something here that isn't the best I've ever had...well maybe the falafel, but that would be tied with the best I've ever had, so I'm not quite sure I can fault it for being amazing.The chicken Shwarama is amazing, I've never had such amazingly seasoned chicken, so juicy, so flavorful.I come here a few times a week, usually for the falafel sandwich special @ only $3.I come with my dog and they bring it outside to me, no fuss or anything they seem glad to! These are the nicest owners(Completely owner-run!!) you could ever want in a restaurant!Will come back time and time again, and recommend to everyone.

I would have given this place 5 stars when they first opened.  They had a 5 star rating and earned it!  They used to deliver really late til like 2 a.m., now it is very hit or miss, but I haven't been able to get delivery past 10 or 11 and we call often.  The chicken shawarma is really good if they get it right (they used to always get it right), now sometimes it's dry :(  I tried their beef shawarma once and it was too salty for my taste, but I may try it again just to see if that was another fluke.  Hummus, baba ganoush, and tabouleh are all solid and reliable.  Falafel is average but not great.Their sauces are really awesome!  The chili, tahini, and white garlic sauces are amazing!  Only downside is they don't seem to know what you mean when you say "can I have extra sauce with that?"  They almost never send any extra sauce, or only send one extra of a random sauce they picked.  Disappointing.  With all that said, it is some of the best Mediterranean faster food I have found in Chicago and the delivery is usually pretty fast.I feel that if they are going to be open until 2 a.m., they really should consider delivering that late, probably not that many people staggering down Clark on foot at that hour looking for shawarma, probably getting beaten every time by pizza, gyros, italian beefs, etc. being offered steps away.  But, what do I know?.... I really loved this place when they opened, I still like them, but we don't order from them multiple times in a week anymore.  Give it a try, hopefully they are on their game that day and cross your fingers that they will deliver when you call... Oh, one nice touch is the sign on the wall that offers free samples for the "unheard of price of...FREE."  I hope they get back to their 5-star glory days!

While waiting for the play to start at the Under The Gun theater, we did a quick search on Yelp for food. The rating, cost, and the fact we could walk and not have to move our car sold us on the place. The food was fan-tas-tic!! The hummus was so fresh it made me sad thinking of the store bought plastic container sitting in my 'frig. The portions are generous and the staff is very friendly. Highly recommended this establishment for a great meal at a very reasonable price.

I had the sandstorm shawarma sandwich! The owner recommended it and it was the bomb! I had to tip them after seeing the tip jar that read, "Pita is a tip spelled backwards." Lol will go back again tomorrow evening. Food is very fresh and the place looks clean and well taken care of. Highly recommend! You can never go wrong with ZamZam!

After reading the reviews on Yelp, I was excited to try Zam Zam. I ordered chicken schawarma with a side of pita and hummus. The delivery time was quoted for 30 minutes, but it took an hour and 15 minutes for my tiny order! The delivery man didn't say one word - not hello, goodbye, or sorry for the wait. Just handed me the bag and walked away. Not surprisingly, my food was cold and had to be reheated in the microwave. The flavor was okay, and I'm sure it would have been a decent meal when it was hot and fresh... But I will definitely not be ordering from Zam Zam again due to the poor service.
Clean environment.. Good service and amazing food .. I recommend this place for a good Middle Eastern food

Zam Zam is a great place for healthy fast food.  I love the chicken shawarma pitas. The first few times we went in they gave a free dessert which was a little unusual but really delicious.  I had not had much experience with Mediterranean food before Zam Zam but when they first opened I would have it delivered at least once a week. Delicious, healthy and fast.

Middle Eastern cuisine is my favorite, and Zam Zam nails it considering the price. Their plates are good (as you have options for two sides), and bowl are equally good, as all are mixed with sauces. I love their steak bowl, chiken shwarma plate, and chicken shish kebab plate!

it was almost closing time but they actually let me in and place my order. i even got extra bread. my favorite thing about this place was that the food was good and that they were open til  later than most of the other restaurants in the area. service was nice too even though they assumed i was mexican which is ironic considering some mexicans think im middle eastern. think about that.

We went to Zam Zam because it got really great reviews, but we were very disappointed.  The portions were small and lacking in flavor.  They were served out of flimsy plastic containers, like TV dinners.  Again, no flavor, and why eat ethnic food when there is no flavor?  Were the other people who reviewed this restaurant drunk?  Also, there is absolutely no character to this restaurant, it is boring.  We spent way too much money, and were still hungry by the time our small portions of bland fare had disappeared.  We ended up going to Dimo's next door immediately after.  Customers should never leave a restaurant feeling hungry and unsatisfied.Sorry, but nope.

The beef schwarma pita sandwich is delicious! The beef was juicy and flavorful, the salad and pickles were fresh and added the perfect acid component to the sandwich.The three sauces (tahini, hot, and garlic) are tasty. The standout sauce is definitely the garlic sauce. It complimented the spiciness of the meat. The Yum yum!The falafel is fresh and made to order. Great flavor and freshness!

Amazing and satisfying late night food! After getting a few drinks, we stumbled across this place and I was pleasantly surprised. The shwarmas were delish and the manager (I think) was really friendly. He even gave us some hummus to try.Come here, late or early, to try some great cuisine.

Grabbed my girlfriend some dinner from Zam Zam since it's right across the street from her place. Got the Chicken Shish kabob plate and was dissapointed. The hummus and tabouleh were ok but the Chicken was salty and over charred in areas, the rice though cooked well was underseasoned. Really wanted this place to be good since it's so close to her apartment but I guess i'll find elsewhere. Maybe for those of you not of middle eastern background this food is good enough but not for my tastes.

Zam Zam is my favorite go-to in the neighborhood. They have the best chicken shawarma, the hummus is super tasty, and the owner (I presume, he's always in there) is really friendly. The lentil soup is a perfect side when it is cold out; otherwise I'll go for the zam zam salad, which is a good compliment to the shawarma and that spicy chili sauce.Highly recommended if you are in the area!

Some of the best food in Wrigelyville and affordable too. Chicken shawarma and sandstorm plate are both awesome. Highly recommend this place. It's a short walk from my work and I go at least once a week now. The guys who run the place are great too.
Only got take out, but I will absolutely be back. Sampled a combination of meat and vegetarian dishes and all were very good. Especially recommend the chicken shawarma.
Their simple menu allows them to focus on and prepare the freshest and most delicious Middle Eastern food "on the go" i've ever tasted. this is not of your "fast food" variety!
Good fresh late-night food!
Amazing food!!! Great cheap Mediterranean food!!! The service is great. This place has great delivery also.

One of the best places in the city! They started off rough, like any new place would, they worked hard and got it down. The Shawarma is just really really good food!CONGRATS on doing a great job!!!!!!!!!!!!
So many great dishes here!  Not expensive and tastier food than Wrigley Field down the block!

Awesome falafel! Picked up a to go order after an afternoon at the beach. Everything was hot, fresh, and delicious. Don't forget to get the garlic and hot sauces. Even the seven year old loved the garlic sauce!
Great food! Got the beef kebab and chicken kebab and both were delicious. Manager was extremely friendly and even gave us a free pita and hummus. Give this place a try!
Great food, open late, and good value.Will stop by again if I'm ever in the area!

This place is pretty good.  Does it deserve its current five star rating?  Short answer is no.  This is your run of the mill Middle Eastern food joint.  I will give it credit, though.  It's better than competitors in its class like Sultans Market.  The chicken shawarma is delicious; nice and sloppy and full of shawarma flavors - Mmmmmm.The French Fries leave a lot to be desired; I grade them at 77/100.  If you are looking for a side with your sandwich, opt for the 4 falafels instead.Bottom line for Zam Zam's: it's great!  I'll be back.
Sandstorm sandwich is awesome!

I was on my way to Gold Crown Liquors Store in Wrigleyville to buy a birthday present, when I was pleasantly surprised to see that Zam Zam had finally opened up. I had been looking forward to eating at this new restaurant since I first noticed their "Coming Soon" sign. Wrigleyville, specifically on Clark St., lacks a good variety of restaurants to choose from. Clark St. is all bar food, and not too far is Taco Bell, McD's, and Al's Beef. The one exception is the amazing Big G's Pizza. Some of the bars have great menu items but they don't specialize in any one particular kind of food or they are over priced. This is why Zam Zam caught my eye.I walked in just as the Cubs v. Cardinals game was about to start and I was greeted by this very nice young lady. The kitchen is exposed and the entire restaurant looked very clean and very new. The prices for everything on the menu were fair and reasonable for a casual middle eastern restaurant. I ordered the chicken shawarma and the baba ghanoush. I asked the lady when they opened and she replied that it was today! (Sunday, May 4th). I congratulated her and the cook behind the counter.For $11 I got a great serving of the best baba ghanoush I've had in Chicago with a nice warm toasty pita bread, a very nice size chicken shawarma sandwich, and a can of coke. The baba ghanoush can easily be shared with another person but I was really hungry so I was able to easily take down the whole meal. The sandwich was packed with fresh ingredients. I noticed some ingredients that I was not used to seeing in a shawarma sandwich like pickles and red cabbage but it made for a really tasty experience and everything had a nice crunch which for me made a big difference. I still had some baba ghanoush that I was able to stuff into my sandwich, and I can't emphasize how delicious the whole meal really was. The chicken was also very tasty and had a delicious flavor profile. I will definitely be going back to say the least. I hope the people of Wrigleyville welcome this family owned restaurant with open arms.P.S.To the owners:Please make sure you start delivery a.s.a.p. This neighborhood thrives on it and you will see your business grow tremendously!!! List your business on Grubhub's website because it will really help with getting the word out. You deserve to be noticed. The food will speak for itself!

This place is AMAZING! It is certainly worthy to be beside the delight that is Dimo's.Beef schwarma was delicious, the cucumber salad was crisp and fresh, the hummus was fluffy and perfectly seasoned, and the prices are completely fair. I can't wait to try more of their menu and I couldn't be happier that this new place is less than a block away.

Decent, nothing great. I got the chicken schwarma on a pita. They suggested getting everything in the wrap so I obliged. BF got the beef schwarma plate that comes with 2 sides. He got hummus and the Jerusalem salad. I was underwhelmed by the Jerusalem salad, but the beef shwarma was pretty tasty. Everything else was underwhelming. It also took a really long time (15+ min) for our food to come out and there were only 3 other people in the restaurant.
The food here is amazing. The chicken shawarma is my favorite. Staff are super friendly as well!

My fiance and I come here almost every Friday for takeout and we love it! We both get the chicken shawarma plate and 4 different sides to share. Sometimes the quality will dip and the portions won't be as big or the chicken won't be as good but usually it's pretty great. The service is really quick too. There's a liquor store around the corner so we'll put in our order, grab some wine and by the time we get back, it's ready to be taken home and devoured haha I love the soup and hummus and ask for extra garlic sauce too. :)
Day one: new Falafel benchmark in the neighborhood.Day Two: Epic Chicken Shawarma, looks like I am going to be regular.
The overall flavors are pretty good especially falafel and chicken shawarmaI like Tabouleh salad also
Best falafels in Chicago! The Zam Zam salad is always fresh and delicious, too! Love this place! (Sidenote - big portions)!

I visited this place on a whim last week and was pleasantly surprised by the quality and size of the portions you receive. Price point is very reasonable. This place is a hidden gem around and area of mediocre food. Stay golden Ponyboy.
Hummus was fantastic! Mike was really helpful and friendly. So glad to know they are in the area!Check this place out

Finally had the pleasure of trying this place and meeting one of the owners, Mike, after several months of living just around the corner.Had the falafel, it was enormous, delicious, and extremely well priced. Also had the Tabbouleh salad. It was both very good and a very generous portion size compared to other similar restaurants at which I have eaten.The owner, Mike, was extremely courteous. He actually prepared the falafel himself, handed it to me, reached over the counter and shook my hand to thank me for coming before I left. A gesture that I always appreciate as a restaurant patron.Moral of the story: Quality food, quality people, I will be back. Thanks Mike!

I absolutely LOVE Zam Zam. Very inexpensive quality Middle Eastern food. I highly recommend the chicken shawarma, hummus, and baba ghanoush. Those are my go-tos, but I imagine everything else is amazing, too. Also, the owner and employees are extremely friendly and generous. 11/10, would recommend to anyone looking for a quick bite to eat at any time of the day.
I go here at least weekly and am always 100% happy with my meal. Friendly staff and affordable food make the experience that much better. Chicken schwarma plate or pocket are my go to.

I live right around the corner from this place, and it has been a very welcome addition to the neighborhood. I'm a fan of falafel and shawarma and Middle Eastern cuisine in general, so I was pretty excited when I saw they were moving in.I've been in the place four or five times now, all for a quick lunch or dinner, and I've been satisfied with each visit. The falafel comes at a good price, and the shawarma is well seasoned and quite yummy. The food always feels fresh, the pitas are warm, and I always get filled up. They have 'the sandstorm' on the menu, and I recommend trying it at least once. Especially as a late-night food, I can imagine it's amazing. Otherwise, go to town and enjoy a good meal, whether it's normal hours or post-bar food.

Great food, great service, great prices. Best place for a quick bite of Middle Eastern food. I found out about this place on yelp last year. Now I stop by here, whenever I am around Wrigley field. Also, the owner is very friendly. Now they have their app to order the food. I cant wait to try it.
Great Food, Great Coffee would recommendCame here from florida and it did not disappoint.Try it out before a Cubs game. Go Cubs

Let me just start with the fact that I enjoyed the decor and the veggie panini with a side of fruit. I ordered a dirty chai that was very smooth and tasty the first few sips but then I realized it was a little too sweet for me. For the record, I have a sensitive sweet tooth, so that's really up to the individual to decide! I stayed to get some work done and was having a pleasant experience, wondering why the Yelp reviews fluctuated so heavily. There was only one person in there other than me and it stayed that way for the hour or so that I hung around (it was early afternoon), though I did notice one of the employees step outside to look down the street and greet people - not sure if this was friendly "getting some air" habit or he was looking for customers. Not the first time I've seen this happen 'cause I passed by the cafe earlier this week, too! Hurting for customers? That's too bad...I liked the music though: it ranged from throwbacks to classics, Etta James to Red Hot Chili Peppers. Free wifi code for the individual and power strips everywhere!The reason I give it 4 not 5 stars has nothing to do with the cafe or food itself or the staff per say, but...After a little bit of being there, I could hear the staff arguing in the kitchen! Not sure what it was about, probably scheduling or something, but I could very clearly feel condescending tones, defensive tones and disagreement involving power differentials. A liiiiiittle off-putting for the atmosphere, enough that I lost concentration on my studies and decided to chug my drink and go. Maybe that wouldn't have been the case if there were more customers while I was there, and through idle chatter I wouldn't have heard the kitchen arguments, but that wasn't the case for my first visit.All this to say that it's a great place to plug in for wifi, catch some Pokemon (wild Haunter this afternoon), study, read, draw or whatever with some coffee and a warm sandwich if you can swing by Clark Street! I'm gonna give it another chance, I'm sure it's different with other employees and customers around, but I did come at a weird time in the day and probably an off time for the employees.

After an early morning Dr's appointment I was on the hunt for a yum-worthy breakfast sandwich. Reviews led me here to Aje Cafe.That morning was a cold one, the smells and sounds of coffee creation welcomed me into the warmed space. Sounds of coffees dripping, steam expelling and heating machinery whirring. The interior is exposed brick filled with art and kitchen deco stuffs. (Can't stress the importance of filling empty walls with stuff. So that sound isn't bouncing around, it gives an ease to making short calls. Walls busied with stuff that customers may like to buy, stuff that can spark the mind to purchase different cafe goods or stuff that helps a seated customer spark in inspiration to the next sentence of text they're needing for that morning email.) The cafe offers plenty of seating and suggests refrain from using larger tables unless having a big group.A few were sippin' drinks whilst punching away on keyboards. Expecting a possible rush inside, I scanned the menu ahead of time which is available online. I entered with an idea of what to chomp. Chipotle chicken scrambler sandwich composed of tomato and red onion scrambled into egg w/ chipotle chicken and picante cheese.. it was damn good. Served piping hot, wrapped in a thin sheet wrap of aluminum. I almost couldn't hold it, but did because I wanted to enjoy it without wait. Paired this with a cafe au lait, which I butchered in pronunciation...  I think I paid just under ten dollars with tax.I'd definitely do the sandwich again, coffee was good but I should probably try something craft in the future.

As someone who uses Yelp daily and even has a family member who works for the company, I've somehow pushed off writing my own reviews until now. Other Yelpers have helped me find the best places and avoid the mediocre, and it's time to pay it forward and advise others about my experience this morning.I moved to Chicago two days ago, excited for all of the hustle and bustle near my apartment. This morning I decided to stop at Aje for food before headed to an appointment down the street. I asked for my order to go as I needed to be there in 15 minutes. While I was waiting for my food I received an email saying the meeting was delayed thirty minutes, in which case I decided to sit and enjoy my food before heading over. As I sat an had a bite or two (barely started) the lady at the counter came over and said "I thought you weren't staying" and asked if I wanted a plate. When I replied that I had changed my mind, she rolled her eyes again in which case I asked if it was okay that I stayed (something that shouldn't have to be done, seeing as I just gave them my service and the establishment was 80% empty). She didn't respond and JUST WALKED AWAY. I went to the counter and asked her, again, if it was okay that I stayed, in which she and the other worker replied that they are "frustrated about how much they spend on takeout containers" which I had received my food in.They made me feel extremely uncomfortable and unwelcome. Remember, I'm new to Chicago- know nobody and anything- and this is my first experience with their service or any in that area. I decided that I would leave mostly for feeling awkward and not because they clearly wanted me to.Perhaps you wouldn't be stressed over the price of your to-go containers if you treated costumers better and kept them as patrons.

Nice little place to grab a breakfast sandwich. Fresh ingredients and interesting flavor combinations. So many establishments crank their music, it was refreshing to sit at Aje Cafe and enjoy breakfast in a more quiet environment. Great service. Portions are generous and the price is right.

This tiny hole in the wall place is a perfect spot to just sit down and enjoy small crafted bites!Just off the beaten path of Belmont, this location offers free wifi and peaceful interior to get whatever work done.Did I mention they have great music selection playing too? What could sweeten the deal - Check in on YELP and get 15% off an order of $10 or more!!

I was visiting Chicago with a group of 7 and we came here for brunch. There was plenty of seating for all of us, a wide selection of food and drinks, and service was great. The food and coffee were fantastic and affordable. If I lived in Chicago, I'd be a regular at this cafe!

Just wanted to update my rating because it's been a few years. I've been coming to Aje since 2013 and the food is consistently fresh and delicious. The owners are really nice and they pay particular attention to the quality of the products they serve their customers. To give you an idea, one time I came in and one of the owners was talking to his beverage rep complaining that the product they were delivering was three months old. I've never looked at the "born on date" on a bottle of soda, and I'm sure most shop owners don't, but knowing that Aje's owners are paying attention to these minor details makes me feel good about the products they serve.

GREAT lunch or coffee spot! Sandwiches were fantastic and my fiancé and I were just saying that it's too bad we don't live closer or we'd be going all the time! We will definitely return regardless! It was a nice, quiet little spot to relax and enjoy your lunch. Prices were good as well.

This was a nice place to sit on a rainy day. They were very friendly and welcoming. Got the western breakfast sandwich and it was made perfectly- cheap too, especially for Chicago. I would be a regular here if I lived in the neighborhood!

I absolutely love Aje Cafe. I've been coming here since I moved to Chicago a year ago and I've always ordered the same thing- The California Club with a side of ranch. To me, it is absolute perfection. The double-decked thinly sliced turkey with avocado and everything else in between dipped in ranch and that pasta salad, oh my gahhhh! It is literally my favorite thing to eat in all of Chicago. Not a day goes by that I don't crave this sandwich. I could eat it every single day because it is THAT good and it makes me so happy.I also love that the owners always know what I'm going to order and always remembers the side of ranch. That also makes me very happy.So yes, this place is amazing.
Great lunch spot! Sandwiches are fresh and service is friendly and quick. Def recommend the turkey pesto panini sandwich.

This spot was a surprisingly good one! I just picked up a quick breakfast sandwich, but was really pleased. The prices are fair, and they have some really good options for many tastes. I would suggest any of their grilled breakfast sandwiches and the potato pancake!

Came here cause of the reviews, it's more about the food than the experience/atmosphere. It's really laid back where you can probably come here for a quick date or meet up. I believe they use Boar's Head for most of their food, which is great because it's one of the best deli brands. They also use intelligentsia which I guess is good.$4 for a breakfast sandwich is pretty good. I got the Bacon Cheddar or something, which comes with a tomato and some onions on it and it was a great breakfast sandwich. I wasn't amazed by the place, but I may come back just to chill.Place is sort of small which kills the ambiance though. I don't think I'd come here for brunch with many people... maybe just a place to stop by.I'll need to come back for lunch.

I'm shocked at all the good reviews on here. My experience was on par with the 1 and 2 star ones. Are they gaming yelp somehow?Everything about this place was uninviting. The staff is incredibly rude and out of touch with basic manners. They make you feel like they really really don't want your business.I walked in, big smile on my face, and ordered a breakfast sandwich. The lady looked at me like she really did not want to sell me one and then said something about how it wasn't available. I got a pastry instead. I asked to use the bathroom and they wouldn't let me. The whole experience was very uncomfortable.
good paninis at reasonable price... quiet place for studying or working on laptops...

Perfect go-to spot for a breakfast or lunch sandwich and some coffee. Owners are always friendly and accommodating, the food is great. Perfect weekend spot, not what you're looking for if you're trying to grab something quick on the way to work since you'll have to wait a bit.

As a yelper I have the duty to share what I find great in the community and as much as I don't want to spread the word of this delightful cafe because I want to keep it just the way it is, it would be negligent on my part if I chose not to post about something so wonderful. I think I may have just found my perfect cafe!+ quiet with some light music playing softly in the background+ not ridiculously crowded in the mornings/afternoons+ lots of options for breakfast/lunch with sandwiches/wraps/salads, etc that are well priced+ my turkey pesto panini + the side of fruit salad was fantastic. I detected plum, berries, apple, and pear (the best soft Asian pears too). Only wish there was more of it!+ staff is super nice. I definitely did not observe any actions that other folks were describing below and I stayed a good 6 hours. Granted, I left a few hours prior to closing time.Any negatives? Can't think of any.Thank you for letting me spend my Sunday here Aje Cafe. With that said, I'm holding onto the slightest sliver of hope that it does not become too overly crowded anytime soon.
Veggie scramble sandwich.  Yummy!  Love the breakfast at Aje and the coffee.  Can't go wrong here. The potato hash brown is a winner.

I've lived near this cafe for 9 months and never had an urge to try it out. I was looking for a quick and simple breakfast on a Saturday morning and decided to give this place a try. The breakfast sandwiches are good but there's no WOW factor - the smoked bacon, egg & cheddar sandwich is basically just those 3 ingredients with some tomato and red onion slices on an Engilsh muffin. This seems like a great place to study and get work done. If you check in here on Yelp, you get 15% off your order!

I love the food here! The sandwiches are amazing and it is the only place that had gluten-bread that doesn't taste awful! The owners are sweet and always willing to chat. Good place to hang out and do your homework, not too loud :)

This is my favorite sandwich shop in Chicago. Joseph and Anna are fantastic, and make the freshest, tastiest soups and sandwiches (breakfast and lunch) in the city. The atmosphere is perfect to get some work done as well - the wifi connection is flawless (honestly is a deal breaker for me and I'm sure most who work from their laptops all day). It is a true gem in the Lakeview area - be sure to stop in! On top of all of that, it is the definition of wonderful small business - the support for these operations is as important as anything!
Best wet cappuccino i have had in the cityTry the western omelette sandwich .  Owner is the chief keeps the quality exceptional.

Needed to pass some time before work meeting so 3 coworkers and I decided to check out Aje Cafe. Been looking forward to checking out Cafe in the city since my Europe trip couple months back.Atmosphere was how it should be for small Cafe shop, trendy but with vintage style, free wifi, and good tea/coffee options.I ordered the Pesto Turkey panini (switch to Salsalito Turkey) with Sriracha mayo along with home made pasta on the side.  Combination of flavor and crispness of panini made it a perfect meal. Adding the Peanut-butter and chocolate chip cookie also helped.  hahaIf you are driving i don't think you'll have an issue find a street parking.
Good coffee, delicious smoothies, and the staff is super nice. This place is sort of a hidden gem. You don't know its there until you're right in front of it. Go in!

Cute quaint cafe serves delicious fresh made sandwiches & coffee/tea & more... Own by a very friendly couple, I've been going now for couple years & addicted to the pasta salad (homemade) ... Their tuna sandwich is delicious, along with the capresse... They offer a huge variety of fresh sandwiches hot or cold... Free wifi quiet place, support the neighborhood & its small business owners!!!!

I stopped in here on a warm winter day recently to grab an Iced Coffee and it really hit the spot.  The staff was super friendly and they seemed to have quite the crowd of people eating and reading.  We waited about 10 minutes for our iced drinks but I didn't mind waiting considering I was watching the 2 employees literally making everything to order.  The sandwiches look great just don't come famished and expect a pre-made sandwich right away- even though it looks like a quick cafe, it seems like they take the quality of their food seriously and while they seemed to be working quickly, you can only work so fast.  I will definitely be back to try their food!

Wish I knew about this place sooner. My co-worker brought this in for lunch one day and it looked amazing so the next day I picked up their veggie wrap. I'm officially hooked. So far I have had the veggie wrap and a veggie melt. They do personal requests (I asked for extra spinach) which I really appreciated. I feel like it's hard to find a solid veggie wrap/sandwich that actually tastes good in Chicago and this place nailed it. I didn't really talk to the girl who took my order but she was nice and polite. I will most definitely be  back.
Great place to hang out and get work done. Good coffee and really good food. All of their breakfast sandwiches are fantastic.

This is my new favorite place.  The sandwiches are great, especially the Chicken Saltimbocca.  The owners are two of the hardest working people I see on a regular basis.The place is for sandwiches, but it has a cool coffee shop vibe.

I'm on the great customer service of this little debate; i've been here a few times and I've been always treated with the utmost respect. I am in sales and I do cater a lot of lunches, and I am one of those people that orders 10 sandwiches 35 minutes before I need them. Needless to say, the sandwiches are always ready and 100% correct. Some of my clients can be a little picky; for example, no tomatoes extra mustard lightly toasted bread and extra crispy bacon.  To top it off, they always serve me with a smile.now, onto the important part... The food. It's fantastic; everything is always Uber fresh, Uber cheap, and uber tasty.  I got the club, ham, turkey, tuna, breakfast, multiple soups and create your own sandwiches. None of them have ever fallen short of sheer perfection.i've also had the fruit and the pasta salad, and both Fall into that uber tasty category also.It's small and cozy, and I'll absolutely be back.  Keep up the great work guys!

Aje Cafe is really close to where I live, but I hadn't been there until last weekend. I was looking for a new place to get a bite to eat and also stay for a few hours to get some work done.I tried out the prosciutto cheddar panino on their menu, which came with a choice of sides - can't remember what the others were, but I got the fruit salad. The sandwich was AWESOME. Hot, melty, and all the ingredients were fresh. Also a great combination of textures and flavors. Get this. It's really good. The fruit salad was also great - plums and pears in a fruit salad?! Say goodbye to your boring, run-of-the-mill strawberry-and-apple fruit salads.I got an iced chai latte later on too - wasn't a huge fan of this. It tasted okay, but I've had better at other cafés.The elusive fifth star is because service is pretty standoffish - nobody was rude, but nobody was particularly pleasant either. The two people behind the counter did not seem to want to be there in the slightest. I generally don't care too much about service (i.e. I don't need a lot of waiting on), but a smile/general human pleasantries go a long way.Wifi worked well and the atmosphere was nice and quiet for getting some work done. Plenty of table space. I'd probably come back.

Maybe the food is good but I'll never know because it takes 2 days to make a sandwich. The guy making it couldn't be more rude to his employee and therefore she's not that friendly to customers. Too bad, I was looking forward to it based on all the reviews.

GREAT SANDWICHES!!  I've tried many different sandwiches and they never disappoint. Each one is handmade fresh--I've seen the chef cut up the avocado and mash/whip it into the spread that goes on the California Club.  I take family and friends there and they are always impressed. But, I get slightly anxious every time I walk over because I'm worried there will be someone else making the sandwiches. Fantastic neighborhood place. It looks like they do a good carry-out business too.

wow my San Diego Scrambler was slamin! It had tomato, red onion, perfectly scrambled eggs, feta cheese, and a little bit of balsamic vin. Again just WOW! I would give this place five stars but the service is spotty and inconsistent.

Everything seems to have eggs in it. The sandwich was good, but it did take awhile to get it. The cafe itself was very cozy and hipster. I wouldn't come here specifically for food, but it's nice to drop by if you happen to be hungry and want to good coffee/tea. The staff is friendly and prices are pretty good, but this does not stand out to me that much. Drop by if you are in the area and need to refuel.

Great little coffee shop that also has very affordable sandwiches.This cafe is in a great location right on Clark. Some of the tables are specifically reserved for groups of 3 or more, which is very nice for students or friends groups. You have to buy something to get the Wifi password for the day (I think they change it often). The sandwiches can take a few minutes, but well worth the wait. Each sandwich does come with a very yummy side. I've tried both the fruit salad and the homemade pasta. Despite the extremely delicious sandwiches and quaint atmosphere, the staff is pretty rude and standoffish. For this reason, I decided to give this cafe four stars. Even with the staff, I'll go back here, but I'll never tip them because of their 'tudes.
Very run of the mill...nothing special here.  Decent size menu for a small coffee shop but really average breakfast sandwiches and very average coffee (a little over priced for what it is)

This cafe is the best! I go there at least once a week and I'm always impressed. Their sandwiches are fresh and beautifully made. They have a fantastic tea selection and never fail to make quality coffee. Highly recommend!
I can't believe I waited so long before trying this place! Delicious breakfast sandwiches and coffee at this cozy little spot. Everything is fresh and great here.
Perfect toast on the bread, perfect ratio of stuff inside, perfect cut on the vegg... some kind of home made yummy sauce... AS GOOD AS A VEGGIE SANDWICH GETS... espresso sooo yummy too..   xoxoxo

I was expecting more based on the reviews. I've passed this place many times walking by on Clark and I went in last week for breakfast. It was empty, although it was about 9:30 on a Friday morning.I ordered the San Diego breakfast sandwich and a cup of tea which was served in a large yellow mug that would have made the Mad Hatter and March Hare proud. My sandwich was ok- I wouldn't order it again. The tea was fine.I ate there and sat at the small couch by the windows. They do have wifi but I'm not sure how long I would hang out here because I didn't think there were too many comfortable chairs. I ordered a sandwich to go to have later for lunch. I liked this sandwich a lot, which is good because I chose the make-your-own option. These sandwiches come with a side as well which I think is pretty good value. I chose the pasta salad which was quite good.One petty thing that irked me is the sign taped to the register that said something like: remember to bring cash next time. I get it. It's a small business and they don't want to pay fees to the Visa, etc if they don't have to... but that's what many people choose to do these days. I think it would come across less condescending if it said something like: as a small local business, cash payments are greatly appreciated. Or something like that.I would go back again to choose my own sandwich. Other than that... probably not.

i have been coming to Aje at least once a month for the past 8 or 9 months. they have a great menu. i have not had one bad experience in regards to food or customer service. they have awesome sandwiches (GREAT panninis), soups, and drinks. restaurant is always clean and quiet, great place to hang out and read. keep it up Aje!

Love this spot! Sandwiches are terrific here (and are well-priced). I highly recommend the tuna melt, which is made with a special tuna salad that has walnuts and other delicious additions. Low-key spot that feels cozy.

People are insane. Two years after my first review with a few visits in-between and Aje Cafe is still 5 stars. I've come to know these owners & there's no way they treated anyone with the level of disrespect they're being accused of without being provoked. Every time I walk in here I'm usually looking like a mess, hungover and they still enthusiastically greet me and provide perfect service. See my last post: you act like a punk, you're going to be treated like a punk. Good for them for not taking bull.Also, tried out the bacon cheddar bfast sandwich and of course it was amazing-- just the right amount of ingredients and all of the highest quality. It's also not swimming in butter/grease so you don't feel THAT guilty about the bacon. Joseph (owner) is killing it on the grill. I never had to wait more than 5 mins for anything, and who cares anyway when you're getting quality food? I'm actually blown away that only Joseph and his wife run this place. They're an awesome team.
I have been waiting 30+ minutes for a panini. Don't come here if you are even a little hungry, because who knows when you will even get your food.

I've been going to Aje for a bout 3 yrs now. I have since moved from the neighborhood and I still frequent this place !! It's honestly such a hidden gem. Their food is always great , fresh and well prepared. Best freakin' pasta salad ever ! Coffee selection is huge and always delicious. I'd recommend an iced chai or a raspberry white chocolate mocha. They never disappoint. Staff is so nice and welcoming every time I visit. I bring all my out of town visitors & they're always impressed. Needless to say I love Aje and the people who run it. Would give it more than 5 stars if I could.

I've had their awesome turkey, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich a few times. Always fresh and delicious with high quality products. Their prices are so low it makes me worried about them! Definitely check this place out if you're in the area.

The quality of their coffee is pretty amazing. The service and the kindness of the staff also amazing. If you need a local coffee shop to work on some projects I highly recommend stopping in for a coffee and a sandwich .
Great customer service, delicious food, quiet and peaceful. A lovely experience. I'll be back again!

At 5:50pm on Saturday, March 14, 2015, the guy working in Aje Cafe told my girlfriend that they were closing and she had to leave. She had 4 large bags with her, which I had left with her so I could run a quick errand up the block, so she asked if she could stay and hang out for another 5 minutes while he closed up while her boyfriend came back to help her with her bags.The man working said, quote, "I'm F***ING TIRED of this S***, get out right now," quite aggressively, then said something about "working a hundred hours a week." When I returned to the cafe, she was sitting on the doorstep of the shop next door, on the verge of tears.My girlfriend is a kind, quiet, introverted girl who likes to read and spend her time in libraries (she had been reading Nabokov in Aje Cafe) - think Belle from Beauty in the Beast, if she had to be a Disney princess - so I know she would not have asked for 5 minutes rudely or aggressively. And worse, the man inside was still behind the counter cleaning when I arrived, so she would not have prevented him from leaving the cafe by staying.I've been to Aje Cafe many times, and the staff has always generally unpleasant and unhappy, but the food was always alright, so whatever, no big deal. But this was unacceptable.There's a Peet's Coffee & Tea literally a block north on Clark Street, and everyone there is always VERY friendly and the atmosphere is just as cozy (and always cleaner) than at Aje Cafe. If you go just a few blocks further north to Belmont, then you'll find Kickstand Espresso Bar, which serves superior coffee and has a much friendlier vibe. Go to either of these places.There is no reason to support Aje Cafe and its ungrateful, unfriendly staff. Go elsewhere.

I would have given them 4 or 5 stars because I love the food and coffee but alas, I was a bit peeved to find that they closed their doors today before their stated closing time.  It's really not good business practice.  Otherwise, the food is great and service has been pleasant.  Will go again but will be wary of going there 30 minutes before closing time going forward.
Great sandwiches, baked goods and service. Quick and convenient. My favorite place to study.
Awesome breakfast sandwiches! Try the Italian one with prosciutto! Nice Americano too.

Okay so in my prior review I said the tuna melt was "alright". I don't know if I just came on an off day, but literally this is the best tuna melt I've ever had. Period. The teas are still awesome and the two owners(?) that are here all the time are really nice and very friendly. The fruit salad is also still amazingly fresh. I think I'm still a little bummed that the portion is small for the fruit, but that's only because it's so good that I want more! I love coming to this place for a sandwich and a study session. I'd definitely recommend checking this place out!

GF got a macchiato and the California Turkey Sandwich, and I got a Dirty Chai Latte and the Mozzarella and Tomato (Caprese) Panini.The drinks were both great.My Panini was simple, fresh, and delicious, the way the Caprese is meant to be. Solid A.The California Turkey was OUTSTANDING. Crisp. Everything was fresh, and freshly cut. GF and I both thought it was an A+ and would go out of our way to get another.And the staff was prompt, and delightful! Would definitely recommend and plan to return next time I'm in the city.

So to preface, this happened in the fall so things may have changed since.I was going to study with a friend who ordered a breakfast and coffee but I didn't order. My friend who ordered then asked for the password and she said she will give it to him with his food. A gentleman walked over with food and said he can give the WiFi password to my friend (who ordered) this one time but he can't have me inside without ordering anything. My friend explained im going to study with him. The gentleman was kind but firm in his decision and requested I not be present if I not order.2 stars bc to his defense I didn't order right away and im sure people abuse the policy, but assuming if I didn't order something asap that we weren't going to share the food or that I would not order later on made for an unfortunate experience. Even if I ordered nothing and my friend did, requesting I leave made my friend embarrassed and not want to return, especially with others. I still may try it alone one day but have held off due to the experience.

Joe the owner is just great.  I frequent this place for lunch.  "Balanced" is how I would describe the meals.  Tomatoes are cut with care to the right thickness.  Not to over power or hinder the favors of the other ingredients.  Never too much mayo.  Cheeses are also perfectly balanced.The sandwiches are a good size.  Don't expect the giant New York Deli sandwich. Besides all you can taste there is MEAT.  Tons of it...BEST CAFE IN THE HOOD!!!!

I hate to rate this place only 3 stars.. But here's why. First let me tell you the good. I ordered the bacon and Vermont cheddar breakfast sandwich and my boyfriend ordered the ham and cheese Panini and both were delicious. But I was expecting a little bit more on my plate for the price that I paid. The panini was on the smaller side and the side of pasta was the portion of an ice cream scoop. I guess if you're about portion control this is a good place. But I'd rather get a bigger bang for my buck
I always come here when I am in the neighborhood, great sandwiches, great coffee, good people, if only I could take them the Hawaii with me when I move!
Got the  San Diego and it was easily one of the best Breakfast sandwiches I've had.You'd better believe I'll be coming back here!

Very nice place to relax in the neighborhood of Lakeview. A " Friends" atmosphere......MINUS the sitting around and not ordering anything. Order Something! Support the small business owners or this one will kindly remind you. Yes he will.

Meh.  Tuna melt/panini was good (with walnuts!) and the background music was good (old time Frank Sinatra stuff) but honestly, but the pasta salad was a meager scoop and I felt a bit pushed around by the guy behind the counter.  He kept coming over to move the tables around because they had been rearranged, wouldn't let a friend add a chair (or little table) to our table to make more space, even though there was no one else in the place, and shut off the internet about 15 minutes to close without an announcement to those of us still in the cafe.  I was in the middle of something, as, I gather from their exclamations, were the people at the table near me.  When I inquired about it, I was told that the modem is programmed that way so "everyone can be out on time." I appreciate that the workers would like to leave in a timely fashion but if they're not ushering people in before they open (so that everyone could be IN on time), why push people out before closing?  The hours posted are for the customers, not the employee shift times.  Just saying.  And there are plenty of other cafes in the city to try so either way, a 2-star experience.

4/5 for food2/5 customer serviceThe food was great. I ordered a prosciutto caprese panini and the classic smoothie. Both were good; the ingredients seemed fresh, and the food seemed reasonably priced.The customer service needs improvement. When I walked in, no one greeted me. I looked at the menu, decided what I wanted, and walked up to the cashier. After about a minute of silence, I smiled and she asked me "what do you want?" in an unfriendly tone. Later, when I asked for a cup for water, she rudely replied "give me one second." On one hand, I noticed they were busy and only had two workers: a middle aged man working in back, preparing most of the food and a middle aged woman at the cashier. I've worked at restaurants too, so I can understand having a bad day, but this is no excuse for poor customer service. They should still take the time to greet their customers. For example, if you're too busy to take a customer's order right away, all that's needed is a smile, eye contact, and a quick "Hi! We'll be right with you" or  "we're really busy right now, but we'll be with you in __ minutes." I understand no one is perfect, but that's the customer service model that any business should strive for.Note, today was my first experience at Aje.I might give the place a second chance and come back for the food, but it wouldn't be my first choice after this first impression.

Meh. I'm not sure why all the stars for this place. Maybe I just hit it at a bad time, at a around 4:15 or 4:30 on a Saturday. The man and the woman at the counter were not particularly friendly at all. And by 5 pm, they were already pulling in the sidewalk signs. (I even asked if they closed at five rather than six; since they seemed like they were closing up shop). They certainly weren't too excited about the remaining customers; they seemed to just want to get the hell out of there. At Starbucks, I expect people to think it's a j-o-b, but not at a locally-owned coffee shop.One thing that's starting to perturb me more and more is places that have minimums for credit cards. Sure it cuts into your margin, the most it could be is 20 cents on a $4.00 drink. I get it. That's a lot of margin lost. But it's 2014, people. Cash is going by the way of the dinosaurs. Charge $4.25 instead and keep your expenses to yourself. Or accept payment by phone. Otherwise, put a sign on the bathroom saying how many sales per square foot you're losing, charge extra for the refrigeration for any juice or iced drink, put a price tag on each piece of furniture in the place... All of these are business costs. Shouldn't I get a discount on the ATM fee if I pay cash? Then there's the sign that says you can only get a wi-fi password if you buy a medium or larger drink. I get it, and I usually tip well in coffee shops. I know that the owners aren't Wall Street bankers. But it really cheapens the experience. Question: Did you do the math before you opened this place to make sure your were in the right business?I will say that the mocha was delicious. I liked the mix of comfy chairs and a couch, as well as traditional tables. Good music at a reasonable volume.I'll always support local coffee shops. But I expect them to be more-friendly than a Starbucks, and I'm always surprised when they're not.

Big thanks to Johnny T for writing such a great review that it inspired me to stop by for a quick lunch & work session. I was driving through the area when I realized I was starving, and a cafe with wi-fi seemed like the perfect choice. This place can be hard to find because it's tiny (and pretty hidden amongst the surrounding businesses) but I scored a meter right out front and made my way inside! I knew right away it had everything I needed: outlets, comfortable chairs, a quiet atmosphere, and a nice-sized menu.The thing about this place (at least during the day) is that it's not just quiet... it's VERY quiet. It's got a hardcore work atmosphere going, and while that suited me just fine, I can see how it might be too quiet for those trying to have a conversation. I bet at night or more towards lunchtime it gets a little more lively. No complaints here, just a heads up. I gladly sat there working to soft Christmas music while drinking a white hot chocolate!Ohh, yes. My white hot chocolate. WHC. Love of my life. Whatever you want to call it. It was made so perfectly with a gorgeous little design on top, and it tasted like every fantastic vanilla ice cream I've ever had steamed into one cup. I also ordered the grilled chicken wrap, which had a ton of fresh vegetables that were cut up right before my eyes. It was a healthy meal that left me feeling great and relaxed.The best part about this place is the owner and his employees. These people are just flat out nice. They brought everything out to me, asked how everything was, and someone even asked me if I wanted a glass of water. So refreshing to see people going above and beyond and enjoying what they're doing!I grabbed a blueberry muffin to go and I can't wait to have it later. Stop by this place to work on your laptop, grab lunch or dinner, or to experience a life-changing white hot chocolate. You won't be mad you did!

The coffee is unreal!  And the sandwiches...don't even get me started.  Everything here is made with the best ingredients and love.  One of my fav spots for sure!  He makes the best California Club hands down!!

Everything here is really nice. For a busy neighborhood filled with young people, we were expecting a hectic atmosphere., especially on one of the first warm days during a Cubs game and Blackhawks game We were presently surprised when we came there to find a comfortable, peaceful, and welcoming environment. The sandwiches and coffee are really good. You get a good sized portion for a reasonable price. The food was very fresh. The service is very good too. I am planning on coming back soon. I recommend everyone give this place a visit.

Cute quaint coffee shop. I came here to work on some reports during my visit in chicago (they have free wifi if you buy something). I got the jasmine tea. The tea comes in a cute cup and a tea holder cup ( I think it's a super cute presentation). It's a good quiet work from home spot. The food looked good too- my friend got the avocado BLT- looked yummy! They have an extensive menu for food and drinks (mainly tea and coffee).
cute and quaint.friendly service and healthy eats.what more can you ask for?
Great customer service! Great sandwich! Will be back again. Get the BLT w/avocado on multigrain. You will not be disappointed. :)

This is a cute little coffee shop with pretty good food. You might overlook it if you're walking by because of the cheesy signs, but stop in and you'll be pleasantly surprised. The place is small but has a great vibe. My medium latte was not completely full but was very good. They have a lot of tea options and tons of sandwich/paninis too. It was a little cold but I guess you can't be upset with how cold it's been in chicago.FYI They like cash and don't take amex.

Delicious, fresh made breakfast sandwiches and piping hot coffee hit the spot before our day of sight seeing.   This place has a lot of what I wish for in a local coffee shop--plenty of plugs, a variety of coffee and non-coffee items, hot and cold beverage options, low level background music, and friendly staff.  If I lived here, this would definitely be one of my neighborhood spots!

This is my go to spot every time I'm in town !!!! Everything on the menu is fantastic !!! And the owners take really good care of their food and produce. Everything is fresh and bought that morning so you never have to worry about food that's been sitting in the cooler/freezer. I have a lot of respect for the owners and how hard they work to make sure their business thrives and making their costumers happy. Once you're here you'll never want to leave !!!

Well that was disappointing.  Went this morning for a breakfast sandwich and coffee, relying on our previous experience of good food.  We walked in, I ordered and was cautioned by the surly employee that it would take a bit longer than usual as they were busy.  That was the understatement of the year.  They serve sandwiches.  Nothing fancy.  No grilling, no sautéing, nothing involving any technique whatsoever.  That is not a slam, just a statement of fact regarding the level of preparation involved.  There were about 20 customers when we walked in.  A few had food, many did not, some were just doing coffee.  And it took 45 minutes to get two breakfast sandwiches.  45.  minutes.  What. In. The. Hell???  AND, I got the wrong sandwich.  The food was still good for what it was, but 45 MINUTES for breakfast sandwiches???  That is ridiculous.  And the cashier/server just is not pleasant.  Not one smile, just not pleasant.  I know you're busy, and that's hard work, but busy = money, so act like your glad you have customers instead of acting put out.  This one bad experience won't keep us away, but another one will.  Get it together.

I came here while waiting for my car to be un-booted. :/ Nice staff, cozy atmosphere, great coffee & DELICIOUS turkey, strawberry & balsamic sandwich. Yum!! I'd much rather be where I'm supposed to be, but I'm glad I came here while waiting & I'll be back again.

I've only been here once so I want to give them the benefit of a doubt. Based on first impression though, I don't understand why their rating is so high. The customer service my boyfriend and I received was a little below average. I would have given this place three stars for the drinks were at least decent, and that's just it... The place was A-OK. It certainly wasn't "top notch" as implied by their current 4.5-star rating. Perhaps it was an off-day?I ordered an oolong tea (Rishi brand). I had a hard time deciding which teas I wanted, and luckily there were no customers behind us so I took my time in deciding. My boyfriend, on the other hand, ordered coffee. We sat down and proceeded to do some work on our laptops. My tea came within 5 minutes, but my boyfriend's coffee never came. Around the 10 minute mark, my boyfriend was annoyed and he went up to inquire about his coffee. When he came back to the table, he informed me that the cashier gave him attitude. Strange. His coffee came to us 5 minutes later.Aje is a nice, quiet place to do work. The coffee shop despite offering free wifi wasn't bustling with customers. In fact, it was quite empty on a late weekend afternoon, which I found a bit strange on Clark Street, one of the most happening streets in Lakeview Chicago.... but I suppose it wasn't so strange given our customer service experience. I mean, really, who wants to wait 15 minutes for coffee? Imagine if they're this slow with drinks, how much slower would they be with the sandwiches? I don't think I'd want to know, but it's nice knowing that a quiet, relatively empty coffee shop is across the street whenever I want to work.

This place is absolutely great. Get the San Diego. I stop in almost every weekend because it is always active, but not too busy, the service is great and the food is even better. If it was closer I'd go every morning.
Great food and coffee!
Great service and sandwiches. I have tried the breakfast sandwich, turkey wraps, and a "make your own" sandwich today that was delicious!

This is a cute little coffee/panini spot right by my work! Their coconut mocha is definitely my favorite. The staff here is always nice and friendly. This place gives off a nice "homemade" kinda vibe.
Absolutely love this cozy little place! This cafe has THE BEST gluten free bread I've ever had.. and thats hard to find! employees were wonderful and i will be going there often from now on. :)

Plenty of space while still keeping that warm coziness. I'm always looking for great places to do homework and I wish I would've found this place sooner! Perfect for if you need somewhere to camp out and get a lot done.

First time here, and am presently surprised that it was so good.  My favorite Metropolis coffee.  Cozy, rustic atmosphere.  The staff are friendly, depending on the day.   Good location, but tucked away.  I have lived here for 5 years and never knew about it since there are no clear signs.  Now that I've been back several times, I will give it a 4 based upon time you have to wait.  Expect a good 7-10 minutes for a sandwich.

My friend and I took a weekend trip to Chicago recently, and Aje was our last stop before hitting the highway to come back home. It was kind of a last minute decision, but I'm glad we made it. Aje was really quaint and somewhere I know I would spend a TON of time if I lived nearby.It was very slow when we stopped in (around 11AM on Memorial Day) with just a few other patrons hanging out and enjoying their drinks. I ended up ordering a panini with prosciutto, basil. red onion, and pesto. It was delicious and served with a small side of homemade pasta salad. Definitely a good lunch; the portions weren't overwhelming and the prices were reasonable. I didn't get to try any of the coffee/espresso offerings, but other reviews seem to suggest that they know what they are doing. Definitely a cute little place that I wouldn't mind visiting again the next time I'm in Chicago.
I checked this place out because it was highly rated and it lived up to its expectation. Great breakfast sandwiches and great service!

This is my favorite sandwich place in the city. Everything I've ordered is delicious, but the paninis are probably the best. Even the sides are remarkable. Go for the pasta or potato salad.Good coffee and tea, but I come here for the food. Plus, the owner is really nice.

Its hard to find a cafe in this neighborhood that isn't overrun with students during the evenings/weekends. Good luck finding a place to sit in the near by Starbucks or Next Door. Due to that, when a friend and I were in the mood to catch up over a coffee we decided on Aje Cafe.The atmosphere was peaceful and the drinks were good. She enjoyed her coffee and I loved my Peppermint Tea.Next thing to try on the menu......the sandwiches.

I walked into this unassuming café with my son, and boy am I glad I did!  Very homey, and pleasant with great music.  The food: Amazing paninis, and sandwiches are fantastic as well.  The gentlemen and lady behind the counter could not be more accommodating!  They made my son's sandwich just as he liked it, and he was happy (he is picky). Nice little fruit salad on the side too.  I had a caramel macchiato (iced) and I HIGHLY recommend it.  You will not return to that other coffee place ever again.  My son had a strawberry smoothie and it was fresh, and delicious. Give it a chance, you will be glad you did.

Definetly a great place to both study and get a good brunch. The internet is solid and all the drinks and food reasonably priced. Not a place you can bring outside food into like intelligensia but if you come hungry you won't be disappointed. Not a ton of tables and they are a little strict about using the bigger tables if your not with a large group. Otherwise no complaints!

Had one of the breakfast chicken sandwiches here and it was just okay. Lady friend had a panini and asked the girl at the counter for no prosciutto in her order but they forgot. The place has a nice ambiance for sure, but am not sold on the food yet.

I really wanted to give this place five stars.I came here for dinner, excited about the menu.When I walked in, there were very few seats. A bunch of people were on their laptops (we later found out they were part of a novel writing group). They were all spread out, and took up way more space than they should have.We walked in at the same time as another person, who ended up leaving due to the lack of space. One of the employees at Aje was very rude to the customer, when she made a remark about there not being enough space for her group, he told her "whatever." I was a little shocked! I felt like they should have forced the group of people to consolidate and not take up the whole cafe. Most of them weren't even eating/drinking anything when we came in (but I guess they could have been earlier). We were lucky to snag the last table.The menu looks great, lots of options, reasonable prices. I ordered a pesto panini, and my Grandma ordered the Caribbean salad. I was very turned off by the fact that the guy (the same one who spouted "whatever") did not use gloves when preparing our food. The food tasted great though, all of the ingredients were fresh and yummy. I liked the fruit salad that came with my sandwich. The salad was large, and my Grandma liked it.Afterwards we split a delicious cookie! They also had a great selection of different teas and coffees.I'm not sure I would go out of my way to visit this place again, but I might give it another chance if I'm in the neighborhood.

Cute. Darling. Charming. Get the picture, yet? This is exactly the kind of place to stop in on a lazy afternoon or a blistery evening and get a quick soup/salad/sandwich of comfort, come home, pour some wine, sit on the couch, and pass out watching HGTV. Not that I have any experience doing any of the above.Keep an eye out for Aje. It's on a very busy stretch of Clark that's beset with boutiques, bookstores, realtors, lions, tigers, and bears. There's a lot going on and it's easy to overlook the cafe. While there are no dancing chickens or neon signs to lure you in, the food will definitely bring you back. While I wanted to go with the strawberry turkey sandwich (just for the novelty of eating a strawberry sandwich), I opted for the California Turkey. Served on your choice of bread (multigrain) and side (fruit salad; I had to have some strawberries), this bad boy comes with turkey, creamy avocado, tomato, cucumber, cheddar cheese, and light ranch dressing. I've had a lot of sandwiches in my day but this may have been one of my favorites. The flavor profiles weren't ground-breaking, but the portion allocation and flavor combinations really worked for me.My sandwich was made by the owner who engaged me in conversation, asked how I'd heard of his cafe, what I liked eating, and what i should order. He was very proud of what he had going on and extremely interested in gaining a new customer. Sadly, one doesn't have owner interactions like that all too often. It was a nice experience. While I waited on him to fresh-make my sandwich, I had time to look over the menu. From pastries to smoothies to paninis, Aje hits all the cafe buttons. Add to the strong menu, a comfortable space perfect for working on your laptop, having a meal with a friend or drinking a coffee and reading a book, and you have the makings of a perfect light meal destination in any season (which may be a given day in Chicago).P.S. He talked me into getting a cookie. It was big. It was chocolatey. It added to my truffle shuffle choreography. I regret nothing.

Went in with friends, 4 of them. 2 of them bought stuff, one of which used the bathroom, then I went in and used the bathroom. The other friend who made a purchase went to use the bathroom. Finally, the last friend went towards the bathroom and the owner or manager told him it wasn't a "f*cking public bathroom", he then continued his rant, eventually turning his attention towards me. Further escalating the situation, he called me a piece of sh*t just for using a toilet without a purchase, swearing and yelling at me and my party (in front of customers, no less). At this point I had not yet uttered a word. I Interrupted his unrelenting tirade with "hey f*ck you, we're leaving!", as I walked the last few feet out the door. He charged after me, out the door, onto the sidewalk and got in my face and asked if "I wanted to start something". Since I wasn't going to hit him, and his efforts to provoke me to do so were fruitless, he eventually went back in. I'm shocked at how little it took for someone to abandon all professionalism and threaten people in his store, not to mention the shock of anyone invading my personal space like that, ready to hit me. As guests we were not unruly or rude. What was that display of aggression for?  Unreal.

I am new to the area having just moved to Lakeview two weeks ago.  In search of a coffee shop to call home during the day, I came upon Aje Cafe.  Don't let the unassuming exterior steer you away.  It has phenomenal sandwiches prepared fresh by the owner in the back, great coffee and tea, and most importantly a jovial neighborhood atmosphere that is conducive to working, grabbing a bite, or relaxing with a friend.The Aje Cafe doesn't take itself too seriously, which is part of its appeal.  The owner can be overheard in the back belting out vocals in his best, throaty Louis Armstrong impression or chatting about his favorite kind of sweater for a 30 degree day.  Speaking of Louis Armstrong, the playlist is impeccable and eclectic, ranging from jazz standards to deep unknown cuts to covers of your favorites that you've never heard before to serene instrumental tracks.  And all of it has a peaceful vibe that is conducive to working.  Which brings me to my next point.My search for a good coffee shop brought me to Aje mostly because other coffee shops were uncomfortably noisy or had a general hustle bustle vibe that wouldn't allow me to do any sustained, focused work.  The Aje Cafe is quiet and cozy enough to get work done.And the food is tremendous.  Try the California Turkey sandwich or one of the Chicken Panini and you'll know what I'm talking about.Five stars!

Great neighborhood bar with great food and serviceThe burger selection was great and we can't wait to come back to try another specialty burger.Nice selection of on draft beer.Good sound (not too loud)

Not impressed.First off, I paid $47 for a burger and two beers! FORTY SEVEN U.S. DOLLARS. The burger was decent but most definitely not a $20 burger. Second, I rode my bike here to meet friends and realized when I arrived that I had forgotten my bike lock. I went in and politely asked if it was ok to bring my bike inside and stash it somewhere out of the way while we ate. The restaurant was about 1/3 full and there were at least 10 places where it would have been out of everyone's way. But they said no. It's ok to bring in gigantic baby strollers, but a bike? No way!So I will not be going back and I recommend you skip this place. You're not missing anything.

Delicious (period).My best burger ever - no, but a contender.Get the porkBelly- you won't be disappointed.Also, the sweet tater tots are RiDUNKulous. I could have eaten just those alone.Definitely recommended

I've had my share of burger places and pretty picky when it comes to burgers.. the burger bar did not disappoint.  The have a variety of burger options to meet the taste buds of just about everyone.I got the the "the game day" special which was a half pound burger, Italian beef, and spicy sausage with a side of sweet potato fries and chorizo Mac and cheese.  Let's start with the burger - i asked for medium and it was cooked well. Thankfully it still tasted well in combination with the other meats but could have been easily a 5 star burger if it wasn't over cooked. The fries were well cooked to my liking nice and crispy. The chorizo Mac and cheese were something else -wow! It was good but it was  filling. Could have gotten that by itself. But hey we're from out of town and needed to try.They have roughly 32 beers on tap which is awesome and tv screens all around for game days. We brought kids with us and hey enjoyed it as well. Definitely a return spot and hope to give them a 5 next time!

Got here on a Saturday for a late lunch. It wasn't too crowded and a table for two was seated right away. There's a bar in the middle, and can see this restaurant being great for game days. For a drink I ordered the seasonal milk shake; I don't remember the name, but it was something with apple and caramel. It was pretty good. Not as sweet as I was expecting. All of the burger selections sounded delicious, and mine definitely didn't disappoint. I don't remember the names of what I ordered, but will be coming back here again, and update as I go. For now I'll post a picture to leave you drooling.What I do remember is the prices are high when thinking about burgers, but they are worth it. Unlike that overrated Shake Shack that people seem to enjoy. This is probably the best burgers I've eaten in Chicago so far since I moved here.

The menu's boasted  both "Best burger in Chicago" & "Most over-the-top burger in Illinois ".  Of course, this made us give it a try!We were not disappointed!   I cannot vote as I haven't had any other burgers in Chicago or many others in Illinois, but I can believe the hype!  The "Over-the-top" seems very likely!My husband ordered the Gyro burger. Over-the-top it was!  He loved it.  Surprisingly,  he really liked his salad.  It was the house salad.  He ate every bite!I was more conservative and just ordered a burger with pepper jack cheese.  It It was really good; so good,  in fact, that I failed to put any condiments on it.  I ate it without realizing I had not added catsup or mustard!   Wow!This time....the hype is real!

This is a good burger joint.  I tried their gyro burger, which is very good, and the truffle fries.
