My daughter had a plain cheese burger which was also very good.  My wife's order got messed up, she wanted the guacamole burger, but they brought a bacon burger.  I think it was a mixup by the waitress.The hostess was missing when we arrived, and it took her a long time to show up.  I was a little surprised she didn't have some kind of backup on a Saturday night.  We were hungry, and the food service was quick. The food is good, the prices seemed in line for like restaurants, so I would recommend this place.

Great service on a Friday afternoon. Started with the house made fried pickles  - recommended.  Tried the mac and cheese with Pork, also good. My partner loved his food, and isn't typically vocal about meals, but wouldn't stop talking about it. I had the gyro burger and it was also good, but I just wasn't in the mood for it. Beer and Cider selections are extensive. Also there is usually a special shake of the day.

After cheering on our lovable Cubs last night and many shots thereafter just to attend an HR Conference this morning I needed to be revived.  Looked up burger joints in south loop and Burger Bar got the nod.  Started with the Fried Pickles and they were awesome!  Ordered the Tri-Tip burger and holy cow (no pun) this was great and just like Harry Caray, I washed it down with an Ice Cold Budweiser!!!
They don't have burgers like this in Texas, ya'll! We definitely recommend this place! Yuummmm!

We stopped in here Friday night after Lollapalooza, needing a bite to eat, a cold beer and -- most importantly -- a place to sit down. They told us it would be a 40 minute wait, but they seated us in just 10 minutes somehow. Despite them being overwhelmed by Lolla jerks like me, we had great and attentive service.I had been to Burger Bar on the north side and am happy to report the quality is just as good here. I built my own burger, keeping it fairly simple with lettuce, tomato and cheddar, and it was fantastic. The sweet potato tots were a little soggier than I had hoped, but still: they were sweet potato tater tots, so how can you complain too much?The beer list is excellent as well. Burgers are a bit expensive here, many in the $15-16 range, but you're paying for high quality food.

The burgers are terrific. This needs to sit at the front of the review because this is the reason you should come and what you should talk about afterwards. The rest of the experience is also very good, but the burgers are everything.My wife doesn't eat beef and burger places sometimes disappoint her, even though a turkey burger can be great. She got an amazing chicken burger with nice truffle fries. I got a special. It was a half pound Angus burger with an 8 oz steak as a burger topping. It was delicious and cooked exactly how I wanted.The location in the Loop lends itself to leaving the doors open and letting in a nice breeze. The place was lively at 8pm on a Friday without being packed. The waitstaff was very helpful and noticeably charming.I was not very happy with the beer selection. It was more interesting to the darker and hoppier side, but if you like lagers and pilsners, the choices were big brands like Blue Moon. I had a new and interesting cider and the beers I found were good. I just wish there was more selection for people who don't want super bitter beer. My wife got a bourbon vanilla milkshake that was very nice, though.I also had the fried pickles. They were good, though not a strong pickle taste. It was really about the breading and the sauce.That epic burger, the good fries, really good staff and the nice location made for a very good experience.

The Big Shoulder Blues does not disappoint! Burger patty comes very moist, tender and greasy. Secret ingredient? The bottom layer of peppercorn adds punch to every bite.I won't recommend the bacon lollipops however. Had excitedly anticipated it to be somewhat similar to bacon wrapped dates, but boy were the pork bellies literally large chunks of their belly fats. :/ Hugely disappointed as I had really built up high expectations for it.
Nice place to come on a weekend, if you want to avoid the ridiculous wait time at River North bars. Good different variety of burgers, that's a nice change.

Very good spot to crave your burger hunger. The location isn't ideal for finding parking if you are driving here. But inside give it a bar vibe with tv around and a bar area.The service was good. They were nice and helpful when asked questions. If they don't know something they will go find the answer right away.The burger was amazing. It was huge and juicy one of the best burger I ever had. Also there are very different type of burgers from bison, lamb, and the tradition beef. There fries are also great. Normal fries will be good enough. I didn't really think paying extra for truffle fries made a difference.
Just freaking outstanding. BBQ wings were grilled to perfection, Firehouse burger was ahhhhmazing. Wish there were six stars to give. Great service, great beers, unreal food!

Was in town for the marathon and came here twice during the week... Completely solid... Food was well-prepared and well-presented... Can't think of anything wrong... Everyone in my party was happy with what they got both times and service was fairly good even though it was crowded due to Chicago in the baseball playoffs... Four stars because I asked for a Shiner Bock and they looked at me like I was crazy lol .. if and when we come back to Chicago we will visit again

Burgers here were delicious and well worth the money.  The burgers here are not cheap (on the higher end around $15) but they are HUMONGOUS.  Both my boyfriend and I took half a burger home each. I ordered the firehouse burger, which was yummy but I almost got tired of the chorizo on there. It tasted similarly and had the texture of chili and I wasn't as big of a fan of that.  But my boyfriend's Hot and Smokey burger was reaaaaally good. Seems like a lot on burger, but has a delicious balance of bbq and good old burger.

Went back for a 2nd visit and while the service has improved from when they first opened, the food has not.  In fact, it's gone down.We were seated promptly on a busy Saturday afternoon. I ordered a 5 Rabbits draft and my partner ordered a Revolution.  Both beers arrived at our table at slightly below room temperature. On such a warm day, a nice cold beer would have hit the spot but we were served lukewarm beer which was not good. I ordered the grass fed burger with cheddar and bacon. It was barely okay. It's obvious they "flame grill" on a natural gas grill because you can really taste the gas. It's basically a slightly better Whopper. Fries were decent though. But the warm beer and subpar burger pretty much made up our minds that we won't be coming back. I'd rather walk a further up Michigan to Shake Shack. But EVERY burger place in Chicago would benefit from making a trip up to Milwaukee and see how burgers should be done.

While in town we ate here and although it was a sports bar (not a fan) and WAY to loud to even have a conversation at my table, they had the best chicken wings I've probably ever had. I really liked the spicy and sweet glaze and how charred they were. Top notch. My partner had a veggie burger how he wanted which is a nice vegetarian option when out at a restaurant. Their menu was not clear that the veggie burger has a patty as opposed to a bun with fixings so that worked out well for him. I would eat here again if in town for sure.
Great burger,  good atmosphere and beer list.  I had the tip stack and it was cooked perfectly.

My favorite place for a burger in Chicago, easily. Kick ass burgers, delicious and heaping helping of sweet potato fries, wonderful list of dipping sauces, and great craft beers. Plus, it's a sports bar. What more do you need? My wife's favorite is a simple burger with bar cheese, and mine is the 'get in my belly', which I almost order every time. And the 'Firehouse' is what I always recommend to first timers. Honestly the only thing I haven't cared for was the 'hot and smokey', which just didn't quite work together. Oh, and the appetizers are great too, especially the blue cheese chips!

If your coming to a burger bar, you better be getting a burger because they are AMAZING.I've been to this establishment twice and I was impressed both times. I got a build your own the first time with the grass fed beef and it was a very solid. Cooked perfectly, although I did find the meat a tad salty. You can choose between salad, fries, sweet potato fries, or chips for a side. I actually highly recommend the salad if you're trying to eat clean - *hint* choose the red wine vinaigrette.Although the BYO burger was good, I recommend you going for their specialty burgers instead. The buffalo bill burger was WOW. The tomato chutney, goat cheese, and arugula packed a nice and original punch to the gamey bison patty.The atmosphere is great, it's very trendy with HDTVs all over. They open the windows during the summer, so if try to nab a window seat if possible.

I went here for a late lunch. I split the burger w the blue cheese with my husband  we also had the sweet potato fries. Both were good and is order them again.This restaurant has excellent air conditioning and appears to be really clean. Love that all the tables look set with beer glasses turned upside down. The vibe is great and I'd love to go back to try some beers at the bar.

If we could rate lower we would!OMG This is the WORST burger place in the country! The burgers were dry and moldy tasting! The cooks were hired on the spur of the moment with zero experience??? For the expensive prices these people charge, this meal should be fit for a King and his palace!Flies all over the restaurant! A woman next to us complained that a fly landed on her burger meat and the cocky waiter said as he rolled his eyes, "because the front doors are open" and walked away! You should order the food and go eat outside across the street in the park, same thing! Indoor Restaurant settings should be fly free! The fries are over cooked and then returned to the grease for their traditional fry recipe??? Wow! Terrible!The bags of the fries are dripping grease and thanks to you we got grease all over the room!You should be ashamed of yourselves for serving such CRAP!Do NOT go here, save your money and go searching elsewhere! Trust us and others we just talked with, this place is not worth the drive, walk and especially doesn't deserve your money! Worst food we had in a long time! Stomaches do not feel good! Stay Away!

Came in on a Friday night, earlier than the dinner rush. It took a long time to be acknowledged by a server and she was not friendly. We ordered two beers, one of which came out as the wrong beer. We ordered two burgers, one that came out as ordered, the other came out without the cheese and under cooked. The waitress never came back to check to see if our order was right, so that was disappointing. The burgers were good, nothing special. The regular fries were good, the truffle fries were soaked in truffle oil. Overall disappointing. Skip this place, and go to The Scout.

Pros:Great food options. Bar foods with a twist. Decadent and not for the health conscious. Great beer options, too. The Founders IPA was the special at $5 each. The decor is great.Cons:Parking is a problem. We circled the blocks for 20 minutes to find a spot 3 blocks away in the dead of winter. Brrrrr! The seat was dirty, and the menus had food stuck to them inside. Super nasty. The water glasses were not clean. Everything else was fine.They say an unkept bathroom means an unkept  restaurant. The women's bathroom had a roll of TP on top and not in the dispenser. This is unsanitary and a definite no-no in my cleanliness restaurant ratings book.The waiter started off strong but disappeared when we got our food. I had to ask the hostess for a second round since our glasses were completely empty. This upset me because I didn't want to eat half my burger with no beer and a dirty water glass.I would have given this place a 3 star rating had the food not been so delicious.

We came here on a Wednesday night a few weeks ago. There were 6 of us and we were seated right away! The music was bumpin' and the restaurant is spacious (definitely good for groups!). Their brewed beer is actually really good and they have a wide variety of options (and even specials depending on the day) depending on what you like (dark vs light beer). I personally love IPA so I got the Great Lakes Burning River and loved it.My friends ordered the fried pickles and they couldn't stop talking about how good they were. I'm so sad I didn't get to try them, but looks like that's enough of a reason to go back! The sweet potato tater tots were delicious as well.I got the Fire House burger for my meal and loved it. It was chipotle spiced and had the right amount of flavor with the jalapeños and scallions. And it came with fries on the side! The portions are huge so come with an empty belly. Definitely coming back here again.

I'm not sure what went wrong here, but for all I've heard and as excited as I was to try Burger Bar, I left feeling really disappointed. First, I got to the restaurant around 10pm. My friends and I were starving and although the restaurant wasn't very busy, the hostess told us there was a 20 minute wait. So we waited while table after table opened up. We asked the hostess if we could just be seated at a table we didn't mind waiting, since the windows near the door were open and it was cool out. We were told that they were understaffed so she isn't able to seat those tables.Rule #1, don't tell the guest you are understaffed. Then about 2 seconds after that a table walked right in and was seated, obviously they knew the hostess. Rule #2, if you are going to serve your friends as VIPs at least be slick about it.So we were seated and our server was very nice and took our drink orders, bringing them out quickly. We put in an order for fried pickles and the chorizo chips. The housemade chips themselves were delicious. My friends found the chorizo on top weird. I liked the flavors, but it was rather difficult to eat and the oil from the chorizo became a pool for the chips, causing them to be rather soggy.We then ordered our burgers. I had the one with pulled pork and Andouille. It was good, but it definitely didn't knock my socks off like I had been told it would. I will say though that their fries were pretty spectacular.Another strange sidenote was that right after we placed our order for dinner, our server informed us that the kitchen would be closing in 10 minutes (it was 10:30 on a Saturday night) and did we want to order anything else. Since we came in with the mindset of getting boozy milkshakes, we assumed those came from the bar, not the kitchen. Long story short, we were wrong....now we know.

Terrible service. We waited an hour for our food including milkshake. We were surprised that the shake didn't come out until after the food-just more delays. The person who brought our food out walked off before I could ask for silverware. Hard to eat a side salad without a fork.So how was the burger? Cold. Yup. So I boxed it up and took it home to microwave. Just a bad experience all together. They were pretty busy so I'll give them that.In terms of taste-it was ok. The gyro burger was different but who wants a cold burger on a dry bun? My husband liked his blue cheese burger but it was also cold. So for the amount of choices we have in Chicago we won't return.Go for the beer. We didn't try any but people around us seemed to enjoy.

One of the yummiest burgers I have been to. They have eight different meats and falvored burgers. I got the wild bull, which was a bison patty with arugula, tomato sauce and goat cheese. It was really delicious, even though the cook overcooked my meat. I ate so much of it and so fast then I got a side if fresh-cut fries with sirracha aioli. The dipping sauce was alright but those fries...THOSE fries were so crispy. I had to take them home. No fry left behind.

I cannot wait to come back on the next Tuesday wing night. I got a very large pile of the sassy wings and also had an amazing time. After last night, I realized I am utterly obsessed with our bartender, Madison. When you stop by BB, make sure to sit at the bar and I promise you'll be taken care of. Madison asked us how we were doing, what we were craving, and gave us the best, most honest and accurate suggestions of the menu. The food came quickly and tasted amazing. I'm going to keep taking her suggestions on burgers, wings and drinks because there's always something I haven't tried that tastes better than the last. Madison was extremely knowledgeable about beer, down to the hops and ingredients, and had the menu memorized to the point where she didn't have to write it down. (We ordered a LOT of food, too!)The best part I noticed is that our bartender served everyone else with the same zest and authenticity as us. She was incredibly patient and helpful to new customers and tourists around us. I can't imagine the difficult sports and entertainment crowds they have to deal with, sometimes unexpectedly, but have no doubt she treats everyone with the same respect and care!I've been a few times before, but just couldn't let her hard work and dedication go unappreciated! This woman is very good at her job and happens to be one of the main reasons I plan to keep coming back.

We were able to get right in at 6:45 on a Friday night, which was great. They have a wide variety of beer selections that were reasonably priced.I had the backyard classic with bacon, lettuce, red onion, and tomatoes. The bacon was just one thick piece and it was candied, I think, but I wasn't a fan and you couldn't have the bacon in every bite of burger. I ended up taking the bacon off the burger, and I'm usually not one to reject bacon. The truffle fries were really delicious but the urban sauce (some mixture of ketchup and mayo) was meh.My boyfriend had the firehouse with sweet potato fries. He reports that it was pretty good and seemed to really like the chipotle sauce. I snagged a sweet potato fry with lime crema and it was delicious.The service was decent, but they didn't refill water the whole time we were there, which wasn't great.All in all, pretty good burgers and it's going to be pretty hard to live above this burger place and not consume my body weight in burgers.

I really like Burger Bar! Conveniently located just about a block from the Roosevelt Red, Green, and Orange line station, it's a great central happy hour location. If you're driving, you'll have to park at least a block away, but it's kinda worth it.The space is a lot bigger than it appears from the outside and is not too small for a group. The staff is super friendly, the place is clean, with typical bar decor.The menu is reasonably priced and accessible. They have a pretty good beer list, they have beer flights, and a full bar. I was very excited to try the burgers. They have beef, veggie, and turkey burgers which made me happy. They have some pre-designed burgers that are listed as beef but you can substitute with turkey or veggie burger patties. You can also build your own burger and they have some pretty good options. I chose a turkey burger with bacon, and was really happy to find that the burger was well seasoned and delicious and my bacon was crispy. I didn't have the French fries, so next time I go that will definitely be my side of choice.

Burger Bar Chicago was a pretty great lunch spot. The service was super super super slow, but our waiter was extremely apologetic and brought us an order of fried pickles to make up for the wait. The fried pickles were bomb, so good.Everyone in my group loved their burgers and most took advantage of the build-your-own option. I got the shrimp burger, which was a bit of a ballsy move (I mean... shrimp burger?)... it was interesting, it tasted good, weird texture but I ate the whole thing! Their fries were great and the truffle fries were even better.Overall, it was a cool spot to grab lunch on Michigan Avenue.

Seriously good. You can smell the burgers cooking on their grill when you walk by outside. Their big garage doors open onto Michigan Ave where a nice breeze comes through. We had their fried pickles - which were awesome with the Urban Sauce. The housemade crispy pork belly chips were outstanding. We weren't overly adventurous with our burger - but Backyard Burger was so juicy and tasty like a burger from a backyard cookout where the guy on the grill knows what he's doing. And the slab of candied bacon on top was sooooooo good. Our server was really attentive and helpful with answering menu questions. Can't wait to go back.

I know they say burgers are bad for you, and if you add cheese and all that other stuff even worse. The only answer to this when it tastes this good, is I'm going to be bad, really bad. One of my favorite burgers here is the Big Shoulder Blues, blue cheese and red onion jam, hmmm onion jam? Maybe they put crack in it because it's additive.Now for the sides, also just sooo good they have to be bad for you too, the mac and cheese is velvety, and the fried pickles are sweet, tart and crispy. Everything I've had here hits the mark.I'm back here anytime, yes it's out of control.

Great burgers! They give you the option to build your own burger which is awesome. They had a ton of different options for toppings and sides to your burger. I opted for the sweet potato fries on the side, and my God they are amazing! I walk past this place everyday on my way to work so I'm glad I finally gave it a shot! I'll definitely be going back on a regular basis!

First time ever on a Saturday (January) around 2ish in the afternoon for lunch, my boyfriend and i stopped in. It wasn't very crowded (im sure due to the weather that day). Service was fairly quick, however not the best. By this i mean our server was polite and somewhat attentive, my thing was i like to be asked if we had ever been there and get some suggestions. Maybe this wasn't the case because it's a burger "bar". All in all my experience was good and the food tasted great!FOOD: We started off with appetizers (bratwurst corn dogs) tasted great along with dipping sauce. My boyfriend ordered their burger of the month. I took a bite and it was very yummy and spicy. I ordered a grass fed burger with provolone cheese and lettuce, tomatoes & red onion. I like to keep things simple. Along with their sweet potatoes fries. Very good and filling. I stuck with water because i don't drink. However my boyfriend ordered one of their beer's (don't remember which one) but he had no complaints.DECOR/ATMOSPHERE - Nice decor and atmosphere. Feels like a bar low key & chill. Seemed clean from what i saw.$$$ - It's about average pricing for a good steak burger.STAFF/SERVICE - i pretty much explained this above. I dislike judging from a first experience from one person because everyone is different. People have off day's, people have different attitudes and personality's etc. I don't judge harshly so i overlook this type of things most of the time unless it is a really bad experience. That is why i still rated this 5 stars. I like to look at the overall picture of my experience and if positive outweighs the negatives then I'm sold.

Good food, good burger, certainly a good quality neighborhood spot, but consistently bad, non-attentive service. Consistent from its opening. And just left watching a well staffed crew without many tables, consistently pass by waiting tables and bar patrons. The manager, Matthew, has his work cut out for him.
The food was pretty good. There are no bad burgers. The sweet potato fries were also good.

The service here is always terrible.  That being said, I've managed to get the same terrible waitress on each of my visits.  I keep hoping that I'll get sat in someone else's section though, because this is a place I'll keep going back to.  Prices are reasonable, burgers are great, and the beer list is always changing.  With TVs constantly showing sports, it's not a place I'll linger at, but it's convenient and delicious enough that I'll keep going back.  Even if it's the same HORRIBLE server every time.
Burger Bar Chicago has very good food. I love their burgers and fries.

Love the ambience here!It was so windy, so my boyfriend & I stopped in. We sat at the bar to chill before we head to our next destination. He got two beers & he loved it, while I got a delicious milk shake. I got to try the sassy chicken wings & they were good too. I'd recommend you to stop by after visiting the Agora Sculptures in South Loop!
This place has awesome burgers. The bartenders were super friendly and they had a really nice tap list. If you have a hankering for a burger, you should definitely check this place out.

So I had a get together with the girls and there is no better way to bond than by eating delicious greasy food and drinking some beer. I found this place on yelp and when I asked my friend if it was good (I have been looking for a great burger). She said her husband really enjoyed it and that was good enough for me so we decided to eat here. I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant. It oozes the dive bar vibe which makes you know what you eat is going to be great. The day we went was great out so the windows were open and there was a cool breeze coming in. We asked to sit by the window and they had no problem accepting our request. Overall great atmosphere and service.The first thing we ordered was beer. While I don't know the extent of their draft menu, I saw some things on their beer list I haven't seen other places. Now keep in mind I like sweet beers so I always enjoy a beer that has fruit accents. They had a full list of summer beers with different flavors. They had pear, watermelon, blueberry, peach sour... the list goes on. I have Summer Shandy often so I decided to try one of the more unique flavors. Watermelon made the cut and it was yummy, but my friend ordered a raspberry beer and that was by far my favorite.The burgers were amazing. I got the hey shortay which had short rib on top of a very delicious burger. The flavor was great. In fact, I finished my entire burger (dont' judge) and those portions are huge. One friend got the Wild Bill. She was a little nervous about trying bison for the first time, but it came recommended by our waiter. She was very happy with her decision saying it was really great. My other friend got the high hog which is pulled pork on top of a burger. While she only ate half, she kept saying how yummy it was. She took the rest home to share with her dad.Next time I plan on trying the truffle fries and one of their boozy milkshakes. I wanted to try a milkshake this time, but I was so full I decided against it. I had a great time here and plan on brining my boyfriend here.

A server never bothered to come by our table after about 7-8 minutes of sitting down, so we just got up and walked out.  Place was also only about 2/3rds full.  After about 5 minutes, the host somewhat ashamedly came by and asked if anyone had come by/poured waters, and we said no.  She then appeared to talk to a couple servers, presumably saying "hey--one of you needs to take that table over there."  Waited a couple min after that, and still got nothing.Menu looked expensive for this type of food.
Burger joint in the south loop area. They have rotating beers on tap and great addition to the neighborhood.

Stopped in for a bite before the game at Soldier Field. The bar had solid ambiance - tons of TVs  broadcasting college football, lots of fans, big bar area, and a great burger list. It is a longer walk to Soldier than you might think - about 20 minutes depending on your pace / luck with lights.Beer list was pretty solid - lots local (Chicago & Midwest) beers on draft and in bottles. My server let me try a few beers to help me decide, which is always a plus. Prices were a bit high, but the place is on Michigan Ave and walking distance to Soldier, so they can get away with it.We ordered the Hot & Smokey with truffle fries and the Santa Fe Salad. The Hot & Smokey was served exactly as I ordered it and was a massive undertaking. The main flavors ended up being the BBQ glaze and the cucumber-onion slaw. The slaw was piled on thick, burying the Tillamook cheddar (and its flavor, sadly). The burger overall wasn't hot as the name suggests, which was a little disappointing. The flavors were more underwhelming than I expected, especially with the lack of heat and lack of cheddar goodness. The truffle fries were seasoned perfectly - salty goodness that was definitely worth the extra $1. Unfortunately, a lot of my fries were overdone. And  I didn't order it, but $2 extra for sweet potato tots? Come on. It's cheaper to add chicken to a salad ($1).The salad was large, served with 2 small bowls of the chili-lime vinaigrette on the side. The dressing was flavorful, albeit a bit spicy (even for my dad who loves spice), beware! It was your basic "Mexican style" restaurant salad - a good option if you're not wanting to tackle one of their gigantic burgers.The manager popped by our table to check in on our dining experience and seemed genuinely concerned about making sure that everyone's table was being taken care of properly. Very customer-oriented and friendly!If I was in this area, I wouldn't hesitate to try this spot again, but it didn't  take over my top burger spots in Chicago list.

Great food,  but I always find the service to be mediocre. Today it was with Madison. She was inattentive,  never check it order was correct or if we needed anything (my order was not correct,  and things were needed). We had to ask every other server for to go bags or ketchup or water... And we tipped well,  dispute her behavior. Just disappointing,  because since order was wrong...  Still couldn't really enjoy food either. Luckily most of there food is good in general.

I laugh that the norm now is to pay around $15+ for a burger and fries without batting an eye. Well I still bat an eye....but hope the taste/quality is at least worth it. I wish it was a few dollars cheaper, but overall I got close to my moneys worth. I went with the lamb burger (house made lamb sausage, manchego cheese, mint chimmichuri (yum!), spinach, tomato-onion salsa. I thought the chimmichuri and tomato-onion salsa definitely provided a unique taste and the lamb sausage was tender and juicy. For a $1.00 I upgraded my side of fries to truffle fries and they were pretty good, although I wouldn't have mind if they were a little less crunchy. My friend and her boyfriend ate a big meal the previous night (so don't judge), but they just went with the cobb salad and sweet potato tater tots which they enjoyed. The sauce that goes with the tater tots was pretty good.We went on a Sunday around 12:30 and were surprised it wasn't packed and there was no wait to be seated. The staff was super friendly and I enjoyed my experience and plan to go back to try more burgers and sides.

Gimme those Sassy Wings ... and Fried Pickles! These two really are a match made in heaven and then some. I think I'll return just for those items.. I'm up to my second visit with one of the two.So it's not a 4 as I've had some other menu items that were less than delicious. The Baha shrimp burger was actually kind of gross in the grand scheme of things. If you want to check it out, have them put the cole slaw topping on the side. The amount of mayo was ridic. My friend said her burger was tasty, but on her second visit.. the burger wasn't stellar. Says to me that maybe certain items sit higher than others.The setting is a great sports bars with enough TVs, that you should be able to catch your sport of choice. The volume can be really loud, so avoid sitting under speakers and hoping to have a conversation.The service is slower than I'd like for it to be. Like minutes before someone takes your order and more minutes before they come back. My advice is to order everything up front, so you don't get h-angry in the process of ordering/waiting.

solid burger jointfood - the menu had a bunch of good looking burgers.  i got one with steak tips on it and it was excellent.  their beer selection wasn't that great though.service - got the job done without complaints.i would go again to try another burger.

Food: freaking delicious. Got blues burger with sweet potato fries + urban sauce (AMAZING w the fries) and sassy wings (some of the best my boyfriend has had).Service: very friendly. Seemed well staffed.Atmosphere: fun, crowded but not crazy. Lots of nice tvs. Huge bar.Beer: huge tap and bottle/can selection. Staff knowledgable about beers.Another pro is that the kitchen is open fairly late (at least 12am).

Decent burger with really good sweet potato fries.  Kind of pricey: we spent 65 bucks on two burgers, two beers, and a cocktail.Word to the masses: when it says "slab of bacon" they mean it.  Not your run-of-the-mill bacon strips.  It was a hunk of meat about a half inch thick.Their local beer menu is solid.  I'll be back for the beers.  Lots of TVs to watch all kinds of sports, too.

Stopped in here on a Saturday around 3 p.m. to grab a late lunch. We sat at the bar, which was less than 1/2 full, and yet the 'tender was slower than molasses in January. He also had the personality of molasses in January. NOT that I need to be chatted up 24/7, but SOME lightness and/or observance would be appreciated.Thought the food might do the work that the bartender didn't - but, sadly, no. Fried pickles had so much breading you couldn't even taste the pickles. And everything else was so greasy I could have oiled my car and then done the duty on another 'mobile. Truffle fries were bathing in oil, burger buns dripping with butter, meat patties over-seasoned and fried in a pan?It'd be one thing if the food made up for the service or vise-versa, but this Michigan Ave. spot is simply relying on its address and nothing more substantial.

I passed by here on the way to my hotel in Chicago and the place seemed to be pretty busy, and had a heavily "burger smell" coming from it (that was my first indicator that it would be a epic burger experience).I came here with a few friends for a early lunch, and was pleasantly surprised by the uniqueness of their burger & topping choices. The server was attentive and explained all of the different burgers to us (i.e. lamb, elk, beef, etc.) I ended up going with the Elk Burger, topped by andouille sausage and chipotle aioli. At first I was unsure of the size of their burgers (that's never stopped me before) and whether it was smart to go for a Elk Burger (it was my first time trying elk!)It ends up that the Elk was cooked to perfection, as recommended by the server due to the dryness of elk if overcooked. It was also the perfect size and all the condiments were in perfect harmony! Also, the sweet potato fries were not overwhelming-ly heavy and the perfect portion of them were served. My friends and I also ended up splitting a oreo milkshake, which thankfully they split 3-ways and was the perfect end to the meal. All in all, I'd say that the ambiance, service, and food were all great!I'll definitely be back if I am in the area! You should too :)

I went to Burger Bar after the Black Hawk Convention at the Hilton. First walking in I was a little nervous because the hostess was rude. But as she walked us toward our table I relaxed because all the waiters and waitresses seemed so friendly!They were playing classic rock-which was awesome!! My sister and I wished there was some karaoke so we had a reason to be singing along to every song! The restaurant had exposed brick and gave off an edgy vibe. This went great with the music and the bit of smoke in the air from the grilling.Our waitress was incredibly friendly and she was very knowledgable about the menu. It's rare to ask a waitress/waiter "What's good" and have them not recommend the entire menu.There was a large beer menu. That included draft, bottle and can. We had the queso-guac-chips as a starter. It was good... The chips were kind of like a Doritos but thin.I had the Wild Bill burger with truffle fries. I really enjoyed it and ended up taking half home.  The truffle fries were great! Thin and crispy!

I give just 3 starts because for me it isn't the best of Chicago! The burger is good, but not the best! The service was very friendly!!! The wigs portion was terrible bad. They said it wasn't fried but come with too much oil!!!  I don't recommend!!!

Slowest Service Ever!The bf and I came in for a burger hoping to order quickly and get out of there because we had errands to run.  We arrived around 6:15, sat at the bar and it took about 5-10 minutes for the bartender to take our drink order.  It literally took 15 minutes for us to get our beers.  And then she came back another 15 minutes to take our order.We left at 8:45 that night - not because we wanted to, because the service was slow and the cooking was slow and the check giving was slow.Burgers were just OK, but what the WHAT!  We had dinner at the bar on a Monday night and the whole thing start to finish took 2.5 hours.TOO SLOW.

I've been to this place a few times, mostly for beers after work. Great selection by the way, and very nice about letting sample tap options before buying. Lagunitas Czech Pils is my summer favorite, I can drink them all night --- unfortunately, I did.Last night I tried the food, I got the Hot & Smokey. Holy Merry Mother of Bob that fucker was good. BBQ beef burger, smoked pulled pork, grilled hot link, smoked cheddar, habanero-bbq glaze and cucumber onion slaw. I tried to eat just half and take half home later because I wanted to be alone with it in a borderline inappropriate way, but I ate the whole damned thing. Great fries, too. So many burgers here I wanna try, fortunately (or unfortunately, depending on your viewpoint) I work just a couple blocks from the place so I can try the other burgers.Also --- great and friendly staff, always service with a smile.
Great grass fed burgers. Bartender recommended a great IPA. Nice experience. Will definitely go back.

First time here and I'll definitely be returning. Came in on a Wednesday evening and The service was great. Our waitress gave great recommendations. The food and drinks were really good especially the wings!!
Food was excellent. Burgers and sides delicious. I had the spicy shrimp burger that was a mouth sensation. Very tasty.Service was attentive witout being intrusive.
Good food and nice seating outside on the river walk. Very expensive and the beer selection is poor and the drinks are worse. Way over priced for the quality, service and selection provided.

My hubby and I both got a prime burger and fried pickles. The burger was very yummy and a good size, I couldn't finish it all. But, what made the meal exceptional was the fried pickles! I am a big fan of fried pickles and have tried them from various places, these are by far the best fried pickles I have ever had. They were so yummy, and didn't have the unhealthy taste that other fried pickles sometimes have. They were clean and yummy and a perfect appetizer. Overall the service was great , the restaurant was nice looking, and the food was very very good. Hubby and I will have to stop here again sometime

Yum!  We came here after a run at Soldier Field.  We were starving and oh so thirsty, and Burger Bar totally came through!  We immediately ordered a round of the $3 Goose Island Thursday special and perused the menu.  The burgers here are fantastic!  Lots of options, or a build your own, if you are high maintenance ;)We started with the poutine, like you do.  Pulled pork on top of fries, gravy and melted curds?  Yes please!  Also ordered the fried pickles which were good, but not great.  They cut the pickle into spears and then fry; I prefer the round slices, you get more batter-to-pickle ratio.  Oh well.  Burger-wise, I had the Big Shoulder Blues, sans blue cheese.  The peppercorn added a nice kick and the onion bacon jam and port wine glaze mixed in a surprising sweet flavor.  I sprung for the truffle fries (high roller) and didn't regret it.  Others raved about the sweet potato tots.  Food was enjoyed by all.Service was a little spotty, but not enough to keep us away.  Nice work, Burger Bar!

I come here a lot and would highly recommend any burger, especially the chicken burger and wings! They have a wonderful Bloody Mary drink list and an array of beers. LANCE and BRI are the best servers, if you sit in there section you'll be treated like VIP.

I wasn't blown away and maybe that is because it was freezing while I drank and ate.  Place was crowded for an event so we sat at the bar and sort of near the door (our choice and bad decision). So that contributed to the problem, plus it was below 0 outside.  Anyway let's get to why were are here.Beer list was great.  I will enjoy it more when the garage doors are open.So we had wings and fried pickles to begin and the wings far out shined the pickles.  I think the fried pickles are pre fried or maybe that was just last night with the event coming on because we forgot to order or the bartender didn't hear me either way the wings come out, I ask about the pickles and they show up 2 or 3 mins later luke warm.  Now wings are smoking hot, I mean smoking, I am sure the place being a little on the cold side helped with seeing the smoke, and the pickles you could eat as soon as they came out.Burger, burgers, and more burgers.  Lots of options here and I like options.  But went with make my own of Grass Fed burger, friend onion strings, bacon and cheese, ended up being just under $20.  Burger was good,, not that best but good. Cooked perfect and everything came out as ordered.  Came with fresh cut fries.My buddy got a basic cheeseburger and ordered truffle fries, that he said they were outstanding.I think between the combination of the cold inside and outside, put a damper on the experience, but i will be back as their mug club option ($40) is an awesome idea.  So I can see a 4 or maybe 5 star in the future.keep it up Burger Bar and open one of these in the 60640 zip code, we could use a burger craft beer place.

I would give Burger Bar 3.5 stars and here is why.Location - is ideal for area residents and anyone walking or taking the Rd Line to Roosevelt. Anyone driving, parking will be a nightmare.Beer - there is a pretty wide selection of craft beers on tap and bottles. Certainly 5 stars for varietyTVs- plenty of TVs make for a great venue to watch some games and drink some beers.Food - now here is where I give 3 stars. In the day and age of gourmet burgers and not to mention 5 guys down the street, I certainly was underwhelmed by the $12 burger. Yes, you have some serious toppings on the stack burgers but the actual burger was meh. We asked to get ours medium rare and the server insisted that we go with medium since their medium has a pink center. Yup, medium got too dry!!All things said I would come back for beer and apps but will walk a block and get my burger at 5 Guys!

Noticed this place when we were on our way to one of the many locations we visited while staying in Chicago. Stopped by for an early lunch and was not disappointed. We tried 4 different burgers and split them all since there were so many that sounded good. My personal favorites... the hot & Smokey,second favorite was the Fire House, followed by the not so stout stacker. Everything was good the sweet potato tots, sweet potato fries, truffle fries as well as the regular fries. Would suggest you not miss the blue cheese bacon chips. These were soooooo good! Arrive was great and they even gave us suggestions for good places to go in the area. Don't miss this place it was delicious!!!

Whatever you do, you need to try this place.Came here Sunday after taking in the Jazz Festival at Grant Park, my phone was 'dead' and when I asked Steve, manager/part owner if by any chance he had a charger, he said 'sure, what kind of phone? we have all the chargers'. I was pleasantly surprised, they have phone charger plugs right under the bar, so while you have a good time, your phone is charging. Steve made our group feel like we were family, nothing better than a service like that, he also gave us some complementary chicken wings to try and let me tell you, you will forget about BWW or Hooters or whatever other chicken wing place, so crunchy on the outside, but so juicy at the same time, the sauces are bomb! I had the get-in-my-belly burger, medium rare, it basically just melted in my mouth, just heaven on a bun, no other way to put it. It's a must try, cool hangout, chill place.We will definitely be back on Tuesday for the $5 wing night! and a big thank you to Steve for the great service.

Pretty good burger spot.A girlfriend and I decided to check out Burger Bar randomly one night and it turned out to be a good choice. We talked in just after 5:00 or so and was seated immediately. The staff were pleasant and efficient.I wasn't feeling particularly adventurous so I decided to build my own burger. I stuck to the basics and just went the burger, lettuce and tomato route. I ordered the half pound angus burger and it turned out to be more than enough food. I actually had a hard time finishing it. The burger was decent. It wasn't the best burger I've ever eaten but it was good enough for me to be a return customer. I liked the fries too.The burger was only $10 which is more than decent for the area. My only complaint is that the restaurant was a little loud. We had to practically yell to ear each other over the other patrons and loud music. But I guess that's to be expected in a bar on a Saturday night.

This place was GOOD. Our server, while I don't remember her name, was very bubbly and nice. We all had two beers each and our server recommended the pineapple beer which everyone loved. All of our burgers were fantastic I got the tri tip stacker. So good. You can customize your own burger as well. Ask for their "special sauce" to dip your fries in. Milkshakes are also good and they have unique flavors to try.  We were gonna try the bacon bourbon cheesecake shake but we were too full by the end to even think about more stuff to fit in our stomachs. Highly recommend
One of the best burgers I have ever had! Great location.

LOVED the hostess staff.. so helpful and friendly and put up with my indecision on where to sit, during a televised HAWKS game.  Bartenders were cool, but not overly friendly.  Love the atmosphere and the open feel of the front window, as Ill definitely be requesting the window table this Summer.. (IF it ever warms, up that is... ;-)My only take away star is for their veggie burger. Yea, yea, yea.. I know this is a 'burger bar' but nowadays there are plenty of vegetarians out there and restaurants should be able to serve a tasty veg burger.. I've been to many establishments in the city that make a mean one.. however, the Burger Bar is not one of them.. I cut into it and it had a white/pal shade??!  WTH is it made of?? Perhaps rice.. maybe garbonzo beans, I guess.. I'm not quite sure..  ? The taste was awful though.  I hope they can find another supplier for the veggie burgers because it was simply, horrible tasting. With that being said, the sweet potato fries that came with it, were excellent.Seems like a cool spot.. will definitely be back.. and will become a regular if they can fix my animal friendly burger. :  )
Salmon burger was to die for and recommended by the waiter.

I decided tonight that I was going to try this joint out..due the wonderful smells of a grill from this place.Placed for an order to go..Ordered - BYOB (Build your own burger)Grass fed beef with Caramelized onions with white cheddar cheese.I was so so disappointed with the burger..it was definitely Not worth the money!! I was expecting the burger to taste like it was actually cooked on grill(which I was told the burgers where cooked on grill).This burger was so salty and HAD no taste of being cooked on a grill!!If I were you, I would go to Reggie's of Chicago for an AWESOME burger!
Unique burger selections and great drink selections. My wife and I enjoyed the chicken burger over greens with avocado and chili-lime vinaigrette. Very tasty and filling...reasonably priced too.
Best burger place in town!!! Try their sweet potato fries and ranch! We go here all the time and it never disappoints us!!:))

Come visit madison she will take care if you!! Her suggestions are really good and shes completely honest!  Im from Minnesota and she showed me a good time here. food is amazing try anything you will love it.

Called in an order for Calamari and Mac n Cheese. The calamari is is lightly breaded and very tasty. Not too salty, served with lemons, delicious aioli sauce, and a sweet/sour sauce. The 'triple cheese' Mac and cheese was pretty good.The aioli sauce for the calamari was especially good. I will be back to sit down and try Burger Bar again soon
They have great beer and great burgers me and my friend spotted this place as we were walking by Saturday stop and have lunch best place to eat in Chicago would happily go back again
The burger was good, but the wings were amazing. Cannot beat $5 Tuesday wings.  I am putting it in my calendar to come back next Tuesday!

Visited this place because it's close to soldier field and it did not disappoint!! The wings were grilled and absolutely delicious!! My son is always ranking his favorite burger and this place came in second and I would have to agree! The burger was excellent!! The service was excellent considering the place was packed but the waitress always checked on us and we didn't wait for anything!! I can't wait to go back to Chicago to try another one of their burgers!!!

And again, another location known for terrible customer service. I was near the location but decided to call in to try to place an order so it would be ready when i arrived. The employee answered the phone and immediately put me on hold. While on my 7 minute hold i had already arrived at the resturant to see, no customers, no lines, nothing! Therefore there was no reason why my order couldn't have been immediately taken over the phone. Once i arrived to the resturant, the call was disconnected on the resturants side. The quality of the food doesnt even matter at this point because the customer is terrible for it to be on Michigan Ave. Again, I'm sure the Caucasians will receive awesome service, so enjoy!*put a star because i had to*

Really bad take out salad experience! Was ready ahead of schedule, but was limp and drenched in dressing, with two more sides of dressing ( and i love an extra side of dressing).  Couldn't bring myself to eat the wilted kale or rubbery chicken. Thats what i get for ordering a salad at a burger plave. No one to blam but myself. Maybe the burgers are great.
Ate here twice while in Chicago. Great food and beer. Had the sashimi tuna burger and sweet potato fries. Wait staff was friendly and efficient on both occasions. Definitely will eat here again.

Ironically the burgers are nothing special here.  Sometimes overcooked and mostly dry from the 4-5 I've gotten.  All other food is on point though! (try the fried pickles, wings, truffle fries).   They have wings for cheap ($5 for 10) on Tuesdays.  It's never too packed since the Sloop is still 'up an coming'.. so its a great place to grab a quick bite and enjoy some local brews on draft.

Absolutely LOVE the craft beer selection. The burgers are some of the best that I have had, and the experience was overall wonderful. The real magic began when I ordered the Poutine appetizer and asked for the Terracotta cheese curds instead of the Mozzerella. You HAVE to try the Terracotta Poutine, it's the greatest appetizer I have ever had, and you will be blown away. Make sure that you ask for the Terracotta cheese curds when you order the Poutine, it will change your life.Edit: make sure you ask for Amber, she was an incredibly knowledgeable Server and she was the one who recommended the Terracotta Poutine.

Super gourmet burgers. We had the elk. It was enough for my husband and I to share. We finished licking our lips. It was phenomenal. Fresh ingredients, hand pattied, lots of gourmet things you would never think of putting on a burger that may make you nervous at first but are delicious!!Truffle fries..... is your mouth watering yet? Because mine is just thinking about these beauties. fantastic.Pricey but worth it. Cant wait to eat here again.

BURGER ME NOWThis burger staple near Lincoln Park is expanding with its second location. I fell in love with the Lincoln Park location many years ago over their fantastic chicken wings. Now my love affair continues with the new South Loop location.The South Loop area is exploding with many new restaurants and this location stands out like a gem with a delicious proven menu.  It's perfect for a few drinks with some fantastic food.I highly recommend  the fried pickles with the urban sauce. I love how crispy the breading is along with the yummy pickle inside. The pickles are even made in house which makes this dish even better. They cut them length wise and not like round circles. This makes them easy to hold and dunk in the urban sauce.I am also in love with the bacon lollipops. Yes you head me right! This is like the best candy ever. One bite and you'll fighting the table for the next one.  It is asian spiced pork belly that is wrapped in bacon topped with a cider glaze. The dish just works & is a great start to any evening here.Do you like Mac N Cheese? Don't be embarrassed because it's not for just kids. The versions here will blow you away. They have a 3 cheese Mac, peppered bacon Mac, chorizo Mac & pulled pork Mac. I've had them all but the chorizo is my favorite and I'm not a chorizo fan either. The spicy ground chorizo mixes perfectly with the special 3 cheese sauce and delivers a real winner.  I literally can not stop eating it.Do you love wings? Then this is the place to order them. I love how these wings are grilled. Anyone can batter a wing and throw it into the deep fryer.  This place has some crazy good sauces to toss the wings in too. Tuesday are a great day to try the wings because they are on special at both locations. I'm totally into the BBQ wings because it is the first wing I ever had here many years ago. It's hard for me to forget my original chicken wing love. If you're into spicy then go for the dry rub wings with habanero bbq or el diablo wings with habanero salsa.  Honestly you can't go wrong with any of the wing choices. They also have sassy wings with a spicy chili-ginger glaze & a sriracha aioli or smokey wings with a sweet smoky basil BBQ. I can't get enough of them here.This place also had a great beer selection. You will find many craft brews available. One week I had a local brew made out of beets and when I came back the next week they had a different brew from the same brewery. I liked that cause it forced me to try a new beer. I like to say, "There's a lot of Craft Brews but not enough hours in a day to drink them all." The Burger Bar is going to help me get closer to that goal. They also have a mug club you can join which gives you your own mug and a 20oz pour for the price of a 16oz beer. I feel like I am in Europe where you only drank at your pub and went nowhere else. The mug club creates a sense of ownership. The bar even had a built in pint rinser which is something every European bar has. You clean the glass prior to pouring the beer to make sure there are no impurities in the glass to ruin the taste of the beer. This place is serious when it comes to your beer. They also have a keg cemetery for dead kegs. It is located outside the bathroom. Make sure you stop by to pay your respects for our fallen kegs.This place has so much great food I almost forget why I started this review and that's because of the unique burgers. This place has been serving up burgers long before the Chicago Burger explosion. In fact, I believe Chef John might have created this fascination with burgers in Chicago. He truly knows good food.I'm going to mention a few of my favorite burgers like the "Hey Shorty" with braised short ribs, caramelized onions & roasted garlic aioli. It is so yummy. The "Hot & Smokey" which is a bbq beef burger, smoked pulled pork, grilled hot link, tillamook cheddar, smoked habañero-BBQ glaze & cucumber-onion slaw. You're going to need two hands & a big mouth to eat this one. If you don't believe me then check my photo out. If you're looking for a spicy burger then go with the "El Diablo Firehouse" which is a chipotle spiced burger, charred jalapeño-scallion-chorizo relish, pepper jack & guajillo aioli.They also have exotic meat like the "Wild Bill" with grass-fed, lean bison, arugula, goat cheese & tomato chutney on a pretzel roll. I love buffalo burgers because of the leanness of the meat & this one didn't let me down.  I can't wait to try the elk burger & the lamb burger. I'm getting hungry thinking about them.  I also loved the chicken burger. It's seasonings were really good. Everyone does turkey burgers but you never see chicken burgers. I am really glad I tried it.So if you find yourself hungry in the South Loop, then stop in here for a meal you will not soon forget. The management & staff are amazing with great customer service. I love the bartenders too because they really know beer. I can't wait to go back to eat & drink again!

Get the fried pickles, seriously so good. I highly suggest splitting a burger and getting some of their appetizers or their shakes. I always leave way too full, but this is one of the best burgers I have had hands down.

This has been by far the best burger I've had in the city or the burbs. Big thick patties,fresh tasting ingredients, great bread. The fries option are various and the servers are very accommodating to special requests such as gluten free alternatives. The beer selection was amazing.

Four stars because the food was great, especially the sassy wings, but it was a little expensive for a burger place. Everyone raved about the wings, so we had to try them, the sassy wings were the perfect amount of spicy and sweet, best wings I've had! I'd got back just for the wings! I ordered the wild bill, it was good if you're into goat cheese, arugula, and tomato chutney; it was a VERY messy burger to eat! My husband did "build your own burger" very delicious but it gets pricy, each extra toppings are  $1.50 each. Sweet potatoes fries were okay, salty and fried. Lots of beer choices too. Atmosphere, was definitely a bar atmosphere, loud and crowded (if you go during w popular time).

Ambiance:the restaurant has an interesting hybrid blend between upscale and casual. it looks semi-fancy on the outside and the white table cloths and somewhat dim lighting add a slight touch of romance but it's actually pretty informal. you'll see people in business casual clothes but also people in jeans or shorts.Food:-- bruschetta ($6.50): roma tomatoes, basil, evoo, crusty bread.  the ingredients tasted very very fresh! 4/5-- Raviolini di Pera ($17.50): Roasted pear, parmigiano, toasted nuts, sun-dried tomatoes, mascarpone cream. according to yelp, this is the one of the restaurant's most popular dishes and it comes highly recommended by yelpers so despite how odd a pasta ravioli sounds, I decided to give it a try and didn't regret it! such an interesting flavor combo that works really well together. subtly sweet and savory at the same time. 5/5-- salmone crocante ($26): crispy skin, braised fennel, gold potato, roasted shallot parsley emulsion. my friend says he orders this dish every time he eats at Tuscany. I tried a bite and will admit that it's good and cooked nicely but the flavor profile doesn't even begin to compare to the complexity of the raviolini di pera! 4/5Service:friendly, waters refilled, no complaintsOverall:my friend who's Italian was very defensive when I said it reminded me of a nicer olive garden. he forbid me from mentioning olive garden inside Tuscany lolllll but he's right. Tuscany is way better than Olive Garden and definitely more authentic. the waiters and cooks appear to be Italian and I believe a good number of the restaurant's clientele are Italian as well. I'm assuming they would know where to go to get good Italian food! :)

Fantastic!  We moved back to Chicago to the soup Loop and are slowly making our way through our neighborhood restaurants.  Last night was Tuscany and it was wonderful.  From the friendly greeting when we arrived to the incredible food and service we received from Luis this place is a stand out!We started with the garlic and as other reviews highlight this is perfect.  So simple but it shows you how good simple ingredients make the difference.We had the Octopus, Pappardelle, Penne, Salmon, and Halibut special cooked in parchment paper with a pernod sauce.As if that wasn't enough, the Lemon Sorbet and Tiramisu was spot in on.We decided to come every day for dinner!

We came here for Father's Day and I would say received exceptional service. Manuel was our waiter and a great sense of humor that made our night more relaxing. I can't say that I've never received  so quick and on point service than I did today.They start us off with their garlic, Parmesan cheese and olive oil dip. And we ordered bruschetta to start. It came very fast and then ordered our main entree. I ordered the Pollo Montecarlo and my wife ordered an my wife ordered the fettuccine alla primavera. Her dish was alright, but the Pollo Montecarlo was very tasty. It had a Chardonnay reduction based sauce with the spinach as the base at the bottom. And then the chicken and prosciutto topped with fontinella cheese. All the ingredients complimented each other very well.One thing that always bothers me is that I never leave enough room for dessert. Perhaps it's the bread in the beginning or chips and salsa at Mexican restaurants but I never seem to be able to taste the desserts. Anyways...I will definitely be returning to Tuscany on Taylor.
Amazing! Authentic Italian cuisine-A must to order...Seared Chilean Sea Bass and for dessert- Tiramisu!! Wonderful menu options and great atmosphere!!!

Not bad but I wouldn't come back anytime soon. I had the seafood pasta I wish it was a tad spicy or packed with more flavor, it was kind of meh. My daughter had the margarita (spelled wrong I'm sure) pizza and it could have been cooked a littleLonger it was good but not great and kind of soggy. My sister had the beef with potatoes and mushrooms and she said it was just ok. After dinner we ordered drinks and she had to send hers back because it was just an awful poorly concoction of everything mixed the bartender probably didn't measure anything and just threw it all together. I had a pomegranate martini and it tasted like cough syrup... In conclusion I won't rush back anytime soon. I just don't find this "great"

Came back again and I still agree with my first rating. This restaurant is a nice Italian restaurant in the middle of Little Italy and definitely one of my favorites. It is a good place for a date night, as it is a quieter, more intimate atmosphere.This time, I went with my boyfriend for an early dinner, which consisted of red wine and a few different appetizers. We got the Grilled Calamari appetizer and the Prosciutto & Mozzarella appetizer. Both were really tasty, but I thought the grilled calamari (which was a special) had too many chick peas in it. However, the prosciutto and mozzarella was delicious. It was so simple, but the meat was perfect and the buffalo mozzarella was the perfect texture.I can definitely see myself coming back again for dinner!
Good food, convenient location with valet parking, outdoor seating if you prefer that, friendly staff, altogether a nice dining experience although I don't find myself craving their food!

This is an excellent place to come have a wonderful Italian meal with family and friends, or even a date.  Eight of us came here after the Opera on a Sunday night around 6 PM for dinner and had a great experience.We were seated almost immediately by a very friendly hostess and after we got situated were brought fresh bread Parmesan cheese, olive oil, jalepeno olive oil (surprisingly tasty) and roasted garlic which the server then mashed with cheese and olive oil right at the table - so so good with their bread!We all ordered different things, but one thing that was a stand out was how the server let us know we could get what we want how we want.  No matter what dish, you could change the sauce.  Everyone enjoyed it all!
Everything was delicious.  This place has a great ambiance that compliments the authenticity of the food.Delizioso!  Grazie!

One Of My Favorite Places To Dine In Chicago.-$$$-Excellent Appetizers-Full Selection Of Wines-Large Portions At Dinner-Romantic Ambience-Valet-Knowledgeable Wait Staff Of Wine List & Food-Clean EnvironmentOnce A Year I Go Here And Have Never Had A Bad Experience.

I absolutely love the roasted crushed garlic clove in olive oil with bread given as complimentary appetizer. I also enjoy the mussels, cozze, Barbe rosse, minestrone, carpaccio di manzo, spaghettini di mare pasta and spicy linguine con scampi pasta. Service is very good and attentive. They have an excellent wine list. The Tuscan interior is warm and inviting. A good date spot. Valet parking is offered and street parking is available farther down the street.

Let me preface this review by saying that the staff was lovely and this one-star review is by no means their fault.What I do take issue with is the lackadaisical manner in which they update their website.My boyfriend and I were craving Italian food, did our research and Uber'ed down to this restaurant with a plan of eating parpadelle with a wild boar bolognese and gnocchi with sausage ragout.Welp, as soon as we opened the menu, we honestly thought we were in the wrong restaurant (Seriously, I compared the address and then we contemplated leaving.).When we addressed the issue with the server, he laughed and said, "Oh yeah, that menu is about a month old. They need to update that." After checking if we could receive said dishes from the kitchen, he came back and essentially said they could, but would throw some sausage in the sauce, which we all know, throwing greasy sausage in a tomato sauce for five minutes really imparts flavor into it.We went with two different options instead and they were awful. The veal tortellini had zero sauce in it and was incredibly bland. The same goes with the overdone parpadelle with the flavorless bolognese. Honestly, we've cooked a better Sunday sauce at home and I expected more from Little Italy.If the restaurant had updated their menu online, we wouldn't have even gone. The pasta combinations were so bizarre that it was clear that they were essentially just throwing ingredients on a plate (Seriously, who serves shrimp scampi with marinara sauce?).Italian food isn't the cheapest of options and I feel sick that I actually spent money here. The whole experience was basically false advertising and I hope the homeless man we gave our doggie bags to enjoyed his meal...because we certainly didn't.
Excellent food, great service. We order eggplant pram and pear ravioli it was delicious. Fettuccine was also great. Expensive but worth it.

Came here for my friends birthday dinner.The services was great!The food was also amazing, one of the best Italian foods I had in Chicago. Everything was well seasoned and presented well.My husband isn't The biggest Italian food fan and he really enjoyed his food here.The prices were reasonable and portions size was filling.They also had great wine selection.Will come back again!

This is my 3rd visit and I still love the complimentary bread with olive oil and 'THAT' garlic. This place is pretty close to where I stay so I end up seeing it almost everyday. The patio seating is huge and nice. We tried the daily special Linguine which was pretty good. Triple chocolate mousse cake with the rasberry sauce was delicious.

I work nearby so I go eat lunch at Tuscany frequently. I think the food is really great and as italian I truly appreciate this restaurant's cuisine. Today I have been served by Roberto, he is like me from Italy, who was kind enough to let me eat something I requested even though it was not on the menu today. I had lamb chops with Gorgonzola risotto and it was the tastiest thing ever :) thank you Roberto for being so nice and it was nice having our conversation!!Paolo

Waited forever for some gelato because nobody was watching that part of the restaurant. The woman making hot foods on 4/14/16 at 2:15pm finally barked rudely at us to "step up" to the sandwich counter to we wanted to order. We told her twice we wanted gelato, and then she just said, "order at the register". Of course we had been waiting under the sign that said, "order gelato here" for over ten minutes and multiple people had gone ahead of us. At least the girl working the cash register was friendly and she seemed apologetic for the harsher woman. She gave is extra large servings of gelato and only charged is for one scoop each, but we didn't finish it because the pistachio flavor wasn't great and tasted really artificial. I would not stop in here again.

Good service! Good Food! I recommend Spaghetti Frutti Di Mare ( Seafood Pasta ) The seafood was decently fresh, Wish they had better bread to go with the amazing olive oil and roasted garlic that was given! Desert ,chocolate mousse, was the best part of the meal, rich and luscious, but  I wouldn't eat a lot and then eat it! Very heavy but in a good way, over all 3 Star!

Based off a friend's recommendation, we had dinner here last night, and it is definitely a place we will be back to.  First off is the garlic spread and bread.  Truly delicious - and definitely, if you like a little spice - get the jalapeno olive oil.  We shared a bottle or two among the table and that, too, was good.I started with the Caesar salad and it was large enough for my husband and I to share.  Good - but not the standout of the night.  That was the entrees.  I had the Fettuccine Primavera and my husband had the Agnoloti Burro e Salvia.  The mixture of vegetables in my dish was really nice as everything was cut up bite size and then I added the jalapeno spread for an additional kick.  I didn't try my husband's, but he loved his dish, too.For dessert, we shared the cannoli - which we thought was really good.Everyone at our table really enjoyed their meal, and I would definitely be back.  It does get loud at the restaurant, so it's not really a 'romantic' place to go.  Our service was really good and even though we stayed longer than we should have at our table, the restaurant was very nice and never really kicked us out.

One of my favorite Italian restaurants.  The Taylor location is very noisy, you can hardly hear anyone at the table without yelling.  The Wheeling location is big and very comfortable.  Love the baked garlic spread for the bread.   Try the grilled calamari.  Many good pastas.  Great food for the price $$.  Tiramisu !! Yum
True Chicago Italian..loud fast excellent service and great food.  The grilled octopus was a bit salty but yummy.  The drinks are always spot on.

Wow, what a difference since we were here  last time. A cold welcome from manager Alex and even colder,  truly rude welcome  from  hostess. Reservation was made for party of four and we were on time. Since one couple was behind to park their car, we were told that if all four of us are not in we cannot be seated.  That it will be, I quote,  "waste of place"! The other couple was late a total of 4 minutes. When you have that many tables open, this was really unnecessary and unpleasant, having in mind we have been coming here for years.Our server Alfredo was great as always.

What happens when a previously excellent restaurant does something strange twice?Owned by the Phil Stefani Signature Restaurants with three locations, Tuscany has always been a friendly, moderately priced, upscale Italian restaurant that pays particular attention to service and product. They've always been very accommodating.Anyone who bothers to read anything I write knows that I was raised with a grandmother that taught me that garlic is a bulb from the onion family.  She taught me that it should be used sparingly - as in, heat the olive oil in an iron pan and rub the raw garlic across the oil - then toss out the garlic.  She also said that tomato paste was an American invention (Ref: Chef Boyardee) and that if you wanted your sauce thick, you cook it all day. You don't add paste as a thickener. Restaurants that add paste are cheating their customers. You also notice that most of those customers end up eating Zantac and Tums as dessert due to the fact that the sauce was undercooked and has about a thousand times more acid than non-paste sauces that are cooked properly.I note these things as a public service and to their credit, Tuscany understands fresh ingredients.  That said, If you've read other reviews here and the writer raves about the toasted garlic, smashed and served in olive oil, I would suggest that they have (to say the least) an uneducated palate. If you want to eat raw or toasted garlic before your meal, you might as well lick a brine block as you'll actually taste nothing that's served after the fact.Does Tuscany serve garlic as an appetizer? Yes!  If you don't like it then don't eat it... easy.  Do they pay attention to detail and help the customer enjoy the experience? Most of the time - yes.The problem is that on our last two visits we've been served portions that are extraordinarily small.We start with the brick oven pizza. It's always good and there's no need to special order anything about it.  Obviously we need modify the pasta (sans garlic) and do so.The last time we ordered the Penne E Capesante ($22) and this time the Ravioli Della Casa ($18). On both occasions the pasta was cooked perfectly and the flavor was great. The serving size was amazing small. In the case of the ravioli, four squares for $18. Why?  When they place the food in front of you, you stare at it as if it were a joke.  Four pieces of pasta on this big, white plate!Then I realized - it's the menu!  There's been a shift in the way they're doing business. Somehow, someone has decided that Northern Italian cuisine has to be "small plates" and multiple courses. This is why you only get a few bites in each course and why, not coincidentally, the overall bill is higher than usual.This is not the way it used to be at Tuscany nor is it the way true Italians serve in Northern Italy.  I know because I have family who own a restaurant in Florence. I've eaten there and you're lucky to walk out with any measure of an "American" calorie count.  As the comedian John Pinette said, "they kept bringing us food to try.  After we'd eaten several dishes they said "okay - now you order!"  That's an accurate account of the generous nature of food as a presentation of life.  Italian food is not tapas and never has been.For many years we've enjoyed Tuscany. Now it's degraded due to economic revisions. "Oh, they won't notice!"  Believe me, we noticed.  Now off our list of excellent food at a good value.

I had a lovely time having dinner at the Tuscany Restaurant, and it was not just because I was with some good friends. The restaurant is on the eastern end of Little Italy and is a traditional upscale Italian bistro with classic red sauce dishes. On our hot Chicago night, the windows were closed, but I could imagine them open on some enchanted evening. We had reservations and were seated promptly by the attentive, but reserved staff.As a word of caution, the portions are very large here. We started with a grilled octopus salad which was my first time eating that particular sea creature. I could tell it was prepared well, but I just did not enjoy it. My second course of gnocchi was truly amazing. The handmade gnocchi with ragu was enormous, but I devoured it with gusto and would love it over and over. Unfortunately, this made my main course of veal parmigiana a labor of love. The veal chop was massive, taking up the entire dinner plate and of course was served with a bowl of gemelli pasta. Dessert was enticing, but the presence of well stuffed doggie bags on our table signaled that we were spent.Overall, this is a great place to take friends or your date. It is a classic Italian restaurant nice enough to impress, but still enjoy on a random Tuesday. I wish we had a nice place like this back home in Sacramento, but I will still dream of that gnocchi at night until I return.

Good service!The garlic + oil they give with the bread was really good, I could keep eating that !We got the RAVIOLINI DI PERA and GNOCCHI CON BURRATA. Both were good and really flavorful. What I liked about both dishes was that they were very different. Also, they portion size is massive so we had left overs :)We also got the chocolate mousse cake for dessert. This was AMAZING, the chocolate was dense but the whipped cream it comes with isn't very sweet so helps balance it out!

I had dinner here with a group of co-workers for an out of town speaker.   Excellent service, traditional Italian dishes, a ton of food, an old-school Italian feel, nothing terribly expensive.   If you want to have a nice filling Italian meal you can't go wrong, I had the Funghi E Taleggio pizza and it was like a salad and a pizza in one, big as my chest.  So saturated....not a good place for a diet!

Carpaccio, the cinchiale is just amazing! The best Italian place for me so far! The 3 cheeses risotto? Divine! I have not ordered anything in this place that I didn't love.The staff is knowledgeable of the menu and their wine. Love this place

Favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago.  Got my friend hooked on it so she has to go there every time she's in the city.  The waitstaff is very friendly, and once they brought my sister multiple entrees to try when she couldn't make up her mind on what to order.  I usually order a chicken or pasta dish.  The dessert selection is exceptional!

Been here two times and not disappointed at all. Simply amazing authentic, Italian cuisine. The service is nice, waiters are very informative and the food is just delicious! My personal favorite and a must try is the Fettucini Alfredo - handmade pasta and fresh Alfredo sauce, couldn't get any better. I also liked the little spread the make on the table, consisting of  of roasted garlic, Parmesan cheese and olive oil with bread. Apart from Fettucini, their margarita flatbread pizza is also very flavorful. Valet parking is for $7. I suggest making a reservation before going. I will definitely return!!

Had a good meal at Tuscany after an afternoon spent wandering around Little Italy. The warm atmosphere of the restaurant and our waiter with a heavy Italian accent made us feel like we'd been transported to Italy.Unfortunately we were not starved due to several pre dinner cocktails and noshing on their delicious bread with olive oil and garlic so we skipped appetizers and went straight for ordering pasta dishes. My boyfriend went with the pasta special of the evening, a linguini with seafood in a spicy marinara. He was pleased with the dish and I loved what I sampled.I went with the Agnoloti Burro e Salvia. I'd had a similar dish at Tuscany's sister restaurant, 437 Rush and absolutely loved it. It was good at Tuscany but not quite as good as Rush's variation which surprised me seeing as Tuscany is more Italian focused.
