I checked out this location this evening and Saul and his team definitely impressed. Get the seasonal sangria (peach) and thank me later. The food was amazing and I'll be back!

I really like Nando's. It opened at this location a month or so ago, and the day before their grand opening they had a "friends & family day" where they let us eat there for free! No alcohol yet at the time, but now it looks like they got their license.Food: I had the 1/2 chicken, hot, with Portuguese rice. Yummy!Service: The waiters were nice and helpful.About time the Roosevelt Collection had a decent restaurant!

I was initially so excited to find out that Nando's would be opening in the Roosevelt Collection.Today I dined in and had my usual from Nando's, half chicken all white meat (well done), fries with peri peri mayo, and the garlic bread. It was perfect! All Nando's are good, but this new location stands out.Every aspect of my visit was superior. The facility is clean and the layout was great. The team working there was enthusiastic and passionate. Alexis who took our order was very friendly and she asked our names and went out of her way to host our dining experience with excellence.If you want Nando's, south loop is by far the best in the city out of all their locations. I will be back again and again and tell everybody I know to dine here!

Had my first taste of Nando's in the UK, it's a favorite there with a larger menu selection. At any rate, I was too excited when it opened on Randolph! I have been to at least three locations in the city and I've never been disappointed! Peri Peri wings are delish!!
I love the food here!!Chicken is so fresh and it has good sauces .....But the one star is going down because the meat to the bone is very less.... Not worth the money we spent !!!
Great food and amazing environment over all five star experience and we love being at roosevelt collection and this is our food option whenever we are there.
Ambience, on point- Food, amazing- Service, spectacular. I love the little outdoor patio overlooking the city. Such a great addition to the Sloop.
This review is about the people working there including the manager ,none of them had  a smile or or looked happy to be there , I visited other locations and this one was a total desepointment ,

Had a early dinner today with friends and we really enjoyed this location. The staff is super friendly and the manager Jalisa was super helpful with suggestions on what to have. I definitely recommend the rice it's so good! Great place to have lunch and dinner!

I am in Chicago on business and my colleagues and I met for a late dinner at NANDOS. I was skeptical at first because chicken had never been my favorite but oh my goodness was this delicious. The staff was incredibly knowledgable about their menu because I had a lot of questions. The young Woman taking our order was so patient. When the food arrived it was absolutely fabulous. I ordered the chicken legend it was cooked perfectly....so full of flavor. The wine, the company, the chicken, the drinks, and the atmosphere were perfect. The prices were extremely reasonable. next time I'm in Chicago this will be my first to go to place.

Great food & great service. The first person I met at the store was the GM. I was impressed. We also got a free meal. I appreciate at it because I feel the company wants to get it right & it's not all about making money. The food was delicious & worth the wait. I can't tell if it's a restaurant or fast food. But whatever it is. It's a innovative way of going out to eat nowadays & I love it. I love the fact they have glass cups instead of plastic. What a great way to cut back on paper waste. My food was hot off the grill. Which was also a plus. & every item is customizable. Rather you want it plain-ish or hot. I love it & from now on always be considered for dinner or lunch
This was the best Nandos I've ever been to. It was soo delicious. The chicken was amazing!!!

Loved it!  Reminded me of my first encounter with Nando's in DC, except they have a beautiful rooftop overlooking the Chicago skyline.  Great addition to Chicago for a healthier not-so-fast food/not white tablecloth option.

Stopped here after seeing a movie, I was pretty impressed. I had the chicken breast wrap with red skinned mashed potatoes and garlic bead. My husband had the half chicken breast with corn on the cob and Portuguese rice. Good food and good service. On our walk home we discussed that we definitely will be back.
Super yummy food and the employees went out of their way to make our experience great. Love the outdoor seating (the inside AC was set to ice cold). We will be back.
Hands down the best nandos location in Chicago! Hope it stays this way! Great foodand excellent service!!!

I need to start off with a confession of guilt. I have been working in the southwest corner of River North for ten months now. Why I waited this long to try this place, I don't have a reasonable explanation.I went in and ordered an oil spill which, is the BP, or combination of brisket and pulled pork. Unfortuantely, they were out of sliced brisket, so I went with chopped instead. I got slaw for my side and I got a free cornbread since I was a first time customer.They give you whatever sauces you select on the side and they ahve six to choose from. I didn't care for the Chicago style with the Old Style beer in it. The KC one had a tang and worked well on the brisket. Next time, I think I'd try the Memphis on it though. But the winner, was the pulled pork topped with the South Carolina mustard sauce. I've had a few mustard based sauces that were just overwhelmingly strong. This sauce was well-balanced between sweet, smoky, spicy, and bitter and it was an ideal complement to the pork. The slaw was a fine side. It had a blend of vinegar, a touch of mayo (thank God, not too much) and some red apple, which made it different than any other slaw. I think I'd try their beans next time though.And I have to give some love to their beverages. They have an excellent homestyle lemonade on fountain with free refills. Also, their sweet tea is freshly brewed and marvelous. Combining these two together makes an ideal Arnold Palmer.As far as Chicago BBQ is concerned, I'd probably have to give the edge still to Smoque just because they have such good ribs and their peach cobbler dessert. But for a limited menu, this place is dynamite and I hope they continue to expland and come to the suburbs.

Pretty good barbecue!I got the Beef Brisket Platter with the side of Mac n Cheese. The Mac n Cheese is SO good! Super crispy, but it is oily. I like that they ask you if you want the beef brisket to be the fatty slices or the thin slices! I would definitely come back here again. Service is quick, even during busy hours.The sitting area is busy during lunch time, but you can still grab a seat if it's just you and a friend. There were a lot of little flies or fleas (?) or something which really detracted from my eating experience because I was shooing them away while trying to enjoy my beef brisket.

I honestly don't know why I didn't come here sooner when I literally passed by this place on the way to work every day and smelled the delicious barbeque, but better late than never right?I got the breakfast bowl with brisket with the Kansas City style sauce. It comes with a generous portion of eggs, potatoes, and brisket, and topped with the KC sauce, it was absolutely delicious. The brisket was very well seasoned, and the KC sauce had a very interesting tang in addition to the heat. The price was amazing for the location and the portion size was perfect for breakfast--enough to keep your stomach full for a while, but not enough to knock you out.Will definitely be back to try the cornbread and the other sauces!

Been a few times for lunch and have always been satisfied. Most recently I ordered the trio (brisket, pulled pork, chicken), with a side of baked beans and cornbread. I also got the optional side of pickles (FREE). The brisket is tender and flavorful. The nice thing about the brisket is that it's sliced to order so it retains all the moisture and juices. The pulled pork and chicken were equally tasty. They have a multitude of sauces to choose from and a limited sides menu.I tried the North Carolina which is a vinegar-based sauce and Kansas City which is thicker and spicier. The baked beans are prepared with what looked like to be pork. The cornbread was moist and flavorful and had bits of corn throughout. Overall a decent lunch spot for quick BBQ and a nice change-up to the Loop lunch rotation.

A great lunch spot in the loop. Instead of going to your typical deli, try out some quick but quality bbq! Chipotle style ordering, so even long lines go by fast. I got the brisket salad with all the toppings, including corn bread, with the Chicago style sauce. This was a great combo. The brisket was delicious and tender, and the sauce was tasty. The cornbread  crumbs were especially yummy and sweet too. Even the salad was a very filling meal, so you get your bang for your buck at this place! A nice change from your average work lunch.

I got introduced to this bbq joint 2 years ago when I started working at the loop. We even had Blackwood Fridays at the office where a bunch of my colleagues heads over here before it gets too crowded for lunch. They do get really packed but the prep line is so efficient everytime, you'll be out with your order in about 10-15mins.If I feel eating healthy I go for the salad otherwise I'll take a pile of meat, 1/2lb with side of pickles, brisket platter baby! Top it with Chicago (simmered with old style lager) + Kansas style sauce for that sweet n' spicy blend. The brisket salad taste equally amazing with all the veggie garnish please. Beans, corn, carrots, onions, pickles then a choice from fatty, lean, or in between chunk of meat. My go to sauce for the salad is the vinegar based North Carolina style. They do have other meat choices like the pulled chicken and pulled pork which I would think is good but not as great as the brisket . 15Hours in the smoker wraps that flavor to the beef and makes that extra tender meat. Don't skip a side order of the crunchy crust and gooey inside mac n' cheese that comes in little cupcake sized foil cups.And whoever thought of bbq for breakfast for a little over 5 bucks is a genius! I'm a fan of eggs+taters+brisket with Alabama white sauce. They recently added the buttermilk biscuit and eggs sandwhich with your choice of either pulled pork or brisket smothered with cheddar on top. The breakfast of champs! They do serve the la colombe coffee too for 99cents. I'm a fan so hope you guys branch out to the burbs soon.

Dropped by the restaurant around 1 pm on a Wednesday. There was no line at all with a few people seated on the small seating area. The staffs are very friendly and the food came out quickly.I ordered the pulled pork platter with the famous apple coleslaw on the side while my friend ordered the beans and mac and cheese on the side.The pulled pork was really nice and tender. We both chose the chicago style sauce. The sauce can be overwhelming so if you can, try asking them to put it on the side or something. Next time I'de want to try the memphis rub, heard a few people ordering that while I was waiting for my food.Overall, a good portion for 8.9 dollars and a quick meal.

A coworker and I decided to try out Blackwood for lunch today. We got there a little after noon so prime lunch rush. There was a long line, but it moved quickly. We both ordered the salad with beef brisket. They give you the option of a fatty cut, lean cut, or in between. I went with the in between and choose all the toppings to go on the salad plus the apple dressing. We took the lunches to go as there wasn't much seating available there. Price for my salad was 10 bucks and some change. When we started eating the salads in our office, my coworker noticed that I didn't receive any cornbread croutons!! Guess the person who made my salad forgot that when I asked for all the toppings. Overall, the salad was really good and didn't even need the dressing since there was so much going on in the bowl already.I'd go back again but would be sure to keep a watchful eye so that those cornbread croutons aren't forgotten...

This place was pretty crowded (a good sign), got in the curvy line that went by pretty fast and ordered the 1/2 lb Beef Brisket Platter for  $9.99.  Comes with house pickles and a side of your choice.  I chose the 3 Cheese Mac with panko crust.  Let me tell you... that was one good MAC!!!  Recommended!The brisket was very flavorful and tender soft.  You also get to choose your BBQ sauce.The service was just ok.  A few of the ladies expressions didn't look like they wanted to be there; no greet no smile.There are some seatings in the restaurant, but doesn't look comfortable.  Seems to be more of a take out place.  PLUS... you don't want to go back to the office smelling like you've been smoke'n ribs all day.My next items to try... the Pulled Pork Platter with the Elote Corn Salad.Sounds divine doesn't it?

Oh how I wish there was a Blackwood BBQ closer to home.  If you love pulled pork sandwiches you must try this place.The staff was so helpful in helping me choose which sauce I wanted for my pulled pork sandwich even allowing me samples to try until I decided.  I went with the Chicago style because I felt out of the 6 options it had the best combination of a smokey and sweet flavor.  For sides we chose the beans and the mac and cheese.  Due to the fact we were first timers there we also were given free corn bread!Let's just say we both finished our meals quickly and did not do much talking because they were that tasty.  I haven't had a pulled pork sandwich that was so tender and juicy in my life.  The sauce was not drowning the pork at all which at times makes it unbearable to eat considering the bread becomes soggy.  Out of the sides I think the mac and cheese was my favorite.  They pride themselves in their mac and cheese and rightfully so.  Before we left the staff asked us how we liked them and were overjoyed to see how happy we were.My experience here was probably one of my favorites while in Chicago.  From the food to the wonderful service we received if I could I would give this place a 10 out of 10.

Straightforward delicious bbq. Choose between a sandwich or platter, choose your meat, choose your sauce, choose your sides. I got the brisket platter - half lean and half fatty (I appreciated that they asked what cut I'd like) - slathered in Chicago-style sauce with mac & cheese and cornbread.The brisket was soft and juicy but slightly chewy. The Chicago-style sauce was pretty good - definitely better than I expected: sweet yet tangy in a good way. The pickles were alright. The mac & cheese left something to be desired. But the cornbread was soooooo good. I haven't had cornbread that good in awhile. It had a sweetness to it that wasn't overpowering, and it was perfectly moist with the right density.More like a 3.5 simply because of the cornbread and lack of other delicious bbq options in the area. I like that they don't drown the meat in sauce so you can actually taste it. The facility was clean and catered to the surrounding offices.

SMOKE IN THE CITYEveryone loves a good BBQ but where do you go in Chicago? This place is like the Chipotle of BBQ and they are slammed by lunch time. The large staff behind the counter runs like a finely oiled machine. They are ready to have your selected food packed for you but be prepared to eat elsewhere because it is small inside. I ended up having a nice BBQ picnic near the Chicago river.The staff was fantastic. I couldn't decide between the the pulled pork or the brisket and they suggested I get both meats. They will split a single portion of meat among two different meats which is great if you are eating here for the first time. I had no idea they would do this because it is not on the menu board. So I was really glad that I asked the guy behind the counter my question.The hard part was to decide which sauces to get. I decided to go with a Kansas City Style BBQ sauce on my pulled pork and an Old Style Based BBQ sauce on my brisket that was called Chicago Style. I looked over at the PitMaster to see if he approved with my sauce selections and he gave me a big head nod. That really made me feel very confident in my sauce choices. I must admit both sauces were really good. They have 6-8 different sauces to choose from. I wish I could have tried them all. Maybe on my next visit.The PitMaster whispered something to one of the staff members and the next thing I knew the staff all did a giant yell saying, "First Timer!" I thought that was really cool and less embarrassing then a version of Happy Birthday at Applebee's. It was a great way to acknowledge a newbie and make them feel special.Ordering here Is similar to a cafeteria counter where you walk along the glass making your selections. Next up for me to choose from was my sides. I wanted all of them and finally settled on the Baked Beans and the Mac N Cheese. The guy behind the counter also threw in a free corn bread. He told me that because it was my first time he was giving me a gift. This is definitely better then a birthday song at Applebee's plus the food is way better here.All three sides were good but if I had to pick one then I would go with the baked beans. These things rocked. I am going to say they are the best baked beans I've had in a long long time. In fact, when I come back here next time I may get two servings of them. I wish they had a larger double order. Yes they were that yummy.I also loved the meats but the pulled pork was my favorite. I would surely come back for that. All of the meat is available in a platter form, sandwich or salad. So depending on your mood you can choose accordingly. They even had pulled chicken but I did not try that.So if you're craving some BBQ in the city then this is your place. The staff will have you in and out in a flash. The food is really tasty. I can hardly wait until I am in the area and I can come back in for some BBQ. I also promise you that it smells really good. There is nothing like some meaty smoke smell in the air.  Stop in for a smell and leave with some meat.

I came here for lunch the other day with some coworkers.  I had the salad and it was just OK.  No avocado which for a BBQ salad is kind of odd- its basically just pulled chicken or pork with a few veggies.  Next time I'll do the platter but I would come back here for a great salad if they added more ingredients down the line!

Quick BBQ at a decent downtown price?  Count me in!I had the pulled pork platter which was a nice serving and include a side.  The meat was perfect - not too dry.  I had the side of mac & cheese which also hit the spot.  And the BBQ sauces were great!  I can't wait to try them all.The real beauty to this place though is the convenience of being able to get in and out.  It has a Chipotle type setup where they prepare your food in front of you while in line.  I was able to get in and out in about 8 mins (right before the noon rush hour).  Seating is limited so plan to take your food back to the office or sit outside if you go during the lunch hour.

Food is good, small portions.  Where they have faltered is their delivery.  My office of 10-15 employees ordered lunch for the office twice from Blackwood BBQ, twice they got the order wrong and were 1.5 hours late to deliver.  In this day and age, if you can't do catering right, why even open the doors.
Very pricey for lunch bbq, tab 33 dollars for two sandwiches with drinks. but the food was good. mac and cheese was good  as well as the cornbread. chipotle potato salad so/so.

I've tried the pulled pork and the brisket.  Prefer the pork, I tried Carolina and Memphis sauce and enjoyed both.Really like the cornbread- didn't care for beans.  This place is popular with lines out the door.BTW- they are open for breakfast.

After my recent not-so-nice experience, I decided to give Blackwood another try. One of the partners, Jon, reached out to me about my previous visit almost immediately after I posted my review. Through talking with Jon, it's evident that they really listen to their customers and take feedback very seriously.  Jon met me when I showed up for my usual yardbird salad, sought additional feedback on how they can improve and apologized that I received service below my expectations.I also went back separately a 2nd time to see how Blackwood fared on my own... And I have to say they passed with flying colors. Everyone was super friendly and helpful and the whole ordering process couldn't have been better - the way it should be.  They also labeled the toppings on the glass per my suggestion (see previous review)! If that doesn't show their dedication to the customer's feedback, I don't know what does.I feel it necessary to update my review - because after all, doesn't everyone have a bad day now and again???

Them beans be bumpin'! I skipped salad day downtown and I'm so glad I did. I ordered my pulled pork platter online to beat any lunch crowd that might await me. No need at 11:15 though, there was only one person in the ordering line. For about $12, I walked out with a tube of pulled pork, baked beans, Cole slaw, a corn bread muffin, and a tasting of pickles. I say tube only because it were wrapped in foil like a Supreme tamale.The piggy was juicy and nicely seasoned. I got a little smoke from some pieces of outside, but it wasn't that much. Too bad though because the rub was fantastic. I wasn't anticipating likely the KC sauce as much as I did but I wound up finishing one of the little cups. It had the chile powder flavor I know from Arthur Bryant's, but it wasn't as overwhelming. With its nice heat, it paired beautifully with their slightly sweet pickles.Did I mention the beans? I liked how the sauce wasn't too thick and there were other visible vegetables. Sorry veg-heads, there's pulled pork in there so it's not for you. The corn bread muffin...again, something I didn't expect to devour but did. Blackwood is the bomb!

Blackwood is a fast casual chipotle style BBQ spot. During lunch, you first pick between a sandwich, plate or salad and then you pick your meat, sauce, and toppings. It's a similar setup during breakfast where the base is eggs + potatoes and then you choose your meat and sauces.I've had both the brisket and the pulled chicken and both are quite tasty. The brisket is perfectly moist and juicy and fatty - but not too fatty. And when I'm feeling super healthy, I opt for the chicken instead. Let's be real though - I get the brisket 90% of the time!The sauces are all made in house and are named after the city that inspired it. I think that the South Carolina (tangy mustard) goes well mixed with the Kansas City (spicy red). Just make sure to keep your eye on the person squeezing on the sauces because sometimes they can get a bit heavy handed for my taste.Lunch time prices are a good value for the quality and portion sizes (~$10). But the real bargain is at breakfast time when you can get a plate full of fresh eggs, potatoes, and bbq meat for about ~$4, which is less than I would pay for a microwaved Starbucks breakfast sandwich !!

DON'T LEAVE WITHOUT TRYING THE MAC AND CHEESEBlackwood has awesome flavor and a great staff! The line is a little intimidating around lunch time, but it moves fast I PROMISE!I've tried the entire menu, including the breakfast (YES THEY HAVE BREAKFAST). If you're in the mood for good brisket, pulled chicken, or pulled pork...this is your place.Personal recommendation is the Beef Brisket in-between and a side of mac and cheese!ENJOY!

UPDATE: The manager reached out to me and gave me the option of calling in my order. Not as convenient, but I'm adding a star for their timely and helpful response.Blackwood, why on earth did you remove the "pay in store" option from your online order system?? This used to be one of my favorite lunch spots but now there's no option to order ahead of time and pay when you pick up your order. If you pay with your credit card online, it doesn't go towards your Spring rewards, and the lines are too long in person. Are you deliberately trying to turn people off your loyalty programs?? Or do you hate lunchtime diners? Very sad about losing one of the better fast lunch options in this area. Let's just say Specialty's is getting a lot more business from me these days.

"Fast Food" BBQ that is actually good? I am as shocked as you are.But it's the truth. Everything that I have had a Blackwood -- pulled pork, brisket, mac and cheese, cornbread -- has been absolutely delicious. I wouldn't even hesitate to put their brisket up against the best in the city. Also, the sauces are REALLY good, each one bringing something different to the table.It's not the best barbeque that I have ever had persay, but for a "Chipotle-esque" fast casual joint, Blackwood definitely ranks supreme.

I am very confused how Blackwood has such high ratings.  It's basically Chipotle, but for BBQ.My fiancé and I were looking for a place to meet for lunch between our offices and decided to stop in here.  I'll give 1 star for quickness and 1 star for variety of sauce options.  Everything else was quite underwhelming and quite frankly, I felt like I was part of an assembly line.  I had the pulled pork with corn salad and my fiancé had the pulled chicken with corn bread.  All was meh at best. Not to mention, we thought the portions were quite small for the price.Being that it was our first time here and we didn't think they were busy...maybe 3 other people in line, we felt rushed by the "line of employees" and not welcomed to ask questions about items.If you have the time to go get BBQ someone else in the city, I'd highly recommend it.  If not, I'd choose another cuisine for lunch.  Chipotle is right around the corner.  :)Having spent 5 years in Texas, I may be over critical on BBQ, but I feel I would still not give high ratings for this place.  I likely won't return, as there are better BBQ joints in the area and throughout the city.

Blackwood BBQ makes me think of that old school saying - "So good, make you wanna smack yo' mama!"Yep, it's that damn good, but I promise not to smack you mom!  :p  My go to is the pulled pork platter which comes with two sides and your choice of, I do believe 5 different sauces.  Chicago sauce is a little sweet, a little tangy and a little spicy and the one I always pick.  Then you have a Memphis, a Kansas, something else and that nasty Alabama sauce which is nothing but spicy mayonnaise.  But what do those country Bamas know about good BBQ sauce?  In any case, the pork comes from happy free range and antibiotic free piggies, never frozen and who doesn't like feasting on happy piggies??  I've heard the brisket is good but I haven't tried it.  Looks tasty though.  A few complaints.  The mac n cheese sides are TOO SMALL!  Something that delicious needs to come in bigger portions!  My stomach demands it!  Also, I don't think cornbread should be a side that you have to pay for!  That's like paying for your toast with your omelet!  Stop being greedy!If you work anywhere near this place, PLEASE check it out!  But not too often or you'll get fat.  Or type II diabetes, whatever comes first
Good BBQ, but very overpriced.  Brisket sandwich, nothing extra, with 2 small sides = $15.  First and last time I'll visit Blackwood.

Had the pulled pork platter with Mac and cheese, and was not disappointed.  Went with the Chicago-style sauce because Chicago.  Highly recommended if you are in the area!  I could probably eat just the Mac and cheese by itself, but I digress.  Very nice staff as well!

Amazing, amazing, amazing! I was visiting over the weekend from Boston...didn't expect to be eating bbq in Chicago but I am so glad I did! The line was pretty long but we went towards lunch time so it was expected. Don't let the line stop you from waiting it moves quick and you get your food right away. I went with the 'smokey woo woo' which came with two dog and was AMAZING! I'm craving this as I'm tying this...please open one in Boston!

I'm from Texas and I literally can't get over how amazing the brisket is here. Slow-cooked and the flavor is on point. Portion size is also good, so come hungry. The mac & cheese is just ok -- very creamy, but would be better if they added more breadcrumbs.Oh -- it's also BYOB and there's a liquor store right across the street :)I will definitely be back!

For the Loop's fast lunch crowd, "good" food is usually sacrificed for faster and cheaper. Not so here.Though its fast BBQ, the meat has been slooooow cooked well in advance of you scarfing it down.Get the brisket. No seriously get the brisket. No pictures will do it justice, just go try it. And don't let "BBQ" deter you, as you can get very tasty options that aren't BBQ-heavy and send you to an afternoon slumber as you try to do some work.

I tried Blackwoods BBQ for the first time last week. It was a gorgeous, sunny Chicago spring day and what better way to enjoy it than to get some BBQ, right?!? I went to the location on Lake Street in the Loop. When you walk in you'll notice that  Blackwoods is very sleek, clean and modern. If you didn't know the store was there you'd miss it as you walk by the concrete and glass office building it is in. You can't smell any BBQ while walking by making me wonder where they cook their meat. This runs counter to the way many think of BBQ. If you go down south BBQ places tend to be a little more rustic, etc. and you can often judge a BBQ joint by the aroma emanating from within. My favorite place is Bogart's in St. Louis. Getting hungry just thinking about it.I ordered a pulled pork sandwich with the "Memphis sauce" and a side of mac & cheese. The guy building my sandwich reached below the counter somewhere and produced a handful of pulled pork. Where did it come from?!? I have no clue. I'd like to see a BBQ place breaking down a pork shoulder behind the counter after it had cooked for hours upon hours but you don't see that here. There's just a mystery drawer with meat in it. All together, my lunch came to $9 which is pretty reasonable in the Loop for a non-sandwich place over the lunch hour.As for the food itself, it was quite good. The pork was tender, the sauce was sweet, and the brioche bun was great too! The only negative thing for me was how big the sandwich was (it's a little much for lunch) and the fact that the meat was luke warm at best. As for the mac & cheese, that was the best part of the whole meal! The cheesy crust on top was delicious and I could have eaten it all day!Overall, I'd give Blackwoods 4 stars. It's good food and it's adds some variety to the Loop lunch scene. Will I go back? Yup!

When I entered this place there were a few guys in suits,.. but everyone else (staff and clientele) looked like real deep south BBQ eaters.  I n fact one woman was from Memphis,.. so I thought maybe we were onto something.The menu is simple, and like usual,. that was a good thing. Brisket, pulled pork or chicken on a bun, a platter, or salad.  I did brisket on a platter and was not disappointed.  Wow, real deal, black and salty on the outside, tender inside, probably one of the best briskets I've had.  My wife had pulled pork on a bun,.. the bun itself was nothing special but that pork!  You get an extra side if you tell them it is your first time.What I liked also was the choice of sauces,.. being Canadian, i feel as if my knowledge of BBQ nuances is limited so was happy to be able to compare St. Louis style with Carolina etc.  The mac and cheese side was just normal as was the cornbread.If this place was here, I'd find myself there frequently.  As it is, I'll just have to curse Memphis Blues and pay for substandard.

Oh My Goodness!Ok... I'm from Texas and I'm very picky and particular when it comes to "good BBQ"I ordered the pulled pork with the Chicago style sauce, MY OH MY, it was so good.I didn't order the brisket due to the reviews on it, but everything I had was A1The MAC and CHEESE... wow... very good... No wonder it only comes in small "doses"My friend got one to go!The cornbread...mmm mmm mmm

Tried a new Bbq shop downtown called Blackwood Bbq. It's a mixed review. The brisket is a little overdone and not as tasty as I'd like. It's a bit on the dry side although the fat on it is very tasty and you can taste the brine which is excellent. The Chicago sauce and the Kansas city sauce were...  Interesting.  the Chicago sauce has too much beer taste to it and the Kansas sauce had too much of a spicy bite. The Mac and cheese is gone and was awesome. Corn muffin awesome. Pickles crisp and tangy like home made garlic and onion pickles.  Would I order again? Maybe just to give it a chance to redeem the dry meat.

The two stars is for the food, the one time my husband took me here. I wanted some more today, and all but ran to get there in time. I hadn't eaten all day, I was holding out for some bbq. Well, the kids working had already thrown the food out before close, told me they were "sold out" when clearly they were already tossing food and packing up their take-home food right in front of me.I don't care how good the food is, if that's their version of customer service, FUCK THAT.Went away mad, sad and hungry. Won't rush down there again.

Really great tasting BBQ at a good price point in the Loop. I had the brisket sandwich and mac and cheese which was awesome.This is a small place and it operates kind of like a Chipotle style ordering system. Not a lot of seating, more of a quick lunch type place.But no ribs here. Just pulled pork, chicken or brisket.6 different sauces, all very good. And friendly service as well. I'll be back.

Yum, yum, yum. Is this the best BBQ you'll ever taste...ever? Probably not...you're in Chicago not memphis. However, it is still amazingly delicious. The Brisket with in-between fat and lean is delightful. The pulled pork is alright. While the brisket is decent in a platter, it actually tastes best in the salad to cut through some of the heaviness. I personally prefer the Chicago and Kansas City sauces as they provide some sweetness with an underlayer of heat.As far as sides go, my coworker adores the cornbread. I think it is alright. My preference is their mac n cheese. Ooey and gooey inside, topped with a crunchy, buttery crust that adds some texture, it is a divine indulgence. Great lunch spot.

I have been very happy with the food here. However, as some other reviewers have mentioned, the customer service leaves something to be desired.I've felt very rushed on a couple of occasions. I've felt like the people behind the counter don't understand what I'm saying/asking and don't make an effort to or try to remedy the situation but instead continue to rush you.I was going through the line today ordering 2 platters. I got slaw on both and then they asked if I wanted cornbread. I said yes, one cornbread for mine. Employee says "are you sure you don't want one for the other? It's included". This leads me to think they changed their pricing so I say yes. Get to the cashier and he has charged me for the cornbread. I explain that the other employee told me it was included. He asks if I've been there before instead of asking which employee said that.  At this point, he should be trying to clarify what was said, and make sure HIS OWN EMPLOYEE knows their pricing. Neither he, nor the manager next to him offered to take back the cornbread and void that charge.I hope they improve upon their customer service so I'm more inclined to return.

This place was amazing. My boyfriend and I were visiting from DC and decided to get BBQ - mostly I just decided because I absolutely love BBQ. The thing is, I get pulled pork and mac and cheese at every BBQ joint I go to so I can have a standard to compare against (and maybe also because I really, really like both of those things). Let me tell you that Blackwood BBQ is at the top of the list! I got the pulled pork with South Carolina sauce and the mac and cheese and was so incredibly satisfied. Sometimes the mac and cheese is just pasta with some cheese thrown in, but this was not. The cheese and macaroni were so deliciously intertwined and inseparable that it was amazing. The pork was tender with just the right amount of some of the best mustard sauce I've ever had. The eating area was small but clean and well kept, and the staff seemed quite nice.Blackwood BBQ: my hat is off to you. Now if only you would open a joint in DC, my life would be complete :)

There was a line but I was in and out pretty quick. The brisket was tender and the you can't go wrong with any of the sauces! Macaroni and cheese was also very good alongside the meat.The sandwich looked good too!

I stopped into Blackwood BBQ last week for lunch since it's right by my job & I'm glad I did because it was a great meal & customer service experience! The ordering process is setup cafeteria style where you give your order at one station then move down to the next - everyone was pleasant and friendly! I even got a free cornbread muffin because it was my first time there! I ordered the brisket platter with it being "in-between" fatty & not so much with the Memphis style BBQ sauce  (which is sweet & tangy how I like!), a side of Mac & Cheese (amazeballs!) & the cornbread muffin with actual bits of corn. Everything was excellent!Gotta love a restaurant that takes care of their customers, has a great staff & amazing food; I will be back again!

It's hard to believe that the best BBQ I've had in Chicago has been at this limited-menu spot with weird hours of operation. But I did.Opting for the brisket platter, I was impressed when the man at carving station asked if I'd like the brisket "fat, lean, or in between." I took the in between and he proceeded to stack one lean  brisket on top of a fattier brisket and then carve off a good half-pound for me.This was some delicious brisket with outstanding smoke and just enough spice. The mac and cheese side was spot-on. perfectly cheesy with a nice cheesy crust on top that reminded me of creme brulee.A table card notes that Blackwood gets all of their seasonings from the Spice House. That says a lot. Spice House knows what they're doing and you can taste their expertise in the cue.Seating is pretty limited--maybe 15 seats total--so plan on coming very early or very late to avoid the midday business lunch crowd.

Fantastic barbecue at the NW corner of the Loop.  They stick to a pretty basic script here: do a few things and do it right.  My usual order is the brisket -- fatty cut.  Forget what your momma told you; FAT IS GOOD and it makes the meat more moist and flavorful.The sides are only ok.  The mac and cheese has a nice crust but should be a bit creamier.  Beans are nicely flavored with scraps of meat.WARNING: Blackwood gets very busy at lunch time and seating is scarce.

If you order beef, order the fatty cut.  I used to order lean or medium. Then I asked for a taste one day of the fatty and I'll never go back.  So juicy and tender.  Wow.My only complaint is I wish they stayed open later so I could pick up carryout to take home for dinner. And maybe if they expanded their sides a bit.  And if they had the sauce in my local grocery store!

First time here today with some coworkers. I've been really wanting some good bbq. OMG I think I've found my go-to lunch spot! Who knew there was amazing bbq downtown?!? The pulled chicken salad was SO good! The meat was tender, the toppings and apple vinaigrette were great. The mac & cheese?! I could probably eat it everyday!!! I wasn't expecting much for the mac but holy cow it was some of the best I've ever had. Definitely will be back soon.

How could you not love this place?  Pulled pork with spicy KC sauce was done just right. Generous 1/2 lb portion. Great slaw and cornbread.What a treat for a downtowner at lunch. I could kick myself for passing this place by before. The lines can get long. But worth the wait. Some of the best BBQ anywhere!

Great lunch time spot with delicious bbq. Service is always friendly and speedy. Line was out the door on my most recent visit and I was still eating my sandwich 5 minutes later.They follow the chipotle model of building your sandwich/salad/platter as you move down the line. Several sauce options, but I usually go with the Kansas City because it has some spice to it. Their homemade pickles and corn beard are also fantastic.

As a Chicago tourist, came to this spot for lunch. Be aware, there is a line for lunch as it seems like many people who work around here picks this or chipotle. The style of service is very similar to chipotle where you walk up to the line and order your entree. Then as you go down the line, you get to pick and choose what kind of side items to add to your platter/sandwich/salad.I ordered the brisket with half lean and half fatty cuts, drenched with the Chicago style BBQ sauce and North Carolina BBQ sauce on the side. I really recommend getting the Chicago sauce if you are visiting the city because it goes really well with the brisket. The North Carolina was a good sauce as well, but would be better on pulled pork since it is a bit sweet. Also, I've got the baked beans and Mac and cheese as my sides. Baked beans wasn't too special but it had chunks of meat in it! The Mac and cheese had a crust layer on top, and was creamy and cheesy throughout. Wouldn't go too crazy over the sides, but would recommend baked beans over Mac and cheese if I had a choice. Overall, had a great experience and recommend!

I have to admit, I was in Memphis this week and I prefer the Blackwood to the Q I had there.  This is sort of a spartan, no frills looking shop with a little bit of clutter showing on the line.   The sort of slid my meal down the line, almost like I was at the grocery store, but the food quality was pretty spot on.  I got the pork platter, got a bun for an extra price and the beans.  The beans were outstanding.  In fact, I sipped the remaining bean juice.  The pork was super moist and I had a very generous sandwich as a result.  I thought the vinegar sauce was quite good, the mustard was above average.Would I go back... yes... and even with the 4 degree weather and a 10 minute walk.
The meat here is so good! I always get the salads and they are very filling and delicious. The space is tiny, though, so don't expect to ever find a seat.

Can I give the corn bread 5 stars? I like it that much. it had real sweet corn in it!this was the 2nd time my office ordered lunch from here and I have never been at the store so I can't speak for service or ambiance. The food is just okay. I suppose this can cure your bbq fix and you can try out the different sauces (Memphis was good). The brisket was kind of dry and lacked flavor both times...I kept chewing on it and I got bored eating it. I liked the pulled pork more. They have a nice crust on the mac and cheese too.

Awesome bbq!  There's always a line so get there early.  Although even with a line the wait isn't bad and it's worth it!  My favorite is the beef brisket but I also like the pulled pork and chicken.  If you get the sandwich the buns are also pretty good.  They have different sauces to choose to your liking.  I heard the sides like mac and cheese and corn bread are also yummy but im trying to limit my fat intake :)  The staff is friendly and the price is right.  Smaller seating area so I usually take it to go. If your in the mood for bbq then this is the place!

This place is consistently great. If you like getting salads for lunch but still feel unsatisfied afterwards, this is a great fix for you. The line moves quickly and you can see the fresh meat being cut as you order. All of the meat looks great, but I recommend the pulled chicken in particular.2 tips:A. adding cornbread is always a great choice.B. ask them to go light with the salad dressing because it can be a bit much at times.

there was a huge line, but it moved fast.  pulled pork sandwich was delicious, though the bread was bagged bread, i think toasting it would have made it better.   the cole slaw addition is a must.  i tried the cornbread, mac&cheese, and beans.  the beans were the best, unique and flavorful.  the other sides were pretty good.
Great place for BBQ for lunchNot sure why they close so early, and are not open on the weekends

I'm not a BBQ guru but this was pretty tasty! It's a smaller place with limited seating but I liked the simplicity of the menu and the ease of ordering. I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with Kansas City sauce and it was pretty spicy!! I would definitely go back to try a different sauce.

Good food if you're looking for que. But if your lookin for your Carona drunk uncle wit those super tender ribs that are knuckle and nub tender (#sotenderyoucouldfeedittoanewborn) cause he forgot they were on da pit ribs. Not gonna get it. Got da smoked sandwich to a chipotle standard. Experts for profit at work.

Perfectly cooked brisket.  Above average mac n. cheese.  Long lines, but quick friendly service. For the price you won't find a better bbq option, especially not in the Loop. I definitely recommend if you're in the area. Keep in mind they close at 3pm M-F.

Excellent pulled pork sandwich; falling apart tender, fresh bun, good amount. Cole slaw was ok; next time, I'll try the other sides. My only complaint: I asked for a lot of BBQ sauce but didn't get enough and the extra I got when I asked was a TEENY little container. From the minuscule sauce taste he gave me at first, and the fact that sides were all extra, I had the feeling if I asked for another extra sauce, they'd charge me. What is it with restaurants being stingy with sauces??? It's like charging extra for ketchup; I'm giving you my business, give me some sauce, man! The Chicago and Memphis sauces were both good although neither as tomato-y, sweet and rich as I like. Unique though.Otherwise, excellent, no line at 1:30. Tasted the brisket and it seemed a bit dry although it looked yummy so maybe the "fatty" brisket next time.

The beef brisket platter was very good and probably some of the best I have had, especially in the Midwest. I had the North Carolina barbecue sauce and it did not overpower the smoky meat flavor. The North Carolina sauce is vinegar based. As far as lunch service goes, the operation runs smoothly. I was in and out the door in about 20 minutes.

What - good BBQ served in the Loop?  If you see the lunchtime lines forming outside Blackwood BBQ, you will believe that is true.  They serve a pretty simple lineup of food here.  You select from pulled pork, pulled chicken or beef brisket, served in a bun or as a stand-alone meat platter accompanied with a side.  You can choose from five sauces for your meat selection.  Once you pick your side item and beverage, you can pay up, so the service is relatively quick.  The interior is smallish so you would be lucky to get table space or one of the window counter seats.  There are two counter seats right by the entrance that should be occupied only as a last resort during crunch time, as I imagine everyone in the ordering line will want to smash into you.My lunch pal and I each ordered a platter for lunch.  I really enjoyed the pulled pork, tender and flavorful, drizzled with the Memphis-style BBQ sauce.  Watch out for tiny bone chips while biting down on the meaty goodness (I bit into two).  My pal had beef brisket with vinegar-y North Carolina-style sauce.  We each ordered the mac and cheese as a side.  Baked in individual foil cups, the mac and cheese has a crusty top, and it was a shame that the plastic cutlery was unable to scrape off each cheesy crunchy morsel from the foil.  Eating messy BBQ and sides in an outdoor plaza while wearing beige pants can be dangerous, so take care and enjoy.

Their line is as efficient as Chipotle's (and operates in a similar fashion), but the quality of their BBQ doesn't suffer. I went to school in South Carolina, and Blackwood's mustard BBQ sauce brought back memories. Highly recommend. Still don't understand how they do it. I no longer travel to Chicago for business, but am holding onto their punch card in hopes that one day, I can get the final 3 punches required for a free meal.

The BBQ beans were quite good but I found everyone else,... well good. It's BBQ and in the city so I guess that makes it special but does not compare to Smoque. Get on the blue line people, I know some brisket thats worth a trip to Irving Park.

UPDATE - 2016-04-15:  Blackwood has updated their salad to be a much-more substantial chopped salad, and I'm a BIG fan of it.  I enjoyed the old salad, but the new one kicks its ass hard.  I'm not as big of a fan of the new vinaigrettes, but not because they're bad.  They're actually quite good, but they just don't provide quite the satisfaction of my favorite salad dressing of their Chicago sauce mixed with ranch dressing.Over the past couple of years, I've tried brisket at 3 or 4 different Chicago BBQ restaurants, and it still amazes me how poorly they compare to Blackwood's brisket.  Blackwood's brisket is the best I've ever had.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Now they're slam dunking breakfast!  Either brisket on a croissant or pulled pork hash.  My favorite is the pulled pork hash - it's outstanding.  Scrambled eggs, potatoes, red pepper and onion with plenty of pulled pork and some sauce if you want.  It's a bargain at $3.  The meat is the star, but I commend them on the eggs, which are cooked perfectly, better than at places that supposedly specialize at breakfast.  Well done, as usual for Blackwood.UPDATE - 2013-08-08:  Well, Blackwood has gotten into a nearly perfect groove, so I had to ramp them up to 5 stars.  I've had lunch here at least once a week since they opened, and they keep hitting the ball out of the park.  It's my favorite lunch spot of the week without question, and I'm betting they'll remain there for a very long time.  Spectacular says it.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------A decent BBQ restaurant only 1/2 block from my office in the Loop???  Oh man, have we waited for a long time for a place like this to come along!  Thanks to their two free sampler platter days this week and their official opening on Thursday, I've had their BBQ each day this week except Monday and tried all but the Kansas City style sauce.  All the sides (cornbread muffin, baked beans, cole slaw and mac-n-cheese) are excellent.  I think the slaw and muffin are my favorites.  All the sauces I tried were also excellent.  The meats are very good (pulled chicken, pulled pork and brisket) and could use a bit more smoke to put them over the top.  Prices are in line for a very good quality everyday lunch spot in the Loop, especially considering the food quality.The co-owner Jon seems to appreciate getting constructive feedback (I've had the chance to chat with him a couple of times to offer feedback) and also seems well in tune with the importance of social media, so I'll offer some feedback.  I already mentioned that more smoke flavor could put things over the top.  I like more sauce than they put on the meat when served, but asking for a side sauce takes care of that (and is really how I prefer to do it).  I hear from others' comments at the office and online that they've had some consistency issues in portioning the meat - they'll get that worked out over time, after all they've only been officially opened two days!Overall, a welcome new lunch alternative in the area.  I'm guessing we'll be hitting Blackwood BBQ for lunch once a week for a while to come.
Went here before the Loop lunch rush. Quick service, tasty food, loved the memphis sauce (sweet and savory). No complaints!

Great lunch experience.  When my friend and I walked in, we got a resounding greeting from everyone.  Once they knew we were new, they started piling samples in front of us to have us try.  We settled on a brisket platter w/ a side of slaw, mac n chz, and corn bread (on them).  The brisket was tender - equal part fat & lean.  The mac was had a crusty top with an ooie gooie filling (wish there was more).  Yummy crunchy apple based slaw.  And the white choc macadamia was the perfect ending.

This place is delicious! Stopped here for lunch on our way out of town for a cabin weekend. There was a line out the door but it moved really quickly so don't let that deter you. We put 25 minutes on the meter and we were done eating and back to the car with 2 minutes to spare.We shared the pulled pork sandwich with the Chicago sauce. It was very good. The brisket sandwich looked amazing so I think we will try that next time we come back. We also ordered the mac & cheese (not my favorite of all time, but still very good) and baked beans which were delicious with bits of pork in them. I'll try the cole slaw and corn bread next time around! We also had the home made lemonade which was a bit on the sour side but a good pairing with the BBQ.Overall, a great dining experience - we will be back!
Food is okay. I think this place needs a reminder of their address...they are IN THE LOOP in Chicago. That's nearly 100% business. And, they don't offer wifi. Ridiculous.

Basically Chipotle with BBQ and better meat portions.I swear Chicago is the mecca of chipotle knock-offs that are even better than Chipotle and this is one of them. You get your choice of meat: pulled chicken, pulled pork, or brisket in a sandwich, platter, or salad. Genius idea for sure!What I tried:MAC AND CHEESE!!!: WOW WOW WOW. I don't even like mac and cheese that much but this was amazing. I could have eaten a whole big bowl of this stuff. Just try it.Brisket: I'd suggest getting the fatty version because it's more juicy but regardless this is pretty good, flavorful, and tender. And you get a really good portion of meatCornbread: also pretty good. I'd definitely choose the Mac and Cheese over this though but it is still good!Cole Slaw: a little more vinegary than I'm used to, but still solid. I mean you need some veggies after all this meat.South Carolina BBQ: This was my favorite bbq sauce. It's definitely very different from the usual BBQ sauce, this thing is good! Definitely worth a try. Sort of reminded me of honey mustard.Definitely one of my favorite lunch spots in the area and definitely a must try!

Quick awesome brisket. I saw other reviews and ordered FATTY brisket with chicago and Kansas City sauce.With a side of Mac and cheese which was fresh out of the oven.The meat is really good and soft. The Mac and cheese is ok.A little on the pricey side for not much meat but it's just enough.

I'm struggling between 3-4 stars on this one, but I'm sticking to 3 for the time-being.Chipotle-ordering-system-style BBQ? Genius, why didn't I think of this first?Let's start off with the great... that mac & cheese. Holy crap. It really is delicious, these Yelpers aren't lying. Super crispy crust on top, perfect warm gooey cheesiness inside. Moving on to the good... the coleslaw. I love me some creamy coleslaw, and this is only $0.99 so I figured why not give it a go. It was decent, but kind of bland... needed more celery seed or something perhaps? And now for the OK... and this is the unfortunate part b/c their name is, after all, Blackwood BBQ. The BBQ. I had the pulled chicken. It was just OK. There wasn't really any smoked flavor to speak of... all the flavor comes from the sauce that they put on (I had Memphis style because Duh) and the sauce wasn't even that flavorful. It was decent, I'd eat it again, yes, but I'm just not like WHOA BLACKWOOD HOLY WOW IT'S THE BEST EVER like some people.There was a line outside the door, we arrived at roughly 12:30, so that was to be expected... butthe line moved super fast, so don't fret on that. Staff was really friendly & funny, too.Basically we were comparing Blackwood to Husky Hog with every bite, and right now, Husky Hog is still the reigning champion of legit BBQ in Chicago. I'll give Blackwood another shot for sure, I love the concept & I mean, it's BBQ. Even when it's not mind-blowingly great, it's still freakin' BBQ.

We did a catering order with Blackwood on a whim and everyone in my office was very impressed.  Even the person from Kansas City.The brisket seemed to be the most popular option of the meats and was my favorite, but the pulled chicken and pork were also tasty.  Mac and cheese was rich and garlicky and the slaw had a nice flavor.  We got all the sauces.  My favorites were Memphis and Kansas City but others enjoyed the North Carolina.  They give you nice big bottles with a catering order.  Even the salad was a hit.This was one of our more affordable staff lunches and certainly  beats a sandwich platter.
Good sandwiches , chicken pork and beef are all good.  Mac and cheese is my go to side .  All the sauces are pretty good.  Long line if you go during peak hours. Pricey but good.
My office is just around the corner so I come here often.And bottom line - Brisket platter with Chicago sauce and mac&cheese on the side is the way to go.My mouth salivates just thinking about it

I absolutely had to try this place, because every time I walk by people are lined up down the block to satisfy their BBQ craving.  I decided to go around 1:00 p.m. which was great timing; there was still a line, but everyone fit inside the restaurant.  BTW the staff is awesome and they have their service down to a science; they make sure that the line moves quickly. If you plan on bringing a group, plan on sitting somewhere else because there's very little seating inside.I ordered the pulled chicken with the Kansas City sauce, which has a little more than a kick.  It's pretty spicy, but has a good vinegary bite.  I also tried the baked beans which are really good, but non-pork eaters beware because I'm pretty sure there's some pork in there.  The corn muffins were actually my favorite part of the meal; they're sweet and have little kernels of corn mixed in.  Definitely worth a try.
Delicious! Bbq brisket bowl with Chicago sauce and I drizzled the Carolina mustard on it. Yummmmm!

Having lived in the south for 15 years, including the BBQ strongholds of Texas and north Carolina, I am typically skeptical of "BBQ" places north of the Mason-Dixon line, especially in an area where people refer to any type of grilling as "BBQ" (tip: if it doesn't involve cooking the meat for at least 6 hours, you're grilling, not BBQ-ing).Anyway, a couple of the guys I work with got some food from here last week and it looked pretty good, so I decided to try it out. Some people get put off by the Chipotle-style setup, but some of the best BBQ I've ever had came from a gas station, so I never judge a BBQ place on its looks. I ordered the brisket with Memphis-style sauce and got sides of corn bread and mac and cheese.The brisket was some of the best I've ever had, and I'm pretty picky when it comes to my brisket. The mac and cheese comes in an individual ramekin-style container, and was also top-notch. The corn bread was pretty good, but not as good as the other two. The sauce was OK, but the meat was good enough that it didn't need any. I also wish I had gotten another slice of brisket, but given the price, I think it was fair.The line was out the door when we went, but moved quickly, so don't be put off by that. Definitely worth stopping in for a quick lunch if you're in the mood for BBQ in the Loop.
This place is amazing! The best BBQ I have ever had! The sides are worth coming here alone! By far the best cornbread and Mac ever! I obviously love it here lol.

We decided to try Blackwood for lunch (which is the only option right now) and it was PACKED. Despite the line being out the door, it actually went really quickly. The idea is similar to Chipotle - you pick your style (sandwich, salad, platter), meat (brisket, chicken, pork), sauce, and sides and watch them make it as you go down the line where you pay at the end. They had enough tables for a few dozen people, but I wouldn't take more than 1 or 2 people with you when you go.The Chicago sauce was an unexpected favorite - it was a little spicy and very flavorful. The North Carolina sauce was pretty bland. The brisket was flavorful all on its own and had a great texture. The mac and cheese was pretty good and definitely fresh out of the oven - good crust and rich cheesiness, although I would have liked a little more spice. The baked beans were TERRIBLE - a total letdown at the end of the meal - and tasted like runny old italian wedding soup. One caveat for the brisket - they do not trim it very well, so if you are like me and don't want a mouthful of fat, you'll have to do that yourself when you get it.We would come back, especially with the sandwich coming in at $8 with cornbread for $1 or mac and cheese for $1.50.

Great BBQ lunch spot. Food was great, think Chipotle  except with BBQ. I had the Kentucky BBQ sauce and it was very very good.Had  the Brisket which was very tender and flavorful with Mac and Cheese and Cornbread sides. Mac and Cheese A++ Cornbread was okay.Only warning is that the portions are extremely small and you will leave hungry. I almost took another star off for this, but the quality of the food kept it at 4 stars for me.
Come in for the breakfast. Eggs, brisket, and bbq sauce are so ridiculously good it should be criminal. It's cheap too. Under $5.
They keep increasing their prices... used to be a place to go to everyday.. more of a once a week place now.

Been here a few times in the last couple of months and the meat just isn't the same anymore. You can choose between lean, regular, and fatty cuts and I've been getting regular and it's just not as vibrant and rich anymore. Also, there's never enough sauce to cover the meat. Don't feel the need to come back anymore.
Great service - everyone is nice and helpful!  Food is just ok.

WOW!  I tried Blackwood BBQ for the first time today.  I wish I had taken a picture of the brisket platter when I opened it because when I thought to take the picture... most of the delicious food was gone :(The brisket was juicy and the Chicago sauce a perfect compliment.  The pickles were the right acid off set for the rich brisket and the richer mac & cheese.  The crusty top of the mac & cheese was heavenly and I'm glad I saved that for last.My only complaint is that I lack the self discipline to eat slowly.

REALLY. GOOD. BRISKET. No, honestly!  And did I mention they deliver??Went here during my lunch break, and was very pleasantly surprised. Food was extremely fresh, staff was super friendly and the beef brisket was so tender I was able to use a plastic fork to cut it...which is awesome cuz I'm lazy. Tried their sides (mac and cheese, baked beans...) and they're pretty decent-- corn bread was top-notch too.The setup is almost identical to Chipotle, and this location is pretty small, so if there's a rush, seating can be limited.I want to give this place five stars but 1.) the portions, especially for the sides, are a bit on the small side. 2.)I wish there was a way of sampling the sauces BEFORE ordering. 3.)They're only open until 3pm M-F.But other than that, I'm a fan.

yum yum YUMMY! They have an amazing chicken salad. The chicken is always served warm which is a plus in my book.Pros:LocationPriceSides (mac and cheese and cornbread are my favs)Chicago Sauce for sureAll the meatCons:Size of the location leaves a small seating areaDo your self a favor and check out Blackwood.

As Carrie S said, this place is dangerous if you work nearby.Heavy meats tend to put people to sleep and if you are eating BBQ during lunch then I imagine most people would be very unproductive the latter part of the work day.One of my colleagues had a chance to try this place and he loved it. He convinced 5 of us to join him on a lunch outing here. He warned us that it wasn't a huge space so we decided to try to make it there by 11:45 to beat the lunch rush. We made it over and it wasn't packed but quite a few seats were taken so we figured the 6 of us would probably not be eating all together. Seating is communal so you will see gaps here and there.Once you walk in you can smell the yummy goodness of smoked meats. They have different versions of BBQ:Memphis BBQ (usually good)Kansas City BBQ (my favorite)South & North Carolina BBQ (have to be in the mood for it)Chicago BBQ (Never heard of it)I tried the KC BBQ pulled pork sandwich and I enjoyed it with cole slaw slapped on top. Sauce was very tangy with a small kick to it.  One of my buddies got the brisket platter and it looked very good. He let me try a piece and it was very tender and packed with flavor. I know what I am getting next time. Good spot to check out for lunch if you work nearby, but beware as it may bring on the itis.

This is seriously as good as it gets.... hit the nail on the head.  I lived in Old Irving Park and have been to smoque a bunch of times but this place blows them out of the water.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  I can honestly say I tried everything on the menu bc we ordered the full menu for everyone at the office.  The brisket, chicken, pulled pork, macaroni, corn muffins and everything else was absolutely amazing.  The sauces are all great as well. The mustard sauce especially!Seriously it doesn't get any better! I was very impressed.  I called to double check our order for delivery and they even followed back up to make sure it arrived on time and hot! Doesn't get better than that... if every restaurant in Chicago could emulate this recipe (great food and customer service) I would be a happy camper!

Awesome barbeque, fresh food, fantastic flavor! Who could ask for more?? I can see why this place always has a line. The food tastes home cooked and the meat is top notch. Plus, the people are happy and engaged at work. I'm so impressed! We need more food like this as a lunch time option in the loop. Can't wait to go back!!

We catered a meeting with Blackwood, and we hit the ball out of the park. We ordered pulled pork, chicken and beef brisket along with all the sauces. For sides we ordered coleslaw, mac n cheese, baked beans and some corn bread.Will definitely order form here again.

I'd say this place is just okay... I've been twice for lunch. They get you in and out quickly and it's really popular... But not sure why? The mac n cheese to die for, and the corn bread is amaze ... But the meat, the whole reason you go there... Meh. I've had the pork and the chicken... The chicken was actually kind of gross really.

This should be all over the country as it is some of the best barbecue I have ever had.  We often order for lunch and have delivered.  Have tried a bunch on the menu and haven't experienced anything other than delicious.  It's something different compared to all of the sandwich, fast food or burger joints.

I looooooove this place.I label it the Chipolte of BBQ. They have a very similar set up and ordering system but with Southern BBQ options.If you walk by this place at night you can smell them smoking the meats for the following day.I get the same thing every time because it's just so good.I couldn't decide between the Pulled Pork or the Beef Brisket so I get the platter with BOTH! I also love their baked beans and if you come here you have to try their Cornbread. YUM!The only downfall of this place is their hours. I wish they were open on the weekends or at least for dinner during the week (Hint-hint... if the owner happens to be reading this post)

*There has been a drastic improvement in the service. Someone in the management group reached out to me in an email asking how they could improve the service. I did not respond. Instead I went back...several times. Each time the service seemed to improve. The food is good and the service got way better.

I can't say enough good things about Ameritalia.  Since discovering them last year, they've become my go-to for pre-run carb loading.  The chicken parmigiano is outstanding and is now a weekly staple of my marathon training.  Along with pasta, they have a number of excellent sandwiches and last fall they offered an incredible grilled cheese and basil tomato soup!Along with the food, I've been blown away by the customer service of Ameritalia.  At this point the owner knows me by my voice and order over the phone, and always takes time to talk for a few minutes every time I pick up my food.  Ameritalia is exactly what you want in a local restaurant and I highly recommend it to all South Loop locals and visitors.

Ameritalia is South Loop's family-owned Italian restaurant. The quality of the food is great for it's affordable price. There are several to-go selections as well as sit me downs with friends. Anna and Brad--the restaurant owners are warm and friendly.Love the spaghetti with meatballs, the bread, and the potato wedges!!

I had the Italian Beef and Peppers. It was dry. Had to put salt and pepper on it to give flavor. The JoJo potatoes that came with it had a powder that I thought may have flavor but it simply added to the dryness.I was hoping for a wet Italian Beef sandwich like Chicago is supposed to have and it just was not.Plus the sandwich with four potatoes and a drink was $16. I should have gone to McDonalds.

Literally the worst spaghetti meatballs I've ever seen/had.  Like a child made it.  Mushy meatballs, completely overlooked pasta, to the point it was like a solid block of wet dough.  Seriously, I couldn't even twirl a fork full, it just all clumped together.Calzone also really bad.  Their dough recipe is just awful.  It's not pizza dough, it kind of tastes like frozen dough?  Tasteless, no texture.Unfortunately I made a mistake and ordered from this place on two different occasions.  Both times very disappointing.

This place is wonderful!! We discovered this gem after moving to the South Loop and walking around with our newborn.  The food taste so fresh and delicious, especially the pasta is cooked just the way we remembered from Italy! The parmburger and also the potato wedges are also my fav! The owner Anna and her son are so friendly, we cannot get enough of this place, go visit as soon as you can :)
It was pretty good. Would definitely go back

What a cute little restaurant. I went for a business meeting and decided to give this place a try for the first time. When I arrived at noon on a Saturday it was completely empty, so I was able to choose exactly where I wanted to sit at. By the time we left though the crowd definitely picked up.I ordered an appetizer for my entrée. I went with the stuffed mushrooms and they were delicious! I only wish the portion size was bigger, but hey it is an appetizer. I was eyeing my associate meal though. Next time I will definitely try the Parm Burger. Great location and great care was taken in preparing the food. :)

Love this place ! They make a fabulous hamburger its called Parm Burger so delicious if you like parm and burgers, its a twist to  normal cheese burgar. If your a chicken eater, you must try the Chicken PLT sandwich soooooo good only 10 bucks. Must try TODAY !! Why are you still reading !?!? Gooooo

Love this local spot. The food is always delicious and the staff is very friendly. It's a casual restaurant and you can get in and out pretty quickly. I definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves burgers, chicken, and Italian food!

This is the first meal me and my fiancé have finished while eating in Chicago this past week. Everything is so flavorful and fresh tasting. I'm truly spoiled and need to have this restaurant back home in Orange with me. The family who owns this are sweethearts and really take care of their place. I am so happy and full and relaxed right now. This was truly a great experience. If you live in Chicago you are truly blessed that this place is in your own backyard.Everyone make the effort and go support ameritalia! I promise you you will not regret it!Love love love
The spaghetti and meatballs lacked the flavor. Not a lot of cheese. The breadstick wasn't the best

Ordered around 3:00pm since I was visiting from Seattle and it was just around lunch time. Shop was empty but was greeted by a cheerful lady. Ordered chicken bolognese pasta. It comes with a breadstick.The pasta was cooked nice and firm not soggy and soft. Sauce consisted of chicken and had green bell peppers. Tasty but a tad expensive for $14 without tax.

Thanks to Yelp reviews, my husband and I found this little restaurant in the Loop.  The restaurant is small, 14 tables.  The space is clean and the music is great Rat Pack type tunes.  This is owned by a young man and his mom helps at the restaurant.  He cooks and she does the baking among other things.  Patrons order their food at a counter and it's delivered to your table in these fantastic metal containers.  The menu is varied from appetizers like salami mushrooms and polenta fries to soups & salads, pasta & sandwiches.  Mama also makes the cannoli cupcakes, tiramisu cupcakes and chocolate cupcakes.  My husband ordered the ameritalian sandwich, which was Italian meats and cheese served warm on wonderful crusty bread topped with a crisp cold salad dressed with Italian dressing.  It was amazing.  I know, I stole a bite.  I ordered the Italian beef with sweet peppers and had it dipped. I like a messy juicy beef.  This sandwich again was huge and served on that crusty bread.  The peppers were fire roasted with a little char and were the perfect accompaniment.  Both sandwiches were served with large home style fries that were so crispy, non-greasy and dusted with Parmesan cheese.  So good.  This restaurant elevates the standard sandwich and fries to a new level.  We were so full from the portion sizes that we took our cannoli and tiramisu cupcakes to go.  I highly recommend Ameritalia.  It was a great find and the mama couldn't have been nicer.  We loved it!

This place is great. Came here to get something other than Lolla food and we were basically the only ones in here. Our food took a little bit, but you could tell they legit made everything from scratch. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs with the orange chicken nuggets. The orange chicken nuggets were good but a little dry. Wish there was more of a sauce. The spaghetti though was really good though.

I really wanted to love Ameritalia because we need more good restaurants in the Sloop but I just wasn't "wowed".When we arrived on a beautiful Saturday afternoon around 1:30, the place was empty. We walked up to the front counter and a nice woman came out from the back. The cook/chef also came walking from out back. It just was not a very "welcoming" experience. The food was good; not great. I opted for the grilled cheese and "jojo" potatoes. The bread for the grilled cheese was a bit too thick but it had a decent taste. The jojo potatoes looked good but didn't have much taste and were too mealy. My partner choose the meatball sandwich. It had tons of toppings that hid the taste and made it hard to eat. He didn't like the fries at all.Perhaps it was what we ordered. We'll be back because the food was okay and I want to see South Loop businesses thrive but the whole experience and food left me underwhelmed.
Ordered delivery to the Hilton, no eating utensils. Stromboli was salty with just meat and cheese. Bolognese, noodles heavy and over cooked, sauce bland.

Excellent food! Went here a few months ago (in March). I ordered the Parmburger which very unique and delicious. The fries were not so good, but the burger made up for the fries! The wait staff was very helpful. The owner's mother came to my table to suggest other local things to do in Chicago. I would definitely come back here the next time I'm in the area!

A cool little spot in an area I would not expect.I came in expecting a typical sit down restaurant but it is not that, you order at the counter and then they bring your food to your table.They have a good range of classic Italian choices.I got the meatball sandwich since that is my go to and it was not bad.I have had many meatball subs and this one was good but I have also had better for less money.Would recommend this spot if you're looking for a tasty bite to eat in the area.

Their spaghetti is good when you sit down and order in. I've been here about 4x and always get the same thing. My fiancé has tried their calzones and liked them.  It's a perfect place to get your carb fix. The lady working behind the counter is always happy to give us extra cheese :)I am not crazy about their cookies and cupcakes. They seem homemade- not the good kind homemade.  Like the super amateur, we made cookies out of a box homemade.  You have to go here for their warm comfort meals.Not thrilled with their carry out food.  We ordered carry out twice and the food was underwhelming both times.  Pasta was overcooked and barely had any sauce on it. Flavor was lacking.  At least the food was still very hot when we brought it back home. Will not get our order to go anymore, but will probably dine in again at some point since location is convenient.

Hidden gem in the South Loop!  It's certainly casual, but the food is delicious and a good value, and it's BYOB.  We loved the stromboli, cavatelli with cheese, and di parma grilled cheese.  Four stars because the atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired, but this place is definitely worth a visit.

Frank in the background.  Clean. Comfy. Cubs game on.  90 degree weather outside.  Then comes the food.  Looks great!  I hope it tastes as good as it looks.  It does. The evening can't get any better.Everything at Ameritalia is cooked to perfection and served hot.  We've been to just about every restaurant in Chicago.  The food here blows most other restaurants away.  So fresh, so tasty, you'll be pissed that you are so stuffed that you can't finish your dinner.  We had the wedding soup, stuffed banana peppers, chicken rigatoni and the parmburger.   Holy cow!  This was the meal we were looking for all week.  Try the Joe Peach Tea- crazy good.Next day update: Ok, so we went back for the Mac and Cheese.  We are Mac people- had to try it.  We decided on the lunch special with an entree, salad and soda.  At first, the Mac portion looked a little on the small side. Upon further review- it was perfect. The taste is off the chart- again.  The salad was incredible as well.  Truly exception taste is delivered here daily.

Ameritalia has a unique menu, but if you're unafraid of leaving your comfort zone a tiny bit, you'll be rewarded with tasty, innovative food and friendly, most pleasant service.I ordered the Pepperoni Sticks, and the Cavatelli and Cheese, while my girlfriend got the Polenta Fries, and the Popo's Tomato Cucumber Salad. The presentation of the food and the shop are humble. The food is excellent and plentiful. It's not I could taste the melted cheddar in every bite of my Cavatelli and Cheese, and the pepperoni center of the breadsticks was delightful. We both boxed up what we had left, which wasn't much, because we ate every bite we could stand to.The food alone was a stellar performance, but the nice service really topped it off.

Amazing homemade food: polenta fries with a delicious side of honey with specs of black truffle and the deluxe Stromboli made with an incredible homemade dough and a filling that was to die for. My husband and I could not get over it!! Even the marinara sauce was outstanding!The service was just as amazing as the food!!
