The female owner was so sweet and we can tell how much loves she puts into every dish she makes.We will absolutely be back and bring our friends and family!! We cannot get enough!

Had lunch twice.  Meatball pepperoni Stromboli and the chicken bites.  It was very good.....the Stromboli was a little cold inside but probably just came to early.  Ton of chicken bites in order.  Other things look good
Outstanding! Their food is homemade and their calzones and the cave tells and cheese are to die for. Highly recommended!

A great find in the Near South Loop.    Located at 13th and Michigan, this little place seems to be family run.You order at the counter and then sit at any of the comfortable tables and wait for them to make your food and deliver to your table.It's BYOB, we had the Beet salad with Chicken and the Cavatelli with Cheese.  Both were Excellent.    The pasta dish was made with perfectly al dente cavatelli and the sauce was perfect, not too heavy, not too salty, not too runny.   One of the best pasta dishes I've had in a long time.     The Beet salad was made with very fresh vegetables, and the chicken was nicely grilled and warm.I would stop here anytime for lunch or dinner.    They run specials often so you can maximize your bang for your buck.

I live right around the corner, and during my Fat Tuesdays (which for me is everyday), I come here primarily for its convenience, but also for its consistency. I love the Parm Burger here, it might be one of my favorite burgers in Chicago!My dock for it being only 4 stars is that, of all the times I've been here, there is always only 2 people working: the Chef and the very nice lady in the front (both of whom I believe are both owners of the place). That wouldn't be an issue at all, if not for the fact that the wait can get long if there are more than 2 or parties trying to order. Having only one cashier and one cook, things can get backlogged and orders can end of taking a while.I've only had a few other items on there menu outside of the Parm Burger: the meatball & pepperoni side, orange chicken nuggets appetizer, and the Ameritalian. the Parm Burger was by far the best, and I'd almost be willing to give 5 stars just for that. The other 3 items were OK to good, but nothing amazing or memorable in my opinion.

Vegetarian Review:Arrived hungry on a not-so-busy Tuesday evening.Service was fantastic. Very helpful with picking out vegetarian options and super friendly.Food: 5 starsPolenta fries are served piping hot! The honey and truffle is amazing.  I wish I had more (probably good that I didn't).Quinoa pepper was tasty. Fresh tasting ingredients. Wish the plating sauce was warmer, but still a great, healthy dish.Garlic grilled cheese and tomato soup...YUM!  This is one of those hot meals that hits the spot. Cheesy, crunchy goodness in the sandwich, and tart and creamy tomato love in the soup.Washed it all down with a Joe's peach tea. Wow!I already know what I'm ordering next time. Give this place a chance on a cold winter day!

3.5 really. Came in and got the Chicken PLT without the crispy pepperoni. The sandwich came out a few minutes later and was pretty good. The chicken breast was nice and moist, the bun was toasty and came with some lettuce and tomato. The real star here was the sauce. And lots of it, without this slightly peppery aioli, its a just a simple sandwich. What came along with it were some decent potato wedges with some crispy polenta scattered on top. Really, the polenta adds nothing to the dish, except for the fact that it dries your mouth out faster than a bowl of weed.For 10 bucks I'd rather go get some chipotle and save a couple of bucks. But if you decide on coming here, its a decent enough place to spend your money.

We came from Shedd Aquarium and stumbled into this cute little Italian shop. It is definitely family owned and run which is nice and the food is also very good! I got the diparma grilled cheese for $& and was really impressed! They also fry their own potatoes to make thick cut French fries. I recommend this place for a casual lunch

Really shocked at all the positive reviews for this place. My BF and I had just finished up a 2-day moving extravaganza (and by extravaganza, I mean 19 hours of packing, followed by 2 hours of sleep, 6 hours of driving, and another 8 hours of unpacking) and all I could think about was carbs. Obviously. It was 10 at night and we were both craving Italian. This place was super close, had fab reviews, and delivered. Winning. Everything smelled and looked amazing when it arrived, but unfortunately even our ridiculous appetites couldn't fool us into thinking this was anything even close to a good meal. We ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and the bolognese with 2 extra bread sticks. The noodles were super rubbery and all stuck together like hard, mushy glue. Obviously we either got the noodles from the bottom of the pot or they were actually made of paste. The sauce had zero flavor and the breadsticks were reminiscent of something soft and squishy that had been dunked in a bowl of sawdust. Trust me, after eating here, you'll actually be craving Prego. Save your doll hairs for literally any where else.

The food here was great! We ordered food for delivery and everything we ordered was great. We ordered the loaded jojos as an appetizer and they were delicious. The tomato sauce was delicious. We ordered the deluxe calzone and the sausage stromboli and both were delicious.We definitely plan on going again!

I've never had a Stromboli with au jus but wow was this one amazing.  Got the Italian beef stromboli and it has sweet peppers in it and is amazing.  The au jus adds a touch to make it like I've never had.  Would love to eat here every week if I could.  Sadly here on vacation.

Amazing orange chicken! Everything else wasn't too impressive- didn't taste fresh ( Stromboli, fries, meatball sub). I also don't like the fact that they don't customize orders- especially bc things are pre made. I give it a 3 star bc of the chicken and good service. Also the place is located in a convenient spot and it's a chill place overall. Not sure if I'd come back for anything else other than the chicken .

I just brought in a large group here for our staff Christmas party. What an AMAZING experience!! First of all, chef Brad is the best. He was just so flexible and attentive to the needs of our group for the event. He gave me suggestions for catering, let me know when I had ordered too much food, was flexible in the amount of time we took up the restaurant, I couldn't ask for more.And that was all just before I'd even met him or stepped foot in the restaurant!Brad's lovely mother Anna was our server for the night. What an angel!! She helped me set up tables and did a wonderful job tending to the needs of our rambunctious group. Her hard work definitely showed and we are so appreciative!Now for the food itself: SO GOOD. And also quite economical! I personally tried the polenta fries, meatball calzone and the cavatelli with cheese. Mind you, I just tried a little of each because the plates are so filling!! But everything I tried is worth getting again the next time I visit! Our group tried everything from the Stromboli to the pasta and the burger and sandwich. Everyone loved it. They also have very cute, but large, cupcakes to top off the meal!Thank you so much to Brad and the team. You made our holiday party unforgettable, and you'd better believe we will be back (though maybe in smaller numbers!):)

My boyfriend and I are somewhat food connoisseurs; especially with Italian food. We went on a date night here over the weekend; food, service basically everything was awesome! I love that they have Frank Sinatra music playing... It's a quaint and adorable restaurant! Both my bf and I were completely pleased with our meals. He ordered a salad with meatballs, and I had the chicken parm pasta. We both said numerous times how we cannot wait to go back; FYI it's a BYOB. To top off the cuteness, the lady who I assume may be an owner, had her grandson(?) maybe 9 or 10 years old helping out.. So old school Italian and I love everything about it!!

This place is amazing! They have authentic Italian food and great deserts. I was looking for desert one day so I stopped by because I seen on yelp they had cupcakes. I did the chocolate cupcake and my boyfriend had the brownie bites. They were both amazing.So we've been meaning to go back for food. So then we went by on a gloomy afternoons for lunch. I got the chicken Parmesan and he got the spaghetti and meatballs. For a appetizer we got stuffed peppers because we were starving. The food was excelled and fresh. You can tell it was freshly made because of the food temperature it was piping hot. Now don't get me wrong this is not a fine dining up scale restaurant but the food quality is there. I recommend this place to anyone who likes Italian foods. The family that owns the place are very nice and the son is the chef. The pasta is fresh made pasta not that boxed stuff. The tomato sauce is not too salty and doesn't give you heart burn. The bread is freshly made as well. This place should be very popular also they have BYOB. I think they would attract more people if they served wine and cocktails however this place was amazing and I will be a returning customer :)

I tried Ameritialia after reading all the good reviews and I have enjoyed my visit to this awesome place over and over again. One big reason which makes this place a 5star for me is  the fresh produce they use to make everything. The meat they use to make their sandwich or burger is really fresh - my fav is parmburger. There thick cut potato wedges that comes with sandwiches / burgers are fresh and crispy as well.I have also tried the Chicken PLT Sandwich and Ameritalia salad (w/chicken) -- I would describe them fresh, juicy and tasty.Its a delightful cute little restaurant with a very pleasant team of people eager to accommodate your requests.
Very good food. Cute place. I also tried the "white stuff" a homemade dessert :-) it's addicting!

Good spot for dinner.  It's a very casual Italian place.  The owner is very friendly, and helpful.  Prices are what you'd expect for the S. Loop area.  Atmosphere is fun.  Went on a Sunday night with a friend and they had the football game on and everyone in the place was talking and having a good time.  Food was good. Atmosphere was good. All around a good experience.   Will definitely return.

I LOVED the parmburger. Two juicy patties with a good balance of flavor from the tomato and basil. I also tried the pulled chicken rigatoni, which was not as flavorful as the parmburger, but still delicious.I was surprised at how empty it was on a Saturday evening, given the great ratings. I think the neighborhood isn't the most lively, but the food is definitely worth stopping in for if you're in the area. Next time, I'm going after the desserts!

Awesome, casual and affordable byob spot. The Italian food is pretty spot on and has a great selection to please everyone. It looks like a fast food joint but you can tell they take their time with every dish. I'll definitely be going back.
The first bite I took of the regular stromboli made me feel 500x times better, and so did the sequential bites. Very well made and delicious food that makes me feel good on the inside.

We walked in right as they opened and were greeted by a cheerful woman. All of our food was delicious! We ordered the popo 's salad (salad with cucumber, red onion, and tomatoes in an oregano dressing)  it was fresh!  We also ordered the white bean dip: one word... BOMMIN!! It was seasoned well and had a bunch of flavor. The last dish we ordered was the delux calzone.  The crust was super tasty and went perfectly with the side sauce.The woman even came up and asked how our food was-  that to me was the winner. Great customer service and awesome food.This is the perfect spot to get a bite to eat before a night on the town.  I will definitely come back here the next time I'm in Chicago.
Popos salad is fresh crisp and amazing! Contains different heirloom tomatoes, red onion and cucumbers with a wonderful balsamic vinegar, olive oil and herb sauce

Casual neighborhood counter service place with very friendly service and homemade Italian dishes. The Parmburger is fantastic and comes with a side of hand-cut fries. The pasta and bread sticks seemed fresh-made and the meatballs were fantastic. Sinatra tunes on the stereo make it even better.
We went as a group of 7 and everyone liked their dish. GREAT taste and GREAT service. Highly recommend!!
One of the best meatball subs i have ever tasted. Good bread and good meatballs and not to mention wverything was freshly made. Definitely coming back for more.

I really can't find any complaint. I was a little worried since I don't eat pork, but I had no problem choosing menu items. I came in with 4 kids. The cavatelli and cheese (without prosciutto) was perfect for the kids. It's like a mac-n-cheese. Kids also got the orange chicken nuggets, but they didn't like the sauce. And my older daughter made her own calzone with chicken because there wasn't one with chicken. My husband and I have big appetites and shared (well he ate most) the parmburger, Italian beef stromboli, and an ameritalia salad. Everything was great. It was a little pricey, but it's important to support local businesses, plus it's walking distance, which is great.

I would definitely eat here again. It was difficult to decide what to try, because everything sounded so good. Between the bf and I, we managed to try two types of Stromboli and two starters (the polenta fries and the stuffed mushrooms). The mushrooms were solid and the polenta fries were amazing. It is admittedly kind of hard to go wrong with polenta, since it is delicious, but these were a nice twist. They had a perfectly crispy exterior with a wonderfully creamy interior. Of the two Stromboli, (Italian beef, Sausage) the Italian beef was the clear favorite. The sausage was good, but not quite the star that the beef was. Also, I personally think the Stromboli would have been plenty large enough to share (and they already come nicely divided into two pieces), but we did not take that route, which unfortunately left us with absolutely no room to try any of their desserts.In short, I would definitely recommend this place, and would say you can't miss the Italian beef or polenta fries.

Ameritalia is probably the best American/ Italian food restaurant in Chicago. The menu is different and unique with a special sandwich called the AMERITALIA  and a delicious burger called the PARMBURGER. The owner of the restaurant, Ana, was very helpful in telling us what to order and brought out appetizers out immediately. The drinks at AMERITALIA are also awesome and unique. They have a fountain for sodas and they also serve joes lemonade and tea in a glass jug. *its also BYOB* for dessert, they have homemade cupcakes,and brownies. We had a little snack called WHITE STUFF that had mnms, cereal and white chocolate. IT WAS AMAZING!!!!!

Pretty good food. I had the Polenta Fries and Chicken Parmesan Pasta. It was okay. I want to try other things on the menu, so I will be back. It is a family owned business, seems pretty quiet, I went for lunch at 1:00pm, it was pretty empty. Portions are pretty big, so bring a friend.

If you are expecting traditional italian food, go somewhere else. Ameritalia is an interesting twist on italian inspired food. Their menu is small, but portions are large, and if you have room-they often have home made desserts. My favorite was dinning their and who i assume is the owner stopped by and offered us a fresh out of the oven cookie. This place is definitely one of our go to places. Highly recommend the pepperoni sticks, chicken PLT, and the Cavatelli and Cheese.

I probably have to have a kid now just so I can name it Stromboli. So delicious. Everyone was friendly and talkative, food was fresh and hot, restaurant was clean, and did I mention the Stromboli?? Or the pepperoni sticks?This is my new go-to for delicious and authentic Italian fare because you can taste the care that goes into the food they prepare. I can't wait to get back there and sample more of the menu (hello, tiramisu cupcake...come over here for a minute).

Love this place. The food is very good! Definitely much needed place in South Loop.  The vibe is more relaxed or casual dining. I usually get their salads and they are very healthy and just plain delicious!

We carried out from there last night. I had the beet salad and my fiance had a meatball calzone. The salad was fine, I would say slightly better than average, but the calzone was terrible. Although the people there were very nice, there was nobody there on a Friday night, not a good sign I guess. Given that half of their menu is calzone and Stromboli based I would not go back.

Wow!  The food was fantastic.  They make the pizza and calzone dough as well as the pasta from scratch.  I saw an earlier review that complained that the calzone was awful...well, it was the best calzone I have ever had.  Maybe is was slightly different than some traditional calzone places, but simply great.  We were visiting CHI and were at the Museum Campus looking for a non-tourist trap with great food and this is it.  The owner and her son were great host.  I loved it, my wife loved it and my kids loved it...that doesn't happen often.  It will become a regular stop when we return to the city.

The Ameritalia was delicious! The bread was perfectly baked, soft on the inside and crunchy on the outside. The dressing is made in house and adds just the right of flavoring to the sandwich. Perfect for lunch!

Went back with the kids and my babysitter. Ordered pretty much same stuff along with the Ameritalia sandwich. Everything was excellent, Anna the owner is very personable and has excellent customer service. Highly recommended!

Major regret tonight - chose a different italian restaurant over this place and I won't be making that mistake again.After an unsatisfying dinner at the other place, we stopped in here for cupcakes - we tried the Tiramisu cupcake and the cannoli cupcake and OMG delicious.Will definitely be going back for dinner next time! If their food is anything like their cupcakes, we are in for a treat!

This was a great lunch stop for our family.  I had the Ameritalia Salad and loved it. Others in our party had salads, chicken parm sandwich, meatball sandwich, and spaghetti with meat balls. All were very tasty and the owner was attentive and clearly takes pride in what she does.We stopped over as a break from the over-priced and underwhelming museum cafes. If you're visiting "museum campus" it's worth the walk to get a fresh, quality lunch.

Ameritalia is a great place whether you are looking to get something affordable to go, or whether you want to sit down and enjoy a great dinner. They have a great variety of things, all of which have been spectacular. Ranging from the Parm buger to the different Strombolis to the Cavatelli and Cheese, everything has been good. My go-to for an entree is normally the Deluxe Stromboli. Another must have are the polenta fries with a great honey-like dipping sauce. The portions are quite generous and normally I have enough left over to eat for left-overs the following day.The food is always out quickly, and the staff is welcoming. It also is BYOB which is great if you aren't wanting to spend a lot of money on drinks at a restaurant.
This place is Incredible!!!! Top to bottom awesome. We had the cavatelli, parm burger and an awesome salad.Come eat here. You will not be disappointed!!!
Had the Deluxe Stromboli and Orange Chicken Nuggets delivered to the hotel...prices are great and the food even better!

On a cold December afternoon we found warm food and service in this small and casual eatery. We ordered the beet salad and a meatball/pepperoni calzone. Both were delicious and satisfying.We were offered excellent service and our order was taken and received right away. The staff stopped by several times to ensure our dining experience was enjoyable.The food is freshly made and is excellent quality.  The atmosphere is clean, modern, and includes some interesting art.This little place will be on our favorite list, as it offers what we are looking for: good food and excellent service at a great price!

I wanted to be wowed, I wasn't.  I ordered the DeParma Grilled cheese Jo Jo potatoes, and a side ameritalia salad. I can't say that any of these choices were fabulous.  I did love the polenta fries with honey dipping sauce.  Get these.  Skip the gorgeous, but flavorless cupcakes.  Cake is dense and plain, icing is too thick and just, nah-skip it.I don't know that I would return, but the staff are great and it seems popular.

This restaurant replaced the small Italian grocery where I had my first porchetta sandwich. Sadly that's not on the menu of the new one, so I settled for Italian beef. It was ok. Portion size was huge, but I had only 2 pieces of peppers in my sandwich and the beef was dry. The bun was nice & crusty though. It's counter service so you order/pay food and server will bring your food out. They must not have many people working in the kitchen because our food took a long time. On the other hand, I suppose that means it's cooked fresh to order. Decent if you're in the vicinity and too hungry to walk more than a few blocks.

The food is fantastic - and their menu has a great mix of 'American' food and Italian classic. The order was ready super fast and price was good.For an order out / delivery place they also make sure the inside is quite nice and welcoming for eating in.As a plus, the staff is incredibly friendly and looking to really foster community and be a part of the neighborhood.

I can't remember the last time I was this excited to talk about a restaurant. We had the stuffed mushrooms, Ameritalia sandwich and the Deluxe stromboli and each was so delicious I couldn't begin to rank one over the other. Already planning a lunch there with a friend to try more items on the menu. Incredibly nice lady running the place too.

After a whole day of being a tourist, I just wanted something comforting and filling to eat without resorting to a fast food chain. Ameritalia filled all that.ITALY MEET AMERICAAs the name suggests, several items blend the land of the Burger with Italian classics. My ParmBurger contained two Meat patties crusted in a crispy Parmesan shell and topped with a roasted Tomato and Basil leaves. All those toppings held together by the mild, yet flavorful Bun just blew me away especially when the cut of the Basil shot through. The Meatball and Pepperoni Calzone was more typical--it contained a lot of the wrapper but it wasn't overwhelming especially because you could add more flavor with the additional dipping sauce.The Cupcakes were very tempting. Each had a thick frosting with a Sour Cream texture while the Cake stayed moist. The Tiramisu was topped with Nuts and had great Coffee tones. The Cannoli Cupcake was also great.EXCELLENT PLACE AND SERVICEThe interior is very casual and seems well to attract the 20-40 year olds in the area. Local art covers the walls and flower vases add a nice touch to the tables. Has a Coffeehouse feel. At the register, the lady was happy to help us and answer questions and later on other staff members brought our food to the table.

I went here with my boyfriend yesterday and the food was literally amazing! We got the parmburger and one of the calzones and they were incredibly tasty. The staff was also so nice and welcoming! Definitely recommend!!
Their parmburger is the best burger in the South Loop. Two words: jui-cy. It's also BYOB, fast casual place. Great service, excellent food.
Came here with some friends and some alcohol because it's byob and we had a great time. The food was delicious, and not too expensive, and the hostess, Anna, was so nice and extremely helpful.

AMAZING. The service was phenomenal and the food was just as great. I'm vegan and nothing there was vegan, but they worked with me until just deciding to create something for me! He even made an amazing sauce for a veggie calzone that he also invented for me. And my sister and her husband enjoyed their jojos and Stromboli! If you're in the area and you want a really casual, inexpensive, real family feel, then Ameritalia is your place!

Really great food! We split two dishes - the grilled cheese (minus the prosciutto on my portion due to a dietary restriction) and the pasta with a sharp white cheddar sauce. Our server (whose name I'm embarrassed to be forgetting - I'm guessing she owns the restaurant) was very friendly! The Joe's lemonade was really good, too.
It was my second time at Ameritalia. Food is probably one of The Best in the sloop.Great relaxing atmosphere with an excellent Service.

If you live or work nearby, come for the polenta fries. They were great, and the truffle honey oil adds a great flavor and nicely complements the fries. The stromboli was a bit of a disappointment - the bread was so hard it bordered on stale and was completely flavorless. The meat didn't have a lot of flavor either. Honestly, the only thing that made it worth eating was the super flavorful tomato sauce (although there wasn't enough of it) that they provide for dipping.The much-reviewed cupcake tasted like yellow cake mix to me, and not even freshly made yellow cake from a mix. Overall, I would split a bottle of wine (they're BYOB) and eat the fries, but probably not do dinner again.

Great food. The Parmburger is a masterpiece. The pasta is fresh. The chicken is amazing. Flavors bursting everywhere. Nothing is bad here. Desserts too. Don't sleep. Quick to go or casual to eat in.  Friendly service too.
Parm burger is something from another world! Food is made fresh with great presentation. There's rarely a wait but don't let the light traffic fool you, everything on the menu is worth trying.

Parm burger was absolutely awesome!!! The orange chicken nuggets tasted good and the pep sticks were super filling. The owner was very friendly and sociable and spent time talking to us when the restaurant was empty and made us feel welcomed. Everyone needs to stop by to try the Parm Burger at least once!

This restaurant is one of the staples of the south loop, in my opinion. The parm sandwich, sandwich not burger, is my favorite item on their menu. Definitely worth a try.If you live in the south loop, it may just become your go to for carryout.

Finally! I've lived in the south loop for 5 years. We need more restaurants like this vs baby grand piano stores!We decided to stop in for dinner. The white bean salad was delicious and my husband ordered the meatball sandwich. We also ordered the cannoli cupcake and tiramisu cupcake just because they are so unique!Def coming back to try the $10 lunch specials!

I decided to finally write my review because I'm hungry right now and craving some Ameritalia! I absolutely love this spot and highly recommend their stuffed peppers and the Parm Burger... And everything else on the Menu! Holly and her husband are such a joy to see while visiting and make it hard to decide whether the food or service is better!

Tasty beet salad and parm burger. The polenta fries were good too, little bit crumbly but nice change of pace. The spot was small and quiet on a Sunday afternoon. The menu is a nice mix of contemporary Italian American food on the lighter side.

This place was exceptional. All pasta is homemade, I had the chicken parmigiano, so good! The cheese cavatelli is also to die for. I went to eat with a large group and had he opportunity to try all their appetizers all which tasted delicious. The atmosphere is very welcoming to families Chef and his mother were very friendly. It is BYOB, there is a grocery store located conveniently across the street to select an adult beverage. Also reasonably priced!
Cavatelli and cheese is delicious. We liked the chicken nuggets and the polenta fries as well. My 5 year old son keeps asking to come back. Great service.

I promised I was gonna finish my review and by George, here is it.We've been to Ameritalia twice and both time the experience has been superb. Both times we were delighted by the food and hospitality of the staff, mainly Anna. We highly recommend the polenta fries. Last time we had the parmburger...yummy. I am really demanding when it comes to the way I like my burger cooked, although it was a little more cooked than I like it was still very, very good. We also had one of the specials which consisted of Rigatoni with pulled chicken. We shared the burger and decided to take the pasta home. However, we kept eating it because it was so good that we could not resist. BYOB, good tasting food and an overall good value combined with a hospitable host makes for a pleasant experience every time.

Stopped here for lunch after our family trip to the Field museum. The restaurant is nice and clean. The owner is very friendly. While we were waiting for our food she brought out a meatball for my toddler to try. The food is outstanding. We got the meatball sandwich, chicken plt and deluxe Stromboli.... I suggest all! I look forward to returning and trying more menu items.

Went in with high expectations.  Food was good, family owned place - fast casual.  Service was quick.  Owner is really nice!  But overall left with an underwhelming feeling.  I guess the 4.5 Yelp stars did that to us.

I went here for the first time this evening and had an absolutely great experience. The woman (I believe the owner?) could not have been friendlier and more accommodating. I ordered the chicken parmigiana and substituted the spaghetti for rigatoni. The pasta was homemade, delicious, and hearty. The sauce and breadstick were great too. But the best part was the chicken. It was in chunks instead of one big piece. It was lightly (perfectly) breaded and was some of the most moist, flavorful, and tender chicken I have ever had. Absolutely delicious. They have a chicken item on the appetizer menu that apparently is the same style chicken with a different sauce...I will likely get that next time as well.  My meal was quite large and my leftovers will be lunch tomorrow. Highly recommended!

The food was amazing. I had the pepperoni breadsticks and spaghetti and meatballs. It's very well prepared and melts in your mouth. Also the staff is very homey. Easy to talk to and make you feel welcome. It's a family ran business worth every penny spent. And it's reasonably priced too.

Drove down to check this place out as I wanted to see the area as well. Very friendly "mom and son". (i'm guessing).had a nice lunch very filling. the Stromboli was so good! Other table had the lunch special and that looked good as well.I will go back if in the area again.

A hidden gem in South Loop.The restaurant is very cozy and their people are very friendly. I tried the Italian Beef Sandwich, which I realized was prepared from scratch and took around 5 minutes. The bread was hot and fresh, the beef was very tender and juicy, and the grilled banana peppers were otherworldly. Potatoes were also amazing and were fresh. I must also say the portions run rather large. And all this came at a nominal price of $10.I didn't have time to try their strombolis, which take a little longer than the sandwich, since they are prepared and baked fresh. Therefore I am certainly going back!How did I manage to miss this place all this time?!

This place is amazing! I live right down the street and just now got around to visiting. The lady that helped us was very friendly. We both had the Deluxe Stromboli. We wanted the regular,  although we came in after the lunch rush and they had run out. HIGHLY recommended this place!
Byob fast casual Italian. Food is excellent. Yes try the parm burger, but don't stop there. Have been a couple times now and have loved everything I've ordered so far.

This place serves the most delicious food!  The prices are totally reasonable.  If I had a Sweet Rice next to where I lived  and where I go to work I would probably be eating here 3 times a day.  I got the steamed chicken over rice with a side of soup.  The chicken was very moist and tender and the semi-sweet garlic ginger soy that accompanies the meal made it extra tasty.  My boyfriend got a noodle bowl soup.  It was the #1 option on their bowl specials.  It had a beef broth base with extra tender beef with rice noodles. Wow!  Words cannot describe the amount of joy we BOTH felt once it hit our taste buds.  I also cannot rave enough about their Korean chicken wings.  It was perfectly seasoned with the right amount of spice and great portions.The service was good and it's in a great location with tons of free parking on the street.  The restaurant is also right off the 606 so it's very convieniet for any bikers, roller bladers, and fast walkers.I definitely reccomend this restaurant because there is a variety of food to choose from and you can explore many different Thai dishes that will rock your world.

I wasn't going to leave a review but Yelp sent me two emails prompting a review so here we go...We were the only people in the restaurant when we walked in to pick up our take out. The rice was over cooked and dry, the rice noodles were burnt and tasted awful and, oddly, the crab Rangoon was undercooked. They didn't provide any napkins or utensils or offer any though it was for take out.I had heard good thing from neighbors but was disappointed. There are so many other places with quality Thai food within blocks.

Just had dinner delivered. Truly regret the choice. We ordered tom yum soup and got what looked like liver dumpling soup with beef bits. The sala pao was a waste of calories, the bulgogi looked like old Italian beef - the spicy ribs were edible (because we had to eat).We ordered from this location before it was renamed and had the same experience. We should have know better.

Tom yum fried chicken and Korean spicy wings were very good. Not supper spicy but full of salvor. The kimchi is on the spicy side too, one of the best I've had in a while. Coffee was strong and not overly sweet. Overall it was a very delicious lunch!

This place has a delightful menu of boat noodle soups for under $10 each and in a variety of broths and toppings. A bit understaffed for the middle of the work day, but possibly busier at night? Flavors were vibrant and the hot coconut cakes were a novel dessert experience of crispy burnt edges, gooey sweet centers, and contrast from corn kernels and savory diced scallions.

Same owners as the Sticky Rice Chiang Mai previous incarnation but with an expanded menu that includes Sushi, Korean food, and perhaps more interestingly Thai Street Food in the form of a selection of mini-boat noodles and over rice dishes for $6 each.   With the mini-portion size, its a great way to sample many dishes.Kao Palo: palo over rice - just the right size of this rich dish - could use a little more rice to sop up that porky goodnessMini Yen Ta Four: seafood boat noodles - greatMini Boat Noodles Chicken Drumstick: good flavor but the drumstick could be more tenderKa Nom Krok: nicely presented - could be crispier on the edges

Hopped off the 606 and decided to check this place out. Pros- clean restaurant and lots of choices on the menu, portions are large and shareable. The food is fine. Good/ fine. Not as good as others in Chicago but a good option if you need a lunch/ dinner spot near he 606. Ordered the chicken satay ( ok), vegetable pad woon sen ( good) and shrimp with mixed vegetables ( watery and not very good).
Projectile puked mid dinner from how gross my dinner was. The chicken was old and gross and nothing tasted fresh. I would not recommend.

Finally a good authentic Thai restaurant. The basil chicken is chopped like it should be which makes it much more flavorful. The boat noodles were so good and I'll crave again later when it's cold out. There were so many things on the menu we wanted to try including Thai street food dishes that most restaurants wouldn't have. We'll definitely be back!
Love the Thai food here very traditional especially their northern Thai dishes like Kao Soi Chicken, Thai Northern Sausage and Hung Lay Curry

Excellent food, atmosphere, and service! As a big fan of the previous StickyRice location, I was thrilled by Sweet Rice's recent opening. This location is definitely more intimate, with a rich ambiance and dark wood decor. Absolutely Beautiful! The menu is a bit different - offers a greater variety of Japanese and Korean dishes --but still keeps the tried and true Thai favorites! I love their curry dishes, Thai ice tea, and coconut/rice ice cream!! Most recently, tried the Maki! And was impressed! This place was a bit hard to find, but definitely worth going to!! I will definitely be coming back soon!

Restaurant is very clean and the staff was very friendly. Lots of great options. We tried the mango chicken and a spicy Thai dish. We also had Kimchi and a crab Rangoon appetizer. Everything was excellent!

My friends and I were impressed by the food although the outside of store looked not nice ha. Every dish was very delicious and authentic! Nice service and dinning atmosphere! They have all you can eat, special and regular menu. We ordered some mini dishes from special menu and some from regular! All of them are above the average than what I had at other Asian places. Prices are reasonable!  I'm glad I tried this place out today! Definitely I will bring my Asian friends to try again.

We have ordered from here many times and have never been disappointed with the food. Tonight we ordered dinner online from their website at 6:30 and when the food still wasn't here and hour and a half later we called. They said that they had just gotten the ticket. No offer to comp our food, no real apology, and just very poor customer service. They have lost some regulars and I hope that they fix their systems or I'm sure they will be losing more.They did deliver the food within 15 minutes of us calling, and added in some extras. So they do get some points for that.

Far better Thai food than the typical combo-cuisine restaurant. The basil chicken is legit; they actually chop it up, as you'd see in any restaurant in Thailand, rather than the large, flavorless pieces of chicken you get in most Chicago-area Thai restaurants. Thumbs up on the boat noodles and other Thai street food, too. Nice to see a place offer more than your typical Pad Thai and curry options -- and do it well. Not sure why it's two dollar signs. There's a huge selection of medium-portion $6 dishes; two people can order three of them and end up pretty full.

This little place is across the street from my apartment, and it's the best Thai I've had since moving to the city. Everything was fresh, portions were big, my order was ready fast. The crab rangoon were great, so don't forget to add some of those to your order!

This place is amazing, the Korean wings, the crab rangoon, homemade and tons of crap, the sushi, everything was amazing, wonderful service, byob.   Some of the best food I have had in the area.  I highly recommend!!!  We plan on going back weekly.

The Massaman Curry is bad.  This is my second attempt since the switch over from Sticky Rice.  Just thought it was a bad day the first time I ordered.  Still seems to be chicken dumped in a bunch of grease/oil or something.  Not good at all.

My husband, son and I recently checked this place out after it changed names and owner (formerly the second Sticky Rice location). The menu is expansive, including Korean and Japanese, but something told me to go Thai. It was so good with all the authentic Thai spices I love. They also have these mini bowl we have yet to try. I got Pad Ped with shrimp and my husband got a basil fried rice with a fried egg on top. Very good. My son loved his miso soup.We have since ordered pick up and delivery and it's been great every time.I only gave it 4 stars because their delivery boundaries are so tight but, last time they delivered to us anyway. Soooo, I guess I need to change this to 5 stars.Turns out Sweet Rice is run by the daughter of the dad who owns Sticky Rice. Good to know. I love being able to get the authentic taste of Sticky Rice closer to home.

My husband and I recently tried Sweet Rice for take out. We ordered the Pad See Eiw and Red Curry. Both were phenomenal and better than any other Thai food we've had in the area. Great vegetarian options.

Wow! Like other reviews, I love the cleanliness of this place. It has a good vibe and the food is outstanding.I had a medley of their tacos and they were delicious. I don't usually like having a variety of meats on one plate, but since it was my first time here I wanted to figure out what they did best.Well, the problem is that they were all amazing. Not salty and full of flavor. Same with the salsa. Spicy, but not overpowering.I love this place and can't wait to go back.

Wow! I read someone else's review and saw that they had breakfast burritos for right around $5.  You really can't beat that price in the loop.  When i went inside at 8 am the first thing I noticed was that the three employees were cleaning.  A quick glance around and you could tell that this place was immaculately clean.I ordered the steak breakfast burrito which comes with potatoes, egg, cheese, your choice of meat and pico.  I loved how it wasn't stuffed full of potatoes and the burrito wasn't soggy from the pico.  The small pieces of steak were tender and the burrito was the perfect size and filling for breakfast.  And looking at their lunch menu, it seems like their burritos and bowls run about $7.50.  I would try their lunch here one day but know I'll definitely be back for another one of their breakfast burrito.

A viable Mexican option downtown...right up my alley.I had a steak asada bowl and a can of pop, which came with a small side of chips. This came in a shade under $10. The bowl was massive! The steak is very spicy so be wary. The red salsa on the table is quite hot as well. I was more a fan of the green salsa - milder and very limey.Definitely a welcome addition to the lunch rotation.

Cute spot, small.. Clean.. And right on the money! Perfect for lunch.. And I just noticed they do breakfast burritos too!Jonesin for some good carne asada tacos and don't want the "sit in" restaurant drama.. This is the perfect place! Located right on wells and lake area.. Great food, fast service and reasonable prices.. Walk up, order and sit.I ordered the Carne asada tacos, so yum!! Good size, great seasoning with just the right amount of onion, cilantro and salsa at the table. PERFECTION. My co worker got their special, Baja shrimp.. Also delicious.. Guacamole and chips were also spot on. Perfect lunch spot. Will definitely be returning!

$5.03 for breakfast after tax...in the loop. In fact, you can order burrito bowls, burritos, and chilaquiles in the morning with chips and salsa for the same price! As you can see in the photo, the serving looks small, but the eggs and protein fill you quickly. I think it's smart to throw French fries in there instead of home fries or hash browns. It's efficient and probably less wasteful.I can't speak to any of the lunch options, but my breakfast burrito bowl was a great value.
Good eats! The place is cute and clean!I had their steak nachos and horchata. So good! Definitely coming back here to try some other items on their menu.

Asada serves a pretty boring meal. Granted, there is a good variety of potential dishes, but all the dishes are very plain and totally lack in seasoning. The safran rice, lettuce, chicken, etc. are all just fine, but they would be much better if they were somewhat seasoned -- instead of relying on the (somewhat underwhelming) salsa to supply all the flavor.As far as local options for a quick/take-out Mexican lunch go, I prefer Chipotle.

A Poem for a Hungry Worker:May your burrito be ever bursting,May your guac be velvety, not mushy.May your chips lean towards crisp, not greasy.May your meat be fresh and lack gristle.May you eat at Asada Grill.
Really tasty Halal take on Mexican.  enjoyed the steak plate

OK so there are deff perks to this place, It is very clean, the staff is super friendly, and the portions are HUGE.  The problem is the food just doesn't really do it for me.. I hate to say it but I'd rather go to Chipotle.  It just tastes like total Americanized Mexican food.  They do hook you up on guac ... but again, it didn't taste the best.

Two words: food poisoning.Perhaps I'm the chosen unlucky one, but I had to leave work early after eating three Asada Steak tacos from here due to feeling ill. Maybe, just maybe I'll forgive the restaurant if the tacos completely blew me away. However, the tacos were nothing to write home about and were borderline cold even though I ate this right away after walking 1.5 blocks.I ordered the tacos through the Ritual app and requested to add tomatoes to my order, but the restaurant either ignored or overlooked that part because there were no tomatoes on my tacos.My situation might be a one-off case, but who knows what's going on inside the kitchen if I got food poisoning. I don't recommend this restaurant, which is a shame since it's so close to me.

I've been looking for Good tacos in the loop. Now while these aren't the best tacos I have ever had, they are the best Ive had in the loop.3 tacos for 7.50, add 1.50 to add beans and rice. For it been in the loop, thats a good deal.I had just the barbacoa tacos and they were delicious, the meat was cooked just right and the portions were good.Also if you like really spicy I would go with the Red salsa.. The Green salsa is still good but not very spicy.The people that work there are really nice and the location is clean.

I eat at Asada pretty much every day, and not out of habit, but because its just that good. Their fish tacos are probably the best that I've ever had and I'm completely obsessed with them. On days that I'm not downtown from work, I get a little bummed out around lunchtime that I won't get to eat them.Seriously. Go to Asada and get the fish tacos. You won't regret it.

I'm from Texas, so granted, my taco expectations are extremely high. These tacos are fine for a quick meal. Not my favorite, but definitely better than other "Mexican" places I've tried in the Loop. Veggie tacos are great for vegas/vegetarians. If vegan, ask for no cheese.

I went here for lunch and it reminded me of chipotle, but what the mom and pop version of chipotle would be (if that makes sense). I had the chicken asada bowl. The ingredients were fresh, the service was great, and they have a small dining area. I chose to eat there and you get a little bowl of chips for the table. I wasn't impressed with the salsa  at the table, but everything else was great. Nice place to stop in for lunch. Also prices were very reasonable.
Ok second time here. I was boring and got the same thing. BUT I got the horchata this time and man oh man is it good! Barely made it back to the office! So glad this place is near!

The food was spectacular, Manager Mr. Humayun has excellent customer service, cooks definitely know there way around the kitchen. If you want great tacos, this place is a must if you're in the Loop!Asada Mexican Grill also doesn't hurt your pockets, prices are very generous! 5 across the board!
Simple and quiet place.Food is good, portions are generous too.Friendly staff, quick service.

Tried this place out today and was VERY pleasantly surprised that they have hard shells for tacos!!!!!!  HARD SHELLS, people!!!!  :)The service was EXCELLENT!  The guy behind the counter was super friendly and extremely patient with me, as I stood and stared at the menu for several minutes...having never been there, it took me a minute to decide what it was that I wanted.  After bagging up my food and giving me some shit about my thoughts that the place was new (it has been there for a little more than a year), he offered me a to go menu, a catering menu, and told me that they offer delivery...to my office which is right across the river.  :)  It wasn't a desperate attempt at getting more business, it was truly genuine...which, unfortunately, is becoming a rarity in Chicago.Ok - onto the grub:  I tried a chicken taco, a barbacoa taco, and a steak taco.  The three came with rice and beans, although I opted to skip the beans and get double rice.  The rice was good and standard with carrots and peas intermingled throughout.  Yum!  The chicken taco was topped with cheese, corn, and cilantro - and was DELISH!  The steak tacos were topped with onions and cilantro - and, again...DELISH.  The barbacoa, on the other hand, is why I am not willing to give this place all five stars.  It was in huge chunks and dry...not at all pulled or marinated...unlike the pics from other reviewers.  Bummer.  :(Oh - and the hot sauce is HOT....which I love.I will most likely be back but will definitely make sure the barbacoa is on point before I order that again.Ole'

Best Burritos in the loop.  Big chunks of quality steak. 10$ for a steak burrito, tortilla chips and a fountain drink. Will keep you full all day. They also have a breakfast burrito for 5$. Will keep you full all day. Highly recommend!

HALAL EATERS - Must have while you're in Chicago! Not a ton of solid halal mexican options in Chicago, so this is a gold mine for us. Got steak asada tacos and steak asada nachos (which is huge), and they were delicious. The owner was super nice and talked to us about his place. Will try to make it out there again if I visit.
Friendly service. Food is fresh and delicious. Great prices. Very clean dining area. Will return.
Asada--the horchata is good, guac is good.  Didn't care for the barbacoa tacos - but did enjoy the steak tacos.

Great little Mexican quick service joint in the loop. Great location and all. The owner is very considerate as well. The other day when ordering a veggie burrito, I saw this nice little nacho side with the daily special... and I asked if I could get the little nacho thing on the side. Without charging me extra, the guys gave me chips and a small tub of cheese and even jalepenos. Great gesture. Small things like that can make a difference.The veggie burrito itself is good. The second time I went, I asked for them to go easy on the grilled veggies, and it seems they didn't do that. Maybe their register system is very simple and doesn't allow for customized orders? IDK... But overall it's still good.Next time I want to try something else... like maybe the nachos? The full nachos, not just side. I plan to go back to Asada. Great change of pace Mexican joint for lunch.

Disappointing since the fish actually taste good however I had asked for the rice to be substituted for beans and I get back to the office and no bean and just lettuce in the box with the fish..and paid $9 basically for some fish and a box of shredded iceberg lettuce

Clean, efficient, extremely friendly.  Asada burrito comes with rice which I enjoy because it drinks up meat and pico de gallo juices.  The salsa verde is notable for heat and freshness.  A palpable cheerfulness of the staff is endearing. The proprietor Nasir (sp?) was very specific in assuring me any recommendations submitted would be quite welcome.  This is a very reliable entry in the dodgy downtown burrito sweepstakes.
I messed up my online order (I put 12:45, meant 11:45) and they quickly/happily put together my meal so I didn't have to come back later.Hard to find good service like that!

I tried this spot while I was walking around during lunch time because the location was crowded.  After looking at the cooks fix chicken and steak nachos for other customers , I decided to try the steak nachos.  They tasted great and the steak was tender. I will definitely consider this location for lunch in the future....

Regular Mexican place in the loop. No fake fancy tacos, just good regular food. I've been there twice, first time had the burrito, and it tasted "healthy" (meaning a little lack of flavor).Went back again - had the steak torta special. One of the better tortas I've had - good avocado spread, and all the ingredients seemed fresh.Maybe growing pains with the first time - really great food the second time. Both times, the cashier was a little indifferent, but the expo was great - love the good attitude and the desire for good service. Is a bit pricey - but that's to be expected in the loop.Great little quick Mexican spot. Will go back.

Who doesn't love this place lolSo I tried it because someone told me about the tacos. First time I got steak and the 2nd time I went I got 1 steak, 1 chicken, 1 barbacoa. The steak is great, chicken is amazing, and the barbacoa needs like some seasoning or sauce.By the way, the people that work there are super nice, especially the guy that may be the owner who rings you up.Don't forget desert!!!! If you like chocolate cake....oh my goodness get it!!! The tres leches cake is also good.

I'm so glad I found this place. I usually order a burrito bowl (wasn't it 'bol' forever ago?) at Chipotle, so I ordered an asada bowl and oh man, I might finally be able to stop kicking myself for having to choose between my monthly bills and a side of guacamole!Yessss, that means guacamole is NOT extra here! Hallelu. For a whopping $8, I got a giant to-go thing filled to the brim with: lettuce, corn, pico, some amazing black beans, a generous helping of fajita veggies (my fav!), sour cream, cheese and of course, steak. Everything was fresh and seasoned perfectly. Their salsas are awesome too, but not totally necessary since the asada bowl already has so much flavor. I do wish the menu had more options but for now, my belly is (so very) full and, most importantly, I am happy.

Bummer, I've been constantly searching for a Small Business Mexican joint to take over as my go-to spot instead of Chipolte.Well...... That hunt continues because it won't be AsadaI got the Burrito, it was somewhat small; but as someone else mentioned probably a "normal" size of what we Should be eating. Either way, I expected more about both the Size as well as the taste. The burrito was pretty boring and sadly I won't be going back.

I was super pumped to see a Mexican joint joining the Loop neighborhood ever since the previous Mexican restaurant closed down.  Asada... looked good, super clean, nice people, decent menu options.  Everything you could ask for, until you are about to finish your meal and there is a hair in your damn quesadilla!Let me back up.  My fiance and I were working from home and since Asada has "loop" hours we knew we could never take advantage of this promising restaurant.  So we ventured out in the cold to try this new place.  I ordered a cheese quesadilla and he ordered a steak burrito.  After much confusion with the workers putting everybody's orders together, we finally had our food and were excited to go home and try it.  My first bite into my CHEESE quesadilla was a disappointment... shredded chicken.  At least I am not a vegetarian, otherwise that could have been very bad!  I ate it nonetheless... mostly because it was too cold to walk back.  Now I don't know if I paid for the chicken or of the kitchen messed up the order but either way, it's annoying.  My fiance's burrito was small in size and in taste.  There was coleslaw in it?  Wierd.I am all for small businesses and was super pumped about Asada, but this is a total let down.  And the price was about the same as Chipotle... which is where I will be going from now on.
Great Spot. Nasir The Manager I Believe, Greeted Me With Open Arms And Peace. Great Atmosphere And Food Was Wonderful.

Space was clean and pretty inviting. I enjoyed the big TV screen airing CNN to catch up on some news. Staff was friendly.Got the chicken burrito, which came out in about 5 minutes. It was pretty tasty, but I wished it was bigger, but it was probably the amount I should be eating anyways. I was left wanting more, but to be fair, I feel the same after eating a Chipotle burrito (I have a big appetite).It soon was packed around noon and noticed that some customers were waiting quite awhile for their orders, so not sure how efficient their service is.Coworkers got the tacos and it was actually 3 tacos instead of 2, as stated on the menu. The red and green salsas on the tables were somewhat disappointing. Both were lackluster and needed more flavor and spice.Not a bad place to go but not amazing either.
Amazing Tres Leches Cake!  And the food was good too.  This my new place for Mexican Food in the Loop.

DONT NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL!!!I am a huge fan of Mexican food. I liked the name of the restaurant so I stopped in.(bad choice) The rice was over cooked and had no flavor at all. It was as if they had slow week and used the same rice all week. The steak had the texture or show leather and no flavor at all. Stay awake unless you want bad food.

I was looking for a quick lunch meal that would warm my belly on a cold, afternoon and saw the inviting sign that said "Chicken Enchiladas Special $7" Spotting the relatively small line, I jumped in the queue and ordered up some Chicken Enchiladas from the counter and patiently waited for my food.The restaurant is brand new, and very clean and nice inside. There is a nice bright big screen TV on Sportscenter to distract you from the wait. All the tables were occupied when I arrived, but luckily seats opened up as I was getting my food.The special included rice and an avocado salad to accompany the Chicken Enchiladas which ended up being a decent amount of food for $7. The Enchiladas turned out a bit dry, but still had the necessary seasoning. I could've probably mitigated it with some sour cream, but I'm not a big fan of smothering my food with that stuff. Their house hot sauce packed a good kick, but the enchiladas was a bit disappointing. However, the avocado/salad that the included was pretty fresh and good (although basic), and the rice was acceptable (with a little help from the hot sauce).Overall, I would say the flavors are OK, but the textures are a bit off (which could be due to inexperience with dealing with heavy traffic lunch hours). This place is still very new, so maybe I'll give it another try in the future.
The food was amazing. Service was nice and super fast. I would definitely recommend this place!

We stopped after reading the reviews and were walking back to the train. We arrived less than 1 hour before closing on a Thursday. Burrito, chips and guacamole, veggie bowl and chicken bowl-Delicious! Everything was very good and their prices are amazing. The owner was very friendly and came over to chat and say hello. Definitely returning! They are opening a suburban location as well he mentioned, RT 59 and 95th area near Naperville/Aurora.

I went to Asada on a lunch break, and was all excited that there was a new place to get Mexican-type food (other than Chipotle) to throw into the mix of places I could eat.The place smelled great upon entry.  The man who took my order was very friendly, and almost looked like he might be the owner, or at least a manager.  You could tell by the way he dressed and talked to the workers.I was in the mood for some steak nachos, and that's just what I ordered.  I was hoping it would be similar to Taco Fresco's nachos (which used to be in this location before it closed), but I was wrong. First of all.....CHEESE SAUCE??????   I'm sorry, but if you're calling yourself a Mexican grill, you should NEVER, ever use cheese sauce!!  Cheese sauce is reserved for crappy festival nachos, or movie theater nachos.  But NOT at a Mexican food joint.  Everything else on the plate was great, but the cheese sauce ruined everything about the food and my experience there.While I will never go back there again for nachos, I try not to throw the baby out with the bathwater on any food establishment.  I always try to come back to try something different next time.  Perhaps there is something else that I will like there?I am not sure where to get good steak nachos (maybe La Cocina?) in the vicinity of my workplace.  If anyone can name a good place, I'd be grateful!

What's not to love about this place?? ... I work down the street and frequent Asada for lunch.  I've dined and have gotten my food to go; never a complaint with the flavor of the food or the food being made correctly.  Service is quick (not rushed) and the staff is friendly.

Tried this new place by my job and it turned out to be pretty good. I ordered 3 chicken tacos(all orders come with 3 unless u get the dinner which also have beans and rice)and the tacos were a good size and the chicken was very flavorful. I also ordered guacamole and chips. The chips were fresh and not covered in oil. The guacamole was good except it had way too many onions. Place is very clean and customer service is good and fast. Will be back here again.

This is a great lunch spot in the loop. the best part is that it is extremely clean, they always have specials, and the man at the register (presumably the owner) is so friendly, always thanks you for your business, remembers you, just an overall good experience compared to some other options in the loop.I always get the chicken quesadilla and it is so much food I don't eat dinner that night or I have enough to save for the next day.

This place is my new quick go-to and Gringas are my new fave lunch. 3lightly grilled flour tortillas with tender chicken that's actually seasoned, not that tasteless shredded boiled stuff that's usually served at Mexican places.  Plus generous cheese, cilantro and onions, with line slices. Delish! The table salsa is great, especially the red, servings are generous, and the owner is charming. Last week I had the chicken salad special; also fresh and yummy. My only sad is no char broiler for carne asada or they'd be 5 stars in my book (but not their fault; zoning issue, I believe.Fantastic for lunch!

We were looking for a Mexican restaurant today to celebrate Cinco De Mayo and we found Asada. First of all this place is extremely clean, which is more than you can say for most of the nearby Mexican restaurants. They have a very simplistic menu with the basics of taco's, burritos, taco salad and a burrito bowl type of thing.I got a steak burrito and it was delicious! Had steak, rice, cheese, tomatoes, and the basics. It was a pretty good size burrito and would have probably been able to split it and I would have been satisfied. That didn't happen though. I ate the whole thing. Something I liked was that they cut the burrito in half for you which makes it much easier to eat.The prices weren't bad but some things are a little high, like the chips and guac for $4.50. I had the horchata too and that was delicious!Overall a really good place if you are looking for Mexican food for lunch in the city. It has replaced, for me, our nearby go to which was Lacocina (sp?).

On my way to work I saw this spot, and immediately told myself that I must come here for lunch soon. It finally happened today. My coworkers and I came here to meet up with another old coworker and had lunch here. It's a small spot, but it was fantastic. I would normally give 4 stars but there wasn't anything I could complain about and there were things that just made the overall experience pretty awesome. First of all, our group of 4 only waited a short while to get a couple of tables together and we were getting help from the owner and another worker there. It was very sweet that they noticed and tried to do something for us. Despite the menu being simple there was plenty I wanted to try. I ended up going with the spicy fish that came on a bed of rice, salad, and guacamole. The fish was flavorful and spicy, the rice was very tasty, and the guacamole was solid. Also, it looks like they have refillable horchata - unheard of! I thought I might have had to order an appetizer or something to get full, but I was more than stuffed. They also give you a sample size of chips, and I really enjoyed the red sauce at the table. I totally want to come back and try the bowl, the chicken enchilada special, the burrito, and the tacos. The owner came by to let us know that shrimp will be on the menu soon. The prices are reasonable, the staff is friendly, and the food is really good. I'm sure I'll be back!

The steak burrito was very good, I loved the Barbacoa it was tender a shredded just right this place is only 3 months in and it is a gem if your downtown find it and try it you will be pleasantly surprised the place is very clean and the owner is very nice he walks around and talks to the customers I will be back for sure plus they open early for breakfast they also close early so lunch time is perfect

I went to Asada yesterday with some coworkers for lunch and we enjoyed it just enough. I ordered the steak quesadilla which proved to be a LOT of dilla. They gave me a free side of chips with my request for salsa which was unanticipated.I really like how clean and bright the environment is. Staff was friendly and fast. Probably will choose this place over Chipotle in the future.
Excellent fast food with a wonderful owner to match. A good to for lunch in the loop.
Really great food. The owner is super nice and friendly, the place is clean, and all their items are great.

I....love...this...place...I work down the street from them and since they opened I have eaten there about 6 times. I have been satisfied every damn time. And to prove a point...I have to walk past a Chipotle to get here....and it gets easier every time to walk right on by and wing a right on wells to this wonderful spot.One of the best burritos i have had in a while and the hot sauces are delicious! I enjoyed the mango last time and am looking forward to trying a few more next time.The staff is also very nice and management seems very hands on and involved...which i think is somewhat rare these days.

Meh. En route to Chipotle I saw that a new Mexican joint popped up, seemingly in the weeks I've been out of town traveling for work.I ordered the Monterrey chicken salad. Something just seemed a little off - the lettuce was wet, the toppings tasted canned, the chicken was just wrong. I guess what really got me though, before I even got back to the office to eat, was the guy packing up orders insisting on placing the container side of dressing on top of the lettuce, even after it had been in the fridge, on the counter, and then in his bare hands that had just handled money.I won't be back.
Came in ordered steak taco salad very friendly staff and my salad was deelish! I will be back! Thanks!

After La Bamba Closed, I cried a lot.. then I walked a little further and found Asada which opened pretty recently. It does not look like your typical "Authentic" Mexican fast food. It looks clean and modern, there are a few tables but I would carry out. What i love most is how vegetarian friendly the menu is. Veggie tacos? thats rare. they have a veggie variant of  burritos, enchiladas, quesadillas, tacos.. etc.. The burrito was big and full of flavor, the hot sauces have a kick. I will be here pretty frequently.
Good food and service! Had the Asada steak burrito and loved it! Will be back to try the chicken burrito soon. Owner was very nice and service was fast.

This place reminds me a lot of Chipotle.  For less than 8 bucks you can get a big steak box not unlike Chipotle's burrito bowl.  Quality-wise, it's also about what you would expect to get from Chipotle, which is mediocre quality and good quantity.

Sadly, the quest for the best Mexican spot other than chipotle continues. I stopped in today with two coworkers for lunch.The restaurant is very clean and the staff is very efficient. The menu is sparse with three burrito options, a few taco options and soups/salads.My coworkers ordered burritos and I ordered a tortilla soup. Since it was subzero outside, we decided to dine in. Perhaps because of the bitter cold the interior wasn't much warmer than the exterior. The food took about 7 to 10 minutes to come out. The burritos were about medium size in the soup was a decent cup.Upsettingly, it's hard to beat chipotle. Asada doesn't come close. The price points are equal to if not greater than chipotle and the quality and quantity aren't there. My coworkers burritos were underwhelming. My soup was ok, but I've had much better tortilla soups.I very much wanted this establishment to be Bueno, but I've learned my lesson and will stick with the tried-and-true for my americanized Mexican food.I'd suggest skipping asada.

This place is a great authentic mexican lunch spot.   We're talking steak tacos with onion cilantro and lime.  If you u like your tacos americanized with cheese and tomatoes and iceberg lettuce....go somewhere else noob.  Food comes quick and with a smile everytime.  These are as close as u can get to Mexico City street vendor food.  So good.  Food comes with hearty rice and a small tray of chips.  Love.
Definitely some of the better tacos in the Loop.

For what it is, it gets the job done.  The food is always fresh, consistent and for $10, which is what a cheap lunch anywhere down here runs, it is worth a repeat trip.Slightly more authentic than Chipotle for about the same price, it is a welcome addition to the area. Due to the mob scene that the local Chipotle is, we needed a place like this.I have been there 4 times, and every time, the service was very fast, very courteous, and the food was of great and consistent quality.  Nothing negative to say whatsoever.Understand, this is not a fancy Loop joint. It is a burrito joint, and it absolutely excels at that.  Reasonable price, really good food.  For you idiots giving it a low star because your order got messed up once, or it is not comparable to Frontera Grill, please just sit down and shut up.  Thanks.

While looking for another Mexican place instead of my usual Chipotle or Q'doba, I came across this in yelp.  Boy am I glad I did!!  The steak tacos are so delish!  I got the dinner with rice and beans and the rice is so good, not dried out or hard, really fresh with a small amount of veggies in it.  The beans aren't refried, they are simply delish too!  I definitely recommend this place.  You also get a fresh lime wedge!  Winning!!!   Now now, yes I gave it 5 stars, but one thing that I do have to complain about is the tiny bag of FREE chips you get with your meal, there are about 8-10 chips in the bag.  They aren't the best, but give me more.  LOL!    Get up and get you some Asada...it's really good!
I just had the carrot, beets and celery juice it's delicious and fresh!! And it's only $3.49!

was not aware that Fresca had closed but saw this in it's place & decided to try it.  Got the steak nachos.  Underwhelmed.  More jalapenos than steak.  Cheese Whiz type of sauce that doesn't stay hot or warm very long.  It was almost like ballpark nachos.  Maybe I got the wrong thing but after reading the reviews here, sounds like most people were disappointed.  I'm sorry that it wasn't good.  I work a block away.  Taco Fresca was better.  Agree that for the price Chipotle would have been better.

WOW WOW WOW. Amazing. I found this place by accident. I had a Chipotle craving so I went on a hunt. My GPS was messing up I was going in circles trying to find it, then I just gave up. I walked past this place and I decided to give this place a try.Best decision ever.I got a steak burrito. And that is the best burrito I have ever had, hands down. Such perfection and an explosion of the right flavors. The hot sauce is amazing too. All these years, I have been deceived by Chipotle as to what a burrito should taste like. Blasphemy.I will definitely be returning to this place. Delicious. True Mexican food (and fast).Thank you!

I gave this place two tries.  First time, I got an arrachera burrito which was the special.  Second time, I got the chicken "bowl" which btw is a salad.  I thought this was going to be pretty much a burrito minus the tortilla.  This food is extremely american Mexican.  I am part Mexican so I know good Mexican food when I have it.  This unfortunately, was a pretty bad attempt on Mexican food.   If you're looking for decent Mexican food in this area of the loop, walk the next block over to la cocina.  Won't be back.
This place was great! Very tasty, clean, and the owner was extremely friendly.
I got the burrito with avocado. Ask for the pickled jalapeños too. Salsa is on the table and really cranks up the flavor to an awesome place. Space is beautiful and staff was genuinely hospitable.
Good food, awesome customer service, and has a modern sleek look to it. And prices are just fine. The owner even offered a free drink since the weather was hot, which was cool. Love the place.

Great place for lunch in the Loop. Ordered a burrito to go and the owner noticed that my car was out front with hazards on. He was worried, that I would get a ticket, so he told me to wait in the car and he brought me my burrito. Great service and a fantastic burrito!
$4.75 for a good sized portion of carne asada, eggs, fajita veggies & rice for breakfast. Tasty without adding sauce or squeezing a lime. Will be back to try out their lunches!
Excellent food and price. I always get the green Chilaquiles. Breakfast menu is great and a welcome variety to your typical breakfast menus. A must try.
Very tasty, fresh and healthy Mexican. Super-clean and cool decor. Very friendly service too. I am a big fan of the "Acapulco Bay" fish tacos and the Santa Fe chicken salad. Portions are generous.

Saw this place when i was aimlessly walking around trying to decide what to get for lunch.  figured i should give it a try instead of going to the usual Chipotle.It made me miss Chipotle!The space is clean and there was a good crowd dining in so I thought that was a good sign. I ordered the chicken Asada bowl thinking it would be similar to the chipotle burrito bowl given the description on the menu.  but it was so NOT!  The ingredients seemed canned and the flavor was a bit off.  I am not sure exactly what the taste was, but it definitely  was not good. I will not be going back and next time will take my $8 around the corner to Chipotle.

I love the food here!  Everything is so fresh and very tasty.  Considering that there is a Chipotle and a Costa Vida around the corner, I thought it would just be some of the same fare.  I ordered the chicken quesadillas and it was more than enough without the beans and rice.  It was so well seasoned too!  This is my new regular place for Mexican food and it's even better that it's right across the street from my job.

Got the Veggie Bowl. Disappointed. Felt like I got charged the same amount for a bowl that just lacked meat. Nothing extra or special about it. At least at Chipotle, you can get the softritas and/or guac on it. Furthermore, there were a TON of onions and hardly any cheese. I spent 8 bucks on a half a pound of onions on rice.

New fresh Mexican quick service restaurant. The staff is really nice, especially the owner. Good quality food that tastes amazing. Decently priced and it's clean! The menu includes Tacos, Burritos, Bowls, Salads, Soups, Quesadillas, Nachos, and various sides.

First time trying Asada today.  I got the steak burrito which definitely did not need to be any larger.  It tasted very fresh and I appreciated that they put it on the grill for a few minutes because my biggest complaint about Chipotle is that nothing is ever hot...just lukewarm which does nothing for the flavor.  The horchata was very sweet but I added a little water to it when I got back to the office and it was perfect.  I will definitely be back...I love the small menu.

Chicken bone in my quesadilla.  Small slightly bland burrito. No sides. $4 guac. Watery salsa and tacos. Cold restaurant - slightly warmer than the subzero temps outside. No kick to the salsa. Decent sized portions unless compared to Chipotle (for the same price). Friendly and fast service. Clean environment and kitchen - though recently opened.) Dessert offerings: biscotti.Overall - if you're in a pinch the Taco's and the burrito were adequate but if you have 5 additional minutes go wait in the line at Chipotle.
expected more from the steak tacos

if you aren't Filipino, you are going to have quite an adventure here.  the people of this land love a big brekkie.  a serious 3 course gigantic skirt steak & eggs meal starting with a bowl of glutenous porridge.  what is that?I've been here a few times & i try hard to eat it all but alas...my belly is not filipino size.the food is pretty hardcore & you have to be open minded to eat your way through the entire menu.  i'm a food wimp but my hubs loses his mind here.if you are looking for a totally unique flavor experience, i don't think you can do better than mike's.it's the real deal, according to my filipino pals.

Smells like my parents' house when they cook Filipino food. Super comforting. I've been here multiple times with friends, with my boyfriend, with coworkers. It's a cool place. Every time I come here it's been packed, but don't be fooled by the small exterior. They have seating in the back. Service is always cool.Okay, now on to food. I almost always get the longanisa and tosino combo, which comes with rice and eggs done your way. I really like their Filipino food. I've never strayed from it when I come here. My boyfriend got steak and eggs one time and instantly wished he just got Filipino food. Well, duh.Back up. What's longanisa? What's tosino? They're tasty pieces of meat (let's be adults here). I would describe longanisa as Filipino sausage - so good with rice. And for you adventurous non-judging folks, I like longanisa with a banana. Don't knock it til you try it. Tosino is a sweet and savory pork belly. My faaaaaave fosho.One more tip: food is waaaay better when you dine in.

Uncle mikes is a great place to get Filipino breakfast. The place is one of those neighborhood diners. The inside isn't a fancy restaurant but it does the job. It's spacious so you can bring a lot of people to dine in with you.Before we ordered, we got this soup that had rice, lemon, chicken, and scallions. It was okay. It was a good start to dining. Just add some salt and pepper and it's good.I got the tocilog which is Filipino pork sausage (tocino), eggs, and garlic rice. They also gave us cold champorado which is rice and chocolate mix. That was ok. Not my favorite.The tocino was really good. It was cooked just right and the right blend. It wasn't too sweet like most tocinos I've had. The egg was egg - nothing special. The garlic rice was good. It wasn't anything special. The portion was great. They give you a lot for it being $10. You can eat the other half for lunch or dinner.Would definitely come back again.

We met up with couple friends at brunch here. My friend who came here before said there's normally a line wait on Saturday mornings/early afternoons. When we got here around 1130am on a Saturday there wasnt a line and we were seated in the back with a big table for 6. They have fillippino breakfast entrees along with the normal brunch items that you would normally order (ie omelette, eggs/ham, etc). We wanted to try the fillippino breakfast so I had the pork chop with garlic fried rice while my husband had the skirt steak. My other two friends had their pork shoulders. We all enjoyed our food.. I really love the garlic fried rice. Something so simple tastes so good! When we were about to leave, they gave us free pork to go! How nice and awesome!
