The waitress who should have been serving us was busy so the manager actually got our drink orders and first food orders.We started with a bottle of Malbec which was reasonably priced for downtown Chicago, and very good.To start we had the artichoke dip and the fried pickles, pickles were served with a sriacha aioli which was great.The entree selection was amazing! I had the executive which was an 8oz steak loaded with roasted Brussels sprouts, potatoes and onions. It was insanely good. My wife ordered the funny guy and subbed out the mushrooms for chicken, it was epicly good!! Amazing flavor.One guest at our table had the burger and after reading the menu description it was surprisingly bland. Not bad, just kind of normal.Overall awesome place and great prices.
Went by with co-workers for a drink.  Was good for what we needed (able to get table, quiet for talk) but a bit spendy.  Bill was $92 (including tax and tip) for three of us each having two drinks.

If I could, I'd rate this a 3.5 stars. I made reservations at The Marq because my family was in town visiting and they were coming in from Ogilvie, so I wanted to meet somewhere in the middle to have a nice dinner and The Marq had nice reviews. The place has a classy ambiance inside and the guests matched: it seemed like a lot of people were having business dinners or meetings after work. The bar was pretty full with guests in suits.I ordered The Executive which was chicken, palenta and stir-fried veggies. I really liked my meal, especially the palenta, but I'm not sure it was worth $19 because the portion size wasn't as big as other restaurants in the area.My sister and Grandma got burgers and both enjoyed them a lot. My dad got the ribs and said they were "OK". We all split the dessert of the night which was an apple crisp with ice cream... again kind of a small portion to split three ways but probably for the best.Overall, nice place.. nothing too special for the area but happy I visited.

Had a great experience here on a Sat Eve after the Blues Fest. Waitress was fantastic. Very friendly & accommodating. Real comfortable upscale atmosphere. Awesome beer list & decent wine list.I has the burger which was awesome, cooked just how I liked it. The fries were just right, a little crisp but not overdone.She had the salmon salad & she loved it.The only knock was the menu isn't too deep, but what is on it was delish.Also they had multiple TVs around the restaurant for excellent sports viewing.
Delicious. Must try the onion rings. Went in for appetizers and wine with my husband. Great ambiance and yummy food. Must try!

Food was good, service lacking - three items on the menu were not available but the server didn't tell us (or subsequent guests) this until we tried to order them. Cheese plate came out with burnt toast - and the next course arrived before we had even gotten started on it. Server then tried to clear our plates while we were still eating the cheese (and burnt toast.) Giant TV gives the place an odd vibe.

The Marq was perfect for dinner. Pretty empty for a Friday night, but I believe this place is mostly packed earlier in the evenings for those who work in the area. It is a nice set up, and the food was good. I had Salmon Succotash - delicious and a lot of food! Their drink menu is also excellent with a good selection of beer and yummy mixed drinks. My friend had a salad, which while tasty, it was strange that the chicken on it was served cold. Altogether a good place!

We stopped at the Marq for some drinks and a quick bite on our way to a party.  Since it was a Friday night I made a reservation, and I'm glad I did, the place was packed!The food was all very good.  I tried a few different things from the appetizer menu and it was all good.  The drinks were...ok.  I had a specialty cocktail that did not knock my socks off (ok, fine, I wasn't wearing socks, but you get the idea).The service was good, they were busy but our server was attentive.I'd definitely stop in for a drink or dinner at the Marq again.  It's on my way home from work and I think we all know how much I like to drink after work.PS...If you do stop in check out the lobby of the building...There's a really cool mural made of Tiffany glass (or so they tell me).

Stopped by on a Wednesday evening during my trip to Chicago, plenty of seating. We got there right before they closed, I felt bad but we really wanted to check this place out.Our server was incredibly attentive. Very friendly staff. Relatively good selection of beers on tap and bottles.Clean and well organized dining area. Bar was polished and fit for a room of queens and kings. Really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant. Sucks they are only open until 10PM. Other my gripe about the closing time, excellent place for drinks with family or friends.
Great service, pretty solid food, nice patio in the middle of downtown Chicago -- a pretty solid combo!
On top of being in a great location for a weekday team lunch, it has a great menu and atmosphere.

Excellent choice for dinner for 2. Had the Pear With Me and In Between Flights for drinks. Both were outstanding! For dinner, enjoyed the Marq Slider, Sticky Ribs, and we shared the Fries (no shortage of fries, plenty to share).Drinks were a little pricey but that's Chicago. Overall, though, great place.

We had the Salmon Park for our appetizer, think ceviche with basil and cucumbers added, it was delicious. It was served with large rustic crackers.Main dishes were the Chicken and the Salmon. The Salmon was fantastic the chicken was very good but could have been just a bit moister. The chicken was served with some grilled veggies and polenta which was out of this world. We had a bottle of The Jack Cabernet  and raspberry covered bread pudding ( they offer a single dessert each day). Our waitress and the manager were both fantastic and took the time to talk with us even though it was a busy Friday night.Overall an excellent evening at a very fair price.

We were dining for the first time at The Marq on Adams St in the Loop, enjoying the friendly, efficient service, when my wife's steak arrived with a sauce that happened to include lots of cilantro, which literally makes her gag.We apologetically explained the problem, the plate was whisked away and the manager, Donny, courteously offered a replacement, no questions asked.A second steak, with no sauce, arrived  tender, tasty and cooked exactly as requested, no charge. My meal was equally good.  We'd definitely return.A small quibble-- if you want wi-fi, you could be disappointed. For us, the guest wi-fi here just didn't work, not at our sidewalk table and not when I tried again inside.

Stopped in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Noticed they had chilaquiles on the menu.I gotta try those! I'm glad i did I ordered them with steak.It was a tossup between the Marq Burger and the chilaquiles.Fast great service as well.

I decided to go out for lunch with one of my friends, he spoke highly of this place. The staff was very welcoming. We came in around lunch time and it was very packed, but no wait time. The waiter was happy to assist us with a popular appetizer dish which he recommended the artichoke dip (which was great suggestion). The artichoke dip had a little spice to it and tasted better on the pita bread. Will come back some time for dinner
Great food, great drinks, great service.Whipped ricotta app was amazing. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for something a little different.

Pros - there were a lot of men at this bar.  Like... a LOT of men. For a while I thought I was at a gay bar.  (Is this a gay bar? I know... if it is, it's probably the straightest gay bar I've ever been in...)Cons - Service was really slow, drinks were kiiiiinda overpriced...

I sat at the bar intending to order a beer and dinner. The bartender has a bit of an attitude so I only ordered a beer. The price on the menu for the beer I ordered, Belgian wheat, allagash white is priced at $7 on the menu, the bartender took my $10 and only brought back $2. Kept  $1 for himself. Maybe that's normal practice in Chicago but I think it's more like theft.The crooked bartender's name is Andrew.I received a message from the owner of the Marq. He explained that the bartender did not steal my $1, he said that my change would have been $0.26 after tax but they have a policy to round all change up to the nearest dollar. Still seems like thievery but they must have different laws in Chicago.  It is also policy not to give a receipt if someone orders only 1 drink at the bar, which means people unfamiliar with their policies would never know where their change went or about the tax.The owner did inform me that going forward they will be providing receipts and round up to the nearest quarter ($0.25).  However, not giving the full amount of change due still seems a lot like theft to me, but I'm not a lawyer.  I wonder how that put that in their books, misc. revenue? Or do the bartenders pocket the little change.
Fun place to go for a good drink, food is good. but they close so early on weeknights, make sure you call to see if they are open.

My good friend and I went to the Marq because it was so close to the PrivateBank Theater.  Service was great.  Drinks and food were very tasty.  Loved my Tequila Eclipse and the Sweet Spicy Sticky Ribs.  Would definitely come back and bring my boo for a date night.

If you've been to any new American-style restaurant, you know what to expect from The Marq. Lots of trendy design choices, with a diverse menu and an extensive beer, wine, and spirits list.Nothing wrong with that though! The burger I got was very juicy - almost too much so. Grab a pint and come here to relax.

Update review**I'm in Chicago for the weekend and went back to The Marq. I noticed a couple of new menu items and decided to have the Chilaquiles with Carnitas.Absolutely delicious!!  Carnitas was perfectly cooked, chips crispy and gooey cheese.This place continues to shine in an area that could use less chains and more homemade cooking.
Short Review: Clean and Trendy spot with a good vibe, at a nice price ($15/head)Order: The Marq Burger with Fries and a beer.Skip: Salmon Burger

My husband and I went to The Marq for the first time last night (saw it had high reviews on Yelp, oh yeah) and were happy! The front of the restaurant was reserved for some industry type event, but there is a ton of seating in the back area and at the bar. We chose to sit at the bar and were able to drink and eat till we almost popped. We sampled a couple beers at the kind suggestion of the bartender and decided two that we were happy with. We had the heirloom tomato brushetta and burratta appetizer and then shared the blueberry salad and chicken entree. Each dish was so flavorful and tasty that the hubs and I started to consider ourselves foodies. But then we laughed, finished our beers, and went on our way. If you are in the Loop area of Chicago, definitely go by The Marq -they have a great happy hour!

Was out shopping on the first day of snow.. What snow? We are in the Loop!This place is good. First time here and I will be back. I am usually surprised when a restaurant is quiet on a Sat night, but the 4 stars on Yelp made stop in to see this place. I'm glad I did. Customer service was great.  Everyone, including the manager was very nice. Food- excellent!!Ahi Tuna Poke- served cold and is a good app to order.Salmon Bearnaise- must get this!! The flavors from the foods blend together to give ur mouth a party.Thank you to the chef!

Picked this spot for a work lunch with my new manager and one other coworker.  We had a 12:15 reservation on Wednesday and the place was decently packed but it's actually a lot bigger than it seems.  They have a bar in the middle and some TVs but most of it is set up for tables of 4.  It's a pretty nice place but still has a casual vibe to it.  We were able to eat a complete lunch within an hour, so that's a plus in my book that we didn't have to wait forever for the food to come out.  I ordered the burger and added bib lettuce.  It was really good and juicy but I think if the sauce on it was more tart that it would have a lot more flavor.  Definitely liked the pickles and pickled red onion on it though! My manager ordered a salad with fruit it in, and just looking at her plate, the fruit seemed kind of sparse.  My coworker had the ribs which were fall off the bone and spicy/tangy but not really smokey.  I tried his side of brussel sprouts and they were a little too over seasoned with salt.  Over all a nicer solid lunch that didn't break the bank.

The fried pickles were better than any I've ever had before! You get just the right amount to share with another person; not too much, not too little. The Marq burger (added fried egg) was fantastic. Be prepared to ask for an extra napkin, however. Very messy! I think the fried egg added to the mess factor. The fries were delicious as well. Service was great and it had a great, relaxed atmosphere and nice bar. The only reason it gets 4 stars is because it was a bit pricey for some burgers and fries.

Located in the Marquette Building...The fry that caught my eye...LOVE the french fries here and they go very well with a beer from their decent selection on a cold winter's night.  I walk past here often and I was never one to catch a bite at the Marquette Diner so this place (being open 'til much later than the former business) was a sight for sore eyes and cold cheeks.I'm solid on a three-star rating...not sure about the four - I was stretching to give it to them for both the location and the service. My young server was personable and went out of his way to make sure I was happy. I always appreciate that.The food we had was good. My friend did take-out on the burger.  I had the three-cheese grilled cheese which likewise, hit the spot though I don't care for it on foccacia. (The bread was slightly soggy.) Cool thing was that I'd taken half the sandwich home and nuked it the next day and surprisingly, it was much firmer and better.The ambience is light-toned-modern. It's nice and that's such a lame word as is the word "lame." But that's the take-away. It felt somehow "cafeteria-ish" to me. Maybe if there were votives or a small flower on the table. It didn't help that it was fairly empty on a freezing night; maybe what it was lacking was just a few more patrons as it's a decent sized space. The bar/tv area was the nucleus and the couple of groups of people who were dining were seated over there, but I felt like a window seat. It'll be great for watching passers-by when the temp isn't 20 degrees.All in all, I agree - great place for a drink, to warm-up and to have a bite and conveniently located across the street from Federal Plaza so I can finally remember to mail the birthday card I toted around all day.Enter off Adams or you can access via Dearborn and catch a glimpse of the lobby of the Marquette building.

Great burger.  Perfect for lunch and really great service.  First visit and went with my team - tables can easily sit parties of ten or less.  Everyone was pleased with their dishes.  Not one complaint.  Definitely will return for happy hour.

I chose this place due to the reviews.  But I found it rather meh.  Had the Marq burger with fries.  It was ok just a bit too soggy for me.  The fries were ok although fries are not my thing.  But they were there so I ate a few.The service was spotty.  Was provided with water that lacked ice and was tepid (I've noticed that in the loop restaurants ice is a scarcity).Food came out fairly quickly but there were no utensils or condiments, not even salt at the table.  Almost had to get up and get it myself from the kitchen.I got lucky when the food came cause I got a new server and he was on top of the game (the other two first ones disappeared into that black hole where servers sometimes tend to go and are never seen again).All in all I can't really complain (and I didn't).  I had an ok burger.

The Marq hit the mark for me tonight! Absolutely delicious. My mom and I were looking for a place to eat that wasn't generic and overpopulated. We found The Marq to be exactly what we wanted. The vibe of the restaurant is relaxing and welcoming. The staff was phenomenal. They were so kind and so accommodating.We ordered the artichoke and spinach dip to start and it was AMAZING. Spicy but not too spicy. Creamy but not too creamy. Just delicious. Then we split an order of the Mac n cheese with the pork belly. It was super rich, but nonetheless a scrumptious entree. And for dessert, the chefs special, bananas foster. And of course, it was incredible. No complaints to be found at this place. I will come back!!!!! Love love love.

The manager makes this review 5 stars.  Food was yummy - in the 4 star category.  I really loved the kale Asian salad and I don't normally even eat salads!A member of my group had a special order burger and it had to be sent back.  Manager immediately came to the table apologizing and was extremely focused on making our experience better.  We noticed later he was meticulous to detail and even when the revolving door was left open he corrected it.  It was the small stuff that mattered!

I was in town on business, saw the reviews so figured I would dine here. This was my second time coming here. Place is cool. Friendly staff good music choice for dining. I was not that impressed with the food. It was fine, nothing to write home about. I ordered the salmon Nicosie. The salmon was broken into small pieces reminded me of cat food. It was moist but why crumble it. & Chef's you should always S&P. It was in desperate need of salt & pepper. The menu said 6 min egg I got 1/2 egg REALLY. Cooked perfect but would have liked the other half. Purple potatoes had no flavor what so ever. The kalamata was the only item  giving this dish some flavor. First time I came had the burger better choice than the salmon.

My wife and I are downtown renewing my passport and getting one for our son. It's cold and we're hungry.  Marq to the rescue! Fantastic burger and the best fried pickles I've ever had. We will be back.

This place was great. I happened upon it on accident. The bartender was attentive and very helpful in food and beer choices. He also help me plan my evening out in another part of town--he was like a personal tour guide!The food was outstanding! I highly recommend the cauliflower as a side. Awesome.The space is nice, very modern and warm. There were plenty of TVs for March Madness!The only con is the price--but that is to be expected in the location it is. Right in the heart of the financial district.
Food was tasty, service was tasty. Good option on a Monday night. I would assume the atmosphere would have been better on another night!

I had the salmon succotash and a glass of Riesling. The salmon was perhaps a bit too overseasoned, but I enjoyed the mix of savory fans fresh ingredients.  The place was relatively busy for a Monday night.  Would definitely recommend!

One of our best girlfriends was in town from LA and we met here to enjoy some cocktails and have dinner. We loved our drinks and the food was to die for, particularly the macaroni and cheese and fried pickles. We had a big group of girls and the staff was so friendly and accommodating.It was our first time here but we can't wait to return.  It's the perfect place to meet for dinner, drinks, have a meeting, or just enjoy the city.

Food: A+. I have so far loved everything I've eaten here! I HAVE to try everyone's spinach artichoke dip, it's a minor obsession, and the Marq's did not disappoint and definitely a new favorite! Also, ahi tuna poke. Delicious.The burgers, the mac and cheese, the ribs, steak, there was a chicken dish I can't remember, soups, all awesome and I'm looking forward to trying something new next.Customer Service: A+. I was pregnant the first time I went to the Marq and my burger wasn't completely done enough for my paranoid self and they were very accomodating and even gave me a snack to eat while I waited for my burger to come back since everyone else was eating.Prices: A. I live in the suburbs and I think they're completely reasonable for what they offer. I expect to spend a lot more when I go to the city.I definitely recommend!

I've been here multiple times, both for lunch and after work drinks.  I actually think it's much better than most other places in the vicinity.  They have a lot of wines by the glass.  As far as food, their version of a Caesar is really good with added chicken.  The chicken is like soup chicken so it's larger bite sized pieces that are very tender.  The steak salad is also good.  The grits are super awesome.  They also have great pork belly that can be added onto entrees.  All pork belly is good but some is better than others and I feel this one is better than others.  The fried pickles and sliders are both decent.  I really like having this option so close to work and will continue to frequent here.
The food was very good and our server Nick was just outstanding.  Would definitely come back and recommend to others.

Not a bad downtown spot for reasonably priced cocktails and beers, ive also gotten fried pickles and the spinach artichoke dip, plus several of their cocktails-passion for bourbon, danika, coronado, and several other beers, usually easy to find a seat, i enjoy going here since i work in the area

Couple of my classmates and I stopped by here yesterday after class. We had 1.5 hours to kill before our next class, so decided to check this place out! Looking at the amazing reviews they have on here, we were excited to try the food. The interior was very posh and exquisite. We were seating almost as soon as we walked in. Our waiter was very helpful with any questions we had regarding the menu. I am disappointed to say that most of us did not like we ordered. I ordered the shishito peppers & soup of the day (it was carrot curry). The peppers did not have any flavor to it what's so ever. As a person who's a fan of spicy food, I was expecting the peppers to be a lot better than what they were. The chipotle mayo sauce they gave didn't really help the taste. A couple of my friends ordered the fried pickles - they were also mediocre. The pickles were sweet instead of sour. A few others ordered Mac and cheese and that seemed to be the only dish everyone like. Although our server was very helpful and came to us with a timely manner with everything (he had over heard that we had class after), I wish the food matched the interior of this restaurant. Definitely trying other options next time!

I was looking for a simple but good-quality meal for a solo dinner tonight while in Chicago on business. The reviews here and the online menu made me think that the Marq would suit me well, and it did.I arrived around 6:45 PM and was seated right away (I chose a table rather than the bar). Service was prompt and friendly. I decided to have a salad and fries, both of which were delicious, and I was on my way soon and with my pocket not overly lightened.Nothing jumped out at me as being particularly amazing, hence the lack of a fifth star, but this was a nice place for a nice meal.

In town for a week and I was tied of itialian, looking for something different and this place hit the spot. I had the Salmon Succotash. Not somthing I would normally order but the manager told me it was a new dish that was really taking off. It was a perfect portion with flavors across the board. Not fishy at all. It is a little loud but it is a bar as well, the staff was great. I would highly recommend.

A few co-workers and I came here for lunch and had an enjoyable meal.Décor: I actually cannot really comment on the interior as we only sat outside. But the seating outside is pretty nice. We were not lucky enough to have an umbrella table but it was a really nice day so we managed. There are a handful of tables right on the sidewalk, behind a "fence" of course, and you don't feel cramped at all.Staff: Our waitress was pretty cool. She was laid-back and very casual, just how I like them to be.Food: We had a few different items: a salad (which was tasty), the Cubano (very good), and the Cali Love (also very good). The food was tasty and, really, that's all I can really say. Nothing was knock-your-socks off delicious but nothing was terrible either. It was just kind of a general lunch with decently general food.Value: The prices are about where you'd expect them: a bit more than I'd like to pay for lunch but, again, it is a sit-down place so I knew what I was getting into.The Marq is a pretty average place from my experience. I'll probably come back in the future but there are many more places I'll try before then.

Food was good. Nothing spectacular. My husband had the burger. It had two thin slices of burger patties between the bun. I had the woldorf salad. Again, nothing to write home about. Considering how much the food costs I expected a little more. The service was good. The manager also gave us a military discount that the server didn't think they had for military people.

I missed out on the opportunity to come here during the summer for a happy hour, and decided to make up for it by selecting it as the spot for a holiday lunch. The staff was very accommodating by moving us to another table to fit in 2 additional people. We started out with the Fried Pickles, which were delicious. I got the 9 to 5 sandwich recommended by the waitress, and was not disappointed. I also got the opportunity to swap out my fries for the roasted cauliflower gratin and that was the way to go. The prices were reasonable and I don't think I'll pass up another opportunity to come back here again.

3-4 stars. The food was (mostly) delicious. We had the charcuterie/frommage appetizer which was kind of expensive ($23 for 5 choices of meat/cheese). It was good; only big disappointment was they served it with greasy wonton like crisps, should be served with sliced baguette.The mains were very good; we had sweet/spicy ribs and chicken. Both were served with delicious polenta and average tasting grilled 'summer vegetables' (yellow/green squash and onion). I don't eat a lot and often have appetizers for dinner but the portions were definitely smallish; don't count on left overs.Oddly, only one dessert choice/night; tonight was an over-dry berry bread pudding which was flavorless.Decent drink selection, comfortable seating (both high and low table choices). Minimalist decor, bar in the middle, 3 tv's by the bar. The place is a mix of contemporary/sports bar/nice restaurant. Spotless, modern bathroom. Would visit again if in the area.

I went here with colleagues because I really wanted a burger and the reviews sounded so positive. We got there early on MLK day, so there was no rush. All 3 of us ordered burgers. They arrived in less than 5 minutes. That tells me they were either using a Turbo-chef or microwave. The burgers were completely tasteless. Thank goodness for all the salt on the fries!The restaurant is attractive and our server was nice, but the food was definitely not worth a walk in the cold.
Food was surprisingly terrible. Server hard to find and not attentive. Couldn't even get refill on drink or check without flagging down any person that appeared to work there.Won't be back.

I was pleasantly surprised how delicious this place was! Service was on point and the drinks were fresh, innovative and unique! I also got the salmon Greek salad and Brussels sprouts which are to die for! I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for quality service, fresh food and superb drinks!
While the food was good, I think it is overpriced for what it is. Meals are perfect sizes to share but again, I found it was nothing special.
Absolutely Delicious!! Service is amazing! Drinks are perfect! This is the first place I have ever liked Brussel sprouts. Must try!

Really nice location. Clean interior. Very nice service.As for the food: for starters we had a pork belly and white haricot soup in a wonderfully rich broth. It was the kind of soup that I romanticize about when I read war novels about WWI.....anyway, for the main course we had the Cubano sandwich. It was well made and the dijon mustard directly on the bread makes for a smooth bite. Its a classic, and they didnt have to change much to get it perfect.

Loved The Marq! I ate there twice during my 4-day stay for training. Both visits were outstanding. The Manager is awesome, stopping by to check on how everything was during both visits. The food was great and The Marq burger didn't disappoint.Next time I'm back in Chi-town, I'm stopping here.
When we first got there, I was kind of skeptical but once we got the food. It was amazing. The marq burger was perfect!

Great place to sit back, check the stock market, knock out some excel spreadsheets and edit your PowerPoints. Casual enough so you can wear a baseball cap too. It's a regular food place but the "executive" sirloin steak comes on a black bathroom slate tile it's odd.  I saw somebody eat French fries but they looked like boring fries......... Try the risotto!

I have been eyeing the crowds at the outdoor tables periodically throughout the summer.  I finally came at lunch with two friends on a Friday.  We waited a bit but then sat at the corner of the bar.   When we checked in, I noticed that those "in the know" made reservations.   Mental note for next time (especially at Friday lunchtime).  My Marq burger was outrageously good (garlicky and tomatoey and cheesey on a fresh bun).  I finished every bite.  I was too full for the fries but they were awesome.  Perfectly crispy and perfectly salted.  My friends had the Cubano and the Cali sandwich and were equally pleased.  This place is a complete transformation from the old Marquette diner.  Can't wait to come back.

When it first opened, I was not a fan of their menu (especially the appetizer list) - it didn't make sense for the crowd here or for me in the context of when I stop by- during lunch or after work for drinks! I don't want bone marrow, probably ever.This latest visit, I noticed the bone marrow was gone (thank goodness) but so were the cheese curds (which I liked). Basically, the menu keeps changing and it's annoying, and some items I've had were not so good. Food is inconsistent, so I usually just stick to the burger.Positives:- We always sit at the bar and the bartender there is super friendly - love her.- Love the bar area - nice decor.- Service is quick.- Good beer/wine choices, although it can get pricey.- Convenient location if in the loopIt can be a good alternative to all the old school restaurant/bars in the area, with a slightly elevated menu and beer/wine selection, I just wish the food would be consistent and the quality matched the nice interior.

I came here on a Friday night after work and had a wonderful experience. The host was welcoming and even though it was packed my friend and I were seated quickly. Our server was super friendly and had a lot of knowledge on the beer and wine lists. I had the burger, which was so delicious and cooked perfectly. The brioche bun pulled everything together. My friend had the mac and cheese with pork belly, which I'll definitely get next time. During dinner the manager stopped by our table to check on us, which was very friendly and appreciated.The music was fun and the atmosphere was great-nice/casual and upbeat.  It's a great place to hang out in for a while at the bar. I thought the prices were very reasonable for downtown Chicago, especially the drinks. Can't wait to go back!

Made reservations here for 5:30 pm on a Friday night because of the location and the 4 star rating.  I would honestly give this a 3.5 star rating, because it is somewhere between "A-OK" and "I'm a fan."  The menu choices and drinks were great; the service was also great even though the front and outside seating was packed with the business crowd.  We ordered two appetizers, which both had large portions.  The salmon poke was very good; however, the crackers that came with it were very greasy and the crispiness wore off quickly.  Same thing with the eggplant frites that came with the hummous; incredibly greasy and soggy.  Maybe it was because it was the first day of heat and humidity?

I stopped by to grab something to eat since I had been running around the city all day. You walk in through revolving doors and are instantly welcomed by the host. The atmosphere is welcoming. You don't realize how big the space is because the bar is kind of hidden by a wall in the middle of the restaurant. The service was really fast, too. I'm not all too sure about their menu, but they had a special menu for the St. Patrick's Day Parade that was on Michigan Ave (The Marq is just a few minutes walk from Michigan). I ordered The Marq Burger.The burger was really good. But the bun was a little stale. The fries were definitely good as well. I'd recommend eating the burger with the fork and knife because it can get really messy. It was very juicy, and I ordered mine medium rare. It's definitely a mouthful, but don't worry, you'll make it through.I'd definitely recommend this place to friends.

I have been to The Marq four times and I love it! My go-to's to order usually start with the Ahi Tuna Poke,  or the Bruschetta (both fantastic and fresh). They always have good craft beers, I prefer Off Color's Saison called the Apex. Depending upon my appetite, I'll order one of two things, the Burger, Or the Poached Pear salad. This burger is easily the best burger on the block, and even the loop in general, so juicy!The decor is real modern, I'm a huge fan of the wood everywhere and front lobby chill spot (my guest was late). I'd definitely recommend for lunch/happy hour or dinner!

Service was horrible.  Our waitress was there to socialize.  Once our food arrived she was nowhere to be found.  For the price of our meals the food was less than average.  The chicken soup was too salty.  For $22 my ribs left me leaving hungry, but they were OK.  The salmon was over cooked.  Fries came out late and looking limp and cold.  We won't be back!

I happen to work in the Marquette building where the Marq is situated, so I couldn't help notice their sidewalk sign for "Best Burger.." on my in every morning. Always up for a challenge-- especially when it comes to "best" and "burger" in the same one. Meeting a friend there for lunch, we were seated next to the window with a great view of Calder's Flamingo. The place - aside from  being well decorated- is meticulously clean and staffed by really friendly people - everyone greeted me when I walked in.When the waitress came up and I asked her about the best burger bit, she winkingly debated that the sign said "...on the block" ok, I'll give that to her. She wanted to undersell it. Said burger finally came. It was delicious. Not a thick beef block like pubs often give, but two medium thickness patties, which I think makes a juicier, more flavorful burger. It was delicious. Maybe not the best I've ever had, but it was memorable enough to get me to Yelp it.Overall, very pleased with this notable addition to the loop. Can't wait to go back for happy hour!

I wandered into this place on a Wednesday night. It was phenomenal!! The host who welcomed us in was upbeat and funny... He talked us into a communal table (it seats like 10, but there were only three of us)... I was honestly thinking it would be weird if anyone else sat at it with us, but the experience was great!On to the booze!.... I had their Calder cocktail before moving onto beer, and I loved it. The cherry garnish was on another level... Our server was very busy with the after work rush, but he was able to get us everything we wanted in a timely manner.... Timing was impeccable...I had the burger and it was fire, my friends had the grilled cheese/ Waldorf salad and they enjoyed it...Music recommendation: more upbeat pop, less classic (but awesome) rock...We will be back!!!

I hit up the Marq with a group of coworkers for a quick Friday Happy Hour. The staff did a great job attending to our group of 15+ people and even split the bill for everyone in our group. I'll definitely return again for a quick bite or drinks -- it wasn't too crowded, they have a decent drink list, and upscale ambiance.

My husband and I lived in Logan Square when we first moved to Chicago about 6.5 years ago, and there are so many new places here compared to then.  We were dogsitting a couple blocks away from The General and saw good things about it on here, so decided to give it a try.  We are happy we did!  We each tried a couple different tacos, which are served on homemade corn tortillas.  Delicious, but our favorite was the smoked verde salsa with fresh, hot chips.  They also had a pretty good draft menu with some different offerings, including a hoppy cider to help me into beer land, since I usually find beer unappetizing.  To finish, we had fresh made chocolate peanut butter pie, and my was it rich!P.S. Our server, Ben, was laid back and never made us feel like he was in a rush.  Thanks Ben!

A great, neighborhood joint. Cool cocktails and cheep beers. Love the $8 taco/beer/shot special, and the tacos are pretty tasty. Package goods to take out.Warning: the cocktails tend to the wayy overpriced for the size. Stick to the cheap beers.Nice interior, with a front that opens up to let in the breezes, and that's always appealing.

Celebrated a friend's birthday, we enjoyed ourselves for the most part. The atmosphere and ambiance was very nice and had a southern themed decor.The food was alright - we each had tacos that were tasty, but the guacamole we had was mediocre. The drinks were also meh - tried three different cocktails and each was very different but was not that great. Lastly, the service was mediocre - it was fairly prompt but we had to repeatedly ask for water.Overall, I would only recommend if it was to a local of the area. Not sure I would visit again.

Stopped by for a couple drinks on a Wed night.  Cool spot.I tried the Brisket Nachos with were excellent.  The server was friendly and knowledgable about the menu.  I also noticed in the back there is a cool patio area that is partially enclosed with a few dart boards.  I will definitely go back again.

So-so......wouldn't really go back to be honest based on my experience...the place was empty and drinks took forever to get to our table(the ONLY table in the bar!!)Food was mediocre at best and overall the place seemed like a local that is trying to elevate itself but just increased prices and not the quality of the food.hoped for the best but it was just adequate.

Oh general where do I begin. So much potential and left so disappointed. We wanted to support a local establishment in the hood but this one should either go find a new one or find a new chef.  We were excited so we ordered every one of their tacos, including the po boy special taco.The best of the rest was the catfish taco but The black eyed peas overpowered your fish and left my mouth mushy and wondering where's the fish. The pork belly so dry we thought maybe it was the pulled chicken...until we had the chicken and it tasted like a mouthful of sawdust. No salt on anything either...and what's with the cole slaw? A splash of vinegar on cabbage alongside a few slivers of carrot without salt does not equal coleslaw. It's just undressed  like the $6 pico de gallo which was so dry. And just tomatoes without the tangy lime, spicy jalepeno or refreshing cilantro one comes to expect from a proper chip dip.And the beers? WTF. where do you get off selling a 12oz pour of Revokution or hopewell for $6. If I were to go there directly I'd get the same beer in a 16oz pint glass for the same price or less. Sad but true. And left thirsty.Great concept (package store) with southern style taco bar but very poorly executed. THANK GOD we came in for "neighborhood appreciation night" where it was buy 1 get 1 free taco. Had it not been, we would have returned out tacos and said, thanks but no thanks.So many great taco joints in Pilsen and little village to waste you money here.

Loved this place and the guy who took me there scored major points for his wise decision to start a night in Logan Square at this joint. We were out on a (very) rare Saturday night that was not only of a reasonable temperature, but where the crowds were light which really offered a chance to appreciate this joint. We sat at the bar and had a few rounds of drinks from their really robust and impressive beer menu, but watching the bartender I definitely was tempted to order one of their really REALLY good looking cocktails. Maybe next time!We weren't initially going to eat there, but ended up getting hungry enough to order a few tacos each and that was where you really see the blending of soul food and mexican food take it next level. I got the Mudcat taco which was breaded and fried catfish, black eyed peas, fresh slaw and sour cream as well as the roasted pork shoulder taco and WOW were they awesome. Totally different than anything I've ever had AND the actual tortillas held up really well. My date got a taco that was a take on a po' boy and he really dug that and we both shared a pork belly mac n cheese. They had some vegetarian/vegan tacos on the menu that he'd had and said were really good, but I wanted to stick with my protein for the night of drinking ahead.The bar itself wasn't huge but there was plenty of seating and while they had an outdoor seating area, I liked being able to just sit at the bar and look out the open front of the joint. If you're in logan square and hungry, check this place out - you'll not be disappointed!

We came at 11 for Sunday brunch. Their servers seem to be covering every table (doubling up). We waited almost an hour and a half for our food. When we asked the server how long it would be (after 45 minutes) he snapped at us saying "I don't know if you can see inside, but we are busy" ...talk about passive aggressive.When one of my friends ordered an ice coffee, that took 20 min to arrive and no cream or sugar was offered.In a competitive food market, this kind of service is unacceptable.Food was good. Portions were slightly smaller than the competition. Quiche looked store bought.The bar seems cool, but I will not be back for brunch.

I was in charge of planning my best friend's bachelorette party, and we wanted to start somewhere for dinner and drinks. Her only two requests were tacos and patio seating. I started researching, and I read great things about The General. It didn't take long for me to book a party package with Eric. He was able to walk me through all the options and explain everything. He was super responsive and very accommodating--such a smooth experience!We reserved a table outside in their awesome, quirky courtyard--complete with cafe lights and a fun game room. Our food package included chips with a variety of salsas and guacamole, boiled peanuts, two types of mac 'n cheese (everyone raved about this), 3 different taco styles, and also bread pudding for dessert (AMAZING house speciality). We also took advantage of a 3 hour drink package. We had great service and, overall, an awesome experience. I will definitely be back, and I would highly recommend planning any group event at The General. This seems to be something they easily cater to and are eager to accommodate.

Great greasy spoon spot for hangovers. Southern meets Mexican inspired comfort food. The portions are small for the price which is sometimes a bummer but it's pretty greasy food so you'll be happy the portions are small.The servers have always been super friendly and attentive when they can but they're obviously understaffed so be prepared to wait. We never blame our servers on that regard. Clearly it's something they can not help.They have live blue grass or folk style country music on the weekends. It's really amazing and sets the mood after it all. BUT if you're looking for a quiet place to hide after a long Friday/Saturday night, just know and prepare for the live music.What are my favorite dishes? Yikes. Everything is good. Honestly!!Only advice? If you get the Chicken and Waffle taco, ask for more syrup and hold the gravy. You'll thank me later.

I really really wanted to love this place and I felt a little bit of a let down. We went in on a Sat night and it wasn't busy but we were told the only seating we could have was bar seating because they have tables reserved.  The bar was great. There is not a lot of seating in there to begin with. I feel like they could make room for tables inside.We got 3 tacos and the nachos. The pork shoulder taco was really good but the fried chicken and the catfish taco were bland, not much going on. Just tasted like fried white meat. They needed some spice, some acid just something to make them stand out. A verde salsa would have been amazing. One of them did have a smoke jalapeño mayo but it was flavorless. They did provide a hot sauce and it was ok but just not the flavor I was looking for, it worked better with the nachos. The tacos seems very small, two bites maybe three. And for $4+ per taco it seems a tad over priced. The nachos with the brisket was great and a highly recommended order. It's hard to screw up nachos though.The service was great. The bartender was friendly and the host even came over to us and apologized again for not having a table for us and said that he had some reservations cancel.I really wanted this place to just shove it's hand down my pants, have a little go and get me excited, but it just didn't. I can see coming back and trying some other items. Decent food, price is a bit high but worth another go.

This is just your standard place that has alright cocktails and OK food. The fried chicken taco that I've seen so many people rave about on Yelp is just bland as can be, but otherwise, the portions are generous and would definitely come back solely for the $8 Boot, shot and taco deal.

I think I may have just found my new "go-to" non-dive Mexican place.While my heart always has a special place for taquerias, sometimes you just want a little more atmosphere and a craft cocktail list. This place has both and more.They do some pretty amazing things with their smoked brisket (i.e. nachos were awesome and so was the brisket taco).I have a weakness for fried chicken, and the southern fried chicken taco filled my needs absolutely perfectly.While I look forward to trying more of the menu in future visits, let's talk about the drinx.Craft cocktails are $10 and the wine list -- it's at wholesale cost. While looking at the prices by the bottle, I kept searching for an asterisk to see if there's a $25-$50 charge in addition to the bottle price to open it. But no.We had a 2009 Rioja Gran Reserva for $26. The Binny's price was $20. In most restaurants, that'd be a $45-$60 bottle.This restaurant is cozy and the staff is fun and knowledgeable.I'll definitely be coming back soon, and I would encourage you to try this place -- I think you'll be very glad that you did.

New place in the 'hood alert! I wish I liked The General more but let me preface this by saying they are just in their second week being open. I hope they pay attention to feedback and make some adjustments because the potential is there.Things started in an upward swing when we arrived to The General. I absolutely love the old timey decor,a few outdoor sidewalk seats, beer boot special of the day for $4, the hostess was very friendly and pleasant, and turnaround time for food coming out once orders were in was speedy. Plus, we were able to be seated immediately at 7:30pm on a Saturday night. I was actually surprised they had a huge TV in there with the Blackhawks game on...didn't quite stick with the theme of the place.We were sat at a four top and what struck me was how much unused space they had. Tables were too small for all the food & drinks that come out and it's not as if tables are squished together. They need to get some bigger tables in there. We were seated under the air conditioning and there was so much condensation, it was constantly dripping on my friend and I.We started by ordering chips and guac for the table for $7. I actually really enjoyed the guacamole because I often find the cilantro taste overwhelming in it. The guacamole at The General didn't have the overpowering cilantro though so I loved it. We liked it so much we used all our chips and asked for more. Three dollars for more chips. Plus they only filled our bucket about 70% for the additional chips. C'mon The General...no need to nickle and dime customers!The General had 12 beers on tap and they were out of 3....that we know of! It could have been more but we didn't make our way through the whole menu. With such a limited draft menu, you need to have backups ready for your next draught drink...or at least erase it from the board. Our server also seemed unapologetic about this...but also kind of got the vibe she didn't care for us much.The General only has 5 tacos on it's list for $4-4.50 each and then a bunch of sides, including a good sized mac & cheese for $5. And for in $5 mac & cheese, you get a choice of a few things they will add in. One of those things was pork belly so I jumped on that! The pork belly was way overcooked to the point of having no flavor that remotely reminded me of delicious pork belly. One of my friends asked what the black stuff was in the mac & cheese, yepppp, that was the pork belly. Plus it seemed more watery than cheesy and just generally something was missing in the flavor.We all agreed the tacos were not worth the $4-$4.50. They were small with not much to them and with so many taco places around, they just don't cut it. My fried chicken taco had a small slab of protein with a tiny bit of sauce on it....that's it. I also noticed every single taco had some element of spice to it. This was fine with me but it may be good to add an option to appeal to the masses...really though....I hate to say it but The General needs a total menu revamp. No one loved any of the tacos nor did we love any of the sides. The space is so great and I can tell a ton of time went into the decor. It's truly fabulous! I don't want to see it go to waste 6 months down the road. When you have such a small menu and drinks are highlighted, you need to have in stock what you have on the board. Also, service started out great but then became more disinterested, glasses left empty at times,  then our server was nowhere to be found for quite some time when we needed the bill. Finally, the prices are just a bit too much. They needed to be lowered a bit. For 4 of us we spent $120 with tax & tip, thus me personally spent $30 for 1 taco, 1 mac & cheese side, 1/4 of our chips & guac + 2 beers. Ouch.I'm rooting for you, The General! Pull one out for the home team!

Cool setup, nice vibe and dig the space.  Great for dates or meeting a few friends for drinks.  Not big enough to sustain a larger party unless their back room is open.  Also their one-per-usage restrooms can't sustain when they are busier. They should consider unisex washrooms.For now, enjoy the space with a few people. Great tacos, tasty sides and try the pie! If you aren't sure about a cocktail, ask for a recommendation. It will save the bartenders time and energy.

Decided on brunch after wandering the area.Great food with interesting flavor combinations. Good perfectly and quickly.Service was top notch with the owner very attentive and helpful.Definitely give this place a try. Unique space and menu with fresh food.

Came here with a couple of friends after work one evening for a couple of drinks.  This is a cool, little neighborhood bar with a fun atmoslhere.  Apparently on some nights they have live music, but on the night we went they were just playing great 70's rock..Allman Brothers, Clapton, The Eagles, and so on.They have a great beer selection here.  Not overwhelming like some places in town, but very good and unique.  Also a nice list of local drinks, some even with absinthe.  Drinks aren't bad, a bit pricy for what you get, but that is Chicago in general.The server we had was a sweet girl from somewhere down south, with the accent and mannerisms, which made the place and it's atmosphere that much better.Place is usually pretty busy, but there is plenty of room for small groups.

0 Search Results for "Hipster Chili's"....surprisingAllow me to elaborate: My girlfriend and I walked in and grabbed an open table. Eventually someone apparently on the staff came over to us and said they were surprised to see us. Maybe I missed the sign-in sheet on my way in? They also seemed surprised that we wanted menus. Yes, I thought. I am after all in a restaurant.. We take in the ambiance for a bit. At this point the interaction with the aloof host-person is in stark contrast against the contrived saloon-style flair of the interior. The tacos were nothing special, and truthfully, at $4, seemed overpriced. Picture a small piece of fried chicken thigh on a silver dollar pancake with some coleslaw on it. Finally, what seemed to be in-between glances at his phone, the waiter hands me the check with a sincere glance which bordered on desperation.Forgive me for calling a spade a spade, and sorry for being hard on a local business in a neighborhood I call home, but I can't see through the pre-packaged novelty.

A-Ok is definitely accurate. We really liked the outside seating, the service was good. However, my glass had lipstick on it...so that wasn't a great first impression...The meat is pasture-raised (free roaming) so if that's important to you, this is a great place to get some happy meat.I tried the fried catfish taco, it was just okay, nothing special. My fiance had the pork shoulder taco, he loved it!!! We also got the Soul Nachos with meat on the side, as my fiance eats meat and I don't, so it was great that they could accommodate that. The nachos were pretty good but they definitely could use (a lot) more of the toppings.
Good beer specials and excited about taco Tuesday deal! The employees are all friendly and the atmosphere is very cool
Happy this place is in my neighborhood. Great decor, food, drink options. Service was excellent and hope to return soon.

Really liked this spot.Farm to taqueria is the theme here. I enjoyed everything I had. They serve beer in a pint-size boot. I couldn't resist the beer/shot/taco combo for $8. This is the new Logan Square PB&J.The guac "snack" was a big portion, and the chips here are super good. All the taco's are $3-4 and that's a perfect price, 2 pretty much filled me up (although I think I could eat 10). Shot-and-a-beer can chicken stuck out as a favorite. The vibe here is cool too. The back porch feels like a tiny Chicago backyard.Maybe I'm just excited about this new place, or maybe it's just a perfect night to sit on a patio, but I loved this spot.

I'm starting with food because it is paramount and will deposit my other opinions after the jump (lol remember the early aughts y'all?)1) brisket taco - delicious, order it2) fried chicken taco - fine, but probably just order another brisket taco3) guacamole - yass4) $8 taco/beer/shot deal - Yass yassThis is not a proper taco truck taco - they are expensive (except for on Tuesday for locals and the $8 deal) they are bougey but they are also tasty and the atmosphere is lovely.gonna break down the specifics of the important things going on in this establishment:1) the staff is delightful2) the fiddle player in one of their bluegrass bands is my future husband (fingers crossed - if you're reading this CALL ME)3) you can buy beer in a boot

Love this place. We came for a late brunch or early lunch on Sunday and our waitress Lauren I think was honestly one of the best waitresses I have had in a long time. We had the breakfast with chicken and I had all four of the tacos which were fantastic. My favorite was the brisket and the beer can chicken. Also I had probably the best Bloody Mary ever. It basically tasted like Smokey BBQ sauce with vodka. Great service great food try it out

Sweet little neighborhood taco joint in Logan Square.  They aren't the best taco's in the city, but they are pretty satisfying, and the bar is clean with good drinking options.  And the staff is always very friendly.  That goes a long way when you are looking for a place to chill and have a drink.  And best of all, its not bro or hispter heavy.  Just normal neighborhood people having some good food and cold drinks.

I REALLY want to love this place and I'm keeping an open mind since they were only in Week #2 when we had our first visit.First - staff & space - awesome!  The General has done a great job of revamping and expanding the old Provenance space, maximizing dining both inside and out.  LOVE the alfresco dining both on the front sidewalk and the back patio.  The ambiance inside is warm & inviting.We went in on the early side... 6:30 on a Thursday night.  The place was pretty busy, which we love to see in a new Logan spot.  The staff are still getting into their groove but the hostess and waiters were super friendly and engaging.  The bar was having a tough time keeping up with orders, but I have faith!  Our food arrived before our drinks and that did not go unnoticed by our waiter.Food: the tacos are definitely on the small side.  We tried four of them and one absolutely stood out... Shot-and-A-Beer Can Chicken.  Delish!!  It's a MUST try!  Juicy & so full of flavor, we ordered a 2nd one.  Yum!  2nd best was the Pork Shoulder taco.  Unfortunately, the Smoked Bourbon Brisket & Southern Fried Chicken tacos were both really dry and without much flavor.  Both sounded fabulous on the menu.  While we were pretty disappointed in those two, we loved the Shot-and-A-Beer Can Chicken!The mac n' cheese was another winner.  It's offered with bonus additions of beef, chicken, pork belly, onion & jalapeno... we opted to try it straight up and it was straight up delicious!  Also, we thought it was the best bang for your buck, dollar for dollar.  The corn bread was good, but pretty standard.  I'd love to see it stand out with a little more jalapeno flavor or kick.Drinks:  We tried the Black Jack, Mexican War & the Abolitionist.  The Mexican War was tasty.  The Black Jack grew on me throughout the meal.  I think the flavors needed time to open up together.  My first sip was a little too syrup heavy, but the flavors blended nicely over time.I mentioned our food arrived before our drinks and we had a good gap between our first and second taco round.  In an effort to smooth out some opening hiccups, our waiter brought us each a bourbon sample at the end of the night.  We really appreciated his awareness and The General's customer service.  Awareness will go such a long way!!Our bill was over $70 before tip.  A little on the pricey side for the dining portions, but it probably won't keep us away.All said, we will absolutely be back for another try and are looking forward to a little bit better quality as The General ages!!

I have to say, if it's between waiting two hours and Longman and Eagle or coming here, just come here!  Chicago needs to learn to spread the love and this place deserves some of it!Atmosphere - Great! Good music. Fun decor. Cozy! What more could you ask for?  Well... a little more heat, I guess.  Those brick walls are drafty.  But other than that, no complaints here.Drinks - The cocktails different, thoughtful and tasty (also around $10 each which is reasonable, I think). The beer list was impressive.  Not very long but some options there you certainly don't see everywhere else, which I appreciate.Food - I ordered something that was new on the menu and I have to say, it was great! It was the Commissary stew - sooooo good!  Everyone else really enjoyed what they got and my group of 9 ran the gamut on what we ordered.One note about the menu - They added a shared plates section to the menu but none of the items seemed really shareable.  I think they should just be entrees, personally and leave the sharing out of it.  My stew was so good, I wouldn't want to share with anybody anyway.Good Luck The General!!! Hope you stick it out!

I'm so glad The General opened up just blocks from where i live! Its such a cute spot right off Logan Blvd to get some quick bites and some delicious cocktails!The decor makes for a rustic chill atmosphere that i really enjoy. Every time i pop in i never get mediocre service! Everyone is so friendly and ready to give you a great experience.I love the option to have a couple tacos but then have some southern comfort food! Besides the tacos, i recommend the mac n' cheese and the cornbread! They also have a pretty sweet deal for 1 taco, a boot beer and shot for $8!I have yet to join in for brunch but last weekend they had a bluegrass band play inside the restaurant! Hopefully i can check it out next time! All in all if you're around the neighborhood pop in The General!

Went to The General with my wife for dinner and a drink. The place has a very cool vibe and decor - especially the back patio. We ordered a variety of their tacos. They were all great - our favorites were the brisket and steak (on special). We will have to come back to try the entrees as they look great. At the very back they have an awesome foozeball table and 3 real dart boards. Fun place to hang with friends and have a drink.
They've fixed all of the things I was disappointed about upon my first visit. Went there again with a group of friends and it went really well. Will come frequently to his place.

The General is a great addition to Logan Square. I took my girlfriend there for dinner and had an amazing experience. Our server Lauren was perfect. She was just the right amount of attentive while still giving us our space. She was very friendly and after talking to her we've decided to come back with our new dog to the front patio and for brunch on Saturday for the bluegrass band and bloodies! They have an $8 beer/ taco/shot special that is completely amazing-Po' boy special and bonded David Nicholson really clinched it. We are sold. Big time!

Super excited to see this end of California coming to life with new restaurants.  The General has a good concept and vibe.  It's a fun place to sit and I would totally come back for a whiskey drink and some of the live music.The food... is just not that good.  The menu is very limited, but the descriptions of the tacos look amazing.  We both had the taco/boot special (boot of beer, whiskey shot and taco) and ordered a few extra tacos.  The tacos were super small, the tortillas were not good, and they fell apart in your hands.  The seasoning and combinations are a little off.  It's not terrible or anything, but definitely not something I would go back for, especially with L'Patron right up the street.

This spot is my JAM. For some reason, bar/laundromat hybrids are not a thing yet, so this is the closest I can get. I live right around the corner so dumping my laundry in the wash and popping into the General for a drink with my man is my new favorite thing.The General has an amazing craft beer list that has something for everyone. IPA's, APA's, ciders, stouts, you name it and it'll be there. If it's not on draft, it's probably at least on their equally awesome can/bottle list. Plus, they have a daily $4 boot special that isn't some crap no one wants to drink, it's always a great pick and I've gotten to try tons of new awesome beers via the Boot.Their cocktails are also on point. I'm obsessed with the Simmerson which has the perfect amount of pineapple without being overly sweet, and the Abolitionist (I think) which is grapefruit and hibiscus. Usually grapefruit is a palate hog and takes over a drink, but not the case here, fellas. It's perfectly balanced to catch that citrus bite and floral accents. A+!I haven't had all of the tacos yet, but I've been pleased with all the ones I have had. I looove the pork shoulder taco with its mustard bbq sauce, and the shot and a beercan chicken taco is a close second. My boyfriend is in love with the fried chicken taco. I had the catfish one and wasn't nuts about it--mushy black eyed peas and a soft fish like catfish don't go too well together, but even though it's not the best, it's still good. Oh, and their guacamole and pico are so tasty, I usually can't stop. And if you go by for their late night menu, their beef brisket quesadilla is amazing and should be on their regular menu. YUM. The portions are smaller, but it's farm-to-table, so for the price and flavor it's worth it.I hope this place stays around the neighborhood for a long time!

I've been to this place twice now and have two completely different experiences. Starting with the not so great one. Showed up a little after 7 on a rainy Friday, they had the front windows open making the place wet and muggy.  We had to ask for them to close them to create more seating so we could grab a drink.  Once we finally sat down we chatted with the bar tender to try and decide what to order.  He suggested a gin cocktail for me which I can't for the life of me remember what it was called, but it sounded good enough the way he originally described.  Upon bringing it to me though he informed me it had peppers in it (not a fan but I choked it down anyway).  My bf got a double Templeton rye whiskey and asked for it neat, easy enough.  When we tabbed out though we found that our bill was $30 for the two drinks because they charged an extra for his neat (without ice).  We were upset because it should be the same amount of alcohol with or without ice. Be careful when ordering drinks in the evening.Our first experience however was fabulous.  We went for brunch on a Saturday and the bartender was super friendly. At the time we were new to the city and he gave us all kinds of advice on yummy places to eat and drink.  We had a couple beers that were decently priced and their daily $4 boot special is a total steal.  We each ordered food and left nothing on our plates and even hung around a little later because we were having such a great time!To make this long winded post short, don't order a drink neat unless you're cool with paying crazy up-charges and GO FOR BRUNCH because its the bomb.

My first visit to General left me feeling a little hungrier and poorer than I had hoped, though the quality of food was undeniable.Within a few weeks, prices were lowered and a variety of food and drink specials were added. I no longer have any hesitance to swing by, be it alone for a drink or with a crew to party. They even hooked it up w free chips n salsa last time I brought a group!

Boo. Third time here we really wanted this place to be good. It's close and has a great vibe to it. The good ends there though. The service is friendly but slow and the food is underwhelming. Small portions and lacking flavor. We'll walk a few extra blocks for better.

My friends and I love checking out new places and had been to the General before the particular night about which I am writing. We enjoyed the food and the ambiance so much that we decided to make this a stop on a bachelor party bar tour through Chicago and the good folks at the General could not have been more accommodating. We arrived in fits and starts after our first stop in Wrigley. The waitress was gracious enough to split all of our checks in spite of our exuberance.The food was as solid as ever. My favorite menu item is the shrimp and grits chimichangas. The cornbread is also delicious with enough moisture and spice to make it a not miss item. The drink menu is very interesting with some craft cocktails and local brews you can't find elsewhere.The General also has a jazz night on Wednesdays and a soul night on Saturdays and a bluegrass brunch on Sunday. Highly recommend The General!
Went here for a late night drink and loved the ambiance of the restaurant. The drinks were delicious! Would definitely recommend this place

What can I say, this place is awesome.  They're excellent on all fronts; food, drinks, service, atmosphere.  I've been here a couple times for drinks but today was my first time dining in.  I had brunch and I was blown away.  I started with their house bloody mary.  This drink was something special, smokey and spicy, drank like a meal.  I loved it!  The brisket hash was my main dish and it was fantastic.  Four hour smoked brisket that was just bursting with flavor.  I finished my meal and couldn't leave without having another bloody mary. Our server was delightful.  Buck Owens provided an excellent soundtrack that really fit the vibe of The General.  I'll definitely be back for a boot of beer, hopefully on Taco Tuesday!

I love The General! I must say, at first glance I thought it was going to be one of those cheesy "hip" places that doesn't end up feeling genuine at all. However, this was the opposite of true. The food is delicious and the tacos are really creative. I even think the coleslaw deserves a mention (not overdressed). I love the beer boot specials, they are always a really good quality beer for just $4. And the shot/beer/taco combo for $8 is genius.The place always feels warm and welcoming on the inside, and seems to be working with the community and doing neat stuff. I was there when a DJ from Bloodshot records was there and he picked some perfect tunes for the vibe of the place. Also, last but certainly not least, the servers were what put my review at 5 stars. They're always so nice and helpful. This is a great place to bring some friends at the end of the week to have food and drinks.
Fantastic place with a real local feel! Great Local beers and all natural food without crap in it.  The owner's ate down to earth to!Food is Bomb would recommend a taco and the mac & cheese!  YUM!

Well, my friends and I were excited to try this placebo - I mean place. Placebo is an interesting word. The food was akin to a feckless sugar pill when you know others in your trial are down the street eating the real deal meals via Rick Bayless or Habanero or Patron.Everyone there was very nice. The people were cool and friendly and all that jazz. The boys doing the cooking in the kitchen did the best they could with the menu and ingredients. I'm sorry to say but the blame resides with the architect of the menu itself. When you eat with Bayless or Habanero or Patron, you know that people who really care about food crafted each ingredient and sourced it from fresh places. It takes years to accomplish those kinds of menus. The General isn't at that level, I regret to say. However, it's early. There is a lot of time to change. The menu requires a complete overhaul. The swift ordeal of human tongues will not suffer from want of other choices during that overhaul.If my taco is going to be $4 or $4.50, it either needs to huge or very delicious. These tacos were neither.One friend went home after the meal and ate a half rotten banana to fill him up, but that could also be because he listens to a lot of Gwen Stefani.I'm sorry to be mean. It's hard to give honest feedback in person. The good news is that it's early and the owner/chef has time to innovate but it will require dedication and willingness to change. Two stars for kind people and potential.

Ay papá en Hawaii this salsa is more V8 than heat / spice. Aye papas I done saw them mexicanos in that kitchen prolly all chuckling at the lack of heat in them salsas. .lol...yo up that heat! Can't be chasing them Duke boys with no heat in that salsa!

Went in for brunch to check this place out for the first time. I was one of 3 people when I arrived for a 12pm reservation. Was concerned at first, but a few more people showed up while we were there. The space is definitely appealing with a unique area to purchase beer to take home and electric menus above the bar. I would definitely want to check this out when there are more people there. Great local beer list! Server did a great job sharing the concept with me and various events they have through the week that intrigued me to want to come check it out later in the evening. Not a huge menu, but definitely a variety of items to choose from. I had the Farmers Hash with smoked brisket served with eggs, veggies and fresh tortillas. I look forward to coming back and hope that the neighborhood gives it some love!

Service was great, the food wasn't. We started with the charcuterie and cheese plate, which had venison and andouille sausage and a couple okay cheeses. The sausages were kinda warm, which is odd for charcuterie in my experience; it was like they were meant to be served hot but were left sitting so by the time they got to us they were just above room temp in the middle. The tacos also came out rather cold, their flavor was okay but nothing spectacular. The mac and cheese with pork belly was decent, as was the corn bread. The decor in this place is strange and a bit confused, they are going for rustic chic but then have massive flat screen TVs to display their drink menus (which have fonts to make it look like it's written in chalk). The decor and service won't stop me from going back but the food sure will.

Went out to get pizza at Reno last night but it was closed for the holiday weekend.  I'm glad it was because I ended up at The General, and everything about it was fantastic.  Having never been there we decided to order 1 of every taco.  There wasn't one that was left behind, infact I may as well change my name to Dyson because those tacos were vacuumed up off the plate in no time.  The flavor combos were all spot on and the collard greens were so tasty.  They also had a homemade hot sauce that fit right in on the collards.  Even the service and drinks were great.  I'll definitely be back, probably sooner rather than later!
Haven't had the food but the beer list is unreal!  And the bartenders are super helpful - they were out of a couple of beers we wanted and recommended similar ones which were awesome!

After seeing the Saturday special for a boot of beer a taco and shot of bourbon on The Local Tourist Chicago site, I was more than excited to book a table at this Logan Square Mexican farm to table restaurant. They offer an extensive beer list, seasonal specialties and crave worthy tacos and small plates. They are also known for their pies which we will be sure to leave room for the next time we go. The guac is served generously with a large pail of chips and enough for a group to share. Two tacos should be enough for one person if you plan to order an appetizer or dessert. We had phenomenal service from Emily. She was a very personable, attentive server. We can't wait to go back another Saturday as long as this special lasts. Such a fun atmosphere and exciting neighborhood. Two thumbs up!!

Really really good food!! Pictures being posted, one taco was beer-can-chicken and the second one pork shoulder something, it was divine. The guacamole and vegetable was amazing as well as the nachos. I recommend going there if you are looking to fill up. The tacos are average street taco size, super filling and yummy.

My friends and I visited on Saturday night. Our server was very nice and without any prompting told us the specials, described the menu and even admitted that while made in-house, the corn tortillas were hand-sized, and yeah, your tacos were gonna be tiny.I ordered the "Abolitionist" which came with an edible orchid. I'm admittedly kind of a pansy when it comes to strong drinks and I usually just stick to beer. I couldn't finish it, and we all traded sips of our respective cocktails. STRONG, and not mixed well. I guess not every bar can be cut from the trendy mixologist cloth.The guacamole was great and came with a bucket of tortilla chips. The Fried Chicken taco was pretty good even though it was bite-sized. I especially liked the mac and cheese, which was rich, filling and tasty. You can add meat for free. The slaw, however, was a useless dish-garnish. It didn't taste like much, and we kinda just shoved it aside. Collared Greens are also A+ - next time I'll just have mac and cheese and collared greens for a healthy, balanced meal.I hate being a pain, but I forgot I didn't really have cash on me, and my friends never do. The server even split our checks between the three of us! Isn't that nice.Nice spot, pleasant ambiance, decent dinner, although I probably won't be buying my groceries at the overpriced general store.

Went to bluegrass brunch here and it was great. Ambiance was very laid back and perfect for enjoying music. The food was good and bloodies were only $5! I'd definitely check it out when in Logan square

It was about 10:30 at night and they were open. We inquired if the kitchen was open and they said they had a late night menu so we stopped in assuming we could get a few tacos and a beer or two and be on our way.  We were given food menus and were pretty excited to try some of the tacos.  When the bartender came by again we got a couple beers and asked for some tacos (which were on the menu we were handed).  But here is the catch:  TACOS ARE NOT AVAILABLE AFTER 10 PM.  Perplexed we asked what was on the menu and we were told, quesadillas (with brisket or pork), mac and cheese, and chips and guac.I understand that its not always economical to keep a kitchen open late at a restaurant/bar.  But if you're a upscale taco restaurant and you opt to keep the kitchen open, you have to dance with the girl who brought you and serve tacos.  After all, tacos are the quintessential late night food.  To make quesadillas you already have most of the necessary ingredients out, why not fully commit to the theme?  Also wouldn't it be easier to make a few tacos then whip up a batch of mac n cheese? (this lead us to believe the mac would be reheated)Overall the ambiance of the place is great.  The beer selection is very good and the $4 'boot' special is unique and a decent value. We did get the guac and it was uninspired (seemed to be missing something) and the quesadillas were, well quesadillas.

Reading some of the reviews, I think some people are really overselling this place. And I guess with my rating, I might be too. I think the rating was more for the vibe and feel than the food. But the food is very good! Let me explain.We sat in the back which was a cute outdoor area. We were the only ones there for the majority of dinner. When we left, it started to fill, which was nice. Our server was very friendly and very passionate about the menu. She went over everything in detail, almost too much (will get to that). My wife and I started with one of the specials. It was pork belly on cornbread basically, with some coleslaw. We did it as an appetizer, and this might have been the best thing of the night. The cornbread was yummy, and the combo with the pork belly flavor was delcioso.My wife got the pork belly taco and totally loved it. I probably should have gotten that. I got the catfish and fried chicken one. I see some people here raving about the fried chicken one. Not sure if I would. It was good, and I loved the chicken part of it. I could eat that all day. But it was pretty plain IMO. Just the piece of chicken and sauce. And at the end of the day, fried chicken on a taco is a bit off, no? I dunno. The catfish wasn't all that great. Thought it would have more flavor. Thought the extra stuff in the taco did more to the flavor of the catfish than the catfish itself. Not a great sign. My wife ordered the mac and cheese with pork belly. This was very good, very rich. I liked it so much and was still hungry after the two tacos that I ordered my own mac and cheese.
