The food melts. Mix of flavors and freshness of ingredients are top notch, and you just want to be back again and again.  À la prochaine !Need to come for dinner ... One day :)

Two small plates and one large plate would be enough for two people.  We got the chorizo stuffed dates (our favorite dish of the night), paella, and the pork shoulder, and left with plenty of leftovers.  The paella was our second favorite dish with a tangy sauce and moist chicken thighs with crispy skin and huge shrimp.  The pork shoulder was just a rich dish of meat but without any greens or bread to counter the heaviness of the dish.Overall, we enjoyed our meal but would have got the paella, the dates, and a lighter dish, like a salad.  Did not know there were half portions as our server never mentioned it to us.  She didn't talk to us really.  We got there at 4 PM on a Friday and there was no wait.  We also got to sit by ourselves at the communal table :).  Worth trying once.

I agree with other reviews, the decor is quite modern and different from most Asian places in the city. However, it's just too loud, they need better sound proofing. We went in on a Thursday evening and it wasn't too crowded. There was a party of 12 sitting right across us in the room and we could every single thing!As for food, their servers are knowledgeable about gluten free options and the food was very fresh. We orders fish cakes, fried tofu, panang curry and basil stir fry. Everything was really good.
Best thai food delivery:Paht Thai and Drunken noodle very good, but Panang Curry and Panang Noodle were exceptional.

Ok, so I gotta say that this place left a lot to be desired. Coming from one who love new food, not afraid of a new taste...you decide.My wife and I got sat at the only 2 top there was. Which was 12" away from a  15 top that was sat at at all high top tables. So the experience was off to a rocky start. With my wife being pregnant, not eating when you need to isnt really an option:)Anyhow, returned the drink I ordered and the appetizer and the pad Thai left me desiring Manne Thai's.

Don't let everyone's crappy food pics fool you; this place is EVERYTHING. *Note, while Silom is casual, the decor is beautiful, so don't be like me and walk in fresh from a run for dinner or you'll feel out of place.  The service was fast, but not rushed, and very friendly.  The best part about the ambiance is the cover music they play in the background; I actually really enjoyed it.  There were very few people there when we arrived, but I can imagine that dining room getting pretty packed.They have a pretty extensive menu but I went straight for the panang fried rice and I was not disappointed.  It was just spicy enough and very flavorful.  *Note, this place does not serve alcohol.  I definitely would like to go back to try other menu items.

Love their take out, they have a variety of great noodle dishes I love. I also specifically love their crab rangoon, they are different from the usual and much more tasty.  It is also a cute BYOB spot for a casual no frills night out.  I have enjoyed everything from Silom!

Really good food. We eat dinner early and arrive around 5 PM on a Friday, the place was empty but they treated us royally. We got the meatballs (no idea to its real name) and they were incredible! Then I had Drunken Noodles with beef while my wife had Panang Curry with Shrimp and she felt it was the best she had ever had.When we left I was honestly shocked at the low overall cost of our meal because it is a nice place (casual dining but not a pub).

I really enjoy getting take out from Silom 12.  As the atmosphere is very nice there also, as well as it's pretty awesome they do BYOB; I just enjoy eating Thai from home, and from Silom 12!  They are very accurate with their timing, if they say it will be ready in 20 minutes, it's ready, thank you Silom 12!Their food - their crab rangoons are amazing!  They are different and unique, and most importantly, delicious.  I've tried their Massaman Potato Curry, their Drunken Noodles, their Pad Thai, and their fried rice.  They have good Thai, bottom line!  I think the prices are pretty reasonable, you get what you pay for!  I really want to try some more entrees on their menu!Their staff is very kind, and welcoming.  This is my go to Thai food when staying in the area!

We had the sesame tuna appetizer which was absolutely phenomenal!  The chicken pad Thai my husband had was good and the ramen was okay. We would come back for the appetizer for certain.  A very nice atmosphere and it's clearly a gathering spot for the locals.

Alcohol:BYOB. Don't let the room separation fool you into thinking the first room / entrance way was a bar, it wasn't. Luckily there's a wine shop near by!Food:Duck Entree - My BF and I love duck dishes! We saw the duck entree and immediately decided to order it. Unfortunately, it was unexpectedly spicy - great for me but bad for the BF. It was on the pricier side and not worth it in my opinion.Pad See Yew (Beef) - I would consider this an average pad see yew. Nothing special or bad about it.Ambiance:Nice. I would consider the restaurant a bit more 'fancier' than casual with it's dim lighting and modern decor. The dining area is pretty tight in space and when there is a good amount of tables filled, the room can get very(!) loud. During our dinner, majority of the tables were filled and we could hear almost every parties conversation, near or far! There isn't any white noise or music playing to drown out the other conversations so I left knowing that the 4 person party (2 couples) had been there before and loved the pad thai, and that the 3 person party (all females) really indulged in Jane's dating life.
By far the best Thai / Asian cuisine restaurant in the neighborhood. Especially dig their vegetarian options.

I branched out on a limb and tried Silom 12 for take out on Sunday night. I was extremely excited to see one of my favorite Thai apps on the menu, mee krob. It is so delicious and I have had a hard time finding a good (or any) version in the city.Silom has really good reviews, so I was very surprised by my experience, which was not so stellar. The food, that came oddly packaged like Seven Eleven salads, really was a miss for me. I even stuck to the most popular picks (how can so many people be so wrong?!?). Here's the rundown:Mee Krob - Not good. Came in the form of crunchy noodles and tofu with the tamarind sauce on the side. . .so you had to toss it. . . yourself! This meant a lot of sauce congregating in the bottom of the 7-11ish plastic container. Uggggggh! Even when I did get some sauce, I wasn't excited. Overall, I won't order it again.Paht Thai - Really disappointed. Ordered it with chicken. but it also came with tofu?! So it sucked up the sauce and was REALLY dry. Also, there weren't any veggies in there. This dish was the biggest disappointment of the bunch.Panang Curry - Star of the show. Really good and the spice was right. I could have drank the sauce with a straw. Would order again.Cucumber Salad - Too much sauce alert (I am probably starting to sound like Goldilocks here)! It was OK. Lots of cucumber, sauce was good but soupy.Overall, I won't be ordering again from here any time soon. There are much better Thai options in the hood (Thai Lagoon, here's looking at you!)

We ordered delivery tonight (Friday). It took about an hour from calling until delivery.Green Curry with Shrimp - 3.5Pretty good with fresh cut veggies and shrimp. There was a biy of heat. The curry sauce was as thin as water; wish it had at least a little substance to at least sit on top of the sauce and not saturate it. They only provided a small container of rice - definitely not enough for two to share!Beef with Flat Noodle - 5Probably the most simple dish, and definitely the best dish of the bunch. The beef was tender and the noodles were perfect.Pineapple Fried Rice - 2The 2 is only for the seafood. It was mostly rubbery calimari, but also had shrimp, octopus and tough pieces of bbq pork. There was also some weird textured stuff (pork?) on top...it resembled cotton candy. Skip it. My companion was so grossed out by the whole dish, I ended up taking the leftovers so they wouldn't go to waste. I tried it again aaaand... the dish was dumped.Tab = $45 before tip.Not sure we'll feel compelled to order again; if so, I know it'll be for the beef/noodles.

Came in to pick up a carry out order and while the place was very nice inside, the value you get is just not there for me. All in all pretty disappointing to pay so much for so little.For a $12 Shrimp Green Basil curry you get 6 medium shrimpFor the $8 Banana Wonton dessert you get 3 tiny pieces of banana deep fried in wonton with about 3 tablespoons of ice cream...Also, the size of the veggies in the curry is way too large coupled with the skimpiness on meat just makes it feel like you are drinking curry with a few pieces of meat and a leftover veggie tray dumped in. The veggies are the only thing you end up tasting with this amount of meat so couldn't we at least get nicer sizes? Maybe this is subjective but I don't like a mouthful of red or green pepper at a time.What I liked: 10% cash discount, the curry itself, delivery area is wide.
I've yet to make it into their Milwaukee location but this is my go-to for Thai delivery.

At last, I found a good Thai eats in the city. I'm a big tom yum and red curry fan so when I stumbled upon this place via Yelp, I was cited to go! And it did not disappoint.We went pretty late around 9:45 and the place was empty but the servers were very welcoming. We didn't get the prawn chips some people here talked about, but that's okay!Appetizer: Creamy Tom Yum soup (of course!) I loved the flavor and richness of this soup. Although I was surprised to find whole green chillies, it wasn't crazy spicey (although, I generally love spicy..so just order with caution if you can't handle spice!)Dinner: Spicy Fried Rice with beef, and Red Pepper Curry with Chicken. I immediately became a fan of the rice, though it was once again packed with more heat than I'm used to in fried rice. But the Red pepper curry balanced it out very well! Although I wish the curry had a bit more flavor. Maybe I'll try to explore other styles next time we go.With their affordable, good sized potion, this was more than enough for two people and I had a pretty decent lunch the next day! We'll be back :)

Ambience: Classy. Trendy. Great for a date night or group outing. There are two sections to the restaurant. You can opt for the island table with stool chairs or individual tables with regular chairs. My only qualm is that there is dim lighting, so you may need to light up your cell phone to read the menu.Service: Quick. Despite coming here on a Saturday night, we got served in under 10 mins.Food: Delicious. Tofu pad see ewe is my to-go dish, and they made it well here.Parking: Street parking available.

Ordered delivery to Logan Square.  Order came about 1 hr 15 minutes later.Food:- crab rice - i don't like rice unless it's fried.. and i really loved their crab rice. they were very generous with the crab and you could definitely get a good helping in each bite. i will definitely order this over and over.- panang curry - good.- pad see ew - also good!- thai iced tea - mmmm!!!! this never disappointsI'll definitely order again or go to their restaurant.

Only ordered the carry-out but thought the food was great. Maybe just a teensy bit on the too sweet side for pad thai and crispy spring rolls. There are definitely a lot of places to get the same dishes for less.The dining room looks to be a bit more upper scale so might explain why they're prices are a bit more too.

Phoned in my order for Panang Curry on the way from work. Still very very delicious and one of my favorite dishes in the city. I have to bring my hubby here for real dinner so we can taste more delicious dishes. So far he agrees with me that the Panang Curry is awesome.

Decent Thai food, though whenever I order to pick up they never give you chopsticks.  So annoying, as I feel that should be a Thai food staple as I prefer to use them vs. a fork when eating my pad sew ew.Pad Thai is a bit dry, but other things I've tried on the menu have been decent.

One of my goals while trying new places in the Chicago is to find a place to call "my Thai place". I have tried so many Thai restaurants with some being pretty good and others being disappointing. Still, I have yet to find one that I would be happy ordering from until I die, or the restaurant closes. Silom 12 was close to taking the spot, but still didn't hit what I'm looking for.My partner and I decided to order it for delivery. I ordered the Paht Siew with chicken and my partner got the Paht Thai. The first thing I noticed were how big the portions were. I was very pleased with that. I find that many, if not a majority, of Thai restaurants serve smaller portions and charge a relatively high price for it. There was an excellent amount of chicken in my dish. The flavor was spot on. The stir fry sauce was flavorful without being overwhelming. The rice noodles where nicely cooked, and not crunchy/hard like some places. I really enjoyed the dish.Throughout my dish I had a really optimistic outlook. Did I just find "my Thai place"? Unfortunately no. My partner and I swapped dishes to try each others. The Paht Thai definitely had a great sized portion like my Paht Siew, but that didn't make up for the flavor. It did not have that peanut flavor that I look for in my Paht Thai. It was a little sweeter instead, which I can say isn't something I wanted. The noodles were dry as well. They stuck together in clumps. I also noticed that there was less meat in the Paht Thai than in the Paht Siew. My guess is that because they put tofu in the Paht Thai by default they take that into account as a protein while deciding how much protein goes in each dish. There's nothing wrong with that, but I would have just preferred more chicken rather than the tofu.Silom 12 is by no means a bad restaurant. I'll honestly probably order from there again just for the Paht Siew. However, because one of my favorite Thai dishes (Paht Thai) wasn't up to snuff, Silom 12 wasn't able to become "my Thai place".

I actually stumbled upon this place on accident, the place is really nice and it's BYOB.The service was incredible, our waitress got things before we even asked for it, like bowls to share food, and water before we ran out, and even apologized for the food taking longer then usual to arrive.We ordered Tom yum soup, drunken noodles with beef, red pepper curry, and pineapple fried rice with chicken. By far you MUST TRY the curry, it was so delicious!! Only complaint I have is that their wasn't enough rice to go with the curry. The Tom yum was a little plain, and the other dishes were just ok, nothing special. But again- try the curries!

Favorite place to get delivered. The other night I was catching up on Empire (the episode where Hakeem got kidnapped while jogging) and the urge for their Orange Chicken set in.The price is higher than most Thai places but so is the quality. I wish they gave a little more orange chicken in the order, but we can't always get what we want. I usually also get the crab rangoon but this past order I got the mini egg rolls. To be honest, they tasted like the smell of a barn so I wasn't able to eat more than a bite. Unsure if I got a bad batch or this is how they should taste, because they are a higher rated item on grubhub.I'll keep ordering and trying new things here because I also got the Chocolate mousse and it was delightful. I'm also going to continue to watch Empire because Terrence Howard is sexy AF (really sucks he is a wife beater though)
Absolute garbage. I can't even offer up an anecdote regarding my experience other than....... Oh fuck it, if you live in Buck Town you may deserve this.
Nice food, but kinda expensive for the quality (in my eyes).It tasted good, but... there's better out there.Sorry guys - maybe I'm biased.Try it. They deliver.

So I would give a 10 put there is a 5 only and I do have two minor minor complaints.  A.  Give more chopsticks on delivery, I had take out for 3 last night and we got one pair, since I am obsessed I ordered again tonight I got none :( B. the delivery driver was super fast but kept ringing the doorbell!  I was in the basement and he kept finding my doorbell while  Otherwise the Crab friend rice OMG can I eat it every meal?!?  Beef salad!!!  Tuna!  And Crab Rangoon, the list goes on.  Love it but please more chopsticks and tel your drivers to just wait 1 minute before finding the doorbell over and over.

Silom 12 is a great Thai food in a little bit of an upscale setting. The decor is very modern and sleek, lending itself to a very nice ambiance.Our server was attentive, but her English wasn't the greatest so there were minor communications gaps, but in the end we received what we asked for.I had every American's favorite dish - Pad Thai (Chicken) - and I enjoyed it, though it wasn't really much different than any other PT I've had before. For the type of place it was, I would have hoped for something to distinguish it. It also lacked the spiciness I desire, so I had to request chili paste.

New to the neighborhood and in search of Thai takeout, we gave Silom a shot. I have pretty high standards for Thai cuisine but I gotta say, WOW. From the online ordering process to the interactions with their (extremely friendly) staff, to the quality of food itself, 5 stars across the board. Best green curry I have ever had. Chicken satay and pad thai were excellent, too.The prices were fair for the generous portions, and although we took our food to go, the restaurant was immaculate with cool, modern decor. We will be back to dine in soon.

We came here excited to eat some yummy Thai food!I will say, the Penang curry was excellent. Best I've had in Chicago. We got the crab fried rice - just okay. We split some edamame to start.I had called and asked if we could bring our own and they said yes wine and beer only. We brought sake (rice WINE) and they got nervous and had to check. Service seemed a bit disheveled so it was a bit of an odd experience here and there.But the Penang curry and other curries are what we'll go back for!

I wandered in for a late lunch, early dinner before going into work. I ordered the Larb Gai and the Drunken Noodles with Chicken and a side of jasmine rice. The Larb Gai was outstanding and was a larger portion. The Drunken Noodles were very good and quite flavorful. I ordered the rice to calm down the heat from the Drunken Noodles and to soak up some of the sauce. The Larb Gai with the rice would be the way I will go the next time. This restaurant is not close enough to where I live to be in the rotation, but anytime I am in Bucktown it will definitely be the spot for an inexpensive meal out. My service was speedy and efficient, without having to tell them I was in a time crunch. Highly recommend Silom 12 for casual Thai dining.

Look no further! This is a BYOB thai restaurant! For an additional $2/person, you can bring your own bottle of wine to enjoy with your meal. Make sure you grab a bottle of wine from across the street at Red and White Wines.The Tom Yung Goong soup is delicious, but beware: there are slices of jalapeño peppers in there. We also loved the Duck Delight! The duck is cooked nicely and perfectly crispy. Also you can't ever go wrong with ordering Pad Thai.TIP: If you pay in cash, you get 10% off your bill.

Came here while I was visiting from out of town. I got the seaweed salad, which was super fresh with sesame seeds on top, a side of soy sauce (which I didn't use), all on a bed of fresh romaine lettuce. Delicious! Also got the panang noodle dish with fried tofu (which they charge $2 extra for). The sauce was perfectly tasty and the dish was really huge, you definitely get a lot of food for the price! The only thing was that the noodles were a little soggy and there was a lot of sauce - I would've liked a little crispier noodle and less sauce (or at least some extra rice to soak it all up). Also included very fresh green and red peppers in the dish, which added a nice texture. Will definitely be back. 10% off if you pay with cash!

Came back for visit #2 at Silom after over a year and the food was even better than before.  I went with the basil stir fry with tofu (again), this time asking them to make it less spicy and it was perfect.  Flavored to perfection, with just the right amount of spice.  Other winners at the table: pad see ew with chicken was perfect (not spicy at all, so make sure you ask for it if you want it) and the panang curry was excellent.  The massaman potato curry was a bit on the "too heavy" side, but still very flavorful.You get 10% off your bill if you pay with cash.This would have been a 5 star review but I'm keeping it at 4 stars because:1). They were out of the complimentary chips with seafood sauce that is one of the best draws of going to Silom.2). I once again had to request them to add white onions to my basil stir fry (still, so weird that it doesn't already come with onions) and instead of charging me $1 for this, they charged me $2!  Seriously?  $2 to add onions to a stir fry dish that should already come with them?  Unfortunately, the Thai food here is so far above and beyond anywhere else in Chicago that I will still come here, but I still think that's ridiculous.

My favorite Thai in the city. Every dish I've ordered here has been absolutely delicious, but I'm often drawn to their beef dishes that have the most tender beef that you'll find.Have only ordered carry out from here, so I can't comment too much on dining in service, but the staff is always timely / courteous when I'm in there, and the interior is really nice.

This review is for delivery.  Every time I order from here, I like it more and more.  The delivery is always fast and delivered by a really nice man.  The food is always correct which is special since I always make special requests.  I almost always get the Paht Thai which is super flavorful without being greasy and over the top.  The pot stickers are delicious!  We also enjoy the Cashew chicken and Sweet Onion chicken.  Taste fresh and seems pretty healthy relative to competitors.

I'm a fan of the food, but have had service issues with the delivery.  I'm pretty understanding if something is going to be late, but expect a call to let me know what's going on.  I try to order delivery directly from restaurants when possible but will probably use GrubHub in the future for Silom so I get updates on the food.That said, the drunken noodles are delicious.

Contemporary restaurant with friendly and attentive staff. BYOB is a huge plus, but the food is the main attraction. Fresh ingredients and different levels of spice on any dish.Things to order: Thai iced tea and pad Thai.Come here with friends, a date, or anyone that loves Thai food because the whole menu is great.

my go-to/delivery thai take out place.I seriously think nothing is bad on this menu. I'm weird and I judge a place by how good their hot and sour soup is, if they have it, and hands down one of best hot and sour soups I've had in awhile.I've had a few of their curries and it's always good. I have yet to eat-in, but I'm sure it's just as good there.Definitely worth a try if you have been here!
This is our go to place. Great for big parties.Food is authentic & delicious. The service comes w a smile. The mango & sticky rice is the ultimate closer. A must check out.
Good protein portioning.  Great flavor, not soaked with sodium.  Will order again.  They even called to make sure my order was correct as described online.

Good modern decoration place. I came here and hope to get some fusion food. My bf try Tiger Cry. I want to cry, test was so plan and was not delicious like the price! $20 with very small sticky rice...too much sticky, hard to eat. Service was normal for asian restaurant. Just bring the food to the table.

The Duck delight is succulent and tasty. The summer rolls fresh and crisp. The thai coon tasty. Service is not terrible but remember you will come here for the food. If the servers were a bit more attentive and swift..this would be 4 stars.

Food was delish! I ordered the Panang Curry Fried Rice & I was not disappointed! Awesome combination since I normally order either the Panang Curry or a Fried Rice dish. Another plus is that it's BYOB!! I'll be back!

Ordered a Chicken Tom Yum soup and a Pad Khee Mao.The soup was basically hot chicken water. It was by far the worst Tom Yum soup I've ever had.The Pad Khee Mao wasn't nearly as bad, but I've had far better many many times from various other Thai Restaurants.I'd be willing to try the Pad See Ewe or Pad Thai before completely writing this place off for good, but I'm not in any hurry to order from here any time soon.
Very friendly people but their food tastes so bland. I don't see the hype. Wish I could like this place.

For several months I have been ordering from Silom 12 through Grubhub. Not only does the orders arrive within the time expected, but the food has always been flavourful. There hasn't been one dish - and I get the curry dishes - that I didn't love to the point of repeat orders. So, I decided to go to the restaurant to have a sit-down experience.What took me so long?The complimentary rice crisps and dip are a hit, and that's just the free goodies. I had tuna tataki that I will order when I return. Notice I said, "when I return." The larb tod was a bit salty and didn't have the curry flavouring that I love most, but I gobbled it to completion. And then there was panang curry with shrimp. Let's just say that I was a happy man with each scoop of the panang dish with accompanying rice.Silom 12 has this whole lounge vibe going, and I love it. With it being in Bucktown, I'm sure it fills up quickly after 5:00 PM and on weekends. It was a good thing that I went during the day on July 4th. But that's okay. I came. I ate. I made a calendar note to myself to return.

Not impressed while hurting my wallet for a Thai place.  This spells a recipe for a not so good meal.My skepticism toward Thai and sushi combo restaurants becomes further affirmed with this place.  Of course there are some exceptions to that rule, but Silom 12 is NOT one of them.I gave this place a couple chances and tried the pad thai, chicken satay, and pineapple fried rice.The portions are modest, bordering weak.  Especially for what you pay -- $9 for pad thai?? Robbed.  Even Opart (best thai in the city) charges only $7.-Pad Thai: bland, slightly dry, but at least the ingredients seem fresh.-Chicken Satay: average, decent flavor and peanut sauce matched well-Pineapple Fried Rice: Weird.  So the dish is composed of rice, pineapple, some veggies, and awkward seafood.  In a rice dish, just stick to stuff that will not be difficult to balance on a spoon.  The seafood in the dish was also overcooked and too rubbery.  I felt bad for the baby octopus so carelessly thrown into this mess.However, there is one redeeming quality to save it from a 1 star review.DELIVERY RAMEN.It does NOT hold much of a candle to Wasabi down the street, but if you are in a pinch or lazy or hungover... and want ramen delivered... Then give 'em a ring.My recommendation: 1/2 mile north on milwaukee ave = blue sprout.

I ordered the pad see ew with tofu and steamed potstickers. The potstickers were on point but the pad see ew- noodles were mushy and overdone, lacking flavor, the tofu wasn't fried but was soggy and also flavorless. When they delivered my order they got the wrong address. The manager was accommodating and discounted my order. Unfortunately I won't be ordering from them again.

This was the worse thai food I've had in a long while and the service was bad too. The waiter was rude and inattentive. I asked for the tofu to be fried and he insisted that it already was (definitely was not). We were the only people in the restaurant and it took almost an hour to get our food. The vegetables in the drunken noodles were completely raw. The panang curry was basically just coconut milk. The decor is modern and trendy, but the restaurant is all style and no substance.

This is one of my favorite Thai food places in town. I've ordered delivery from them more times than I care to admit;) the food is delicious, the Panang Curry, mama paht kee  mao (I probably spelled that wrong, sorry) and their Thai iced tea are amazing! I can't speak about the location or the inside of the restaurant itself cuz I've never been inside, but I passed by a few times and it seems like a very convenient location with meter parking and not that far away from western or Damen blue line! So if you want great Thai food look no further.
Not my favorite Thai restaurant in town. Silom disappointed on taste, and the food. After the meal, felt a bit uneasy. Hopefully things don't get worse in the next few hours.

Gave them a try last night via Grubhub.  Delicious & Fresh! We ordered the Basil Curry and the Panang Noodles - Lots of meat, vegetables and the curry was awesome.  No MSG.  Good size portions.  Can't wait to try other dishes!

Delicious!  The only reason this review does not get 5 stars is because their curry was overly oily to the point of seeing the oil as you scooped the curry out.  Next time I shall tell them to put less oil.  Flavors and service, though, are excellent!/it is BYOB, too with a $2 corking fee per person.  Didn't drink last time we went but wouldn't mind bringing a bottle of wine for the next trip!

The music selection is awful. We listened to all of the worst depressing soft pop rock songs in existence. If you want to go to a place that's vibe will make you ruminate about all of the awful things that have happened in your love life, then this place is for you.This place also can't get many customers because some of the tables have started to accumulate dust that hasn't been cleaned in days.The food wasn't bad, but nothing was delicious by any means.

The veggie bun was awesome.  The noodles were good too!  They do have some cocktails and wine, I'm not sure if they're still BYOB.Its pretty upscale, different then your typical thai restaurant.  Totally reasonably priced too!
The pad thai was underwheleming, but the curry was amazing! the crba ragoons are pocket of heaven!

Had a great experience at Silom 12. Went there based on yelp reviews, and am sure glad we did. It was pleasantly full for a Sunday night, not too busy, but still a lively and fun atmosphere. Very modern ambience, but not stuffy at all. The host was very friendly and led us to a great table.I had the panang chicken curry, and ordered it mild. Would definitely agree with other reviewers that their food is spicy. The mild I requested still had a big kick. My husband and mom got the Tonkotsu Ramen which according to him was "good, especially for a Thai place." Sister got Pad Thai which was solid. HUGE PORTIONS.About ten minutes into our meal we noticed water started to drip down the wall behind us and got us a little wet. When we asked to move tables, the staff was so nice and very apologetic (although it was very obviously the unit above them that was leaking and not at all the restaurant's fault). At the end of the meal they gave us a $10 gift certificate to come back and apologized for the water--- again very nice and not necessary but such a nice touch!The thing about this place is that they have a large menu with many Thai and Asian varieties, but they do it all well. It's not like your typical Asian fusion place that does one or two categories well but lacks in the other categories. Everything we got was great! We will definitely be back here.
everything i have ordered has been awesome. no complaints.i always order delivery for lunch and this place is quick and the food is hot.

This place is great! I've ordered from them several times and although they forgot the egg rolls on my first order (which is why I docked one star) everything was delicious. I've had their chicken wings with sweet chili sauce, SO good, their pad see ew which was good but the noodles were a little over cooked, their red pepper curry with brown rice, both AMAZING, and their tonkotsu ramen. This last one I didn't like too much but it's only because I hate truffle oil and this clearly had some. Even with the truffle oil I could tell that to someone else it would've been great. The pork was tender and well seasoned, the noodles were fantastic so yeah if you like truffles then sure. That curry tho...really, really good. Must try!
The Larb Gai is AMAZING spicy, minty goodness with a hint of nuttiness from the rice powder.Order it!Disclaimer - I've only ordered delivery, haven't yet eaten there.

BUZZ- Curry (in general)I TRIED- Tom Yum Goong (5/10)- Penang Coconut Curry Beef (10/10)Uh oh! I think Dan Thai has a challenger! And surprisingly, it's not in LA, at least not yet, but from Dan Thai's own backyard. Who knew that in Bucktown, of all places, there would be a Penang Curry that rises to the challenge?!Went here for a birthday. It's BYOB! They have some really interesting drinks on their menu. I was specifically craving any of their lychee cocktails, as 1) I love lychee, 2) I love lychee-anything bubble tea, and 3) I've never had a lychee cocktail! Their food menu was also interesting. Considering this is a Thai place, the back of the menu had like 5 different kinds of Japanese ramen noodles. Who woulda thunk it? Their menu is very big, and they even have vegetarian choices.The place was already predetermined, so I was Yelping to find suggestions, and I was surprised that a specific Chicago Suburbs Community Manager who loves Thai and vegetarian menus has not reviewed this place!TOM YUMI enjoy Thai food, but I don't think I'm fully educated on it yet. I always get either Tom Yum or Tom Kha - extra spicy. Obviously, like Korean places, the spelling can be different, but here you have a choice of Tom Yum clear or creamy. Tom Yum "creamy" sounds like Tom Kha...but then they have a Tom Kar Gai, which fits the description. So...I'm really not sure what's what, but I ordered the Tom Yum Clear - extra spicy.The spice level was perfect! It's sweat inducing, but not tear jerking. See, tear jerking is where I draw the line. To help understand how spicy this was, let me put it in perspective. For me, BW3's Wild is sweat inducing, and Blazin' is tear jerking. So, when I asked for "Extra Spicy" I got the equivalence of Wild.The top layer is basically floating mushrooms - and I love mushrooms! There are a lot of "landmines" in the soup; however, all of them sink to the bottom, so you're pretty safe.Now taste. The seasoning, I'd say, was acceptable, but the flavor was lacking. I don't know how the "creamy" tastes, but clear tastes watery, actually! The spice kept me going, but it was like spicy "Tom Yum flavored" water. I'm thinking Tom Kha might be the way to go here. They brought this out the same time that my curry did, so I only got to finish about 2/3 of it, so that I can move on with my main dish.PENANG CURRYServed in a long boat, with a side of rice. First thing, the sauce is thick! If you dip your spoon in it real fast, it might drip a little, but the spoon would be, essentially, coated in it, which is just the way I like it. The taste of it - very rich in flavor, without being too basil-y. Seasoning is also right on (which they all usually are). Plus, I asked for "extra spicy," and just like the Tom Yum - they got the level PERFECT!The beef was a little chewier than other places, but this almost felt and tasted like pieces of steak. Still, it wasn't rubbery or tough or anything, it was good. The flavor of the curry was just so spot on, I can't even explain it well! The best word to describe it was "rich." Not overpowering on any specific flavor, but very well balanced. Scoop of rice, scoop of curry + beef, and it's eclectic!Last but not least - no land mines!Flavor and seasoning-wise, this and Dan Thai are pretty even. Beef is better here though, and I think the curry itself is a little thicker here, which I also like better. But probably the most important thing...when I say "extra spicy," it's actually as spicy as I want it here. Dan Thai doesn't quite understand my "extra spicy." So, I'm going to have to award the crown to Silom 12! Who knew Bucktown had good Thai?!SILOM #1!That was a great matchup, Silom 12 vs. Dan Thai, but we have our victor! Dan Thai will still remain on my 5-star list, but it will have to live under the shadow of Silom 12. I'm not sure I understand the "12" in its name, but it could be "18956" for all I care. It's VERY hard for me to come back here - but I will be back!

Found not one but two hairs in my delivered curry... And now I'm really disappointed because it was really good until I lost my appetite. This is the second time I've had their food. The crab Rangoon made it worth a repeat but unfortunately I'll have to find my curry elsewhere from now on. The search for the perfect Thai place continues...

I wanted to ask my server to be friends. That's how nice the guy treated me. Very attentive and he seemed truly sad when I left. Now that's being made to feel at home.While the decor is modern, the food and experience are still excellent.The Skewered Chicken Satay was delicious. Plump, moist chicken with a not-too-spicy peanut sauce. And the cucumber salad was excellent.I found the Seaweed Salad to be just ok. Perhaps the dressing they used was not to my taste.I chose the Green Basil Curry for my entree. Yes, it was a bit rich, but they put LOTS of chicken in there and the coconut sauce made me not even notice it contained eggplant!I will definitely return to Silom 12!

Just ordered delivery from here. I was so hesitant. A few people said that it was great, best food EVER, and some told me it wasn't worth it, it was overpriced, and the portions were small.It is not cheap, sure, but everything we ordered was good: paht thai (aka pad thai), egg rolls, fried veggies, fried rice, and some organge chicken dish that was phenomenal. I'm a chicken person and usually don't like how restaurants prepare/cook their chicken, but that chicken was awesome. It was crispy but yet tossed in a dressing (which I could've done w more, but I'd say it was the perfect amount so it didn't get soggy). The rice was a great combo of tasty, clean, and yet "greasy" yumminess. We will definitely order from here again (although sparingly bc it is a little pricey, but worth it). There was nothing small about their portions. Also the delivery was prompt for a Saturday evening.
Great Thai food.  The crab ragoon is the best.  I usually get takeout from here, but the location itself is pretty good too.  And its BYOB.  Definitely worth checking out.

I really enjoy the curry noodle from here. The drunken noodle is also delicious. The only complaint I have is that they do not serve traditional Kra Prao Chicken (Basil Chicken) with minced meat. They only have sliced chicken for this dish. The chicken slices just do not absorb the flavor of the sauce the same way that minced chicken does. I would order from here much more often if they prepared this dish the way I like - unfortunately I only come here when i'm craving noodles.

I think this place is a little too slick and modern for me, and as a result the flavors can be a little dumbed down. I prefer my Thai with zero decor and a lot of sour and funk to the food.BUT - that being said I definitely appreciate Silom 12's place in the world. They do very good food across a number of different styles/types - really a pretty large menu. Everything I have had has been between good and very good. They are also open late and deliver in a huge range, right up until closing. They really package all their food for delivery with care, and it is tough to find a place where you can get well made food at 11p at night.

I'm really starting to think there is no such thing as bad Thai food. In city full of great Thai restaurants what makes Silom 12 stand out, is the atmosphere. Silom doesn't go for dated looking gold elephant pictures or cliche Asian art, but rather an upscale modern feel.The prices, while maybe on the higher end for Thai food is still very reasonable. Service was excellent and our entire party of 10 all loved their dishes, which consist of standard  Thai fair and some of their own specialties. The overall vibe and food quality make Silom a great date option as opposed some other Thai restaurants with less pleasing esthetics.

As a thai/laos reviewer I am bias and can never give 5 stars because nothing will beat my mother's cooking. However, I appreciate Silom 12 attempt at providing very delicious thai food. The take out order always come in the nicest package and the yum nuer that we normally order is our favorite dish. We love the panang curry and the tod mun, as well as the pad kee mow. My only gripe is the sticky rice. While offered in a nice corn husk wrapping... It has been steamed too long and becomes so gelatinous, it's almost impossible to eat. That is comfort food and I wished it was a little more authentic. I miss home and this restaurant helps curb some of my cravings.

You know a place is truly good when you order from there about once a week.  Silom 12 fills my Thai cravings like no other and their delivery service is remarkably fast.  I typically start with an order of the tasty crab rangoon...a must order item.  To make myself feel a little more health conscious, I often order the fresh summer spring roll as well - delicious peanut dipping sauce to accompany.  I've always been a fan of red curry and the Panang Curry with chicken is never a let down.  One of these days I plan to dine-in as I hear great things about the restaurant's ambiance as well.

Probably one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. My boyfriend and I drove by this place all the time and just randomly thought to try it the other day and let me tell you, this place is seriously a hidden gem!To start off, the atmosphere is really nice. It feels like a trendy Japanese sushi restaurant or something. I was kind of amazed at how NOT busy it was on Friday night. In fact, I even hesitated reviewing this place and giving it 5 stars in fear that it will start to become another Nori or Cumin, because that's where it's headed.We started off with a couple drinks. Mine was a ginger vodka with iced tea and my boyfriend got a Long Island and they were both great! Our crab rangoon came out quickly too and it was delicious.Next up, I got the panang noodles and they were AMAZING. I always crave curry, but I love noodles, so this was a perfect fit. My boyfriend was jealous and I think we'll probably both order it next time. He did get a really amazing seafood noodle basil dish though, but the curry noodles were off the charts!I definitely want to come back, and I could not be happier that I'm moving to this neighborhood!

This is my go-to Thai place in Bucktown, and not just cause it's like 4 doors down from my apartment. I can't speak for the rest of the menu, but the Paht si-io and Crab Rangoon is always on point. That being said, I personally find the decor and music a tad lame, meaning I'd never eat in. Take out is good enough for me.

I recently visited Thailand and was transported back to Bangkok's Silom street nightlife with my inaugural meal at Silom12!The Silom mussels were fantastic and deserving of the house's name; the mama phat kimao had generous portions of fresh seafood, and the green curry was great!  I loved the urban hip environment and would highly recommend for a date night, girls night out, or group.  And, did I add it's BYOB with nominal corkage fee ($2)?!  The staff was very friendly and on point.  I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!

Solid Thai food.I compare every Thai restaurant to Opart thai (thats my fave thai in Chicago) and Silom is a great place with some real good food. Came here for lunch on Sunday at around 2:00pm, and it was quite empty. We ordered the Pad thai and the Panang curry - both vegetarian with tofu. The pad thai was delicious, I would have preferred it to be more spicy, but I had asked only for medium spicy. So I know for the next time to order extra spicy. I enjoyed that dish - it was a blend of flavors with fresh vegetables and the tofu was the perfect texture. The panang curry looked really good, and tasted even better. Yum!! The curry has a nice thickness, I am not sure if that is the authentic way of making it. But it sure was delicious. The vegetables were fresh, there was basil - lots of it which is the way I like it. It is served with a side of white rice, hubby and me were in curry heaven!! The service was pretty good and attentive. The decor is quite nice... I would definitely visit this place more often if it were in my neck of the woods.

I used to order from Silom all the time and was a huge fan of this place. After a series of not so great experiences I'll be finding a new place for Thai.Their Hot and Sour Soup is Fantastic.The last pad thai I ordered from them tasted like a dog smells. I ended up spitting it out and throwing it away.
Fantastic!The service is excellent!Food is deliciousTry also the Thailand BeerVery friendly and nice peopleI really recommend it !

Great food!! Great Prices!!! BYOB....Good atmosphere and serviceI called before hand to ask if it would be socially acceptable to bring a 1 year old in with us for dinner on a Saturday night.  The owner said absolutely not a problem, they could seat us away from any other guests in case he decided to act up (which doesn't normally happened) I'm very socially conscious of bringing children to certain restaurants.  The owner had a table waiting with a high chair for our son.  I thought that was very nice of him.
Great cozy place with great food! Highly recommend to anyone looking for a small to medium party. Food was deliciuus and they are byob .
I always order take out, and they never fail :) warm and hearty!
Excellent service and food. I ordered late night and food was HOT and delivery was prompt. I highly recommend this restaurant.

YES. YES YES YES YES YES.I randomly decided to order from this place on GrubHub without checking the reviews.7:55PM: Place Order, Delivery estimate 8:55PM7:56PM: Walk Dog8:15PM: Return home8:16PM: Phone call from (really friendly) delivery driver that my food is there.8:30PM: Thai Bliss.The food was REALLY good. One of the best Pad Thai preparations I've had in the city. Their Pad Woonsen was out of this world. I think I found a Thai delivery restaurant that will make me start ordering Thai food regularly again.And now we mourn the death of my disposable income.

We started out with Crab Rangoon, Coconut Shrimp & cucumber salad. All were good.I ordered the Paht Thai and my husband ordered the Red Hot Chili Pepper Curry. Kids split the Thai Fried Rice. All 3 dishes were surprisingly good, but this place is pricey for Thai food.  Banana Wontons are $8 and it comes with 3 small wontons with a few banana slices.  8 bucks?We ordered thru GrubHub and while it was on NYE, delivery took longer than promised. The only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because of price.  There are Thai places equally as good/tasty for less $$.
Great food and prices. We love the crab rangoon, paht thai and panang curry.  Fast delivery.

I stopped in here with a friend for a late lunch on a Saturday and found myself in an asian restaurant in the classic style of hip and trendy - spare, modern furniture, house/dance music playing at a moderate volume (which, by the way, how did this particular feature come about?) and nice food plating. They also have a full bar but I stuck to the hot green tea for this visit.The place was not crowded at all, and the server was fast and helpful. We started with the fried tofu served with a slightly spicy peanut sauce, which was very good. For my entree I had the tofu green curry and my friend had the panang curry. Both were tasty and just what we wanted on a rainy day. This is a nice neighborhood place and I would certainly come back here the next time a Thai food craving hits.

The food at Silom 12 is very high quality and made with care. I have never had a bad meal here. We dine in occasionally, but usually take out about once a week. I always get the Vegetarian Panang Curry with tofu, and while the veggies may occasionally change the sauce, spiciness, and preparation of the tofu are always very good.The ambiance of the restaurant is very nice, and classy-- a bit modern but comfortable. It would be a nice place to go on a date, or out to dinner with friends.For the price and consistency of the food, there is really no other Thai/fusion restaurant that I'd prefer to go to. Definitely worth trying.

Ordered through Grub Hub tonight for pick up and it was very fast! Our order was ready in about 10 minutes, which was great! It was reasonably priced, and the food was delicious! This will be our go to Thai place from now on!Crab Rangoon: 2/5 -- very small little purses with thin dough which was nice, however they were lacking any flavor other than cream cheese. The sweet chile sauce to dip in was good though!Cashew Stir Fry with Beef: 4/5 -- The sauce in this dish was delicious; typically sauce in a cashew dish is very thin. This was a nice, rich, caramelized brown sauce that enriched the flavor of the veggies and went perfect with beef. The meat could have been a little more tender.Pad Thai with chicken: 3/5 -- Good as far as pad thai goes, definitely ask for spicy if you like a little heat. We found it to be bland. There were LOTS of peanuts though, which was great!Massaman Curry: 5/5 -- Absolutely delicious. Just the right amount of coconut flavor to compliment the curry. The sweet potatoes were creamy and perfect with the other flavors.We will order from here again and again!! Can't wait to try out the BYOB!

When I ordered shrimp on the side for my pad Thai they called and explained that the shrimp would not be in the sauce and would be plain cooked shrimp. And to make sure that what I wanted. I think the fact that they took the time to make sure I got what I wanted is astounding.

I absolutely love this place!!! I love thai food and BYOB! And this place has best of both!! The ambiance is really nice and so was the service! Added bonus, its jut down the road from my favorite ice cream place- Margies!! I'm surprised it took me this long to come by Silom!! You must try this place if you love either thai or BYOB!

Decent food, very quick delivery in the late evening, will definitely order from Silom 12. We tried the Drunken Noodle and Panang Curry, both of which were tasty. Looking forward to trying some new dishes.

I have always been a frugal sort of man... and seeing the cost of delivery for this Thai/whatever venue... fended me off for a few months. But one fine evening of Maker's consumption led me to throw in the towel.If you prefer generic, Americanized, predictable, normalized Thai dishes, like Pot Pan, Penny's, and Thai Aroma... Silom 12 is likely not for you.The flavors are highly Earthy, basic, and unpredictable. The Summer Wraps, Gui Chai, and Banana Wonton all have a flavor that you'd never expect... not naming anything in particular, but their tastes are unusual, satisfying, and unique.Their main courses, by delivery, are a fair sum above average, but are not truly different enough to call them out on a higher level that is worth discussing on any long term basis.It is my opinion that the chefs/cooks/etc here are amazing and have a large amount of potential to create truly groundbreaking cuisine... but may have a management level that prevents their primary initiatives from hitting their highest caliber.But, like most ethnic foods of Chicago, I cannot hold much against minor imperfection, so... and so, with a shot of Maker's Mark held high, I rate Silom 12 5/5 despite its shortcomings.

I'm only giving 4 stars because I've never dined in, but it sounds like the atmosphere would warrant 5 stars! I've ordered carry out via Grub Hub twice (in one week) and it's been phenomenal. We've found a new favorite spot. The food is absolutely top notch. From the appetizers to the curry to the Chef Specialties and the sticky rice (gotta try the sticky rice). Everything has been awesome. The Osso Buco is veal shank and the bone marrow (according to my boyfriend) is incredible...smooth and buttery. It's probably one of the best dishes we've ever ordered for take away. Our next step will be visiting the restaurant since they gave us a $5 coupon when we dine-in (clever!). They're definitely doing something right....go here!

Best thai food in the area!  Everything I've ordered here has been good (Paht Woonsen, different curries, Basil Shrimp), but the best dish we've tried was the Green Curry Fried Rice with catfish.  Our friend ordered it, I never would have even noticed it on the menu, and it was fantastic.  Really amazing flavors - I'm definitely getting that the next time.  Our starter of summer wraps was really fresh, but I wish the peanut sauce were a bit more flavorful.  We LOVE the fried shrimp chips with chile sauce that they bring out when you get there.  Amazing.They serve alcohol now so now charge a corkage fee - $2/person.  Seemed reasonable to us.  They are also really attentive when it comes to re-filling the water if you order a spicy curry!  Street parking is usually pretty easy.220/365

So, after searching for a replacement take out Thai place after our go-to (Zen Noodles) closed, I think we may have a winner! We have ordered probably 5 or 6 times (had to make sure it wasn't a fluke). After a particularly bad experience and another joint recently, we called to order...were told 45-1hr for delivery (no prob) and in 14 minutes they rang our doorbell. I seriously was impressed! So the crab rangoon is awesome and not greasy at all. Light and fluffy and a different presentation than usual. I also love the rock shrimp! So good. We have also tried the Green Bean Tempura dish, which was also great, the sauce was super good (it is a lot so be aware!) The pad thai is great. I have actually been ordering the rice dishes and they are super good! I have had the panang curry (sooo creamy and delish!) I tried the Drunken Noodles last night (which I have had at other places) and they were just way too spicy. I almost think it was a mistake. My hubs who love spice even tried them and said the same thing, but have no fear, there is plenty of other awesome stuff! Great service and super fast!

Delicious, quick and tasty. The crab ragoon is a particular favorite of my, because it is light and a good balance of dough and filling. Everything has always seemed very fresh and well season for this type of establishment. I would recommend takeout or delivery. The atmosphere is nice as well!
Really really good Thai food. I got larb gai and it was fresh and flavorful. Very authentic dish. I will be back.

Friendly staff really makes a place.  The staff here was great and friendly.Example 1: First time being here, I asked about whether they're red and green sauce was homemade.  The lady said yes with a smile, and I thought that was it.  Nope, she brought out a couple of homemade chips and let me try them.Example 2: The cook made some small talk, mentioning how big the torta was and how a big serving of fries was provided.  All in a friendly manner with a smile on his face.I appreciate good/solid/friendly people.  Can make all of the experience.  Curious if they were husband and wife.Now, I ordered the Chorizo con Huevos (Huevos = eggs and if you don't know that by now, having lived in America, you're ignorant.  Hey, no one cares about "learning our (english) language" bullshit) Tortas with a side of fries.  The tortas was indeed large and the serving of fries (which were seasoned) was indeed plentiful (fries maybe being under-salted, but come on man, salt 'em yourself, the salt level was to my liking).  Unfortunately they were out of avocados, so it was missing on my torta, but no matter, it was great as is, and it's good to know they get fresh ingredients (possibly daily).  The story was some guy came in and ordered 8 servings of guacamole to go (got damn!).  You do you guac. person.  I could go into how great the chorizo was and all that, but I'm no poet.  I got it to go (received my order quickly) and asked for some of the green sauce (which is amazing!).  The whole meal cost ~$7 dollars making this affordable as hell.  Plus the food was great and I am beyond full!I'll definitely be coming back here to try out other things on their menu, and regret just now finding the place after living in the area for almost a year.Gonna pass out from a food coma now.Oh, the interior.  Dude are you looking for something decorative and elegant?  Fuck out of here with that bullshit.  It's a taco joint.  The interior had tables, that's all it needs.  Wait, it also had a fish tank with fish in it, so nice touch there.

Look, I've been in Bucktown all my life, more so in my recent years. Every time I go down Milwaukee and see Turbo Tacos, I used to think, 'I've never seen anyone go in there before...is it closed down?' Then, a few months ago, a friend recommended me this spot saying they make some of the best tacos. I was shocked, now having this knowledge of a human being stepping into this restaurant, but I vowed to myself that I would check it out one day. Today was that day.I ordered three tacos al pastor and an horchata. The casher (who I assumed was the owner) was an incredibly nice guy. Always checked in on me every 10 minutes while I was dining in as well as the other customers at the time, making small talk and having a couple of laughs; it was everything a owner should do that gives a place an extra piece of greatness to it.The tacos itself were great. Yummy al pastor that actually left me satisfied as I was starving when I walked in. Great price too! $1.50 for tacos, $2something for gorditas, and about $5 for burritos and tortas.Don't be me and overlook this place. If you're sick of Los Comales or Arturos or Lazos or whatever, make sure to check out Turbo Tacos one of these days if you're in the area. Hell, you don't even have to be in the area, check out this place! I really appreciate small joints like this.
First time here, the food was good. The bathroom was broken which is never good! The inside was okay, it's could definitely be upgraded so it's more welcoming.

As a guy that lives in what could be considered the epicenter of great Tacos, Turbo Tacos has the best Mexican food I've been able to find in Chicago. The owners are great, super friendly and there's some parking and room to get your grub on. Love it.
Great taco's on the cheap and the staff is incredibly friendly.
Delicious, authentic, no frills tacos. $1.50-1.99 each. I had chorizo and chicken and they were perfect. Very kind staff. Yessssssss

Niko gets it done!I come here almost every day and Niko is the best. Great food, great variety. He has things from pizza puffs to enchiladas to gyros and it's all amazing.Not contrary to the name, almost everything on the menu is cooked in under 10 minutes.All in all, great place, great service and great staff.Definitely stop by for the enchiladas!
My friend Niko just put a beautiful fish tank for us to enjoy and feel and at home atmosphere while dining at Turbo Tacos

Got the taco dinner with 2 steak and 1 al pastor. The al pastor was good, just and flavorful. The steak was even better with a great crispiness. Rice and beans were solid too, not too salty, which I like. For the price this can't be beat, I will be back, and soon!

An Old Logan Square Taqueria that has some really great food. Stop here with a friend while passing by and had a really great experience. Food was excellent and  good. I like that it had an old-school Taqueria feel to it

Amazing the best tacos I ve tried and that's bicoastal . They are very unassuming when first walking in but the food is incredible, the guys are very friendly and it all comes within 5 min. Definitely recommend especially for breakfast or brunch they have really good omelets

I had lunch here today. The service was friendly and I paid at the register beforehand even though I was dining in. I had three tacos: chorizo, al pastor, and carne asada. They weren't the best tacos I've ever had but they were a steal at $1.50 each. The chorizo was nicely spiced, the al pastor was fatty but in a good way, and the asada was solid. I also had a large horchata which was served in a big glass mug and very tasty. Overall I would say this isn't the best Mexican in Logan Square but it's an excellent value and worth a try.

Came here late night, worse place to go to. We were at the Concord and looking for late night eats of course.  We dodged traffic and came to this spot.  We probably should of just gotten into an Uber and went to L'Patron.  The service was very poor, food was nothing that I could of made at home.  Not only will we continue to dodge traffic, but definitely this place in the future.Odd though, because the other reviews were high.

I stopped into this place on a whim prior to heading into a show across the street at the Concord.  Dangerous move, getting Mexican right before heading into an hours-long event at an enclosed venue with no re-entry.  But wound up having zero regrets!The Chorizo Tacos were so good that I had dreams about them during my booze-soaked slumber that night.  Couldn't stop thinking about Turbo Tacos so I went back the next day and ordered a Chorizo Torta.  Also a top-notch piece of cuisine.  Some of the tastiest chorizo I've ever eaten.My friends all enjoyed their meals as well.  And the staff were super friendly and lightning fast with the service.  Price point is extremely respectable as well, helping to earn that all-important 5th star.Not sure when the next time I will ever be in the area is.  But if I don't have time or $$$ to go to Wasabi instead (ultimate Ramen house across the street), I will definitely hit up Turbo Tacos again!

Textbook greasy spoon but the Best Al Pastor burrito I've had and great service to boot.   Use the red sauce!  Crunchy yet doughy tortilla, and super flavorful.  Free chips (unlike most places around here).  Prices for tacos are some of the lowest around.  2 tacos and chips for under $4.  Dollar for dollar this is an outstanding value.

Turbo is heaven! I can't say enough great things about this place. The staff is extremely friendly and always go out of their way to make sure you're happy. Plus, the food is amazing AND at a great price!Highly recommend if you are looking for great food, fast!

Just straight up good Mexican food. Great service. Easy and delicious. No frills kinda joint. Just the way it should be. All tacos are excellent. Love the beans here also. Will be here a lot in the future.

Great food, super cheap and friendly - had the cecina, asada, and al pastor tacos, and the asada torta and they were all good, with the pastor standing out as very good. All of that for less than $14 with drinks.Sad we didn't try the burrito, but that's on the list for next time - all they need now is a liquor license :)

Popped in for a quick torta and was not disappointed. They staff is extremely nice and they keep it clean in there. Food came out quick and it tasted fantastic. I recommend the chicken milanese torta.

So good!! Fresh and delicious.  Great portions. We had the tortas al pastor and Cecina. The lady who works there is so sweet and down to earth. I think it's the own. They have as a free taco to try. So fresh. The meat is really good.  We just moved from California where we have a lot of delicious Mexican food. Defiantly gonna be our after work favorite !! Loved it

Amazing taco shop. My wife and I just got to chicago from California and had dinner here. This will definitely be the first of many. The tortas are great and the carne asada is perfectly seasoned, moist, yet crisp on the edges. I'm going to try the lenguas next time we're here (you know it's legit Mexican food if they serve lenguas).

Awesome food, awesome service! A family run business that caters to its customers! The owner told me chips were free for dine-in customers because of the many times she had been made to pay for chips at restaurants. How cool is that? Come support this local business!!!

We were two Canadians seeking delicious ramen down the street, but alas were denied. Lucky for us, Mexican is another favourite for us! We saw Turbo Tacos as we passed to get to the other place, and immediately headed there when we couldn't get into our original choice. From the outside its a little questionable, I admit... But the minute you walk in and the smell hits you! Yum! Boyfriend had taco after taco, the food was as close to being in Mexico as you could get (for us!). The Canadians got their Mexican fix in the USA, and that's ok.The service was amazing, they made sure we had some free wifi, which is important when traveling abroad!

Probably the best burrito I've ever had.The tortilla is almost more like a paratha than a traditional tortilla.  If you like crunchy on the outside and doughy in the middle, you know what to expect from the "tortilla" they use.  Simply amazingI get a mix of chorizo and carne asada, combined with that paratha outside, I'm floored every time.Salty, greasy, hot, and above all, as delicious as it getsI can't speak to their other food because i can't venture away from this order.  Have it with their orange sauce and prepare to be happyExcellent service as well!
Stopped in before a show at the Concord across the street. Holy moly! Fire. Asada burrito was the best I have had since being in Chicago. Not to mention super cheap. 5 buckaroos.
Best tacos in the area (concluded after extensive research), and everyone who works there is always very friendly. Chilaquiles, Jamaica, and chorizo are awesome.
Delicious and super affordable. The staffs are very friendly. Clean and bright interior. Couldn't ask for more.
Affordable and yummy! The staff is super kind and once stayed opened past close when I called and said I was on the way to get food. They're the best!

Amazing tacos! The chicken was delicious and well seasoned and the retried beans were so good (they must've known I like extra cheese). I didn't really care for the steak, but I'm definitely getting chicken tacos and trying the pork next time.

I've been waiting forever for something to open up here!Turbo!OkI am glad they cater to my American-ness by having an American menu as well as the standard Mexican fare.  So I can order fries with my tacos.  But it goes further than that. I can have a beef sandwich with my tacos.  Or a burger with my tacos.  The options are surprisingly numerous!So the tacos are ok.  The al pastor, though without a pineapple, was flavored well.  The steak was pretty bland.  But they're cheap at $1.50, and like I said, I can get fries with my tacos.  Fries aren't the greatest, but they'll do.Hope to try the rest of the menu in the future, and I hear they will be open 24 hours eventually.  Take note, early birds and late-night owls.I don't know why, but I dig a place called Turbo, like a lot.

What a dump.  This place is brand spanking new and its a dump.  That just isn't acceptable.If you are drunk and its late, and you can't find a Taco Hell, stop here.  Otherwise avoid this place at all costs.  With all of the good Mexican food/Taco joints in Chicago, why go to this one.Blech!

I love this place! I know good Mexican food and this gentleman is no joke. The owner is super friendly and makes everything fresh, delicious tacos and burritos, such tasty fresh guacamole, I thought I was eating my own version , you want hot he's got that and the best horchata in the city, who knew? Kudos!
Great food... Very "roadside mexican" reminds me of driving thru Mexico. The Asada was awesome!
Good tacos these guys throw down great location. It definitely looks questionable from the outside but it's what's on the inside that matters.

Fantastic! Not the nicest looking place, but the workers were very nice and the food was great. The taco base prices varied from ~$1.60-$2.00, and were definitely amongst the best I've ever had. They weren't very large, but at the price it doesn't matter. The worker was very jovial and accommodating--all around nice guy. We actually got a few tacos to test it out and then went back up to the counter and got several more. Horchata was also very good and large for the price.

Was in the neighborhood to train for a new job and I didn't feel like driving anywhere.  A burrito sounded like a great idea so I decided to try his place.  Great customer service, wonderful menu selection and it was fantastic.  A little on the greasy side on the outside but so tasty.  They used fresh veggies and provided free chips and two different salsas.  I recommend a visit to someone who's in the mood for authentic Mexican "fast food."  4 stars because I could use a little less oil but not enough to truly complain about.  Very friendly and convenient lunch place! :)

I always stop by this small, but amazing, restaurant. They seem to have lots of different stuff on the menu, but I usually just go with the chicken/beef tacos... They are very reasonably priced and the food quality is above average, i would say. The service is also great. The ladies at the counter are incredibly sweet. I should probably venture out and try more stuff next time.

Hi guys! Disregard any low star reviews! This place is super cheap, super delicious and the service can't be beat. The guy (not sure if he is the owner) up front is the nicest and is always happy to see ya. The al pastor is so good and their fries are fresh and crispy. And they bring chips and salsa to your table! And they have real Mexican coke. We could go on and on but trust us and just go.
I should say first I'm a vegetarian and I have only had the veggie taco plate. BUT the owners here are very friendly and I just had a  fresh, filling dinner(including a drink) for only $6.50!

All I can say is Wow..... Again WOW..... I live in the back of this place and I can't believe I never tried their food before. I definetly will be returning. Had a steak torta and pastor tacos very tasty food. I recommend this place plus the cooks and the lady that takes your order is very friendly. You will definitely love this place two thumbs up Turbo Tacos..... I should know my father is a cook my mother a waitress and I work in a restaurant extremely good service.

Summer's nice right now, but come winter going farther than a short distance for food is going to suck and a good taqueria nearby is important. Having moved into the neighborhood a few months ago, I've kept a curious eye on Turbo Tacos.A Saturday afternoon trip led to a purchase of a taco, gordita, torta, chips & guac, and the post-order realization that I must have been a bit more hungover than I thought.First, the good news: As a number of others have pointed out, the staff is quite friendly. I don't know if the gentleman who took my order was the owner that is mentioned in some other reviews, but regardless he was very friendly and patient.Second, ignore the woman who claims the place is dirty. The building has very clearly been remodeled recently, so there's nothing inherently unclean about the place and all the tables were spotless when I visited.Now to the food. Again starting with the positives -- everything was very fresh. I watched the protein for my order go on the grill, the aforementioned gentlemen cut up an avocado to make my guacamole, chips were fresh out of the fryer, etc.Yet we start to go a bit downhill.  The guac was fresh, but the kitchen forgot to make it until I noticed that the bag felt a bit light.  As above, the guy was super pleasant and apologetic, but in the rush to make up for his mistake it tasted like he went a bit sparingly on the salt.The gordita was good, but was very one note. The sandwich was exactly what you'd expect from a torta and not one bit more. It sucks because it's not as if any of these items were bad, leading one to believe that Turbo Tacos is within reach of being really solid. Case in point: Other reviewers have correctly noticed that the steak is very bland. Yet out the corner of my eye I saw a fellow diner who figured out that applying some fresh lime juice and cilantro turned a bland taco into something delicious.Unfortunately, we have to judge on what was instead of what could have been and in that context these five star reviews from other folks make no sense.  Single tacos don't seem to come with the critical lime, guac was forgotten even though I was the only order up, but most of all too many things were just average. I appreciate the really kind service, will always defend a place against unfair accusations of dirtiness, and will go back hoping for improvement, but three stars for now.

My first visit was because my little son wanted to eat right away.  I stopped.  This owner is super cool, and very nice to chat with.  Mexican food is made fresh, yummy  tacos and burritos from a four year old.  While we were waiting for our food, the owner, offered our son to play soccer table game.  They also have FREE parking right next to the restaurant.  GOOD FOOD.

This place just opened up around the corner from my place and I couldn't be happier. The gentleman who helped me was extremely kind and friendly.I ordered two vegetarian burritos and an order of chips and guacamole. The chips were made to order and so was the guacamole, he even let me try it to make sure it was to my liking. Everything tasted great and the price was right!I definitely recommend this place.

This place is good.  I have only had their tacos, but they compare VERY favorably to the 4 closest taquerias.  I wish I could give 4.5 stars.  The one star knock is for the atmosphere - it's nothing special.However - the service, tacos, and salsa are excellent!  The prices are great.  Give it a try!

Ok. I didn't go there, but this is my boyfriend's second day in a row. He brought me home some tacos, 2 steak and 1 al pastor. I enjoyed them. I think they are simple and tasty. No frills, which I like. I did think they were a little bland, probably just needing a little salt and pepper. The tortillas were a bit dry and too thick. I felt like the tortilla was too prominent in my tacos. With that being said, I think this place has great potential if they work out the kinks.
Very good, reasonably priced food, good service, nice people. It's very clean, too, despite whatever Ariel L is yelling about.
Pizza pot pie, as amazing as it looks!!My advice is to order one for pick up to try it and avoid that 2 to 3 hour wait!

First off, expect a wait no matter what. Gets longer if you have a large party. It was only a table for two for us and it still took us at least an hour.  Restaurant is small! so expect to shimmy against each other if your near the bar.Multiple stars..Person working the front: 2 starsOur waitress: 4 starsFood: 4 starsHere's why.Person working the front (the shorter then the two), seating people is equivalent and reminds me of the soup nazi in Sinefeld.  You would think host/hostess are nice, personable and inviting... this guy has some issues.  There is no wait list to put your name on, he says its in his head... um okay. Sure.. At first we were giving the guy credit. Then he seated the guys behind us who came in 10 minutes after we did. How did we know that, its because we were talking to the guys when they walked in. So my husband went to tell host with the baditude that, and he was flat out rude! he starts telling my husband with an attitude... I told you it will be an hour and a half wait. My husband says the guys were after us, and he was wrong.  He says he's never wrong.  The people next to us who were Chicago locals overheard... and later asked us if we were on the list.... they were joking of course, cause theres no list.  Its all filed away in metal cabinets in his head. These Chicago locals specifically told us that they try not to go there because of this. So beware of the grumpy dude.Our waitress, she was bubbly, quick and nice. I liked her!! She delivered our salads rather quickly.  Our waiter always consistently refilled our waters, took away our plates and items quickly.Our food.. well now here it is. I was really excited to try this place. I saw the review to this place, even saw the video and I was intrigued! Pizza that looks like a humongous muffin, flip it and it becomes a pizza. Its like a dam transformer.  We choose the 1-pounder, Pizza Pot Pie with Mushrooms with wheat crust. about 20-minutes later.. viola the dam muffin looking thing is in front of you. ready to be flipped. Our waitress flipped and knifed the dish until it flops on to the plate.  First taste, the melted cheese is fabulous. Watch the video.. its not just mozzarella. its a combo of cheeses that make this dish so fabulous. You like cheese,come and get some! The meat sauce too was very tasty.  I've had meat sauces in different restaurant and I always feel like its 20% meat, and 80% running tomato water. This sauce was meaty and flavorful. perfect.. just perfect. Just to mention, the wheat crust was different, it actually felt grainy so perhaps oder it with the white.

Definitely not worth the wait, if there was actually a waiting system.  They do not take your name down and there is no list.  They will tell you they will remember your face and tell you to wait 2 hours. The reality is they won't remember you,  and there is no way of telling how many that came after you got to eat before you.  I know because they asked me to wait another 2 hours after 2 hours.The pot pie is basically a bread bowl with tomato  meat sauce, half mushrooms, and alot of cheese.Another Chicago thing.

Saw Chicago pizza and oven grinder company on the food network a week before my trip to Chicago and immediately added to my itinerary!The restaurant is located in a residential area. The entrance was located downstairs. The restaurants are much bigger than the place appears!On a Friday evening, an hour before closing, we were hoping there wouldn't be a wait for three, but boy were we wrong! Once we walked in, our waiter immediately told us that it'll be a 45 minute to an hour wait. There's a bar area for you and your party to sit at while you wait to be seated.The pizza pot pie is a must try! I never had such a unique pizza before and I'm glad I discovered this.The wait for the pizza is 30-40 minutes. With all that waiting, the restaurant was already closed even before we got our food. Luckily the staffs were very patient and did not even mention that they were closed.

After so many years of hearing about this place and seeing it featured online I had to come check it out.The place is tucked away. If it weren't for the old timey signs sticking out you could walk right by it. It is a very narrow restaurant with a low ceiling (at least for me). It's just barely big enough to handle the kind of foot traffic it sees. When I arrived with friends we were greeted by valet. Which I highly recommend you do! They will park your car for $10. When we got inside we were told to wait by the bar for 45 minutes. We expected an hour wait no matter what...and you should too!But by some great blessing we were seated within about 25 minutes...maybe less. We were blown away! We took a booth and sat down.Great selection of beers.For an appetizer we did the Mediterranean bread.
