Hipster chicken places that you want to hate because they're so trendy--until you actually taste it and it heals your soul.Roost is making their own buttermilk biscuits, fried chicken (strips or bone-in or sandwiches) and the all the appropriate accouterments (mac & cheese) like it's their artistic mission in life. The biscuits are exactly right--light enough to cut in half with no trouble, strong enough be an important part of the overall flavor of each bite.Yeah, if you order at the counter you have to wait almost table-service times (10-15 mins), but this is because they are personally frying goodness just for you. I'm going to try not to break down into little tears of joy.My only complaint? Why not serve their breakfast chicken biscuits all day? It seems like pretty much the same main ingredients, but throw an egg on that thing and I'm going to blast off into space. I don't care that it's noon.

Yummmmm. Tried the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich with the Mac 'N Cheese and Bread pudding as a send off before my Monday diet and I'm so glad I did. This place is damn good. For that area their prices are really impressive. You get a lot for what you pay.Taking them down a star because it smelled awful in there. Crack some windows or something the grease smell was nauseating but that won't stop me from coming back!

I've been coming to this location on and off for lunches.  The chicken recipe is delicious. I usually get the 1/4 bird combo with Mac and cheese and a biscuit. My suggestion is to go with spicy. Be warned though, spicy and Nashville hot will make you sweat! Biscuits are fluffy and very rich.

I've been to Roost twice: once to this one, and once to the one on Milwaukee.It kind of ruined me for other fried chicken places.Super delicious, juicy chicken and very reasonable prices.Takes a while since they're making things fresh per order, but it's worth it.

Nashville hot is the latest hotness and this place heats it up quite nicely.Having a history of sticking my hand in places it shouldn't belong, I knew enough to bring along some rubber gloves to protect myself, but despite precautions still managed to stick a nice load of ouches into my eyeballs.Beyond the tears I cried i still was able to stick these tasty foods into my face and I confess I liked it all.The capsaicin and oil which coated my chicken order was just right for me to get some sweat on my brow.The coleslaw crunched and soothed while the fluffy buttery biscuit was the perfect wingman to this plate of meat.It was a one time love affair which was messy, shweaty and left me oozing from my body holes.and yes, I think I'm in lust.Parking looks free on Irving though be aware of Cubs game traffic as this can become an obstacle large enough to push you to their southern location.Cheers.
Tacos were really good but make sure to order ahead because if you walk in it will take a while.
Jeeze.  Never again.Ordered delivery.  Grubhub sends me confirmation.  Roost sends me confirmation.  2 hours after I order, no food.No call, no show.

So, first of all, this food is phenomenal! The vibe is to die for with appropriate southern blues playing and the round bulb string lights on the ceiling. I actually had some pretty bad service on my first visit but after speaking to the young lady, she assured me that she was just having an off day and gave me a credit for a free meal. I've gone back 3 or 4 times since then because everyone was very sweet and understanding about the situation, and the food speaks for itself! Summer at the front counter is so nice, very efficient, and excellent at her job!

Sometimes I really want biscuits, but I don't want to make them. The Roost always solves that problem for me. They have the best biscuits. They're not greasy and they're amazing hot or cold. I've pretty much eaten everything on The Roost's menu and I've never once been disappointed.The sandwiches are great, but nothing beats good old fashioned fried chicken. I always get Nashville Hot or Spicy. Mexican Coke is a nice added touch. It's weird that I've been eating here throughout their mac and cheese evolution. My first time eating here, the mac was very basic and came in a plastic container. Now, the mac has a spicy kick to it and comes in a tinfoil container that's convenient for oven reheating.Ordered delivery from them a couple nights ago. There was a staple in my macaroni and cheese. That won't stop me from going back.

I've been dying to come here because well, fried chicken and biscuits?! I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich on A buttermilk biscuit with cheddar cheese and the ranch sauce. The biscuit was unreal, and the flavor of the chicken is spicy and not disappointing. My only complaint is the chicken isn't super crispy. I was then told that Carolina style normally isn't. So, I wasn't super wow'd because I was expecting that crispy chicken. I don't like the soggy crust and biscuit all meshing together. Flavor is there though, 100% Then I had the Mac and cheese and chips. Both has great spice to them. The Mac was super thick and creamy. Chips were ultra crunchy.

When you think of good chicken places in Chicago what are really your options?  You have Popeyes which is the franchise version and lesser of two evils.  There's KFC which I'm not sure if what they serve is actually even considered chicken.  The real deal is Harold's chicken shack but that's just way too far away to even have that as an option in the north side of the city..  So I was craving chicken one night and was looking for some other solid chicken places near bye .  We were with some friends and they suggested I try this place out just based on the Yelp reviews alone and they had  never partaken ether.We ordered through Grubhub the first time and pretty much every time since.  The food was ready quick and it was delivered hot, tasted fresh and the chicken was extra crispy.  Which is just how I like it.  Not greasy, or soggy like some other chicken places I've ordered from in the past.  The inside of the chicken was moist and it had a lot of flavor .  I tried the Nashville hot sandwich with a side of mac & cheese and peach cobbler for dessert.  I would recommend ordering it with the habanero hot sauce to dip your sandwich if your looking for some kick.  The menu overall is pretty simple and there are not a ton options which makes it really easy to pick what combo suits you best.  So far I've tried four different dishes/combos and liked them all.I moved to North Center about a year ago and literally live right across the street from Popeyes and I've probably ordered from this place more in the last two months than I have from Popeyes all year long.  If you're looking for good chicken at an affordable price and are on the north side of Chicago this is a really good option for sure.If I had to pick one downside it would be that the restaurant itself is small.   I would encourage patrons to perhaps order online vs a sit down meal unless it's during the week and not at peak dinner hours.   Otherwise this place is solid when it comes to making some delicious fried chicken.  4 stars all day long!

Pro-tip: do not bring up Chik-fil-a, perhaps not even in jest, especially not if the man who is going to provide you with delicious hot spicy greasy chicken cannot tell you are being sarcastic.We were warned that there would be a wait as the chicken is cooked fresh and man, it was worth the wait. Crackly red skin and super juicy meat. The mac and cheese was very good, albeit on the small side and the biscuit was the right buttery canvas for the chicken. We also got the peach cobbler and bread pudding, both very well done. I'll be back to get more stamps on my frequent frier (their pun, not mine) card!

Finally made it to Roost and happy I did! The hubs and I went for brunch and had delectable biscuit sandwiches with the Nashville hot chicken. Sandwiches were super spicy and delicious. Those biscuits though. Wow. The mac and cheese was ok and the peach cobbler was almost as good as my daddy's!!! I'd like to go back and try pretty much everything on the menu. Like everyone says, be prepared to wait.....but also be prepared to enjoy the hell out of that chicken!

I was really excited to try this place as I lived spicy food and had never tried Nashville hot chicken before.  Got the 1/4 chicken meal with a biscuit and bread pudding.Before I go any further, let me say that it was my bad for ordering take out and arriving 5 minutes later than they said it would be ready...fried chicken should be eaten right out of the fryer.  So I will come back and if I like the good I will adjust my rating.The chicken was really not that spicy...I understand that I am probably an outlier when it comes to heat tolerance, but I thought Nashville hot was supposed to knock my socks off; instead, I tasted some sweetness and didn't reach for my water until halfway through the second piece.  Maybe you need to wink at the counter and ask for the "really spicy" chicken.  It was also kind of soggy, but that's my bad for getting carry out.The biscuit was good, not great, and the bread pudding was also good, not great.  Definitely a good value though.  I am torn between 3 and 4 stars, but liked I said I will eat in and adjust as necessary.

Overall, this is a very good chicken sandwich place. I can't really think of a better chicken sandwich now that I mention it.  A very simple menu, very few items, but everything is pretty solid.My main complaint with this place is the service and the wait times, but you have to pardon the wait because it is fresh and they are up front about it.  I would not recommend coming here on a weekend due to the line and the wait.  I may be nitpicking, but when you've been standing in line for 10 minutes staring at the same menu board with the same 5 items as everyone else has been staring at, and when they get to the cashier you hear time after time from each of these clueless yuppies in front of you, "what sides do you have?", you kind of want to hurt someone.  How could you not know after staring at the menu for 10 minutes? Oh Lawwwdyyy!The service is usually just a notch or two below "friendly." Indifferent is how I would describe most of the attitudes I encounter here.  Although there are a few shining stars here and there that will smile or offer a pleasant tone, that is not usually the norm here.One example:  I went to throw away my bottle cap and a couple napkins and found the trash to be overflowing onto the floor as I made an attempt to place these small items on the top of the heap without them falling over as well.  As I was sitting there, I heard this woman come out and exclaim, "Oh geez, I guess I actually have to empty this trash.  I hate emptying the trash.  I've been trying to avoid this all afternoon." I guess she was talking half to herself, half to her co-workers a few feet away, but as a customer who had to deal with the overflowing heap, it was pretty disappointing and a bit frustrating to hear that this employee had been deliberately avoiding the task throughout the day.As for the food, chicken sandwich with slaw and ranch is out of this world.  Chipotle ranch is just amazing! Mac and cheese seems to vary day to day and is usually on the salty side with a bit of spice.  Chips are good, but way on the salty side.  Desserts are decent, but not great.  Now that you can't get the desserts as a side with the meal without paying extra, I doubt I will order their dessert in the future.A tip, when they say 20-25 minutes, they mean 25 minutes.  It will not be ready sooner!  I have tried, and it is never ready sooner.  So the 20-25 minute lead time makes it something that you have to plan ahead for if you're out and about and just randomly think of ordering some food.I would order more often if: wait time was shorter, staff were friendlier, you could still get desserts as sides, they were open later.  That said, I still order regularly and the food is reliably very good quality.

While many of you silly geese ventured out into the chaotic mess known as Black Friday, I went out to go get some damn food.And oh my, was this place a perfect way to treat myself again after eating like 5 pigs on Thanksgiving. I ordered the boneless chicken (Nashville hot) on a buttermilk biscuit with all the toppings except cheese, along with a side of mac and an extra biscuit.The sandwich was amazing, the chicken was cooked to perfection, very tender and the sauce and toppings were tasty. I just wish it was spicier! I'm a borderline masochist when it comes to spicy food.The mac was a cheese lover's dream, sooooooo cheesy, I would easily order 20 lbs of this. The biscuit was soft and tasty as well.It takes a while to prepare so if you're ordering to go then I'd highly recommend you call ahead of time.So get it, get it!

I have a soft spot for places that specialize.  This place is a perfect example of how restaurant don't need to have a huge menu to  be great.  I happened upon this place while walking to pick up take from another restaurant. I saw the size of the biscuit through the window and immediately made a detour to get a taste.  It was a bit pricey $2.11, but it is was everything I want in a biscuit.  Buttery, moist while still fluffy, and with a crispy exterior,  Probably not something you should eat everyday, but Lord, I wish I could.I saw they did breakfast, so I ordered take out the very next day. I had the Brittany (Biscuit with boneless spicy fried chicken, fried egg and cheddar) and it was perfect.  The chicken was juicy with a little kick and the egg was perfectly cooked.  I will be stopping in every time I am in the neighborhood and highly recommend others do the same.

WOW. The fat kid inside me dreams of the chicken sandwich here. Quite possibly the best I've ever had. I like the small menu to limit my indecisiveness. The accompanying biscuit is delicious. For me, the Roost doesn't make 5 stars because of its side-dishes. The slaw was not my favorite and the mac and cheese, while good, did not blow me away. Come for the sandwich though...you won't regret it. Small restaurant, but people seem to move in and out quickly.

The food here is excellent. I mean...excellent. I particularly enjoy the buttermilk biscuits, macaroni and cheese, and peach cobbler. I'm giving 4 stars because the service here is really subpar. The employees all pretty much yell at each other which creates a pretty uncomfortable and unpleasant experience if you're dining in. Taking your food to go can also be a bit of an ordeal. They haven't quite figured out how to balance their dine in guests with their carry out orders and the online orders as well. Also, fried chicken does not have to be greasy to be delicious and I'm not sure The Roost always understands that.

I work near the location on Milwaukee, and eat here at least once a week.  I've tried everything on the menu.  I have a few thoughts on what could be better, but I think the Roost offers a unique & quality chicken.  You are getting very high quality fresh chicken cooked to order.Helpful hint: If you are in a rush phone your order in.  It takes about 10-15 mintues for your food to be cooked fresh if you order at the counter.Update:  I previously would feel a little let down if I got a chicken wing on a two piece order of chicken.  Now, the roost allows you to but the wings separately for only a buck each.  Not only do I feel this is very fair for a quality chicken experience, but I think adds something to the menu that could be used for a get together or for supplies for a football game.Pros:  The Carolina Hot chicken has a lot of heat.  The Spicy also has a lot of flavors, but less heat.  I prefer the spicy because the flavor is a bit more complex.  The chicken is always cooked well done, and the coating is a bit crunchier and thicker than what you would find at a KFC.  It is almost as if it was rolled in crumbs instead of dipped in a batter.  The biscuits are large, and taste great.  There is plenty of honey on the table (and you can get a container to get some to go).  The desserts are also wonderful, and come in good portion sizes.  The mac and cheese is also exceptional.  The cucumber coleslaw is also unique and taste refreshing (more on this later though.)Cons:  There are only four sides available.  Coleslaw, home made chips, mac and cheese, and biscuits.  They all come in good portions except the coleslaw, which comes in a small two ounce (i think) container.  So if you get the only healthy side on the menu you feel like you are missing out.  I would like it if they increased the size of the coleslaw to match the other sides on the menu, and also if they added one or two more options.Finally, there is no real family style option.  You can get large orders of chicken easily enough, and at reasonable prices considering the quality.  However, you don't have any options for the sides.  You cannot feed 3-4 people from one of the individual side orders.  If you order multiple sides by itself, it will quickly become cost prohibitive.  I think they would be best served if they had a mid sized option.Overall, I strongly recommend the sandwiches (on a biscuit) with everything on it.  The flavors and textures complement each other very well.  My second recommendation is the hillbilly tacos.  Bone in chicken is flavorful, but does not feel like the best item on the menu.

My problem isn't with the food. It is delicious. Or the people that work there, they are super friendly.I've been back a few times since my last review and you know what. They still haven't figured out order processing. It BLOWS my mind how inefficient it is.I watched three different couriers come in to the restaurant after I had ordered... pick up food for delivery customers and then come back again to to deliver again.Apparently I am a TOTAL FOOL for supporting this place in person because it takes a full HOUR to get food while people are ordering on grubhub and seamless instead get their food hand delivered to their homes 45 minutes after ordering.The solution is so simple, analyze your in person order volume by date and time (you have over a year of data at this point) and restrict online ordering during those times that you can't handle the volume.Also, having to double check on my order and then having to find out that they "accidentally" must have given it to someone else is not cool.The food however is as good as ever. The bread pudding and chicken biscuits are borderline incredible.

So I chickened out and ordered the spicy sandwich on a biscuit  instead of Nashville hot. I was super hungry and thoroughly enjoyed my sandwich with bluecheese and pickles in my car. I had also picked up an order of regular chicken sandwich for my kids with a side of mac and cheese.  So I split the sandwich for my kids and got small piece to taste lo behold it was my spicy sandwich in a bun. Fortunately my son enjoyed it but my daughter refused to eat. I wish they paid more attention while getting the orders ready to avoid the mixup.
Delicious!!!! I got the Nashville Hot 1/4 bird. Amazing.  Mac and cheese was delish and the biscuit, yummy.

This places fills in the blank for two food items in the sentence, "The best *blank* I have ever had!" Those two items: the fried chicken (herb crusted is my jam) and mac 'n cheese.It's comfort food at it's finest, and my mouth is watering just thinking about it. My fiance loves the spicy chicken sandwich on the biscuit with everything on it, as well as the mac 'n cheese (even though he typically dislikes mac 'n cheese).I suggest calling ahead to order, as it takes a little bit to get your food. They make the food fresh after you order (no warmers in sight), so it's definitely worth the wait.

Fried chicken..mmmmmmFor what you pay for the chicken is great. Been here a few times, chicken is never dry well seasoned. The sides are nice and homemade. The desserts are good as well, and seem to be homemade as well. But even if they are not they are good anyway. They make a good chicken sandwich with several topping options. There isn't many dish options here. Basically if you don't like fried chicken you're in the wrong place, but if you love fried chicken it's worth a try. It's small so there can be a wait at times, but I tend to go during slow hours and am never disappointed. Overall this place is great. The chicken is good and not expensive either. Give them a try, I think you will enjoy the food. I do.

This place is delicious!!!! Fried chicken with a flair. It's pricey, but worth it.We bought the following:1. Half bird Nashville spicy - yummy2. Half bird herb - smelled so good in the car3. Mac n cheese - nothing special. More oily than buttery.4. Peach cobbler - yum, but for the price, they should have used fresh peaches5. Biscuit - best biscuit ever6. Cucumber cole slaw - I don't like cole slaw, but this was refreshingBe sure to ask for their frequent fryer card here. Buy 8 meals and the 9th is free I think. We got two stamps from this dinner, which fed me, my bf, and 7 year old son.I can't wait to come back! Thank you to my coworker who told me about this place. I had no idea.

I dock a star only because I'm too lazy to go to Irving Park on the regs and I can't believe they didn't factor _my_ needs into their location selection process.Ditch the pickles and slaw (I'm sorry, I'm English and we're dainty), and that Nashville chicken sandwich will change your life. It'll ruin you.
Great fried chicken, fried, simple menu, good eats! Small cost atmosphere, self service / order.  Portions are ample for most people though I ended up getting another half (burp, and loved it too).

Wow felt like we were down south. Biscuits were moist and flaky, Marconi had that perfect kick to wake up your taste buds and the chicken sandwich was perfection. Beware their hot is really spicy if one can handle. Perfect southern chicken taste in chi-town.

Very credible fried chicken is served right here on the north side of Chicago. I had 4 pieces of the herb seasoned bone-in chicken with sides of a biscuit and coleslaw. At first I thought I ordered too much--but 4 pieces ended up not being too much. The chicken was moist and tasty. The skin was less crispy and the meat a little less well-cooked than I would like--but still good. The herbs in the seasoning went really well with the chicken. The biscuit was terrific and I liked the the coleslaw along with the cucumber slices. Service was friendly. The made to order chicken takes about 15-20 minutes. Well worth the wait in this sharp little chicken shack.

I live near this location and have given it a number of tries. I work in a restaurant, so I completely understand that sometimes mistakes happen. I do have to echo a few of the other reviews here; every single order I have made has been wrong in some way. Biscuit when I ordered Kaiser. Wrong side. But the last time I went in was the final nail in the coffin of this relationship.I decided to try their buffalo chicken on a kaiser roll. I saw the guy manning the fryer drop my chicken in. I watched him pull it out. Witnessed the dip in Buffalo sauce. When it arrived and I took a bite, everything was soaked in ice cold sauce. The chicken itself was hot. But the bun was cold, the sauce was cold. Maybe that's their jam? Maybe they're different. But it makes no sense to douse a fried hot piece of chicken in cold sauce.It's a shame to be consistently dissatisfied with a place that has a great rep. Many other neighborhood people have raved about it. I want to really love it. But I can't.In terms of cleanliness and friendliness? Absolutely. I have always had a great experience in those departments.

I went to the original Roost with my family and friends on our annual food hopped. Our theme was actually restaurants from Food Network's Diner Drive in & Dives. Man this place serves a bomb fried chicken sandwich. I felt like these flavors transported me to the South and I need to get another spicy chicken biscuit soon. It's good for the soul, right?!

This review for the truck only.  I love food trucks.  I eat at them often.  So I know that when Roost took about 20 minutes, this is not the standard you should expect from a food truck.  However, I was hoping the sandwich was worth the wait.  It was not.  I got the Nashville and it had a nice spice but nothing crazy as I was expecting.  You definitely cannot eat this as a sandwich cause the biscuit falls apart.  Like completely apart.  I took a picture when it started but as the sandwich went on, there was pretty much no biscuit left.  The biscuit itself was average tasting as well.  Another complaint I had is I expected fried chicken, meaning crispy skin.  It was not at all in any way crispy.  So that was strange to me.  It was just a soggy piece of spicy chicken.  The last issue I had was how unbelievably greasy it was.  I have a pic of me wiping my hands with a napkin once and you can see how much grease there is.  I mean I know fried chicken isn't exactly a health food, but, as with pizza, there are varying levels of greasiness and this was on the far end of it.  I am trying to understand why so many people love this place and wondering if I just had an off day?  Is the chicken not greasy and soggy normally?

SO, we all make mistakes. What matters is how we handle mistakes, and Ashley, the General Manager at The Roost, is clearly a customer service professional. She took the time to not only read my review on Yelp but to read all of my reviews and understand that I'm reasonable and balanced as a customer. She took my feedback to heart and is using it to revamp their processes to ensure that what happened to me doesn't happen again.She offered to make recompense and has gone above and beyond to be available for my feedback.I still give only 4 stars, because I haven't actually had the food.

YUMMM!Stopped her for dinner with my boyfriend (per his request) and it was awesome! I ordered the original chicken sandwich. It was perfectly crispy and have a decent amount of heat to it. If you do not like pretty spicy food, I would do anything hotter than the original.Biscuits were fabulous and airy and buttery. The only thing I wasn't a big fan of was the mac n cheese. Not quite what I was hoping for. I wanted thick creamy mac n cheese.I will be back here, but not often or I will have a heart attack.

Finally did try the Nashville hot chicken out, and it didn't disappoint. It does have some spiciness to it, but I was fine with it, and it reminded me of the level of a jalapeno-style spiciness. Guess I should try the original version at Prince's(where this was inspired from), whenever I revisit Nashville someday?It's too bad about some of their sides being slightly weak(like I mentioned in my 1st review), since if it wasn't for that I'd say 5 stars. Still it's at least 4.75 stars, in my book.

Obsessed. That's the only way to describe how I feel about this place. Being a transplanted Texan in Chicago, and growing up spending most of my summers in Alabama, I have grown very accustomed to excellent fried chicken. I am very happy to say that I have found what I was missing and longing for, here in Chicago. The Roost is my favorite place to go to get that little taste of home.It's not little in flavor, but it is little on space. It's a small joint, so avoid going with a large party.I am in love with their sides of macaroni and peach cobbler, although I'm usually too full to finish it all in one sitting. I always have a doggy bag of cobbler for a snack later on. And the sweet tea! Can't get enough of it.You absolutely can't go wrong with your choice of chicken and seasoning. I have yet to try the Nashville hot, but look forward to experiencing it on my next visit. The food isCooked to order, so you may have to wait several minutes to receive your food. Trust me. It's worth the wait.Get to The Roost as soon as you can, but save a spot for me!

After a fun day watching the Air and Water Show on Belmont Harbor, my girlfriend and I finally made the trek to The Roost! I have been wanting to come here for a very long time, and I was very happy to finally make it.The inside is very casual with a long communal table and a few individual tables. We ordered a medium quarter dark piece with cole slaw and peach cobbler, and a biscuit sandwich.. Nashville hot! The biscuit was crumbly as advertised, so I ate my sandwich with a knife and fork. The flavors worked very well, and I enjoyed the extra heat. I am not a fan of the painful spice, but this heat added some flavor. The fried chicken was also fantastic. Cole slaw was unique and tasty, but the highlight of the side dishes was the peach cobbler. I did not expect it to be that tasty!Overall, I would give this five stars for great, reasonably priced food.. except it took us 50 minutes to get our food. We came at 5 PM, and were promised a 20 min wait. I understand there were some big call in orders, but the restaurant didn't look that busy and we were waiting for three pieces of chicken. If we were extremely hungry, this would not have been a good look, but hopefully this day was an aberration.

My second experience has me scratching my head... an hour wait for a half bird to-go? Well it is a Saturday night, but that's a bit redunkulous. The sweet joy of a bite of their delicious Nashville Hot will be worth it, right? They obviously do a huge delivery business. A biscuit on the house should be in order. Really not too crowded inside either.

Got home & my order was wrong.  Was having a long hard day and decided to order take out after working 10 hours then about to work 2-3 more hours tonight.  I called Roost, was told that my order would be ready in 20 minutes.  Got there 23 minutes after I called and still stood there for over 15 minutes.  Then I got home and my order was wrong.  I had ordered chicken on a biscuit w/ mac & cheese, plus peach cobbler.  I was sooooooo looking forward to that cobbler.  But instead they gave me ANOTHER BISCUIT?  Who gets a sandwich with a side of the bread?  NO ONE that's who.  I would have been so happy eating my peach cobbler, but now I'm just super sad and bummed I stood there so long waiting.

omg, the food!SO GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!SO GOOOOOOOOODDD!!!!!!dining in is a pain butSO GOOD!!!!!!let me just tell you,I once ate every single meal from their delivery for a whole weeklike everything is awesomeI have yet to find a place where everything taste awesome before I found this place on grubhubI literally tried everything and loved everythingTheir bread pudding? AWESOMETheir chicken? AWESOMEEVERY FLAVOR IS AWESOME!Their biscuits?!!?!!?!? SUPER AWESOME!Tho....after eating it none stop you kind of get bored of how good it is loli haven't had it for a while just because I had too much of it lolkind of like instant ramen, you can eat it for days but after eating everything and everything tastes yumming you start feeling everything just taste the same and you want to try something new for awhile and go back to it lol
I could eat the Nashville Hot with cucumber slaw on a biscuit everyday. Will be back ASAP.

This place has been on my to-do list for months now. I'm glad it was on my way home on one of my outings. Their food was delicious...filling for the soul as well as the stomach. Such a small place---such great food.

I've eaten here twice, once for dinner and once for breakfast.I ordered the Stevie at breakfast, and it has singlehandedly ruined all other breakfast sandwiches for me. It was that good.When I came for dinner I had chicken strips (Nashville hot), Mac and cheese, and peach cobbler. The strips were spicy and tender, just like you might find in Nashville or Memphis (places I have visited many times). The Mac and cheese was good but nothing to write home about. The peach cobbler is some of the best I've ever had, warm and sweet and fresh tasting.The service was great, the restaurant (Irving Park location) was clean, and they play phenomenal music. One of the all around best places to get fried chicken in the city of Chicago.

I reviewed Roost after a recent visit when (despite calling in advance to make sure it could be done) they sent me an order full of the devil's chicken - not spicy, mind you, but filled with sad, dry, breast meat pieces. (Mind you, I mean compared to delicious godly dark meat - some people like breast meat.)HOWEVER!  After receiving my feedback, the owner of Roost reached out via Yelp to make things right.  That kind of customer service speaks volumes, so I am happy to return the stars I had knocked off for the previous experience.That all said, I definitely recommend Roost.  The chicken is perfectly seasoned, crispy (perhaps a touch less if delivered, but that's the nature of the beast) and even the herb-seasoned has a tiny, delightful kick.  The mac and cheese is rich and decadent and gooey, the biscuits are melting with buttery goodness, and the chicken (ESPECIALLY if you get dark meat) is tender and juicy.What more can I ask for?  Oh!  Mashed potatoes and gravy.  But, the sad lack of taters and graves still won't keep me from coming back to Roost and recommending them again.
Can you say omg in my mouth so yummy the only thing wish they had more sides but worth the drive!

Very pleasant surprise! Nice, little place, with common wooden tables and a grand tradition of soul food and fried chicken! We suggest the fried chicken menus, less than 10$ and you get also two side dishes! Awesome!

Growing up eating Southern Food/ Soul food my entire life I was excited to try The roost Carolina kitchen. Unfortunately it was just okay. The wait was ridiculous for the quality of food. I got the bone out with the biscuit and peach cobbler , and the macaroni and cheese. Both of my sides were dreadful! The  macaroni and cheese taste like it came from Kraft, and the peach cobbler was slimly. I had takeout. When I came home my biscuit was drenched with the hot sauce and broke apart. They were rushing so they did not properly package my food for takeout.!I have a high standard for southern food and I was unimpressed.
The food is AMAZING and so fresh! The girl at the register was so friendly and really went the extra mile!!!

It was a long bike ride for me to get here but I knew I wanted to try this place for a while.  Who doesn't love a good chicken sandwich?  The Nashville Hot wasn't as hot as I thought it would be and it delivered on flavor.  The buttery biscuit provides an excelent counterpoint to the heat.  I opted for the Mac and Cheese and Potato Chips as my sides.  Both were pretty tasty, but the Mac and Cheese left a little to be desired.  As the mac and chesse is served, there is no balance in texture to it.  It's very goey and creamy but needs like a bit of a crust or something to make everything right.I ordered my drink a little too qucikly as I saw that they had homemade sweet tea and lemonade and a half and half would have have hit the spot. Though I couldn't be to dismayed by my choice of a root beer. All the classic bottles for sodas really plays well into that old school vibe.

Ever since Endgrain dropped their food concept, I've been at a loss for a goooood chicken biscuit.  Endgrain however only offered a breakfast biscuit.  Roost on the other hand is available pretty much anytime, since chicken or fried chicken sammiches rather are their whole concept.The Roost is, as the name suggests only about chicken.  I.e. a Chicken roost.  Southern style and they do it mighty great.  There is a nicely fried aspect to their chee-kun.  Their food is stellar.  If doing sandwiches forget the bun, it's worthless. It isn't toasted or warmed, so its forgettable. Get a biscuit, tortilla or do it naked instead.  All their sides are tasty, much like their desserts.  Hearty, filling and should satiate any hunger.  The mac'n cheese is sublime with its super cheesy & rich texture.The food is good, the wait is alright but the place could have been cleaner.  Seriously.  The benches got forgotten about. If the tables get wiped down, the benches should too right?  The chairs as well. Usually I look before sitting, but the other day I sat in pools of honey.  (It's offered as a condiment) I was wondering what kind of fool spills honey on a chair and doesn't tell anyone about it. My jeans were wrecked and the counter-person wasn't paying much attention.  I assume from a busy morning that could explain it, still someone should be paying attention to these details.  Doesn't take much to look over and clean off chairs and benches as well.  I mention this because there was a whole lot of conversation going on behind that counter.  Last what's the deal with the overly waxy floor? I was doing the Charleston from the dining area to the restroom.  (Don't know what the Charleston is?youtube.com/watch?v=jUqR…

Ever since we came back from Nashville, we've been trying to replicate the food we've had there. Especially, the juicy, spicy, crispy, delicious chicken we've had at Hattie B's. We had sworn to never have fried chicken again if it wasn't from Hattie B's. But after reading the reviews for this place we felt that maybe, just maybe we have found a replica of the chicken we've had in Nashville (and b/c they have named one of their flavors Nashville hot). Sad to say we were a bit disappointed. The chicken was not Nashville hot nor it was anything like the chicken we've had in Nashville.However, I don't think that's fair to this place, we did come here expecting way too much and we shouldn't have. The chicken here was good, it was way better than poppyes and KFC, so if you're looking for fresh fried chicken, definitely try this place out.  It was tender, moist, and juicy, not quite as spicy or crispy as I would have liked. The oil that they use definitely needs to be changed more often because we can taste the stale oil. Considering this place has a long wait to order in and a place is extremely small and very busy, I am sure that's completely affordable. The sides that I tried were mac and cheese and cole slaw, cole slaw was not bad, however, mac and cheese tasted like kraft dinner and not homemade!Prices are not bad and the staff is friendly. Place itself is a small, cute place where while you're waiting, you have choice of playing chess (neat idea)! All in all, this place was good if you're looking for good fried chicken but don't come expecting a lot.

Best fried chicken in Midwest. Three flavours herb, mild and Nashville hot. If you can't handle hot seasonings the. Do. It try Nashville style. Otherwise the spicy flavour is out of this world. Their biscuits made on premises are a mainstay with your chicken dinner. I do t m ow what else to say except this is the BEST of best fried chicken and the atmosphere and music are lively making you want to eat

Legit solid comfort food. I wish I had stopped by more times! The Nashville hot sandwich is amazing. The chicken inside has a perfect layer of fried coating but the taste of cayenne pepper was extremely strong. It's the perfect spice level for me because it was a) actually spicy b) but not enough to make me lose my appetite. The chicken was also very moist on the inside. Biscuits are crispy on the outside, creamy and smooth on the inside. I enjoyed the mac and cheese too. Bread pudding was average.I really should stop by again to taste their other non-spicy sandwiches next time!To note: When we went, it took a bit of time for them to get our orders out even though there were only 1-2 people in front of us. Make sure you're not in a hurry to go as the food is worth waiting for.

I decided to give Roost another shot after a so so experience last year.I had a Nashville hot chicken sandwich with slaw and pickles.Let me tell you, it is HOT! The heat is up there but not too spicy (at least not to me). The slaw is definitely brings the heat down a notch.The chicken itself tastes terrific, a plus.My critique last year was that it was greasy and that the crust fell off. which is a cardinal sin with fried chicken. This time the wonderful, not greasy, flavorful crust stayed on but it was a little too soggy for my liking.I think their food tastes great and probably is not meant to travel from the store due to the steam in the box.

Just because it used to be a food truck doesn't mean you should go.  The place is about the size of a closet.They lost my order.  Everyone else I was with got theirs and I waited an extra ten minutes before I asked the staff.  They seemed annoyed and said it would come right up.  Well it didn't.  I waited another twenty minutes for my overpriced chicken.  No explanation, no compensation.Avoid this chicken closet.
Amazing Nashville hot chicken. Quite a wait, yet it's made to order so worth it. Mac N Cheese is a pass. Bread pudding is excellent.

Awesome spot in Lakeview for some southern Chicken! Visited here this evening and had the Nashville hot chicken sandwich. Really well seasoned. The biscuits they serve here also practically melt in your hand. Serving size felt just a tad small for the price. They hand make and fry every piece of chicken, so expect to wait.I'll certainly be returning!!

I can't get enough of this place. Embarrassingly, I once ate three fried chicken sandwiches from The Roost in one week! Crap. Am I going to die? Anyway, came here with bae after doing yoga and sippin' brews at Begyle. He ate hot chicken and bought tickets to the Kentucky Derby. The next day he regretted one of those choices.

6 starsWent to The Roost for lunch on a Sunday around 12:30. The restaurant is quite small and they cook your chicken fresh to order so be prepared for it to take a little while for your food to come out. But, the wait doesn't matter because the food is SO FREAKING GOOD!I got the spicy chicken sandwich with cheese on a biscuit, with mac n cheese and peach cobbler as my sides. The sandwich was amazing! The chicken is so incredibly good and the biscuit was really soft and fluffy. The chipotle ranch added a great, smoother flavor and you can get pickles and coleslaw too if you want. The mac n cheese was really good, definitely homemade, and the peach cobbler was a great way to end the meal. And maybe the best part, I got all of this for $11.I will definitely be back. This place is a real gem on Irving Park rd and must have some of the best, if not the best chicken in Chicago!

Ruined for life. I will probably never be able to eat any other fried chicken than the Nashville Hot chicken from The Roost. (Honestly, I probably will, but it just won't be the same...) The chicken meat is so moist, yet the skin is so crispy and flavorful--I've never had anything like it! Also tried the biscuits, which were SO fluffy and had a distinct buttermilk flavor. Would come for every meal if it was closer.

Food was greasy and took over 45 minutes to make. It's not anything special. Just friend chicken and a basic biscuit that crumbled every time you picked it up. There isn't much sitting room inside and it can get very hot inside because of the fryers.

I review this place based on three factors:1. The chicken2. The rest of the food3. The service1.  Excellent overall.  Either bone in and bone out are not greasy with a nice crunch and great flavor.  The Nashville Hot is not too hot (compared with Thai and Korean type heat) and has a pleasant peppery flavor. White breast meat can be dry.2. Mac n cheese has a simple twist with a speckle get of black pepper.  This can make or break it for purists.  It's different, but I prefer a sharper cheese or horseradish for contrast.  Coleslaw is downright bland, dry and dotted with too much celery seed which gives it a sandy mouthfeel.  Not right.  Peach cobbler is spot on, but again, it's southern peach cobbler with a pie crust top rather than the crumble which may turn some off.3.  My first visit was great.  There's really not too much to expect here as it is counter service, but the guy (the owner I suspect as it just opened) was friendly, took our order and fried the chicken as well.  Recently, when I ordered to go, the girl on the phone was rather curt.  After I picked up my order, I called them again to say the order was incorrect and that they gave me spicy when I ordered original, which the online menu states that it's mild.  She tried to correct me and say that there's always going to be a bit of spicy on it because of the recipe.  Well someone's lying or doesn't know their shizz.Can't rate it higher because only the chicken was good.
Delicious, filling, easy to find, friendly staff, menu is concise and not overwhelming, and did I mention DELICIOUS?

The food is amazing, but what is better is the customer service. All smiles when you walk in. They messed up my order once and did more than what was needed to make it up to me. Food is one thing but customer service is what will keep me coming back.

Taste: 5Presentation: 4Service: 3.5Atmosphere: 4Cleanliness: 3Value: 4Food was delicious! I had the Nashville Hot sandwich with Mac and chips. Every last bite was very tasty...especially the biscuit, chicken, and chips. It was a bit slow, but that's partly because they don't fry the chicken till you order. The place is small and run like a fast food joint, so it has that vibe to it. I will definitely be back! Next time I'm going to order the half bird and share with my wife!
The cucumber Cole slaw is excellent.  Quick casual service.  Good chicken.  I'll be back.

Such a cute little place! Very fresh, cooked to order so it takes a little longer. Worth the wait! I had the original chicken sandwich on the biscuit (a must!) with cucumber coleslaw, dill pickles, chipotle buttermilk ranch, and sharp cheddar cheese. Man was it good! I was also hungover and I swear this sandwich could be a cure! I don't live in Chicago but looking forward to my next trip just to visit this place again!
This place is incredible. Everything is fresh and delicious. Makes Hattie B's in Nashville look like a joke.

The spicy chicken sandwich was great. I opted for it not on a biscuit because of how easy the biscuit crumbles. I ate the biscuit as a side with Mac and cheese. The Mac and cheese was okay and the deserts were just alright. Didn't really care for the desert. The restaurant could of been warmer.

Craving southern fried chicken?  This is your place.   I get the Nashville style sandwich every time and am never disappointed.  Sides could use some work (wasn't ultra impressed with the mac and cheese, but I liked the cucumber slaw).  Something to keep in mind: it looks like a take out place, but this is a slow food place.   Leave at least 20 min to have your order prepared.  It's hand-breaded right there at the time of the order.
Place is fantastic! Not a huge menu but everything done well.  Chicken is on the small side, a half chicken won't feed 2 people.Dining space is small so best for carryout .

The Roost sets the standard for southern-style chicken sandwiches in Chicagoland.Granted, I'd just run 6+ miles, and Divvyed through the rain to get here... so I was pretty hungry and thirsty. Still, when I took a sip of the sweet tea, I knew I was hooked. A lot of sugar and top quality tea make for a wonderful combination. Not a trace of granulated sugar in the cup, either, which is somewhat miraculous for how sweet this tea was.I also ordered a Stevie, the chicken, egg, bacon and cheddar special.How is this place not 100% full at 10:00 on a Saturday?The fried egg was perfectly runny and the bacon thick, and the slice of cheddar perfectly melted. This is all true, but the biscuit and chicken separately were exemplary.I haven't had a chicken sandwich with moist, tender chicken like this. The breading provided more than a hint, but not too much, in the way of cayenne (among other spices). It was also crunchy, which is good, because the biscuit is quite soft, actually. And had a strong buttermilk flavor.The sandwich as a whole is probably 4-5" tall, so you get your money's worth. And from what I can tell, several people ordered ahead for pickup.Fortunately you don't have to run a 10k to earn these sandwiches... just make a quick trek up to Wrigleyville.

There's a new food Nazi in town...Came in on a lazy Saturday at 3:30PM and wanted 2 Nashville Hot Chick meals. They said it will take 1 hour, is that okay? Coming all the way from Long Grove, I gave in and said ok. Then I said can ya make that 4 meals? The 4 dudes in the back jaws just dropped. So cashier asks tough lady cooking the chicken if that was possible. They whisp whisp whisp and the verdict back to me was you'll have to wait till 5:30! I said no way!!As I'm waiting for my 2 meals, I noticed other couples were there before me. Sad, they had that whupped look, sitting at the communal bench quietly waiting. 15 minutes later, they get called. That means they must have been there 25 or even 30 minutes for their 2 chicken sandwiches!My observations says these are the causes for the bottleneck -1) Only 3 fryers used for cooking chicken to order.2) More orders going out for delivery than serving dine in customers first.3) 4 staff packed like sardines working in the small open kitchen.4) Wasting time folding clunky cake boxes for chicken orders at cash register.5) Was not cooking chicken ahead of time to anticipate walk-ins.I guess Roost's chicken was good but so is Brown's Chicken at half the cost and afraction of the wait time.C'mon people, its just .69 cents a pound chicken, soaking in buttermilk salt & peppa, rolled in flour and cornstarch, then dropped in hot oil for 20 minutes. Try it at home and amaze yourself!

As a Southsider, I am forever skeptical of fried chicken places up north. Southern cuisine specialty eateries in general, for that matter....So I went into The Roost in Doubting Thomas Mode waiting to be let down like Imhotep was by the chick he brought back to life in The Mummy Returns.Oh, was I wrong!!!!I got half a chicken , chips, and mac & cheese. I peeped how they were seasoning the bird while I ordered so that was the start of me changing my mind. When my order was teady, I was greatly impressed by the flavors and the spices used. It was delicious. I hadn't eaten something like this since I went to a repast in Arkansas several years ago.I will go again after I have my physical check up.

First of all, this joint is small so we expect it to be busy and pack. You order in the counter and then grab a seat. We came here on a Saturday night and the place was full. But we did grab a seat. All the fried chicken will take about half an hour to fried and prepare. By the time we got our meals was 8:45pm already. I usually do not est so late but we did.The Mac and cheese was just average nothing amazing.We ordered 1/2 fried chicken and a chicken sandwich.The Nashville hot is too spicy that it kinda ruin the flavor of the chicken so I would recommend the spicy one instead. I expected fried chicken to be greasy but I didn't finish my second piece because I felt like heart burning cause it was hot.It is hole in the wall kind of place and it took us a whole to find a parking on the street because the side streets are permit only.Overall, we enjoy it but I don't think this will be my go to fried. Chicken place if I want something quick and fast.

Now that's some good fried chicken! My brother heard the praises of this place way up in Evanston. When we visited Chicago, this place topped our list of places to try. We were not disappointed. Fantastic chicken, tasty biscuit, spot on pickles. We've had hot chicken in famous Nashville spots - but this is the place I crave when I think of fried chicken.

Definitely my favorite place so far for fried chicken. This fried isn't your average fried chicken where pieces aren't just tossed in a deep fryer and come out bland. This chicken is tender where it comes right off the bone. But what really separates this fried chicken is the delicious choices for seasoning. There are three choices (graded upon spiciness). All levels are equally delicious. The sides are also fantastic. I usually end up getting the bread pudding as a side (YUM) and their biscuits (also YUM).  As for the restaurant itself expect a casual atmosphere perfect for a night out after work or catching up with an old friend.

A group of friends and I ordered from The Roost for delivery and I was not disappointed. I've had The Roost bookmarked for a while now, and am glad to have finally tried their delicious food.I ordered the Nashville hot chicken sandwich. SO good. I love burning my mouth off with hot sauce and this sandwich had great flavor and just the right amount of heat. I was hesitant to try it on a biscuit because I figured it wouldn't travel so well, and the kaiser roll is sturdier. I'll order extra pickles next time for sure.Now, the sides. The chips are freshly-made and have a great crunch. The mac and cheese....is why I'm subtracting a star to be honest. It wasn't spectacular, but not awful, just "meh". I can make better mac and cheese, let's be real.I did try a piece of biscuit from my boyfriend's meal (sharing is caring) and it was SO good. Next time I'll have a side of biscuit for sure.

Brought my daughter to Deluxe Tattoo and stopped in to eat with family. Got a to go order, drive all the way home, 30 plus miles south, and the half chicken I ordered was not in the bag. Called the place and got nowhere. The person I spoke to actually called back to say I wasn't at the W. Irving Park restaurant but the Milwaukee location. Really?????

Southern comfort food at its finest!I had been wanting to try this place for awhile now and decided today was the day.Ordered the spicy chicken on a buttermilk biscuit with pickles and the ranch as toppings. Chose the homemade chips and Mac & cheese as my sides! It was as great as I'd hoped it would be! The other sides looked just as good!Could have just had the sandwich and one side as I couldn't eat it all.Sweet tea was on par! So good.I will be back, for breakfast too!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago by far. Best Tapas choice by far. Great prices.First of all, I love the atmosphere. There are bar seats that you can pick up without a reservation but I do recommend that you make a reservation if you want to eat here.It's a great place to hang out with friends/have a reunion/get some light drinks and appetizers/date night with dim lighting/everything you would want.To get:- Paella (Chorizo one is my favorite)- Sangria (Mango and classic are great and not very strong but delicious)- Bacon wrapped dates (Perfect!)- Goat cheese and tomato dip- Mash potatoes and pork shoulder- Scallops- Brussels sprouts salad- Can't wait to try more!To eat for free:- I love their free bread in the beginning dipped with olive oil...maybe I was just hungry but I ate like 5 in a row.

I have been here several times and feel that I am qualified to write this review. The sangrias are great and strong so be careful not to keep knocking them back. Definitely order the patatas bravas as they are the most all-around-good menu item, enjoyed by everyone at the table. Everything else varies. I've had some good and not so good; although most of it seemed to be a difference in taste buds.I would also recommend the fried chicken with piri piri sauce. The service is good but last time I went it was incredibly slow. The waitress was just chatting on the side while I waited for my bill. It seemed almost impossible to get her attention.Anyway, they have an extensive menu with lots to choose from!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago; definitely the best Tapas. The food is excellent and service has always been consistent during my many visits. Getting a reservation on the weekend is often difficult, and the noise level can be a little out of hand at times but the food is definitely worth it.Recommendations: Sangria (the specials are often the best), Pintxos Platter (gives you a little taste of everything... definitely a good choice if you've never been), spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, **beef tenderloin and blue cheese, grilled squid with olive oil and garlic.

Came into Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! on a Sunday morning to sort of wind down a great long weekend in Chicago. This was on a long list of recommended brunch places our friends picked so we ended up choosing to come here and I'm very glad we did!We got a table for six pretty easily around noon on Sunday. The layout of the restaurant is pretty fun and there are pretty deliberately sectioned off parts of the restaurant. We were ushered to the back right of the establishment. Just glancing at the menu I knew this was probably going to be a great brunch. That, and the fact that there is an "!" in the name of the restaurant makes me expect big things.The menu was big. Like reallllly big. There were breakfast/brunch options on one side, and then more lunch/dinner options on the other. Lots of dishes to choose from. We split three pitchers of sangria between the six of us throughout the brunch and it was delicious. We got the regular house red and the white peach. They don't put way too much ice in their pitchers like you see at some places, for which everyone was thankful.As for the food, you'd think with a menu so big, everything might be one note and taste the same. That's definitely what I was expecting going into it. That was not the case AT ALL. We probably sampled 12-14 dishes between the six of us and each dish was unique and had its own flavor.Some standouts for me: The Pan Catalan, bacon mac and cheese, bacon wrapped dates, and the patatas bravas. All of these were incredibly tasty, and something I'd recommend you NEEDING to get while you're there. I thinkt the patatas bravas was my favorite. I've had them done a dozen different ways by different Spanish restaurants, but the sauce they put on them here really stuck out to me. It had a nice spicy kick but wasn't too much for people who aren't a huge fan of spice. Just really well done.The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the shrimp and grits and the paella. The shrimp and grits were a little bland and the paella I thought was just sort of "Meh." I'm not a huge paella fan so take that with a grain of salt.With all the dishes we had and the sangria, I'm pretty sure we all got out of there for less than $40 a person which was incredible considering we all had our fill of drink, and were stuffed to the brim with food. It's probably not the first place you think of when you hear "authentic Spanish cuisine" but it's pretty damn good. Only my second brunch in Chicago but I'd say if you're looking for some great food and sangria, this is your place.

Stepped in on a bright sunny Saturday afternoon for late lunch. Perhaps 2pm was nearing the end of lunch's busiest hours, but waiting for window seats was reasonably quick without needing to make reservations.As I'm a serious fan of bacon wrapped dates, my agenda going in was to order both their toxpintos chorizo medrool dates stuffed with cheese and a tapas order of bacon wrapped dates. Both were delicious and I would keep ordering them if my tight pants have enough give for them.Their banana caramelized dessert is also a solid winner. First bite was full of crunchy pistachio bits mixed with warm browned banana. Get it please.

Came as a group of 6 for brunch, ordered:*pitcher of sangria, and one virgin sangria*seafood paella*bacon wrapped dates*burrata with tomato sauce*seared scallops*short ribsEverything was good and especially liked the sangrias!  Love to come back again.

The first thing you will notice when you walk in, is the beautiful ambience. About2 tapas er Erson would be sufficient. Mind you, it takes 35-40 min for the paella so order in advance.We order the spicy potatoes, Moroccan lamb and the salmon. Everything was very good and exquisite!

Came here with a large group on Sunday night (made reservations on OpenTable beforehand), and I'm glad we made a reservation because this place was poppin. We decided to all get tapas and paella to share, which allowed us to try many different things. I would recommend getting a pitcher of their sangria (we got the classic red, but all of them looked great!).Here's all of the food we got to split between 4 people in order from best to worst:1. Chorizo-wrapped mejdool dates and cheese ($2/piece) - the BEST thing we ordered, you definitely need to get one per person because you won't want to share yours!2. Pork Paella ($12/per order, min. 2 orders) - yum yum yum so much PORK!3. Burrata with tomato marmalade ($11)4. Iberico chorizo with blistered shishito pepper ($2/piece)5. Grilled octopus with harissa ($12)6. Shrimp with garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes ($9)7. Rioja-braised shortrib ($12) - still very tasty, but didn't taste new or excitingOverall, the food was all good, not the best tapas I've ever had, but lots of great Spanish options and very delicious. The paella and the chorizo-wrapped dates are a MUST order.PRO TIP: If you check in on Yelp, you get a free dessert tapa! I really liked the marcona almond caramel bar.

Very crowded on a Saturday night, so be sure to make a reservation! We didn't mind sitting at the bar, and we enjoyed the fresh bread and red sangria.We weren't very hungry but needed to try some of these excellent dishes. We ordered the grilled octopus first- the best octopus I have had. The texture was so deliciously chewy, and the sauce flavorful and rich. Even the potatoes were excellent. We also ordered the cured salmon after seeing another party get it. It was like a Spanish version of lox, but tasty nonetheless.I would love to come back and try the other tapas on the menu. I also used my check in offer for the cherry streudel dessert- which was quite tasty too. I loved the tapas portions, good for people not too hungry but enough for the whole party to take a bite.

Food was mediocre and very bland. Last weekend, their special sangria was a Pear Sangria, but unfortunately, all I tasted was Peach Schnapps. Not good. I used to really like that place, but since my last visit that has changed. I don't think I will be returning.

We tried quite a few items from the menu and sadly nothing really stood out. Probably won't be back anytime soon.-Grilled squid (ok)-Spicy chili oil shrimp (meh just oily)-Seafood paella (way too salty and the seafood was over cooked)-Lamb loin (ok, not gamey)-Steak with chimichurri (just ok)- Goat cheese in tomato sauce (good)Bill with tax and tip for 3 ppl and two drinks was ~$145.

Great place for tapas and the prices are extremely affordable. The food is super tasty. I recommend the lamb and the short rib they both were super tender and cocked to perfection. The stuffed mushrooms with spinach and manchego are crispy and they melt in your mouth. I also recommend the goat cheese in tomato sauce creamy and very tasty. Overall, the food was excellent and the service was great. If you want to try an affordable tapas place come check this place

An awesome place for a date or for a big group outing. The menu has a lot to offer and there's always something new to try! The bacon wrapped dates are amazing. A few of my favorites are the spicy potatoes, scallop empanadas, calamari, ham croquettes, and buttermilk fried chicken. You really cannot go wrong here. The sangria is amazing too.

Came here on a Monday night and it was the best thing because of the $5 cocktails!! which we didn't know about before coming here (bonus :D). Everything on the menu is around $6-$8 and I recommend 2 dishes per person. We ordered spicy potatoes with tomato alioli, rioja-braised short rib, and galician empanada of bay scallops all were pretty amazing. The tab came to about $20 per person (super cheap for tapas) :)I would definitely come back and try everything if I can!!!

I've been to Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba a few times over the years, but it's fitting to review it now because it wasn't until recently that I noticed how sizable the space was. I've always sat towards the front of the restaurant and didn't pay that much attention...the tables are still small as heck though. Good thing that the servers are typically quick to pick up used plates because there's not a lot of room to place the various tapas that you will undoubtedly order.As for the tapas itself, I can't think of a single one I've tried thus far that I didn't either like or love. What falls into my love category?1. Baked goat cheese2. Pretty much anything with chorizo in it3. Last but certainly not least, the bacon wrapped dates. I don't even eat bacon, but I will if it's wrapped around those dates!I went for weekend brunch and you get to order from both the brunch menu and the regular one. Highly appreciated.Price is reasonable but keep in mind, because these are small plates, and depending on the size of your party, it may take you quite a few to get satiated. In other words, don't be surprised if your bill falls into the $30-40 range. The one cost-effective tip I'll give you: if you have a party of 2-3, split a sangria pitcher, instead of going glass by glass. I split a pitcher of red with another person and felt like I got a whole lot of sangria out of that thing...definitely my money's worth.Ba-ba-reeba is consistent and I've yet to have an awful experience. Great place to celebrate a birthday, introduce out of town friends/family to tapas, or have a date.

What a cute place! Ideal place for girls day/night out. I went for brunch but ended up ordering just the lunch menu items. I thought the menu was small for a tapas joint, maybe it wasn't the full menu.We ordered:Passion fruit sangria (Delicious, you can't taste the alcohol at all!)-Grilled Octopus (Octopus is not as soft as other tapas dishes I've had but the flavor of the grilled/charred octopus is pretty good)-Goat cheese dip (The bread it comes with was too hard but the dip is tasty. It's better with the bread that they give you at the beginning of your meal.)-Brussel spout salad (This was good but nothing special.)-Seafood paella (I asked our server to cook the paella a little longer and it was good.)Caramelized banana (I always order this dessert at tapas restaurants and like it every time.)Chocolate truffle cake (Not my favorite..)I would return to try other dishes, maybe for dinner to see the full menu. The paella was not on the menu I had so I'm assuming that there is a fuller menu. The dessert portions were small and presentation wasn't as good but it tasted good.When the paella came out, I asked the person who brought out the food not to mix the food yet so that I can take a photo. He waited for me to take a photo but said "I'm very busy". That wasn't nice...

A cute tapas restaurant located in Lincoln Park. Love the surrounding neighborhood.Tapas that I tried:-devil eggs (5/5): one of the best deviled eggs I've had; love the crispy ham on top!-chorizo with pepper: (3/5)-potato and onion omelette: (2/5)-spicy potatoes with tomato aioli: MUST ORDER loved this even though i don't like potatos (5/5)-wood oven veggies with pine nuts: (3/5)-bacon dates with apple and vinaigrette: (4/5) i've had better bacon wrapped dates-beef empanadas: GET THIS! love how puffy the pastry was and how decadent the beef filling was (5/5)Order the deviled eggs, spicy potatoes, and beef empanada.And of course, try one of their sangrias!I ordered a pitcher of the classic red sangria, and it was a bit too much for 2 people. But the sangria was strong and good.

Tasty and large selection of tapas with a nice atmosphere. However the tapas aren't particularly original and the sangria is lacking. Wish theyd hone the menu down a little and focus on what they do best. The service is slow and they can get very very busy, but the ambiance is fun. We enjoy it but more for the vibe than the food.

Heard a lot of hype from Café Ba-Ba-Ree-ba but never really had an occasion to go here until yesterday, and was very pleasantly surprised after the experience. Not only because of the flavors and presentation of the food, but also because we surprisingly didn't break the budget doing it, spending around $20 per person(I was fully expecting to spend twice as much). First thing to note is that this place is gigantic. It has like 5 different rooms, two semi-floors, walls of bread and bundles of ham swinging from the ceiling. They really do try to capture the dim but bustling atmosphere of a restaurant in Barcelona, and in my opinion they do so fairly successfully. Ordered 7 tapas between 3 people, including the warm potato and onion omelette, spicy potatoes with tomato aioli, beef empanada, chicken and ham croquetas, buttermilk-fried chicken thighs, seared Spanish sausages, and skewered chicken + chorizo sausage. All the dishes were good, though my personal favorites were the potato dishes, the croquets, and the skewered Spanish sausages. The beef empanada was also good though for a single $6 empanada I would probably wait for happy hour. Speaking of which, they have a solid happy hour here, where their dishes are priced as they were when they first opened 30 years ago, meaning you essentially get 50% off a lot of their favorites(patatas bravas, empanadas, roast dates, chicken & ham croquetas, pintxos, etc.) along with $16 pitchers of Sangria. It's every day from 4pm-6pm, along with Friday sand Saturdays from 10pm-midnight as well, and you can definitely get full off of $10-15 or so if you come by around this time.All in all tapas are never cheap, though with the right orders, along with plenty of complimentary bread and olive oil, you can actually get fairly full without breaking the bank. We averaged around $12/person on just food, and with drinks it just brought it a little higher, which is not bad at all. Also, they knew it was our first time there, so they even brought us out a trio of desserts, on the house, which was a great way to end the meal and start off the night. For that and their happy hour, they are definitely warrant another half star(4.5/5)

Very underwhelming for all the reviews we saw. My boyfriend and I ordered grilled squid  (way too salty), beef tenderloin with blue cheese (beef was dried and tough), Brussel sprouts salad (too much cheese, made the dressing too creamy and the beef empanada, which was delightful. The desserts were below par as well. We ordered caramelized banana and the flan, it just didn't have a lot originality.  The good part was that we got the desserts for free as a part of checking in via yelp. Overall, not very good food and was a disappointment given all the rave reviews.  Maybe we just ordered the wrong things?

This place is amazing! it is huge and has tons of space to accommodate a large group or if you're looking for a table for 2.  I've only been here for brunch, never another meal.  If their dinners are anything remotely close to brunch, you're in luck.  The food is always on point and you cannot go wrong with the make your own Bloody Mary Bar.  Seriously, do it! Its Awesome! Try all the food as its great and if you go with friends and share plates, it won't hit you in the wallet too much either.  Enjoy!
Very lovely cafe with amazing Spanish tapas! I especially love the yogurt served here. It is different from normal yogurt and more like cream and not too sweet.

Great ambiance/atmosphere and the service was impeccable! I especially appreciated how attentive the staff were, immediately removing plates when we were finished. Our waitress was incredibly helpful with offering up suggestions and explaining the tapas concept. Bread was given to us upon arrival and I don't know anyone who doesn't love a little freebie to begin a meal! The food came out rather quickly despite the large crowd on a Friday night. We ordered several small plates of food and two of our favorites were the short rib and the beef empanada. It was a bit expensive but a nice little treat!

I've never been to a tapas/small plates restaurant before (gasp!), and this was definitely the place I wanted to give my tapas virginity to.I came on a Tuesday with some friends, so getting in wasn't an issue. We split a pitcher of sangria which was amazing. I easily could've drank an entire pitcher by myself (one woman did. She was throwing up in the bathroom. Happens to the best of us). I would recommend the berry.We got a variety of different plates-some of my favorites were the Brussels sprout salad, chicken with peri peri sauce and steak with mashed potatoes. My favorite was hands down the burrata: the bread was crispy and light, the spread, which was sweeter than I anticipated, complemented the fresh mozzarella perfectly. Its like biting into a little cheesy piece of Heaven. The chorizo dates, which are $2 for one, are worth a try as well. They were warm and amazing and I probably could've eaten 5 more.I got the butterscotch dessert tapa, and it was rich and perfect. I tried the dessert ones my friends ordered and we passed around, and we all agreed the butterscotch was best.I know there are a million more tapas restaurants to try, but I will definitely be back here soon!

Love this place.  They always have great food, and the prices are super reasonable.  Their brunch tapas are also very good, but their traditional Spanish tapas are still the best.  Also have great Sangria and wine.Also have done private events here, and the prices were more reasonable than most other places.

This is a really fun place for brunch just because there are so many tapas options that you can go with! At the same time, the menu can be quite overwhelming, again because of the number of options. My favorites were the citrus french toast, the short rib sliders, the serrano ham eggs benedicts, and the spinach and artichoke crepe. We got a ton of other tapas which were also fantastic but these were probably the ones I would definitely order again. A few of us also split a pitcher of the pear sangria which was a sweet sangria but it didn't really taste very much like pear unfortunately.The best part is you get a free dessert tapas with each person who checks in on yelp! We ended up with a couple of desserts from the check ins including the caramelized banana, natilla flan (which has a really great saffron flavor), the almond caramel bar and the chocolate truffle cake. All were really yummy!As usual with tapas, keep track of how much you're ordering because it can easily get out of hand with the amount and dollar signs!

Went out to dine in tonight. Haven't been back in two years and it was way below par.The lamb was overlooked, veggies burned, octopus was tough. Sangrias are watered down and with a ton of ice. $85 bill for four small plates and a pitcher of sangria was not worth it. There are much better, authentic tapas restaurants in Chicago. This place sucks.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I love it so much I went for my birthday this year. We actually just got back from Spain and the food here was just as good. I also love the amount of vegetarian options. Highly recommend:Red house sangria (obviously!)Tortilla EspanolaPatatas BravasBurrata with Bread and Tomato MarmaladeFried green peppers with course black saltThe two times I went the service was excellent and the food even better. Highly recommend!!

I went with a friend to this place on a busy Friday night and found two seats at the bar. We started with their half bottle red wine blend with Syrah and Cabernet, which had a dry, almost pepper like aftertaste. Very nice! The tapas we had were:Bacon dates (I want these at my wedding)Goat cheese in tomato sauceBurrata with tomato marmaladeShort rib with manchego mashed potatoesGrilled PorkFried chicken thighsAll were quite delicious! Be aware that the portion sizes are not typical for a tapas restaurant. They are quite generous and each plate is good for two people.I'm giving 4 stars because the service was so so. Our desert (espresso ice cream) took over 20 minutes to get to us and we had to wait over 20 minutes to get our check. No apology from our server, either. I would come back again though for those bacon dates. Those were incredible!

Where do I even begin?  Everyone always asks me what my favorite restaurant is in the city, and almost always I say, "I don't know, I have so many!", but now I can give a definitive answer and tell the whole world that Café Ba-ba-reeba is one of my all-time favorites.  This restaurant totally hits it out the ballpark, and I would reccomend it to anyone and everyone.  Café Ba-ba-reeba is equivalent to the eight wonder of the world - can you tell that I love it here?Like I said - where do I begin?  I suppose I can just start off by listing all the tapas thar we ordered, so here we go:1. Potatoes and aioli2. Spicy meatballs in sherry sauce3. Beef empanada4. Ham and chicken croquetas5. Melted goat cheese in tomato sauce6. Octopus with smoked potatoesAlthough I could just lean back, relax and tell you that each of these were phenomenal, let me just give you a brief description of each tapa we ordered. The potatoes and aioli are simple, but amazing; the aioli is finger-lickin good (quite literally).  The meatballs are juicy, and the sauce they are in is wonderfully flavorful.  The beef empanada was like a meat filled croissant - it was awesome.  The croquetas were amazing - that's all.  The melted goat cheese in tomato sauce came with garlic bread and the flavor mixed perfectly together - this was one of the best deals as well.  And finally, the octopus tasted like they fetched it straight from the sea; it had all the salinity your heart could desire, not to mention it was chewy but tender in the most perfect way.  Biased as I may sound, all of these tapas are a "must-get".  Yes, there's so many others to choose from but these were freaking amazing.But hey, guess what?  The empanada, meatballs, croquetas and potatoes are all $3 or less during happy hour which is 4pm-6pm, Monday-Friday.  That way you can try more of their tapas for a little less money.  You can only take advantage of these happy hour deals if you sit in the bar area, but why not?  You still get the same great atmosphere and service when sitting in the bar so take advantage why don't ya?Now, I'm not done - oh no, not even close.  My fiancé and I got the seafood paella after all those tapas.  I had high expectations for the paella since my fiancé has said it's the best he's had, and I was anything but disappointed.  The paella exceeded my expectations, and I can say it is now my favorite paella as well.  The saffron is very distinct, but not overwheleming, and the seafood was cooked perfectly.  I had some left-over and it still tasted just as good the following day.  That's impressive.  I don't usually have a burning desire to go back to the same restaurant twice, but I'd go here 10x over to indulge in this paella.And after the paella, we had dessert - not one, but four to be precise (we pigged out just a little).  We had the black raspberry sorbet, caramelized bananas, natilla flan and the butterscotch mousse.  Don't even ask what my favorite one was there - they satisfied the sweet tooth like no other dessert ever has.  I'd say that you definitely should try the butterscotch mousse and the caramelized bananas...if you really have to choose.  Each dessert is only $3 and they're small so you should choose to get more than just one.And finally (as if that wasn't enough, right?)
