We got a pitcher of sangria that lasted throughout the entire course of our meal.  That pitcher is huge, and it's not filled to the brim with ice so you truly are getting a whole lotta sangria.  We got the red sangria which is only $17 for a pitcher during happy hour - hell yeah!  The sangria was awesome, maybe a little too awesome since I walked outta that place a little tipsy.  We also got some Spanish beer that was on draft and it was also very good...and yes, I was double-fisting it for a bit there.The atmosphere and the service made this dining experience even better.  The waiters and bussers were extremely attentive and always came through picking up our dirty plates.  We definitely didn't feel ignored, even though we weren't sitting in the main dining area.  In fact, it was kind of nice because it felt like private dining be for all the dinner crowd came.Ultimately, we left in some pain because of all that we ate, but can say that we came, we saw and we conquered.

I've been coming here for over 10 years now, even through different ownership, this place has been able to withstand the test of time. The ambiance is cozy, comfortable and chatty - a great place to go on a date or simply to grab a bite with friends. After coming here for so many years there's a standard list of things I always order: Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli, Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce,  Roast Dates with Bacon & Apple Vinaigrette, and Chicken & Ham Croquetas. The rest are always fun to try!P.S. If this place could bring back the creme brulee from years ago that'd be great.

Lived in Chicago for 3 years and already been here at least 15 times. It's incredible! Fun atmosphere, great for dates or big groups (went for a bachelorette party and they easily accommodated 15 people at one table). The tapas are amazing and inexpensive ($5-10 on average per tapa, plan to get about 2 per person, served family style), cheaper during happy hour at the bar.Must try the sangria (pitchers around $20 easily serve 4-6 people), patatas bravas, bacon wrapped dates, and empanadas. Brunch is also delicious.

I came here with 2 friends who love this place and come often. We made reservations ahead of time and were seated immediately. It was a Wed night at 730pm. They were pretty busy but seemed to have some free tables.Drink. We started with white wine sangria.4/5.  Yum! Lots or oranges and lemons with the rinds so don't expect to really eat any of the fruit though.Food. We got the appetizers sampler. 4/5. The deviled egg was surprisingly good and the bruschetta with Apple and sausage was decent.Seafood paella. 5/5 A must have! Save room for this and don't order too many tapas! It's one of the best paellas I've ever had with lots of seafood and yummy crispy rice. They serve it to you straight from the skillet.Sausage tapas. Okay. 3/5. Maybe not a fan of sausage but it wasn't anything special.Bacon wrapped dates. 4/5. Very good. I was already expecting it to be quite amazing, given the Yelp reviews. Not disappointed. I would order again. There are about 6-7 to an order.Dessert. 3/5. I ordered the caramelized bananas tapa. It was a nice small size - good for one person who just wants to finish off the meal with something sweet. However, it's pretty ordinary. The banana could have been warmer too. I would probably try a different dessert next time.Overall, great service and food. I would go back if I'm in the Chicago area.

Not sure why this place has 4 stars. It's such a mediocre place. It was my second time and last time here. The sangria's here are weak and the food is soooo bland. Nothing special about it. I don't recommend it.

This place has grown on me each time I seem to come back. The food has always been good here and I've always enjoyed their paella and sangria options, but note that you can easily surpass $30/person price point making it a $$$ experience rather than $$ as listed.On our last visit here, we did the rioja-braised short rib, summer melon salad, buttermilk fried chicken with piri piri sauce, seared Spanish sausages, grilled octopus with potatoes and olives, & porky paella (pork shoulder pork belly, chorizo, & chicharrones). Overall a solid meal. If there were items I could live without, it would be the seared sausages and the buttermilk fried chicken. Sausages were good but nothing that really stood out for me and the buttermilk fried chicken was tasty but kind of out of place in my opinion for a Spanish tapas bar. My favorite was probably the braised short rib due to how tender and flavorful the meat was. The melon salad I really enjoyed the serranos and the smoked vinaigrette they used. The grilled octopus was good, but some of the pieces of octopus were had a bit too much char in my opinion. And lastly, for the pork paella... be ready for a mouthful of pork flavors and textures. Really good, but after a few bites I was definitely overwhelmed and needed to balance it out with other bites from the other dishes. On a final note, their classic sangria is my go to and goes great with any of the food here.'Til next time, cheers!

Food is really good.  All small portions except the paella its huge and very authentic.The variety of vodka sangria pitchers is delicious. The plates are tiny but food is very filling.make a reservation ahead of time.  Decor is good. Music is loud and enclosed patio get hot in the winter with heaters shooting vapor at you.Food comes out pretty quick.
Love this place! Their seafood paella is amazingggg!!! I usually go just for that! Of course I've tried plenty of things on the menu and everything is delicious!

Don't forget to check in on your Yelp app to receive a free dessert! :) you're welcome!The vibe here is very chill, I love it. It's a great place to work (there's free wifi) when they're less busy but when it's packed, it gets very loud and the wait can be very long! As per usual at a tapas bar, the portions are pretty small here and it can be very easy to rack up a big bill, so don't come in too hungry if you're not prepared to pay with your wallet!Rioja-Braised Short Rib - fell right off when I cut it, very tender and flavorfulShrimp with garlic, olive oil - this was a little too much for me, the shrimp were practically drowned in olive oil, taking away from my appreciation of the shrimp itself!Chocolate cake - delicious!I would like to come back and try their paella! Next time I'm ordering the sangria as well!

We had some friends visiting from New York City, so naturally we had to choose a place that would impress.... And Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba was it. Brunch is fantastic, but I LOVE their dinners. Truly one of my favorite restaurants in the city.I like the way they designed their menus with favorite items and/or chef recommendations highlighted in red. Because they do change the menu pretty frequently, it's nice to automatically know some of the newbies you should try.Some things you should absolutely order:-a pitcher of sangria. We shared it among 4 people and we each got two full glasses and then some. The pitcher costs $26, while a single glass costs $7. Huge savings, and well worth sharing among a small crowd.-on the pinxtos menu, the date stuffed with cheese wrapped with chorizo is to die for. Embarrassingly enough, I always order 2-3 just for myself. They have something similar on the full size menu, but it's not identical, and these are sooooo fantastic that I don't even chance it. Get more than one. It's all of the flavors you would never expect to work that just do.-spicy potatoes. They aren't over powering, and contain just the right amount of kick... And that chipotle mayo sauce is delicious!-beef tenderloin with blue cheese = perfection. It's cooked medium rare and has a slightly salty taste from the cheese. Mmm, mmm, good!-goat cheese with tomato sauce. It's super creamy and warm, and when placed on top of the garlic bread, it melts.Some other menu items we thought were tasty (though not at the same 5+ star level as the above list):-ham and cheese croquettes. They came four to an order and were jam packed with flavor. Although they look like mozzarella sticks, the cheese isn't melty, it's more cream-based.-hanger steak. It was cooked medium rare and came with roasted potatoes and harissa sauce (which we all thought was similar to sofrito, but I'm not sure if it was the color or the flavor that led us to believe that!).-octopus! It was many of our first times trying octopus, but it exceeded our expectations. Ever so slightly chewy, but great pop of flavor.Tips:-Check-in on Yelp and you get a free dessert. Surprisingly, because we all checked in, they let us all get a free dessert. It was NOT one per table. We tried four different ones and passed them around the table in true tapas fashion. They were about 5 bites a piece and hit the spot! My personal favorite was the rich chocolate cake!

Tapas. So many options. So much sangria. Very authentic. Waitstaff sometimes forgets about you. Plan to be patient and keep eating and drinking. Worth it.Recommended: garlic potato salad, goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, grilled octopus and shrimp with garlic.

I've been here a few times and usually leave pretty satisfied.  The atmosphere is very fun and is great for groups.  Last time I tried the cava sangria, which I found to be very tasty.  The tapas are pretty good, but definitely not the best I've had.  The service is always friendly, which makes for a nice experience.

Good food but a bit pricey for my taste. I very much enjoyed the ambience. Nice music, and rustic decor. I ordered the pintxos platter, shrimp with garlic, buttermilk-fried chicken thighs, and seared sea scallop. All of it was good, but the best thing I tasted was the buttermilk-fried chicken thighs. BEST FRIED CHICKEN I HAVE EVER TRIED.

I wasn't expecting much of this place, but Café Ba-Ba Reeba knocked me off my feet! Out of all the restaurants we ate at during our 4 days in Chicago, this restaurant came out in 2nd place!Our party of 4 arrived 5 minutes after the restaurant opened. We were seated towards on the left which looked almost like a covered patio. Beautiful brick walls with red chairs to accent. Our server was great in assisting us. After a few recommendations and selecting what we thought sounded good...Full sized breakfast paella, patatas bravas, eggs benedict, nutella banana waffles, hash, flan, and a slice of chocolate cake (free dessert with Yelp check-in). You really can't go wrong ordering anything off the menu!Great service, excellent food, nice atmosphere.

Food is great, especially pork paella!My tips for you is: Order paella (min. 2 orders, choose from chicken, pork or seafood; you can mix n match) before you even sit down, cause the wait was 40 mins!Chorizo wrapped date is good, worth trying, one per person will be good enough cause it's a bit on the sweet side.Grilled octopus .. Hmmm, I saw lots of compliments here so I ordered it. But mine was over-cooked, and tasted blend. I don't recommend it.Red Sangria is a must!

I've been here several times and it never disappoints. A few must-have menu items:Dinner Menu:-patatas bravas (the aioli has a little kick and is delicious!)-bacon-wrapped dates (no explanation needed)-goat cheese baked in tomato sauce-fried green peppers (trust me on this)-shrimp-scallops-white peach sangriaBrunch menu:Pintxos:-short stack of pancakes (the cutest, tastiest stack you'll ever eat)-waffle-battered chicken stickI don't recall my other brunch selections, and I'm sad to say I've never had any of the paella selections, but that's definitely on my list. Make a reservation, they're always busy--and for good reason!

My friend who lives in Chicago loves this place, mainly because it's still stylish and cute inside but it's not in the all time busy downtown area (about 10-15 min drive from there). Located in Lincoln Park community, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba! was super busy on a Friday evening, with different ages crowd. The wait for a table was 1.5 hours, but luckily you can order off the main menu at the bar as well. We were there around 8 pm and were barely able to snag the last 2 seats at the bar. This place offers a variety of Spanish tapas. If you order a paella, make sure you specify for how many people. It was two of us and they must have assumed we ordered paella for two and boy was it A LOT of it! My favorite part of the evening was the passion fruit sangria - it was DELISH! Very easy to drink too hahahaThe cafe offers valet parking, as well as plenty of Ubers driving around.I would go back!

It brought be back in Spain.We were just in the area and was looking for a place to eat before we head to our summer event that evening.I checked my yelp and boom - found this place.My cousin and I wanted to try all of it. We ordered at least one or more in every section of veggies, seafood, beef.. I enjoyed the salad and the grilled quid with asparagus. We also had the tuna with melon slices (that was different) but good.Everything was delicious except the calamari - I've had better.The different flavors of Sangria was just a treat! We had a pitcher of mango.The server's knowledge and atmosphere was a great addition to the experience.

Definitely come here. Very authentic Spanish food. I felt like I was back in Barcelona. The sangria is a must. Strong, flavorful, fruity. We ordered the originally and I'd recommend it!Food we ordered:Potatoes bravas: too spicy for our liking. Actually I couldn't even eat it it was so spicy. We told our waiter and he took it off the bill which was very nice of him.Chorizo wrapped dates: good but you can go withoutStuffed mushrooms: must!! Best stuffed mushrooms I've had. Amazing crisp on top and juicy inside.Brussels sprouts salad. loved this salad. Great flavor. Crunchy and fresh.Don't forget check in on Yelp for free dessert

Tapas galore!!! I love the food here. A fave is the deviled egg...yum. It's got so many dishes and they are incredibly tasty. Tapas are always good when you want to try different types of dishes.It's a huge, busy, loud space that's dimly lit for the most part. Prices are decent and the cocktails are good!Make reservations ahead of time!

Food: truly delicious, I don't even care if it's not authentic. It's good.Service: very very good.Price: pretty reasonable. Good food, the good service, and the upscale neighborhoodFun place to go. Loud and social Thurs-Sat nights. Definitely good for a date night!

Great experience. I was celebrating my birthday & had a great time.We made a reservation at 11am for Sunday Brunch. Once we arrived we were right away seated in a packed restaurant. The ambience was perfect!It was our first time going to Cafe Baba-Re-Ba. The waiter explained the menu and our food came out really fast.We ordered:-Waffle-battered chicken sticks - (do not recommend. It was like a corn dog)-Mac N' Cheese - (AMAZING)-Buttermilk Waffle with marcona almond nutella and bananas - (Pretty dry & not sure if that was nutella)-Spicy Potatoes with Tomato Alioli - (AMAZING)-Goat Cheese Baked in Tomato Sauce - (AMAZING)-Shrimp With garlic, olive oil, red pepper flakes - (Really good)-Beef Skewer Horseradish Cream & Red Onions - (Really good)-Chicken Skewer - (The chicken was kind of dry)Asides from the waffle battered chicken sticks & waffles, I definitely want to come back for the spicy potatoes & goat cheese.

Loved Cafe Ba ba reeba so much I returned the same day during Happy Hour with 3 of my girlfriends. The beef empanadas are a MUST try and $16 for a pitcher of Sangria is just too good to skip. I will surely be back.PS - I wish they offer authentic Valencia Horchata ;)

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is a tapas restaurant in LP. I came here once for Sunday brunch, and continue to come back. Its a place where food is meant to be shared and they accommodate large parties exceptionally well. I celebrated a birthday here last week, and CBBR accommodated our party of 8 and didn't hesitate to split the check 8 ways. My only complaint is that if you order pitchers of sangria, they don't replenish water. My friend and I had to ask for a water refill.I like how they space out the tapas, and their initial recommendation to order 1-2 tapas per person. This provided enough food for everyone to share.At my most recent dinner experience, we ordered the following:chorizo-wrapped medjool dates and cheese-a popular tapa that reminded me of Avec's prosciutto-wrapped dates.spicy potatoes with tomato aioli-one of my favorite tapas here and at Mercat a la Planxa. I prefer M a la P's patatas bravas over the spicy potatoes at CBBR, but for the price point, CBBR hits the spot.grilled octopus-this was one of my favorites tapas at CBBR and I would order this again. Don't be afraid to try octopus. It's not fishy tasting at all!scallop empanada-flaky crust, generous scallop filling.buttermilk-fried chicken thighs-Mmm. Not what you'd expect if you're a Nando's fan. This is a marriage of fried chicken doused in peri peri sauce.grilled hanger steak-sliced for sharing, moist and succulent meat.seafood paella with squid and squid ink-Our entire party's favorite dish, this is a special that should be made into a regular offering. Instead of rice, this dish contained vermicelli noodles, with a generous seafood portion. Highly recommend ordering this before its no longer offered!

I see why this restaurant has such a long and rich history in Chicago, because it is truly outstanding. My friend and I came for brunch recently, and really loved our experience here. Making reservations was easy since they are on Open Table, and I was able to snag us a table the day before our Saturday brunch. During brunch you have the options of choosing between the brunch items, or the dinner items on the other side of the menu. The fact that there are so many options is dangerous, because everything sounds delicious. I decided to focus on items from the brunch menu, because I know I'll come another time to try the dinner items.Our waitress was very attentive and answered our questions about the menu well. My friend and I both didn't order any cocktails, since we both were more in need of caffeine, but I hear their sangria is amazing.  To eat I ordered the citrus french toast  stick, deviled egg, and baked eggs.Citrus french toast stick: It had a light citrus taste, and the flavor was not overpowering . The outer texture was crispy, and the inner part was soft. I almost wish I had ordered two instead of one, because it was my second favorite item from my visit.Deviled egg: It was good and had a little bit of a kick to it.Baked Eggs: I am head over hills and in love with their baked eggs. The eggs are covered in cheese,  a tangy sauce and are  perfectly baked.  The tomato bread is seriously some of the best bread I've ever had, and it paired perfectly with the baked eggs. If you enjoy eggs, tomatoes, and cheese, then this dish is for you.The price point is excellent for the quality of the food here. My whole bill before tip was a little over $12, which wasn't bad at all.

Pros: very reasonably priced tapas, great choices, great sangria, very large space and great atmosphere.Cons: it's a popular spot so the wait time can be over an hour during busy periods. However, there's a bar you can grab a drink at while waiting.

Sorry Chicago-ans.. if this is your version of a top tapas restaurant... I'm not sure what else there is to say.If Ba-Ba-Reeba were located in a small town, I'd rate it higher (3 stars)... but it's located in one of the largest cities in the US, so the quality, flavor and freshness should be compared with places like Boqueria (Flatiron) and Olea (Ft. Greene) in NYC. Or even Spain? I've only lived in Andalucia (Southern Spain) and I think the comparison is similar to Chinese food in the US (babareeba) vs. Chinese food in China...The Bloody Mary bar should be avoided at all costs. Even their "spicy" mix is just a tad spicy at best. Plus, the choices are overwhelming... your drink will just taste like tomato juice with random spices in it.The food was just off. I felt like I was at a commercialized chain restaurant eating processed food (The Cheesecake Factory was the first place that came to mind).1) Patatas Bravas: They put a coating on the patatas (paprika?), which make them taste funky. I appreciate that they don't want to serve up traditional patatas, but this iteration tasted starchy, processed and strange.2) Brussel sprout salad: This was admittedly the best dish from what I tried. However, the ratio of cheese and dressing to sprouts was off... So I felt inundated with the fixings, I could barely taste the sprouts.3) Octopus: Check out my picture, does that look appetizing? It was overly oily and rubbery. My cousin had never tried octopus and I convinced him (Since I savor the octopus at Taverna Kyclades in Astoria, Queens and even Boqueria). Our server said "it's everyone's favorite..." (This dish reaffirmed why I left Chicago after living there for 3 years).4) NOW for the worst part of the meal... DESSERT. I received a free dessert through Yelp and our server recommended the marcona-almond caramel bar. It's basically a glorified snickers bar, but worse... So we looked on Yelp and saw that folks reallllly liked the butterscotch custard. So for sh*ts and giggles we ordered that too... #fail. It tasted like overly sweetened condensed milk with flavoring.Silver lining? I got to hang with my cousin, who I haven't seen in a few years... so I did enjoy the company, thus the 2 star rating.

What a fantastic tapas place in Chicago.The restaurant space is huge and there is a wide variety of seating options, ranging from big group tables illuminated by skylights in the front to the dimmer, date-night candlelit areas further back.  Our server was extremely friendly and helpful; no complaints whatsoever.Since it was our first time here, we decided to go with the more popular items, which were helpfully highlighted in red on the menu.  We ended up ordering at least one thing from every category, and they were all delicious.  Thankfully, the food also came with enough time in between each dish to enjoy each one properly.Burrata (vegetables & cheese): very creamy cheese which contrasted nicely with the fresh sweetness of the roasted corn, tomatoes, and other vegetables.Rioja-braised shortrib w/ mashed potatoes and vegetables (beef & lamb): the shortrib was tender and flavorful, and mashed potatoes were satisfying (as they always are).  However, the vegetables were somewhat overcooked and a bit soggy due to the red wine sauce.Seared sea scallops (seafood): normally I'm not a big fan of scallops due to their somewhat fatty taste, but the citrus and the leeks helped to balance out the flavor and provide a nice bite.  Not quite sure it's worth $13 though.But the highlight of the meal came in the form of the bacon wrapped dates (under the label chicken & pork, for some reason).  Oh my gosh, they were so good!  Sweet, salty, and rich, hitting all the reward systems that are a part of human taste.  No regrets.Total cost: $42 w/out tax or tip.  This was enough food for two people, so I ended up paying around $26-27.  Not very cheap, but given this is a popular restaurant in the middle of Chicago, it's to be expected.I would definitely recommend coming here for a delicious experience.
Great tapas place!

I'm surprised I've never reviewed CBBR before because I'm such a big fan of it! The numerous options are great for foodies and trying things with friends. There are plenty of options for picky eaters as well, if you've got someone with vegetarian/GF type restrictions or who is just plain picky. They do a great job of accommodating large groups as well so if you plan a group outing here it is easily doable!

Yum, love this place. The best Spanish food on the northern side of Chicago (the best on the southern side is Mercat a la Planxa oh yeah oh yeah). It's a great place to come with friends and the food is super solid. You'll have a great time - definitely recommended.

An excellent place to take visitors for a fun time, good buzz, and full stomach - all without breaking the bank!First of all, sign up for their texting service- about once a month, Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba issues a special free food item. You can log on to their website and sign up directly there (right panel).Secondly, there's almost always a Yelp checkin special - also for free food. There used to be a foursquare one, but foursquare..is no more.Third, if you're going during a popular time..PUT IN A RESERVATION. You and your guests will thank you.Now...before you order any food. Get some sangria in ya! It's tapas for goodness sakes! They normally have a seasonal, but I love sticking to the traditional red - Not overwhelmingly sweet and shared among a few friends, a decent value.I've been here more times than I can count. Without writing an essay for you, my recommendations:- brussel sprouts salad, marcona almonds, manchego cheese ($6)- spicy potatoes with tomato alioli (patata bravas) ($6)- rioja-braised short rib, manchego mashed potatoes, roasted seasonal vegetables & rioja wine glaze ($12)- grilled hanger steak with charred green chili chimichurri & fingerling potatoes ($10)- grilled octopus with green harissa, smoked potatoes & olives ($12)- buttermillk-fried chicken thighs, piri-piri sauce & shaved vegetable salad ($7)Now keep in mind, these are tapas so the portions are far from big. Normally when I go with a big group I get a few servings of the Paella to make sure we're all full. I normally go with the seafood paella with shrimp, monkfish, clams & green beans ($17 per serving)PS: They also have a happy hour. Last I checked, it was $16 pitchers of sangria, and select tapas at 1985 prices. M-F 4-6. Go get'em.

This place is perfect for dinner out with friends. I have been here for birthdays, work, family, and girls night out dinners. Always a hit.First off the ambiance is great. It's trendy and a lively, maybe a little too loud for grandma. You can get dressed up or show up in jeans and a comfy old T-shirt and fit in just fine.The menu is small plates and is best shared.  The staff is great at making suggestions both about specific dishes and the number you need for the size of your group.Definitely get the bacon-wrapped dates. Huge hit, even for people who aren't sure they like dates. The paella is good for groups but I'd skip it if it's just two people because there are other things I like more. Obviously get a pitcher of sangria.This place is popular so definitely make a reservation. I have come here without one and sat at the bar, but I called ahead of time.

Wow.  Just.  Wow.I've been coming here for years and every time the menu changes it just keeps getting better and better - not many restaurants can say this.I'll admit - the only thing on the menu that I'm not a huge fan of is the paella but it's still good!  The sangria is the absolute best in Chicago.  The patatas bravas are just heavenly.   Everything from the goat cheese to the bacon wrapped dates are always made fresh and taste amazing every time I come here!     Great vegetarian options as well.   The servers are always very professional and attentive - and personable!This place has a very unique vibe and they do it well.   Always packed, but this only adds to the very cool atmosphere here.  Make reservations in advance, though!  The music is very cool and the area is very beautiful.I bring friends here all the time and they become obsessed with this place.  The day this places closes will be a very sad day indeed for Chicago.

BRUNCH! I have been here for both brunch and dinner and both experiences were great.Brunch is one of the best in the city. There are so many breakfast tapas to choose from, as well as the regular menu too.They have a make your own Bloody Mary bar, which is a meal within itself. They will bring you a glass of your preferred vodka and you go up to the bar and can make it however you like. There is bacon, shrimp, olives, etc.They also make dank sangria.The tapas are also exquisite. I would highly recommend the spinach & manchengo stuffed mushrooms and the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce. For brunch, the deviled egg and potato & egg bite are AMAZING!The tapas are not as small as one would think, so I definitely had a lot to bring home. Also, can be pricey!

sausage fried paella with eggiberico ham hashbuttermilk waffle with berriespatatas bravasbacon wrapped dateschorizo stuffed datesred sangriatried and true spotfrom those college days.tapas style dishes.great place to dine with a groupand taste a bunch of dishes.

came here for a Monday dinner with my boyfriend,  he'd been here before but I had never been. We ordered plenty of tapas and all were delicious!I really want to thank our two servers for the night Eduardo and katlyn (sorry if I misspelled your names). My boyfriend and I had no clue who was training, I had even suggested maybe they always have two servers. They both were very helpful and everything they recommended I loved ( keep in mind I'm not the most picky person but still).My boyfriend and I were really impressed with the service, as well as them letting us know about the specials on Mondays! 1/2 off cocktails! There's really no words to describe how great they made our night that night ! Thank you again, keep up the great work! :)
Food are tasty but a bit oily. We got octopus, calamari, bacon and dates, steak, spicy potato. Dimly lit nice interior.

Reservation for Monday were easy for 6 people. They sat us right away even though the entire party wasn't present.They had half-off cocktail specials (the Barca Blues was my favorite). This was my 1st visit but I have tried their food before as my office catered from here for special events. The food was all pretty good.We had the...- Serrano wrapped date from the pinxtos menu- batatas bravas (can't go wrong)- the super tender short rib- octopus (Mmm), and- the ever indulgent garlicky shrimp.- the only dish that was sub par was the pork shoulder with apples and chestnuts...it was an odd flavor compared to the rest of the dishes.- For dessert, we girls shared a salted caramel butterscotch custard and the glazed bananas.The service was attentive and aimed to please. Overall, this is a great place for pretty much any occasion or non-occasion. I can see how this place can get busy. The space is big with nice décor and great food and service.

Amazing food, great service and really cool atmosphere. The goat cheese & garlic bread, grilled hanger steak, pork paella (2 servings for 4 people was plenty), and the calamari were all AMAZING. Oh and they make a really tasty gin & tonic (THE Gin & Tonic) that has mint & cucumber in it.

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba never fails me. I've been a multitude of times, and always give it as a recommendation to those visiting Chicago. It's a tapas place, so diners are meant to share a bunch of small plates around the table. Everything I've tried has been delicious, but in particular I would suggest:- Roast dates with bacon and apple vinaigrette- Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce- Brussels sprout salad (which is actually quite large)- Red wine sangriaI love that their menu is so extensive, with lots of options for vegetarians and pescatarians. Also, if you check in on Yelp you get a free dessert tapa!The service is always good, and very attentive. This restaurant is popular though! So expect it to always be busy and a little loud. Many people come here for special occasions because they can accommodate larger groups and the atmosphere is lively. You can make a reservation ahead of time on Opentable, or try your luck just walking in. Either way, make sure to check out this awesome eatery!
Cool place! Fun for groups or date night. Love the tapas and they come in a generous portion. Fun outdoor patio as well.

Made a day-of reservation for 9:30 on a Saturday. I was a little apprehensive about eating so late because that's not my usual style, but I think eating late and embracing the Spanish/European habit of eating late made the experience all the better.This was my first time here and I was amazed by the sheer size of the restaurant. There are so many different rooms that all have their own atmosphere. My friend and I were seated in one of the back rooms, so it was quiet and made for a really pleasant and private dining experience.Our waitress was really nice and attentive, and gave good recommendations. We ordered a half pitcher of the Classic Red sangria. It was delicious, and red wine is not usually my favorite. We really debated between the Classic Red and the seasonal special, which was white with mango. Next time.This is definitely a menu you have to approach with a plan. Because we were only two people, we wanted to maximize our plates, so we ordered one plate from each category:32. Goat cheese baked in tomato sauce.42. Grilled squid with olive oil & garlic.51. Short rib with mashed potatoes.58. Meatballs with sherry tomato sauce.They were all AMAZING. I wouldn't change what we ordered and I would order them again -- but first I would try everything else on the menu. I was seriously impressed.The meatballs came out first and they were the perfect start. When we finished the meatballs, we dipped the table bread in the sauce -- YUM! The squid, short rib, and goat cheese came out pretty quickly after that.The goat cheese was so fresh and creamy and the tomato sauce complemented the cheese very well. With the garlic bread that comes with the plate, these 3 make the perfect bite. Amazingly fresh and vibrant flavors.The squid was wonderful. I'm not used to having grilled squid and it was so refreshing to actually taste the flavor of the squid and not fried breading. The sauce was really light and made this dish a great choice for something lighter, especially compared to the short rib.The short rib was definitely the heaviest of the dishes and wasn't my favorite. The short rib had a great flavor but the mashed potatoes were kind of bland and eh (IMHO). The veggies that came with also weren't mind-blowing. I'd like to try the other meat choices.We also got a free dessert for being first-timers (so I got to save my check-in dessert for later!!!). After the richness of the meal, I probably should've opted for a lighter dessert choice, but I couldn't resist the chocolate truffle cake. It was deeeeelicious. Definitely super rich and maybe not the best choice after such a rich meal, but it was amazing. I would for sure order this again.Overall, an amazing dining experience. I want to come here for brunch now, too, to see what they have to offer.

Excellent service, excellent food, and excellent drinks. We had a large party, and they accommodated very appropriately, and everything we ordered was beyond expectations. The service was impeccable. 5 stars!

As LEYE restaurants go... meh.  It wasn't bad. But it wasn't what I've come to expect from that brand either.In fact, they brought us one wrong dish, a misunderstanding, but since our server didn't come by for at least 10 minutes, we just ate the wrong one at that point.We had paella, which was alright (we had seafood one)...  The manchego mushrooms were ok, but not special. Our friends liked the short rib a lot. We ordered about 16 things and most were just not noteworthy.The best dishes we had? Octopus, burrata, and nope, those were the best two  I'm in no hurry to go back. I don't discourage people, especially if they're tapas (or sangria) fans --  but if you're just looking for something that lives up to the hype for a special event? This isn't it..

The food was really good but they didn't seat us until 35 minutes past our 10:00pm reservation. Then they bus boy was cleaning the table (blowing out candles, taking napkins, threw us dirty looks etc...) as we were winding down our meal and signing the check. I understand you want to leave but you still had guests in the restaurant, that was downright rude!

Yummmm tapas and sangria. Never been a better combination!I've been here a few times, both with small parties and large groups. The restaurant is great for both options - huge space, but has more intimate seating as well.Things I love: spicy potatoes (crispy potatoes with this amazing tomato-based sauce), bacon-wrapped dates (duh), goat cheese baked in tomato sauce (the most succulent goat cheese atop a ridiculously good tomato sauce, served with bread), buttermilk fried chicken thighs.Service could be better, taking a star off for that. But all in all, delicious food and the rotating seasonal sangrias are always fabulous!

This place has great food and a great ambiance. Good for dates or large parties/gatherings. Saw a couple of bridal showers/bachelorette dinners.Would recommend about 2-3 dishes per person. We tried the following:*Garlic Shrimp*Meatballs*Buttermilk Chicken*Hangar Steak*Bacon Wrapped Dates*Caramelized Banana (free with yelp check-in)Favorite was definitely the meatballs and the bacon wrapped dates. The hangar steak was also very good - smaller portions than the other tapas, but very tender meat and went great with the chimmichurri sauce.The caramelized banana we got as dessert was good and came with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, but it was nothing special.

A friend of mine has been trying to get me to go here for years, but it wasn't till I got a Lettuce Entertain You gift card that I took the plunge. The hubby, some friends and I decided to go check it out. Half a block away we could already smell the amazing food. We started with a pitcher of peach sangria. Lovely!One friend got the grilled squid with olive and garlic. I'm not a fan of arugula or tons of garlic, but this dish was perfectly balanced! So yummy. The shrimp skewers and cheese plate were good, though I didn't care for the guava cube or the orange marmalade.However the absolute BEST thing we had was the shrimp paella. I'd heard of paella, but had never had it. We ordered the smaller portion to split 4 ways, and it was FANTABULOUS! I'm talking lick the plate clean and think about ordering some more...The server was excellent, keeping tabs on us, but not hovering too much. Also, because there was a Yelp coupon, I got a free butterscotch pudding which was frankly the best I've ever had.The ONLY problem with Tapas is that its so good and you are having such a good time that is is really easy to rack up a big bill. I will TOTALLY be back again. I had no idea what I was missing.

I've been here twice now and the food has been delicious both times.My favorite dishes are:Braised ShortribGoat Cheese in TomatoBacon wrapped DatesI'm sure there are many more delicious tapas but these stood out. Great sangria as well!

I like it here. It's relaxed and unassuming, and the food is good too. It can get loud and crowded, but that doesn't bother me. They have some interesting cocktails and a bunch of sangrias. It has a low, red tinted lighting. Try the goat cheese in tomato sauce.

This place is definitely one of my favorites, I have not had a bad dish at this restaurant. The meats have always been juicy and tender and nothing has ever been dried out or over/under cooked.I came here for my 3rd time over the weekend. We had a half pitcher of their blackberry raspberry sangria and their seasonal blood orange sangria. Both were a great combination of fruity and just a little tart. We had the flank steak, spicy potatoes, beef tenderloin & blue cheese, and my favorite the chicken paella. *Note - order the paella first because it takes awhile!* We also had some desserts which were perfect small plates (what else would it be?) so we got to try a few and they did not disappoint.Great atmosphere, quiet and romantic!As a side note - make sure you make reservations a little in advance. This place packs up FAST and I usually make mine about 2 weeks out for a Saturday night.

I was very impressed by Ba-Ba-Reeba! I'm not sure what was better - the pitchers of sangria, the excellent staff service or the food.With an 8pm reservation we were seated by 815 and had some sangria while we waited. Our server (whose name escapes me but was a delight) was extremely knowledgeable and made wonderful suggestions.We had baked goat cheese, short ribs, olives, spicy chorizo and chicken skewers, stuffed mushrooms and the almond desert.  For the size of the tapas I was impressed - it was honestly a lot of food for just two people and we couldn't finish everything.The exterior of this restaurant is deceiving, because this place is huge. While it may be large, latin and loud, this is a fantastic late night/date spot still maintains a great level of intimacy.Would absolutely go back.

Johnny J is the best waiter I can remember in YEARS.  My husband, daughter, brother-in-law & I had dinner here last night.  It had been many years since any of us had been here - for various reasons - location being one.  My last experience here was 'meh' at best, but I'm sooo glad we gave it another try.  4 people is perfect to be able to order a dozen dishes.  Bacon wrapped dates - sublime, the cheese board was a huge hit - there was really nothing left on any plate as we waddled out of there..  But back to the star of the night - Johnny was friendly and knowledgeable and paced us perfectly.  He has a way with people and I wish him all the success in the world, as I have a suspicion he could be an actor.  If I'm wrong, he's just 1/1,000,000 as a waiter.  BTW, we're old timers who used to go the the prior incarnation at that location - Otto's Beer Garden.

We went here on a Sunday evening as part of a group of eight (one of our party made reservations - not sure if you can only do this only for large groups but if you can make them,I would recommend this as it was crowded on a Sunday at 7:30). We enjoyed a large assortment of tapas and all were excellent (patatas Brava, squid, Brussel sprouts salad were just a few). The paella is excellent and a larger portion than the tapas. The sangria (four varieties) is refreshing although the alcohol content seemed low - not a bad thing. The desserts (we tried two- the chocolate cake and the marcona almond caramel bar) were the perfect size to end our meal on a sweet note. Only complaint is that the noise level is a bit high so it made it challenging to converse with our group.

Love Tapas! The place looks small from the outside, but its huge once you get in.  We came here for Restaurant week, but the R week menu was pretty lame so we just ordered off the regular menu. It was Sunday brunch, and there was a Bloody Mary bar which was pretty cool. The bacon wrapped dates were my fave, followed by the patatas bravas, that orange chipotle mayo is to die for. The jamon eggs benedict was surprisingly good. I would pass on the hanger steak it had a weird after taste. We finished the meal off with some French toast with jam and goat cheese, not too sweet and a great savory dessert. Overall great tapas, great brunch!

We had a blast tonight! Our good friend visiting from Japan,  wanted to try something new and we decided to take her to one of our favorite restaurants, Cafe baba reeba! And she really enjoyed it! Moreover, there was no waiting this time for our seats and the service was excellent as always. This place is still one of my favorite places to have tapas. I definitely would eat here again and I definitely would recommend them to my friends and family.

Nice place to come for a quick bite after work.Food is ok. Drinks are ok. I am not too crazy about their food but it's to bad.prices are reasonable, the staff is friendly.this is a place to come every now and then when in the neighborhood.

I had an early-ish dinner here with my fiance last Thursday, and we had a great meal. We were able to be seated right away arriving around 5:30. We chose the chorizo-wrapped date and the laughing bird shrimp for a bite-sized pinxto ($2/ea.) Hubs enjoyed his date; my shrimp was good, but I wasn't prepared for the actual strip of chewy white fat adorning the top of the skewer, which I removed and didn't eat. When they said "topped with fat" I guess I assumed it was drizzled with a little grease or something; I personally don't eat solid pieces of fat like that.We shared the goat cheese baked in tomato sauce, which was really delicious ($8), and had a plate of soy-orange duck wings which were the special that evening and should go on the permanent menu, they were so tender and tasty. We attempted to order 1/2 a pitcher of the blood orange sangria (also a special for the evening) but apparently the server heard "HAVE a pitcher of sangria," and brought us a full one, which we didn't figure out til we looked at the bill. I thought it was a little generous for a half, but didn't ask! Oh well. Guess someone's gonna have to drink all that extra sangria. Shucks!We also ordered 2 portions (the minimum order) of the seafood paella with shrimp, scallops, and monkfish. I could only find a single piece of monkfish in the entire pan, but there were a more reasonable number of shrimp and scallops. The paella takes about 30 minutes to cook to order, so they ask you to be prepared that it will take a little longer than the tapas orders. Though we were stuffed by this point, my Yelp check-in earned us a free dessert tapa, so we chose the caramelized banana with vanilla ice cream and pistachios, the perfect sweet but not too heavy ending to our delicious meal. We ended up spending about $85 for the meal, which earned us 1 point per $1 for the Lettuce Entertain You group's frequent diner reward program - there are so many affiliated restaurants, it's a great program to enroll in! We would definitely eat at Ba-Ba-Reeba again for the delicious food!

This bustling tapas restaurant is larger than it looks from the outside, and is consistently busy.The menu has a reasonably broad selection of tapas and also paella. There is also a substantial wine and sangria list, and a separate cocktail menu.I particularly enjoyed the house smoked salmon.Bacon wrapped dates were nice and crisp on the outside without being mushy on the inside.Buttermilk chicken thighs seemed mis-named, and were more like chicken tenders with a wing sauce on them.Beef skewers were tender and nicely charred on the outside, although the horseradish sauce could have used more kick.The empanadas had a delightfully flakey pastry.Service was friendly and attentive. Dishes are delivered by runners, and come out as they are ready, so don't order everything at once or you will be inundated in food!

My last experience was so good but the server today ruined it. Last time was my first time dining here, and everything was perfect (the food and excellent server)! I was soooo looking forward to coming back so I recommended this place to my friends for one of us's farewell dinner since she was leaving town.Okay, checking on us is good. But coming and asking too frequently whether we need anything else/ whether we're gonna order some more is a little uncomfortable. To me, experience is the second important thing (of course, the first thing is food) when I evaluate a restaurant but it was bad today. It felt like she wanted us to either order more or eat quickly and just leave. Yeah, more people started to come in for dinner but it wasn't that busy like last time when I came during the weekend. There were still empty tables. Also, when we got out receipt I wrote down my LettuceEats number on the receipt but it seemed like she didn't add it so I asked her and she said she'll add it later. I checked and it's not added.The supposedly warm/hot tapas dishes we ordered were generally quite cold when it came out. Seems like it was sitting there for a while before it was served to us.  Also, I told my friend that grilled octopus tapas they have here is so soft but what we actually had today was hard to chew. Since I had a really great time last time, I was really disappointed. I felt sorry to my friends for recommending. Before today I always recommended this place when people asked me some good places to dine but I don't think I will anymore. Well, they might have a good experience like when I first came, but I'm afraid they'll have a bad experience like i had today so I don't want to take that risk.

This is one of my go-to's in Chicago. I've come here multiple times with a group of girlfriends, and Baba never seems to disappoint. Their tapas are delicious and the ambiance is light and fun. I always start with a pitcher of the sangria(all of the flavors are good!) and a mini pinxtos plate. I love that you can get a mini sample of many things at once!

I've been wanting to come here for a long time and we finally made it out on Wednesday for happy hour at the bar. They had $3 tapas so we got to try a ton of different things. My favorite was the bacon wrapped dates. It was a combination of sweet and savory but really bold flavored! We also had the ham croquet, chicken empanada, meatballs, and the mushroom toast thingy. They were all small flavorful bites. My bf also had the grilled octopus but was disappointed that it was a bit too salty. We also order the pork paella. It came out really hot and well seasoned.  Overall, ton of food!Since we were there, we absolutely had to try the sangria! We had a pitcher of the white peach one, and it was one of the best sangrias I have tried. I also wanted to try another one and the bartender was nice enough to give me samples of them all. So my second favorite was the black raspberry followed by the passion fruit. The plain red was my bfs favorite, it really has that red wine flavor! And the sangria of the day was mango which was a little too sweet for me. I would definitely come back here for just drinks and small bites at the bar.

Unfortunately, in Chicago there is not a great selection of Spanish food. In my opinion, I feel that Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba offers the best paella and patatas bravas available in town!The rest of the tapas are ok. I went there several times and I think I have tried a large varieties of their tapas. I feel they are ok, but I would not go crazy for any of them. I like the cuban sandwich a lot!! It is really good.The environment is really nice, large, spacious, you can see the big jamon cerrano hanged as in Spain!The sangria is pretty tasty too!

Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba is one of my favorite places in Chicago! The vibe is awesome and they are really great with special food diets! They even have a really good gluten free bread (important with their spreadable and soupy tapas items)! My favorite item on the menu is the broccoli manchego salad - it has a wonderful crunch and a ton of manchego!

This place lives up to its name. The food was really placed at a good price, the food was fantastic and the service/ambiance was wonderful. Great place to impress your significant other! The only thing I recommend is to make reservations asap. It gets really busy fast.

This place is incredible. I walked in after landing in Chicago in a rain storm to find Sammy Faze at the bar. He was using was looked like 8 arms to make several drinks at the same time while talking to me. He didn't spill a drop or miss an ingredient. As soon as they were finished, the server grabbed them before the glasses could sweat and he started on my drink. Absolutely blown away! The drinks are as amazing to drink as they are fantastic to watch being created. Then you get to sit back and sip on art while watching more art getting created! It's like a hands on art museum with no kids that you can get drunk and eat in while chilling with the artists. Is there anything better than that!?!Did I mention the burger I had? Oh man, sit back and get ready for a thick patty cooked to perfection. Topped with the right amount of sweet and savory on an actually fresh bun.Be are to stop in, and if Sammy is there, you're in for a treat.

I've been here several times. Nice place to catch up with friends. The bar food menu is quite good, with pretty gourmet-like options.The lamb meatballs were my favorite. The dates and fondue were also good. I think I've also had a beet salad that was tasty.

Cool venue with interesting drinks and good beer. The allure abruptly stops there. I sat at the bar and the rest of my party was sat at a nearby table. The waitress didn't greet our party at the table and led with "is he with you!? we enforce table service, only". - Smugness you'd expect from a stereotypical "trendy" Lincoln Park business. The bartender that served me obviously hates his life and made it well known to the patrons he served.Next time I'm waiting for Pequod's and want to stop in for a drink or two, I'll walk the opposite direction.
Love this place! Great cocktails at amazing prices (for Chicago). Loved the ambiance and service. We can't wait to come back.

Came here for dinner and drinks with my boyfriend and we were very impressed. Their menu for food is quite limited, but we were both craving something unhealthy and meaty and got the patty melt. What an amazing sandwich! Not something I'd eat every day because it is a bit greasy, but the combo of cheese, bread, and meat was perfection. The waitress we had was very knowledgable about their beer selection, and gave us a great pairing for our sandwiches! They were very efficient filling our water glasses and bringing the check too!

Wet my beak...  Hilarious!Seriously, The Drinkingbird is a fun little bar.  The have a nice selection of beers and cocktails.  Their classic Manhattan is not bad, but there are many other options to choose from as well.  The inside is dark and intimate.  The patio is way better.  Class glass-filled fire pits are the rule.  Couches surrounding them.  Yeah, not the best when it's -20F, but on a cool spring/fall evening, this place rocks.  Now, kick out the smokers, and you'll really have something here!The staff was nice and accommodating, but not terribly attentive on the patio.  Make 50% more rounds and you have me won over.Seriously, The Drinkingbird is a cool place.  I can't wait to come back and try the food as well as the drinks.

We stopped here while waiting for our table next door, and it was just the dark, loungey vibe we needed after a long day socializing with a rowdy group.Though we only tasted one of the cocktails (the Old Fashioned, A+), the drinks all had quality, top shelf ingredients that mixed fresh (think mint, ginger, lemon) with your classic bar favs (bitters, sweet vermouth, champagne).The highlight of the experience was the 2 rounds of Frites we opted for to hold us over until dinner. They came perfected seasoned with sage and sea salt, and were complimented with a pair of savory dipping sauces: garlic aioli and zesty romesco.  Pure magic.Go here before you fill up on deep dish, and treat yourself to one (maybe 2) drinks to start the evening off right.

I recently hosted a private launch event at the Drinkingbird.   The communication and execution from the staff at the Drinkingbird was first class.   The back room and patio was perfect for our party.   Not only was the venue and staff great.....the cocktails and food were fantastic as well.   I definitely recommend the Drinkingbird for a private event or just a place to enjoy a deliciously made cocktail or food.   Thanks!

When you walk in to the Bird it has a dive bar, neighborhoody feel to it but when you order the drinks they are made with the quality of a high-end cocktail bar. Sammy is one of the main bartenders there and he can make a drink like it's nobody's business. He even gets into the ice often sculpting those beautiful large cubes or preferably spheres of ice that sit into one of his many tasty libations. The drinks here range from strong and bitter to fruity and sweet. But I have never had a bad drink here so that should comfort you.They have a fairly extensive food menu as well. Although the food is hit or miss, the burger and Mac & Cheese are off the charts good.Overall The Bird can appeal to many tastes  ranging from fancy $12 cocktails to someone who just wants to drink a Miller Lite. So come relax and stay for a while, ask for Sammy, trust me you won't get a bad drink, pair that with some Mac and your night is set. Drop the mic!

We stopped in on a whim the other night looking for some decent bar food. What we got was way more. The drinks were great, the service was super attentive, and the food was amazing! I cannot get over how awesome my burger was! The Drinkingbird is now in our rotation, and I can't wait to go back with friends!

I love this place!  Like some of the other folks, I was waiting in line at Pequod's and my friend happened to notice there was a bar right on the corner.  We went in to get some cocktails and they were the tastiest cocktails I've ever had.First order was "connect the dots" which was a dainty cocktail.  I literally could have drank that in 3 gulps but was trying very much to drink it lady-like.  But I still finished it first.Second drink was "door no. 1" which was even better.  It came in a tall glass and the flavor was out of this world. I think it has cucumbers in it which gave it a refreshing taste.After my second drink, I went next door to Pequod's and within minutes we were seated.  Had a lovely time at Drinkingbird catching up with a friend and feeling nice a tipsy.  Loved the ambiance and the servers.

Cool red decor at this watering hole next to Pequods. 4.5 starsHighlights:- Bartender: pretty cool and made us cool drinks too--ones on their list and dealer choice creations based on what we liked- Decor: looks like a dive from the outside but it's not. It had bright neon signs, a long bar with a few black tables and copper lights in front, and red pleather booths in back.- Not too crowded--at least later on a Thursday nightLowlights:- Don't be fooled by the pool in back signs: it's a pool tableWasn't expecting much and we loved it here. We would've stayed longer if we didn't have to catch a ride back to our hotel.

Not many places I can go to get a classic daiquiri & my bartender understands what I'm looking for. These guys & girls are pros. They love what they do & you'll love what they serve. It's always a pleasure

I had the most legit awesome party here last weekend. (Yes, it was a week ago, it's taken me almost that long to recover from birthday madness.) I loved the super chill vibe and that the cocktails were some of the most delicious I've ever had. Chris was amazing - incredibly nice and really accommodating to my ever growing number of party-goers. We had the best time drinking and shooting pool and hanging out. It was the perfect night.

Walked into this place after a catching a movie across the street. It's a little tiny spot between an Asian restaurant and a pizza place. You could miss it - so be paying attention. Because the food is super delicious! We ordered the lamb meatballs and the cauliflower steak. Yea - we like to mix it up. The cauliflower steak with lentils was a perfect balance is flavours - lentils being heavy in the palate while the tangy cauliflower very light and refreshing. The lamb meatballs come in a polenta and cheese base. I could swim in it! Super delicious. But the meatballs were a miss. They tasted like something from a box ( and that's a minus 1 star). We ordered some cocktails and those were spot on. I would definitely go back. This time i would order the lamb meatballs - without the lamb!

Neat little dimly lit whiskey bar with interesting appetizers and hor devours. I often stop by here for a couple drinks and a snack before going to the movies. Service, atmosphere, food, and drink are all satisfactory, can't really say there's anything super special that draws me to this place other than location. They do have an interesting looking men's restroom, so there's that.

I was visiting some family in Chicago and stumbled upon the gem that is The Drinking Bird. We were greeted by what I think is one of the best bartenders I've ever had, Richard. Super friendly!!... And watching him make these premium, yet affordable cocktails was quite the sight to see! I told him to make us whatever he wanted, and instead of making 3 of the same drink (like any other bartender would probably do), he made 3 different drinks, which were all AMAZING! It just felt like Richard genuinely wanted to make sure we had a great experience. I will definitely be back whenever I come into Chicago and I'm so so glad to have found this place!! And Richard! Haha

Great bar, amazing cocktails. The beverage program is well thought out and perfectly executed. Sammy Faze, one of the best bartenders I've gotten to know. He truly loves what he does, and you can see it when he is crafting your cocktail.

Dark lounge bar that makes the perfect spot while you wait for a table at Pequod's like we did.  I am not sure about the prices as a friend picked up our tab but they had a ton of cocktail options that the ladies in our party enjoyed.  I just stuck to a simple beer.Not a bad spot at all.
No words are needed.... The best! It makes me wonder what tastes are out there that haven't been thought of... Worth the time and the dime!

Tucked next to Parlor Pizza...this is a great place to head to after dinner to enjoy a wide selection of local beers for 5 dollars. You can hang with a friend at the front bar or go towards the back if you have a larger group for a bigger table and possibly play some pool if you're for it. Or...if you're looking to have a casual date go towards the back if the summer is nice and enjoy the patio.A great casual place with friendly service.

This place has a great atmosphere. However we found the food lacking a bit. Had a 15 minute wait past our reservation time which was understandable. However the restaurant was empty.We will be back and will give the place another chance.

This is my neighborhood "go to" bar.  I love this place. The beer selection is excellent.   The cocktails are fun and tasty.    The food is also very good, I've never had anything that I did not enjoy.   Brittney is a fabulous waitress who is attentive and always offers spot on recommendations.   This is why I keep returning!   Keep up the good work.

Solid burger and beer special on Tuesday nights.  It's nice that you can pick which draft of beer you want and the house burger was pretty tasty.  The bar itself was cool and it's wasn't too crowded here, I'd definitely return for a drink.

Stopped here to kill time before getting seated at Pequod's next door and was pleasantly surprised at the casual but good-craft-cocktail vibe here. Even better was the each pool table in the back. Got a "su novia" because I've been on a spice kick and was really happy. The coconut really cuts the chile liqueur down and the cucumber and hint of salt really make the drink extra refreshing!

Nice looking bar located by pequods at the webster clyborn intersection, I thought they'd have a bit more wide beer selection, but the beer I got was still good, very dark mood lighting, kinda hard to see

I absolutely love this place. Consistently impeccable service. Everyone who works there knows exactly what they're talking about when it comes to food recommendations, beer and wine pairings, as well as cocktails and desserts. I always make a point of having dinner and a drink here with my boyfriend before we see a movie, and then stop back in for a drink or two for a nightcap.The atmosphere is as cozy as it is strikingly attractive. It has the charm of a dive bar but with superbly picked modern decor. I adore their vintage looking neon sign on the back wall of the bar area. Also, the seating is super comfortable whether it be the bar stools with backs, the raised bar tables, or the intimate booths near the back.Overall I'm so impressed with how well the owners keep this place clean, stylish, and updated. Keep up the amazing work!
From the food to the drinks everything was great! Loved the ambiance and out server Britney was awesome! Definitely will be back again.

Like most of the other Yelpers, came here after a delicious dinner at Pequod's. Loved the vibe of this place: dark, great music, and fun for groups or couples.We only had one drink, and I honestly can't remember what I had, so I'm assuming it was nothing to write home about.All in all, I'd definitely come here again next time I'm in the area.

So pretentious, I almost laughed out loud at our bartender. He was annoyed that I asked for a margarita on the rocks instead of choosing one of their drinks on the menu with 87 ingredients. Will never be back. Too bad because it's right near theater.
Delicious vegan friendly cauliflower steak everyone should try! Amazing service in a relaxed atmosphere.

Probably a decent place to go while waiting for a crowded table next door at Pequod's, but when I came on a Saturday night with a group of friends the service was abysmal. When someone asks a waiter about the beer selection, a waiter shouldn't respond, "Whatever you like. I don't really know." Also, when a woman asks for a cocktail recommendation, the optimal response isn't, "That depends: are you still in a sorority or do you want a real drink?" I get that some people just have a snarky sense of humor, but the best time to rely on nothing but said sense of humor is probably not at midnight on a Saturday when we're the only eight customers in your bar.

Chris, the owner/bartender, Knows. What's. Up.His food and drinks achieve exactly what they're supposed to - the flavors are well mixed, and he knows what he's doing with his ingredients. It's good food and drink, without any of the pretense.Also make sure to look around you - the decor is really well thought-out and manages to achieve both form and function.All in all, one of the best bar experiences you'll have in Chicago, unless you're into places that try too hard. Highly recommended!

This place is awesome!!!! Half Priced draft beers on Sunday!!  Specials all week.  My fav is the ATTS( All The Time Sweet). Bottle of Schlitz and a shot of Dickle for $5!  The DickleSchlitz!  Awesome!! Chris the GM, Cesar, Pete, James, Richard, Brittney, kitchen staff, all incredible!  The burger is one of the best in the city!  Cocktails are legit!  My favorite spot in Lincoln Park.  They have a burger and beer special for $12 on Tuesdays before or after you see a 1/2 priced movie at Webster theatre.  Plan on going back once a week for sure!

This is a charming medium sized bar in the Lincoln Park area.  We had ate dinner prior to coming here, so we didn't explore the food menu. There were appealing cocktails on the cocktail menu, and also a large number of beers to choose from as well. I ordered the Old Fashioned, and it was one of the best ones I've had in the city. The drinks and attentive bartenders made my first visit here very pleasant.
Really good and interesting cocktails. Cool atmosphere too, low key and on the quiet side. I like coming here when you want a more casual evening.

The Drinkingbird is hiding in plain sight, and I love that the place is fairly empty on Tuesdays, as the $10 burger/fries/beer special warms the heart.  (Of course, I'm sure that the business owners would like to see a bigger crowd on Tuesday...)  The burger comes topped with bacon, a fairly unique form of cheddar cheese and some special sauce (the menu says it is jam), and the fries were served with some shredded parmesan on top.  They were a little overcooked, but otherwise great.  Paired this with the Eliot Ness beer from the draft list...yessir.  The space is dark, definitely has the feel of coming from another era, love the bartender who has been there both last night and in my previous visit.  Of course, the playlist helped; I don't hear Lyrics Born's "I Changed My Mind" remix too often (off the "Same *&^%, Different Day" album), so that made it all worth it.Great spot to hit when Pequod's is crushed on a Tuesday and you want to see a movie at the Regal afterwards, since Tuesday flicks are only $6.50 at Regal.  You're welcome!

Stopped in here for a drink on a Saturday night while waiting for a table at Pequod's next door. This bar is a really cool space and has a great vibe inside. We grabbed a table by the open window which was awesome. They have a really nice cocktail and beer menu and our server was very friendly. We didn't stay long because our table next door was ready sooner than expected but I enjoyed my beer and the server cashed us out really quickly.I would love to come back again for longer!

Great place for some delicious cocktails. They make a great Pimms cup. Not the place to go to go to if you want to watch any kind of sports....they rarely have their tv on and when we asked them to put on something, we were given a look like we weren't supposed to be asking such a thing....

Ah yes, the magnificent Drinkingbird - my favorite kind of bird.Actually, my favorite kind of bird is probably the bald eagle, but my favorite retro booze-related bird is, hands down, the Drinkingbird.My date and I arrived on the early side of a Friday night, and we snagged a red booth in the way back, beside a pool table and lit fireplace.  We later learned that this nice little back room can be reserved for private parties (noted!).  There's also a deck that I suspect gets packed in the summer time.We started with an Old Fashioned (Rittenhouse 100, Demerara, Angostura bitters, cherry bark, vanilla bitters - with cherry and citrus garnish).  This cocktail beat the pants off of any Old Fashioned I've ever attempted to make, and it's probably the best I've ever had.  My following cocktail choices include the Reverend Mother (red wine, cognac, cardomom, cinnamon, cloves, citrus, simple / almond / cherry syrup - served hot), and the El Diablo (Tequila, creme de cassis, lime and ginger beer).  The Revered Mother was just too sweet for my liking, but the El Diablo was a nice, crisp follow up.I sampled a variety of appetizers: fried olives, polenta, and the croquettes (mushroom, chicken, and yam/marshmallow) - the croquettes, specifically the yam/marshmallow, were the most tasty.I really enjoyed this place - the old school atmosphere, the top notch cocktails, and the service.  Our waiter was so nice and friendly.Side note:  I loved the red & gold women's restroom - so glam!

Came in on a Saturday evening with my husband.  Excellent food and drinks.  We had the frites, meatballs, burger, pickles and crime brûlée.  Everything was excellent - especially the service.  Stop in and get a couple of cocktails.  No regrets.

Drinks were VERY yummy and their creme brulee was to die for.  It comes with caramelized bananas and a peanut butter mousse. YUM!We didn't try any of their food items so I can't comment on that...yet.  But I WILL! When I go back for that creme brulee =D

I don't really know how to rate.I walked in to see several open tables, but was not able to sit since I just wanted a drink without ordering food.I then just left since no spots at bar.So,I was unable to get a drink at the "Drinking" Bird

I was in Chicago for the weekend and worked hard to find a place with excellent food, a unique atmosphere and great drinks. It met all my expectations.The atmosphere was cozy and relaxed with an old world feel. I had their old fashioned which was expertly balanced and exactly what I was looking for. The food was delicious, my sister and I shared several smaller plates and we were not disappointed.

This is an old-school Sinatra, gold-seated lounge bar. The first thing I noticed is that the Drinking Bird is one of the cleanest bars I've seen in awhile while I was shocked to find out it is 3 yrs old too. The ambience is classy rat pack with a touch of contemporary just to remind you didn't enter a dive.Other than that, it's a no-nonsense, great music, fine craft drink establishment.  A multitude of micro brews on tap as well as bartender suggested drinks. Bartenders are conversational, knowledgeable, and attentive given I came mid-day thurs. I can see this place being a good date joint at night as well.Custom Drinking Bird match packs, neon DB front bar light, and DB drink doilies are all great touches.  This is a joint I would go out of my way to hang out. Next to Pequod's to boot!

I was going to watch a movie and had some time to kill and decided To stop in for a drink. My boyfriend and I shared a flat bread as an appetizer which was good and both had the house burger . The house burger was very good ! The drinks were even better ! We both had the Su novia , it was really strong and delicious with hints of cucumber . We then we had the zombie killer which was awesome ! I would definitely visit again if I was in the area !
The cocktail Door No. 1 is excellent!  Had no idea until today there was a retro cocktail bar in Lincoln Park.  Will be returning!

Came here last weekend, fell in love and ended up back last night. I've been waiting to find a bar like this in Chicago since I've moved. Adorable decor and an awesome patio. Great attention to detail in the drinks make this place a standoutDrinksEl Diablo-smoky and spicy with infused vodka and some raspberryHigh point punch-some sort of peach apricot nector and lime juice, with an umbrella of course. Delicious and easy to drinkTried two other drinks can't recall the names. The best being in a champagne fluke made with whiskey and topped with prosecco. So tart and great! One of my favorite drinks hereBurger-WOW. Delicioussss. Tomato jam adds a lot. Perfectly cooked. Served with decadent fries topped with Parmesan shavingsDates-bacon wrapped dates. YUMknocked off a star because the waitress forgot the last drink I ordered but I was already tipsy and ended up not being too bothered by it. Service on the slower side.
Waitress was very kind. Drinks were great as well.Different atmosphere that you would expect.

Came in not knowing what I was in for. I started with their old fashioned. Very well made. Generally prefer an OF that gives a great balance between flavor of the spirit that follows with the hint of sweet. Great stuff. Moved onto ordering the burger of the month.... Floored. Simply incredible. One of the if not THE best burger I have ever had. You can tell they pay attention to detail and have honed in their craft.Still floored. I'd give 10 stars if I could. More than worth a visit.

I really enjoy this bar. I am here almost weekly with coworkers after work. Well we arrived today and they apparently went to cash only over the holidays. A few of us didn't want to use the atm. While we were waiting on the rest of the crew to arrive, they said we needed to leave because we were not buying anything. It's inappropriate to go into it but the owner was very rude. Disappointing losing a large group of regulars. Small Biz life

This place was exactly what I was looking for on a Saturday night... Great vibe, friendly people and amazing food/ drink. Very laid back place with tons of quality liquor to choose from and lots of different foods to try. If your looking for someplace to go and relax while you get your buzz on, I highly recommended this establishment... I heard the owner is pretty freaking cool too, if your lucky enough maybe  you can have a drink with him!
Drinks: 4.5Decor: 5Ambiance: 4Service: 4Value: 4Great drinking spot while waiting for a table at Pequod's. Love the mid-century vibe.

Showed up right when they opened.  Glad we went against normal rule of never be only people in the bar.  Good service, drinks, and food.  Husband thought Angles Envy boilermaker in particular was great, while I loved the Positive Hollering.  Burger with egg was unexpectedly tasty.  Peter was a very attentive server.

I feel like this place is either a hidden gem or the sucky service keeps people away. My friends and I easily got a table on a Friday night, but the place emptied out after an hour or so. I loved the retro decor and my awesome Pimm's Cup, but our server was super slow and rarely checked on us. I sat for almost a half hour with an empty glass while she ignored us.One tip: stay away from the Miss Noma. It sounds delicious but tastes like an ashtray!The food looks pretty good and I wouldn't mind coming for the whiskey and wing night!

We love this place! The cocktails are fantastic and the food is terrific! I simply adore the little touches like swizzle sticks and linen coasters. I'm not giving a 5 star rating based on the CASH ONLY option. We would spend more $ if we could use our cards. Please reconsider accepting cards again.

OMG what a hidden gem! My fiancé and I came here on a Sunday night before catching a movie. We ignorantly thought we would go to Pequod's but the wait was undesirable. So we stumbled in here instead. I really like the decor. I like mad men and chevron patterns, so I was into the mod-60's vibe. They had a little patio in the back that was nice too. It was half priced beers, so our beers cost $3. Always down for cheap beer! The food was bomb! I got the Waldorf sandwich and frites. The frites had Parmesan cheese melted on them-yum! And the sandwich had the perfect balance of savory and tart flavors! My fiancé got the Mac n cheese which had four types of cheese. So good! Service was good too! All in all, those folks who come and have a drink here while waiting for a table at Pequod's, should just drop the light up buzzer and eat here instead!

I probably should come back here and have another experience before reviewing the place, but if I ever do return I'll just update it. The place itself is really cool, intimate, and has awesome music. Situated right across from the theater, it's in a great location for a pre- or post- movie drink or meal. My roommate and I came for a late dinner before an even later movie and were excited to try out the cocktails and charcuterie and cheese plate, until she realized she forgot her ID which is always awkward... So I just ordered beer (from their fairly extensive draft and bottle list). Our waitress was super slow and didn't seem to make serving a priority. She also had no idea what was on the charcuterie plate for that evening which was a bigger delay... We also ordered the kale salad to share. The figs, goat cheese, and pistachios went really well with the vinaigrette dressing and I probably could've eaten a whole salad myself. Luckily we had a heaping pile of meat and cheese and pickled veggies with grilled bread on the table to enjoy as well. There was a spicy sausage, a more mild sausage, a cheddar cheese and another unknown type--because no one bothered to let us know. It also took me about 5 tries to flag down our waitress, who seemed to just be sprinting by our table each time she passed, just to order another drink, which I ended up having to chug really fast to make the movie on time. All in all the food and drinks and music are great here, but the service is just really lacking in efficiency and friendliness.

One of my favorite bars in the city. Laid-back speakeasy type feel to it. Friendly bartenders who make damn good drinks. Amazing Old Fashioneds. Beer selection is on point, too. (1/2 price draughts on Sundays!)Changed their menu a few months back and got rid of the chicken BLT which was a game-changer, but the new menu is still pretty good. Pool table in back, too. Hard to go wrong with this spot.

We came here for drinks after dinner.  It took us awhile to get settled, and the waitress wasn't too friendly until our group started to dwindle down as people left for the night.  I understand that a group of eight walking into a bar can be a little overwhelming.  That being sad, the drinks were good and the bar seemed nice.  I'd like to go back again with just the boyfriend next time.  I'd be interested in trying the food.  A group nearby ordered quite a bit and it smelled good.
Love this bar!  Awesome place - drinks are on point.The vibe is awesome - try an Old Fashioned.  They're amazing!!
