Cocktails are on point for the price, beer selection (both bottled and on tap) is great.  Atmosphere and decor are cool.  Nice long bar to sit at.  Love this place!Also I, or should I say my wife, appreciates the free matches on the bartop.  We keep them in the bathroom...
We walked in. We were told to sit where we wanted. We waited 10 min. Servers walked by. No one came over to us. So we left. Pretty pathetic.

Very cute little pub/restaurant and perfect for dinner before a movie at Webster Place theater. We ate at the bar and had wonderful service and the food was delicious and served quickly so we could make our movie time.The burger of the month was the best thing we ordered - cooked perfectly, juicy and with a ton of flavorful toppings. The deviled eggs were also good. The chicken liver mouse was ok but not the best I have had.

The Drinkingbird is one of my favorite restaurants in the nation! The service is stellar and the food is killer. Great drinks too! I wish there was one in my hometown! I love the bacon wrapped, cheese stuffed dates! Super delicious!
APerfectSpot to waitFor a tableAt Pequod. The beers and cocktails were good.
Best bar for me...dark, cool without attitude, great spirits selections, amazing food...major kudos to Sammy, a fellow artist of the liquid libations (bartender). I'm happy when I'm here.
Good atmosphere. The hot toddy was something new to try. Great place to grab a cocktail.

I have given this place at least a half dozen tries and I am done with it despite immensely convenient location. Every time I have left this place my hangover screams cheap booze and my wallet screams bankruptcy. I like good food and good drink and don't mind paying for it, unfortunately while you certainly pay for it, it's just plain not good. The service is consistently atrocious and the food is just not good, they can screw up a burger which is just plain hard to do..

This joint has slowly but surely become my default date spot in Lincoln Park. Besides being one of the most cleverly and tactfully decorated bars in Chicago, the drinks are top notch. The bar caters to just about anyone. The retro 1950's/60's decor is really cool - complete with awesome neon signs, mood lighting, and cool bar stools and tables. A TV also lets the sports fan catch the game at the bar.The cocktails are my favorite part - the list is simple and not too long, so those who are undecided can quickly make up their minds. For those who want to order off menu, the bartenders know their shit and have been able to make anything I ask for. The wait is not long and the place is never too packed. Specials are also great, with half-off craft cocktails on one night, split of champagne and oysters for $12 on another night, etc.I would try the food, but who are we kidding, I usually end up eating at Pequod's on the same trip as the Drinkingbird.
Service was great!  Have only come here for drinks, so quaint place to go to.  Good ambiance, and the drinks are pretty good as well.

Such a great place for a twist on vintage cocktails and something to eat!  Sammy is a most excellent bartender; attentive and super friendly!  It wasn't crowded, yet there were a good amount of people for a Monday evening.  Just loved, Loved, LOVED the 60's vibe! From the vinyl swivel bucket-seat bar stools, to the 60's lounge music, to the matchbooks and swizzle stix... all spot on!   Vintage style cocktails served in appropriate vintage style glasses (of course).  There were 3 of us, and we sampled 6 of the drinks on the cocktail menu.  All were great!  And can we talk about the olive tots?!?  A MUST TRY item!  We ordered a lot of items to try, (many a nod to the 60's) and none disappointed!  We ordered so much that the Back of the House noticed and came out to chat with us!  I don't remember his name (sorry), but what a nice guy!!  So many places that nod to the past or tout a special theme can, and often are pretentious.  Not The Drinkingbird!  What a gem!  Will return again the next time I am visiting Chicago!

Wife an I ate here the other night. Had burger, soup and wings. All made perfectly. Enjoyed the fries with the burger.  Also had the french onion soup - wife says maybe best ever. Great service.  Rating 4 stars only because they were out of a couple things on the menu.  It wasn't even late - just seemed like poor planning.  Great drink menu - great atmosphere.  Recommend.

Came in at 1a m.. let's just say friendly and awesome service by MR. SAMMIE.. He makes awesome drinks! Had a St. George ' s phate and a milk punch! I will be coming back :] atmosphere is chill with the likes of hip hop..non radio.thank god!

Awesome bar with a very relaxed vibe.  The bar manager Chris is great!  Not only does he really know his stuff and is able to recommend some great drinks but he's also super friendly.  He even recommended other bars to visit while we were in town.  All the bars he suggested were spot on to what we were looking for!  We had a great time in Chicago and are glad we stopped into this bar :)

This bar has a cool style and a really tasty old-fashioned!The menu is a little unorthodox but everything we've ordered has been awesome, especially the burgers!I love the classy 50's vibe and the jazz/funk/blues they play.There's also a pool table in back and the bartenders are great.It's a cool stop on your way to or from the movie theater across the street!

Stopped in for dinner and drinks and had the $10 burger and beer special, which is an amazing deal. The burger was so good, cooked perfectly and came with fries. They had a great craft beer selection, too. After watching the bartender mix some drinks we had to order a cocktail. The old fashioned was outstanding and the su novia was really unique and tasty. Both the bartenders were very friendly and welcoming. We'll definitely be back to see Jillian as she was outstanding!

Came here for the Old Fashioned and same grub, wasn't disappointed with either. The drink was very good, and I believe I ended up eating a burger with fries. If I remember correctly, the fries were pretty crunchy and amazing. The place is smaller than I thought even though it has seating in the back, but its a great date night location.One of our glasses mysteriously fell off the table even though no one touched it, which was odd. Apart from that everything went smoothly with great service.

When I had difficulty deciding on a drink (nothing on the cocktail menu really appealed to me), the bartender suggested a cassis cocktail (liqueur made from black currants).The cassis cocktail was fruity and tasted like a cocktail should!  No sweet and sour, no sugary soda mixers, none of that stuff got involved.  My cocktail was $8, and it was definitely worth it.  I would have likely paid $5 more at any of the fancy cocktail bars in the city.The bartender was friendly and checked in on us a few times but didn't linger unnecessarily either.The atmosphere was more of an upscale watering hole for locals than an upscale swanky cocktail lounge.  The bar stools are surprisingly comfortable.  On a Sunday in the early evening, it wasn't crowded at all.  And that little bird mascot is simply adorable.But, really, "famous for nothing"?  It's cute.  It's kitsch.  But it's kind of true.  My cassis cocktail was REALLY good, and I give tons of credit to that bartender.  Drinkingbird is strikingly similar to Scofflaw with the cocktail menu and prices, and they both seem to be trying to accomplish the dark "speakeasy" feel.Supposedly the place is haunted, or at least that is what we were told during our Weird Chicago Haunted Tour.  At this Lincoln Park spot you can drink spirits and feel 'em too.

This place rocks!  It's a good stop pre or post movie, but a friendly spot with good drinks and food.   A comfortable neighborhood spot with daily specials.  Sunday $6 craft drafts are worth leaving the house rain, snow, or shine.  Great drink list overall - Oregon Pinot Noir for $40 bottle?!  This is hard to come by in the city.   Good music, old school, classic vibe.  Not pretentious, just right.
Cocktails are delicious! Try Connect the Dots if you like Jameson. The people are also really friendly. I was sitting in there waiting to have pizza at Pequod's so didnt order any food.

I like this place, and would definitely make it my hang out. However, I wouldn't call these guys Mixologist. I've been spoiled by the inventive, daring, and delicious cocktails I've had in NYC.When asked to duplicate; they either didn't have the ingredients and/or just didn't know how to make it.I would strongly recommend they take a look at the menu from Second Floor On Clinton, DeSantos, and Employees Only.

We needed a spot to eat/drink before a movie and had quite a lot of time to kill. We were able to pop in and get a table immediately (7:00 on a Saturday night), and had excellent service throughout. The cocktails were refreshing (she had The Grandlife, I had a Tito's martini--sans blue cheese olives, sadly), and we tried the kale salad, fondue, and crab dip. Every dish was light and well portioned, and we left feeling content and lightly toasted. Definitely our new go-to spot for pre-movie shenanigans!

This place is sort of a non sports neighborhood bar with great great cocktails and pretty good food.  I usually go in when it is not all the busy, sit at the bar or in the front by the windows, so the service is fine. I could see how some of the other reviewers were frustrated by the service, especially if you sit in the back area.  I had to sit back there or on the patio a couple times and the service was a little uneven.  I'd ask you to give them another chance!And Drinking bird. I love you most of the time, but tighten up the service and you will get my fifth star.

Had an hour to kill before our movie, so what better way than to chill at a bar. This place is nice and cozy. Nice vibe. Great service. And on Sunday evenings their selection of draft beers are half off!! Awesome.

Sunday night was a success here. Came for a late night drink before catching a late movie and the ambiance was great. The cocktails are awesome and the bartenders were attentive even with how busy they were. Su novia was so good I would have gotten another one but we had to go.Definitely coming back for more drinks. By the way parking was hard to find though.

I did not have the food but the drinks art great. A super chill vibe inside -- the decor is up to date, clean bathrooms and a fun pool table in the back that takes $ bills now. We sat at the bar and the bartender were very attentive.Definitely check it out!

Stopped in on a slow Monday evening.  No matter, Sammy was quick to greet us and help us out.  Very friendly and not hovering.  Was looking for something delicious and new.  Great website that listed all the menus items and specials.Can it get better than a Dickel and Shlitz? HA.  Decided to try a handful of the small plates and each one was great.  Wings, Parmesan Frites, Bacon wrapped dates and Mac and Cheese.  Great presentation and the presentation delivered.  I cant wait to try the rest of the menu.A good place to hang with friends.  Pool table in the back.  The only trouble is parking and less than obvious signage.  Corner of Clybourn and Webster.  You will find it.  I will be back.

I am seriously thinking about tatooeing (?) the drinkingbird -bird and martini symbol- on my wrist ...no joke!Have been to this place like..a BILLION times because we always go to the movies at the regal across the street and afterwards we need to put some alcohol down in order to feel like adults again. No sense whatsoever.Drinks are cute and delicious, there's something about their old fashioned because it is a very popular drink and everyone orders that.  I wanted one but J said it was too strong for me. boo.This time we ordered some clams,...or oysters? I think they were actually mussels.YEP, asked my husband and they were mussels! Oh my! so deliciously delicious.The Drinkingbird has specials M-Thu, so it is the puuuuurfect spot to come around with that girlfriend of yours and kill some time, while enjoying some good cheap deal and listening to some music. :)The bar has a retro mood, or should I say.. wannabe sophisticated? I don't know.  It's not a lounge, a sports bar, nor a dive bar.  Far from a pub, although with beer on tap, still...not a pub...I don't know what it is, you should go check it out.

The waitresses are super rude and charge a $5 food minimum to sit at a table even if you've ordered over $25 in alcohol. Then they list beers on their menu that their out of. They'll say okay and go check and come back asking you to choose another.
Just stopped in for a few beers. Great bartenders, awesome music, overall fun feel. Will def be back to try some food!

I was really surprised with The Drinkingbird.  I figured they would have good cocktails, which they do, but i didn't think the food would be top notch as well.  I had their burger and it was delicious.  I'm very critical when it comes to burgers and I don't give the thumbs up very often.  It was cooked how I wanted it and the flavor of the meat itself was great - juicy and savory.  The toppings and cheese were fresh and complimented the meat well.For drinks, I had a Pimms Cup which was refreshingly delicious and an Old Fashioned, which was one of the better ones I've had.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  Overall, The Drinkingbird is a great place for dinner and drinks and I recommend checking it out.  I'll definitely be back.

This place is THE BEST. Tasty food, incredible drinks, great ambience, and good service. We came here for some apps and drinks before a movie across the street but would have stay and lingered for hours if we had been able. I usually prefer beer over cocktails but these are not to be missed, and are extremely affordable when it comes to drinks in the city.We ordered the crabcakes, the sausage (served with charred bread, spreads, etc.), and half an order of the mac n' cheese. All were delicious and just enough to act as dinner for two.Really doesn't get better than this; already excited to go back soon.

Great bar, and very conveniently located next door to Peoquods. Whenever I go for pizza I always have a drink or two here before, usually while I'm waiting for my table at Peoquods. They have great cocktails and a large beer menu. The back patio is very nice in the summer, it's shady and very enjoyable. I've never tried food here but it always looks great.

The Thursday night specials drew me in. Looking for a place I haven't visited and this was the half way point for meeting up with a few friends. The $7 cocktails and $2 PBR made for a good combination. Start with the liquor first, obviously.Fries and croquettes were summoned for something to munch on while slurping down those delicious cocktails. The fries are legit so do yourself a favor. The Old Fashion was right on the money. One of the better ones I have experienced in a while. The bar keep also whipped up a Manhattan, which isn't very difficult, but it was well balanced. Hats off.Our server was pleasant and tended to our needs. No need to wave her down or wonder if she had taken a 30 minute cig break. Pleased for sure. No experience of the smugness or discontent with the staff.This is a place to enjoy the company you are with and the drink in front of you. The dimly lit front room is relaxed and the booths in the back lends itself to some seclusion.There are two TVs situated above the bar and that's it. They did have the Blackhawks game on but it was definitely an after thought. Just steer clear if you are looking to to drink shitty draft beer and watch a game. Speaking of which the rail featured a nice selection of drafts if PBR doesn't do it for you.Three people, 4 rounds each, croquettes, and fries for around $75 (one straggler had a couple beers). You can't beat that for a Thursday night. But we were left wanting to finish up both the sporting events so down the the street to Zella's to cap off the night.

A fitting evening.Context: Birchwood Kitchen (RIP), the former inhabitant at this address was one my favs for many years living in Chicago. So much so that when I needed a relaxed and lovely place to get married, I chose BK. It holds a special place in our hearts beyond the excellent food and coffee and patio.And as such, despite knowing Birchwood was no longer, we headed to this address to try Americano 2211 on our anniversary.Flawlessly redesigned and appointed, the dimly lit and sultry confines of 2211 W North Avenue certainly have taken on a very nice direction. The space is gorgeous without being over the top, sleek yet still inviting. Truly a 5-star overhaul.While focused a bit more on its cocktail, beer and wine offerings (as the long bar would indicate) they offer a lovely menu of sharing plates that we enjoyed immensely: the highlights being the brussels sprouts, farm green salad and hangar steak. Excellent.Those drinks -- well, you are in for a treat. We split a bottle of the Cab Franc and then I indulged in a glass of rose sparkling (selected by the owner), but surely I'll be back to sample the stunning cocktail list.The service was exceptional.The only question left is -- what are you waiting for? It's as good as its predecessor, and stands out. Worth the few steps off the beaten Wicker Park track to make this a mainstay.

Having stopped into this beautiful, dark-wood and flower decorated cafe for coffee to-go before, I've always enjoyed the bright, clean tasting drip coffee and had extremely positive exchanges with the employees.  Upon finding out we could bring the pup ((back patio dog friendly!)) my friend and I headed to the ridiculously lush back patio to enjoy brunch surrounded by ten thousand gorgeous green plants. Although the menu serves alcohol, we opted for coffee, served in a carafe on a cute wooden tray accompanied by a cheery red mug, and an Americano, which the barista altered to specification perfectly.The food was crazy good, mostly due to unique flavor combinations: Rosemary biscuits and homemade peach jam had both of us reeling. Bruleed grapefruit was at once bright and smokey, the quiche came individually-portioned in a nest of crust that flawlessly contained its buttery goodness.  Favorite for me was a sauteed combination of peppers and eggplants, served cold, with a melty portion of mozzarella cheese and perfect chewy flatbread.None of it was stupid expensive, all of it was delicious. You order at the counter but the service is really accommodating, friendly, and attentive, and at noon on a Sunday it seemed at about half capacity. Go have a fantastic little brunch!

We really wanted to enjoy a quick breakfast at this cafe but unfortunately, it was a disappointment.The espresso was just awful, very oily and bitter. The  rosemary biscuits used for our sandwiches had an odd flavor, and were greasy. Grapefruit was fine.Portions are small and perhaps a bit overpriced.

Love, love, love! Short, simple, but delicious menu made even better thanks to the pastries and baked goods. Met a friend here for a late lunch midweek and we both left happy and fed. We decided to split a couple of items. We had the chickpea salad (good sized portion), rosemary biscuit with butter and jam (so light and fresh), and the cocoa-crème fraiche coffee cake (also light and not too dense). All was great and it was the perfect amount of food for the two of us. We were there at about 1:30 on a Tuesday and unfortunately they were out of the quiche of the day so if that's what you have your eye on, make sure you come a bit earlier!The interior feels very open and the back patio is wonderful on a warm day (some tables had umbrellas for the sun-averse). Staff was very friendly and chatty. You order at the register, get a number for your table, and they bring your order to you. Pricing is definitely fair. We didn't order any of their drinks, but all of the café options sounded great as did the alcoholic beverages.

Pretty cool coffee shop. We got the drip coffee. For an extra $.25 cents you could sponsor a child in Africa... Or you can upgrade your coffee to a large!!When I walked in I wasn't sure if it was a sit down restaurant with food or just a grab your food at the counter place. It didn't have a hostess so I assumed it was an order and pay now kind of deal. Then the cashier said go ahead and sit down so I left the counter only to be told no order first then sit down. Haha who's on first? Little miscommunication there.We ordered the seared halumi sandwich and some dish with spaghetti sauce and egg with some toast on the side (shakshumi or something like that). Food was interesting. Seared halumi sandwich was like spicy and looked like pesto but tasted like organic pine sol lol. Spaghetti egg dip was pretty good although not much to the dish. I think there was kale in it? It must be healthy right?Anywho we sat outside on a nice Sunday afternoon. It was new... It was hip and the coffee was legit. That whole self serve water and utensils was kind of weird. Also having to tip before food comes out needs work. You should be able to order food sit down then pay after you consume therefore allowing you to tip after. Needs some wifi and it would be a hit amongst the hipsters that live in the area. Ooh free parking on North Ave too if you're hungover from Saturday's Shenanigans.Boom! Wow look I accomplished something on a Sunday.

Stopped in to Americano 2211 twice this week for very good coffee. This place makes a perfect macchiato, which is a rare treat in this city.The breakfast options are interesting, slightly more adventurous than other cafe restaurants in the neighborhood. I liked the creamy buratta with spicy eggplant relish. I have also tried  the toast for something simple and light and quick:  fresh bread with a berry-rich jam.The space is well decorated - fresh flowers on each table are a nice touch. The staff are friendly and efficient.

Wonderful breakfast cafe! We got two egg biscuit sandwiches (one of each of the flavors) and a medium coffee. It was about $15 total. Both of the sandwiches were amazing but the spicier one with ham was our favorite!

I absolutely love the atmosphere here--there's a cute patio in the back, and the shop itself is very well decorated. The menu, while limited, is creative and unique-- I had the shakshuka and a prosciutto + gruyere croissant. The croissant wasn't bad, but I've definitely had better elsewhere; however, the shakshuka was delicious with all its simplicity. There was just a touch of hearty spice in the tomato sauce, which went quite well with the poached eggs and toast.Will definitely be back-- the vibe itself is enough to warrant another visit, and the rest of the menu sounds extremely interesting as well.

Great first lunch experience at this new Wicker Park counter-serve cafe and coffee shop (with evening hours promised).Chef-written lunch menu includes rosemary sea-salt biscuits, pearled barley salad w/ pickled tomatoes, or a seared haloumi cheese sandwich w/ schug (huh?).  Wading through a few terms you don't know is worth it though (what really IS the shakshuka?), because the resulting taste experience was rich and salty and tangy and ultimately satisfying. The house ham & cheese with nordic creamery cheddar and piccalilli (Indian pickled veggies)?--I had to tell myself to slow down--so good! (Though I would wish the sandwich sear on the one we received was a little less black on the top--added a burnt taste to parts.)At $8-10, prices were really reasonable for the quality of lunch.Coffee options are serious, including Chemex pour-over.Counter-ordering was pleasant enough, although once our party of four sat, the four dishes trickled out separately, which made it hard to have a polite start to lunch.The interior atmosphere is white-washed brick and American-Amish dining chairs, but I think the back deck has a lot more potential for warmer days.

Came here for breakfast they have a simple menu however food is still delicious. I had the granola and my partner had the Shakahuka which were both very nice. There's free wifi but doesn't work at the back courtyard. Also you order at the counter first and seat yourself and get all your utensils / sugar/ creamer. Coffee is not bad either and would come back here again

Absolutely loved the experience. The food is diverse and you have a lot of options that are delicious and diverse. Had a group with a lot of allergies - gluten, dairy, protein limitations, etc. - and everyone still had a few options to pick from. Shakshuka is especially delicious (not spicy at all though - we had to add some hot sauce). The coffee drinks were outstanding as well. They have a very nice patio - great addition tk the experienceThe only complaint is that the food did nt come out at the same time. One of the grain bowls was brought out in 4-5 minutes, and the second one took over 20 minutes to arrive. These guys should do a better job making group orders around the same time. All else was perfect :-)

I'm hesitant to write this review as I don't want the place slammed - or maybe I do because I can't lose Americano in my week-end routine. This place is cozy, hip and the food is both creative and delicious. The service is fast and friendly. The ambience is contemporary but cozy. Although I have yet to sit on their patio, I have gazed longly at this green oasis and plan to spend some quality time there next summer. I've never ordered the same thing twice and have never been disappointed. I'm lucky to be within walking distance but totally worth making a grander effort!

Loved this place while staying in Wicker Park for a few days.  It was a block away from where I was staying and I looked forward to coming here every day.  They brew Verve coffee which is delicious and they make amazing baked treats!  Its a counter walk up kind of place and there is a great little patio out back in addition to an awesome coffee bar and 4-top seating inside.  The decor is sleek and cool.  Service was always friendly.  I had an americano every time and enjoyed their almond cookies, their pistachio financier and their mocha creme fraiche cake.  I also had their 2 eggs and potatoes with grilled toast.  Nothing disappointed.This place is new and service was sometimes a bit slow as it appeared they were short staffed a few of the times I was there for take away coffee, you feel this less when you stay and eat in... but I'm sure they are still working out their rhythm.

My heart was broken when Birchwood Kitchen closed unexpectedly. My local go-to brunch place was gone. Then weeks passed by and I noticed a cute little smiling egg-looking sign hanging where Birchwood Kitchen used to be.We decided to give Americano 2211 a try today not knowing what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. They definitely spruced up the space into a more comfortable modern clean interior. Menu was very simple. The big sign displayed coffee and housemade ice creams. Current menu sits on a table counter for you to browse. Still an order and sit down kind of place.Food:Shakshuka: Lovely. The tomato sauce had quite impressive flavors. It was concentrated without being salty or overly seasoned. The cilantro was delicious with the sauce. The egg was pornographic. Yolk was not quite entirely runny. It was that half gooey, half runny consistency which is perfect for spreading on the grilled toast. They really allowed each ingredient to shine through in this dish.Ham & Cheese sandwich: Comes with potatoes. Potatoes were crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. Kind of tasted like fries from an amusement park which isn't a bad thing. Sandwich itself was as simple, yet unique and full of flavor. I think there was some kind of pickled cauliflower in it. It really helped cut through the heaviness of the ham and cheese. Well balanced.Cocoa creme fraiche coffee cake: Crust was a little crunchy and inside was moist. Awesome paired with the Caramelized Banana Choco Chip ice cream which they make in house.Cold brew coffee: solid.Staff was very helpful in describing each dish and portion. They were really friendly.So happy we have a new local brunch place!

I didn't eat here and don't want to tamper good reviews, but when I came here for an espresso based drink I was told they are transitioning to just a bar.Lots of people describe coffees and lattes, but their sign no long has any of that either. Just gelato. Just wanted people to know!

Great food! We ordered Brussels, hummus, heirlooms, croquettes--all great! Seats are a bit uncomfortable but atmosphere is nice. Scott the DJ was fantastic! Bring him back! Please get olives for martinis stat!

We have been twice for breakfast and have not been disappointed.  Their drip coffee is outstanding. I have had their daily quiche with simple greens - spot on, amazing.She had their breakfast sandwich (soft scrambled egg, schug) and also their grain bowl (farro, klug farm peas, pea tendrils, black lentils, fried meadow haven farm egg). She was impressed.Friendly, laid back staff. Nice space with a great patio out back. The only thing odd was that both times we visited - we have seen people fill up their water glass at the self service station and accidentally walk away leaving the water running to spill everywhere... just strange. People, it's a manual handle to turn on, so why would it shut off automatically?

Everything in this place is really well done. Similar price wise to a reasonable breakfast place,  just a whole lot better. Healthy, beautifully presented, reasonably priced. I went at lunch so I'm thinking of it in that context although they do dinner also. Even if you were just looking for a small take away bite they have excellent pastries. One of the owners used to sell organic ice creams at the farmers markets. They were excellent then and are available here too. She was a dessert chef in some of Chicago's better spots and it shows in the quality of their offerings. I can't wait till try dinner. Do yourself a solid and drop by.

Such a great neighborhood spot. I've gone for both lunch and for their new dinner menu. I highly recommend the shakshuka,  the burrata dish, the eggplant pintxo, and chicken from the dinner menu. The chicken was so succulent and maybe the best chicken I've ever had at a restaurant. Sit on their adorable back patio. This place is so great, you guys!

I'll keep this short. Still waiting for my food and will already give 5 stars. Coffee is excellent. Served hot. Breakfast menu is on point. Beautiful outdoor patio. Definitely try to make it here, likely will improve your day.

It was nice out, so I decided to check out Americano 2211 which just opened where Birchwood used to be.  They are currently still in the process of getting their liquor license, so for now only have breakfast/brunch items.  I ordered the quiche and my husband ordered the lemon pudding cake.  To drink they have your standard coffee, lattes, AMERICANOS, etc. I had a iced latte.  Both of the quiche and the cake were delicious, and we are excited to go back and try more!

This place is so cute! Love the Scandinavian feel and could def hang out for hours. The pastry display is beautiful. Had the quiche (vegetarian and delicious) and granola (buttery and good but would prob try something diff next time). Cappuccino and coffee are mmmmm.Service was nice but non-invasive (thank you!). Will be back to try the biscuit and cookies.

Some of the best dinner small plate options in the city. Probably not the first thing one thinks of for this place but one of my new favorite dinner spots. Brunch is also excellent. Great service and vibe.
As per most eateries near the Hipster Highway... Good food, small portions, over priced.
The shakshuka was great. The biscuit egg sandwich was a bit dry and the biscuit had too much rosemary in it.

Really liked this place a lot. Granola dish was excellent, potatoes were excellent, tea was excellent, and staff was friendly and courteous. Really nice back patio area too. Looking forward to going again soon.

4 stars and some change... A nice addition to the neighborhood. We've been here 3 times in 3 weeks. I am a fan of consistency. The food was tasty, and had a nice homemade feel. Some highlights "house ham & cheese" was very good, and the side smashed potatoes were very nicely done. I enjoyed chickpea salad and coffee cake. Honorable mention to a very solid cortado and tea cake. We will continue to return and try more items.

The food is delicious but the servings are tiny. We didn't realize it was a "small plates" menu and our waiter did not try to educate us about the service. We ordered what we thought were entrees (due to the price). If we had been prepared, we would have eaten snacks before. Too pricy to order enough for a full meal. Servings were too small for more than sharing with 2. But the flavors of the food were amazing.

Came here for brunch last weekend, it was fantastic. The weather was beautiful, and their back porch allowed us to take full advantage. Cappuccinos were top-notch. Food was great: the fiancee and I got the eggplant burrata and the weekend's special, biscuits with merguez gravy. Both of these hit the spot, definitely an appropriate portion given their richness.We even got a bonus mushroom quiche when the server accidentally brought over our burrata to the wrong table. He did send it directly over to us after confirming its first recipient did not touch it rather than sending it back to the kitchen, an offense that *SOME SENSITIVE TYPES* (shade: thrown) might dock a star for, but I am neither thin of skin nor constitution, and also appreciate that their instinct is to serve food rather than waste it.Being pleasantly full, and able to walk away from the table under our own power, we did the sensible thing: order coffee cake. Chocolatey, crumbly and served warm, in other words, perfect.If I were a nitpicky type (see above), I might suggest to the owners that their porch configuration could use some work. Our lovely city is full of some wider denizens, myself included, and it would have been nice to not squeeze up against my fellow brunchers in getting to and from my seat. Also, I'm not sure that I love the order, and then be served model. I think I would rather they commit to full service, but they probably have their reasons, and I can respect them.Anyway, those are some minor points against a backdrop of an excellent experience. I'm looking forward to returning, particularly once their liquor license has been approved. I'm not looking forward to the waits that will surely grow once people get hip to their offerings.
Quaint, beautiful, delicious, and friendly. The atmosphere is so cozy and the craft that goes into each item shows that there is a passion in every detail. I'll surely be back soon!

At brunch get the potatoes..and not to share as everyone will want their own. This place is great especially if you're looking for lighter fare as the portion sizes are pretty small. I've had their burrata and the farm greens and it hit the spot as both times was just looking for a light breakfast or lunch and coffee. Only rating as a four as the prices are a bit much for the portions. With that said, the food is good enough that I'll keep coming back.

My husband and I had a late lunch on a Thursday- shakshuka and the grain bowl, a side salad.Delicious. Very generous portions and very flavorful. Afterwards, we had 2 delicious pastries with a cup of coffee- very good.We look forward to try dinner there soon.

Americano 2211 is a unique brunch/lunch and (now) dinner spot just a couple blocks from the crowded 6 corners.  The space is comfortable and hip and the food is creative and delicious.  We've been once for brunch and last night for dinner.  I think the breakfast sandwich (i believe they rotate) is the way to go for brunch, but everything is excellent.  The fried haloumi and honeycrisp apple salad were the highlights of the dinner, but, again, all was good.  I should note that if you act quickly there is a Gilt deal for 4 cocktails and two dinner plates for $39 at the moment, which, coincidentally, is about how much it costs for two cocktails at Cindy's.
The perfect neighborhood spot for coffee or brunch.

Yum.  Tasty carry out lunch the other day!  Fantastic quiche.....like the best I have ever had.  Great crust with perfect filling.  The biscuit was tasty, but the chocolate chip cookie was amazing.  I like this place and if I can find parking, am eager to return.

I stopped by for a coffee and croissant the other day and both were exceptional. I was surprised there wasn't more of a crowd here, hopefully it picks up since this place is a great spot! I'll be back to sit down for a meal soon!
This place is excellent. Has the shakshuka and hallumi sandwich . Sandwich had an excellent sauce with a very complex taste. Highly recommended.
Best breakfast place around.  Not as big of a menu as Kanelas which is close by, but everything they have is perfect.  The eggs, toast, and bacon don't get any better.

As previous reviews have stated this place is fantastic. Great atmosphere for small groups and perfect pastries (best I have had in the city yet). The cold brew I had was great too. Between two people we tried the pistachio financier, a croissant, quiche and rosemary biscuit. Everything was phenomenal, but I would say quiche and croissant were my favorites!

This restaurant cafe makes up for the loss of Birchwood.  The menu is thoughtfully crafted and the space and outdoor seating is quite comfortable especially during pleasant spring mornings and afternoons.  The highlight for me was the pastries.  I've to this place three times already and am working my way thru the menu.  Looking forward to sampling the upcoming dinner menu.

Everything was excellent, and prices seem in line with the neighborhood. The daily special, asparagus hash with bacon and crispy potatoes, was unbelievable. The potatoes were super crispy on the outside while light and fluffy on the inside. I could eat those for days.The bread was also a standout, we had it with burrata and the shashuka.

I was sad to see Birchwood go and was worried that Americano wouldn't compare, but, thankfully, this place is just as good! I had the egg biscuit sandwich that came with a green hot sauce and my husband had the special hash - we loved them both. We didn't try the baked goods, but they looked incredible. Very nice staff and same cozy feeling to the space. Will be back soon!

Really enjoyed this place! It's small, but quaint. The staff was all super friendly and helpful. We tried the eggs, bacon (which was amazing), quiche and rosemary & sea salt biscuit. Everything was delicious and I would definitely go back to eat, or to just do some work.

The place was quaint and cozy. The staff was helpful in explaining the menu. The mood was chill, warm. We ordered both biscuit sandwiches and the salad which turned out to be flavorful, the right size, with a great presentation. Definitely a gem of a find for us and we will definitely be back to try something else on their menu.
Ham & cheese sandwich was excellent! Looking forward to their full menu and dinner options!!
Such a cool place. The patio is amazing and the coffee is strong! They have wifi if you want to get some work done. I highly recommend the Rosemary Sea Salt Biscuits!!

Americano is an adorable little café in Wicker Park. We went their for brunch and they have a lovely backyard patio. The food is amazing too! The people are so friendly and the mood is casual. I would go again the next time I visit Chicago!

I stopped by today for the first time and picked up two pieces of quiche - one wild mushroom and the other kale & green garlic. From the crispy crust to the creamy quiche and flavorful mushrooms, both were spectacular. I will be back many times I'm sure, looking forward to trying some of the baked goods, pastries, etc. Very much look forward to this place being open for dinner as well!

Love this restaurant!  Highly recommend.On the weekends they serve a wonderful goat soup that has tender meat and flavorful soup.  Makes me really happy and I like to take the leftover soup home, throw in some noodles and bokchoy as a second meal.  My favorite tacos are still the lengua, al pastor and barbacoa.

Couldn't find cheap, authentic tacos in the West Loop area so we drove five-ten minutes away to this place and we're happy we did!Being from California where Mexican food is readily available, we had to get our fix. The tacos were absolutely amazing! I ordered three chicken tacos, one carne asade taco, and my boyfriend ordered an asada burrito. It all came out to $20. WOW!!!! The tacos are simple with just the meat, onions and cilantro. They come with a side of limes and there are spicy sauce bottles on the bar table. Simple tacos with flavorful, juicy meat. Staff are friendly and keep the place super clean. What more can you ask for.This place is a no-fuss establishment. Come in, order your food, eat, and go. Seating is pretty limited. Also, parking is all street but the area is not crowded so it should be easy to find a spot.

Favorite taco place in Chicago hands down. Get the tacos the traditional way (cilantro / onions) and don't add cheese, lettuce, etc. and make it all American.Lengua, cabeza, tripe, flank steak are the best tacos.On Sat/Sun they have birria soup which is phenomenal.Ask for their secret salsas!

If your looking for hole in the wall taco places with bomb ass food, then this is the place. They tick all the right boxes (small location, open late, packed restaurant, friendly staff, legit tacos). This is not a one of those fancy Wicker Park taco places either. Very fortunate to have found this place as it has now become my go to for tacos when in the neighborhood. Personally the tacos de lomo are some of the best I have ever had. So if your in the area, stop by and give this place a try, granted any more then 12 people in there and not sure if you can even get in the building. Ha!

Good for late night taco, consistent and predictable. Toetas ahogadas are spicy but not the best since the bread must be special. Tacos are tasty specially thr pastor.  Pozole are good the craving. Aguas frescas are nice.

Solid tacos, but the winning formula is the tomatillo salsa. Stopped by for lunch and got the al pastor and the carne asada, both of which I thoroughly enjoyed--the carne asada I found a little more chewy than I would've liked, but the marinade on the al pastor was pretty spot on. The tacos are a little on the pricey side, but very generously filled with meat, onions, and cilantro. Each order comes with a generous serving of tomatillo salsa, which I absolutely loved--chilled yet wonderfully spicy, the salsa topped off what was already a very solid taco.It's a small place with limited seating and cash only, but the solid food makes it worth it and a great place to stop by for a fast meal.
Love the tacos!!!! Definitely a must if your in the area!! The guys here are friendly and attentive to the clients it's a small location but welcoming and their hot sauce highly recommend
Al pastor is the best I've ever had. The carne asada is also great. Some of the other tacos I've had have been mediocre. Service is always good, friendly, and quick. Place is always clean.

We are still obsessed with this place. Whatever you order, make sure you get it with al pastor. The chilaquiles are bomb, as are the tacos. Last night I had the huaraches and those were tasty too. Check it out if you're in the area. CASH ONLY!

everything we tried here is just amazing, a lot of exotic stuff, tripes, pig brain, etcwe come here every week, it is such a hidden gem, my favourite so far is the tilapia tacomust try their home made horchata, it has a rich rice taste to it, unless some other places which fill it with sugar...this place's horchata feels more flavourful and natural

I went there today for lunch. I had the burrito, carne molida, like I typically get at these taco joints. I have to say, it was quite tasty!The cheese that was used was really good. Cash only and it was just south of $10. Which I have to say is quite expensive for a burrito. But worth it and filling.The chips looked pretty good too so maybe split the burrito with someone and get the chips. While waiting, someone was eating a Cuban, that looed really good too! I will be back and try some new things. Of the options around, it is one of the better ones, especially better than one that starts with a C and the ending rhymes with bone.

Equivalent to a taco stand that's how small the inside is, but it works for a spot to grab some tacos at a cheap price and get them quickly. Must remember to bring cash, no cc accepted.Service: I called my order in and was told 5 min (super quick). The service over the phone was exceptional as he was patient and very nice.Food: I wish they labled the tacos bc when u order so many you want to be able to easily identify them. I ordered a chicken quesadilla and 7 tacos. Below are my reviews on each:Barbacoa taco - not impressed. Won't order this again.Beef taco - not bad, not great, no complaints.Fish taco - a really great grilled taco with pico de gallo. Was my favorite taco of the bunch.Pork taco - 2nd best taco. I would order it again.Steak taco - not much flavor, but was tender. Slight tweekn and this taco could be good.Glad I tried their food and if I lived closer would probably come back, but I don't live close by so probably will have to stick to pilsen area for my occasional taco fix. I still recommend anyone in the area to try it if looking for a quick, cheap bite to eat.

I love this place. This is literally one of those hole in the wall - I hope there's room for me to walk in- places.So flavorful super authentic - love the torta ahogada or the enchiladas are #offthechain also! The rice and beans is ok, not the best but definitely a goodie. (Refried beans)I've been here a few times and they have never failed me!! There's usually street parking and most people pick up to go orders so if there's room- I suggest staying a while!Also, good sized portions- I always eat with my eyes :)

This place is a little hole in the wall...of taco heaven! The tacos here were really good. They also have complimentary soup and it was great on a cold day. The best taco I thought was the barbacoa and second best was the tilapia taco. I did get the cow brains taco and although it was good, I don't suggest people with weak stomachs get this. Professional taco eaters only.
Best Mexican in the city... hands down authentic! Don't bother with La Pasadita and come down the street here.

My favorite Mexican food in Chicago and there are LOTS of options. I go here at least once a week.My go to is the Lomo - ribeye steak and grilled onions. Always done to perfection. Their regular carne asada is also super solid.The super fresh homemade salsa is always spot on as well.Employees here are great and the food is always fast and fresh. I recommend this place highly to everyone!

Traspasada is a five-star taqueria. I haven't had a meal I wouldn't recommend but here are a few of my favorites:Tacos - It seems like they have dozens of choices but make mine Birria or Chorizo or Steak or Pork. They come with cilantro and onions.Tortas: Chorizo & Egg is my favorite, loaded with lettuce, tomato, avocado and goodness. As with tacos, they have a million options.They serve sopa birria on the weekends- give it a try!

Yum!Some of my favorite tacos in this whole city (Chicago!). I am a fan of the al pastor most, but they are all very scrumptious, affordable and friendly! Get a Topo Chico bubbly water  --those are the best bubbles I know.
Amazing authentic tacos... and bottled coke to top it off! The guys were very patient as we decided on our lunch as they have an expansive menu. Definitely coming back. CASH ONLY.
This place has some of the best burritos in Chicago. The al pastor is particularly good. I would highly recommend to anyone.
ProsAuthentic tacosGreat al pastor; has an extra smoky taste to it.  Delicious!NeutralDelivery starts at 11amConsNo pineappleOverall: will recommend to a friend

Amazing food, fast service, authentic dishes, what more can you ask for? You can definitely ask for bigger facility, and that the place takes plastic. At this point seating is enough for 10-12 people max, and if you don't have cash, don't even bother stopping by. It's not very cheap either, but what can I say, when you're looking for an awesome quick Mexican food fix, this is the place!

This little spot doesn't look like much (and the surroundings will turn many tourists away), but the food and service can't be beat. The pico is some of the freshest and tastiest I've ever had, knocking much more expensive places out of the competition.  I'm a vegetarian and have many great options here, but the veggie tacos are my go-to menu item. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful.  Grab a seat at the window and watch West Town while enjoying your completely affordable meal. Cash only, but there's an ATM on site also.

Fantastic. The chimichangas, burritos, and fish tacos are all great. On the weekends they have goat soup which (perhaps surprisingly to many Americans) is delicious and full of tender meat. If you dine in, it can take a while to get your food -- they seem to prioritize carryout orders, which I guess makes sense for a such a small place. The staff are very friendly.

Awesome place, a true Authentic Mexican joint in the Chi-Town area.Most restaurants look to be "fancy" and "overpriced", well not Taqueria Traspasada, it's stuck to it's tradition of a small Mexican joint with AWESOME authentic Mexican food.The Carne Asada taco was beyond good! I also really liked the Chili Relleno taco.If you want amazing Mexican food and don't care about going to some crazy fancy place, then check out Taqueria Traspasada
I walked in because of the great reviews.  Cashier was handling cash and then food without gloves or washing hands.  I left.  Sorry guys.  Bozo no no.

I was very underwhelmed by this place. I ordered the steak, pork skin, and beef brain (feeling adventurous at the time...). I wasn't impressed by the steak but the pork skin was packed with flavor. If you're into something fatty and hearty and aren't counting calories, I'd go for that option. The beef brain one was kind of gross. I'm all for trying new things but the consistency was rubbery and it was hard to shake the feeling that I was ingesting brain. But at least that's one more thing to check off my bucket list.Also, the owner or guy working the counter seemed a little pushy. I asked him for recommendations and he gave us a curt non-helpful answer... okay... won't make me like this place anymore. What's the rush really?Also, the prices seemed a little high for a hole-in-the-wall tacqueria dive place. I mean, I'd rather pay the $3 for a taco at the Big Star than pay $2.50 for a mediocre taco in my opinion.

I just had sesos tacos - as in beef brain. That's hardcore $%#&. Talk about Bizarre Foods with Andrew Zimmern, I was feeling adventurous and bold with a slight fear of mad cow disease. Thankfully, I'm okay and still able to write this review for Taqueria Traspasada.The tacos are $2.25 each and look small but they are packed with flavor. I also ordered the al pastor and tried the chicharron. These are definitely a must try since both were delicious. The owner was kind enough to give us some birria (goat stew) and followed up throughout our meal.Taqueria Traspasada also does steak burritos well but this is the place to try something different. Bizarre Food fans should definitely put this place on their list to try.
This is probably the best traditional taqueria I've found in Chicago. Tacos and enchiladas are amazing. Menudo is worth the price of admission. Also, the side salsa are great too. Add it to the list.

Steak burrito with everything is slightly tastier than Dona Natys & El Taco Veloz but $2.50 more expensive. I'd go here if the other two places were closed.One star off for the price, the other for the cash only policy.

This place used to be just OK.After Renae took the reins they have improved in all ways.The steak tacos are amazing. Make sure to only get cilantro and onion with some limes on the side. The fish tacos are great too and come with a special sauce.Their new manager makes this place tic.I come in on a regular basis and it never disappoints.

It's been said but I'll say it again. Best Al Pastor I've come across in the city. Friends have said the cecina is great too. My favorite place for lunch or a quick bite in the evening before or after going out.
Best Mexican food in Chicago for the price. Give this place a shot. You won't be sorry.

So since Taqueria Moran was a huge failure I said I was going to check out a new place for Mexican food so I wanted to check this place out.  Been thinking about it for a while. They are a bit pricier then Moran but OMG they are so tasty. Ordered both steak tacos and ground beef tacos. I can't decide which is better.  I ordered my mom the chorizo torta and she was happy with it.  The service was great and quick. It's definitely my new go to place at this time.
There's a ton of taco places near hear along Ashland and Chicago, but this tiny place has the best tacos I've had in the area.

Service was good, despite the small inside area of the restaurant. The guy at the counter gave us free samples of a soup/stew with our meals. He came back and checked on us a couple times.The food was pretty good, too. I wouldn't say it was amazing, though. I had the taco dinner, brother had the enchiladas, wife had tacos as well. No complaints. Horchata was also REALLY good.

This is my favorite taco place in the area and there  are tons including la pasadita. I eat here at least twice a week and almost always seem to get the steak tacos. They really load them up too. They also have a rather full menu of stuff outside of the typical tacos and burritos which I've been meaning to try. Always very friendly here too.

I don't know how you fuck up such a simple order. I ordered one chicken and one pork tostada. What do I get? Two steak tostadas. That with a can of Squirt cost 9.47.........Not worth it to me. I can get much better at Authen taco and La Pasadita.

Tried the al pastor, chorizo, ground beef, and flank steak.  I would do the flank and the al pastor again, but the chorizo and the beef were a disappointment.  Love the space, perfect for what I need for an on-the-run taco joint.  But the price-to-value ratio was a little off to me, with $2.25 tacos that weren't that hearty.  Generally, I expect three tacos to fill me up at most Chicago taco joints, and at Traspasada, I would have needed five (at least) to get out of here full.  You have been warned.I will come back because this place is a five-minute walk from the house...but I'll focus on a couple of other flavors the next go-round.

Food is great.  Tacos carne asada has a great char to it.  Fish tacos are beautifully tasty.  The manager (guy at the register) is the reason I keep coming back.  Owner should feel grateful to have him at the helm.

Took some out-of-towners (Canadians) to this spot because they wanted some good Mexican food. They were very pleased and so was I.The burritos are a good size and not too expensive.They of course had a vegetarian option for my friend which is pretty easy to get with mexican food.
I called to place an order for pickup and because I asked for no cilantro they hung up; not once? But twice. I'm allergic to cilantro

Total grab and go taco joint. No frills, but none needed.   The food is cheap, tasty and quick.  Guacamole is really fresh and perfect smooth consistency.   The tostadas didn't  travel that we'll but they tasted great so that's all that mattered.   The steak was flavorful and moist, pretty much all you really need in a taco spot.  I'll be back!

My third time here and it's always great service.  Cash only joint, but they do have an ATM.  Small restaurant more for take out but if you're lucky to grab a stool, it's always clean.  Today I had the steak Chimichanga which is hard to find these days on the westside.  It's a fried burrito.  Perfectly fried, soft crisp, topped with cheese.  The steak flavorful, not salty but even better with their brown salsa.  My husband likes the green salsa because it's spicier.  So if you prefer hotter get the green sauce.  Oh and the horchata is so good, no fountain fake stuff here.

I'm astounded by the other reviews I've read of this place. Best pastor you've ever had? Amazing carne asada? Incredible hole in the wall taco joint? I pity you, friends!It might be great drunk food and I admit I was dead sober, but I ordered al pastor, carne asada, and suadero tacos and each was as bland as the last. The al pastor had a slight hint of what could have been flavor, but that was the extent of it. I could write a book on my love for al pastor tacos, but I'd leave this place unmentioned. With the ridiculous amount of taco places in the area, I'll cross this one off the list and peep the next block.
One of my go to spots for authentic carne asada tacos in Chicago.
The Al pastor burrito is good here.  The fajitas and street tacos are also very good.The manager is also really good and the service is quick and friendly.
Super flavorful great speedy service and undeniable Mexican quality. New go-to in Ukrainian Village

Cash only can sometimes ruin an otherwise amazing taqueria experience, but I'll be damned if I'm going to dock Traspasada for a two dollar transaction fee. This past midnight Mexican spot is legit one of the best in the city.It's small and slender, which is the exact opposite of what you'll be if you add them to your regular rotation. The menu is massive with many meats and mariscos to choose from to put between corn or flour tortillas. Amazing ones I might add.The talipia tacos are grilled and delicious and the steak deserves the name carne asada cause it's almost as good what you'll find in Southern or Baja California. Overall it's about as good as I've found in the Midwest after experiencing some of the best by the border.

I drove past here and made a second attempt to get these tacos. They were open for lunch! Haaaaaaleluyah!!!Grabbed the al pastor and carne asada. Served incredibly fast, I sat alone and gobbled it up. The main guy was nice and quick.They have bottled drinks, bar style seating and affordable prices. No frills, good tacos.

This is my go-to taco place. It is conveniently close to me, but I would come here anyway if I were to move away.The food is authentic, as well as the experience. They have great vegetarian options. The food is always delicious and made to order. The service is fast and friendly. Rene always asks how your meal is once you get your food.They don't have much seating, so take out is always good. But it is fun to stay and sit inside sometimes if you are alone or with a smaller group.

Seriously for the past week I have been trying to eat at least two tacos a day. IDK what's wrong with me but I have been seriously looking to eat at a new Taco joint every day. No I'm not pregnant if that's what you guys are thinkingI received a call from one of my friends that I haven't heard from in a while. We met up here because I told her "I'm feeling tacos and margaritas" so she suggested this place. We sat on the patio because this weather has been phenomenal (cross my fingers that it stays like this ). Their tacos were not the greatest; tasted just plain nothing special. If their Tacos were good this place would easily get a 5 star from me. I ordered a Mango and a Peach margarita and let me express how tasty those were! I mean I wanted to try every flavor but I had to drive my ass home.This is definitely a place to come for a nice flavorful and refreshing Margarita! My drink didn't lack a thing. It was made exactly the way I love it. Our check was really cheap as well so I will definitely return to try more of their drinks.Our server was really nice and attentive. She didn't bother us every 5 seconds but came around enough for us not to be smothered by her.
2 words: Barbacoa Tacos!My friends had the Al Pastor tacos and were also very good. Service was excellent as well. I will definitely be back for more.

Real. Authentic. Mexican. Food. Really I can't decide which tacos are better, I'm stuck between carne asada, barbacoa, or the green pork skin tacos? Whatever, YOU decide you can not go wrong with place. Very impressed!
I love late night food and tacos, they have both with many different proteins including goat and chile relleno.  The service was quick and friendly.

I definitely love Mexican food so I was excited ordering from a place with so many stars. But this is just not good food. I was completely disappointed and $60 not well spent. The tortas smell like a dog cage and just very dry with no flavor. The nachos were semi edible and the shrimp ceviche is not shrimp ceviche. And the steak burrito is very dry/blan with an excessive amount of beef. I'll give it one star because the rice and beans were good.

Late night mexican food that is as tasty as this???? Really it was a dream come true and a dream I hope I get to have again very soon!Really though, if I am ever back in this area, even if I am not hungry, I will be coming here to get at least one al pastor taco or quesadilla or something. That al pastor was so so good! And that quesadilla was grilled to perfection with just the right amount of cheese and fillings, I didn't want to share any of it with Matt J. at all, but I knew it was the nice thing to do. I pretty much wanted to order one of everything on the menu there and you could tell that this place has it set of regulars too, since people would walk in and all of the staff would say hi to them, give them food hook ups, it was like being at cheers but instead being at a late mexican taco spot that felt as happy and homey as cheers. It is small inside, but hey, you don't need much space to enjoy food like this. Everything was so flavorful and it isn't as cheap as some places were in CA when I used to live there, but it was worth every dollar hands down and I will definitely be back. Maybe tomorrow.Taqueria Traspasada, will you be my friend forever?

Great late night food spot. A lot of people working drunk food joints get jaded and mean but not these guys. Always been greeted with a big smile. I was short a buck and the cashier let me slide. Don't worry boys, I'll get you back next week!
I love them! Always so delicious and the service is killer! I've been going for 8 years!

I love this place, but they can never give you a total until they show up. Often, the order is not accompanied by a receipt, and the totals don't seem right.Tonight, our delivery guy showed up and told my husband he owed $40. To make a long story short, he just brought our money back after I threatened to call the cops. He actually tried to keep the tip, too. Moron.This kind of thing has happened too often with them. Bye bye, Traspasada.
Un dia pace por la Chicago and Ashland  y prove la delicious talpiqueña del restaurant la traspazada k rica

Tacos were just ok, nothing special, al pastor tasted like chorizo, asada tacos were very bland. prices were high for these small ass tacos, people that say these are the best need to get out more an taste some real shit.
Another great taco place with awesome negro salsa the steak tacos are tender not fatty , small place but never over crowded and the guy taking your order is always friendly... customer for life

This is a little hole in the wall place to grab some reasonably price Mexican food to go. I came here for a late night bite after going to Beauty Bar down the street. It was pretty crowded, but the line moves fast.  I ordered the Carne Asada taco with cilantro and onion. Steak was cook good and flavorful, taco size was decent, and price point was okay. Definitely a late night bite stop when I'm in the area.

I literally live 2 minutes away from this place, and I like it! It usually has a few people in there eating in or ordering out. Its not anything insanely special but it's good for genuine Mexican home cooking. the staff is pretty friendly, and straight and to the point when ordering. As for food, I know they have a pretty wide variety on the menu but I've only ordered the tacos (al pastor, flank steak, and ground beef), my favorite by far is the al pastor!Remember this place is CASH ONLY!! if you forget there's a Bank of America across the street. all in all the prices are very reasonable and you can get a lot of food for a little cash.
Three words: chicken taco saladLiterally the best thing to eat, especially after a night of drinking. Their salsa and chips are yummy too

I've checked out a decent portion of the menus at the various Mexican joints in the area.  I go here if I'm feeling like something with steak in it, which is usually in burrito form.  This place has what I think are the best Carne Asada burritos in the area.  Lots of meat, good balance of other fillings, cheese is nicely melted.  I tend to find my staples at certain restaurants and stick with them... so for their steak burritos alone, I give it 5-stars.I go elsewhere for tacos though.  Pastor is my go-to for tacos, and there are better to be had, plus the corn tortillas aren't always the best.  They do have a lot of meat options, and tend to generously fill them, though.Lots of other things on the menu as well.  Open late.  Cash only.
My favorite local taqueria! I live a block away and don't know what I'd do without their steak tacos.

Taqueria Traspasada has always been on my bookmarked list to try after a drunken city night at 2am when all you want is some greasy, comfort Mexican food. Well, since I'm old and these 2am rendezvous don't happen as much as they should in your mid 20's, I dragged my hubby out on a Thursday night around 8pm just for a casual dinner. Was it worth coming out from the suburbs? Probably not. However, was it super delicious and definitely worth trying? Yes. The place is a hole in the wall, this is not your trendy or colorful Mexican joint, this is literally perfect for that 2am stop before going home to fill up on crazy, amazing burritos. Anyways, despite the environment, the guys working there seemed super friendly.We ordered the Pastor Burrito which I had and my hubby had the Carne Asada Burrito and I must say the Pastor was much much better. It was a big portion for $6.99 and it came with a little soup and salsa. The burrito was full of veggies and flavor and the pork was super moist, tender and had so much flavor. Like it was really good to the point that I'm clearly still thinking about it. The only issue is that it's too far from our house. We need a place like this open super late on the weekends that is that good.Only annoying part about this place is that it's cash only so keep that in mind. And who wants to count exact change when you're super drunkie at 2am, when you'd rather have him swipe that credit card. Well, in any case, we will probably be back after a downtown rendezvous whenever that will happen, but we won't be coming back for a simple burrito dinner from the burbs just for fun. That, was a one time only wonderful experience. But taqueria, keep on doing what you're doing and expand to the burbs!

Saturday. A long night of cocktails and conversation behind us and we've officially burned through the modest sized dinner consumed earlier in the evening. We were hungry. Yelp pointed us towards Traspasada, a well rated burrito joint steps away from our friends apartment and open until an astonishing 3:30AM - not a rarity by my hometown (NY) standards but certainly worth mentioning in Chicago.We arrive. The staff is halfway through the usual choreographed cleaning dance; flipping the stools, wiping the tables, and sweeping the floor, Semisonic may have been playing - it's all a bit foggy. We beg, plead, and negotiate for two more burritos to be made. After some back and forth, a beacon of hope comes in four words, "we only have steak." I think, only steak... well I guess THE BEST POSSIBLE OPTION will suffice. The urge to broverdose into visceral grunts of happiness, and game winning high fives was overwhelming. After what seemed like hours of pensive anticipation our burritos were delivered. A tear of joy almost rolled down my cheek as I pulled back the foil blanket the little bundle of joy was wrapped in. Buttery tortilla perfectly toasted, freshly minced onion and cilantro, hot off the grill steak melting the cheese around it. It was a masterpiece. A $7 masterpiece.Yes, I had a few cocktails. Yes, my dinner earlier that evening wasn't amazing, but it wasn't terrible, nor was I intoxicated to the point where a dollar slice can be confused for edible. Nonetheless, I had my doubts. How could a stumbled-upon 3AM burrito surpass all that NY, SF, LA, and every other place that arguably has "the" best burrito? I don't know. Further investigation was required.Round two was during normal business hours. Instead of the carne asada I chose the chicken. The TV was playing Ghost Rider and while Nicholas Cage en español was an experience in itself, the chicken burrito proved that my suspicions were true. These are the best burritos ever.Thanks for ruining every other taqueria. Until next time Traspasada, until next time...

...PASTOR...OK now that we've got that out of the way, having lived literally dozens of feet away for 3 years, this is the single most thing I miss about my name old hood. I have yet to try any other taqueria in Chicago who's Pastor stacks up! Sober or drunk, the food is a top notch hole in the wall. With my homeboy always (usually) behind the counter, the service is always friendly, and this became the go to quick dinner spot for virtually all my friends coming here for their pregame dinner (which often led to the round 2 trip, post game drunken snack). While I almost always got the pastor here, both the chicken and steak are good quality and I'm partial to the Costillas en Res con Papas (sp?) You'll see a picture of it on the menu, love the grilled jalapeño.Short story long, and not just because I have more than a few drunken (and sober) memories, but this is by far my favorite pastor in the city and I will always keep coming back!

i did everything i should've done before heading here: i was at a hoppin' birthday bash not too far away, had a little too much fun, and had an awesome designated driver who i could thank for putting up with me with tacos.i easily ordered enough food for three people. all tacos, all topped traditionally (cilantro and onions):- carne asada- barbacoa- carne molida- chorizo- lomo encebollado- tilapiawe got these to go. the kind gentleman also gave me a free horchata (which, after you stir the chunks of coagulated cinnamon around on the bottom, is actually pretty tasty..and the reason why this review is two stars, not one). all in all, the trip seemed successful. and then i got home.everything was bland. the corn tortillas were inconsistent in texture. some were soggy, others tough. the meat, while textured seemingly perfectly, lacked ANY type of flavor. i grabbed the tilapia out of the tortilla and cabbage slaw to see if i could taste anything extraordinary, and while it was honestly the best out of all the tacos, it was likely only because the fish was lightly fried. green chile did nothing to enhance the protein.it was so disappointing that i didn't even want to spend my caloric intake on that nonsense. it just wasn't worth it to me. so i rolled up all the foil with the sad leftover foodbits, tossed it into the rubbish bin, and called it a night.

Loved the fajitas I got here! The guacamole was a delicious addition. Best of all, the staff is really nice and attentive. It's a smaller place so going with one to two people max would probably be best. The steak taco was a bit chewy, but my chicken fajitas were the perfect consistency. I would come back here for sure!

Holy crap - some of the best street tacos I have ever had.  And I used to live in Southern California and currently live in Texas where taco joints are a dime a dozen.  This place holds it's own again anywhere.  I had a chorizo taco and pastor taco, and my wife the pozole.  All amazing...

I think at least a 1/2 star is based on proximity to my home. Their service is always fast and nice. Food is well prepared and they know how to roll a good quality tight burrito.I'd take away a half star for cash only and another half star for their hot sauces. They're kinda blah.

There are a lot of really good taquerias in this part of town and I've tried just about every one of them, but La Traspasada is my favorite!Most important to me, the pastor meat is done just right: a key indicator of a quality Mexican restaurant. And I am completely hooked on their pozole! It's so good: big portion, enough to feed a group of four. And they hook up all the fixings.La Traspasada doesn't look like much. It's TINY. Just a little counter with a few spots for dining in. So you're not coming here for a date. On the other hand, they do a great carry out business, and the young fellow usually working the front counter is always very pleasant and helpful.But if you can be bothered to stay and dine-in, La Traspasada will sweeten the deal by giving you a complimentary cup of their daily soup, which is always good.Highly recommended if you're looking for a high quality, low cost Mexican lunch or dinner!p.s. They've also got a location up at California and Belmont with a lot more seating.
This place is really good and the staff is quick and organized with their orders love going there once in a while for a quick taco and the prices are really good too.

This cash-only place is my go-to for authentic, tasty Mexican food. The first thing I noticed about this place is that the steak  had a slightly charred, fresh off the grill taste that elevated my burrito. You can see them cook up everything fresh right behind the register, too. Al pastor is also really good here. Most underrated part of this restaurant--the sauces. Definitely don't forget to put the green and red salsas on before you take a bite (I always regret forgetting this).
Fast, cheap, tasty. Food is ready in 10 minutes. Burritos seem to have this umami flavor. This place never fails me.

I enjoyed some pretty killer enchiladas verdes here, complete with some wonderfully classic rice and beans. This is my litmus test, and I will say that Traspasadas passed with flying colors.This place is tiny. No tables, just some counters and stools, so don't expect a sit-down experience. What you can expect, however, is sit-down quality service. They were so attentive, kind, and friendly--and fast!Cash only. Salsa verde is tangy and a touch smoky, so hit that up.

Having recently moved from Austin to Atlanta, I have experienced a marked lack of good south-of-the-border fare.  While visiting Chicago, I ate here and it was great. I got the chimichanga con todo with lengua. It was pretty great.  The lengua was mild and tender.  It was HUGE.  My husband and I ordered the same thing and we could have split it. They have this excellent black salsa.  They also have good aguas fees as and chips.

Excellent authentic Mexican food at a reasonable price. In particular, the burritos are big and flavorful. No free tortilla chips, but salsa is included if you dine in. Ambiance is not a forte: not much room for dine-in (only two rows of bar chairs).

Taqueria Traspasada - One of the best place for a delicious Taco and Burrito!The Burrito alpastor.hereso delicious, I remember my friend said how she crave for Burrito whenever she recalls Taqueria Traspasada's delicious burrto.  The Huevos rancheros here was also unexpected, we never thought that they serve a good tasting Huevos rancheros here.

This is my spot for tacos. Al pastor, chicken, tilapia, steak, on holidays, chicharon, cabeza. Fresh food and friendly service - this is my favorite place for takeout. And..I take them for granted. And tinge past week or more I go by and it's closed. They've been closed for more than a week and I'm distraught. I want tacos right now. What happened? Where are they? Is everything ok? I'm worried!
Incredible steak tacos.

Stopped in for two steak tacos, which come standard with onion & cilantro (I also added avocado). They were tasty, and ready in under 60 seconds, which is probably a record for Chicago-area taquerias I've visited, and also indicates that they had the steak already cooked & ready--which some might say isn't a good thing.The tacos were tasty, but I have to give them a low rating because they don't serve free water. I'm of the belief that any restaurant should let you have a glass of water for free, but these guys want to push bottled drinks on you. That's unacceptable, and they lose two stars for it.

Amazing food. Definitely more expensive than I would have thought and cash only. Burritos were very good and came out quickly. Guacamole was decent. Service is great. Very few seats so more of a take out joint or eat quickly. Again, pricier than expected

Like I said.....4.5 Yelp stars don't lie and neither does my aunt when she says the barbacoa tacos are exactly the way she used to get them in el DF. So naturally that's what I got during my taco crawl.  Actually a lot of my fellow crawlers got barbacoa and from what they said, they enjoyed them as well.The tacos were made the way they were meant to be eaten, juicy and fatty. I, being the picky little brat I am, picket out the fat and put some of their delicious salsa on it. Along with the cilantro, cebollas, sal y limon, this taco was the BOMBA! Yea, I couldn't say that in English, it wouldn't do it justice. I've also had the carne asada tacos and cecina tacos, those are equally tasty.The multi-tasking cooks (cooks, waiters, cashiers, busboys) were so nice, they're the only ones running the joint and they're doing a perfect job. Yes, it's a small joint and by small, I mean small. But we all fit there! I was shocked.I've only been there twice but I have a feeling I'll be going there as much as possible.

This is one of my favorite places in the city to get Tacos.Arrechetta Steak tacos are #1 thing here in my book. So juicy and have a great off the grill and straight from mexico taste.A free bowl soup is always a great as well.If you have time please try the "Chile Relleno" taco/torta dinner--It is a dream!My friend always orders the Shrimp cocktail and it looks fabulous :-)

The next step on my "taco quest" brought me here.  All i can say is Wow.  I definitely understand the yelp reviews here. The place is small with limited counter seating but it packs a punch.  (Note: It can get a bit crowded inside.) While it may not be the cheapest taco in the area, it is delicious and full of flavor.  My favorite is probably the asada or pastor.  They both have so much flavor.  The simple preparation with onions and cilantro lets the meat shine.  The tomato like soup they brought with the tacos were also amazing.  Service is good.  Yo quiero más tacos from here!

Once again this place has done it again.  Quick tacos and awesome taste. It has a 2 car loading zone for a quick pick up.  CASH ONLY.Taco are reasonably priced.  I guess their dinner menu could be priced better.  They do have a dine in option for a few guest.Customer service is good.

Yo, this place is the truth! You can't go wrong with any choice and the ambiance kills. I been driving around my city turning my nose up at all my local Mexican restaurants since I visited this one.
