They have every variation of hoisin and fish sauce you can find but I guess most people wouldn't like the smell of strong fish sauce so it had to be very diluted.They were really smart to bring this concept to a busy section of Lp. And it's a good bowl of soup if convenient, but not really worth it if something else is nearby. Or if you really want no frills good pho.

I`m going to start my review off by saying that I got this via postmates- so I do always like to give restaurants the benefit of the doubt when coming through non-direct delivery services. BUT. Frankly, I was disappointed. I felt it was a bit too salty of a broth, and the chicken had zero flavor. Some of the highlights were the quantity of vegetables provided (a plethora) and I really liked the mushrooms I had added on. It also wasn't super pricey.I`ve yet to find a great pho place in Chicago that lives up to the ones I had in LA. Would I come back to fuh? If everyone else was going- I wouldn't put up a fight, but otherwise I would probably order from elsewhere.

Not the best Pho I've ever had.  It was fine but not super flavorful.We ordered on the phone and we're going off of an order sheet online (it's basically a chipotle style Pho place) and we told the girl what we wanted to go.  She didn't listen to us and gave us everything.  Luckily it's on the side but it really didn't make sense to waste our time if she was just going to put everything in both our soups anyway.We also ordered the egg rolls which were good.  I'll come back and try again. They were quick with the orders and had great service.

I have been waiting for my food for two and a half hours. They said their system was down and they didn't get my order thrudelivery.comWhich is what you have to use via Yelp. I call there twice and they still have yet to really apologize OR give me an update on when my food will behere.WTF. I calldelivery.comcustomer service and they tell me the restaurant is just not familiar with the app. WHY DO THEY HAVE IT IF THEY DONT KNOW HOW TO USE IT?! I want a refund, who knows if they will even be able to give itto me... Or if my food is ever coming.UPDATE: the food got here after three hours. The order was wrong. I ordered chicken pho w chicken broth and they brought me beef w vegetable. Food was very bland and they did not provide ANY sauces. They also did not give me chopsticks which I specifically asked for in the comments. Food was bland on top of it all probably BC they don't provide you with any. Will never be ordering from here again. So it was $42 for a totally incorrect order, no sauce, and it took 3 hours to get to me. If all that wasn't bad enough, the next day when i check out my leftovers the "broth" was completely dried up and i basically was looking at a cup of just rice noodles. GROSS!!!Will NEVER be ordering from this place again and advise you not to either.

Probably one of the best pho's outside of Argyle I have had. The concept mimics Chipotle, you go down the line adding whatever you wanted to your initial noodle and meat selection. Customization at it's finest!The beef broth itself was flavorful but found to be on the oily side. I added brisket and and beef balls to my pho, and damnn, the brisket was soft and cooked perfectly. Falls apart just by touching it!! The amount of additional toppings you could add to your pho blew me away, I wanted everything in obscene amounts. This option was preferable to the small amount of toppings they usually give you at pho restaurants especially when you are in a group of people. The dipping sauces other then hoisin and and hot sauces were a good change from the norms, loving the fusion.At first I was skeptical that a place in Lincoln could make pho in a assembly line fashion, but after trying it I'm a fan. Would definitely come back to try the other sauces. Lesson learned, good food can come in all forms and in the most unexpected places. Happy munching!Ordered:1. Rice noodles2. Beef protein (brisket and beef balls)3. Added: bean sprouts, mint, basil, cilantro, jalapenos, green onions4. Used pineapple habanero hoisin sauce!!!!!!! TRY THIS!!!

The casualization of Pho has now arrived to Lincoln Park at Fuh!Here you can get your Pho craving quick, easy and customized, chipotle style. Got the rare steak (came in one large chunk, hard to separate and a small portion), noodles were subpar, and lots of tasty fixings (fried garlic, fried onions, mint, etc.). The broth really surprised me with its rich, full flavors so that was a huge plus. They also have some fun sauces on the side that you can use to level up your pho. The portions overall are small and make you feel jipped  when you know you usually eat almost double the amount, but that's the price of convenience, i guess. Seating is small and narrow.Overall, fuh is an approachable pho place nearby, but come with the expectation that there are some sacrifices to pay with the easier commute.

Pro:-select everything from meat to topping whatever you want for your noodle soup- affordable price, around $10- their broth is really good and their veggies are fresh- the name is "FUHHHHH"-ing cool, so unique!Con:- portion of the food is really small, not enough for meOh and feel free to use their sauces to add flavor to your soup :) love their sauces
The broth, vegetables, rice noodles are very mediocre. This restaurant only sells for its Chipolie-type concept--choosing the materials and mixing them together. Will never come back.

It's not "Foe" or "Foo"--  it's FUH! Once an Edzo's, the fast casual assembly line concept has now infiltrated vietnamese food. At first, I was a little hesitant to enter the shop because eating pho has always been a risky endeavor. Why? Peanut allergies. The last time I was on Argyle having pho, my face turned splotchy, beet red just from neighboring peanut powders and garnishes. Alas, a place that I can have pho and feel relatively safe knowing that the peanuts are well contained as an optional sauce.Vegetarians, vegans and carnivores rejoice! There's options aplenty!Pick your veg and main proteins:-Mushrooms (they had two kinds that day)-Chicken-Brisket-Meatball-Tofu-Flank SteakThen pick your broth:-Chicken-Beef-VeganGarnishes (too many to remember):-Beansprouts-Peppers-Red/White Onions-Jalapeños-Green Onions-Carrots-Mint-Cilantro-Basil-Fried shallots//GarlicDown the line you can order extras like egg rolls, their asian "churro", vietnamese coffee, or a cold beverage. Their sauces range from the traditional such as fish sauce, hoisin, sriracha to funky like apple ginger, mango serrano and peanut coconut.I got a tofu and flank steak on my beef broth with the traditional garnishes of basil-green onion-cilantro-beansprouts and lime. I've braved some awesome pho (::wink wink:: Ca Dao in San Diego) and also some lackluster pho (::cough cough:: Saigon Sister). This is not the place if you're in the mood for tripe with other exotic entrails. Save that for Argyle. Fuh is fast, straightforward, serving up great bowls of pho, one customization at a time. As for me, I'm a fan of any place where I can have delicious vietnamese food and leave with my face intact.

Made to order pho by you! Great idea and great ambience. I gave pho 3 stars and up another star because of its interior and ambience. First the Pho. The noodle was cooked just right and not soggy.Pho to me is all in the broth! I have had better pho broth and then I have had worse pho.I love the idea that you can special order your pho to your liking. You want pho ga ( chicken pho) they have it. You want pho with tofu or mushrooms or both, they got those too. And of course your usual beef brisket, pulled beef ( not in traditional pho), rare steak, and beef meatball. However if you are one of those pho connoisseur looking for tripe and tendons like in pho dac biet, you will not find it here. And there is only one size pho bowl. Sorry , those of you looking for XL bowl eat two bowls :)I love the clean and hip decor. That in itself is a star.If you come here for the beef pho( cannot say about the chicken or vegetarian pho) it is 3 stars but pho and ambience, a 4.

I had never had Fuh before but my friends are all convinced it's the best hangover cure. I figured eh why not? This place is Delicious! The owner completely hooked us up and gave us a whole run down on what traditional Fuh is and what he recommended for us. It was incredibleMy friend Taylor is gluten free and they had all the ingredients to accommodate her. Meanwhile I got the traditional beef and beef broth -- I joined the clean plate club because I have no self control and it was so good but my friends had some to take home! Portion sizes were great. Looking forward to heading back when I'm not hungover too!

This pho place is definitely unique and much appreciated! Everyone working there was very friendly and welcoming!I ordered the Fuh Noodle Soup for $8.95, which is a bit pricey in comparison to other pho places, but for the experience and flavor, it was totally worth it!I chose to have chicken as my protein with the chicken broth in my bowl along with every veggie/herb offered except for cilantro, basil, and jalapeños. The amount of noodles in the bowl were very filling and the chicken was super tender and perfect for dipping into all of the yummy sauces offered!Everyone should try the sauces there!My friend ordered the shiitake mushrooms as her protein and they were super delicious! She also asked for the vegan soup and it was still packed with flavor!This place is definitely worth checking out and I will for sure be back!

PROS-fast casual atmosphere and great concept. Kind of like naf naf or chipotle where you get to customize and eat as quickly as you want. You can also eat by yourself and it wouldn't be weird-the extras like Chinese broccoli, fried garlic, mint, and carrots aren't typically options in other pho places I've been, so that was a nice touch-extra noodles for no extra charge!-service was detail oriented and very friendlyCONS-I grew up loving pho so my standards are higher, but usually it's the broth that makes or breaks the dish. The beef broth I had here was good, but not as flavorful as authentic Vietnamese placesI would probably come here again with friends but not if I'm craving authentic pho. It's like chipotle... Really good but not unless you've had authentic Mexican.

We wandered here on a weekend evening after visiting Zoolights; it was about a 10+ min walk from the zoo.I like the idea of a DIY soup place. They had signage that explained how to order, plus the server was very helpful too. There was also a suggested menu board, for those who need some inspiration or dont want to bother picking out each ingredient.I got the standard pho. The broth could have used more flavor, and it was quite skimpy on the meat (I had maybe 4 of the thincut ribeye stuck together, and that was about it). My husband got one of their other pre-designed soups. I was hesitant about the idea of brisket and pulled pork; I think it was, perhaps I was thinking of Southern BBQ, but it actually worked really well in the soup. He also had more of a generous portion of meat.The place also had a good variety of sauces, and they mentioned that the spicy garlic sauce was actually house made. I also was excited to see a pineapple habenero hoisin sauce that was unique too.The place was a bit pricey and smaller portion for your standard pho bowl, but it seems more like it's marketing to a different population. I'd give it a 3.5 stars, but bumped it up a notch because the guys working there were very friendly and helpful, and seemed to take pride in what they do, which is great!
Cheap, fast, and fresh. What else could you ask for?The noodles are chewy and good. All the toppings are fresh (I'd recommend getting all of them). The vegan broth is delicious.

We travelled all the way from Miami just for Fuh! Actually here for work, but 2nd time at Fuh and our go-to spot when in Chicago. One of the best places for Pho we have found. Think of it as a Moe's for Pho.
It wasn't bad but honestly I don't see why people rave about this place and give the 5 stars. The food certainly wasn't spectacularly delicious. I have had better Vietnamese style food elsewhere.

Ordered from grub hub. Paid extra for beef. Got chicken. Didn't feel like wasting what they sent and dealing with all that. My bad. What I got wasn't very good (after all, it was bland, boiled, white meat chicken). It was also kind of cold. I had to nuke the broth to make it edible. I didn't finish it and had to throw most of it out. That's a first for me.  Would also have preferred some chopsticks, but I guess that's a relatively minor complaint in the grand scheme of things. Overall, not a great first impression.The search for proper pho south of Irving Park continues...

LOVE this place, came in here because I had a giftie and have been back many times since then. there's a lot of great pho places in chicago, this place is conveniently close to me and i love the format of picking your ingredients, and being able to be in & out of the restaurant within 20 minutes. i'm usually out to eat if i am in a rush, this is pretty much the chipotle of vietmanese but way better.

The food: 3.5/5. It's a pretty decent pho that can be customized, but it's nowhere as good and cheap as what you'd find at Argyle. I paid $26 after tax&tip for two bowls, which is a bit pricey considering the portion was pretty skimpy on the meat and greens. The broth could use a little salt. It's definitely better than Banh mi&Co and Ba Le, but Fuh also doesn't have much else on the menu. I was disappointed they were sold out of spring rolls at 7pm on a Wednesday night.The service: 2/5. It seemed the employee who helped me has never tasted pho himself. I asked if they had regular hoisin sauce, and he said it doesn't come like that, but only in the mango habanero flavor they had. Really? Because I found two bottles of regular hoisin at the condiments table a foot away.Overall: 3/5. It's a decent pho spot and I'd probably stop by every once in a while if I lived around, but if you have to commute there, go to Argyle instead to get better pho for cheaper.

This was a solid Pho choice while in Chicago. I was really impressed with the selection of add-ins such as protein, veggies,noodle, & you can even choose a broth! This is a one of a kind quick serve place and Pho is good on a hot or cold day, it really doesn't matter! Pho is always the best choice, especially when you don't know what to eat. That's how I feel anyway, I can never turn down delicious hot soup with tender meatballs. However, since this isn't my local Pho place, I highly suggest any local reading this to make it theirs. The owners pride themselves on this broth, one of them came over to our group to talk about the broth and the purpose behind Fuh.inside, its trendy and has that hipster vibe with the rustic lights and the exposed brick walls. High top tables and bar seats are all around. And don't forget to try all of the sauces, you're bound to enjoy at least one or two, or three...

A perfect place on a rainy or cold winter day to have some total body warming good pho.  This place does one thing and does it well.  It doesn't have the full range of vietnamese food of a full blown restaurant, so don't expect to have anything other than pho.  That being said, you can order one of the suggested combinations or create your own by choosing a broth, sauce, protein, vegetables and herbs.  I really liked the sauces and portions are generous.Decor is also nice to sit and eat there - red stools and metal chairs matched with dark reclaimed wood.Note:  It can be difficult to get in/out with a stroller, but the staff are super helpful if you decide you want to give it go.

Create your own pho and very vegetarian/vegan friendly! It was our first time there and the staff was really helpful. The portions were the perfect size, just enough to fill you up. The atmosphere was great. The place was pretty laid-back and it was surprisingly clean.The peanut sauce with hoisin and coconut milk was to die for. Definitely get this sauce if you go!My boyfriend got the beef brisket and he thought the seasoning was amazing. The pieces were huge and really thick. He said he would definitely recommend for meat eaters.The chopsticks were really slipper though...hard to eat with but thankfully they had wooden ones too.

OMG this was the worst Pho I have ever eaten! My boyfriend and I were visiting family in the area and ventured out on a very cold night thinking Pho would be the perfect remedy for the cold... NOPE.First off, it's not worth it for the price, you only get a tiny amount of meat and it is not a very large bowl. The veggies are not fresh. Normally I get bean sprouts, but these were BROWN, the onions were discolored, and the greens were soggy from sitting out. Also the girl that helped us got the rice noodles out of a plastic tub with her bare hands before putting her gloves on.It resembles a subway in the fact that all of the ingredients are sitting out in the open and you choose what goes in, but it was not working since the veggies were not fresh.Also, the broth.... it was disgusting. I have had some amazing Pho, and the trick is in the broth, there has to be a significant taste of ox tail, and it was not present. It tasted like bouillon from the grocery store.The place was very clean, and I liked the modern decor, but the food was not on point.

It's chipotle for pho. Simple. Easy. Delicious.I got the beef pho with rare steak. it's the best (for me anyway)- I think they charge you extra for more protein which is the downside since you can go to any other Pho place and get any amount of protein for the same price (speaking relatively)- but I get it, they're a new business so they need to pay the bills. It's also all stools -- which I'm not a fan of but I guess you're leaning over your bowl anyway eating those sexy noodles. I recommend it. I think it's a nice "Intro to Pho" for people who have never had it. There are also different dishes there- saw some customers get it but I think the pho looked more delicious haha.

Cute place in LP with a chipotle style ordering system where you can choose your protein, broth and toppings for pho.Flavors are pretty spot on and the portions are sufficient for 1 person. I really liked how the ingredients are fresh and you can see/taste the difference.I did not really enjoy the Vietnamese coffee so I would recommend against that if you're expecting the sweet stuff from other pho restaurants.Overall this is a great alternative to going to Chinatown or argyle - I will definitely come back.

It's official...the fast casual concept has infiltrated every food category now. This Fuh-potle place takes getting your rice noodle on to the power of quick and easy.Step 1: Pick between chicken, flank steak, rare steak, tofu, and mushroomsStep 2: Add your choice of fixensStep 3: Coordinate brothStep 4: Pay under $10 bucks for a bowl of Pho that you'll get in under 5 minutes flat.Step 5: Pat yourself on the back for a cheap, fast, and delicious way to satiate a craving for noodle soup.

Second time eating Pho and each time it tastes better. Was in the lincoln park area and the craving hit me hard, these guys had good reviews so I checked them out.I had the three beef pho soup and got to choose my own ingredients . I chose green onions, basil, bean sprout, cabbage, cilantro, and extra jalapeños. Lime and hoisin sauce on the side.The rare steak is super tender and juicy, the shredded beef was amazingly flavored too and enhanced the soups flavor! The broth was super sweet and salty, and a good portion. I actually ordered a second bowl of broth to take with me for a leftovers round.
Phaaaaaaabulous. Fresh ingredients, friendly owners, and a chiq modern decore make this a must stop lunch spot for anyone craving a delicious bowl of herb filled goodness.

First time trying Fuh (the food and the restaurant) and I was very impressed.All of the ingredients are fresh, broth is homemade and delicious. Oh and you get a TON of food for just under $10 a bowl. Eggs rolls are top notch as well. I will be returning often.

Great modern Pho place!! The owner is a great person who cares about his establishment and customers. The spring roll has a twist to it which is very nice and the Pho is amazing!!!!!!! Great environment and atmosphere here, a great place to have lunch. I would recommend to friends and fam.

Amazing service, amazing food. So glad we stumbled across this place. Chipotle style but with Pho. So Fuhking genius.I really enjoyed my meal. The sauces are very good and I thought the broth was done very well. Would've liked a little more meat but overall a great experience!

Do not let the fast food, Chipotle style concept fool you - this is damn good pho, and a very pleasant overall experience.The service was excellent.  I was helped by the proprietor who seemed genuinely excited to be explaining the menu, the concept, and the ordering process to me.  There are a lot of great looking non-traditional options but i opted for a fairly traditional bowl of pho.  How else was I to measure the quality of a pho place?!  I did opt to add the pulled beef (it was delightful) in addition to the traditional rare beef, which was beautifully tender.  When I was done putting together my bowl he suggested I add some fish sauce if I like the traditional flavor of pho.  They leave it out of the broth to accomodate people with seafood allergies and because it is more aromatic added at the end anyway.  I have to agree with that assessment, and really I usually add some anyway!  This was some of the best pho I've had, and the price:portion ratio is a great deal!The egg rolls were also very good but that's just a bonus.  If you've got a craving for pho like I did, make your way down to Fuh.As a side note,  it is very cringey that one of the featured reviews, while positive, calls this 'ramen.'  Ramen is delicious in its own right but has about as much in common with pho as it does with spaghetti.   Get it together man!

This place is awesome and the owner is a really cool guy! Traditional pho with a cool modern twist, simple menu, you pick what goes in your pho or on your noodles. I wish I lived in Chicago so I could come here all the time

FAST CASUAL PHO SIGN ME UP! Came in on a sunday, and did the BYObowl. Amazing. Get the rare steak - cooks to medium once broth is poured in (and the vegan broth is TASTY). The staff is friendly and knowledgable, and will walk you through the schtick if you've never been. The pineapple habanero hoisin is freakin' awesome, and you can customize your spice with fresh red chili pasta and sriracha (but I recommed getting the fresh jalapeno, as well). The servings are HUGE (deff enough for two small lunches or a dinner and snack), but I decided to treat myself and ate the whole bowl. Oops. Oh an all for less than 10 bucks?!?!  I will be back for sure!

I absolutely LOVE this little place! It's like the Pho version of Chipotle! Go down the line and pick the type of broth, protein, veggies and toppings you want in your pho and commence to shoving your face with this delicousness! I stumbled upon this place when heading to an appointment right down from here and was so glad I popped in to try it. I am obsessed with pho and everything here is super fresh and the staff is so friendly! I got a veggie pho with mushrooms and tons of veggies making it vegan. Loved it!

Excellent job so far Fuh!!!! Came in with my son for a quick bite after Oz park and the noodle bowl was great. My son (along with most 8 year-olds) does not like a TON of veggies on his noodles/in his pho and it's ABOUT TIME a place opened where you can control exactly what goes in your bowl!!!! Fuh is a one-of-a-kind concept so the best analogy I can give you is think Vietnamese and then think Chipotle.Now....mix the two and you have Fuh. Best of luck as you get a feel for the neighborhood and don't change a bit!!!! Big $$$$ is coming your way....as long as you keep it real. Fuh is very different than Tank, Ramen San, Slurping Turtle etc.. so comparing is really not fair or accurate.Suggestions to Fuh:1) Have a few of the more popular condiments at each table. Sometimes a bowl of Pho may take a couple of additional "hits" as you get to the bottom!2) Widen your drink selection.3) Add some tables to the right side of restaurant (as you enter)...seems like wasted space.

It took an hour and a half to get our food. I called after an hour and they said their driver wasn't picking up and that he would throw in a tofu wrap and 2 cokes as a remedy. Food finally came and both my order and my husband's order was wrong and we were missing an item. On top of whatever we ended up receiving which was basically mushrooms and noodles, it didn't taste good.

This place prepares its food in a similar way as Chipotle. You get in line and get to choose what you want in your pho. You get your food fast and then you sit at a high table on stools. I had the classic pho and it was pretty good. I was also full after the meal, which is always a plus. The reason why I gave this restaurant 3 stars is because I prefer a more traditional pho. I wanted to go to a sit down restaurant where a waiter takes my order and delivers my food. I also like seats with back support but that really wasn't a big deal. More important, I like my pho with a number of different types of thinly cut meats. At Fuh, I got a single piece of pretty thick beef that wasn't that tasty. It was definitely different than any pho meat I've ever gotten. In addition to that, I like being given a plate of bean sprouts, mint, jalapenos, and lime to put into the pho in the portions that I like throughout my meal. At Fuh, all the ingredients are put in when you order and so I lose that aspect of eating pho that I love. Just to be clear though, you can ask for extra or less of what goes into your pho. My friend put it best when he said that Fuh hit the craving but not the spot. The pho is good but not quite everything you want if you're used to or want a more traditional pho.
Greatest soup. Nice combination, and very fresh(If you don't like soups usually-like me- you have to try this place)
Place is simply just awesome build your own bowl. meat is of good quality and their apps are just as good especially their spring rolls and egg rolls.

This is phu-real! Vietnamese owned and super friendly owner. Great "chipotle" style but for pho. Coming from a Viet person, I've never eaten pho noodles for vermicelli Buon dishes, but don't judge it until you try it. Go for all sauces! And the pulled beef is phenomenal and tender! You can chose 2 types of meat for same price.

I am very impressed with their beef broth- more flavorful than a few authentic Vietnamese restaurants I've been to. It didn't leave me with that thirsty feeling afterwards, in other words there wasn't any MSG in the broth.I didn't go crazy with customizing my pho with kale or carrots. I just stuck with the traditional beansprouts, basil, cilantro, and onions with rare steak. I love that I can ask for extra broth and beansprouts. Overall, this place is awesome and I would definitely go back!

Great pho in Chicago!  Came here with the family and it did not disappoint.  This is a Pho only place with some egg rolls and spring rolls offered.  The broth was well seasoned, not too salty.  A chicken broth was an option.  Noodles were good.  The meats were good quality.  You have the option to put whatever garnish (basil, cilantro, green onions, jalapeños etc) you like on your soup.  Pho is simple food but making the broth takes time and skill.  This place is on point.  Service is great and I will come back here soon.

I've tried Pho from a few different places both in the city and suburbs and i have to say that this place is hands down the best i've had so far. I've come here a few times already and as long as they remain in business and the Pho is consistently as good as its been, i'll be coming here every chance I get, It's that good!! Please open another spot in Wicker Park. I'm convinced your business will flourish here.
Great concept! I come here whenever I'm looking for something tasty, quick, and affordable. My favorite is the beef brisket. Highly recommend!

This is such a great concept. Kudos to the owner! I love pho. Beside simply it, there's not many Vietnamese restaurant in the neighborhood. The beef broth was tasty, I'll have to try the other broths next time.

First time ever having Pho and this place has me hooked. It's set up where you can choose all your own ingredients and then they make it for you right behind the counter. Well I guess they just put it all together for you, behind the counter, but you get what I mean.Anyway... I ordered the Chicken broth pho and added chicken and mushrooms and all the veggies. The broth was great. Perfect cure for my insane hangover. I felt like a new woman 3 spoonfuls into my pho. I was sweating and my nose was running, and I loved every second of it.The guys working behind the counter were super friendly and helpful. I will be frequenting Fuh on the regular, honestly I am hooked! Welcome to the neighborhood guys!

love the concept of moving down the line and adding whatever you want.. I also like the amount of meat they put in there vs normal pho restaurants..I got beef brisket, meat balls, rare steak?, few types of veggies with chicken broth..the meat was ok.. in my opinion i think the beef brisket is cut alil too thick and the rare steak is too thin.. also i did not like the noodles.. it was hard like it wasn't cooked long enough?other then that.. I think the broth was pretty good and I like the portion size..
I loved my bowl of pho.  Everything was fresh, meat was flavorful,  noodles were perfectly cooked. I loved the peach tea. No complaints at all. I'd definitely come back.
My stomach could not be happier! And that pineapple habanero hoisin sauce..,Oh man I'll take a cup of that just for drinking!
Love this new PHO concept! You can choose everything you want in your own bowl and the taste is very authentic.
Great service.  They really took their time to walk me through creating my own dish.  Fresh tasting food that ended with me not feeling unpleasantly full.  I'll be back for the pulled beef.

More of a 3.5.Love the concept and service was great.I got the beef brisket pho with beef broth with every garnish. Right away, I noticed the small amount of noodles and meat given. However, being able to get all the toppings without extra charge made up for it. The brisket was pretty good along with the broth. However, the noodles is what prevents this from being four stars. It was pretty hard and somewhat uncooked, which was unpleasant. I can deal with 'al dente' even though it's not common in Asian noodles, but this was not even the case.I did enjoy the various sauces and the veggie/vegan friendly options.Overall, Fuh did not quite satisfy my pho fix, but it did suffice for dinner. Decent option and probably would come back some time.

Pho, Chipotle style. Pick your noodles, type of protein,veggies and broth. Awesome. I'm a picky eater so having the choice to select what I want was great. I had the chicken pho which was super soft and no broth. Instead of bean sprouts, I requested cabbage (which is way better, IMHO). Nice selection of craft sodas too!I know the owners and I know they will make each bowl just perfect for you. They are really new so there may be kinks to iron out, but it's worth a try!
I got the pulled beef and beef broth with everything in it. I'm so happy the dude was nice at a nice price I'm so full and might take some as leftovers! woo.
Go! Fantastic options to build your own. All 3 in my family enjoyed what we got. If we lived in Chicago we'd soon be regulars.

Pho is probably my favorite kind of soup in the world and I've had more bowls of it than I care to admit. I heard about a Chipotle-esque Pho place opening in Lincoln Park of all places so it was in order for a visit.The interior is nice but not overpowering or anything, and made from some good wood. All the workers were pretty enthusiastic which made everything a little better. You can tell they care about the business.As far as the pho goes, there's a lot of customization here. I was told the point is that the broth is made a little clearer than normal (not as much spice but still not bad at all) to allow for more customization. For me, it need a tad bit more salt until I added some sriracha to the mix. My suggestion to them is to have some salt (not normal table salt) on the side for someone who doesn't like to put a lot of stuff in it.Regardless, I thought the pho was pretty good. You can tell the broth was cooked for hours on end and not from some spice cube you can buy at the market. When the guy opened the container full of beef broth, you could see the bones floating in there. Good!I'll be back - one of the better bowls I've had in town. Lincoln Park should feel lucky this place is there.

4.5 stars.It is Chipotle for Pho - fantastic concept. And pretty darn good pho for a fast food place.I got the vegetarian broth pho and hubby got the noodle dish with Pineapple habanero sauce. Both of them were delicious. The pho more than the noodles - because the noodles get kind of dry, but they have bottles of various sauces that you can help yourself with and my hubby was given a small cup of veggie broth on the side as well. As for the pho, it is a little bit salty - but oh so flavorful. The concept of making your own bowl of soup is awesome. I just wish that htey had more vegetable options like steamed broccoli or bokchoy, but otherwise I loved the pho. The fried tofu was greasy - so the next time i go I will skip that. Its perfect bowlful of goodness for a cold, foggy night. The portions are generous, I had leftover pho enough for next nights dinner.

This is a semi-fast food restaurant. I would say it's the pho version of chipotle. Anyways, the food was good and there are plenty of options to choose from. I got the cilantro chicken with beef stock. I would recommend it if you're looking for good food but not too formal.
Some of the best pho in the city. Packed with flavor and you get to choose your own fillings. I would definitely come back to this place again.

My first Pho! I loved that they had so many broth and topping options. I've avoided trying pho all these years because of dietary restrictions, but this chipotle-style Fuh lets you pick and choose all sorts of toppings. The Asian Churros dessert is delicious as well - go with the condensed milk!

This place is freaking delicious. While the concept of BYO ramen is awesome, the food actually lives up to the awesome concept. I am a big fan of the pulled beef, and topping things off with fried garlic is always a plus. Love all the self-serve sauce options as well. Additionally, the staff is friendly, and the atmosphere is nice. I suggest stopping by this place any time, but especially on a cold evening when you need some ramen to warm you up.

Stopped in for a quick lunch by myself and could not have been happier. I had the traditional pho and it was flavorful and very fresh. The owner was there and we chatted a bit about how he favors his pho broth. Super friendly guy who cares a great deal about his food.

Service was lovely but the noodles were a huge disappointment. My rice noodles were very mushy and the portion was tiny. I did get delicious meatballs and lots of veggies, but the noodles just weren't there.

SO good. My first time.The man behind the counter - maybe the owner -  was so helpful and nice...and the chicken pho was really wonderful (I had almost ALL the veggies(.. $9 for a bowl of soup may be a wee bit pricey but it was quite yummy and oh so fresh and I even took a bit of it home. I'll go again!

I love pho. Like "I could eat it every single day for the rest of my life" kind of love. But Fuh is just so disappointing! Their beef broth is not bad, but everything else about their pho is just incredibly Americanized and not authentic at all. The beef pho comes with barely any beef. And where's the tendon and tripe?? For $10 you are mainly getting a large bowl of noodles.The only reason I am giving them two stars is because they are in Lincoln Park and two blocks away from me.

Delicious and clean.  My favorite combo.  I eat a lot of vietnamese pho in California, so I was pleasantly surprised Fuh was on yelp.  Bless these brothers for providing hot noodle soup on a cold windy Chicago day.  Don't hesitate to come here to eat!
Pho in chicago sucks. I was hoping this would prove me wrong but no dice. This place is better than than other "fast food" pho places in the city but it's definitely worse than Tank Noodles.

I've been to many pho places in Chicago, hands down this is the best one!The online ordering was super easy.  I went to pick up my order and the place was very clean! There was a custom sauce area where you could take what ever sauce you wanted home!I will be back

I got the beef meatball pho and it was amazing. The meatballs are great quality and the broth was amazing. You can add all different kinds of veggies and they have a great assortment of unique sauces as well. Highly recommend this place!
My husband like the rice noodle! I like beef soup a lot and the iced coffee egg roll are amazing

I was pretty excited about trying out a new pho place, particularly if it had just recently opened.  You get to pick your protein, other ingredients, and sauce (if desired).  Overall, the pho was good.  What really makes or breaks pho, I would say, is the broth. I had the beef broth which was pretty legit and reminiscent of the quality at Tank.  I picked the beef to go with it as my protein.  The quantity wasn't as much as I would have anticipated, although it is cheaper than Tank - but you do get less.  I also ordered the Vietnamese coffee which was also quite good.

Amazing Yelp reviews so we tried it tonight. Oh yeah. It was good. They start you with a bowl of noodles. You tell them what meats and veggies you want (one meat for that price- unlimited veggies) then when you get it just right you pick a broth and they pour the heaven right over it. Mint leaves, arugula, cabbages...and all the traditional herbs and veggies too. You want five limes and ten jalapeño slices?  You got it. The broths have simmered for fourteen hours. Three kinds. Beef, veggie, or chicken. Fourteen. Hours.If all that doesn't make you want to eat here (and you should), nothing will.

PHO "Chipotle style" The best way to eat your pho is when you get to pick any proteins with the choice of chicken or beef and veggies to go into your hot bowl of noodle soup. They also have vegan broth.  Everything was so delicious, I got the beef broth and it was full of flavor!Don't forget to stop by to have a bowl of FUH when you are in the area!

The Pho was just okay; the broth was solid but something was just missing from the bowl itself. The service was really good though and they were patient. I also did not care for the Spring rolls too much; they were not very flavorful.

Tasted healthy with lots of veggie.  It doesn't taste like they use too much MSG .  But I have a friend who owns a Vietnamese restaurant once told me that it's impossible to make pho without MSG,  otherwise the soup would get cloudy. I'm trying to eat healthy and curious if that's true.
I love this place! I get the beef broth bowl with rice noodles, brisket and various veggies. Staff are also very nice and fast!

Hooked on FUH! Very unique dining spot, as you can choose what you want in each bowl. Their meats are so flavorful, mushrooms are fantastic, broth is always on point, and the options of veggies are wonderful. They even have a great assortment of homemade sauces to choose from.Service is great, food is great, music is great, and ambiance is great!Definitely my go-to spot for my Pho cravings!

I'm making my rating upon my selection of the classic bowl of pho... I'm vietnamese, I've had pho since I was in my momma's belly.  When I was going down the pick your ingredient line, I had to really hold it in to not scoff at the thought of adding chinese broccoli or cabbage or mushrooms into the bowl...So I made my bowl and biggest complaint is the beef broth lacks the depth of flavor of what pho is all about.  I want to appreciate the concept, I think it's a fun concept and I'm all about sharing with the world what Pho is all about, but gotta get the broth better!Experimented with the various sauces, didn't find anything that moved me, except the housemade sambal which is apparently created by the owner's dad -- legitly tasty stuff.  I added that to my "Fuh" and it made it exponentially tastier.The proteins we tried (beef meatballs and brisket) were very tasty.Overall, it's a fun concept as a neighborhood noodle spot.  Prices are right for lincoln park.  Just wish the beef broth (which is the heart of the soup) had more depth.
Just for the coffee..Tried Thai iced coffee. .. on sunny day.. and it was great. Iced pure coffee with a bit of sugar..If you are nearby .must visit and try this coffee..

I ordered pad see Ewe, it taste terrible.. waitress she didn't  even replace the dish and she started arguing as if it taste really good..Taste fishy, terrible ( they didn't  add fish sauce in the dish) it just sweet soy sauce  that taste terrible..Worst costumer service ever.. I will never ever visit this place again..Two stars-- for other dishes which we ordered and for her serviceCompulsory Tips --- worse than any otherPlease no to this place

I dined in here with a date and we had Crispy Pad See Ewe and the Lad Nar along with spring rolls for an appetizer. The food was solid. Nothing extraordinary but certainly not bad either. We both went with "spicy" when asked what kind of heat we wanted. I think what we got was "white people spicy" because there really was no heat!Portion sizes were not as huge as some places... Didn't have any leftovers, but wasn't completely stuffed either which was ok by me (left room for dessert down the street).The dining room isn't particularly fancy but it's nice for a quick dinner and staff seemed friendly and attentive but not all up in my face every ten minutes. Probably would go here again, but for take-out instead.

I'm a little spoiled by really good thai food where I'm from (houston) so this place didn't quite live up to my expectations but it's decent enough.this review is for a to-go order so can't comment on service or dining in house. the restaurant seems pretty small and no frills though. easy to call in to place your order then pick up and pay. i tried both the tofu pad thai and the chicken pad thai ($8.75 each) - Stir fried thin noodles, choice of meat, bean sprouts, eggs, green onions and tamarind sauce topped with ground peanuts and vegetables. they come in little plastic to go containers.I order without bean sprouts because I don't like them. and then I add the entire little chili container they include with your order because I like my pad thai spicy! not sure if you can ask them to customize the spicy level for you but it definitely was not spicy as cooked. noodles were a bit on the softer/mushier side. flavor was ok but could be better. like I said, a solid dish, just not amazing.

There's plenty of options for thai food on taylor st, and I think Golden Thai's been my go to just cause it's a bit closer to the medical district than yummy thai and thai bowl, and luckily the food here is quite good and a solid spot for take out.I've had their Golden Thai Fried Rice which comes packed with basil and pineapple, making a flavorful dish.Their fried Tofu Panang Curry is nice, peanutty and has a pretty good amount of tofu in it. Only knock against the place is that their pad see ewe was overly sweet and the noodles a little too soft for my liking.In the end, Golden Thai knows how to cater to its customers with heavy flavors and decent portion sizes. A huge plus is that nothing is too expensive considering most of the people that dine here are probably students. Reasonable prices + tasty food is a win.

Went here for the first time. I only ordered the panang curry so this review is only based on that. I loved it. I've tried a lot of Thai places in the city, and they served the best panang curry I've had thus far. It was full of veggies and meat and chopped peanuts...and of course, yummy. I will be going back to try other items. I looked around the restaurant, which was packed and EVERYTHING looked really good. I'm ready to become a fat kid at this place.

Golden Experience at Golden ThaiIndulging in a new tradition of empty nesters, we've been ordering out for the Holidays instead of going to the trouble of cooking. Thankful that this place was open and delivering today (Easter Sunday, 2016).Our trio had the Roasted Duck Curry spicy, the Nam Sod salad, and the Pan Fried Noodles with Chicken not spicy. I was happy with the spice level and flavor of all three because I like spicy. Our Nam Sod person thought theirs was a little too spicy, but our Pan Fried Noodle person was very happy. The quantities were a little small for the price compared with other places I am acquainted with, but good flavor and freshness. The little printed labels on each dish helped and a nice touch.There are other good restaurants in the area, but I can see myself ordering from this place again. On a par with other 'good' Thai places I've experienced. One thing I liked too is that they originally told me 45 minutes for delivery; we had the good fortune to have it here in a half hour.

Sooooooo good. I had the Curry Noodle dish...  which I've never seen on a Thai menu before. Very tasty! It was a huge portion and I took almost half home. Less than $10 and you get two meals! This is my new fav place.

Again to those who are more picky than I, to establishments that don't overcharge I usually award 5 stars unless something out of the ordinary happens, or something tastes especially bad.Golden Thai has a large menu and the food is usually outstanding. The highly recommend the Green curry. You get a choice of meet but I usually get beef (it was the server's recommendation). Thai Currys are complicated because they are supposed to balance sweetness, saltiness, spiciness and acidity. I thought it was done perfectly.Food is served quick, portions are massive and flavors are outstanding. I highly recommend this place.
Excellent Thai food. The food is fresh, the service is great. The flavor of the common noodle dishes are fantastic, offering a balance of spice vs. sweetness. Excellent service.
The meal was delicious, delivery time was superb and did I mention the food was Amaz Ballz
Best Thai food in my opinion... Fresh, fast, and did I mention fresh!!! This is my go to for lunch or even date night. It's BYOB so you can never go wrong!!

Favorite thai spot! I live close by and I've eaten at and gotten food to go too many times to count...Favorites are beef pad see ewe, tofu pad thai, and the chicken panang curry. You can't go wrong with these, and you can add any level of spice you want when you order.Service is always friendly and quick, seems like a family-owned business. The restaurant is small and cozy.

My pad see ew and my husband's garlic chicken were both delicious. It was our first visit but won't be our last! The food is delicuous, waitress friendly and attentive despite being busy, and the prices are reasonable.
Very tasty combination fried rice, seaweed salad, and Thai iced tea. Reasonably priced and great portion sizes. Solid service.

I've  always felt that Thai is a more healthier choice than Chinese. It just tastes better with more fresh ingredients. Golden Thai makes no exception! Everything is done right! Hot and spicy! just how I like it! What really stood out to me where the big pieces of shrimp that come in the rice platter! I definitely reccomend the Tiger Shrimp! It comes with such a delicious spicy red sauce! You will sure like it. The place is small and seating is limited,so just be patient if there's a wait.
Excellent Thai restaurant for a very reasonable price.  I've had all the curries, soups, and drunken noodles.  I highly recommend this place, even if it's a drive.

I ordered pickup for a large tom yum soup with beef. The order was ready for me within 15 mins. At first I was disappointed to see that it was in a smaller than usual container for a large soup order but when I start consuming it, I noticed that there was a generous amount of beef. Plus they included additional hot sauce on the side. This is not the best tom yum I tasted. Kind of a bit too salty for me but it was good enough to satisfy my craving for it.

I wish that Yelp had a 3.5 star option. I got take out on a Thursday afternoon. I got beef pad thai and chicken yellow curry. The staff were really nice and the service was pretty fast. The pad thai was tasty but the noodles were a little soft. The beef was pretty good, though. The yellow curry was also pretty good and was flavorful. I've always thought Thai food is generally pretty expensive and I thought I would've gotten more for $9 per dish. This place is not bad at all, and I'd consider trying other things on their menu.

We had come here on a wednesday night for dinner. This place is a small and can probably fit about 20 people inside. The service was good. We had got crab rangoons which were good - yummy. I got pad thai with chicken (medium) and my friend got drunken noodles (mild) which chicken, both were good. I liked my pad thai better - it had bearable amount of spice :D.

I had been to this restaurant couples times, they offer decent Thai food. However, the reason that I gave them ONE star because they charged TIPS on a Compulsory base. It happened every time when I went there. There is a 15% compulsory tips charge on my bill. I just thought tips pay base on customer service and I don't see restaurant can make it a fixed charge to their customers. Since it happen many times to me and there is so many Thai restaurants around this area, I guess I will never come back again.
We did carry out and ordered panang curry and the basil fried rice. Both were really good. One of fav Thai eats in a while.

yesterday would of been my second time here.. I forgot my first experience here since it was a long time ago.. just remember it was decent hahaanyways.. I ordered the indian curry fried rice with beef, pad see ewe with chicken.. and baby egg rolls..Baby Egg Roll has Shrimp and chicken, glass noodles wrapped with egg roll skin served with sweet & sour sauce... it comes with 6 of them in a order.. I thought it was just ehh.. they aint lying when they said baby egg rolls haha.. its really small... but i didn't really like it... tasted bland and tasted like frozen egg rolls from the store even tho it is probably not..Indian Curry Fried Rice has stir-fried with jasmine rice, onions, tomatoes, Egg and Indian curry powder with your choice of meat in which I picked beef..  I love curry and I love fried rice and when you combine them... it is full of awesomeness! it was good.. it wasn't overwhelmed with curry flavor.. just enough to taste it..Pad See Ewe has wide rice noodles, choice of meat which I chose chicken, broccoli, and egg.. stir fried with their sweet soy sauce...it was good.. not too oily.. everything was just cooked right..I must say.. they do skimp out on the meat a little.. other then that.. I think it's a pretty good place to get thai food..
Solid tasty thai food! My go-to place when I want something spicy. Prices are good, but service could be better. They definitely aren't very friendly, but that's weirdly part of its charm.

I wanted a quick carry out option on my way home from work and decided to try out Golden Thai based on the reviews. I called and ordered drunken noodles with chicken (spicy) and massaman curry w/ beef. They told me the order would be ready in 15 minutes for my pick up.I arrived probably a little less than 15 minutes later, but my order was ready. They had prompt service and I was on my way home w/ my Thai delicacies in no time. The drunken noodles were delicious. Even though we asked for spicy, they definitely were not that hot. If you like your food very spicy I would ask for extra, extra spice. The sauce was flavorful and there were lots of fresh veggies cooked with the chicken. The massaman was also very tasty. The sauce was thinner than what I typically think of for massaman curry, but I didn't mind because the flavor was so spot-on. The beef wasn't great quality, but when you're paying $8.75 for a dish, what can you expect?Price was very reasonable- for both dishes it was ~$20. They served decent portions- with two of us sharing we had plenty of leftovers.Overall, when I'm craving Thai food I would order from Golden Thai again. Worth checking out if you're in the area!

The golden fried rice and fried rice noodle with beef are the greatest taste I've ever tasted. I like spicy food and they do very spicy, but the degree of spicy is far beyond my imagination as well as far beyond most of the restaurants. The next time I will choose the medium spicy not very spicy. If you chose the degree of spicy, I would recommend a lower lever. The beef in the noodled is very delicious as they maybe fried. Iced tai tea is my favorite in tai cuisine and it's sweet. I really enjoy  this tai restaurant food .

Tried this place out for the first time tonight. The egg rolls were the tiniest egg rolls I've ever ate, they were crispy and tasty I enjoyed them. I ordered the red curry chicken, it was okay a little too watery, I've had it at a couple of places and at each it was differnt. I also had the Thai Ice Tea it was really good but would have liked the size to be a little bigger or at least less ice. Overall a decent experience, I'll probably stick to my regular Thai place but this place is worth a try!

I love the food here but the delivery service and customer service at the restaurant is horrible. On Thursday, August 11, 2016 I placed an order for delivery at 11:15am. The food did not arrive until 12:45pm. It took an hour and a half to arrive. I ordered the Seafood Combination which was $12.95. The delivery fee was $3.00 and tax was $1.49. I basically paid $17.44 for one dish of food. I didn't order a drink or appetizer. It was simply one dish and they couldn't get it to me by noon. This is very appalling. When the food arrived I called to speak with the manager to ask for an explanation. They said a manager will call me back. The manager never called me. I went on their website to email them. I did and haven't gotten a response since. Customer service is the last of their priorities, so it seems. I was very disappointed because I was not able to enjoy my meal since I didn't have enough lunch time left.

I love it! So good. I have done both delivery and had great experiences with each. They were super accommodating with a couple of substitutions that we asked for. I highly recommend the first: adding BBQ pork to the Golden Thai fried rice. The meat is delicious and so is the rice. Also the basil fried rice is great, though I think the only difference is pineapples. So good.We got the Pad See Yew both with plain noodles, and with the crispy noodles. It's hard to say which I like better. The plain wide noodles here are thin and soft and delicious. The crispy ones are fried. Mmmm. They also use regular broccoli, vs Chinese. This works for me.Green curry was amazing, cashew chicken was out of control good - and something I don't normally get. Bonus points for having variety on the menu, while still nailing the fan favorites. Egg rolls and potstickers also tasty. Oh, and the Tom Khar soup!I really love this place, can't wait to order from here again!!

First visit to Golden Thai tonight.  Overall I was very pleased with the food and service.We were out doing some shopping and heading home so we decided to try something new in the neighborhood we've never been to.  Once I turned on to Taylor I took the very first parking spot I saw.  Let's be honest Saturday night can get pretty crazy on Taylor.We jumped out of the car and walked into the first place we saw.  There was only one other diner so that may have had something to do with the quick personalized service we received.  None the less our service was prompt and attentive.We tried the chicken satay for an appetizer.  The chicken was served hot and was very well seasoned.  The peanut sauce it came with really set it off.For our meals we had Singapore noodles which contained shrimp, pork, bean sprouts, and very then noodles.  The dish was also served very hot and was flavorful.  The portion was very large and filling.  We also tried the yellow curry.  The dish again was served very hot and was bursting with flavor.  The only thing to critique would be the thickness of the sauce was on the thin side so it wasn't the heartiest version of this dish I've tried.The meal was $25 or a lot of food for a good price.  I would most likely try this place again and suggest it to friends looking for Thai.

I went to this restaurant last week with my family. One of my family members is a regular here, and they recommended the place.The restaurant looks like a hole in the wall place, and there is just a little bit of room for people to sit. The decor needs some updating because I even noticed an outdated air conditioning device from the 1950s or something.We were seated quickly and we gave our order. The waitress was very polite, friendly and quick with our food.We ordered crab rangoon, spring rolls, miso soup spring dumplings, pepper beef, pad bamee, spicy shrimp, and tofu fried rice.The crab rangoon was delicious! It came with a sweet and sour dipping sauce. We did not want crab in the rangoon, so we asked them to exchange the crab with imitation crab. They were nice enough to fulfill our request. We also liked the shrimp dumpling and the soy dipping sauce.The spring rolls were just okay. They were cold wrapped, and full of half cooked chopped vegetables.The miso soup was delicious, and one order came in a large bowl. So a few of us shared the soup.All four of rated our food as okay. The food is good, but you wouldn't go out of your way to come to this restaurant for the food. If you are in the area and your are craving thai food, that you should come here. However, if you have a favorite thai place you should just go there rather than come here.
I had the Thai noodles. They're very delicious. This place is going to be my new go to Thai restaurant.
Oh my goodness, the curries... Red curry, yellow curry, and my favorite, panang curry. Everything on the menu is good but these are outstanding. It's a takeout staple in our home.

I love Asian food a whole lot. From delicious Pakistani biryani, to savory Chinese noodles, you'll find me drooling outside of an Asian restaurant always.I ordered the chili paste fried rice with shrimp and a side of crab rangoons as take-out, even though I was about 12 minutes walking distance away (it was finals week, okay! Don't judge me.) About 20 minutes after making my order, I started to regret not walking and ordering (I could've burned off some calories before inhaling those delicious carbs), because the delivery time was 45 minutes. Even though I was a 4 minute drive away. Four minutes. Four. 45 minutes. 45. After getting my food, I ran to the nearest table and ate the food so quickly because I was so hungry. The food was warm and tasted so fresh. The flavors were like little ballerinas dancing on my tongue. I loved it! I finished the chili paste fried rice and was completely satisfied. The crab rangoons...don't get me started. I died. And then reincarnated. THEY WERE SO GOOD. And the dipping sauce was unreal as well. Overall, the food was amazing, and I will be DEFINITELY going here again. I'll probably order two orders of crab rangoons next time because guess what? I LOVE LIVING LIFE.All in all, go to Golden Thai, but don't order take-out, unless you're super patient.

I don't know about all their other items, but this place has the BEST RED CURRY. It is SO good, I order it at least once a month. I've probably had it at least 12 times now, and it has been delicious. every. time. I tried it with tofu once and it was really good, but it is perfect with chicken. Another loved item on the menu is the pad see ew. My husband and I always order chicken red curry and beef pad see ew together, it's kind of our monthly guilty pleasure meal. :) I will say I've tried some random chicken or beef dish that came with rice and it was less memorable, and I personally don't like their noodles for their pad thai (it's similar to pho noodles, very thin, but maybe they would change the noodle type if you asked? Not sure). Lastly, I recommended red curry to a friend, but she was afraid it'd be spicy (although I don't find it spicy at all), so she ordered yellow curry instead, and tasted kinda funky - it was a bit too sweet.I'm not sure if this all warrants an average of less than 5 stars, maybe the restaurant as a whole might be less, but because of the amazing red curry and delicious pad see ew, I'm sticking with the 5. You go, Golden Thai!

Came here with 2 friends. We ordered the Crab Rangoon as an appetizers and was pretty delicious. Everything went awry when we ordered the Pad Thai (because you can't go wrong with the pad Thai) and wow, it was probably the worst pad Thai that has ever touched my taste buds. After one bite, I immediately asked if I could exchange the plate for another one and she straight up said "No!" and showed the "No exchange No refund" print on the bottom of the menu, and walked away. I will not come back here again.

I go here for lunch every Tuesday and every time the food has been a 5/5. I'd highly recommend the meat noodle soup (all are good) the basil chicken and the ginger chicken. Service is quick, food is more than affordable for the quality and quantity.

This is one of the best places to order thai food from. I frequent this place for catering for business meetings and their food is amazing! The customer service is also fantastic! For the cost the amount of food you get is crazy, I would think they would charge a lot more, especially for catering.We will definitely continue to order from here for future purchases.

In a cluster of thai places, all very good, Golden Thai stands out for two things : taste and price.The owners recognized my accent and asked me if I wanted to get my food "spicy". It didn't burn my tongue off in an acid like feel (which most places in this country consider "spicy". Spice is flavor, bold and subtle and varied all together. Not acid burn hot)Thai iced coffee is excellent. Recommend the seafood as it is fresh and infused with the fresh spices. Also Indian Curry rice.The staff is excellent, friendly, courteous and quick.

Golden Thai is very good.  I have ordered their various curry options, among other items, and have not been disappointed.  Generous portions at an affordable price.  I don't eat out a lot, but I go back to Golden Thai time and time again.
No, don't go to Thai Bowl (too Americanized for the sake of UIC students). Go to Golden Thai if you are to eat some thai food on Taylor.

Listen....you are my new favorite thai food place.  Your food is outrageously good and incredibly affordable.  This review is coming from someone who has been to Thailand many several times. Bangkok,  phuket, chiang mai and pataya beach.  Love Thailand and thai food.  Your taste is authentic, your presentation on point, portion sizes are much appreciated.  I am super stingy with my 5 star reviews. You earned every star.  Gone are the days of me trekking up north or being on an unending search for great thai food.  You are my new happy place and i love you.  Now...carry on or more fittingly, sawatdee!

I love Golden Thai. I am picky about Thai restaurants. The beef paradise is out of this world and so was the curry fish cake. This is my go to Thai place when Im at work. And they deliver freaky fast!!
My first visit and can't wait for the next! Super friendly service and delicious food, thanks Golden Thai.
Came here during the week for lunch. Quick service and excellent food. The curry dishes are the best!
Amazing food. Big portions. Really cozy place. Perfect for a weekday lunch or dinner. Service takes a long time though.

Love this place! I've tried a lot of Thai places and this is a good one. I always get the drunken noodles with chicken and crab rangoon, both are delicious. Their spice level scale is pretty accurate, a 5 is actually HOT. It's a small hole-in-the-wall kind of place but food is great and reasonably priced. Take out is very fast as well.

I had my first Pad Thai from here.. I loved it so much, that I believed a Pad Thai can never go wrong. I was wrong. I had Pad Thai from a hell lot of places. Every single time, it was crap. It was either too tamarind-y, or too sweet or too crappy. It was never good. And then, I'd return to Golden Thai for my fav Pad Thai.I asked them why their Pad Thai is so so good. They  claim they use their own pad thai mix, not a ready made one. I don't know if that is the real reason. But I do know that their Pad Thai is so damn good!I usually do the Pad Thai combo- adding beef and shrimp. Its heavenly.Must go place in Chicago, if you like Thai Food.

how does Golden Thai stay in business when Yummy Thai is like two blocks away?Been to Golden Thai twice. First, got some really greasy pad-kee-mao for dinner. The food was okay, not great. The second time I looked at their menu online and ordered Tom Yum Noodles with no bean sprouts for take out. Got there 15 mins later... and got Tom Yum Noodles with bean sprouts. Minor misunderstand, that's fine. They removed the bean sprouts and then rang up the bill.. which came out to be about $9. When I told them that their online menu lists the tom yum noodles for $6.95 (which is what Yummy Thai current charges), he said that that website is ancient and the price has been raised to $8.25. hell, how was i supposed to know.got home, and my tom yum noodles was worse than yummy thai. that extra dollar something did add anything to the price.. which brought up the question: how does golden thai stay in business?Yummy Thai...is cheaper (and also doesn't have a $10 credit card minimum)has better service from what I've experiencedhas a much more pleasing dining areahas comparable/better foodis only two blocks awayNeedless again, I won't make the same mistake again.

This is our go-to place for Thai food. Best pad see ew I have ever had. Good pad thai. Excellent singapore noodles. Golden Thai rolls, yum. Rob is fun and knows us so we chat whenever we dine in. Have been eating here for over 15 years, since back when it was Siam Pot. Still solid, good, fresh food. About to order again right now...
Mind blowing Chicken Red Curry (Spicy), Indian Curry Fried Rice and Crab Rangoon.. Would recommend it anyDAY.. But a bit to expensive for students.

Amazing Pad Thai. Great flavor and I love that it's a hole in the wall. Enough said! The Thai iced tea is spot on as well. Great spicy foods such ad the curries and soups but you can get them spicy to order. Food is usually quick but fresh. My husband loves the rice rolls which comes with a sweet chili sauce. Prices are reasonable and then owner is very sweet.

Pros:+Good Location for the Little Italy strip+Good Food+FastCons:-This place is always freezing/boiling-They could add a second door to keep the elements out-Bathroom is literally a tiny closet-Smaller than usual portionsThis place has excellent food and rarely disappoints as I've eaten here with friends multiple times, it's the experience that ruins it. Every time someone enters or exists, the door which leaks, allows for a gust of air to come in. When I ate here in the summer it was raining and the scent coming in from outside was not so good, in the winter I had to keep my winter gear on as I ate.What's the deal with the rice??? The portion size is TINY and they offer no refills or additional rice,  literally the rice is 1/6th the size of the curry bowl. Please management if you're reading this, stop leaving the galangal(relative to ginger) in the soup, it's impossible to not have pieces in your mouth because you chop it so small.  Also if you inform them the curry is too spicy, although you ordered a mild, you'll have your curry diluted by adding additional chicken broth killing the flavor.I recommend the Tom Yum Soup(get the large size it's the equivalent of 6 or so of the regular size), Pad Thai and Red Curry(probably the best I've had in Chicago)
Quick, easy, cheap, and consistent.  I will be coming back here more!

The good news is that everything is under $10 but the paradox is there is a $10 minimum on the card which is inconvenient unless you are really hungry, high, or on a date (in which case your date doesn't need to know how cheap this place is).The food is okay but the service was fine, probably one of the best I've experienced in an Asian restaurant but something that would be considered just okay in the customer based economy we live in.I enjoyed the pad thai and it looks like their curries would be nice. They are also generous with giving out fortune cookies if you are into that...
Amazing crab rangoon. Amazing salads. Great curry chicken. So, so pad thai. Good delivery service, they take credit cards. Not very attemptive service when dining in. Would I come back? Hail yes!

column4: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column13: Pad thai taste is very inconsistent. I order this dish 2-3 times a month as i live in a close by apartment. I should say you will get a 50% chance of getting a great pad thai when noodles are perfectly cooked with their delicious sauce. If youre unlucky, you will get a reheated pad thai with dry noodles without much sauce, or just simply without taste. I dont know how they do quality control but it seems like they have a different chef every single time. Good luck for getting a good pad thai.
Good tasty food!! I love the Indian curry fried rice here. The best thing i like about this place is the hospitality.

My favorite Thai place. Food made fresh when you order. Produce ingredients and garnishes are always fresh and crunchy. When you order Pad Thai, I am happy to report that you are asked whether you'd like it mild, medium or spicy! Pad Thai is great, basil chicken is flavorful, and the egg drop soup is light and refreshing. Overall a great lunch and dinner place.

Very good the first time i sat there to eat my lunch. the tom yum soup was savory and tofu pad thai was exquisite. but then i orderd take-out one night and it was quite bad. the soup was diluted with few ingredients and the noodles were tasteless. when they're good, though, it's amazing. plan to stop by later on...

I went to Golden Thai with a friend for lunch early on Friday, they seated us quickly and got the food out pretty fast. The food is very good, I loved their Red Curry and Thai Iced Tea. I am giving an OK review because just the food was good, our server was rude. Also this place charges a random 18% service charge, even if you are a party of two. After this, they still expect a tip, which I wouldn't mind giving if they did not force customers to pay service charge for smaller parties.
This is my second visit and love their shrimp tempura. Their green curry is nice too. Casual place with nice good. The staff are friendly and nice.

BIASED ReviewerDISCLOSURE: I love Golden Thai, its in my speed dial, read on to see whyA few meal combos I suggest:Combo#1 (for 2-3)shu-mai appetizer - steamed bags of shrimp, crab, onion, starchy love, served with a sweet salty soy based sauce for dipping and golden fried garlic chunks for a little bite to offset the sweetnessBYOB: 3 Floyd's Gumball HeadSpicy Beef Salad -  spicy combo of chillis, grilled beef, red and green onion, rice, and lime juice.  This will really open up the sweat pores and get the fragrance moving in your skull.BYOB: Green Flash West Coast IPALad Nar noodle entree - perhaps my favorite classic wide noodle dish, Golden does it right with plenty of garlic in the delicious brown gravy. I get it with chicken and add peanut, chillis with juice, as well as red chilli garlic paste that are located in the metal four bowl serving tray that may or may not be on the table. Ask for it if not.BYOB: Bell's 2-Hearted Ale, Stone Arrogant Bastard BomberCombo #2 (for 2)Appetizer: Crab Rangoon with sweet and spicy, tangy dipping sauce. A refreshingly quality rangoon with flavor and isnt mushy. Careful, they are served directly out of the fryer and can be popping with oil still at delivery.BYOB: Victory HopDevilPad See Ewe entree - Obviously you can see I like the wider noodle dishes. served with brocolli and egg, the sweet brown sauce is wonderful and far superior to other local versions. I wasnt a huge fan of the fried version they offer the one time I tried it.BYOB: Goose Island Pepe NeroSpicy Pad Ped entree - shrimp, beef, chix with eggplant, green peas, bamboo shoots in a spicy red curry; I dont usually get anything with eggplant but this dish is very flavorful and has lots of pop. I thoroughly enjoy this when in a red curry mood. It is absolutely packed with meat and not skimped on the shrimps.BYOB: Goose Island SofieRidge York Creek Vineyard or Pagani Ranch ZinfandelDINNER FOR A KING (see the king of Thailand's pic)Yum Woon Sen - glass noodles tossed delicately with shrimp, chix, red and green onion, in a delicious Thai style dressing. A wonderful blend of flavors where each ingredient can be picked out in each bite yet isnt overpoweringBYOB: La Crema Pinot Noir SonomaThree Flavor Red Snapper is AMAZING - This is a classic whole fish fry dish with one of my go to finned friends, the red snapper in her sapphire party dress deep fried and coated in chilli, garlic, sweet and sour sauce that will really have you thanking he BYOB gods.BYOB: Ravenswood Dickerson Valley Reserve ZinfandelOther dishes I enjoy (but not as much as those above):Nam Sod Salad (good for a light lunch)Pad Woon Sen (better than Yummy Thai down the street)Pad Bamee (get with pork or beef opposed to chicken)Singapore noodles (loves me bbq pork)Basil, Ginger, Garlic Chix all good stir-fred selectionsThai Fried Rice (extremely fragrant with Thai basil) and way better than Yummy'sRegular Fried Rice (excellent) with a nice selection and variety of fresh veggies. Very clean flavors without the overly oily taste or texture. I like Golden's better (I am biased by now) but think its a very close competition with Yummy Thai's reg fried rice, which I also think is excellent and shares a similar taste/texture profile.Beef, BBQ pork, and Japanese Udon noodles are all very tasty as wellI wasnt a huge fan of the Tom Yum or Kar soups, better across street at Yummy.Food is 3.5 stars+ 0.5 star for BYOB and the fact that the owners love NBA games and will gladly change over for youto any channel you desire if thats your thing.+1 star for Free crab rangoon or egg roll with any delivery over $10, this is huge considering our standard delivey order is around 20-30 bucks after delivery charge with this free app. Make sure you mention it ahead.
The food is just good enough for two stars. The place is not so clean. Ordered Pad Thai and Golden Thai fried rice.

I always get the cashew and chicken with extra chicken....on point.  Their ginger chicken is only other thing ive tried and its was good.Quality: 9 out of 10Quantity: 8 out of 10 (last time i ordered it did seem like it got small from the usual....so...)

So, they messed up our order. We received pad see ewe instead of cashew chicken. Too bad we got our food to go and we're already home with it.Luckily, the food we did get was good! As was the the pad kee maw with chicken. Also, we asked for it spicy and it actually came spicy (which shouldn't surprise me, but is often not the case). The pad Thai was mediocre, not bad but I've had much better. The chicken fried rice was also ok. It tasted like chicken fried rice anywhere, which is fine, just not special. The service was nice and the food was quick.We will be back to try it again as it was close and some of order was great. We will try a few other things before giving up. As long as they give us the right order next time, we will be happy.

Some of THE best Panang Curry I have ever had.  Golden Thai does it right. If it wasn't for how pricey it can sometimes get, I would be here all the time (okay okay, and maybe if not for my waistline as well). I get the veggie panang curry with tofu (an extra charge) and brown rice (another extra charge). But for around $13, this satisfies me and lasts me 2-3 meals when I'm not being a pig.Plus, their service is great. I once ordered their pad thai (minus the fish sauce, since I'm a veggie), and it was just blah. No flavor, and completely plain noodles and bland veggies. However, they were more than happy to make me my curry to replace it at no extra cost. Now that's what I call awesome customer service!

Im a great fan of Thai food and I judge a Thai restaurant by its Panang Curry. I have eaten this curry in every Thai restaurant on Taylor and this place has the best Panang curry I have ever had. I love their Indian curry fried rice and of course, their Thai Iced Tea is really good. Its not as coconut-ty and low on calories as well! Yes, you read it right. I was of the impression that Thai iced tea has coconut milk and condensed milk which makes it high on calories. But the person who was serving us told me that they use soy milk instead which gives is a lighter texture and its really yummy, without being too sweet.Great food, inexpensive prices and good services makes this my favorite Thai restaurant..

I went here with my sister and my niece after we left the dentist.  Small store but kinda cozy.Waitstaff was quick to greet and left us some time to order....I had the beef Pad Thai, niece and the Ginger Chicken, and sis had the Mongolian beef.Now for the price I thought the portion was good...I would have though I'd get alittle more beef, but this is the 4th thai place in Chicago I had eaten, being spoiled by my old hangout River Kwai on Belmont (RIP), which the portions were huge.  But the food tasted great, as did my sisters, but my niece and the ginger chicken was quite exceptional.I thought my thai ice coffee was tasting odd...but I guess it just needed getting used to...maybe it was different milk.Parking on the street was fine, just remember when it expires (and yes I know rates went up but you k new t his when our beloved Mayor stabbed us with this from the get go.)I digress.Outside the door, they have a to go menu you can grab, and on the front it says one free appetizer with any carry out purchase of $10.00 or more (before tax and delivery charges.)  I will scan the front and post this.And if by late night (as one of the questions ask down there) is 10pm?  Well then by some 10 is late.  But thats when they close.

A good place to go if you want some Thailand food.  The location is great and parking is not that difficult to find.The fried rice was very great. with Shrimp and chicken was my favorite.Dong Yum Soup is a must order for me.  It is a little bit sweet, though. I guess it is a little bit Americanized Thailand food.The service is always great.  I usually go there when I am not in the mood to cook and it never disappointed me.
