The rating for our visit for the food is three stars, maybe three and a half. The final rating overall rating including the terrible service is two stars. Our explaination follows:I will not bore the reading with tales of how or why we ended up eating dinner here on Wednesday July 27 about 5pm.  It does not matter and we absolutely find those stories utterly so self-absorbed that anything the reviewer types afterward becomes suspect.Our server was a chunky male with black hair and he had a short name, but just cannot recall.  Part of our order for the appetizers was the parmesan fries.  He brought out a small plate of regular fries.  When I asked about the parm fries he said "I heard you just say fries. I will take these back to see if they can do something." About two minutes later he brought the exact same plate of fries, now with some parm sprinkled on them.  I still had to ask for the ranch sauce.Time and time again throughout the meal he would pass by to refill other tables water or beverages, but never stopped at ours.  Several times he had a full water pitcher as he raced past with no eye contact at all.After the meal we sat for almost 15 minutes for him to bring a check.  Another 10 to get the credit card and receipt back.I watched as other servers gleefully assisted their customers.  Not us.We had a view of the entrance toward the kitchen area.  Bussers stood there often. One frequently biting his nails and spitting what he chewed off out onto the floor.The calamari was fantastic.  Chicken chopped salad divine blew my mind with the texture and flavors.  Do not pass it up and the portion was yuuuge.  Now the pizza.....sigh...well....bland. Almost no sauce and just was bland. There is a shaker of some seasoning at each table, please use it because the kitchen does not.So, that sums up the visit. Even though the hotel we stay at is just down the street, on the next visit we will certainly find another pizza joint. This one is just too pricey to give it a second shot and it to fail. Be well, my friends.

Before I start my review, I want to there to be complete disclosure that I am a New Yorker and will always have a bias towards the New York style pizza.So visiting Chicago for the first time, being a total tourist. How could I not have the Chicago deep dish pizza.After, much debating my wife and I finally decided to go to Giordano's along with a few friends. We decided to order the bruchetta since the wait time for a deep dish pizza is 45mins-1 hour. For the pizza, we decided to play it safe by ordering classic pepperoni.The bruchetta did not disappoint. The tomatoes were as fresh as they could be and the bread nice and crispy. It had a nice flavor.A little while after getting done with the bruchetta, there it was, the moment of truth, our deep dish pizza finally arrived. The cheese was nice and gooey, the filling was nice and fresh, and the crust was perfectly crispy. All in all a solid pizza. We ordered a medium, which was good for 4 people.Now was this the greatest pizza, perhaps not, maybe because I'm too used to having my pizza New York style on the go with the cheese dripping and the paper plate being greasy. Having said that, the pizza was still pretty solid and would recommend it to someone. The only thing which was disappointing was the service. The servers looked confused and were not very accessible.

Located next to the airport I went there with lower expectations but was surprised of the quality of ingredients and pizza served. The deep dish pizza was a true Chicago style pizza, the crust very well done and ingredients overall fresh.Very well recommended when you are staying in the area or on a short business visit.

Food was basic. The meat on meat thin pizza had great big piece of yummy meat on it. Crust was not good. The extra thin olive and mushroom pizza was good. Small size pizza is a great size for 2-3 eaters. Bloody Mary had a weird citrus taste to it. Waitress was hard to keep around.

Let's start by saying that the deep dish pizza is good. Two of us had the small veggie which is 6 slices and ended up saving one slice each for breakfast the next day (take note...equally as good cold as it was warm the night before). There are naturally a lot of pizza options, and we also split a side Greek salad as an appetizer. Speaking of appetizers, I had joined the Giordano's e-club and had a coupon for a free bruschetta or garlic bread. Unfortunately, I was informed that they cannot be shown on a mobile device, they must be printed, which is fine, but what bothers me is that it is not written anywhere so how would we have known? Anyway, our pizza took over an hour to come out which I should add is completely normal and should be expected (even when we just ordered a small pizza and the restaurant was relatively empty at the time). Our waitress got the job done, though I wouldn't go out of my way to praise her friendliness by any means. For the pizza, salad, and we each got a pint of beer (not a huge beer list), the tab came to about $50.

We were in town for a family gathering and this location was a few minutes from our hotel.  We were here on a Friday night, and it was busy but we were seated immediately.  We ordered the Meat and more meat stuffed deep dish pizza.  It takes about 40 minutes to get to the table.  The pizza was good, but I didn't think it was as great as we we had heard.  The service was good in the beginning, but towards the end of our meal the waitress became very busy and we waited about 15 minutes before she came over to ask if we needed the check.  Overall an average experience.
Bomb bomb bomb!!! This pizza is life. I love cheese and its full of it no matter what kind you get. Taste is amazing. I don't like red sauce and I ate theirs without asking for lite sauce.

Pretty mediocre.  Pizza took an hour.  Waitress was horrible, had to ask for silverware 3 times.   There were two floaters in our lemonade and she seemed upset when we had to ask for a replacement for the third time.  Couldn't get the fountain lemonade right so they finally bought a bottle lemonadeOverall just mediocre.  Very unimpressed.  Will not be going back.  There are plenty of better options.

Greet service and great food .  Sharon was our server and so personable.  The experience from the time we walked in to sitting down was phenomenal.  I recommend this place to everyone staying at the nearby hotels.  I'm looking forward to eating there again and will recommend this to all my colleagues.

My family has enjoyed and loved Giordanos Pizza for over 20 years and while the pizza is still as good as it always has been, the service is not. I live a few blocks from the 63rd and Cicero location and it's the location I normally order from. The last few times I've ordered for delivery it has taken close to 2 hours for the pizza to arrive  which is not a big deal since they tell you up front that it's a long wait, the problem is that by the time the driver makes other deliveries and gets to me my pizza is already cold.Second issue is that they stopped accepting coupons as of June 1st so the extra coupons I had (with no expiration date) are no longer valid and they wouldn't even honor my $5 coupon as a courtesy given that I didn't know they had stopped accepting coupons.The gentleman who took my order suggested I sign up for email alerts or whatever in order to get coupons via email. Soooo you still issue coupons but you can't honor mine? Mmm, okay so I register online and the coupon code never arrived, how annoying.I will continue to buy from them because I love their pizza, I just wish their service was a little bit better so I can happily recommend it to other people, for now all I can say, if you don't mind paying a lot of money and waiting up to 2 hours for lukewarm pizza then this is your place!
Always a great experience and service when I come here. Great food and drinks across the board, so I won't go on and on lol My server Valerie K. was very nice and courteous.
Service is slow. Waitress should learn how to give customer's attention.  Italian beef and pizza tastes good. Maybe it was just late.

Finally had the opportunity to try a real deep dish pizza while visiting from California. I really like it a lot and wish we had them back home. As far as the restaurant, it was very clean and had plenty of parking. Our hostess and waitress were both really friendly. We ordered the garlic parmesan fries and the fried calamari for our appetizers and had a Chicago style deep dish pizza. I would definitely recommend this place based on the outstanding service and great food.
Excellent deep dish pizza. Good service. Place was very busy but staff was attentive and took good care of us.

Been a while since coming to Chicago, so ive gotten used to, mostly NY style pies.  Having this has now changed my mind about having to have NY style pies.  So, the debate goes on.  But Giordanos pizza was very good.

Had to stop for my Chicago Italian "fix" again!  Giardanos at Midway.  The service really improved since my last visit!  Miranda suggested the bruschetta and it was fabulous.  Had chicken parm and a salad.  Hint for Caesar Salad.  It's much better if you let them toss it rather than take dressing on the side.  Big improvement over my last visit.  Hats off!
Amazing deep dish! This is a great place to hit right before you go to the airport, and the pizza will survive a 5 hour flight!

Best pizza I've ever came across in my life. I called in my pizza and they told me how much it was and 45 minutes later I sent to pick it up.  They had it hot and ready for me and I swear to God that a medium pizza weighs about 5 pounds.  2 slices was more than enough for me. Big clean restaurant. I will be coming back before I go back to Texas
I am from California  and this place rocks. Good customer service exelente food  I strongly recommend this place   I will be back

Friday night. Seated on entry. Decent cocktails, yummy chopped salad to split between two, and a spinach stuffed pizza. Service was good. Giordano's reliably dishes up the best stuffed pizza in a casual setting. I've been coming here (as well as other locations) for a long time, with no plans to stop. It' a Chicago classic. : )

Wow. I'd always dreamed about what true deep dish should taste like and upon a business trip getting stuck in Chicago, I was finally able to see for myself. The deep dish here was so delicious. I tried the stuffed pizza with pepperoni and everything about it was heavenly. The crust on this pizza was flaky and light, which is different than any deep dish variety you can get out east which is normally dense. The inside of the pizza oozed unendingly with cheesy goodness. I can normally eat quite a few slices of pizza, but here I struggled through two. I won't even think about the potential calories so I'm glad I live far far away. Try this pizza if you're in the area and you won't be disappointed.

This is by far the worst restaurant ever!!!PLEASE BE AWARE.... DO NOT CALL FOR DELIVERY!! A crack head, drug addict will deliver your pizza and take your "cash" then he'll call the police and say you never paid for the pizza... Giordano's DOESN'T do a criminal background check on their delivery drivers or any of their employees!!!!!! Be very careful with this restaurant!! They can ruin your good background history over  a cheap crack head employee!!!!!

First time having a truly Chicago deep dish pizza.  I was never really a fan until my friend took me here.  It was really good.  The first time I had a deep dish pizza was one a single serving pie.  I guess, like a burger, the ratio of size to toppings to dough makes a huge difference.  We ordered a half and half which is great because you order 2 different types for share.  Servie is great.  Plenty of parking.  I was forewarned the pies are made fresh so it takes a while for the order to arrive.  If your in rush, it might be an issue.  If you have plenty of time like we did, it was worth the 40 minute odd wait.  A definite must do when in the Windy City.

The food is always on point. But the waiter is racist! To the racist lady at the bar who changed the Hawks game while I was clearly watching it just because the white kid who just came in wanted to see the Oklahoma game screw you!! That was rude and uncalled for! Horrible! JustHorrible!! I made a point and stated "hey! I was watching that!!"" And she ignored me and kept walking. It didn't matter to her that I was there first and watching a Chicago team in Chicago play. She changed it because I wasn't white. Shame on you giordanos shame on you!! Brown people love hockey too!!
Horrible. Ordered delivery, pizza was cold - like out of the refrigerator cold in the middle, and my chopped salad was not chopped! It was super disappointing - can we give zero stars??

Clean, noisy family joint with excellent service, convenient location (inadequate parking - everybody's caught on to this place). Comfy seating, quickly seated. Great Chicago style (deep dish) pizza, great salads!

*Giordano's Midway  best place for Pizza and excellent quality good food, great customer service, love delightful chicken wings (buffalo) spicy... mmm thin crust crispy Hawaiian Pizza and Tiramisu for dessert, my order actually for pick up they say 35 minutes, live at 5 minutes from here $38.00 dlls.*I just got red wine; perfect for invite some friends on this beautiful evening.*Great experience when you're there, expect waiting time or make reservations in advance.*Servers at Giordano's: Thank You

Chicago-Style Pizza in the shadow of Midway Airport.A work colleague and I had finished a business trip to Michigan City, Indiana and we drove back to Chicago for our respective flights home the next day. Actually, I was going to Des Moines for the weekend to visit my Parents, and Jeff was heading back to Northern California. After checking in at the nearby Hampton Inn, we separately asked for restaurant recommendations and pretty much got the same response (word for word) from 2 different front desk staff. Oh well, beggars can't be choosers, especially since we didn't want to get in the car,Giordano's is one of the Chicago Deep Dish Pizza chains that some people swear by. And so much so that cross-country delivery is available. We ordered cheese and spinach, with a starter salad, and a few glasses of Goose Island beer. It was all delicious and with enough left over for another meal over the weekend. Service was most hospitable for these weary travelers, even though I wish I were a little closer to Chicago proper for this dining experience.
I'm a New Yorker so the deep dish was not for me. To much cheese and when it got cold it didn't seem edible.  I should have ordered thin crust.

Went today. Was great. Got a good table. Mozzarella sticks were amazing. Ordered a small deep dish. Didn't take that long to come out. Service was good. Pizza was out of this world good Everything was great. Went to the bath room. And it was COMPLETELY a mess. There was a crap in every bowl there was a sign not to flush toiletries, to use  the garbage ..but there wasn't one in each stall. So there was pads every where. The bathroom was super dark. Someone could a been in the corner and i wouldn't have even seen them. When I got in there I didn't even have to use the bathroom anymoreEverything else was amazing. Sad that I had to deduct a star cos of how well they kept the bathroom.Will be back (the restaurant... not the bathroom)

It was our first time in Chicago this past month for a week long vacation and we decided to try this place first since it was the closest to our hotel.Let me tell you...it's simply jaw-dropping and mouth-watering delicious! This pizza changed my view of "deep dish pizza" and I now completely understand why they call it a "pie"! Patch P. and I ordered a 2 person pizza that came with 6 slices and were barely able to finish 2 slices each in one sitting with some beer! We were greeted by the friendly owner who told us his personal favorite toppings are the all-beef meatballs and the chicken sausage.  We went ahead and ordered half all-beef meatballs with mushrooms and then chicken sausage with mushrooms on the other side. The winning protein topping was the all-beef meatballs! We had to get a personalized 6" pizza combo each before we left Chicago.  Each combo came with a bottle of soda and choice of a side salad or garlic fries for $8.95.  We also ordered fried calamari to-go. Everything was delicious from start to finish! We noticed they do nationwide shipping on their website and will definitely have to try that in the future.Tip: Each pizza takes about 40-45 minutes to make, call ahead and order to go, or if you're dining in, order some appetizers to hold you over! Also, don't forget to join their mailing list as they offer a complimentary appetizer of bruschetta to try!

Came here on my way to my hotel from the airport hoping to get some deep dish pizza. Unfortunately this place isn't very solo diner friendly if you want pizza and are traveling. They do not do pizza by the slice or offer pizzas small enough for one person. I stayed in a hotel with a tiny mini fridge so I couldn't really take leftovers with me. I was about to leave but in an effort to try and accommodate me the waiter offered the Beefzza as an option. I decided to try it and it tasted alright but it wasn't the deep dish pizza I was looking for. Maybe if it had had tomato or Alfredo sauce in it it would have been enough but instead it had a dipping sauce (which tasted good but again, was in the mood for deep dish pizza). Probably won't eat here again unless I'm with other people and can split something. I gave it three stars because the staff was friendly and attempted to accommodate me.
First time here and pizza was great along with our server who was quick and very happy to serve usThank you!!!

This is one of the 3 giordanos  locations I order from. It's the Closest one to my house. But sadly the pizza here is garbage. It's never consistent. I have no complaints about the other locations I go to by my job or my friends house. Maybe it's jus the cook or something. But I will avoid this location.
